english: For Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had devised plans against the Jews to destroy them. He had cast pur (that is, the lot) in order to afflict and destroy them.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat pitqurriutigiŋagaat, kiŋuniimigñullu, Jew-guġumaaqtuanullu, piviksraq nalautitaġikpan ukiutuaqpan taapkuak uvluk ilaaguaqtautquvlugik maliġuaġlugi Mordecai-m piraksriutiŋi.

english: But when the matter came to the king’s attention, the king gave written orders that Haman’s evil intentions that he had devised against the Jews should fall on his own head. He and his sons were hanged on the gallows.
inupiaq: Nalupqinaimmaġiksiŋagaat Jew-gupayaaqtuanun iḷagiiñun kiŋunġuruanun nunallaamigni suli iniqpallaamigñi itqautausaqługu suli maliġuaġlugi uvluŋi Purim taimuŋaaglaan tikitchaġikpan.

english: For this reason these days are known as Purim, after the name of pur.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tuvaaqataa umialgum Esther, pania Abihail-gum, piqatigivlugu Mordecai, aglaŋammiuq tuyuqhuni, inillakługu iluqaaqługu ataniġnaqutini tunulliḷiqsuqługu Purim, aglaaġiŋaraŋa Mordecai-m sivuani.

english: Therefore, because of the account found in this letter and what they had faced in this regard and what had happened to them, the Jews established as binding on themselves, their descendants, and all who joined their company that they should observe these two days without fail, just as written and at the appropriate time on an annual basis.
inupiaq: Tuyuun aglaaguŋaruq Jew-gupayauraqtuanun, suli tuyuġirauŋaruq iluqaiññun 127-nun nunaaqqiñun Persia-m atanniqsimaviani. Jew-gupayauraqtuat tutqiutiqaquvlugich suli anayanniuquŋił̣ł̣ugich,

english: These days were to be remembered and to be celebrated in every generation and in every family, every province, and every city. The Jews were not to fail to observe these days of Purim; the remembrance of them was not to cease among their descendants.
inupiaq: Suli piraksriqł̣ugich kiŋuniiŋiḷḷu maliġuaquvlugich uvluŋich Purim piviksraq tikitchaġikpan, akuqtuaġiŋaramisigun maliġuagaksriamisun niġiŋaiḷaġnikun suli qiñunikun. Piraksriutigiŋagaik taapkuak Mordecai-vlu Esther-vlu.

english: So Queen Esther, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew wrote with full authority to confirm this second letter about Purim.
inupiaq: Esther-m piraksriutiŋi, nalupqinaiqsaqługi pitquraŋi Purim, aglaaguŋarut immuamun.

english: Letters were sent to all the Jews in the hundred and twenty-seven provinces of the empire of Ahasuerus – words of true peace –

to establish these days of Purim in their proper times, just as Mordecai the Jew and Queen Esther had established, and just as they had established both for themselves and their descendants, matters pertaining to fasting and lamentation.
Esther’s command established these matters of Purim, and the matter was officially recorded.
The Lord said to Jonah son of Amittai,
inupiaq: Uvlut iḷaŋanni Atanġum uqallautigaa Jonah iġñiŋa Amittai-m.

english: “Go immediately to Nineveh, that large capital city, and announce judgment against its people because their wickedness has come to my attention.”
inupiaq: Uqaqhuni, “Aullaġiñ Ninevah-mun, iniqpagmun, kiliktuġlugich; Iḷisimatilaamnik uvva qanutun pigiiḷḷiqirautilaaŋiññik iñuŋich.”

english: Instead, Jonah immediately headed off to Tarshish to escape from the commission of the Lord. He traveled to Joppa and found a merchant ship heading to Tarshish. So he paid the fare and went aboard it to go with them to Tarshish far away from the Lord.
inupiaq: Aglaan Jonah, qimaaŋaruq Tarshishmun unitchaqługu Ataniq. Spain-muŋaruq, paqiłłuniasii umiaqpagmik Tarshish-muksaqtuamik. Akiḷiqł̣ugu ikkutiksrani ikuŋaruq, aullaqatigisaqługich Tarshish-mun, qimaummiyumiñaqsivḷuni ATANIĠ-miñ.

english: But the Lord hurled a powerful wind on the sea. Such a violent tempest arose on the sea that the ship threatened to break up!
inupiaq: Aglaan Ataniq aullaqtitchiŋaruq suaŋaruamik anuġimik taġiumun, anuġiqłuk suaŋavaił̣ł̣uni anayanniuliŋarut umiaqpaiyaiġniaġniġmun.

english: The sailors were so afraid that each cried out to his own god and they flung the ship’s cargo overboard to make the ship lighter. Jonah, meanwhile, had gone down into the hold below deck, had lain down, and was sound asleep.
inupiaq: Umiaqpagaqtit iqsiññiulipiaġataŋarut suli ququulavlutiŋ ikayuquvlutiŋ nanmiñiq God-igillaaramignun. Tavraasii anayanniuŋaipayaaqsaqłutiŋ, iginŋagaich usiatiŋ. Tainna pipkaqługich, Jonah atqaŋaruq alliġmun, aasii nallaqhuni siquvluni.

english: The ship’s captain approached him and said, “What are you doing asleep? Get up! Cry out to your god! Perhaps your god might take notice of us so that we might not die!”
inupiaq: Qaukłiŋata Umiaqpaum paqitkaa, aasii apiqsruqługu, “Summan immaimña siñiktuaqpich? Makillutin aŋaiyyuiñ God-ignun ikayuqulutin. Iḷaanni nagligiluta annautiviaġaatigut.”

english: The sailors said to one another, “Come on, let’s cast lots to find out whose fault it is that this disaster has overtaken us.” So they cast lots, and Jonah was singled out.
inupiaq: Umiaqpagaqtit avanmun uqaaqsiñiqsut, “Saaptaġluta, iḷitchuġiyumaugut kiña patchisautilaaŋa anayanniuġniptigni.” Tavraasii tainna piŋarut, aasii Jonah-m atqa amuŋagaat.

english: They said to him, “Tell us, whose fault is it that this disaster has overtaken us? What’s your occupation? Where do you come from? What’s your country? And who are your people?”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautigaat, “Ki, aasii, uqallautisigut! Kiña imña patchisauva? Suliqivich imña maani? Kisumiñ nunamiñ qairuatin? Sumiuyaaguvich?”

english: He said to them, “I am a Hebrew! And I worship the Lord, the God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”
inupiaq: “Hebrew-guruŋa,” Jonah-m kiugai. “Qiksiksrautiqaqtuŋa ATANIĠ-mun, God-iŋanun qiḷaum, savaŋaruam nunamiglu taġiumiglu.”

english: Hearing this, the men became even more afraid and said to him, “What have you done?” (The men said this because they knew that he was trying to escape from the Lord, because he had previously told them.)
inupiaq: Jonah-m uqallautiniġai qimaatilaamiñik ATANIĠ-miñ. Tavraasii umiaqpagaqtit iqsiḷipiaġataŋarut, aasii uqallautivlugu, “Uvva iłuaŋipiaġataqtuq tainna piñiqavich!” suli apiġivlugu, “Summan uvva qimaaruatin tainna?”

english: Because the storm was growing worse and worse, they said to him, “What should we do to you to make the sea calm down for us?”
inupiaq: Siḷaqłuk suamasisaiññaŋaruq, aasii umiaqpagaqtit apiġigaat, “Qanuq imña piñiaġniqpisigiñ siḷaqłiuŋaiġumaugut?”

english: He said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea to make the sea quiet down, because I know it’s my fault you are in this severe storm.”
inupiaq: Jonah-m kiugai, “Igitchiñŋa taġiumun, anuġaiġumauq. Iḷisimaruŋa patchisautilaamnik uvva siḷaqłukpaguutimmasi.”

english: Instead, they tried to row back to land, but they were not able to do so because the storm kept growing worse and worse.
inupiaq: Aglaan, aŋutit tulautiniatanagutiŋagaat umiaqpak, aŋualgutilaamiktun. Aglaan anuġi iŋattaqsisaiññaqhuni, payyiñŋagaat.

english: So they cried out to the Lord, “Oh, please, Lord, don’t let us die on account of this man! Don’t hold us guilty of shedding innocent blood. After all, you, Lord, have done just as you pleased.”
inupiaq: Tainnamik ququulanagutiŋarut ATANIĠ-mun, “Ataniiq, tatavsaġnasigut tuqqunmik uuma iñuum iñuggutaa pisigilugu! Ilvich, Ataniiq, aŋalatkiñ tamanna; ilvich savaaġigiñ.”

english: So they picked Jonah up and threw him into the sea, and the sea stopped raging.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tiguvlugu Jonah siŋitkaat taġiumun, aasii qaiḷḷiiqsautigillaaŋaruq.

english: The men feared the Lord greatly, and earnestly vowed to offer lavish sacrifices to the Lord.
inupiaq: Umiaqpagaqtit tavrani qiksiksralipiallaŋarut ATANIĠ-mik, aasii qaitchivḷutiŋ aitchuunmik suli unniqsuqłiivḷugu savautiniaġnivḷugu.

english: Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the stomach of the fish
inupiaq: Jonah aasii aŋaiyyunagutiŋaruq ATANIĠ-mun God-imiñun iḷuaniillaġmi iqaluum:

english: and said,
inupiaq: Tavraasii Atanġum piraksriŋagaa tivvuaquvlugu Jonah paliumaruamun nunamun, aasii tivvuaŋagaa.

english: “I called out to the Lord from my distress,
and he answered me;
from the belly of Sheol I cried out for help,
and you heard my prayer.
You threw me into the deep waters,
into the middle of the sea;
the ocean current engulfed me;
all the mighty waves you sent swept over me.
I thought I had been banished from your sight,
that I would never again see your holy temple!
Water engulfed me up to my neck;
the deep ocean surrounded me;
seaweed was wrapped around my head.
I went down to the very bottoms of the mountains;
the gates of the netherworld barred me in forever;
but you brought me up from the Pit, O Lord, my God.
When my life was ebbing away, I called out to the Lord,
and my prayer came to your holy temple.
Those who worship worthless idols forfeit the mercy that could be theirs.
But as for me, I promise to offer a sacrifice to you with a public declaration of praise;
I will surely do what I have promised.
Salvation belongs to the Lord!”
Then the Lord commanded the fish and it disgorged Jonah on dry land.
The Lord said to Jonah a second time,
inupiaq: Ataniq uqallavsaaŋaruq Jonah-mun.

english: “Go immediately to Nineveh, that large city, and proclaim to it the message that I tell you.”
inupiaq: Uqaqłuni, “Aullaġiñ Nineveh-mun, iniqpagmun, uqautiyyaġlugich iñuich uqalugmik qaisamnik iliŋnun.”

english: So Jonah went immediately to Nineveh, as the Lord had said. (Now Nineveh was an enormous city – it required three days to walk through it!)
inupiaq: Jonah-m kamagiŋagaa Ataniq aasii Nineveh-mukłuni, iniqpauvił̣ł̣uni piŋasuni uvluni pisuaqtuni tapiglagataġnaqtuq.

english: When Jonah began to enter the city one day’s walk, he announced, “At the end of forty days, Nineveh will be overthrown!”
inupiaq: Jonah aullaqiŋaruq iniqpagmun, pisuaganikami uvluq naałługu, uqautinagutiŋagai, “Malġukipiat uvlut pianikpata Nineveh suksraunġiqsauniaqtuq!”

english: The people of Nineveh believed in God, and they declared a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest to the least of them.
inupiaq: Tavraasi iñuŋisa Nineveh-m ukpiġiŋagaat Godim kiliktuutigipkaqtaŋa. Sivunniŋarut iluqaġmiŋ niġiŋaiḷaġukłutiŋ, aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñuich kamanautiqaġaluaqamiŋ kamanaiññiqtaugaluaqamiŋ, atiŋarut miitchugnik nalunaiqsaqługu isumalitqiktilaaqtiŋ.

english: When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he got up from his throne, took off his royal robe, put on sackcloth, and sat on ashes.
inupiaq: Umialikpaŋa Nineveh-m tusaakami, makiłłuni aquppiutaqpagmiñiñ, mattaqługu qaliġuani, ativluni miitchugnik, aquvinŋaruq aġranun.

english: He issued a proclamation and said, “In Nineveh, by the decree of the king and his nobles: No human or animal, cattle or sheep, is to taste anything; they must not eat and they must not drink water.
inupiaq: Kiliktuipkaiŋaruq iñuŋiñun Nineveh-m: “Uvva una piraksriutaa umialgum atanauraŋisalu: Kiñaunnii sumik niġiñiaŋitchuq; iluqaġmiŋ iñuich, niġrutit, suli imnaich niġitquŋisaurut naakkaunnii imiqtuksrauŋitchut.

english: Every person and animal must put on sackcloth and must cry earnestly to God, and everyone must turn from their evil way of living and from the violence that they do.
inupiaq: Iñupayaat suli niġrutit atiruksraurut miitchugnik. Iluqaġmiŋ iŋiqsruqtuksraurut God-mun suli aġiulugich pigiiḷḷiqutitiŋ suli piaġiitchuat piraġausitiŋ.

english: Who knows? Perhaps God might be willing to change his mind and relent and turn from his fierce anger so that we might not die.”
inupiaq: Suagguuq God isummitqigñiaqtuq; suagguuq qinnautini aġiuniaġaa, aasii uvagut tuquŋiḷḷuta!”

english: When God saw their actions – they turned from their evil way of living! – God relented concerning the judgment he had threatened them with and he did not destroy them.
inupiaq: Godim tautugniġai qanuq pitilaaŋiññik; tautukkai aġiuŋatilaaŋiññik pigiiḷḷiqutimignik. Tavra tainnaqłuni isummitqiŋaruq suli tatavsaun iliŋiññun sivunniutikkaluni atuŋił̣ł̣ugu.

english: This is the record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
inupiaq: Uvva aglaich maŋŋuŋigun Jesus Christ, kiŋunġuruam David-mun, Abraham-mullu.

english: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,
inupiaq: Abraham aapagigaa Isaac-gum. Isaac-li aapagigaa Jacob-gum. Jacob-li aapagigaat Judah-vlu aniqatiiŋisalu.

english: Judah the father of Perez and Zerah (by Tamar), Perez the father of Hezron, Hezron the father of Ram,
inupiaq: Judah aapaŋak Perez-guvlu Zerah-vlu. Taapkuak aakaŋak Tamar. Perez aapaŋa Hezron-gum, Hezron-li aapaŋa Ram-gum.

english: Ram the father of Amminadab, Amminadab the father of Nahshon, Nahshon the father of Salmon,
inupiaq: Ram-li aapagigaa Amminadab-gum. Amminadab-li aapagigaa Nashan-gum. Nashan-li aapagigaa Salmon-gum.

english: Salmon the father of Boaz (by Rahab), Boaz the father of Obed (by Ruth), Obed the father of Jesse,
inupiaq: Salmon-li aapagigaa Boaz-gum, Rahab-mik aakaqaqtuam. Boaz-li aapagigaa Obed-gum, aakaqaqtuam Ruth-mik. Obed-li aapagigaa Jesse-m.

english: and Jesse the father of David the king.
inupiaq: Jesse aapagigaa Umialgum David. David-li aapagigaa Solomon-gum, aakaqaqtuam Uriah-m nuliakkaluaŋanik.

english: David was the father of Solomon (by the wife of Uriah),
inupiaq: Solomon aapagigaa Rehoboam-gum, Rehoboam-li aapagigaa Abijah-m, Abijah-li aapagigaa Asa-m,

english: Solomon the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asa,
inupiaq: Asa-li aapagigaa Jehoshaphat-gum, Jehoshaphat-li aapagigaa Joram-gum, Joram-li aapagigaa Uzziah-m,

english: Asa the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, Joram the father of Uzziah,
inupiaq: Uzziah-li aapagigaa Jotham, Jotham-li aapagigaa Ahaz-gum, Ahaz-li aapagigaa Hezekiah-m,

english: Uzziah the father of Jotham, Jotham the father of Ahaz, Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,
inupiaq: Hezekiah-li aapagigaa Manasseh-m, Manasseh-li aapagigaa Amos-gum, Amos-li aapagigaa Josiah-m,

english: Hezekiah the father of Manasseh, Manasseh the father of Amon, Amon the father of Josiah,
inupiaq: Josiah-li aapagigaa Jechoniah-vlu aniqatiŋisalu. Taimani iñuich Israel-guruat aullaurrausaġmata Babylon-mun.

english: and Josiah the father of Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
inupiaq: Iñuich aasii aullaurrauganiŋmata Babylon-mun ukuali aniŋarut. Jechoniah aapagigaa Shealtiel-gum. Shealtiel-li aapagigaa Zerubbabel-gum.

english: After the deportation to Babylon, Jeconiah became the father of Shealtiel, Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel,
inupiaq: Zerubbabel aapagigaa Abiud-gum, Abiud-li aapagigaa Eliakim, Eliakim-li aapagigaa Azor-m.

english: Zerubbabel the father of Abiud, Abiud the father of Eliakim, Eliakim the father of Azor,
inupiaq: Azor-li aapagigaa Zadok-gum, Zadok-li aapagigaa Achim, Achim-li aapagigaa Eliud-gum.

english: Azor the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Achim, Achim the father of Eliud,
inupiaq: Eliud aapagigaa Eleazar-m, Eleazar-li aapagigaa Matthan, Matthan-li aapagigaa Jacob-gum,

english: Eliud the father of Eleazar, Eleazar the father of Matthan, Matthan the father of Jacob,
inupiaq: Jacob-li aapagigaa Joseph-gum, uiŋa Mary-m aakaŋa Jesus Christ-guruam.

english: and Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, by whom Jesus was born, who is called Christ.
inupiaq: Tavra kiŋuniġiich Abraham-miñ David-mun akimiaġuutaiḷauŋarut. Suli David-miñ aullaurrauniŋannunaglaan Babylon-mun kiŋuniġiich akimiaġuutaiḷauŋarut. Aasiiḷi aullaurrauniŋanniñaglaan akimiaġuutaiḷauŋammiut kiŋuniġiich aniñiŋanunaglaan Christ-guruam.

english: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon, fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to Christ, fourteen generations.
inupiaq: Tavra aniñiŋa Jesus Christ piŋaruq inna. Aakaŋa Mary piksrausiutauganikami Joseph-mun, tuvaaqatigiiksinŋaiñŋaġmik, iḷitchuġiŋaruq siŋaiyautilaamiñik Ilitqusiġiksuakun.

english: Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way. While his mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Aasii uiksrautauruaq Joseph, nalaunŋaruaguvluni, Kanŋunaqsiḷiġuŋił̣ł̣ugu Mary iñuŋnun, sivunniŋaruq avitchukługu nalunaqtuakun.

english: Because Joseph, her husband to be, was a righteous man, and because he did not want to disgrace her, he intended to divorce her privately.
inupiaq: Tavra taavrumiŋa isumalaaġutiqaqtillugu, Atanġum isaġulga niptaŋaruq ilaanun siññaktukun, aasii uqaqłuni, Joseph, kiŋunġuruatiin David-mun, sivuuġanak Mary-mik tuvaaqatiniksaġnipkun, qanuq ilaa siŋaiyaupkaŋagaa Ilitqusiġiksuam.

english: When he had contemplated this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, because the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Iġñiqaġniaqtuq, aasii atchiġisigiñ Jesus-mik, qanuq ilaan annautiniaġai iñuŋni piḷuutiŋiññiñ.

english: She will give birth to a son and you will name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”
inupiaq: Tamatkua iluqaġmiŋ piŋarut taŋŋiqsaqługu Atanġum uqautigiŋaraa ilaan uqaqtimigun inna.

english: This all happened so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet would be fulfilled:
inupiaq: “Aŋusiuŋaitchuaq siŋaiyauniaqtuq aasii iġñiqaġluni, aasii atiqaġniaqtuq Emmanuel-mik, sivuniqaqtuamik, God-im itqatigigaatigut.”

english: “Look! The virgin will conceive and bear a son, and they will call him Emmanuel,” which means “God with us.”
inupiaq: Joseph itiqami, piŋaruq pitqutaagun isaġulgata Atanġum. Ilaan tuvaaqasiutiŋagaa Mary.

english: When Joseph awoke from sleep he did what the angel of the Lord told him. He took his wife,
inupiaq: Aglaan aŋalanŋaitkaa nuliaġiruatun iġñianigataqtillugu aŋunmik, aasii Joseph-gum atchiŋagaa Jesus-mik.

english: but did not have marital relations with her until she gave birth to a son, whom he named Jesus.
After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, in the time of King Herod, wise men from the East came to Jerusalem
inupiaq: Jesus aniŋaruq Bethlehem-mi Judea-miittuami, Herod umialgumman. Tavra Iḷitchiruat iñuich paaŋŋamiñ tikiññamiŋ Jerusalem-mun, apiqsriŋarut.

english: saying, “Where is the one who is born king of the Jews? For we saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”
inupiaq: Sumi imma aniva umialgat Jews? Tautuŋagikput uvluġiaŋa paaniinŋapta, aasiuvva qairugut sitquġvigiyaqtuqługu nanġaġukługu.

english: When King Herod heard this he was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him.
inupiaq: Herod-gum umialgum tusaakamiuŋ taamna, isumaaluliŋaruq iluqaġmiglu iñuŋi Jerusalem.

english: After assembling all the chief priests and experts in the law, he asked them where the Christ was to be born.
inupiaq: Aasii katitiłługich iluqaisa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich, iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik, apiqsruqtupiaŋagai sumi Christ aniyumaaġmagaan.

english: “In Bethlehem of Judea,” they said, “for it is written this way by the prophet:
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, nunaaqqimi Bethlehem-mi Judea-miittuami, qanuq God-im uqaqtaata aglaaġiŋagaa uqalua God-im inna,

english: ‘And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,
inupiaq: Aasii kiliktauvlutiŋ siññaktukun utiquŋił̣ł̣ugich Herod-mun, utiqsaŋarut nunamiŋnun allakun apqutikun.

english: are in no way least among the rulers of Judah,
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchiruat aullaaniŋmata, isaġulga Atanġum niptaŋaruq Joseph-mun siññaktukun, aasii uqallautivlugu, Makittin. Pigruutikkik miqłiqtuq aakaŋalu Egypt-mun, aasii taamaniitchumausi uvamnun aullaqutchiaġilusi taamaŋŋa. Qanuq Herod ivaqłiayumalliqsuq miqłiqtumik tuqutchukługu.

english: for out of you will come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.’”
inupiaq: Aasii unnuakun Joseph makinŋaruq pigruutivlugik miqłiqtuġlu aakaŋalu, aasii aullaqłutiŋ Egypt-mun.

english: Then Herod privately summoned the wise men and determined from them when the star had appeared.
inupiaq: Tavraniinŋarut Herod tuquniŋanunaglaan. Taamna taŋŋiutauŋaruq Atanġum uqalugiŋakkaŋanun ilaan uqaqtimigun, “Egypt-miñ qaitquŋagiga Iġñiġa.”

english: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and look carefully for the child. When you find him, inform me so that I can go and worship him as well.”
inupiaq: Tavra Herod, iḷitchuġikami sagluqitilaamiñik iḷitchiruanun, qinnalipiaġataŋaruq. Aasii piraksriiŋaruq tuquġaquvlugich iluqaisa aŋugaurat ukiuqaqtuat malġugnik naagga inuŋallaktuamik Bethlehem-miittuat iluqaaniḷu tamattumani nunami, miksrautchaqługu taimani nalupqinaiyaani iḷitchiruaniñ.

english: After listening to the king they left, and once again the star they saw when it rose led them until it stopped above the place where the child was.
inupiaq: Tavrani taŋŋiqsauŋaruq Jeremiah-m God-im uqaqtaata uqautigiŋakkaŋa inna,

english: When they saw the star they shouted joyfully.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod tuqumman, isaġulga Atanġum niptaŋaruq siññaktukun Joseph-mun Egypt-mi uqaqłuni,

english: As they came into the house and saw the child with Mary his mother, they bowed down and worshiped him. They opened their treasure boxes and gave him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
inupiaq: Makittin. Aullautikkik miqłiqtuġlu aakaŋalu nunaŋannun Israel. Taipkua tuqutchiyumaruat miqłiqtumik tuquŋarut.

english: After being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back by another route to their own country.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa makinŋaruq, aasii aullautivlugik miqłiqtuġlu aakaŋalu nunaŋannun Israel.

english: After they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Get up, take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to look for the child to kill him.”
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamiuŋ Archelaus umialgutilaaŋanik Judea-mi, inaani aapami Herod tuquŋaruam, tavruŋaqsausiiñŋaruq, aasii kiliktauvluni siññaktukun, aullaŋaruq nunaŋiññun Galilee-m.

english: Then he got up, took the child and his mother during the night, and went to Egypt.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuurraqsiŋaruq iniqpaŋani Nazareth, taamnaptauq uqautigiŋakkaŋat miqłiqtukun uqaqtiŋisa God-im taŋŋiqsauŋaruq inna, “Ilaa tairauniaqtuq Nazareth-miumik.”

english: He stayed there until Herod died. In this way what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet was fulfilled: “I called my Son out of Egypt.”

When Herod saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, he became enraged. He sent men to kill all the children in Bethlehem and throughout the surrounding region from the age of two and under, according to the time he had learned from the wise men.
Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
weeping and loud wailing,
Rachel weeping for her children,
and she did not want to be comforted, because they were gone.”
After Herod had died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt
saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the child’s life are dead.”
So he got up and took the child and his mother and returned to the land of Israel.
But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. After being warned in a dream, he went to the regions of Galilee.
He came to a town called Nazareth and lived there. Then what had been spoken by the prophets was fulfilled, that Jesus would be called a Nazarene.
In those days John the Baptist came into the wilderness of Judea proclaiming,
inupiaq: Taipkunani uvluni John Paptaiqsi qaiŋaruq, alġaqsruivḷuni nunagluktuaŋani Judea-m.

english: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
inupiaq: Uqaqłuni, isumalitqigitchi, qanuq God-im atanniqsimasaaqsigai iñuich.

english: For he is the one about whom Isaiah the prophet had spoken:
inupiaq: John-guŋaruq Isaiah-m God-im uqaqtaata uqallausiġiŋakkaŋa,

english: “The voice of one shouting in the wilderness,
inupiaq: Tavra John annuġaaqaŋaruq kakaktim pikukturuam amianik, suli qisiŋmik tavsiqaqłuni, aasii niqigivlugich nuttagayuich qupilġut igutchaiḷḷu honey-ŋannik paqinnaqtuamik nunagluktuami.

english: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.’”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich ullaaŋagaat John Jerusalem-miñ iluqaaniḷḷu Judea-miñ, suli iluqaiññiñ nunaaqqiñiñ avataaniittuaniñ kuugum Jordan.

english: Now John wore clothing made from camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and his diet consisted of locusts and wild honey.
inupiaq: Suli John iñuich paptaiŋagai kuuŋani Jordan, quliaqtuqługich piḷuutitiŋ God-mun.

english: Then people from Jerusalem, as well as all Judea and all the region around the Jordan, were going out to him,
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchuġikamigich iñugiaktuat Pharisees Sadducees-lu paptaiqsauyyaqtuat, ilaan uqallautiŋagai, tuqunaliktun nimiġiatun ittusi, pisaasuqtusi. Isumanasi paptaiqsaugiññaġlusi pillugniaġasugalugu God-im tatavsautaa.

english: and he was baptizing them in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
inupiaq: Iñuusitchi nalunaiġḷugu isumalitqiksilaaqsi piḷuutivsiññiñ.

english: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
inupiaq: Suli isumasaġnasi pillugniaġasugalugu God-im tatavsautaa pisigilugu Abraham-mun kiŋuniġiniḷusi. Qanuq uqallautigivsi, God miqłiqtuliḷḷaruq Abraham-mun makkunaŋŋa uyaġagniñ.

english: Therefore produce fruit that proves your repentance,
inupiaq: God-im isivġiutaa qallipiaġataqtuq, iñuktun itqanaiqsuatun kipisałhiñaaġuqługu napaaqtuq kaŋiagun. Napaaqtupayaaq siiġñiḷḷuatalaitchuaq kipirausuuruq, aasii qirugivlugu igniġmun. Tainnatun God-im suksraunġiġñiaġai iñuich nalaunŋarualiqiŋitchuat.

english: and don’t think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that God can raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
inupiaq: Uvaŋa paptaiġivsi imiġmik isumalitqikavsi, aglaan imma qaiñiaqtuaq aqupkun sapiġñałhaaqtuq uvamniñ, nalliummatiŋitchuŋaunnii aluġutik saagaġumiñaġlugik. Iḷiñiaġaa Ilitqusiġiksuaq iḷuvsiññun, aasii piiġḷugu piḷuun.

english: Even now the ax is laid at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
inupiaq: Ilaan amiġaiyautini kakiuraqpait saagaġigai, suli suaqłuiyaġniaġaa amiġaiyaiviñi aasii katillugich palauvaksrat tutquiviŋmun, aglaan ikipkaġniaġai amiġaŋich qaminnaġumiñaitchuamik igniġmik.

english: “I baptize you with water, for repentance, but the one coming after me is more powerful than I am – I am not worthy to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani Jesus iñukpalliŋaruq Galilee-miñ Jordan-mun John-mukłuni, paptaiquvluni ilaanun.

english: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clean out his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the storehouse, but the chaff he will burn up with inextinguishable fire.”
inupiaq: John-gum paptaiġuŋitkaluaġaa, uqallakłuni, Ilivich uvva paptaigaksraġigaluaġiŋma, aasiuvva qaivich uvamnun paptaiquvlutin?

english: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John to be baptized by him in the Jordan River.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiugiññaŋagaa, Tainna piḷi paŋmapak. Taamna piguptigu, taŋŋiġñiaġikpuk iluqaan God-im piraksriutaa. Tavra John piyumaliŋaruq.

english: But John tried to prevent him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and yet you come to me?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus paptaiqsauganikami, tavrauvvaa qakiŋaruq immamiñ. Tavra qiḷak aŋmaqłuni, John tautuŋagaa Ilitqusiġiksuaŋa God-im atqaqtuaq tiŋmiatun, aasii mitchaaqłuni ilaanun.

english: So Jesus replied to him, “Let it happen now, for it is right for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then John yielded to him.
inupiaq: Aasii tusaaŋagaa nipi qiḷaŋmiñ, Uvva piviuttaġikkaġa Iġñiġa. Ilaa iviġaummatigilluataġiga.

english: After Jesus was baptized, just as he was coming up out of the water, the heavens opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming on him.
And a voice from heaven said, “This is my one dear Son; in him I take great delight.”
Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullatiŋagaa Ilitqusiġiksuam nunagluktuamun ikł̣igutchaktinniaquvlugu Tuunġaġmun.

english: After he fasted forty days and forty nights he was famished.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaa niġiḷaiñŋaruq aŋaiyyuuġukłuni malġukipiani uvluni unnuaniḷu, aasii aquvatigun kaaliŋaruq.

english: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become bread.”
inupiaq: Tuunġaum qaivḷuni uqallautiŋagaa, Iġñiġipiaqpatin God-im, makua uyaġaich punniġuqtitkich.

english: But he answered, “It is written, ‘Man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagaa, Aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, Iñuk iñuuniaŋitchuq niqikun kisiagun, aglaallu ukpiġilugich God-im uqalupayauraŋi.

english: Then the devil took him to the holy city, had him stand on the highest point of the temple,
inupiaq: Tavrani Tuunġaum aullautiŋagaa Jesus Jerusalem-mun, aasii inillakługu nuvuquyuanun aŋaiyyuvikpaum qutchigñiqsramun,

english: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you’ and ‘with their hands they will lift you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugu, Iġñiġipiaqpatin God-im, nautkiaġiñ, qanuq aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna,

english: Jesus said to him, “Once again it is written: ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
inupiaq: Tavrasuli, Tuunġaum aullautiŋagaa qutchipiaġataqtuamun iġġimun, aasii satqummiutivlugu iluqaiññik umialgutiŋiññik nunam, kamanautaanniglu.

english: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their grandeur.
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautivlugu, Iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa aitchuġniaġikpiñ, sitquġlutin aŋaiyyuvigigumŋa.

english: And he said to him, “I will give you all these things if you throw yourself to the ground and worship me.”
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aullaġiñ Satan, qanuq aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, “Aŋaiyyuvigisaġiñ Ataniq God-in, suli kisian savautiniaġiñ.”

english: Then Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan! For it is written: ‘You are to worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Tuunġaum qimaŋagaa, aasii isaġulgich qaivḷutiŋ ikayuŋagaat Jesus.

english: Then the devil left him, and angels came and began ministering to his needs.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaakami John tigutaaġnivḷugu, Galilee-muksaŋaruq,

english: Now when Jesus heard that John had been imprisoned, he went into Galilee.
inupiaq: aasii qimakługu Nazareth aullaqłuni iñuurraqsiŋaruq Capernaum-mi tatchim Galilee-m siñaaniittuami, nunaŋani Zebulun Naphtali-vlu.

english: While in Galilee, he moved from Nazareth to make his home in Capernaum by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
inupiaq: Taamna uqautigiŋakkaŋa uqaqtaata God-im Isaiah-m nalautautquvlugu inna,

english: so that what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled:
inupiaq: Jesus pisuaġniallaġmi siñaagun tasiata Galilee-m, tautuŋagik aniqatigiik, Simon tairauruaq Peter-mik, Andrew-lu aniqataa, kuvriqsuak tatchimun, iqalugniaqtauvlutik.

english: “Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagik, Maliktinŋa. Iqalugniaġusiptiktun, iḷisautiniaġiptik iñunnagniaġniġmik.

english: the way by the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles –
inupiaq: Tavrauvvaa qimaŋagaik kuvratik aasii malikługu.

english: the people who sit in darkness have seen a great light,
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋa aullalgiññami Jesus tautulgitkik malġuksuli aniqatigiik, James-lu John-lu Zebedee-m iġñiŋik, umiuramiinniqsuat Zebedee-lu aapariŋ, allaiyaqługich kuvratiŋ. Ilaan ququaŋagik.

english: and on those who sit in the region and shadow of death a light has dawned.”
inupiaq: Tavrauvvaa qimaŋagaich umiuraqtik aapariglu, aasii malikługu Jesus.

english: From that time Jesus began to preach this message: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
inupiaq: Aasii ilaa kukiḷuŋaruq iluqaani Galilee-mi, iḷisaurrivḷuni aŋaiyyuviŋiññi alġaqsruivḷuniḷu tusaayugaaġiksuaŋanik atanniqsimmataata God-im, suli iłuaqsivḷugich iñuich naŋirrutiqapayauraqtuat.

english: As he was walking by the Sea of Galilee he saw two brothers, Simon (called Peter) and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaaŋagaat aliuġnaġniŋa siamiłłuni iluqaiññun nunaaqqiŋiñun Syria-m. Aasii iñuich qaġġirriŋarut ilaanun iluqaiññik naŋittuanik, tamatkuniŋa nagliksautiqaqtuanik qanusiḷimaanik naŋirrutinik kiiqsiuġutiniglu, iḷitqusiqł̣uqaqtuallu, qiiqsruġuuruallu, avatiŋiḷḷu tuquŋaruat, aasii ilaan iłuaqsiŋagai iluqaisa.

english: He said to them, “Follow me, and I will turn you into fishers of people.”
inupiaq: Suli iñugiapiaġataqtuat maliŋagaat Jesus Galilee-miñ, quliniḷḷu nunaaqqiñiñ, Jerusalem-miḷḷu, Judea-miḷḷu taavaŋŋatchianiḷḷu kuugum Jordan.

english: They left their nets immediately and followed him.
Going on from there he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. Then he called them.
They immediately left the boat and their father and followed him.
Jesus went throughout all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of disease and sickness among the people.

So a report about him spread throughout Syria. People brought to him all who suffered with various illnesses and afflictions, those who had seizures, paralytics, and those possessed by demons, and he healed them.
And large crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan River.
When he saw the crowds, he went up the mountain. After he sat down his disciples came to him.
inupiaq: Tautukługich iñusalaich, Jesus mayuŋaruq iġġimun, aasii aquvinman iḷitchitquraŋisa ullaŋagaat.

english: Then he began to teach them by saying:
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan iḷisautirraqsiŋagai, uqaqłuni,

english: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
inupiaq: Quviasugitchi iñuich uqamaqłuktautigaluaqpasi nagliksaaqtitkaluaqpasiḷu suli nivlialutiŋ qanusipayaanik pigiitchuanik ilivsigun saglutigilusi pisigilugu maliġuaqtauniqsi uvamnun.

english: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
inupiaq: Quviasupiaġataġitchi, qanuq aŋiruq akiḷiusiaksraqsi qiḷaŋmi, tainnaptauq iñuich nagliksaaqtinŋammigaich uqaqtiŋi God-im sivuvsiññi iñuuŋaruat.

english: “Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
inupiaq: Ilivsi iḷitchitqurat taġiutun ittusi nunam iñuŋiñun. Taġiuq taġiuġniiġumi, qanuġluni taġiuġniḷitqigñiaqpa? Taġiuġniiqami, anniqsuutauŋaiqsuq supayaamun aglaan naavillugu aasii iñuich tunmalugilugu.

english: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be satisfied.
inupiaq: Ilivsi iḷitchitqurat qaummatitun ittusi nunam iñuŋiñun. Iniqpak ittuaq qimiqqam qaaŋani tautuŋiññaġumiñaitchuq.

english: “Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii iñuich ikitchikamiŋ nannimik iḷiḷaitkaat utkusium ataanun, aglaan naniqaġviŋmun, qaummatautquvlugu iñuŋnun iglumi.

english: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
inupiaq: Tainnatulli qaummatitun qaummaġigitchi nakuurualiqilusi, iñuich tautukkumagaich nakuurualiqiasi aasii nanġaġlugu Aapari qiḷaŋmiittuaq.

english: “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called the children of God.
inupiaq: Isumanasi qaiŋanasugaluŋa asivaġiaġlugich pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun, iḷisaurrutiŋiḷḷu uqaqtiŋisa God-im. Qaiŋaitchuŋa asivaġiaġlugich, aglaan taŋŋiġiaqługich.

english: “Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷumun uqallautigivsi, qiḷaglu nunalu piiŋaiñŋaagnik, atausiuraqunnii God-im pitquraŋiñi naumaŋiññiqsrakkaluaq unnii piiġumiñaitchuq iluqaisa pitqurat taŋŋiġataqtillugich.

english: “Blessed are you when people insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things about you falsely on account of me.
inupiaq: Kiñapayaaq tavra kamaksriŋitkumi atausiuramikunnii kamanaiññiqsraŋannik makua pitqurat aasii iḷisautiaqsiḷugich iñuich tainnali pitqulugich, kamanaiññiqsrauniaqtuq atanniqsimaviani Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam. Aglaan iñuk kamaksriruaq pitquranik iḷisaurrutigivlugiḷḷu, kamanaġniqsrauruq atanniqsimaviani Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: Rejoice and be glad because your reward is great in heaven, for they persecuted the prophets before you in the same way.
inupiaq: Qanuq uqallautigivsi, Iñuuniaġusiqsi nalaunŋaruakun nakuułhaaŋitpan iñuuniaġusianniñ iḷisaurrit pitquranik Pharisees-lu, suuramikunnii isiġumiñaitchusi atanniqsimavianun Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: “You are the salt of the earth. But if salt loses its flavor, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything except to be thrown out and trampled on by people.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋarusi uqausiusiaŋannik taipkua iñuich inna, Iñuaġnak. Kiñaliqaa iñuaġniġumi anayasaaġniaqtuq isivġiqsauniġmun.

english: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill cannot be hidden.
inupiaq: Aglaalli uvaŋa uqallautigivsi uumiŋa. Iñupayaaq qinnaurriruaq aniqanmiñik anayasaaġniaqtuq isivġiqsauniġmun. Kialiqaa uqamaqłuutigumiuŋ aniqatini, anayasaaġniaqtuq isivġiqsauniġmun ataniġnaqusiraqtuaniñ. Kiñaliqaasuli uqallaurrigumi inna, Ilivich isumalluaġiitchuatiin, ilaa anayasaaġniaqtuq nagliksaaġviŋmugniksramun igniġmun.

english: People do not light a lamp and put it under a basket but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all in the house.
inupiaq: Tavraasii aitchuiyumaagaqsiguvsi God-mun aitchuutivsiññik ikipkaiviŋmi, aasii tavrani itqaiḷusi aniqatiksi sunŋutiqaqtilaaŋanik ilivsiññun,

english: In the same way, let your light shine before people, so that they can see your good deeds and give honor to your Father in heaven.
inupiaq: qimaksigik tavruŋa aitchuutisi sivuġaanun ikipkaivium, aasii aullaġlusi, iḷauraaliuqqaaġitchi aniqativsiññun, aasii qaiḷusi aitchuutigiyaqtuġlugu aitchuutiksi.

english: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets. I have not come to abolish these things but to fulfill them.
inupiaq: Atisiqatigisigik pasirisi qilamik, uqaqsitaaġviŋmullavsi, iḷaanni pasirivsi aitchuutigiviaġaasi isivġiqsimun, aasiiḷi isivġiqsim tigutaaqtitchirimun, aasii isiqtaulusi tigutaaġviŋmun.

english: I tell you the truth, until heaven and earth pass away not the smallest letter or stroke of a letter will pass from the law until everything takes place.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, aniyumiñaipiaqtusi suuramikunnii akiḷiiganiqqaaŋaunnasi.

english: So anyone who breaks one of the least of these commands and teaches others to do so will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever obeys them and teaches others to do so will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋarusi uqautauŋaruamik inna, Allatuġnak.

english: For I tell you, unless your righteousness goes beyond that of the experts in the law and the Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
inupiaq: Aglaalli uqallautigivsi, iñupayaaq qiñiqtuaq aġnamun ikł̣igivlugu, allatuaniktuq isumamiñi.

english: “You have heard that it was said to an older generation, ‘Do not murder,’ and ‘whoever murders will be subjected to judgment.’
inupiaq: Taliqpium irivsi piḷuksipkaqpasi, iñuusitchi ilivsiññik iraiġḷusi iksiruatun irivsiññik. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq iraitkuvsiunnii aasii iñuulusi nalaunŋaruakun, timisi suġġaiḷḷugich igitauniġmiñ nagliksaaġviŋmun.

english: But I say to you that anyone who is angry with a brother will be subjected to judgment. And whoever insults a brother will be brought before the council, and whoever says ‘Fool’ will be sent to fiery hell.
inupiaq: Suli taliqpium argavsi piḷuksipkaqpasi, iñuusitchi ilivsiññik taliqpivsiññik argaiġḷusi iksiruatun argavsiññik. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq ilivsiññun argaiḷḷusiunnii iñuuguvsi nalaunŋaruakun, timisi suġġaiḷḷugich nagliksaaġviŋmuktitauniġmiñ.

english: So then, if you bring your gift to the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,
inupiaq: Uqaluuŋammiuqsuli, Kialiqaa avitkumiuŋ nuliani, qaitchiḷiuŋ makpiġaanik aglagluni nalupqinaiġutinik avinnikun.

english: leave your gift there in front of the altar. First go and be reconciled to your brother and then come and present your gift.
inupiaq: Tavrali uqallautigivsi, kialiqaa avitkumiuŋ nuliani, allatuŋaitkaluaqtillugu, taamna avittuaq pasirauruq allatuqtitchirualiḷugu uiñitqikpan nuliani. Aasiisuli aŋun nuliaqtuaq avitauŋaruamik allatuġmiuq.

english: Reach agreement quickly with your accuser while on the way to court, or he may hand you over to the judge, and the judge hand you over to the warden, and you will be thrown into prison.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋammiusi uqausiusiaŋannik taipkua iñuich inna, Aŋiuqsiñak unniqsuqłiisignik kimulliqaa sivuġaani Atanġum, aglaan taŋŋiġuŋ unniqsuqłiisigiŋakkan.

english: I tell you the truth, you will never get out of there until you have paid the last penny!
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi uqallautigivsi, Unniqsuqłiiguvsi ukpiġnaqsiḷiġniatagnagu atuġlusi suaŋaruanik uqaluŋnik. Atuġnagu qiḷak uqaluvsiññi, qanuq God umialguruq tavrani.

english: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’
inupiaq: Atuġnagu nuna uqaluvsiññi qanuq God-im isigagmiñun tunŋavigimmatun itkaa, naaggaunnii Jerusalem qanuq kamanaqtuam umialgum iniqpagigaa.

english: But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to desire her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
inupiaq: Suli unniqsuqłiiguvsi ukpiġnaqsiḷiġniatagnagu atuġlugu niaquqsi uqaluvsiññi, qanuq atausiqunnii nuyaq qatiqsipkaġumiñaitkiksi naagga maŋaqsipkaġlugu.

english: If your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away! It is better to lose one of your members than to have your whole body thrown into hell.
inupiaq: Tavraasii unniqsuqłiiguvsi aŋiġnił̣hiñauli iḷagaluaġnagu allamik uqaluŋmik, naaggaaġnił̣hiñauluniḷu qanuq supayaam uqaluum iḷḷatauruam taapkuŋnuŋa piḷuksipkaqpiaġaasi.

english: If your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away! It is better to lose one of your members than to have your whole body go into hell.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋagiksi uqallautauŋaruaq, Iri akisautiqaġli irimik, kiguttauq kigunmik.

english: “It was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a legal document.’
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi uqallautigivsi, Akisaqtuġviginagu iñuum pimaqłukpasi. Aglaan kialiqaa iqsraaviñaqpasi taliqpivsigun, mannisiuŋ igḷuanik.

english: But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except for immorality, makes her commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli kialiqaa pitqurriqutilusi uqaqsitaaġviŋmi akiḷiipkaqsaqpasi qaliġuuravsiññik, quppiġaaqsiḷu piḷiuŋ.

english: “Again, you have heard that it was said to an older generation, ‘Do not break an oath, but fulfill your vows to the Lord.’
inupiaq: Suli aŋuyaktim nunuriḷusi saagaqtitpasi nanmagmiñik atautchisun mile-tun, nanmaksigik malġuktun mile-luuġutiktun.

english: But I say to you, do not take oaths at all – not by heaven, because it is the throne of God,
inupiaq: Aitchuqsiuŋ iñuk piatchiaqtuaq ilivsiññiñ, suli itigaurraqtinnagu iñuk attaqsiruaq ilivsiññiñ.

english: not by earth, because it is his footstool, and not by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋarusi uqallautauŋaruamik, Piviuttaġiyumagiksi siḷalliqsi aasii uumigilugu akiḷḷiḷiqsuqtiksi.

english: Do not take an oath by your head, because you are not able to make one hair white or black.
inupiaq: Aglaalli uqallautigivsi, piviuttaġisigik akiḷḷiḷiqsuqtisi suli aŋaiyyutilugich tamatkua nagliksaaqtitchiruat ilivsiññik,

english: Let your word be ‘Yes, yes’ or ‘No, no.’ More than this is from the evil one.
inupiaq: ilivsi miqłiqtuġiyumagaasi Aapavsi qiḷaŋmiittuam, qanuq siqiñini nuipkallagaa pigiitchuanullu nakuuruanullu, suli sialuguqtiłługu nalaunŋaruanun nalaunŋaŋitchuanullu.

english: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
inupiaq: Qanuq piviuttaġiguvsigik tamatkua piviuttaġirisi, summan niġiukpisi God-mun akiḷiġñiaġasugalusi? Tainnaptauq tax-iñik katitchirit pisuummiut.

english: But I say to you, do not resist the evildoer. But whoever strikes you on the right cheek, turn the other to him as well.
inupiaq: Paġlaguvsigik kisiisa aniqatiisi, allauruamik pivisi allaniñ? Tainnatuttauq Jew-guŋitchuat pisuummiut.

english: And if someone wants to sue you and to take your tunic, give him your coat also.
inupiaq: Tavraasii nalaunŋapiaqtuksraurusi, Aapavsisun qiḷaŋmi nalaunŋapiaqtuatun.

english: And if anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two.
Give to the one who asks you, and do not reject the one who wants to borrow from you.
“You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor’ and ‘hate your enemy.’
But I say to you, love your enemy and pray for those who persecute you,
so that you may be like your Father in heaven, since he causes the sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Even the tax collectors do the same, don’t they?
And if you only greet your brothers, what more do you do? Even the Gentiles do the same, don’t they?
So then, be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
“Be careful not to display your righteousness merely to be seen by people. Otherwise you have no reward with your Father in heaven.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi piraġausiqaġuŋiḷḷusi nagliktuutivsiññik qiñiqusaaqsiññaġlusi sivuġaŋanni iñuich. Tainnatuaġuvsi Aapavsi qiḷaŋmiittuam akiḷiġumiñaitkaasi.

english: Thus whenever you do charitable giving, do not blow a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in synagogues and on streets so that people will praise them. I tell you the truth, they have their reward.
inupiaq: Tavra, aitchuiguvsi nagliktuutinik, nipauqłuktautiginagich, ukpiŋŋuaqtuat piḷġusiatitun aŋaiyyuviŋñi apqutiniḷu, nanġaqusaaqłutiŋ iñuŋnun. Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, akiḷiusiaqaaniktut.

english: But when you do your giving, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi aitchuiguvsi nagliktuutinik, iḷisimapkaġniatagnasi saumiksi nalupkaġmatun suliqitilaaŋanik taliqpivsi.

english: so that your gift may be in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
inupiaq: Nagliktuisitchi nalunaqtuakun, aasiiḷi Aapavsi tautullaruam nalunaqtuami akiḷiġñiaġaasi.

english: “Whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to pray while standing in synagogues and on street corners so that people can see them. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli aŋaiyyuguvsi, piññasi ukpiŋŋuaqtuatun, qanuq iliŋich makitavlutiŋ aŋaiyyullaturut aŋaiyyuviŋñi apqutillu kayyaaŋiññi, tautuqusaaqłutiŋ iñuŋnun. Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, akiḷiusiaqaaniktut.

english: But whenever you pray, go into your room, close the door, and pray to your Father in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi aŋaiyyuguvsi, isiġitchi inauravsiññun aasii umiqqaaġlugu upkuaq aŋaiyyuaqsiḷusi Aapavsiññun nalunaqtuamiittuamun, aasiiḷi Aapavsi tautullaruam nalunaqtuami, akiḷiġñiaġaasi.

english: When you pray, do not babble repetitiously like the Gentiles, because they think that by their many words they will be heard.
inupiaq: Suli aŋaiyyuniġmi uqallakkaluamiiġñasi taŋiġitchuanik uqaġniġnik Jew-guŋitchuat piḷġusiatitun, qanuq isumasuurut tusaarauniaġnivḷutiŋ pisigilugich iñugiaktuat uqalutiŋ.

english: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
inupiaq: Tuvraġnasigik, qanuq Aapari iḷisimaruq sunik pigiraksraġikkavsiññik sivuani apiqsriŋaiñŋavsi inmiñun.

english: So pray this way:
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyusitchiasii inna:

english: Our Father in heaven, may your name be honored,
inupiaq: Qanuq suliqutigiŋaiġuvsigik itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich iñuich piḷuutiŋich, Aapavsi qiḷaŋmiittuam suliqutigiŋaiġñiaġmigai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutisi.

english: may your kingdom come,
inupiaq: Aglaattauq suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaitkuvsigik iñuich piḷuutiŋich, Aapavsivsauq suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaiñmigai piḷuutisi.

english: may your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
inupiaq: Suli niġiḷaitkuvsi aŋaiyyuuġlusi, qiññaqaġnasi ipiqtunaqsiḷusi ukpiŋŋuaqtuatun, qanuq ilaisa qiññaġiiḷiraġigaich kiiññatiŋ niġiḷaisilaaqtiŋ tautuquvlugu iñuŋnun. Iḷumun, uqallautigivsi, akiḷiusiaqaaniktut.

english: Give us today our daily bread,
inupiaq: Aglaan niġiḷaitkuvsi aŋaiyyuuġlusi, allaŋŋuqtiġnagu kiiñaqsi,

english: and forgive us our debts, as we ourselves have forgiven our debtors.
inupiaq: iñuich naluyumagaat niġiḷaiññiqsi aŋaiyyuuqłusi, aglaan Aapavsi nalunaqtuamiittuam iḷisimagaa, aasii Ilaan tautuaġiruam nalunaqtuami akiḷiġñiaġaasi.

english: And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.
inupiaq: Tutquiñasi mattumuŋa nunamun ilivsi piksravsiññik suġaliġnik, qupilġullu qalġuvlu maqutchuugai, suli tigligayuktit siqumutivlutiŋ tigligaġviannun.

english: “For if you forgive others their sins, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
inupiaq: Aglaan tutquisitchi qiḷaŋmun ilivsi piksravsiññik suġaliġnik. Tatpagmani qupilġuitchuq qaliḷaitchuġlu maqutchiruksranik, tigligayuktaitchuġlu siqumutilutiŋ tigliktuksranik.

english: But if you do not forgive others, your Father will not forgive you your sins.
inupiaq: Qanuq irvianni suġalivsi, tavraniitchugniaġmiusi.

english: “When you fast, do not look sullen like the hypocrites, for they make their faces unattractive so that people will see them fasting. I tell you the truth, they have their reward.
inupiaq: Irrak nannisun ittuk timimun. Irisi surruitpata tautuksisuġniaqtusi iñuulluataġniksramik tuvraġlugu God-im sivunniutaa. Inniaqtusi siḷivinŋaruatun qaummaġiksuamik.

english: When you fast, put oil on your head and wash your face,
inupiaq: Aglaan irisi surruiñŋitpata tautugluatayuiññiaqtusi iñuulluataġniksravsiññik, God-im sivunniutaa tuvralguiḷḷugu. Inniaqtusi siḷivinŋaruatun taaqtuamik. Tavraasii isumagaluaġuvsi iñuunasugalusi God-im iñuutqutaatun makimaŋallaan God-im sivunniutaa, qanutun killukuaqtigirusi.

english: so that it will not be obvious to others when you are fasting, but only to your Father who is in secret. And your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa savakkumiñaitchuq malġugnik ataniqaġluni atautchikun, qanuq ilaan uumiginiaġaa igḷua aasii piviaġilugu igḷua. Naaggaunnii qiksiksrautiqaġluni igḷuanun aasii suuŋiḷaġilugu igḷua. Savautiyumiñaitkiksi God suġallagniaġniġlu atautchikun.

english: “Do not accumulate for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautigivsi, uŋiarrisiqaġnasi niqiksravsiññik, imiksravsiññiglu iñuusukpaiḷḷusi, naaggaunnii annuġaaksravsiññik. Iñuggun naumałhaaqtuq niqiksraqsiuqsiññaġniġmiñ, suli timi naumałhaaqtuq annuġaaniñ.

english: But accumulate for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and rust do not destroy, and thieves do not break in and steal.
inupiaq: Qiñiqsigik tiŋmiat tiŋmiruat siḷami, kanġaqsruiḷaitchut nautchiaksranik naagga kivriḷaitchut katitchiḷaitchullu suġalliqpiŋñun, naaggauvva Aapavsi qiḷaŋmiittuam niġipkaqsimaaġai. Ilivsi akisułhaaqtusi tiŋmianiñ.

english: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
inupiaq: Nalliqsi iñuuniqtusiḷaaġumiñaitchuq uŋiarigiññaġluni.

english: “The eye is the lamp of the body. If then your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light.
inupiaq: Aasii summan uŋiarrisiginiqpisiuŋ annuġaaksraq? Isumalaaġutigisigik nauriat qanuq nautilaaŋat. Siġġaqilaitchut ukił̣harriulaitchullu,

english: But if your eye is diseased, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
inupiaq: uqallautigivsi, Solomon unnii qanutun kamanaqtigigaluaqłuni annuġaaŋaitchuq atautchisun-unnii tamatkunatun nauriatun qiñiyunaqtigiliġḷuni.

english: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
inupiaq: Tainnatun God-im qaunagillaniqpagich nauriallu ivgiḷḷu uvlupałhiñaq nauruat aasii uvlaakun qirriutivlugich igniġviŋmun, nalupqinaitchuq annuġaaksraqaqtinniaġaasi. Qanutun ilivsi ukpiġutikisigirusi uŋiariruasii.

english: “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Isn’t there more to life than food and more to the body than clothing?
inupiaq: Tavraasii uŋiariñasi. Apiqsruqtuġnasi inna, sumik niġiñiaqpisa? Sumik imiġniaqpisa? Sumik annuġaaġniaqpisa?

english: Look at the birds in the sky: They do not sow, or reap, or gather into barns, yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you more valuable than they are?
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiŋaitchuat piññagniaġuurut iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa. Aapari qiḷaŋmiittuaq iḷisimaruq piqaqtuksrautilaavsiññik iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa.

english: And which of you by worrying can add even one hour to his life?
inupiaq: Tavraasii piqaqtinniaġaasi iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa ilivsi atanniqsimapkaqqaaġuvsi God-mun iñuulusiḷu nalaunŋaruakun.

english: Why do you worry about clothing? Think about how the flowers of the field grow; they do not work or spin.
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainman, uŋiarrisaġinagu uvlaakuksraq, qanuq uvlaakun iñuk uŋiarrisiqaġumiñaqtuq uvlaakun piruanik. Uvluġaġikpan uuktuaġusiat naamarut uvlullaanun.

english: Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these!
And if this is how God clothes the wild grass, which is here today and tomorrow is tossed into the fire to heat the oven, won’t he clothe you even more, you people of little faith?
So then, don’t worry saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’
For the unconverted pursue these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them.
But above all pursue his kingdom and righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
So then, do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Today has enough trouble of its own.
“Do not judge so that you will not be judged.
inupiaq: Qanuqinniġaqłiġñasi allanik, God-ivli qanuqinniġaġniaŋiñmigaasi.

english: For by the standard you judge you will be judged, and the measure you use will be the measure you receive.
inupiaq: Qanuq qanuqinniġaunmik uqallautiqaġuvsi taavrumiŋa qanuqinniġausiaqaġniaqtusi. Qanutchikun qanuqinniġaiguvsi tuniqtusiḷugu naagga tunikiḷḷugu, tainnatuttauq qanuqinniġausiaqaġniaġmiusi.

english: Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye, but fail to see the beam of wood in your own?
inupiaq: Summan pasivisigik aniqatisi killuliqirualivḷugich ilivsi pigiił̣haaġaluaŋŋavsi?

english: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while there is a beam in your own?
inupiaq: Tainna pikavsi, iñuktun ittusi qirugruaġmik irimiutaqallaġmi irriugauramik piiqsiñiataktuatun aniqanmi iraaniñ.

english: You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
inupiaq: Ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii, iłuaqsruqqaaġitchi ilivsiññun, aasii ikayuġumiñaqsivaalluglugich aniqatisi killukuaġutiŋiññik.

english: Do not give what is holy to dogs or throw your pearls before pigs; otherwise they will trample them under their feet and turn around and tear you to pieces.
inupiaq: Iḷisautiniatagnagich uumisuglutiŋ paaqsaaŋaruat God-mun qanuq qimmisun ittut saallusi ugiaġniaqsaġumaruatun ilivsiññik. Iḷisautiniaqsaġaluaqtuni ittut iḷisimmatun uyaġagnik akisuruanik tuttuqłuich sivuġaannun. Puttuqsrisaitchut akisutilaaŋanik aasii tunmalugigiññaqługich.

english: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened for you.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuguvsi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi qiññuaqtuġitchi aitchuusiaqaġniaqtusi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi ivaqłiasitchi paqinniaġiksi ivakkaqsi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi tigluktuġitchi aasii upkuiġutiniaġaasi.

english: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñupayaaq qiññuaqtuqtuiññaqtuaq aitchuusiaqallaruq, suli ivaqłiatuiññaqtuaq paqitchivḷuni, iñuk suli tigluktuqtuiññaqtuaq upkuiġurriqaġniaqtuq.

english: Is there anyone among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
inupiaq: Nallivsi aapauruasii aitchuġumiñaitkiksi iġñiqsi uyaġagmik apiġikpasi punniqaġugluni,

english: Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a snake?
inupiaq: naagga aitchuġumiñaitkiksi nimiġiamik apiġikpasi iqaluqaġugluni.

english: If you then, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilivsi, nakuuŋitkaluaŋŋavsi, aitchuisuurusi nakuuruanik miqłiqtuvsiññun, qanutułhaaq aasii Aapari qiḷaŋmiittuaq aitchuiyumiñaqtigiruq nakuuruanik tamatkunuŋa qiññuaqtuqtuanun inmiñun.

english: In everything, treat others as you would want them to treat you, for this fulfills the law and the prophets.
inupiaq: Tavra qanupayaaq pitquyumaguvsi iñuŋnun, tainnatulli pisigik, qanuq taamna taŋŋiutauruq pitquranun qaisauruanun Moses-kun, iḷisaurrutiŋiññullu God-im uqaqtiŋisa.

english: “Enter through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the way is spacious that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter through it.
inupiaq: Isiġitchi niġukitchuakun isiġiakun. Isiġiaq niġukitchuq siġḷiġnaqtuġlu apqun kaŋŋiññaqtuaq qiḷaŋmun aasii iñukitchut iñuich paqitchiruat tamattumiŋa apqunmik. Aasiivsauq igḷuani iñugiaktuat isiŋagaat niġuturuaq isiġiaq aasii iglauvigivlugu siġḷiġnaitchuaq apqun kaŋŋiññaqtuaq nagliksaaġviŋmun.

english: But the gate is narrow and the way is difficult that leads to life, and there are few who find it.
inupiaq: Nipuŋaitchitchi uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuanik God-mun, qanuq qaisuurut sagluqinnigukłutiŋ qiññaqaqłutiŋ imnaisun anniaqłiḷaitchuatun. Iliŋich ipiaġataqtut kaaksiuruatun amaqqutun anniaqłiġumiñaqtuatun ilivsiññik.

english: “Watch out for false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are voracious wolves.
inupiaq: Ami iḷitchuġiniaġisi piḷġusiŋisigun, napaaqtututtauq siiġñaŋisigun iḷitchuġimmatun. Grapes siiġñat naulaitchut nauruaniñ kakiḷḷaġnaliŋniñ, fig-giḷḷu siiġñat.

english: You will recognize them by their fruit. Grapes are not gathered from thorns or figs from thistles, are they?
inupiaq: Tavra napaaqtuġiksuat siiġñisuurut siiġñaġiksuanik, aglaan napaaqtuġiitchuat siiġñaġiitchuanik.

english: In the same way, every good tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears bad fruit.
inupiaq: Napaaqtuġiksuaq siiġñiyumiñaitchuq siiġñaġiitchuanik, naaggaunnii napaaqtuġiitchuaq siiġñaġiksuanik.

english: A good tree is not able to bear bad fruit, nor a bad tree to bear good fruit.
inupiaq: Napaaqtupayaaq nauriḷaitchuaq siiġñaġiksuanik kipisuugaat aasii qirriutivlugu igniġmun.

english: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
inupiaq: Tainna tavra uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuat God-mun iḷisimaniaġisi pilġusiŋisigun.

english: So then, you will recognize them by their fruit.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich uqaqtuat uvamnun inna, Ataniiq, Ataniiq, isiġumiñaitchut atanniqsimavianun Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam, aglaan iñupayaaq kamaksriruaq pisuutaanik Aapama qiḷaŋmiittuam isiġniaqtuq.

english: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the kingdom of heaven – only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.
inupiaq: Taivrumani isivġiġviŋmi iñugiaktuat uqaġniaqtut uvamnun, Ataniiq, Ataniiq, uqaqtauŋaitpisa God-mun pisivlutin, anittaiŋaitpisalu ilitqusiqł̣ugnik atuqługu atqiñ, suli piŋaitpisa iñugiaktuanik aliuġnaqtuanik atuqługu atqiñ?

english: On that day, many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, and in your name cast out demons and do many powerful deeds?’
inupiaq: Tavraliasii nalupqinaiġḷugu uqallautiniaġitka, qaŋaunnii iḷisimaŋaitkivsi, aullaġitchi uvamniñ, ilivsi piḷuusiqirit.

english: Then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you. Go away from me, you lawbreakers!’
inupiaq: Iñupayaaq tavra tusaaruaq makkuniŋa uqalumnik aasii kamagivlugich arriqaġniaqtuq isumaturuamik iñuŋmik igluqpiruamik uyaġagruam qaaŋanun.

english: “Everyone who hears these words of mine and does them is like a wise man who built his house on rock.
inupiaq: Tavraasii sialuguqtuq, ulittuġlu, anuġi anuqqaŋmivḷuni aasii qasaqtaqługu taamna igluqpak, aasii ulġuŋitchuq, qanuq maŋŋuqaŋaruq uyaġagruamun.

english: The rain fell, the flood came, and the winds beat against that house, but it did not collapse because it had been founded on rock.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli iñupayaaq tusaaruaq makkuniŋa uqalumnik aasii kamagiŋił̣ł̣ugich arriqaġniaqtuq isumalluaġiitchuamik iñuŋmik igluqpiruamik qaviam qaaŋanun.

english: Everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
inupiaq: Tavra sialuguŋaruq, suli uliłłuni, anuqqaŋmivḷuni aasii qasaqtaaqsivḷugu taamna igluqpak, aasii ulġuŋaruq suksraunġipiallakłuni.

english: The rain fell, the flood came, and the winds beat against that house, and it collapsed; it was utterly destroyed!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaŋaiġataġman taapkuniŋa uqaluŋnik, iñusalaich kamasuutiqaŋarut iḷisaurrutiŋiñik,

english: When Jesus finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed by his teaching,
inupiaq: qanuq ilaan iḷisautiŋagai iñuktun ataniġnaqusiraqtuatun, iḷisaurriŋił̣aaŋisitun pitquranik.

english: because he taught them like one who had authority, not like their experts in the law.
After he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus atqaġman iġġimiñ, iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich maliŋagaat.

english: And a leper approached, and bowed low before him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
inupiaq: Tavrani, kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuaq ullautiŋaruq ilaanun aasii sitquqłuni sivuġaanun uqaqłuni, Ataniiq, pisukkuvich mamititchumiñaġiŋma.

english: He stretched out his hand and touched him saying, “I am willing. Be clean!” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isaaŋaruq aasii aksikł̣ugu uqallakłuni, Piyummatiqaqtuŋa. Mamittin. Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq ilaan kiḷḷiġruaqtuutaa maminŋaruq.

english: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you do not speak to anyone, but go, show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, uqaqsaiḷiyumautin sumikunnii iñupayaamun, aglaan aullaġiñ, tautuktitchaktuġiñ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun, aasii aitchuiḷutin aitchuunmik Moses-kun piraksriutauruamik, iñuich iḷitchuġiyumaut salummaqtautilaaġnik piqataullasivḷutin iñuŋnun.

english: When he entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him asking for help:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiḷġataviksillugu Capernaum-mun, Rome-miuguruam aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata paaŋagaa, qiññuaqtuġvigivlugu,

english: “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, in terrible anguish.”
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, Ataniiq, uvaptiŋni amma kivgaġa nalaruq, avatiŋi tuquvlutiŋ, iłuiḷḷiupiaġataqłuni.

english: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Ullaglugu iłuaqsiñiaġiga.

english: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof. Instead, just say the word and my servant will be healed.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, nalliummatiŋitchuŋa isiġiaġumiñaġlutin iglumnun, aglaan uqallaksiññaġiñ piraksriunmik, aasii kivgaġa iłuaqsirauniaqtuq.

english: For I too am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go’ and he goes, and to another ‘Come’ and he comes, and to my slave ‘Do this’ and he does it.”
inupiaq: Qanuq uvaŋaptauq ataniqaġmiuŋa atanauranik, aasii aŋuyaktiqaġmiuŋa aŋalatamnik. Uqallakama iḷaŋannun, Aullaġiñ, aullaġaqtuq. Suli allamun uqallakama, qaġġiiñ, ilaa qairaqtuq. Suli kivgaġikkamnun uqallakama, Una piuŋ. Taamna pisuummigaa.

english: When Jesus heard this he was amazed and said to those who followed him, “I tell you the truth, I have not found such faith in anyone in Israel!
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaaqqaaqługu ilaa uqaqtuaq, kamatchaŋaruq, aasii uqallautivlugich tamatkua maliġuaqtini, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Israel-guruaniunnii iḷitchuġiŋaitchuŋa iñuŋmik ukpiġutiqaqtigiruamik uumatun iñuktun.

english: I tell you, many will come from the east and west to share the banquet with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, iñugiaktuat Jew-guŋitchuat qaiñiaqtut nunapayauraniñ, aasii aquvitqataulutiŋ niġġiviŋñun piqatigilugu Abraham, Isaac-lu, Jacob-lu atanniqsimaviani Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: but the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋiḷḷi Israel-guruat miqłiqtuunasugiruat atanniqsimanniktuamun igitauniaqtut taaġniqsrauruamun. Tavrani iñuich qianiaqtut tiriqtillugiḷḷu kigutitiŋ.

english: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; just as you believed, it will be done for you.” And the servant was healed at that hour.
inupiaq: Tavrali aŋuyaktit atanauraŋannun Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Aullaġiñ. Taŋŋiqsuq apiqsrian ukpilianikavich. Tavra kivgaŋa iłuaqsirauŋaruq tavrauvvaa.

english: Now when Jesus entered Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying down, sick with a fever.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isiqami Peter-m igluanun, ilaan tautuŋagaa Peter-m aakaruaŋa nalaruaq uunnautiqaqłuni.

english: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she got up and began to serve them.
inupiaq: Jesus aksiŋagai argaŋi, aasii uunnautaiŋaruq, makitiqłuniasii niqłiuġutiaqsivḷugich.

english: When it was evening, many demon-possessed people were brought to him. He drove out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.
inupiaq: Taavrumani unnugiaqtuami iñuich qaġġirriŋarut iñugiaktuanik ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuanik, aasii Jesus anittaŋagai ilitqusiqł̣uich uqaluŋmiñik, suli iłuaqsivḷugich iluqaisa naŋittuat.

english: In this way what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet was fulfilled:
inupiaq: Taamna taŋŋiutausaŋaruq uqautigiŋaraanun uqaqtiŋan God-im Isaiah-m inna, “Ilaan piiŋagai suaŋairrutivullu naŋirrutivullu.”

english: “He took our weaknesses and carried our diseases.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamigich iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich avatimiñi, piraksriŋagai iḷitchitqurani ikaaquvlugich taaguŋatchiġmun.

english: Now when Jesus saw a large crowd around him, he gave orders to go to the other side of the lake.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurri pitquranik ullautiŋaruq ilaanun aasii uqallautivlugu, Iḷisaurrii, maliġuaġniaġikpiñ sumupayauraq aullaġuvich.

english: Then an expert in the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Pisukkaat sisiqaqtut, tiŋmiallu ugluqaqłutiŋ, aglaan Iġñiŋa Iñuum aimaaġviitchuq pimaaqtuġumiñakkamiñik.

english: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens, and the birds in the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
inupiaq: Allasuli iḷaŋat maliġuaqtiŋisa uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Ataniiq, iḷuviġiallaktiqqaaġlagu aapaga, maliġuaqsaqpaallukkumagikpiñ iḷuviqqaaġlugu.

english: Another of the disciples said to him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautigiññaŋagaa, Akkupak maliŋŋa. Tamatkua tuquŋaruatun ittuat iḷuvviuġlich tuquŋaruanik.

english: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ikimman umiaqpauramun, iḷitchitquraŋisa ikiqasiŋagaat.

english: As he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
inupiaq: Tavraasii anuqqałłaŋaruq, umiaqpauraqunnii iksruġaliqł̣ugu imġum. Aasii Jesus siñiŋaruq.

english: And a great storm developed on the sea so that the waves began to swamp the boat. But he was asleep.
inupiaq: Tavra ullakługu itiqsaŋagaat, uqaqłutiŋ, Annauttutigut Ataniiq, suksraugaqsirugut.

english: So they came and woke him up saying, “Lord, save us! We are about to die!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Summan iqsivisi? Qanutun ukpiġutikisigivisi? Tavra Jesus makinŋaruq, aasii suakługik anuġiḷu imaġlu, aasii quunniġupaluŋaruq.

english: But he said to them, “Why are you cowardly, you people of little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and it was dead calm.
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuich kamasupaluŋarut, uqaqłutiŋ, Qanusiq uvvauna iñuk, anuġivlu immavlu kamagillaniqpatku.

english: And the men were amazed and said, “What sort of person is this? Even the winds and the sea obey him!”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñman taaguŋatchiġmun nunaŋannun Gadarenes, malġuk ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuak paaŋagaak, iñukpalliqł̣utiŋ iḷuvviviŋniñ, iqsiñaqpaił̣ł̣utiŋ iñuich unnii tamaunaallaiŋaniqsuat.

english: When he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were extremely violent, so that no one was able to pass by that way.
inupiaq: Tavra nipaalarraqsiŋaruk, Iġñiġuruatiin God-mun Suniaqpisiguk? Qaivich nagliksaaqtitchaqtuqłunuk nagliksaaqtitauviksraq nalautinŋaiñŋaan?

english: They cried out, “Son of God, leave us alone! Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
inupiaq: Tavra tuttuqłusalaich niġiñiaŋarut uŋasiuraqłutiŋ iliŋiññiñ.

english: A large herd of pigs was feeding some distance from them.
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uich apiġipiaġataŋagaat, Anitkuptigut, aullaqtittigut tuttuqługnun.

english: Then the demons begged him, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Aullaġitchi. Tavra anikamiŋ aullaŋarut tuttuqługnun. Tavraasiikii, iluqaġmiŋ tuttuqłuich paŋaliŋarut suamavlutiŋ anmun qutaiḷakun ikpikun immamun, aasii ipivlutiŋ.

english: And he said, “Go!” So they came out and went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep slope into the lake and drowned in the water.
inupiaq: Tavra qaunaksriruat tuttuqługnik pigruŋarut, aasii iniqpaŋmukamiŋ quliaqtuaġiŋagaich supayaurat, qanuqtilaaŋagniglu ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuak.

english: The herdsmen ran off, went into the town, and told everything that had happened to the demon-possessed men.
inupiaq: Tavraasii, iluqaġmiŋ iniqpaum iñuŋi qaiŋarut kasuġiaqługu Jesus. Aasii tautukamirruŋ apiġiŋagaat katchuŋaiqł̣utiŋ qimautitquvlugu ilimiŋniñ.

english: Then the entire town came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.
After getting into a boat he crossed to the other side and came to his own town.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ikivluni umiaqpauramun ikaaŋarut, aasii tikił̣ł̣utiŋ ilaan iñuuvianun iniqpaŋmun.

english: Just then some people brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Have courage, son! Your sins are forgiven.”
inupiaq: Tavra, qaġġirriŋarut ilaanun aulalaitchuamik, nalavlugu ikuvġamiñi. Tavra Jesus puttuqsrikamiuŋ ukpiġutaat uqallaŋaruq aulalaitchuamun, Quviasugiñ, iġñiiŋ. Piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich.

english: Then some of the experts in the law said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming!”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋich iḷisaurrit pitquranik uqaŋarut inmiŋnun, Una iñuk uqaqtuq iḷiuqłuni God-itun.

english: When Jesus saw their reaction he said, “Why do you respond with evil in your hearts?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisimavlugich isumaŋich uqallaŋaruq, Summan pigiitchuanik isumavisi?

english: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
inupiaq: Nalliak uvva siġḷiġnaił̣haaqpa uqallaktuni inna, Piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut, naagga uqallaktuni, Makillutin pisuaġiñ?

english: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” – then he said to the paralytic – “Stand up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
inupiaq: Ukpiġnaqsiḷiġniaġiga ilivsiññun Iġñiŋa Iñuum ataniġnaqutiqaqtilaaŋanik nunami suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaqługich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutit. Ilaa tavrani uqallaŋaruq aulalaitchuamun, Makillutin pisuaġiñ. Tigulugich ikuvġatin aggiiñ.

english: And he stood up and went home.
inupiaq: Tavra makiłłuni aiŋaruq.

english: When the crowd saw this, they were afraid and honored God who had given such authority to men.
inupiaq: Iñusalaich tautukamirruŋ, kamatchaŋarut, aasii nanġaŋagaat God suaŋŋatiqaqtitchiḷḷaruaq tainnatchimik iñuŋnun.

english: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him. And he got up and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaqłuni tavraŋŋa, tautuŋagaa iñuk atiqaqtuaq Matthew-mik aquppiruaq tax-iḷiqiviŋmi, aasii uqallautiŋagaa, Maliŋŋa. Tavra makiłłuni maliŋagaa.

english: As Jesus was having a meal in Matthew’s house, many tax collectors and sinners came and ate with Jesus and his disciples.
inupiaq: Qakugulimman, Jesus niġiyaqtuŋaruq Matthew-m igluanun. Tavrani iñugiaktuat tax-iñik katitchirit piḷuusiqirillu qaivḷutiŋ niġiñiaqasiŋagaat Jesus iḷitchitquraŋiḷu.

english: When the Pharisees saw this they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees iḷitchuġikamirruŋ taamna, uqallautiŋagaich iḷitchitquraŋi, Summan iḷisaurriksi niġiqatiqaġuuva tax-nik katitchirinik piḷuusiqiriniglu?

english: When Jesus heard this he said, “Those who are healthy don’t need a physician, but those who are sick do.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamiuŋ taamna, Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Tamatkua surruitchuat taaktituaksraitchut, aglaan tamatkua naŋittuat.

english: Go and learn what this saying means: ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
inupiaq: Aullaġlusi iḷitchaqtuqsiuŋ una sumik sivuniqaġmagaan, “Kipiġniuġutigigiga nagliktautquvlusi, ikipkautiłhiñaŋiḷaanik aitchuutinik.” Qaiŋaitchuŋa ququaġiaġlugich nalaunŋaruat aglaan isumalitqiquvlugich piḷuusiqirit.

english: Then John’s disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitquraŋi John qaiŋarut Jesus-mun, uqaqłutiŋ, Suvlutauvagut Pharisees-lu aŋaiyyuuqapta niġiḷaitchuuvisa, iḷitchitquratin tainna piḷaisillugich?

english: Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot mourn while the bridegroom is with them, can they? But the days are coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷisimarusi katirrusiqiruanun tuyuġmiaqtauruat ipiqtusugniaŋitchut nayuqtigiŋŋaan uiksraun. Aglaan uiksrautim aullaurrauviksraŋa tikitchumaaqtuq, aasii taimanigu niġiḷaitpaallugniaqtut.

english: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, because the patch will pull away from the garment and the tear will be worse.
inupiaq: Suli kiñapayaaq iḷaaqtuutiqalaitchuq iḷiġniġmik ugliŋaitchuamik ukił̣haamik annuġaaluŋmun, qanuq iḷaaqtuutauruaq algutiniaqtuq annuġaamiñ, aasii allaq aglił̣haaġluni.

english: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the skins burst and the wine is spilled out and the skins are destroyed. Instead they put new wine into new wineskins and both are preserved.”
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii nutauruaq wine puuġnaitchuq puuġruanun. Puuġaluaqpan wine puuġruamik puvlagluni qaaġniaqtuq, aasii wine kuviḷuni, puuġlu maquluni. Aglaan nutauruaq wine puuġnaqtuq nutauruanun wine puuŋiññun, aasii iluqatiŋ puuġlu wine-lu maquŋił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: As he was saying these things, a ruler came, bowed low before him, and said, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her and she will live.”
inupiaq: Tavra tainna uqaġataviksillugu iliŋiññun, umialiŋnaq isiŋaruq aasii sitquqłuni sivuġaanun uqallaŋaruq, Paniga tuquqqammiqsuq. Qaiḷutin aksiugiaġuŋ, aasii iñuuniaqtuq.

english: Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus makiłłuni maliŋagaa, piqatigivlugich iḷitchitqurani.

english: But a woman who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak.
inupiaq: Tavra iglaupkaqtillugich, aġnaq nagliksaaġutiqaŋaruaq aunaaqsruġniġmik qulit malġugni ukiuni Jesus tunuanuŋaruq, aasii aksiullakługu siñiġutaa annuġaaŋan,

english: For she kept saying to herself, “If only I touch his cloak, I will be healed.”
inupiaq: isumavluni, aksiḷḷaksiññaġupkuunnii annuġaaŋa, iłuaqsiñiaġaluaqtuŋa.

english: But when Jesus turned and saw her he said, “Have courage, daughter! Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was healed from that hour.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiŋiaŋaruq, aasii tautukługu uqallaŋaruq, Quviasugiñ paniuruatiin, ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin. Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq aġnaq iłuaqsiŋaruq.

english: When Jesus entered the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the disorderly crowd,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiññami umialiŋnam igluqpaŋanun, tautukługich atuqtuuraqtit suvluaqtuġnanik, iñusalaiḷḷu qiaqpaktuat,

english: he said, “Go away, for the girl is not dead but asleep.” And they began making fun of him.
inupiaq: uqallaŋaruq, Annisitchi. Niviaqsiaġruk tuquŋitchuq. Siñiksiññaqtuq. Tavra ilaisa iglautigiŋagaat.

english: But when the crowd had been put outside, he went in and gently took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich anitauganiŋmata, ilaa isiŋaruq aasii tiguŋagaa argaŋisigun, tavrani niviaqsiaġruk makinŋaruq.

english: And the news of this spread throughout that region.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqaluk taavrumuuna siaminŋaruq nunaaqqipayaanun.

english: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, shouting, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iglaupkaqtillugu tavraŋŋa, malġuk ayauŋaruak maliŋagaak, ququullatigillaan, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun naglikkutiqaġiñ uvaptiŋnun.

english: When he went into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”
inupiaq: Jesus isiġman iglumun, ayauŋaruak ullaŋagaak, aasii Jesus apiġiŋagik, Ukpiqpisik uvamnun taamna piyumiñaġnivḷugu? Iliŋikta kiuŋagaak, Aaŋ, Ataniiq.

english: Then he touched their eyes saying, “Let it be done for you according to your faith.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan aksiŋagaik iriŋik, uqaqłuni, Ukpiġutiqaqtilaaptiktun taamna pirauli iliptiŋnun.

english: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus sternly warned them, “See that no one knows about this.”
inupiaq: Tavra iriŋik tautullasiŋaruk. Tavraasii Jesus piraksripiallaŋagik, Suuramikunnii uqaġnatik kimulliqaa.

english: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that entire region.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqłutik siaminŋagaak iḷisimanautaa Jesus nunaaqqipayaanun.

english: As they were going away, a man who could not talk and was demon-possessed was brought to him.
inupiaq: Aullaqsalgiñmiullu iñuk uqalaitchuaq ilitqusiqł̣uqaqłuni qaġġisiŋagaat ilaanun.

english: After the demon was cast out, the man who had been mute spoke. The crowds were amazed and said, “Never has anything like this been seen in Israel!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uk anitauganiŋman, uqalaitchuaq iñuk uqallasiŋaruq, aasii iñusalaich kamasuŋarut, uqaqłutiŋ, Qaŋaunnii innasiq iḷisimanaŋaitchuq Israel-mi.

english: But the Pharisees said, “By the ruler of demons he casts out demons.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Pharisees uqallaŋarut, Ilaa anittairuq ilitqusiqł̣ugnik ikayuqtiqaqłuni umialgannik ilitqusiqł̣uich.

english: Then Jesus went throughout all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kukiḷuŋaruq iluqaiññi iniqpaŋni nunaaqqiuraniḷu, iḷisaurrivḷuni aŋaiyyuviŋiññi, alġaqsruivḷuniḷu tusaayugaaġiksuaŋiñik God-im atanniqsimmataata iñuŋnun, iłuaqsivḷugiḷḷu naŋirrutipayaat suaŋairrutipayaallu.
