english: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them because they were bewildered and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamigich iñusalaich, nagligiŋagai, qanuq irrusiqaŋarut qanuqsausiiqsuatun ikayuqtaiḷḷiuqłutiglu, imnaisun munaqsraitchuatun.

english: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq iḷitchitquramiñun, Iñusalaich utaqqirut tusaayumavlutiŋ tusaayugaaġiksuanik palauvaksratun nauganiktuatun kipisałhiñaaġuqługich, aglaan savaktit iñukitchut.

english: Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii qiññuaqtuġitchi Atanġanun nautchiaqaġvium tilisivsaaqulugu savaktiksravsaamiñik.

english: Jesus called his twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits so they could cast them out and heal every kind of disease and sickness.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qaitquŋagai inmiñun qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurani aasii suaŋŋasiŋagai ilitqusiqł̣uiyaiḷḷasivḷugich, suli iłuaqsiriyumiñaqsivḷugich naŋirrutipayaanik suaŋairrutipayaaniglu.

english: Now these are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon (called Peter), and Andrew his brother; James son of Zebedee and John his brother;
inupiaq: Atiŋich qulit malġuk tilirauruat uvva, sivulliq, Simon tairauruaq Peter-mik, Andrew-lu ilaan aniqataa, James-lu, John-lu iġñiŋik Zebedee-m,

english: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
inupiaq: Philip-lu, Bartholomew-lu, Thomas-lu, Matthew-lu tax-nik katitchiri, James-lu iġñiŋa Alphaeus, Thaddaeus-lu,

english: Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
inupiaq: Simon-lu Zealot-guruaq, Judas-lu Iscariot, aitchuutiginniktuaq Jesus-mik.

english: Jesus sent out these twelve, instructing them as follows: “Do not go to Gentile regions and do not enter any Samaritan town.
inupiaq: Taapkua qulit malġuk Jesus tiliŋagai piraksriqł̣ugich inna, Aullaqqayaanasi sumupayaaq Jew-guŋitchuanun, suli isiġnagich nunaaqqipayaaŋich Samaria-ġmiut,

english: Go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
inupiaq: aglaan aullaqsiññaġitchi tammaŋaruatun imnaisun ittuanun Israel-guruani.

english: As you go, preach this message: ‘The kingdom of heaven is near!’
inupiaq: Aasii alġaqsruiḷusi iglaullavsi uqaġlusi, Taamna qiḷaŋmiittuaq atanniqsimanniksaaqsiruq iñuŋnik.

english: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, cast out demons. Freely you received, freely give.
inupiaq: Iłuaqsisigik naŋittuat, aŋipkaqsigik tuquruat, mamititchigik kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuat, anittaqsigik ilitqusiqł̣uich. Suaŋŋasiqsauŋarusi akiḷiġaluaġnagu, aasiiḷi atuqsiuŋ suaŋŋan akiiḷaaġlugu.

english: Do not take gold, silver, or copper in your belts,
inupiaq: Saagaġnasi maniqaġvivsiññi maniŋmik kaviqsuamik qatiqtuamiglu, naagga unnii kannuyamik.

english: no bag for the journey, or an extra tunic, or sandals or staff, for the worker deserves his provisions.
inupiaq: Puukataiḷaaġlusi iglauguvsi, naaggaunnii annuġaatqiusiraaġnasi, aluġusiraaġnasiḷu, naagga ayauppialiraaġnasi. Savaktauruaq piqaqtitaksrauruq pigiraksraġikkaŋiñik.

english: Whenever you enter a town or village, find out who is worthy there and stay with them until you leave.
inupiaq: Suli kisupayaamun nunaaqqimun tikitkuvsi, iḷitchuġiyumausi iñuŋmik tukkuliiyumaruamik tavrani, aasii tukkuġilugu aullaġnivsiññunaglaan.

english: As you enter the house, give it greetings.
inupiaq: Isiġuvsi iglumun, uqallakkumausi inna, Tutqiutiqaġitchi.

english: And if the house is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua iñuich paġlakpasi, tutqiutiqaġniaqtut. Aglaan paġlaŋitpasi, tutqiutiqaġumiñaitchut.

english: And if anyone will not welcome you or listen to your message, shake the dust off your feet as you leave that house or that town.
inupiaq: Tavra kialiqaa tukkuliŋitpasi naagga naalaġnisuŋitpatigik uqalusi, piiyaqsiuŋ avyuq isigavsiññiñ aniñiallavsi iglumiñ naagga nunaaqqimiñ.

english: I tell you the truth, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town!
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, uvluani isivġiġvium, God naglikkutiqałhaaġniaqtuq iñuŋiññun Sodom-lu Gomorrah-vlu taavrumaŋŋa nunaaqqimiñ tukkuliiŋitchuamiñ ilivsiññik.

english: “I am sending you out like sheep surrounded by wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.
inupiaq: Uvva, aullaqtitkivsi imnaisun akunġannun amaqqut, iḷimasuktuaġitchiasii nimiġiatun suli anniaqłiŋisigilusi tiŋmiatun.

english: Beware of people, because they will hand you over to councils and flog you in their synagogues.
inupiaq: Nipuŋairvigilugich iñuich, qanuq aitchuutigiraġaġniaġaasi uqaqsitaaġviŋñun, suli ipiġaqtuġlusi aŋaiyyuviŋmiŋni.

english: And you will be brought before governors and kings because of me, as a witness to them and the Gentiles.
inupiaq: Suli pisigiluŋa qaġġirrauniaqtusi sivuġaŋiññun kavanauruat umialgiḷḷu, uqaqulusi tusaayugaaġiksuanik inmiŋnun Jew-guŋitchuanullu.

english: Whenever they hand you over for trial, do not worry about how to speak or what to say, for what you should say will be given to you at that time.
inupiaq: Ilaisa tigutaaqpasi, uŋiariñasi qanuq uqaġniaqtilaavsiññik naagga sunik uqautiqaġniaqtilaavsiññik, qanuq uqaluksriusiaqaġniaqtusi tavraġuqpan.

english: For it is not you speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
inupiaq: Qanuq ilivsiuŋitchuq uqaqtuaq, aglaan Ilitqusiġiksuaŋa Aapavsi uqaqtuq ilivsigun.

english: “Brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
inupiaq: Iñuich aitchuutiginiaġaich aniqatitiŋ tuqutautqulugich. Suli aapauruat tainnatun pipkaġniaġmigaich miqłiqtutiŋ. Suli miqłiqtut makivsaallagniaqtut aŋayuqaamiŋnun aasii aŋayuqaatiŋ tuqutillugich.

english: And you will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
inupiaq: Suli iñupayaat uumikkiutiniaġaasi pisigilugu uvaŋa pigikavsi. Aglaan iñuk igḷutuutiruaq nagliksaaqtitauniġmik iñuuniqtutilaamisun, annaurrauniaqtuq.

english: Whenever they persecute you in one place, flee to another. I tell you the truth, you will not finish going through all the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
inupiaq: Nagliksaaqtitpasi nunaaqqimi, pigruġitchi tuglianun. Qanuq iḷumun uqallautigivsi, naatchianiŋniaŋitchusi savaavsiññik iluqaiññi nunaaqqiŋiññi Israel qaigaluaqtinnagu Iġñiŋa Iñuum.

english: “A disciple is not greater than his teacher, nor a slave greater than his master.
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraq kamanałhaaŋitchuq iḷisaurrimiñiñ, naaggaunnii kivgaq ataniġmiñiñ.

english: It is enough for the disciple to become like his teacher, and the slave like his master. If they have called the head of the house ‘Beelzebul,’ how much more will they defame the members of his household!
inupiaq: Naamaruq iḷitchitquraq itkumi iḷisaurrimisun, suli kivgaq ataniġmisun. Taiguġuugumiñŋa Beelzebul-mik Ataniġikkavsiŋa, qanutułhaaq iliŋisa atiġiił̣haaqtuanik taiguġniaġaasi uvaŋa kivgatka.

english: “Do not be afraid of them, for nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known.
inupiaq: Tavra sivuuġaginagich iñuich. Suna matuqaqtuaq matuiġñiaqtuq, aasii nalunautchiapayaaq iḷitchuġipkaqtauniaqtuq.

english: What I say to you in the dark, tell in the light, and what is whispered in your ear, proclaim from the housetops.
inupiaq: Sut uqallautitka ilivsiññun taaġmi, iḷitchuġipkaqsigik iñuŋnun uvlumi, suli uqautitka ilivsiññun kisivsiññun, quliaqtuaġisigik iglut qaaŋiññiñ.

english: Do not be afraid of those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Instead, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
inupiaq: Suli sivuuġaginagich iñuich tuqutchiruat timimik qanuq suksraunġiġumiñaitkaat ilitqusiq, sivuuġagiłhaaqsiuŋ God suksraunġiiḷḷaruaq iluqaagnik ilitqutchimiglu timimiglu nagliksaaġviŋmi.

english: Aren’t two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father’s will.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi malġuk tigmiaġruurak tunisuuruk maniuramun atautchimun. Naaggauvva nalliak unnii katakkumiñaitchuq nunamun uniuġlugu Aapavsi pisuutaa.

english: Even all the hairs on your head are numbered.
inupiaq: Ilivsivsauq nutchasiunnii niaquvsiññi iluqaisa God-im iḷisimagai iñugiaktilaaŋat.

english: So do not be afraid; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
inupiaq: Tavraasii sivuuġanasi, piqpaŋnałhaaqtusi iñugiaktuaniñ tiŋmiaġruuraniñ.

english: “Whoever, then, acknowledges me before people, I will acknowledge before my Father in heaven.
inupiaq: Tavra kialiqaa quliaqtuaġigumiŋa iñuŋnun piginiḷuni uvamnun, uvaŋaptauq tainnatun piñiaġmigiga Aapamnun qiḷaŋmiittuamun.

english: But whoever denies me before people, I will deny him also before my Father in heaven.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq kialiqaa piiḷaaġikpaŋa iñuŋnun pigiŋiññiḷuni uvamnun, uvaŋaptauq piiḷaaġiniaġmigiga Aapamnun qiḷaŋmiittuamun.

english: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I have not come to bring peace but a sword.
inupiaq: Isumanasi qaiŋanasugaluŋa iñupayaurat atisipkaġiaġlugich. Qaiŋaitchuŋa atisipkaġiaġlugich, aglaan qaiŋaruŋa atinġiquvlugich.

english: For I have come to set a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law,
inupiaq: Qanuq qaiñiġma atiŋaiqsinniaġai iġñiġuruat aapatiglu, suli paniuruat aakatiglu, suli ukuaguruat aakaruatiglu.

english: and a man’s enemies will be the members of his household.
inupiaq: Suli iñuich akiḷḷiġiliutiniaġaich ilaisa igluqatitiŋ.

english: “Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
inupiaq: Iñuum piviuttaġiłhaaġumiuŋ aapani naagga aakani uvamniñ nalliummatiŋitchuq uvamnun, suli iñuum piviuttaġiłhaaġumiuŋ iġñini naagga paniñi uvamniñ nalliummatiŋitchuq uvamnun.

english: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
inupiaq: Suli iñuum iqsriutiŋitkumiuŋ aŋarraurani tuqutauyumaliġḷuniunnii pisigiluŋa, nalliummatiŋitchuq uvamnun.

english: Whoever finds his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life because of me will find it.
inupiaq: Iñuk iñuullatuvaił̣aktuaq tammaiñiaqtuq iñuggunmiñik, aglaalli iñuk sullatuaġumiḷu atiruaq tuqqutiyumiñaġluŋaunnii, tammaiyumiñaipiaġaa iñuggutini.

english: “Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives the one who sent me.
inupiaq: Iñuum paġlagumisi paġlammigaaŋa, suli iñuum paġlaruam uvamnik paġlammigaa tilisiŋaruaq uvamnik.

english: Whoever receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. Whoever receives a righteous person in the name of a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.
inupiaq: Iñuk paġlaruaq uqaqtaanik God-im pisigivlugu uqaqtauniŋa God-mun aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq uqaqtaata God-im akiḷiusiaŋatun. Suli iñuk paġlaruaq nalaunŋaruamik iñuŋmik pisigivlugu nalaunŋaniŋa, aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq nalaunŋaruam iñuum akiḷiusiaŋatun.

english: And whoever gives only a cup of cold water to one of these little ones in the name of a disciple, I tell you the truth, he will never lose his reward.”
inupiaq: Suli kiñaliqaa aitchuiruaq atautchimununnii makua kamanaiññiqsrat maliġuaqtima iḷaŋannun qallugauram imałhiñaŋanikunnii nigliñaqtuamik imiġmik pisigivlugu iḷitchitquraunini, iḷumun uqallautigivsi, akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtuq.

english: When Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in their towns.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus naatchikami iḷisaurrunmiñik qulit malġuk iḷitchitquramiñun, tavraŋŋa aullaŋaruq iḷisaurriyaqtuqłuni alġaqsruiyaqtuqłuniḷu nunaaqqiñun tamaaniittuanun.

english: Now when John heard in prison about the deeds Christ had done, he sent his disciples to ask a question:
inupiaq: Tavra John tusaakami tigutaaqtaullaġmi savaaŋigun Christ, tilisiŋaruq uqaluŋmik iḷitchitquramigun

english: “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
inupiaq: aasii apiġivlugu Jesus, Taivrumiŋauvich qaiyumaaqtuaguruaq, naagga niġiugniaqpisasuli allamik?

english: Jesus answered them, “Go tell John what you hear and see:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagik, Aullaġlutik quliaqtuaġutiyaqtutku John sunik tusaaravsiññik tautukkavsiññiglu.

english: The blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have good news proclaimed to them.
inupiaq: Ayauŋaruat tautullasirut, tusiattuallu pisuaqtut, kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuat mamititaurut, tusiḷḷaqtuatsuli tusaallasirut, tuquŋaruallu aŋipkaqtaurut, suli piqaqtuksrauruat tusaayugaaġiksuanik alġaqsruusiaqaqtut.

english: Blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me.”
inupiaq: Aasii quviasugli iñuk ukpiŋaiŋitchuaq uvamnun.

english: While they were going away, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
inupiaq: John-gum iḷitchitquraŋik utiqsaġmaŋnik, Jesus uqautisarraqsiŋagai iñusalaich John-kun. Tautugiaqavsiuŋ John nunagluktuamun, sumik tautugniaġasugiraġivisi? Tautugiaqtaqpisiuŋ iñuk maliksuktaqsiññaqtuaq ivigruatun anuġim aulataġikkaŋatun? Naumi.

english: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fancy clothes? Look, those who wear fancy clothes are in the homes of kings!
inupiaq: Summanmi aullaġuuniqpisi? Tautugiaqpisiuŋ iñuk annuġaaqaqtuaq akisuruanik annuġaanik? Iḷisimarusi tamatkua akisuruanik annuġaaqaqtuat umialgich igluqpaŋiññiittut.

english: What did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
inupiaq: Summanmi ullautiraġivisi? Tautugiaqpisiuŋ uqaqtaa God-im? Aaŋ, uqallautigivsi nalupqinaitchuq, kamanałhaaqtuq unnii uqaqtiŋiññiñ God-im.

english: This is the one about whom it is written:
inupiaq: John taimñauruq aglausimaruaq Bible-ni inna, “Uvva tiligiga kivgaġa sivuŋni, itqanaiyaġniaġai iñuich akuqtuiyumiñaqsiḷugich iliŋnik.”

english: ‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, John Paptaiqsi kamanaġniqsrauruq iñuŋniñ aniŋaruaniñ nunami. Aglaattauq uvva paŋmapaŋmiñaglaan iñuk kamanaiññiqsrauruaq tamatkunaŋŋa atanniqsimapkaqtuaniñ God-mun kamanałhaaqtuq John-miñ, qanuq iḷitchuġiłhaaġniaqtuq sunik God-im salapqiġñiakkaŋiñik uvapkun.

english: who will prepare your way before you.’
inupiaq: Alġaqsruisaġniŋaniñ John Paptaiqsim paŋmapaŋmunaglaan, piyumalaaqtuat iñuich siġġaqiŋarut God-mun atanniqsimatquvlutiŋ.

english: “I tell you the truth, among those born of women, no one has arisen greater than John the Baptist. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he is.
inupiaq: Qanuq Moses aglaaŋisa iluqaġmiglu God-im uqaqtiŋisa John-munaglaan uqautigiŋagaat sivuani tikiñŋaiñŋaan God-im atanniqsimmataa.

english: From the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and forceful people lay hold of it.
inupiaq: Aasii ukpiġisukkuvsiuŋ uqaluat, ukpiġiyumiñaġiksi John-gutilaaŋanik sivuani uqautigikkaŋat qaiñiaġnivḷugu inniaqtuaq Elijah-tun.

english: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John appeared.
inupiaq: Siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksragnik, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: And if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah, who is to come.
inupiaq: Aglaan sumun arriḷisiginiaqpik ukua paŋmapak iñuuruat? Miqłiqtutun ittut avutqautiruatun piuraaqłutiŋ kasimaraġaġviŋñi, katirrusiqiŋŋuaqłutiglu, tuquruaniglu aŋaiyyurriŋŋuaqtuatun.

english: The one who has ears had better listen!
inupiaq: Piuraallaġmiŋ ququullativlutiŋ avanmun inna, atuqtuurautigaluaġivsi uaminŋitchusi. Kiŋunġuŋŋuaqłuta qiaŋŋuaqapta, qiaŋitchusi.

english: “To what should I compare this generation? They are like children sitting in the marketplaces who call out to one another,
inupiaq: John Paptaiqsi qaikami niġiḷaitqataŋaruq imiġaluaġnaniḷu wine-mik, aasii uqautigigiksi ilaa ilitqusiqł̣uqaġnivḷugu.

english: ‘We played the flute for you, yet you did not dance;
inupiaq: Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaiŋaruq niġivḷuni imiqłuniḷu allatun iñuktitun, aasii uvyauġiksi, Marra niġġiqsuruaq wine-tuqtiqpaglu, avilaitqataat tax-iñik katitchirit, piḷuusiqirillu. Suliqutauŋitchuq qanuq uqaġaluaġuvsi, qanuq isumaturuat iñuich puttuqsriḷḷagaat God-im isumattutaa.

english: we wailed in mourning, yet you did not weep.’
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus suarraqsiŋagai iñuich nunaaqqiñi iñuuruat savagvigiŋarani iñugiagniqsranik aliuġnaqtuanik, qanuq isumalitqiŋiñmata.

english: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi, Chorazin-miut. Qanutun naglignaqtigimmiusi ilivsi Bethsaida-ġmiut. Qanuq aliuġnaqtuat savaat savaaguruat ilivsiññi savaaguŋakpata Tyre-miḷu Sidon-miḷu, taimaniuvva isumalitqikkumiñaŋagaluaqtut annuġaaġlutiŋ miitchugnik suli aquppiḷutiŋ aġrani.

english: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look at him, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautigivsi, uvluani isivġiġvium isivġiusiaksraŋat Tyre-vlu Sidon-lu iñuŋisa tunikił̣haaġniaqtuq ilivsi isivġiusiaksravsiññiñ.

english: Then Jesus began to criticize openly the cities in which he had done many of his miracles, because they did not repent.
inupiaq: Aasii ilivsi Capernaum-miut, isumavisi tugliqsruutinasugalusi qiḷaŋmun kamanaunmi? Nunaaqqiqsi suksraunġiqsauniaqtuq. Qanuq aliuġnaqtuat savaaguruat ilivsiññi savaaguŋakpata Sodom-mi, napanayaġaluaqtuq uumuŋaaglaan uvlumun.

english: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! If the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
inupiaq: Aglaan uqallautigivsi, tunikił̣haaġniaqtuq isivġiusiaksraŋat iñuŋisa Sodom, uvluani isivġiġvium ilivsiññiñ.

english: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you!
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Quyyavigigikpiñ, Aapaaŋ, Atanġuruatiin qiḷaŋmun nunamullu, iriqsimaŋakapkich iḷumun ittuat pisin isumatunasugiruaniñ iḷisimanasugiruaniḷḷu, aasii satqummiqł̣ugich iñuŋnun miqłiqtutun ittuanun.

english: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to Hades! For if the miracles done among you had been done in Sodom, it would have continued to this day.
inupiaq: Aaŋ, Aapaaŋ. Tainna pisuutigiŋagiñ iviġaumagivlugu.

english: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom on the day of judgment than for you!”
inupiaq: Aapama supayaat qaiñŋagai uvamnun, aasii kialiqaa iḷisimaŋitkaa Iġñiq aglaan kisimi Aapam. Kialiqaa suli iḷisimmaġiitkaa Aapa aglaan Iġñiġum kisimi, kiapayaaġlu Iġñiġum iḷitchuġipkakkaŋa Aapamik.

english: At that time Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and revealed them to little children.
inupiaq: Iluqasi uqumaiḷḷiraqtuasii uŋiarrisaġivlugich piḷuutisi akuqtuqtauniksraqsiḷu God-mun, qaisitchi uvamnun unaŋuiqsiqsitchumagivsi.

english: Yes, Father, for this was your gracious will.
inupiaq: Anuqasiutisitchi uvamnun, aasii iḷisaġlusi uvamniñ, qanuq uvaŋa piaqłuktaŋitchuŋa qimmaksaliyaitchuŋalu, aasii unaŋuiqsiġñiaqtusi.

english: All things have been handed over to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son decides to reveal him.
inupiaq: Qanuq anu aitchuutiga ilivsiññun naammaktuq, aasiisuli savaaksraq piraksriutiginiakkaġa ilivsiññun nagniġutauniaŋitchuq.

english: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
Take my yoke on you and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
For my yoke is easy to bear, and my load is not hard to carry.”
At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on a Sabbath. His disciples were hungry, and they began to pick heads of wheat and eat them.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu pisuaŋarut palauvaksranik nautchiaqaġvikun Jew-guruat Savairvianni. Iḷitchitquraŋi kaaliŋarut, aasii nutchugairraqsiŋarut palauvaksranik aasii niġivḷugich.

english: But when the Pharisees saw this they said to him, “Look, your disciples are doing what is against the law to do on the Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees tautukamisigik, uvyaqiŋagaat Jesus, Tautukkich, iḷitchitquratin navgirut Savaiññikun pitquraptiŋnik.

english: He said to them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry –
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Nalupqinaitchuamik taiguaŋarusi qanuq David piŋatilaaŋanik kaaksiuliqamiŋ piqatiniḷu.

english: how he entered the house of God and they ate the sacred bread, which was against the law for him or his companions to eat, but only for the priests?
inupiaq: David isiŋaruq igluanun God-im aasii niġivḷutiŋ punniġmik aitchuutauŋaruamik God-mun, nalaunŋaitkaluaqtuamik ilaallu piqatiniḷu niġikparruŋ, kisiiññun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun niġiñaqtuat.

english: Or have you not read in the law that the priests in the temple desecrate the Sabbath and yet are not guilty?
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik taiguaŋarusi pitqurat piraksriutiŋiññik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun ikipkaitquvlugich aitchuutinik uvlutuaqpan. Savakkaluaqamikunnii Savaitchuani aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, pasiraulaitchut navgiñiḷugich Savaiññikun pitquramik.

english: I tell you that something greater than the temple is here.
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, Iñuk imma maaniitkaluaqtuq kamanałhaaqtuaq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ.

english: If you had known what this means: ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.
inupiaq: Iñuich killukuaŋitchuat isivġiġumiñaitkaluaġisi pikpata taapkunatun iḷisimaguvsi sivuniŋiññik God-im uqaluŋisa inna uqaqtuat, “Kipiġniuġutigigiga nagliktautquvlusi ikipkautiłhiñanik aitchuiŋaiġḷusi.”

english: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii Iġñiŋa Iñuum ataniġnaqutiqałhaaqtuq pitquraniñ aŋalatchiruaniñ iñuŋnik Savaiññiġmi.

english: Then Jesus left that place and entered their synagogue.
inupiaq: Jesus tavraŋŋa aullaŋaruq, aasii isiqłuni aŋaiyyuviannun.

english: A man was there who had a withered hand. And they asked Jesus, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?” so that they could accuse him.
inupiaq: Iñuk tavrani inŋaruq argakisuurauniqsuaq. Iñuqaŋammiñiqsuq tavrani ittuanik pasiññigumaruanik Jesus-mik killuliqiniḷugu. Tavra apiġiŋagaat, Nalaunŋava iłuaqsiriruni Savaitchuani?

english: He said to them, “Would not any one of you, if he had one sheep that fell into a pit on the Sabbath, take hold of it and lift it out?
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Nalliqsi ilivsiññi, atautchimik imnaiqaġniġumi katakpan iḷuqsramun Savaisillugich, qiluyumiñaitpauŋ?

english: How much more valuable is a person than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Iñuk piqpaŋnałhaaqtuq imnaimiñ. Tavraasii nalaunŋaruq anniqsuiruni Savaiññiġmi.

english: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out and it was restored, as healthy as the other.
inupiaq: Tavrani ilaan uqallautiŋagaa iñuk, Isaakkich argaktin. Tavra isaaŋagai, aasii argaŋi iłuaqsirauŋarut igḷumiktun.

english: But the Pharisees went out and plotted against him, as to how they could assassinate him.
inupiaq: Tavrali Pharisees aniŋarut aasii sivunniugaqsivḷutiŋ qanuġlugu Jesus tuqutchukługu.

english: Now when Jesus learned of this, he went away from there. Great crowds followed him, and he healed them all.
inupiaq: Jesus, iḷisimavlugu taamna, aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa. Aasii iñugiaktuat maliŋagaat. Suli ilaan iłuaqsiŋagai iluqaisa naŋittuat.

english: But he sternly warned them not to make him known.
inupiaq: Ilaan piraksriŋagai quliaqtuaġitquŋił̣ł̣uni.

english: This fulfilled what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet:
inupiaq: Taamna taŋŋiutausaŋaruq God-im uqautigiŋaraiññun uqaqtimigun Isaiah-kun inna,

english: “Here is my servant whom I have chosen,
inupiaq: Tavrani ayauŋaruaġlu uqalaitchuaġlu ilitqusiqł̣ulik qaġġisiŋagaat Jesus-mun aasii ilaan iłuaqsiŋagaa. Uqalaitchuaq iñuk uqallasiŋaruq tautuksiḷḷasivḷuniḷu.

english: the one I love, in whom I take great delight.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iluqaġmiŋ aliuŋarut, suli uqallakłutiŋ, Uvvauna kiŋuniġiŋitkaluaqpauŋ David-gum, Christ-guruaq?

english: I will put my Spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.
inupiaq: Tavrali Pharisees tusaakamirruŋ taamna uqallaŋarut, Kisiagun Beelzebul-kun, umialgatigun ilitqusiqł̣uich, taamna iñuk anittairuq ilitqusiqł̣ugnik.

english: He will not quarrel or cry out,
inupiaq: Jesus iḷisimavlugich isumaŋich, uqallautiŋagai, Nunauruat atinġiqł̣utiŋ aŋuyautikamiŋ inmiŋnun suksraunġiġuurut. Suli iniqpakkaluaq naaggaunnii igluqpaum iñuŋi atinġiqamiŋ suksraunġiġñiaqtut inmiŋnik.

english: nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq Satan ilitqusiqł̣uŋi atinġiġumiŋ piyuutilutiŋ avanmun, ilaan suaŋŋataa isukłiññayaqtuq.

english: He will not break a bruised reed or extinguish a smoldering wick,
inupiaq: Aasii uvaŋa anittaġupkich ilitqusiqł̣uich Beelzebul-kun, kikulli maliġuaqtivsi anittaġuuvatigik? Tavra iliŋich isivġiqsiginiaġisi iḷisimanaqsiḷugu killukuapiaġataqtilaaqsi.

english: until he brings justice to victory.
inupiaq: Aglaan Ilitqusiġiksuaŋagun God-im uvaŋa anittaiguma ilitqusiqł̣ugnik, nalupqinaiqsuq God-im atanniqsimasaanikkai iñuich akunnavsiññi.

english: And in his name the Gentiles will hope.”
inupiaq: Iñuk suaŋarualuk qiḷiqsruiqqaaġlugu iglua pakagnaġniaqtuq suġauttaiġḷugulu. Tainnatuttauq Satan payariraksrauqqaaġniaqtuq ilitqusiqł̣uŋi anitauniaqpata.

english: Then they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute. Jesus healed him so that he could speak and see.
inupiaq: Iñuk piqatauŋitchuaq uvamnun akiḷḷiuruq uvamnun, iñuktun ittuq kivriñaqsimman palauvaksranik katitchiqataugaluaġnani siavsigiññaqtuatun.

english: All the crowds were amazed and said, “Could this one be the Son of David?”
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautigivsi, God-im suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaġai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich iluqaisa iñuich piḷuutiŋich iluqaisalu pigiitchuat uqallautiŋich, aglaan iñuk uqaqtuaq pigiitchuamik Ilitqusiġiksuakun, sumikunnii suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaitchuq.

english: But when the Pharisees heard this they said, “He does not cast out demons except by the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons!”
inupiaq: Suli kiñapayaaq uqallakkumi pigiitchuamik Iġñiŋagun iñuum suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaqtuq itqaumayumiñaiġḷugu, aglaan kiñaliqaa uqallaqtuaq pigiitchuamik Ilitqusiġiksuakun suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaitchuq, paŋmapak isuitchuamullu.

english: Now when Jesus realized what they were thinking, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and no town or house divided against itself will stand.
inupiaq: Napaaqtuq iḷitchuġinaġmatun nakuutilaaŋanik naagga pigiisilaaŋanik siiġñiaŋigun, tainnaptauq iñuich iḷisimanaġmiut.

english: So if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
inupiaq: Ilivsi tuqunalgich nimiġiat. Qanuġlusi uqaluqaġniaqpisi nakuuruamik piḷullavsi? Iñuum salapqiagaa irrusipiani uqaluŋmigun.

english: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? For this reason they will be your judges.
inupiaq: Iñulluataq uqaqami salapqiiruq nakuutilaamiñik, aasiiḷi pigiitchuaq iñuk uqaqami salapqiimmiuq pigiisilaamiñik.

english: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has already overtaken you.
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, uvluani isivġiġvium iñuich pasirauniaqtut anniqsuutauŋitchuatigun uqalupayauratigun uqallausiġikkamikkun.

english: How else can someone enter a strong man’s house and steal his property, unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can thoroughly plunder the house.
inupiaq: Qanuq uqaluvsigun patchisaiqsauniaqtusi, suli uqaluvsigun pasirauniaqtusi.

english: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
inupiaq: Tavrani iḷaŋich iḷisaurrit pitquranik iḷaŋiḷḷu Pharisees uqallaŋarut Jesus-mun, Iḷisaurrii, tautugukkiptigiñ aliuġnaqtuamik savaglutin nalupqinaiyautiksramik kiutilaaġnik.

english: For this reason I tell you, people will be forgiven for every sin and blasphemy, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiugiññaŋagai, Qanutun pigiisigirut god-aitchuat makua iñuich savaquriruat uvamnik aliuġnaqtuanik. Aliuġnaqtuatualuk savaaguniaqtuaq piñiaqtuq Jonah-tun uqaqtiŋatun God-im.

english: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.
inupiaq: Qanuq tainnatuttauq Jonah-m uvluni piŋasuni unnuaniḷu piŋasuni iḷuaniinmatun aġviġum, Iġñiŋaptauq iñuum nunam iḷuaniinniaġmiuq piŋasuni uvluni piŋasuniḷu unnuani.

english: “Make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad, for a tree is known by its fruit.
inupiaq: Isivġiġviŋmi iñuŋisa Nineveh-m akiḷḷiḷiġñiaġaasi ilivsi iñuuruasii paŋmapak aasii pasirauyumiñaqsiḷusi, qanuq iliŋich isumalitqiŋavlutiŋ alġaqsruimman Jonah, aasii imma iñuk kamanałhaaqtuaq Jonah-miñ maaniittuq.

english: Offspring of vipers! How are you able to say anything good, since you are evil? For the mouth speaks from what fills the heart.
inupiaq: Isivġiġviŋmi suli aġnam umialgum akiḷḷiḷiġñiaġaasi ilivsi iñuuruasii paŋmapak, aasii pasirauyumiñaqsiḷusi. Qanuq ilaa qaiŋaruq uŋallam tuŋaaniñ nunamiñiñ uŋasiksuamiñ tusaayaqtuqługu isumattutaa Solomon. Aasii imma iñuk maaniittuq kamanałhaaqtuaq Solomon-miñ.

english: The good person brings good things out of his good treasury, and the evil person brings evil things out of his evil treasury.
inupiaq: Ilivsi pigiitchuasii iñuuruat paŋmapak ittusi iñuktun ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuatun. Ilitqusiqł̣uk anikami iñuŋmiñ, ilaa kukiḷuktuq imiġitchuakun nunakun ivaqłiavluni piḷaiŋiaqsiaġviksramiñik, aasii paqitchiŋitchuq.

english: I tell you that on the day of judgment, people will give an account for every worthless word they speak.
inupiaq: Tavraniasii uqallaktuq, Utiġniaqtuŋa iñuŋmun, annivimñun. Tavra utiqami paqitkaa inigiŋakkani imaiḷaaq, tilaiŋaraatchiaq, sut iłuaqsruqtat.

english: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii aullaqłuni qaġġirriruq tallimat malġugnik allanik ilitqusiqł̣ugnik pigiił̣haaqtuanik inmiñiñ, aasii isiqłutiŋ iñuuvigiaqsivḷugu. Tainna pimmata, iñuk taamna pigiiḷił̣haaŋaruq aqulliġmi sivulliġmiñ. Tainnaġniaġmiusi pigiitchuasii iñuuruasii paŋmapak.

english: Then some of the experts in the law along with some Pharisees answered him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqaġniaqtillugusuli iñuŋnun, aakaŋalu aniqatiiŋiḷu makitaŋarut siḷami, apiqsrivḷutiŋ uqaqatigisukługu.

english: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
inupiaq: Iñuich iḷaŋata uqallautiŋagaa, Aakallu aniqatiitillu qaŋma makitarut aniiqł̣utiŋ, apiqsrirut uqaqatigisukłutin.

english: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa iñuk uqallaurriñi, Kisuuva aakaga? Suli kisuuvat aniqatitka?

english: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them – and now, something greater than Jonah is here!
inupiaq: Tavra isaaqługich argagni tuŋaannun iḷitchitqurami, ilaa uqallaŋaruq, marra makua aakagimmatullu aniqatigimmatullu itkitka.

english: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon – and now, something greater than Solomon is here!
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñaliqaa nalautchiruaq pisuutaanik Aapama qiḷaŋmiittuam aniqatigigiga, aakagigigalu.

english: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it passes through waterless places looking for rest but does not find it.
Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I left.’ When it returns, it finds the house empty, swept clean, and put in order.

Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there, so the last state of that person is worse than the first. It will be that way for this evil generation as well!”
While Jesus was still speaking to the crowds, his mother and brothers came and stood outside, asking to speak to him.
Someone told him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside wanting to speak to you.”
To the one who had said this, Jesus replied, “Who is my mother and who are my brothers?”
And pointing toward his disciples he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”
On that day after Jesus went out of the house, he sat by the lake.
inupiaq: Taavrumanisuli uvlumi Jesus aniŋaruq iglumiñ aasii aquptaaŋaruq tatchim siñaanun iḷisaurrisukłuni.

english: And such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat to sit while the whole crowd stood on the shore.
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich katirvigiŋagaat avałługu, kiisaimma ikivuq umiaqpauramun aasii tavruŋa aquptaaqłuni, aasiiḷi iñusalaich makitavlutiŋ siñaani.

english: He told them many things in parables, saying: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqautiŋagai iñugiaktuanik uuktuutitigun, uqaqłuni, Nunaliqiri aullaqtuq kanġaqsruiyaqtuqłuni nautchiaksranik palauvaksraġuġniaqtuanik.

english: And as he sowed, some seeds fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured them.
inupiaq: Tavra kanġaqsruipkaqtillugu iḷaŋich kataŋarut apqutinun, aasii tiŋmiat qaivḷutiŋ niġiŋagaich.

english: Other seeds fell on rocky ground where they did not have much soil. They sprang up quickly because the soil was not deep.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich aasii kataŋarut uyaġauruamun nunamun nunaqapiaŋitchuamun. Tavrauvvaa naurut, qanuq mapturuamik nunaitchuq.

english: But when the sun came up, they were scorched, and because they did not have sufficient root, they withered.
inupiaq: Siqiñiq salapqiġman maŋŋuił̣ł̣utiŋ panaqłuŋagai, aasii tuquvlutiŋ.

english: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and they grew up and choked them.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋich nautchiaksrat kataŋarut akunġannun kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauruat, aasii kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauvlutiŋ nagguviksraiŋagaich, naupkaŋił̣ḷugich nautchiaksrat.

english: But other seeds fell on good soil and produced grain, some a hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.
inupiaq: Allat kataŋarut nunagiksuamun, aasii nauvlutiŋ palauvaksrat iñugiaksivḷutiŋ. Iḷaŋich nauŋarut iñuiññaq qulinik palauvaksranik, iḷaŋich aasii piŋasukipiamik, aasii iḷaŋich tallimakipiamik.

english: The one who has ears had better listen!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksraŋnik, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: Then the disciples came to him and said, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat qaivḷutiŋ Jesus apiġiŋagaat, Summan uqaqpich iñuŋnun uuktuutitigun?

english: He replied, “You have been given the opportunity to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but they have not.
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, God-im kaŋiqsipkaŋagaa ilivsiññun kaŋiqsiñaiñŋaruaq sivuani atanniqsimmatini iñuŋnun, aglaalli allat iñuich tusaqsraġigaat uuktuutitigun.

english: For whoever has will be given more, and will have an abundance. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk kaŋiqsiñiḷuktuaq kaŋiqsipkavsaaqtauniaqtuq kaŋiqsiḷḷuataġumiñaqsiḷugu. Aglaan iñuk kaŋiqsiñiḷuŋitchuaq piiguiñiaqtuq kaŋiqsił̣auraġaluakkaġmiñik.

english: For this reason I speak to them in parables: Although they see they do not see, and although they hear they do not hear nor do they understand.
inupiaq: Unauvva pisigivlugu uqautigitka uuktuutitigun, qanuq qiñiġaluaqłutiŋ iḷisaqsriḷaitchut, naalaġnigaluaqłutiŋ tusaalaitchuatun ittut aasii kaŋiqsiḷaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: And concerning them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled that says:
inupiaq: Ilaiññun nalaunŋapiallaktuq aglaaŋa Isaiah-m inna uqaqtuaq,

english: ‘You will listen carefully yet will never understand,
inupiaq: Naalaġnisitchi aasii iḷiḷḷugu sivuniŋa uuktuutim nunaliqirikun nautchirriiruakun.

english: you will look closely yet will never comprehend.
inupiaq: Iñuich tusaaruat uqaluanik God-im atanniqsimmataata aglaan kaŋiqsiŋił̣ł̣ugu, nautchiaksratun ittut kataktuatun apqutinun. Tuunġaum qaivḷuni piiguipkaġai tusaakkaŋannik.

english: For the heart of this people has become dull;
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi nautchiaksrat kataktuat uyaġaulaamun nunamun, iñuktitun ittut akuqtuiruatun uqaluŋmik quviasuutigivlugu tusaapqauraqamirruŋ.

english: they are hard of hearing,
inupiaq: Aglaan akuqtuaġiŋiññiġaat uqaluk naamasiḷugu tuniqsimmatiksraqtiŋ, nautchiaksratun maŋŋuqavigruaŋitchuatun iłłutiŋ. Tavraasii iłuiḷḷiuġutit nagliksaaqtirrusiallu qaimmata uqaluk pisigivlugu, iliŋich tavrauvvaa nikatchaktut aasii qapiqłutiŋ.

english: and they have shut their eyes,
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi nautchiaksrat kataktuat akunġannun kakiḷḷaġnat nauruat, ittut iñuktitun tusaaruatun uqaluŋmik, aglaan uŋiarrisit mattumani iñuuniaġniġmi piviuttaqsriñġuvlu suġaliġnik nagguviksraiġaat uqaluk, aasii iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauŋił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: so that they would not see with their eyes
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi nautchiaksrat kataktuat nunagiksuamun iñuktitun ittut tusaaruatun uqaluŋmik akuqtupiaġataqługu, aasii iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauvlutiŋ, nautchiaksratun kataktuatun nunagiksuamun, aasii naurivḷuni iḷaŋiññik tallimakipiatun, iḷaŋich piŋasukipiatun, suli iḷaŋich iñuiññaq qulitun.

english: and hear with their ears
inupiaq: Allamiksuli uuktuunmik Jesus uqautiŋagai, Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam ittuq iñuktun kanġaqsruiruatun palauvaksraġiksuanik nautchiaqaġviŋmiñun.

english: and understand with their hearts
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich siñiktillugich, uumigiriŋa qaiñiqsuq aasii kanġaqsruivḷuni palauvaksraġiitchuanik akunġannun palauvaksraġiksuat, aasii kanġaqsruiqqaaqłuni aullaqłuni.

english: and turn, and I would heal them.’
inupiaq: Tavraasii palauvaksrat naummata naummaġiksikavsakłutiŋ, palauvaksraġiitchuat salapqiŋammiut.

english: “But your eyes are blessed because they see, and your ears because they hear.
inupiaq: Tavraasii kivgaŋisa nunaqaqtuaq ullakługu uqallautiŋagaat, Aŋuun, palauvaksraġiksuanik kanġaqsruiŋarutin nautchiaqaġvigñun. Qanuqłutiŋ palauvaksraġiitchuat salapqiqpat?

english: For I tell you the truth, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Uumigirim savaaġiŋagaa taamna. Kivgat apiġiŋagaat, Aullaquvisigut nutchugaġiaġlugich palauvaksraġiitchuat?

english: “So listen to the parable of the sower:
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautigiññaŋagai, Naagga, iḷaanni katitchaġuvsigik palauvaksraġiitchuat maŋŋuiyaqpiaġisi palauvaksraġiksuat nutchugaqatigilugich palauvaksraġiitchuanun.

english: When anyone hears the word about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches what was sown in his heart; this is the seed sown along the path.
inupiaq: Iluqatik naulich atautchikun kivriviksramunaglaan, aasii kivrivik tikitpan uqallautiniaġitka kivririt, Katitqaaqsigik palauvaksraġiitchuat aasii qiḷiqsruġlugich atautchimun ikipkagaksriuġlugich, aglaan katillugich palauvaksraġiksuat suġalliqpimñun.

english: The seed sown on rocky ground is the person who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy.
inupiaq: Allamiksuli uuktuunmik Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋagai, uqaqłuni, Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam nausaiññaġniŋa arriqaqtuq mustard-mik nautchiaksramik iñuum nautchirriutikkaŋatun nautchiaqaġvigmiñun.

english: But he has no root in himself and does not endure; when trouble or persecution comes because of the word, immediately he falls away.
inupiaq: Mikiniqsraugaluaŋŋaġmi nautchiaksrapayaaniñ, naukami aŋiniqsraġuġuuruq nauriapayaaniñ aasii napaaktuġuqłuni. Tiŋmiat qaivḷutiŋ ugluliuqtut qisiqsiutiŋiññun.

english: The seed sown among thorns is the person who hears the word, but worldly cares and the seductiveness of wealth choke the word, so it produces nothing.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagai allamiksuli uuktuunmik. Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam nausaiññaġniŋa arriqaqtuq imaksramik. Aġnam imaksraq akutqatigigaa palauvaŋmun, iluqaan puvlagataqtillugu.

english: But as for the seed sown on good soil, this is the person who hears the word and understands. He bears fruit, yielding a hundred, sixty, or thirty times what was sown.”
inupiaq: Iluqaisa tamatkua Jesus uqautigiŋagai iñusalaŋnun uuktuutitigun. Ilaan uqautisuŋiñŋagai sunik uuktuutauŋitchuakun.

english: He presented them with another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a person who sowed good seed in his field.
inupiaq: Ilaa tainna piŋaruq taŋŋiutausaqługu God-im uqaqtaata uqaluanun inna,

english: But while everyone was sleeping, an enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus qimaŋagai iñusalaich aasii isiqłuni iglumun. Aasii iḷitchitquraŋi ullautiŋarut ilaanun uqaqłutiŋ, uqauttutigut sivuniŋanik uuktuutim palauvaksraġiitchuatigun nautchiaqaġviŋmi.

english: When the plants sprouted and bore grain, then the weeds also appeared.
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Iñuk kanġaqsruiruaq palauvaksraġiksuanik Iġñiġigaa iñuum.

english: So the slaves of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Then where did the weeds come from?’
inupiaq: Nautchiaqaġvik nunauruq, aasii palauvaksraġiksuat sivuniqaqtut iñuŋiñik God-im atanniqsimakkaŋiñik. Palauvaksraġiitchualli iñugigai Tuunġaum.

english: He said, ‘An enemy has done this.’ So the slaves replied, ‘Do you want us to go and gather them?’
inupiaq: Aasii taamna uumigiri kanġaqsruiruaq tamatkuniŋa palauvaksraġiitchuanik Tuunġaq, kivrivik aasii sivuniqaqtuq nunam isuanik, aasii kivririt isaġulgich.

english: But he said, ‘No, since in gathering the weeds you may uproot the wheat with them.
inupiaq: Palauvaksraġiitchuat katitaummatun aasii ikipkaqługich igniġmun, tainnatuttauq piñiaġmiuq nunam isuani.

english: Let both grow together until the harvest. At harvest time I will tell the reapers, “First collect the weeds and tie them in bundles to be burned, but then gather the wheat into my barn.”’”
inupiaq: Iġñiŋan Iñuum tiliñiaġai isaġuligni, aasii ilaisa katinniaġaich atanniqsimakkaġmiñiñ piiyaġlugich iluqaisa piḷuksisauruat, iluqaisalu pigiitchualiqirit,

english: He gave them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.
inupiaq: aasii igillugich inaanun igniqpaum. Tavrani iñuich qianiaqtut tiriqtinniaġaiḷḷu kigutitiŋ.

english: It is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it has grown it is the greatest garden plant and becomes a tree, so that the wild birds come and nest in its branches.”
inupiaq: Tavraniasii God-im iñuŋi iłuaqtuat qaumaniqaġniaqtut siqiñiqtun Aapamiŋ Atanniqsimaviani. Iñuum siutiqaqtuam naalaġniḷiŋa.

english: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all the dough had risen.”
inupiaq: Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam ittuq suġaliqtun akisuruatun iriqtauruatun nautchiaqaġviŋmi. Iñuum paqinnamiuŋ sautqiŋagaa. Aasii quviatchakpaił̣ł̣uni aullaqłuni tuniŋagai iluqaisa pigikkani tauqsiutiqaġukłuni naamaruanik maniŋñik aasii tauqsiqł̣ugu taamna nautchiaqaġvik.

english: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the crowds; he did not speak to them without a parable.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli, Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam inmiuq tauqsiġñiaqtitun ivaqłiaruatun akisuruanik uyaġagiksuanik.

english: This fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet:
inupiaq: Paqinnami atautchimik akisuruamik uyaġagiksuamik akisuqpaktuamik, aullaqłuni tuniŋagai suġauttapayaani, aasii tauqsiqł̣ugu taamna akisuruaq uyaġagiksuaq.

english: “I will open my mouth in parables,
inupiaq: Aasiisuli Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam ittuq kuvratun kuvriutauruatun, aasii kuvraqługich qanusipayaat iqaluich.

english: I will announce what has been hidden from the foundation of the world.”
inupiaq: Kuvraġviksraiġutimman, iñuich nuqinŋagaat nunamun aasii aquptaaqłutiŋ ilaaguaqługich nakuuruat iqaluich utkusigñun, aasii igiłługich pigiitchuat.

english: Then he left the crowds and went into the house. And his disciples came to him saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.”
inupiaq: Tainnatun inniaqtuq nunam isuani. Isaġulgich qaiñiaqtut aasii ilaaguaġlugich pigiitchuat iñuich nakuuruaniñ,

english: He answered, “The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man.
inupiaq: aasii igillugich inaanun igniqpaum. Tavrani iñuich qianiaqtut suli tiriqtinniaġaich kigutitiŋ.

english: The field is the world and the good seed are the people of the kingdom. The weeds are the people of the evil one,
inupiaq: Jesus apiġiŋagai, Kaŋiqsivisigik taapkua iluqaisa? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Aaŋ.

english: and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Tavraasii kaŋiqsiñiġuvsi, itqaumasitchi tamatkua iḷisaŋaruat Atanniqsimmataanik Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam igluqpiraqtuatun ittut, salapqiiḷḷaruatun sunik nutauruanik naagga utuqqauruanik suġalliqpiŋmiŋniñ.

english: As the weeds are collected and burned with fire, so it will be at the end of the age.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus naannamigich taapkua uuktuutit, ilaa aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa.

english: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will gather from his kingdom everything that causes sin as well as all lawbreakers.
inupiaq: Aasii tikiññami ilaan nunamiñun, iḷisautiŋagai iñuich aŋaiyyuvianni. Iñuich aliuġutchaŋarut, aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Sumiñ uvvauna iñuk piññakpa inna isumattunmik makkuniŋalu aliuġnaqtuanik savaanik?

english: They will throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
inupiaq: Uvvauna kaamniġum iġñiġiŋitpauŋ? Aakaŋa taiguutiqaŋitpa Mary-mik? Aasiisuli aniqatigiŋitpagich James-lu, Joseph-lu, Simon-lu, Judas-lu?

english: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. The one who has ears had better listen!
inupiaq: Suli nayaaluŋi maani iñuuŋitpat? Sumiñ aasiuvvauna iñuk piññakpa isumattunmik piḷḷasivḷuniḷu aliuġnaqtuanik?

english: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure, hidden in a field, that a person found and hid. Then because of joy he went and sold all that he had and bought that field.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich qanuqpaaŋaliŋarut. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, God-im uqaqtaa nanġausiaqallaruq sumiḷiqaa aglaan nunamiñi iḷamiñiḷu.

english: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa piŋaitchuq iñugiaktuanik aliuġnaqtuanik savaanik tavrani, pisigivlugu ukpiġutairrutaat.

english: When he found a pearl of great value, he went out and sold everything he had and bought it.
“Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was cast into the sea that caught all kinds of fish.
When it was full, they pulled it ashore, sat down, and put the good fish into containers and threw the bad away.
It will be this way at the end of the age. Angels will come and separate the evil from the righteous
and throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
“Have you understood all these things?” They replied, “Yes.”
Then he said to them, “Therefore every expert in the law who has been trained for the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house who brings out of his treasure what is new and old.”
Now when Jesus finished these parables, he moved on from there.
Then he came to his hometown and began to teach the people in their synagogue. They were astonished and said, “Where did this man get such wisdom and miraculous powers?
Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother named Mary? And aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
And aren’t all his sisters here with us? Where did he get all this?”
And so they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his own house.”
And he did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.
At that time Herod the tetrarch heard reports about Jesus,
inupiaq: Tavrani Herod atanaurauruaq Galilee-mi, tusaakami kamanautaanik Jesus,

english: and he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead! And because of this, miraculous powers are at work in him.”
inupiaq: ilaa uqallaŋaruq kivgamiñun, Ammaamna John Paptaiqsi piuq, aŋiŋaruq tuqqunmiñ. Taamnauvva pisigivlugu savallaruq tamatkuniŋa aliuġnaqtuanik.

english: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,
inupiaq: Qanuq Herod-gum tigupkaŋagaa John aasii qiḷiqsruipkaqługu isiqługu tigutaaġviŋmun, pisigivlugu Herodias, aniqanmi Philip nuliaŋa.

english: because John had repeatedly told him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
inupiaq: John Paptaiqsim Herod uqallautigaluamiiŋagaa, nalaunŋaitchuq ilivich tuvaaqasiutigupku aniqarvich nuliaŋa.

english: Although Herod wanted to kill John, he feared the crowd because they accepted John as a prophet.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tuqutchukkaluaġmivḷugulu sivuuġagiŋagai iñuich, qanuq ilaisa uqaqtigiruaġiŋagaat God-mun.

english: But on Herod’s birthday, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod,
inupiaq: Tavra Herod annivia tikiñman, pania Herodias kanaakkiuŋaruq sivuġaanni tuyuġmiami, aasii iviġaŋagaa Herod.

english: so much that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilaa unniqsuqłiiŋaruq nalupqinaiqł̣ugu aitchuġniaġnivḷugu supayaamik apiqsrisukpan.

english: Instructed by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”
inupiaq: Pisuksaaqtiqaqłuni aakamiñik, niviaqsiaq uqallaŋaruq, Aitchuŋŋa niaquanik John Paptaiqsim uumuŋa puggutauramun ikilugu.

english: Although it grieved the king, because of his oath and the dinner guests he commanded it to be given.
inupiaq: Tavra umialik isumaaliŋaruq. Aglaan pisigivlugich nalupqinaiqł̣ugu unniqsuqłiisini sivuġaanni tuyuġmiami, ilaa piraksriiŋaruq aitchuutigitquvlugu apiqsriaŋa.

english: So he sent and had John beheaded in the prison.
inupiaq: Herod tilisiŋaruq aasii niaquiqsiłługu John tigutaaġviŋmi.

english: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan niaqua qaġġisiŋagaat puggutauramun aasii aitchuutigivlugu niviaqsiamun, aasiiḷi ilaan qaġġisivlugu aakamiñun.

english: Then John’s disciples came and took the body and buried it and went and told Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra John iḷitchitquraŋisa qaivḷutiŋ piŋagaat timaa aasii iḷuviqługu. Aasii aullaqłutiŋ quliaqtuaġutiŋagaat Jesus.

english: Now when Jesus heard this he went away from there privately in a boat to an isolated place. But when the crowd heard about it, they followed him on foot from the towns.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaakamiuŋ taamna, ilaa aullaŋaruq tamaaŋŋa umiaqpaurakun iñuił̣aamun kisimġiuġukłuni. Tavra iñusalaich tusaakamirruŋ, maliŋagaat pisukataqłutiŋ nunaaqqiñiñ.

english: As he got out he saw the large crowd, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.
inupiaq: Tavra tulagniallaġmiŋ ilaan tautuŋagai iñusalaich, aasii nagliksratchaŋaruq ilaiññik, aasii iłuaqsiŋagai naŋittuaŋich.

english: When evening arrived, his disciples came to him saying, “This is an isolated place and the hour is already late. Send the crowds away so that they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
inupiaq: Unnuksraaġman, iḷitchitqurat ullakługu uqallautiŋagaat, Iñuił̣aaq marra manna ini, unnuagaqsimmivḷuni, aullaqtitkich iñusalaich nunaaqqiñun tauqsiġumaut niqiksramiŋnik.

english: But he replied, “They don’t need to go. You give them something to eat.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Aullaŋitkumikunnii suŋitchut, ilivsi aitchuqsigik sunik niqiksraŋiññik.

english: They said to him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa uqallautiŋagaat, Tallimanik punniġutiqaqsiññaqtugut malġugniglu iqalluŋnik.

english: “Bring them here to me,” he replied.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Qaġġisisigik uvamnun.

english: Then he instructed the crowds to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and two fish, and looking up to heaven he gave thanks and broke the loaves. He gave them to the disciples, who in turn gave them to the crowds.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan piraksriŋagai iñusalaich aquvitquvlugich iviŋnun, aasii tiguvlugich tallimat punniġich malġuglu iqalluk aaġluŋaruq qiḷaŋmun, aasii quyyavigivlugu God. Tavraasii avguqługich aitchuutigiŋagai punniġich iḷitchitquranun, aasiiḷi iḷitchitqurat aitchuutigivlugich iñusalaŋnun.

english: They all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, twelve baskets full.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ niġiŋarut pisuġuiqsuaqłutiŋ. Aasii iḷitchitqurat katitchiŋarut qulit malġugnik aguummagnik siḷiviłługich avguanik iḷakunik.

english: Not counting women and children, there were about five thousand men who ate.
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua niġiruat 5,000 aŋutit itpalliŋarut, kisitqatigigaluaġnagich aġnat miqłiqtullu.

english: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he dispersed the crowds.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurani ikipkaŋagai umiaqpauramun aasii ayusaqtiłługich sivumiñi ikaanmun, Jesus aullaqtitchiñiaqłuni iñusalagnik.

english: And after he sent the crowds away, he went up the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqtitanikamigich iñusalaich, ilaa mayuŋaruq qimialuŋnun kisimi aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłuni. Tanuġaksimman, Jesus tavraniinŋaruq kisimi.

english: Meanwhile the boat, already far from land, was taking a beating from the waves because the wind was against it.
inupiaq: Tavrali umiaqpauraq ayuuŋaruq nunamiñ qaggiuqłutiŋ, anuġim arguġiannaġuutivlugich.

english: As the night was ending, Jesus came to them walking on the sea.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluyasimman, Jesus ullaŋagai iḷitchitqurani pisuaqłuni immam qaaŋagun.

english: When the disciples saw him walking on the water they were terrified and said, “It’s a ghost!” and cried out with fear.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat tautukamirruŋ pisuaqtuaq immam qaaŋagun, iqsitchaŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Ilitqusiq marra. Tavra nipaalaŋarut iqsialavlutiŋ.

english: But immediately Jesus spoke to them: “Have courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaan uqallautiŋagai, quviatchaktitausitchi. Uvaŋauruŋa. Iqsiñasi.

english: Peter said to him, “Lord, if it is you, order me to come to you on the water.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, iliviupiaġuvich tuksiŋŋa iliŋnun qaitquluŋa immakun.

english: So he said, “Come.” Peter got out of the boat, walked on the water, and came toward Jesus.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Qaiñ. Tavra Peter niuŋaruq umiaqpauramiñ aasii pisuaqłuni immam qaaŋagun ullaŋagaa Jesus.

english: But when he saw the strong wind he became afraid. And starting to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷitchuġikami anuġimik naŋialiŋaruq, aasii kivisaaqsiruiññaqami nipaalaŋaruq, Ataniiq annautiŋŋa.

english: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him, saying to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
inupiaq: Jesus tavrauvvaa isaaŋagai argagni aasii tiguvlugu, uqallautivlugu, Ilivich ukpiġutikitchuatiin. Summan nalupqisukpich?

english: When they went up into the boat, the wind ceased.
inupiaq: Tavra ikimmagnik umiaqpauramun anuġaiŋaruq.

english: Then those who were in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua umiaqpauramiittuat sitquġvigiŋagaat kamanniuġvigivlugu uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷumun Iġñiġigaatin God-im.

english: After they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.
inupiaq: Tavra ikaaqamiŋ, nunaliñŋarut Gennesaret-mun.

english: When the people there recognized him, they sent word into all the surrounding area, and they brought all their sick to him.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuŋi taavruma nunam iḷisaqsrikamiŋ ilaanik, tilisiŋarut uqaluŋmik nunaaqqipayauranun aasii qaġġisivlugich naŋirrutiqapayauraqtuat Jesus-mun,

english: They begged him if they could only touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
inupiaq: apiġipiaqługu aksiḷḷagniaqsiññaġukługuunnii siñiġutaa annuġaaŋan. Aasii iñugiaktilaamiktun aksiutiruat iłuaqsirauŋarut.

english: Then Pharisees and experts in the law came from Jerusalem to Jesus and said,
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees-lu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun Jerusalem-miñ aasii apiġivlugu,

english: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat.”
inupiaq: Summan iḷitchitquravich kamagilaitpatigik iḷisaurrutiŋich maŋŋuupta? Qanuq niġiŋaiñŋaġmiŋ iqaġilaitkaich argatiŋ tuvraġlugu piraksriutaat maŋŋuupta.

english: He answered them, “And why do you disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Summallivsauq ilivsi kamagilaitpisigik pitquraŋi God-im, kamagiłhaaqługich maŋŋuuvsi iḷisaurrutiŋich?

english: For God said, ‘Honor your father and mother’ and ‘Whoever insults his father or mother must be put to death.’
inupiaq: Qanuq God piraksriiŋaruq Moses-kun, suuŋiḷaġinagik aapallu aakallu. Kiñaliqaa uqallautiqaqtuaq pigiitchuamik aapamigun aakamigullu, tuquruksraupiaqtuq.

english: But you say, ‘If someone tells his father or mother, “Whatever help you would have received from me is given to God,”
inupiaq: Ilivsiḷiasii iḷisaurrirusi iñuk piqaġniqpan sumik ikayuutigiyumiñaġaluakkamiñik aapamiñun naagga aakamiñun aglaan uqallausiġikpagu, Taamna pigigaa God-im,

english: he does not need to honor his father.’ You have nullified the word of God on account of your tradition.
inupiaq: ilaa pasirauyumiñaitchualigiksi ikayuŋitkaluaġumigik aapaniḷu aakaniḷu, pisigivlugu maŋŋuuvsi iḷisaurrutaat, anniqsuutauŋaiġisi uqaluŋi God-im.

english: Hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied correctly about you when he said,
inupiaq: Ilivsi ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanutun nalautigiŋaruq Isaiah uqaqtaa God-im uqallausiġikamisi. Ilaan aglaŋagai God-im uqaluŋi inna,

english: ‘This people honors me with their lips,
inupiaq: Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, Kamagiŋitkisi God-im pitquraŋi, kamagiłhaaqługich piḷġusiḷiaŋich iñuich.

english: but their heart is far from me,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ququaŋagai iñuich inmiñun aasii uqallautivlugich, Naalaġnisiŋa kaŋiqsiḷusiḷu.

english: and they worship me in vain,
inupiaq: Taavruma qaniġmuktuam niġiruatun piḷuksipkalaitkaa iñuk, aglaan taavruma aniruam qaniġmiñ, uqaluum piḷuksipkaġumiñaġaa iñuk.

english: teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraŋisa ullakługu uqallautiŋagaat, Iḷisimavigich Pharisees piavsaktilaaŋat tusaakamirruŋ taamna uqallautin?

english: Then he called the crowd to him and said, “Listen and understand.
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Nautchiapayaaq qiḷaŋmiittuam Aapama nautchirriutiŋaisaŋa nusuktauniaqtuq.

english: What defiles a person is not what goes into the mouth; it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles a person.”
inupiaq: Ilimiktun piḷich. Aullarrirut ayauŋaruatun iñuktun. Aasii ayauŋaruam iñuum aullatikpauŋ ayauŋaruaq iñuk, iluqatik qargisaġniaqtuk.

english: Then the disciples came to him and said, “Do you know that when the Pharisees heard this saying they were offended?”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m uqallautiŋagaa, Sivunniuġuŋ uvaptiŋnun taamna uuktuun.

english: And he replied, “Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
inupiaq: Ilaalli uqallautiŋagai, Ilivsivsauq kaŋiqsisaiñmivisi?

english: Leave them! They are blind guides. If someone who is blind leads another who is blind, both will fall into a pit.”
inupiaq: Kaŋiqsiŋaitpisiuŋ sunapayaaq qaniġmuktuaq aqiaqqumuguuruq, aasii anivḷuni timimiñ.

english: But Peter said to him, “Explain this parable to us.”
inupiaq: Aglaan suna pigiitchuaq uqaluk aniruaq qanikun aullaqivluni isumaqaġvianiñ, taavruma piḷuksipkaġaa iñuk.

english: Jesus said, “Even after all this, are you still so foolish?
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuum isumaqaġvianiñ salapqiġuurut pigiitchuat isumat piḷġusiġiitchuallu, iñuaġutit, allatuutit, tigligautit, saglutiginnigniġich, tiġlirautit.

english: Don’t you understand that whatever goes into the mouth enters the stomach and then passes out into the sewer?
inupiaq: Tamatkua tamarra piḷuksipkaġaat iñuk, aglaan niġiruni iqaġigaluaġnagich argaich piḷuksisauŋitchuq iñuŋmun.

english: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and these things defile a person.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa aasii aullaqłuni nunaaqqiŋiñun Tyre-m Sidon-lu.

english: For out of the heart come evil ideas, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq Canaan-miu iñuuruaq tamaani ullautiŋaruq nipimigun, Naglikkutiqaġiñ uvamnun Ataniiq, Iġñiŋa David. Paniga atqunaqługu ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuq.

english: These are the things that defile a person; it is not eating with unwashed hands that defiles a person.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋaitkaa uqaluuramikunnii. Tavra iḷitchitquraŋisa ullakługu apiġipiaŋagaat, Aqpikkuuŋ una aġnaq, qanuq uvva małakkaatigut nipimigun.

english: After going out from there, Jesus went to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
inupiaq: Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Tilirauŋaruŋa kisiiññun Israel-guruanun imnaisun tammaŋaruatun ittuanun.

english: A Canaanite woman from that area came and cried out, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is horribly demon-possessed!”
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq qaivḷuni sitquŋaruq sivuġaanun uqaqłuni, Ataniiq, ikayuŋŋa.

english: But he did not answer her a word. Then his disciples came and begged him, “Send her away, because she keeps on crying out after us.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiuŋagaa, Nalaunŋaŋitchuq tigulugu miqłiqtut niqaat aitchuutigiruni qimmiñun.

english: So he answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
inupiaq: Aġnaq uqallaŋaruq, Aaglukiaq Ataniiq, naaggaptauq marra qimmich unnii niġisuummiut kanġallugnik kataktuanik iñuŋmiŋ niġġiviŋiññiñ.

english: But she came and bowed down before him and said, “Lord, help me!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Aġnaaq, kamanapaluktuq ukpiġutin. Taŋŋiġḷi kipiġniuġutin. Tavra pania iłuaqsirauŋaruq tavrauvvaa.

english: “It is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs,” he said.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullalgitchuq tavraŋŋa aasii iglauvluni siñiqsraqługu tasia Galilee-m. Tavra ilaa mayuŋaruq qimialuŋnun, aasii aquviłłuni tamauŋa.

english: “Yes, Lord,” she replied, “but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich ullautiŋarut ilaanun, qaġġirrivḷutiŋ tusiapiktaqtuanik, qilluutiqaqtuanik, ayauŋaruanik, uqalaitchuanik, suniglu iñugiaktuanik allanik naŋirrutiliŋnik, aasii iḷivḷugich sivuġaanun, tavra ilaan iłuaqsiŋagai.

english: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, your faith is great! Let what you want be done for you.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñusalaich kamasuŋarut, tautukamisigik uqalaiḷat uqaaqsimmata, qilluutituqtuat iłuaqsiraummata, tusiattuat pisuaġmata, suli ayauŋaruat tautullasimmata. Tavra ilaisa nanġaŋagaat God-iŋat Israel.

english: When he left there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up a mountain, where he sat down.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus ququaŋagai iḷitchitqurani inmiñun aasii uqallautivlugich, Nagliksraliqsuŋa iñusalaŋnik, pisigivlugu nayuutiniŋat uvamnun paŋmapak piŋasuni uvluni, aasii paŋmapak niqiksraiqsut. Aullaqtitchumaŋitkitka kaaŋŋaisa, sayaiġñiaqtutkiataŋ apqunmi.

english: Then large crowds came to him bringing with them the lame, blind, crippled, mute, and many others. They laid them at his feet, and he healed them.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat apiġiŋagaat, Sumiñ niqiksranigniaqpisa naamaruamik nunagluktuami niġipkaġumiñaġlugich innatun iñugiaktigiruat?

english: As a result, the crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they praised the God of Israel.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai, Qavsiñik punniġutiqaqpisi? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Tallimat malġugnik, iñukisuuraniglu iqaluuranik.

english: Then Jesus called the disciples and said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have already been here with me three days and they have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry since they may faint on the way.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus piraksriiŋaruq iñusalaich aquvitquvlugich nunamun.

english: The disciples said to him, “Where can we get enough bread in this desolate place to satisfy so great a crowd?”
inupiaq: Ilaan tiguŋagai tallimat malġuk punniġich iqaluiḷḷu, aasii quyaanikami God-mun avguqługich qaiñŋagai iḷitchitquranun, aasiiḷi iḷitchitqurat qaił̣ł̣ugich iñusalaŋnun.

english: Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” They replied, “Seven – and a few small fish.”
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ niġiŋarut pisuiqsuaqłutiŋ. Aasii iḷitchitqurat katitchiŋarut tallimat malġugnik aguummakpagnik siḷiviłługich iḷakunik kisiŋŋuqtanik.

english: After instructing the crowd to sit down on the ground,
inupiaq: Tamatkua niġiruat 4,000-tun iñugiaktigiŋarut, aġnat miqłiqtullu kisitqatigigaluaġnagich.

english: he took the seven loaves and the fish, and after giving thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples, who then gave them to the crowds.
inupiaq: Aasii aullaqtitanikługich iñusalaich, ilaa ikuŋaruq umiaqpauramun aasii aullaqłutiŋ nunaaqqiŋiññun Magadan.

english: They all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
Not counting children and women, there were four thousand men who ate.
After sending away the crowd, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
Now when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees-lu Sadducees-lu qaiŋarut Jesus-mun, aasii uuktuaqsaqługu apiġiŋagaat tautuktitquvlutiŋ aliuġnaqtuamik qiḷaŋmiñ, iḷisimanaqsisaġlugu God-mun iviġaumagitilaaŋa.

english: He said, “When evening comes you say, ‘It will be fair weather, because the sky is red,’
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Unnuksraaġman uqallaguurusi, siḷaŋŋuġniaġaa qanuq qiḷak kaviqsiruq.

english: and in the morning, ‘It will be stormy today, because the sky is red and darkening.’ You know how to judge correctly the appearance of the sky, but you cannot evaluate the signs of the times.
inupiaq: Aasii uvlaami uqallaguummiusi, sialugniaqtuq uvlupak qanuq qiḷak kaviqsiularuq maŋaaqsiruġlu. Iḷisimagaluaqłusi sivunniuġniŋanik qiññaŋata qiḷaum, iḷitchuġilaiññiġisi sivuniŋich aliuġnaqtuat savaaguruat akunnavsiññi.

english: A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” Then he left them and went away.
inupiaq: Qanutun pigiisigirut god-aitchullu iñuich, makua savaquriruat uvamnik aliuġnaqtuanik. Aliuġnaqtuatualuk savaaguniaqtuaq piñiaqtuq Jonah-tun uqaqtiŋatun God-im. Tavra ilaan qimaŋagai aasii aullaqłuni.

english: When the disciples went to the other side, they forgot to take bread.
inupiaq: Tavra ikaaganikamiŋ taaguŋatchianun tatchim, iḷitchitqurat iḷitchuġiŋarut piiguqtilaamiŋnik punniġnik.

english: “Watch out,” Jesus said to them, “beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Qaunagisitchi nipuŋaiḷḷusiḷu imaksriuqtaŋiññik Pharisees, Sadducees-lu.

english: So they began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “It is because we brought no bread.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqaarraqsiŋarut avanmun uqaqłutiŋ, Ilaan uqallausiġigaa taamna punniliraaŋiññapta.

english: When Jesus learned of this, he said, “You who have such little faith! Why are you arguing among yourselves about having no bread?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, iḷisimavlugu qanuq uqaqtilaaŋat uqallaŋaruq, Uvvailivsi summan uqaaġutiqaqpisi akunnavsiññi punniġutaiññivḷusi? Iñuich ilivsi ukpiġutikitchusi.

english: Do you still not understand? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
inupiaq: Kaŋiqsiŋaitpisisuli? Itqaumaŋitpisigik ipkua tallimat punniġich avguqapkich 5,000-nun aŋutinun? Qavsiñullu aguummagnun immiqsiŋavisi?

english: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many baskets you took up?
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii tallimat malġuk punniġich avguqapkich 4,000-nun? Qavsiñullu aguummakpagnun immiqsiŋavisi?

english: How could you not understand that I was not speaking to you about bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
inupiaq: Qanuq imña kaŋiqsiŋiññiqpisi uqautiqaŋisilaamnik punniġnik. Qaunagisitchi imaksrautiŋisigun Pharisees Sadducees-lu.

english: Then they understood that he had not told them to be on guard against the yeast in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
inupiaq: Tavrani iḷitchitqurat kaŋiqsiŋarut ilaanun uqautiŋisilaamiŋnik imaksraŋagun punniġum, aglaan qaunagitquvlugich iḷisaurrutiŋisigun Pharisees Sadducees-lu.

english: When Jesus came to the area of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiññamiŋ nunaaqqiŋiññun Caesarea Philippi-m, apiġiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Iñuich kiunisuuvanŋa, Iġñiŋa Iñuum?

english: They answered, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
inupiaq: Iliŋich uqallaŋarut, John-gunisuugaatin Paptaiqsi, allalli Elijah-univḷutin, allat suli Jeremiah-univḷutin naaggaqaa iḷaginivḷutin uqaqtiŋiñun God-im.

english: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
inupiaq: Ilaan apiġiŋagai, Ilivsiḷimi kiunivisiŋa?

english: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
inupiaq: Simon Peter uqallaŋaruq, Ilivich Christ-gurutin, Iġñiŋa iñuuruam God-im.

english: And Jesus answered him, “You are blessed, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father in heaven!
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Quviatchaktitaugiñ Simon iġñiŋa John, qanuq iñuum satqummiŋaitkaa iliŋnun taamna uqallautin, aglaan Aapama qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overpower it.
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautigikpiñ, ilivich Peter-aurutin, sivuniqaqtuaq Uyaġagmik, aasii taavrumuŋa uyaġagmun nappaġniaġiga aŋaiyyuviga, aasii suaŋŋatipayauraŋisa Tuunġaum payariyumiñaitkaat.

english: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”
inupiaq: Aitchuġniaġikpiñ pitchiġiiyautiŋiñik Atanniqsimmataata Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam. Taamna sivuniqaqtuq pitquŋisasi Aŋaiyyuvimñi nunami pitquniaŋiñmigai Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam, aasii supayaat pipkallakkasi nunami pipkallaniaġmigai Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: Then he instructed his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqautipiaġataŋagai iḷitchitqurani quliaqtuaquŋił̣ł̣ugich kimununnii Christ-guniḷuni.

english: From that time on Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋaaglaan Jesus iḷisautirraqsiŋagai iḷitchitqurani aullaqtuksraupiaġnivḷuni Jerusalem-mun aasii nagliksaaġutiqaġluni iñugiaktuanik umialiŋnaŋiññiḷḷu Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuliqsiqpagniḷḷu iḷisaurriñiḷḷu pitquranik, aasii tuqutauluni, aasiisuli uvluk piŋayuanni aŋipkaqtauluni.

english: So Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him: “God forbid, Lord! This must not happen to you!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m asivaqtaaġutivlugu uqallautiŋagaa, Tainna uqaqtuksrauŋitchutin. Ataniiq, God-im pipkaŋaiḷḷiuŋ taamna. Taamna piruksrauŋipiaqtuq iliŋnun.

english: But he turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, because you are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but on man’s.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaqługu Peter uqallautiŋagaa, Satan, piiġiñ uvamniñ. Piñaiḷutaurutin uvamnun, qanuq isumaŋitchutin God-im isummasianik aglaan iñuich isumaŋannik.

english: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Kialiqaa maligukkumiŋa piruksrauŋitchuq ilaan pisukkamiñik, iqsriutilugu aŋarraurani, itqanaitchuksrauruq tuqqutigiyumiñaġluŋaunnii.

english: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk iñuullatuvaił̣aktuaq tammaiñiaqtuq iñuggunmiñik, aglaalli iñuk sullatuaġumiḷu atiruaq tuqqutiyumiñaġluŋaunnii, tammaiyumiñaipiaġaa iñuggutini.

english: For what does it benefit a person if he gains the whole world but forfeits his life? Or what can a person give in exchange for his life?
inupiaq: Iñuk suġallakkaluaġumi supayauranik nunamiittuanik aasii tammautigilugich, ilaa suuramikunnii anniqsuġumiñaitchuq inmiñik. Sumik piitchuq iñuum simmiutiksraŋanik iñuggunmiñun.

english: For the Son of Man will come with his angels in the glory of his Father, and then he will reward each person according to what he has done.
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaiyumaaqtuq piqatigilugich isaġuliŋni qaumanġagun Aapami, aasii tavrani akiḷiġḷugu iñupayaaq savaaŋigun.

english: I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, iñuqaġniaqtuq iḷaŋiññik makitaruanik uvani tuquniaŋitchuanik tautukkaluaġnatiŋ Iġñiŋanik Iñuum qairuamik umialiktun.

english: Six days later Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John the brother of James, and led them privately up a high mountain.
inupiaq: Tavra itchaksrat uvlut pianiŋmata Jesus piqasiutiŋagai inmiñun Peter-lu, aniqatigiigḷu James-lu John-lu, aasii aullautivlugich qutchiksuamun iġġimun kisiisa.

english: And he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa qiññaġmiñi allaŋŋuŋaruq sivuġaanni, suli kiiñaŋa qaummaġiksivḷuni siqiñiqtun, annuġaaŋiḷu qatiqsivḷutiŋ qaummaqtun.

english: Then Moses and Elijah also appeared before them, talking with him.
inupiaq: Tavraasii niptaŋaruk ilaiññun Moses-lu Elijah-lu, uqaaqatigivlugu Jesus.

english: So Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, I will make three shelters – one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq Jesus-mun, Ataniiq, iłuaqtuq tavraniinnapta. Pisukkuvich tupiġniaqtuŋa piŋasunik mauŋa, atautchimik iliŋnun, suli atautchimik Moses-mun, suli atautchimik Elijah-mun.

english: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my one dear Son, in whom I take great delight. Listen to him!”
inupiaq: Uqaġataviksillugu suli, qaummaġiksuam nuvuyam qulaŋiġmagich, nipi nuvuyamiñ uqallaŋaruq, Uvva piviuttaġivlugu Iġñiġa iviġaummatigilluatakkaġa. Naalaġnisiuŋ.

english: When the disciples heard this, they were overwhelmed with fear and threw themselves down with their faces to the ground.
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat tusaakamirruŋ nipi, punŋarut nunamun, suli iqsitchapiaġataŋarut.

english: But Jesus came and touched them. “Get up,” he said. “Do not be afraid.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qaivḷuni aksiŋagai uqallautigillaan, Makittitchi suli iqsiŋaiġitchi.

english: When they looked up, all they saw was Jesus alone.
inupiaq: Tavrani aaġluqamiŋ, tautuŋitchut iñuŋmik aglaan Jesus kisian.

english: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Do not tell anyone about the vision until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”
inupiaq: Tavra atqallaġmiŋ iġġimiñ, Jesus piraksriŋagai, Quliaqtuaġnasi iñuŋmun tautukkavsiññik, Iġñiŋa Iñuum aŋitchiaġilugu tuqqunmiñ.

english: The disciples asked him, “Why then do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat apiġiŋagaat, Summan uvva iḷisaurrit pitquranik uqaġuuvat Elijah qaiqqaaqtuksrauniaġnivḷugu qaiŋaiñŋaan Christ-guruaq?

english: He answered, “Elijah does indeed come first and will restore all things.
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Iḷumun ittuq Elijah qaiqqaaġniaqtuq Christ-miñ aasii itqanaiġñiaġai supayaat.

english: And I tell you that Elijah has already come. Yet they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted. In the same way, the Son of Man will suffer at their hands.”
inupiaq: Aglaalli uqallautigivsi Elijah qaiganiŋaruq, aasii iñuich iḷisaġiŋaitkaat, aglaan iñuich piŋagaat qanupayauraq pisukamirruŋ. Tainnatuttauq aasii Iġñiŋa Iñuum nagliksaaqtinniaġmigaat.

english: Then the disciples understood that he was speaking to them about John the Baptist.
inupiaq: Tavrani iḷitchitqurat kaŋiqsiŋarut ilaanun uqautitilaamiŋnik sivuniġivlugu John Paptaiqsi.

english: When they came to the crowd, a man came to him, knelt before him,
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaŋnun tikiutimmata, iñuum ullaŋagaa Jesus aasii sitquqłuni sivuġaanun uqallaŋaruq,

english: and said, “Lord, have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers terribly, for he often falls into the fire and into the water.
inupiaq: Ataniiq, Naglikkutiqaġiñ iġñimnun, qanuq ilaa qiiqsruġuuruq aasii nagliksaaqpaguuruq, qanuq akulaitchuami puukaġuuruq igniġmun imiġmullu.

english: I brought him to your disciples, but they were not able to heal him.”
inupiaq: Qaġġisiŋagaluaġiga iḷitchitquraġnun, iłuaqsiḷaiñŋagaat.

english: Jesus answered, “You unbelieving and perverse generation! How much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I endure you? Bring him here to me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Qanutun uvva ukpiġutaisigirusi killukuaqtigivlusiḷu iñuich. Qanutun sivisutigiruamik nayugaksraġivisi ukpiliġataqtillusi? Qanutun igḷutugaksraġivisi? Qaġġitchuuŋ nukatpiaġruk uvamnun.

english: Then Jesus rebuked the demon and it came out of him, and the boy was healed from that moment.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus suaŋagaa ilitqusiqł̣uk, aasii aniŋaruq nukatpiaġrugmiñ, suli nukatpiaġruk iłuaqsirauŋaruq tavrauvvaa.

english: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
inupiaq: Tavrani iḷitchitqurat qaiŋarut Jesus-mun iñuił̣aamun aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Suvluta uvagut ilitqusiqł̣uk anilaitpisigu?

english: He told them, “It was because of your little faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; nothing will be impossible for you.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Patchisauruq ukpiġutikiññiqsi. Qanuq iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ukpiġutiqaġuvsi nautchiaksratun mustard-tun mikipiaġaluaqłuni naullaruatun napaaqtuqpaġuqłuni, uqallautiyumiñaġiksi una iġġiq, Nuuttin maaŋŋa avuŋaqpanun, aasii nuunniaqtuq. Suli sunaliqaa piḷḷasiñiaġiksi.

english: When they gathered together in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.
inupiaq: Aglaan tainnasiq ilitqusiqł̣uk sumikunnii aniḷaitchuq aŋaiyyutauŋitchuakun niġiḷaiḷḷuni.

english: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they became greatly distressed.
inupiaq: Tavra kukiḷuŋniallaġmiŋ Galilee-mi, Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Iġñiŋa Iñuum aitchuutauniaqtuq iñuŋnun,

english: After they arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Your teacher pays the double drachma tax, doesn’t he?”
