inupiaq: aasii tuqunniaġaat, aglaan ilaa aŋipkaqtauniaqtuq uvluk piŋayuanni. Tavra iḷitchitqurat ipiqtutchapiaŋarut.

english: He said, “Yes.” When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do earthly kings collect tolls or taxes – from their sons or from foreigners?”
inupiaq: Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu tikiñmata Capernaum-mun, katitchirit Aŋaiyyuvikpaum tax-iġutiŋiñik qaiŋarut Peter-mun aasii apiġivlugu, Iḷisaurriksi akiḷiiḷaitpa tax-iutiŋiñik aŋaiyyuvikpaum?

english: After he said, “From foreigners,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Akiḷiisuuruq. Tavraasii Peter isiġman iglumun, Jesus uqallaqqaaŋaruq ilaanun, Simon, qanuq isumavich? Kisuniñ umialiŋi nunam katitchisuuvat taxes-nik? Ilaisa nunamigni iñuŋmiŋniñ naagga allat nunat iñuŋiññiñ?

english: But so that we don’t offend them, go to the lake and throw out a hook. Take the first fish that comes up, and when you open its mouth, you will find a four drachma coin. Take that and give it to them for me and you.”
inupiaq: Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Allaniñ. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Umialgum iñuŋi akiḷiiḷaitchut.

english: At that time the disciples came to Jesus saying, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani iḷitchitqurat ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun, apiqsrivḷutiŋ, Kiña kamanaġniqsrauva atanniqsimaviani Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam?

english: He called a child, had him stand among them,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tuksiaqługu inmiñun miqłiqtuuraq inillaŋagaa qitqannun,

english: and said, “I tell you the truth, unless you turn around and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven!
inupiaq: aasii uqallakłuni, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ilivsi isumalitqiŋisuaġuvsi aasii iḷiḷusi miqłiqtutun, sumikunnii isiġumiñaitchusi atanniqsimavianun Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: Whoever then humbles himself like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa kamanaqsiḷiŋaiġumi inmiñik uuma miqłiqtum irrusiatun iḷiḷuni ilaa kamanaġniqsrauruq atanniqsimaviani Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: And whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me.
inupiaq: Iñuum paġlakpauŋ miqłiqtuuraq uvaŋa pisigiluŋa, uvaŋa paġlagaaŋa.

english: “But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a huge millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the open sea.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa ukpiġutaiqsitpagu iḷaŋat makua miqłiqtuuratun iḷivḷutiŋ ukpiqtuat uvamnun, iłuałhaaġayaqtuq uyaġagruaġmik quŋusiġutchiġḷugu ipipkaqpan itiniŋanun taġium.

english: Woe to the world because of stumbling blocks! It is necessary that stumbling blocks come, but woe to the person through whom they come.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirut nunam iñuŋi ukpiġutaiqsitchiruat iñuŋnik. Tainnainniaġniqsuq ataramik, aglaan qanutun naglignaqtigiruq ukpiġutaiqsitchiruaq iñuŋnik.

english: If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.
inupiaq: Tavra argavsi naagga isigavsi piḷuksipkaqpasi, iñuusitchi argaiqsuatun naagga isigaiqsuatun piḷusi. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq isiġuvsi atanniqsimavianun God-im argaiḷḷusiunnii naagga isiġaiḷḷusi piqaġniġmiñ iluqaaktun argaqaġlusi isigaqaġlusiḷu igitauniġmiñ isuitchuamun igniġmun.

english: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into fiery hell.
inupiaq: Suli irivsi piḷuksipkaqpasi, iñuusitchi iraiqsuatun piḷusi. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq isiġuvsi atanniqsimavianun God-im atautchimik iriqaġlusi malġugnik iriqaġluni igitauniġmiñ nagliksaaġvium igniŋanun.

english: “See that you do not disdain one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi suuŋiḷaġitchaiḷisiuŋ atausiqunnii makua iḷaŋat miqłiqtutun iḷivḷuni ukpiqtuaguruaq uvamnun. Qanuq uqallautigivsi, qiḷaŋmi isaġuliŋich qakuguliqaa ullautillarut Aapamnun qiḷaŋmiittuamun.

english: What do you think? If someone owns a hundred sheep and one of them goes astray, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains and go look for the one that went astray?
inupiaq: [Qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaiŋaruq annautiyaqtuqługich tammaŋaruat.]

english: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he will rejoice more over it than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.
inupiaq: Qanuq isumavisi? Iñuk tallimakipiamik imnaiqaġumi, aasii iḷaŋat tammaġluni, qimagniaŋitpagich tallimakipiaġuutaitchuat qimialuŋnun aasii ivaaqsiḷugu atausiq tammaqtuaq imnaiq?

english: In the same way, your Father in heaven is not willing that one of these little ones be lost.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, paqitkumiuŋ ilaa quviasuuttaqałhaaqtuq taavrumuŋa atautchimun imnaimun ukunaŋŋa tallimakipiaġuutaitchuaniñ imnaiñiñ tammaŋaitchuaniñ.

english: “If your brother sins, go and show him his fault when the two of you are alone. If he listens to you, you have regained your brother.
inupiaq: Tavra pisuutigiŋitkaa Aapavsi qiḷaŋmiittuam atausiqunnii iḷaŋat makua miqłiqtutun iḷivḷutiŋ ukpiliŋaruat tammaqulugu.

english: But if he does not listen, take one or two others with you, so that at the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter may be established.
inupiaq: Aniqatin piḷuksikpan iliŋnun kisivich ullaglugu uqallauttuuŋ pimaqłuutaanik, ilipkullu ilaagullu. Naalaġnikpatin atisiqatigilutin utiqtitqikkiñ aniqatin.

english: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. If he refuses to listen to the church, treat him like a Gentile or a tax collector.
inupiaq: Aglaan atisiqatigisuŋitpatin, ullatqikkumagiñ piqasiġḷutin atautchimik naagga malġugnik iñuŋnik iḷisimaruksragnik sunik uqautiŋnik ilaanun. Tainna piguvich, kamaksriñiaqtutin pitquranik uqaluqaqtuanik inna, “Pasikkutipayaaq ukpiġnaqsiñiaqtuq iḷumun itilaaŋanik malġugnik naagga piŋasunik iḷisimariqaġluni.”

english: “I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
inupiaq: Naalaġnisuŋiḷgitpan, quliaqtuaġili aŋaiyyuliqiruanun, aasii naalaġnisuŋiḷgitpan aŋaiyyuliqiruanik iḷiuqsiuŋ aunniuġutiŋaisavsisun katitchiritullu tax-iñik.

english: Again, I tell you the truth, if two of you on earth agree about whatever you ask, my Father in heaven will do it for you.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, sunapayaaq piñaisitaqsi nunami piñaisinniaġmigaa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam. Suli sunaliqaa pipkallakkaqsi nunami pipkallaniaġmigaa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: For where two or three are assembled in my name, I am there among them.”
inupiaq: Uqallautivsaaġivsi, atisiḷutik malġuulutik sunapayaaq nunami apiqsriaġiguptitku aŋaiyyulutik, pipkaġniaġaa iliptiŋnun Aapama qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: Then Peter came to him and said, “Lord, how many times must I forgive my brother who sins against me? As many as seven times?”
inupiaq: Qanuq sumun malġuk naagga piŋasut katinmata pisigivluŋa, tavraniinmiuŋa piqatigivlugich.

english: Jesus said to him, “Not seven times, I tell you, but seventy-seven times!
inupiaq: Tavrani Peter ullautiŋaruq Jesus-mun aasii apiġivlugu, Ataniiq, qavsiiqsuaġlugu suliqutigiŋaiġñiaqpigu itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuksigaluamiiqpan aniqatiga uvamnun? Tallimat malġuiqsuaġlugu?

english: “For this reason, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Naumi, tallimat malġuŋiḷaaŋni, aglaan qanutupayauraq suliqutigiŋaigaksraukpan.

english: As he began settling his accounts, a man who owed ten thousand talents was brought to him.
inupiaq: Tavra inna ittuq atanniqsimmataa qiḷaŋmiittuam iñuŋnun. Umialiktun ittuq piyummatiniktuatun iłuaqsruisukłuni akiiḷaŋiññik kivgami.

english: Because he was not able to repay it, the lord ordered him to be sold, along with his wife, children, and whatever he possessed, and repayment to be made.
inupiaq: Makpiġarriqisaaniŋman, iñuk qaġġirrauŋaruq ilaanun akiiḷaqtuqpauraqtuaq maniŋñik.

english: Then the slave threw himself to the ground before him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay you everything.’
inupiaq: Tavra akiḷiiyumiñaiñman, atanġata tunirautquŋagaa, piqatigilugich nuliaŋalu miqłiqtuŋiḷu supayaallu pigikkaŋi, aasii akiḷiutigilugich akiiḷaŋiñun.

english: The lord had compassion on that slave and released him, and forgave him the debt.
inupiaq: Tavra kivgam sitquqami qiññuaqtulavigiaqsiŋagaa, Ataniiq, qiñuirrutiqallagiñ uvamnun, akiḷiiviginiaġikpiñ iluqaiññik akiiḷamnik.

english: After he went out, that same slave found one of his fellow slaves who owed him one hundred silver coins. So he grabbed him by the throat and started to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe me!’
inupiaq: Tavra naglikkiagutivlugu atanġata aullaqtitkaa suliqutigiŋaiqł̣ugich akiiḷaŋi.

english: Then his fellow slave threw himself down and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay you.’
inupiaq: Tavraliasii taamna kivgaq, anisaġniallaġmi, kasuġniġaa iḷaŋat kivgauqatimi akiiḷałauraqtuaq inmiñiñ maniŋñik, aasii tigguġlukamiuŋ nunuiñiaqsautigillaan uqallautivlugu, Akiḷiigiñ akiiḷaġnik uvamnun.

english: But he refused. Instead, he went out and threw him in prison until he repaid the debt.
inupiaq: Tavra kivgauqataa punŋaruq aasii qiññulaaqsivḷugu, Qiñuirrutiqaġiñ uvamnun, akiḷiiviginiaġikpiñ.

english: When his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were very upset and went and told their lord everything that had taken place.
inupiaq: Tavra tainna pisuŋiñŋaruq aasii aullautivlugu isiŋagaa tigutaaġviŋmun akiḷiitchiaġisaqługu akiiḷaŋiñik.

english: Then his lord called the first slave and said to him, ‘Evil slave! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me!
inupiaq: Allat kivgauqatiŋisa iḷitchuġikamirruŋ piruaq taavrumiŋa, atqunaq iłuiḷḷiuġutigiŋagaat, aasii aullaqłutiŋ quliaqtuaġutivlugu ataniqtiŋ taavrumiŋa iluqaanik piruamik.

english: Should you not have shown mercy to your fellow slave, just as I showed it to you?’
inupiaq: Tavra atanġata qaitquŋagaa taamna kivgaq aasii uqallautivlugu, Ilivich piḷuktuatiin kivgaaq. Suliqutigiŋaiŋagikpiñ iluqaanik taavrumiŋa akiiḷaqpauraġnik qanuq iŋiulakamŋa.

english: And in anger his lord turned him over to the prison guards to torture him until he repaid all he owed.
inupiaq: Tainnatulli naglikkutiqaqtuksrauŋagaluaqtutin kivgauqatiŋnun, uvaptun naglikkutiqaŋaruatun iliŋnun.

english: So also my heavenly Father will do to you, if each of you does not forgive your brother from your heart.”
inupiaq: Tavra qinnautivlugu atanġata aitchuutigiŋagaa tigutaaqtaliqirinun tatavsaqtautquvlugu akiḷiitchiaġisaqługu iluqaiññik akiiḷaŋiñik.

english: Now when Jesus finished these sayings, he left Galilee and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan River.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaŋaiqami tamatkuniŋa, aullaŋaruq Galilee-miñ aasii tikił̣ł̣uni nunaaqqiŋiñun Judea-m taavanitchiani kuugum Jordan.

english: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuat iñusalaich maliġuaŋagaat, aasii ilaan iłuaqsiŋagai naŋittuat tamaani.

english: Then some Pharisees came to him in order to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful to divorce a wife for any cause?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees ullaŋagaat aasii uuktuaqsaqługu apiġivlugu, Nalaunŋava pitquratigun iñuum nuliani avitpagu sumigliqaa patchisiqaġlugu?

english: He answered, “Have you not read that from the beginning the Creator made them male and female,
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Taiguaġiŋaitpisiuŋ aullaqisaami iññiruamun taapkuŋniŋa savaŋatilaaŋa aŋunmiglu aġnamiglu?

english: and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and will be united with his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?
inupiaq: Aasii uqallakłuni, Taamna pisigivlugu, aŋutim qimaguugik aapaniḷu aakaniḷu aasii nayuqsiutivlugu nuliani. Tavra iliŋik malġuuruak atautchisun iñuktun iḷiñiaqtuk.

english: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋaaglaan malġuuŋaiqsuk aglaan atausiŋŋuqtuk. Taamna pisigilugu, iñuum avinŋaiḷḷiuŋ tuvaaqatini God-im atautchimuktinŋammatik.

english: They said to him, “Why then did Moses command us to give a certificate of dismissal and to divorce her?”
inupiaq: Pharisees uqallautiŋagaat, Moses suŋiññiŋagaa iñuk makpiġaamun aglagluni nalupqinaiġutinik avirrusiuqpan, aasii aullaqtillugu nuliani.

english: Jesus said to them, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because of your hard hearts, but from the beginning it was not this way.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Pisigivlugu iḷisautitchiġiiññiqsi Moses avillayumiñaqtinŋagaasi nuliavsiññiñ. Aglaan isuaniñqaŋa tainnainŋaitkaluaqtuq.

english: Now I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except for immorality, and marries another commits adultery.”
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautigivsi, kialiqaa avirrusiġumiuŋ aġnaqtiŋ, allatuŋisuaqpan, aasii tuvaaqasiġḷuni allamik aġnamik allatuqtuaguruq.

english: The disciples said to him, “If this is the case of a husband with a wife, it is better not to marry!”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat uqallautiŋagaat, Tainna aŋun sivuniqaġniqpan tuvaaqanmigun, iłuałhaaġniqsuq tuvaaqatiniŋitchuni.

english: He said to them, “Not everyone can accept this statement, except those to whom it has been given.
inupiaq: Tavrali ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Taamna iḷisaurrun tamatkiġḷugich aŋutit sivuniqaŋitchuq, aglaan tamatkunuŋa God-im ikayukkaŋiñun iñuuyumiñaqsivḷugich taavrumuuna iḷisaurrutikun.

english: For there are some eunuchs who were that way from birth, and some who were made eunuchs by others, and some who became eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this should accept it.”
inupiaq: Qanuq aŋutiqaqtuq aniŋavlutiŋ tainna tuvaaqasiġumiñaitchuanik, suli aŋutiqaġmiuq tuvaaqatinikkumiñaiyakkaŋiññik iñuich, aasiisuli aŋutiqaġmivḷuni tuvaaqatinikkumiñaiyaŋaruanik inmiŋnik savautisukługu taamna qiḷaŋmiittuaq. Iñuum akuqtuiyumiñaqtuam taavrumiŋa, akuqtuġliuŋ taamna iḷisaurrun.

english: Then little children were brought to him for him to lay his hands on them and pray. But the disciples scolded those who brought them.
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuich iḷaŋich qaġġirriŋarut miqłiqtunik Jesus-mun iḷitquvlugich argaŋi ilaiññun aŋaiyyutilugiḷḷu. Iḷitchitqurat suaŋagaich iñuich qaġġirriruat.

english: But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Miqłiqtuurat qaipkaqsigik uvamnun, suli pitquŋiññagich. Qanuq tainnaiḷiŋaruat atanniqsimagai Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: And he placed his hands on them and went on his way.
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilaan aksiukługich aŋaiyyutiqqaaqługich miqłiqtuurat, aullaŋaruq.

english: Now someone came up to him and said, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to gain eternal life?”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk ullautiŋaruq Jesus-mun uqaqłuni, Iḷisaurrii, sumik savaalluatamik piruksrauvik isuitchuamik iñuggutinnagugluŋa?

english: He said to him, “Why do you ask me about what is good? There is only one who is good. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Summan apiġiviŋa sum nakuutilaaŋanik? Atausiuruq nakuuruaq. Iñuusarraqsisukkuvich kamagikkich God-im pitquraŋi.

english: “Which ones?” he asked. Jesus replied, “Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,
inupiaq: Nukatpiam apiġiŋagaa, Nalliŋich? Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, iñuaġnak, allatuġnak, tigliŋnak, saglutiginnignak,

english: honor your father and mother, and love your neighbor as yourself.”
inupiaq: suuŋiḷaġinagik aapallu aakallu, suli piviuttaġilugu siḷalliñ iliktun iḷiḷugu.

english: The young man said to him, “I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws. What do I still lack?”
inupiaq: Nukatpiaq uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Tamatkua pitqurat iluqaisa kamagiŋagitka. Sumik minitchivik?

english: Jesus said to him, “If you wish to be perfect, go sell your possessions and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Inuqsraŋaitchupiaġuvich, aullaġiñ, tunikkich supayaat pisin, aasii aitchuutigilugich maniich iḷiappauruanun, tavra piiḷḷiuġniaŋitchutin qiḷaŋmi. Aasii qaiḷutin, maliŋŋa.

english: But when the young man heard this he went away sorrowful, for he was very rich.
inupiaq: Nukatpiam tusaakamiuŋ taamna, aullaŋaruq ipiqtutchakpakłuni, qanuq iñugiaktuanik suġaliqaŋaruq.

english: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven!
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi. Qanutun siġḷiġnaqtigiruq suġalliruam isiġniaġniksraŋa atanniqsimavianun Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam.

english: Again I say, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter into the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Uqallautivsaaġivsi, siġḷiġnaił̣haaqtuq pikukturuaq kakakti isiqpan mitqutim iraagun, suġalliruam isiġniksraŋaniñ atanniqsimavianun God-im.

english: The disciples were greatly astonished when they heard this and said, “Then who can be saved?”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat tusaakamirruŋ taamna atqunaqłutiŋ qaallaŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Kiñaasii annaurrauniaġniqpa?

english: Jesus looked at them and replied, “This is impossible for mere humans, but for God all things are possible.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaŋagai aasii uqallautivlugich, Iñuich taamna piyumiñaitkaluaġaat, aglaan God supayaanik piḷḷaruq.

english: Then Peter said to him, “Look, we have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Uvva uvagut qimaiŋarugut supayaanik aasii maliġuaqłutin. Sumik aasii piññagniaqpisa?

english: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth: In the age when all things are renewed, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi. Nunatchiami, Iġñiŋa Iñuum aquvitpan kamanaqtuanun umialgum aquppiutaŋiñun, ilivsi iḷitchitqurat maliġuaŋaruasii uvamnik aquppiñiaġmiusi qulit malġugni umialgich aquppiutaŋiññi, isivġiġḷugich qulit malġugnik maŋŋuqaqtuat Israel.

english: And whoever has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.
inupiaq: Suli kiñaliqaa qimaiŋaruaq iglunik naagga aniqatiinik naagga aapamiñik aakamiñiglu naagga miqłiqtunik naagga nunamiñik pisigiluŋa, aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq tallimakipiaġuġlugu, suli kiŋuvaannagluni iñuggunmik isuitchuamik.

english: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
inupiaq: Aglaan qaunagisitchi. Tamatkua salliuniataktuat paŋmapak qamalliġuurrauniaqtut taimanigu, aasii qamalliuruat salliġuutilutiŋ.

english: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam arriqaqtuq iñuŋmik siiġñaqaġviŋmik nunaqaqtuamik. Ilaa aullaŋaruq uvlaatchaurami akiññagniaġlugich iñuich savaktiksraqsiuqłuni siiġñaqaġviŋmiñi.

english: And after agreeing with the workers for the standard wage, he sent them into his vineyard.
inupiaq: Sivunniuqatigiqqaaqługich savaktiksrat nutim akikaamik uvlumi savaktuni, tiliŋagai siiġñaqaġviŋmiñun.

english: When it was about nine o’clock in the morning, he went out again and saw others standing around in the marketplace without work.
inupiaq: Aasii aullalgiññami nainukłaaqpalliġman kasimmaviŋñun, tautuŋagai allat ittuaqsiññaqłutiŋ makitaruat,

english: He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard too, and I will give you whatever is right.’
inupiaq: aasii uqallautiŋagai, Aullaġitchiḷi savagiaġlusi siiġñaqaġvimñun, aasii qanupayaaq nalaunŋaruakun akiḷiġñiaġivsi. Tavra savagiaŋarut.

english: So they went. When he went out again about noon and three o’clock that afternoon, he did the same thing.
inupiaq: Aullalgił̣ł̣uni qitiqqaqpalliġmallu piŋasunugmallu, tainnasuli piŋaruq.

english: And about five o’clock that afternoon he went out and found others standing around, and said to them, ‘Why are you standing here all day without work?’
inupiaq: Tavrasuli vaivukłaaqpalliġman aullatqiḷgitchuq aasii paqiłługich allat makitagiññaqtuat uqallautiŋagai, Summan makitavisi uvani ittuaqsiññaqłusi uvluqtutilaaŋatun?

english: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go and work in the vineyard too.’
inupiaq: Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Qanuq kia unnii akiññaksaqtinŋaitkaatigut. Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Savagiaġitchiḷi siiġñaqaġvimñun.

english: When it was evening the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the workers and give the pay starting with the last hired until the first.’
inupiaq: Tavra anaqammagu, iñua siiġñaqaġvium uqallaŋaruq suġautchiqirimiñun, Qaitqukkich savaktuat aasii akiḷiḷḷugich akiññaktaaŋiññik, isagutilugich savagiaqqaaŋitchuaniñ, sivulliġñunaglaan.

english: When those hired about five o’clock came, each received a full day’s pay.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua savaktiksraqtaaguruat vaivukłaaqpalliġman qaiŋarut, aasii iñullaa akiññakłuni nutim akikaamik uvlumi savaktuni.

english: And when those hired first came, they thought they would receive more. But each one also received the standard wage.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua savaksaqqaaŋaruat qaikamiŋ, isumaŋarut akiññałhamaaġniaġasugalutiŋ. Tainnatun taapkunatun iñullaaptauq akiḷiusiaqaŋammiuq nutim akikaamik uvlumi savaktuni.

english: When they received it, they began to complain against the landowner,
inupiaq: Tavra akiññaanikamiŋ taamna uqavaaġutiaqsiŋagaat akiññagniaġviksiŋ,

english: saying, ‘These last fellows worked one hour, and you have made them equal to us who bore the hardship and burning heat of the day.’
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, Ukua uvva aqulliich savaktut atausił̣hiñami ikarraġmi, aasiuvva ilivich atunim piqasiutigitin uvaptiŋnun igḷutuqługu uunnaq savaktuanun uvluqtutilaaŋatun.

english: And the landowner replied to one of them, ‘Friend, I am not treating you unfairly. Didn’t you agree with me to work for the standard wage?
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiuŋagaa iḷaŋat, Avilaitqaan, ivayaŋitkikpiñ sumikunnii. Sivunniuqatigiŋitpiŋa nutim akikaamik uvlumi savaktuni akiqaġukłusi?

english: Take what is yours and go. I want to give to this last man the same as I gave to you.
inupiaq: Tigulugu akiḷiusian, aullaġiñ. Aitchuiyummatiqaŋaruŋa iliŋnun uumuŋa aqulliġmun akiḷiutiptun.

english: Am I not permitted to do what I want with what belongs to me? Or are you envious because I am generous?’
inupiaq: Piyumiñaitpik uvaŋa isumaptun sutigun uvaŋa pigikkapkun? Naagga sunŋusuutigiviuŋ anniqsraiññiġa?

english: So the last will be first, and the first last.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, Tamatkua qamalliuruat paŋmapak salliġuutiniaqtut taimanigu, aasii salliuniataktuat qamalliġuurraulutiŋ.

english: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve aside privately and said to them on the way,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus Jerusalem-mun iglaullaġmiŋ, asivaqtaaġutiqqaaqługich qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat uqallautiŋagai,

english: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the experts in the law. They will condemn him to death,
inupiaq: Uvva, Jerusalem-muksaaqsirugut, aasii Iġñiŋa Iñuum aitchuutauniaqtuq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun iḷisaurriñullu pitquranik, aasii ilaisa tuqutaksraġuġniaġaat.

english: and will turn him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged severely and crucified. Yet on the third day, he will be raised.”
inupiaq: Suli aitchuutiginiaġaat Jew-guŋitchuanun kipagitqulugu ipiġaqtuqulugulu, suli kikiaktuutilugu aŋarrauramun, aasii ilaa aŋipkaqtitauniaġmiuq tuqqunmiñ piŋayuagni uvluk.

english: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, and kneeling down she asked him for a favor.
inupiaq: Tavra aakaŋakta iġñakisa Zebedee-m ullaŋagaa Jesus, piqatigivlugik iġñagni, sitquqłuni sivuġaanun qiññuaġvigiŋagaa pisitquvlutiŋ.

english: He said to her, “What do you want?” She replied, “Permit these two sons of mine to sit, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your kingdom.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagaa aġnaq, Sumik pisitquvich? Ilaan kiuŋagaa, Unniqsuqłiigiñ ukuak malġuk iġñaka aquppiyumiñaqsiḷugik avatiŋni umialliutiguvich.

english: Jesus answered, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup I am about to drink?” They said to him, “We are able.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Nalurusi sumik apiqsrisilaavsiññik. Tavra Jesus qiviaqługik iġñiŋik uqallautiŋagik, Isumaaqtigiyumiñaqpisik isumaaġutiginiakkaptun, imiġmatun qallugauramniñ? Iliŋikta kiuŋagaak, Imiġmatun piyumiñaqtuguk qallutiŋniñ.

english: He told them, “You will drink my cup, but to sit at my right and at my left is not mine to give. Rather, it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagik, Imiġniapiaqtutik qallugauramniñ, aglaan uvaŋa piksraqtuksrautauŋitchuŋa aquppiruksranik taliqpimñi saumimñiḷu. Aapama aitchuutiginiaġik taapkuak inik kisunun itqanaiyautikkaġmiñun inigitquvlugik.

english: Now when the other ten heard this, they were angry with the two brothers.
inupiaq: Tavra qulit iḷitchitqurat tusaakamirruŋ taamna, uumitchautiŋagaich malġuk aniqatigiik.

english: But Jesus called them and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in high positions use their authority over them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ququaŋagai iluqaisa iḷitchitqurat atautchimun, aasii uqallautivlugich, Iḷisimarusi iñuich atanaurauruat iñuŋnun suaŋŋatiqaqtut iliŋiññun, suli aullarriŋisa atanniqsimavlugich.

english: It must not be this way among you! Instead whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant,
inupiaq: Aglaan tainna piñiaŋitchusi ilivsi. Kiñaliqaa kamanaġuktuaq akunnavsiññi, kivgauruksrauruq ilivsiññun.

english: and whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave –
inupiaq: Aasii kiñapayauraq ilivsiññi qaukłiusuktuaq, kivgauruksrauruq iluqavsiññun.

english: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋaunnii Iñuum qaiŋaruq kivgaqaġiaqsaŋaiqł̣uni. Ilaa qaiŋaruq kivgauyaqtuqłuni tuquyaqtuqłuniḷu tasuġukługich iñugiaktuat iñuich.

english: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed them.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqsaqtillugich Jericho-miñ, iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñusalaich maliŋagaat.

english: Two blind men were sitting by the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David!”
inupiaq: Aasii malġuk ayauŋaruak aquppiŋaruk saniġaanni apqutit. Tusaakamik Jesus tamaunnaaġnivḷugu, nipaalaŋaruk, Naglikkutiqaġiñ uvaptiŋnun, Ataniiq, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun.

english: The crowd scolded them to get them to be quiet. But they shouted even more loudly, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
inupiaq: Iñusalaich suakkaluaġaich, uqallautivlugik nipaisaaquvlugik, nipatusiḷaaqsiññaŋaruk, Ataniiq, naglikkutiqaġiñ uvaptiŋnun, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun.

english: Jesus stopped, called them, and said, “What do you want me to do for you?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nutqaŋaruq aasii qaitquqqaaqługik uqallautivlugik, qanuquvisik uvamnun?

english: They said to him, “Lord, let our eyes be opened.”
inupiaq: Iliŋikta kiuŋagaak, Ataniiq, tautullasisuktuguk.

english: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nagliksrautikun aksiŋagik iriŋik, aasii tavrauvvaa tautuksiḷḷasiŋaruk aasii malikługu.

english: Now when they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,
inupiaq: Tavra qallikamiŋ Jerusalem-mun tikisanikłutiŋ Bethphage-mun, Iġġiuramun atiqaqtuamun Olives, Jesus tiliŋagik malġuk iḷitchitqurak,

english: telling them, “Go to the village ahead of you. Right away you will find a donkey tied there, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.
inupiaq: uqallautivlugik, Aullaġitchik nunaaqqiñun akivsiññun, aasii tavrauvvaa paqinniaġiktik kakakti pituqaqtuak nuġġaŋalu. Pituiġḷugik qaġġisitkik uvamnun.

english: If anyone says anything to you, you are to say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them at once.”
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa uqallautikpatik qanuq, uqallakkumautik, Atanġum atuġukkik. Aasii ilaan aullaqtinniaġik tavrauvvaa.

english: This took place to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet:
inupiaq: Tavra taamna nalaunŋaruq taŋŋiutauvluni uqalugiŋaraanun uqaqtaata God-im, uqaqłuni inna,

english: “Tell the people of Zion,
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurak aullaŋaruk aasii pivḷutik Jesus pitqutaatun inmiŋnun.

english: ‘Look, your king is coming to you,
inupiaq: Iliŋikta qaġġisiŋagaak kakakti nuġġaŋalu, aasii ilaisa iḷianiŋmatigik annuġaatik kakaktiŋnun, Jesus kakaksirraqsiŋaruq.

english: unassuming and seated on a donkey,
inupiaq: Iñugiagniqsrat isivinŋagaich annuġaatiŋ apqutinun, allalli kivluiŋarut qisiqsiutinik napaaqtuniñ aasii iḷiuqqaqługich apqutinun.

english: and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich pisuaqtuat sivuani tamatkualu aquaguaqtuat nipaalaŋarut, Hosanna. Nanġaqtauli Iġñiŋa David. God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ qairuaq pisivlugu Ataniq. Nanġaqtauli God.

english: So the disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiñman Jerusalem-mun, iluqatiŋ iñuŋi iniqpaum piallaŋarut, apiqsruqtuqłutiŋ, Kiñauvvauna?

english: They brought the donkey and the colt and placed their cloaks on them, and he sat on them.
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich uqaŋarut, Tavra uqaqtiŋa God-im, Jesus Nazareth-miñ Galilee-miittuamiñ.

english: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun aasii anittaqługich iluqaisa tuniuqqairuallu tauqsiqsuqtuallu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi. Suli ulġuġaqługich taipuŋich manniqirit aquppiutaŋiḷḷu tamatkua tuniuqqairuat tiŋmianik.

english: The crowds that went ahead of him and those following kept shouting, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Aglausimaruq Bible-ni God uqallaŋanivḷugu, “Igluqpaga taggisiqaġniaqtuq iñupayaat aŋaiyyuyaqtuġviannik.” Aglaalli ilivsi iriqtuġviḷiutiŋagiksi tigligayuktinun.

english: As he entered Jerusalem the whole city was thrown into an uproar, saying, “Who is this?”
inupiaq: Tavra ayauŋaruallu tusiattuallu ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, aasii ilaan iłuaqsiŋagai.

english: And the crowds were saying, “This is the prophet Jesus, from Nazareth in Galilee.”
inupiaq: Tavra tautukamisigik aliuġnaqtuat sut piraŋi Jesus, miqłiqtullu nipaalaruat aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, Nanġaqtauli Iġñiŋa David, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik sunŋutchaŋarut.

english: Then Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple courts, and turned over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa uqallautiŋagaat Jesus, Tusaavigich makua qanuq uqaqtilaaŋat? Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Aaŋ. Taiguaŋaitpisi qaŋaunnii Bible-ni uqalugnik inna, “Miqłiqtut nanġaipkaŋagitin nanġautilluatamik.”

english: And he said to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are turning it into a den of robbers!”
inupiaq: Tavra qimakługich, Jesus aullaŋaruq iniqpaŋmiñ Bethany-mun aasii siñiktaqłuni tavrani.

english: The blind and lame came to him in the temple courts, and he healed them.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaami, utiqsaġniallaġmiŋ iniqpaŋmun, Jesus kaaliŋaruq.

english: But when the chief priests and the experts in the law saw the wonderful things he did and heard the children crying out in the temple courts, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they became indignant
inupiaq: Aasii tautukługu fig napaaqtua apqutit saniġaanni ullaŋagaa, aasii paqinŋaitchuq siiġñanik tamarra akutuqpaich kisimiŋ. Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagaa napaaqtuq, Tavraŋŋaaglaan siiġñanik nauritqigñak. Tavra fig napaaqtua tuquliŋaruq tavrauvvaa.

english: and said to him, “Do you hear what they are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read, ‘Out of the mouths of children and nursing infants you have prepared praise for yourself’?”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat tautukamirruŋ aliuŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Qanuqłuni manna fig napaaqtua tuquliva tavrauvvaa?

english: And leaving them, he went out of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ukpiġutiqaġuvsi sumikunnii nalupqisuŋiḷḷusi kisianik savaaqallayumiñaitchusi taavrumiŋa pirauruamik fig napaaqtuanun, aglaan uqallakkuvsiunnii uumuŋa iġġimun, Nuuttin, igitaugiñ taġiumun, taamna pirauyumiñaqtuq.

english: Now early in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.
inupiaq: Suli supayaamik apiqsriguvsi aŋaiyyutigilugu, aitchuusiaġiniaġiksi ukpiġutiqaġuvsi.

english: After noticing a fig tree by the road he went to it, but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, “Never again will there be fruit from you!” And the fig tree withered at once.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isiġman aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich umialignaŋisalu Jew-guruat ullaŋagaat iḷisaurripkaqtillugu, aasii uqallautivlugu, Sum ataniġnaqutaagun savaaġivigich tamatkua? Kia aitchuŋavatin taavrumiŋa ataniġnaqunmik?

english: When the disciples saw it they were amazed, saying, “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uvvalivsauq apiġiniaġivsi apiqqunmik. Uqallautiguvsiŋa kiggutaanik, uvaŋalivsauq uqallautiniaġmigivsi sum ataniġnaqutaagun pisilaaŋannik tamatkua.

english: Jesus answered them, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only will you do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.
inupiaq: Kia ataniġnaqutiksriñŋavauŋ John paptaiqsiñiksraŋagun, God-im naagga iñuich? Tavra iliŋich uqavaaqatigiirraqsiŋarut avanmun, Uqallakkupta God-miŋŋaqtauniḷugu, ilaan uqallautiniaġaatigut, Summanmi ukpiġiŋaitpisiuŋ John?

english: And whatever you ask in prayer, if you believe, you will receive.”
inupiaq: Aglaan uqaġumiñaitchugut ataniġnaqutaa iñuŋniñ piñiḷugu, Qanuq sivuuġagigivut iñuich. Qanuq iñupayaat nalupqigiŋaitkaat John God-mun uqaqtautilaaŋa.

english: Now after Jesus entered the temple courts, the chief priests and elders of the people came up to him as he was teaching and said, “By what authority are you doing these things, and who gave you this authority?”
inupiaq: Tavra kiuŋagaat Jesus, Nalurugut. Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Uvaŋaptauġli uqallautiyumiñaiñmigivsi kimun ataniġnaqutiksrisilaamnik tamatkuniŋa piyumiñaqsivḷuŋa.

english: Jesus answered them, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer me then I will also tell you by what authority I do these things.
inupiaq: Qanuq isumavisi? Iñuk malġugnik iġñiqaŋaruq. Ilaan ullaŋagaa aŋayukłiq aasii uqallautivlugu, Iġñiiŋ, savagiaġiñ siiġñaqaġviŋmi uvlupak.

english: Where did John’s baptism come from? From heaven or from people?” They discussed this among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiuŋagaa, savagiaġuŋitchuŋa. Aquvatigun isumalitqikł̣uni savagiaŋaruq siiġñaqaġviŋmun.

english: But if we say, ‘From people,’ we fear the crowd, for they all consider John to be a prophet.”
inupiaq: Aasii Aapaŋak ullautilgitchuq igḷuanun iġñiġmi aasii uqallautivlugu tainnatun suli. Tavra iġñiŋan kiuŋagaa, Aaŋ aapa. Savagiaġniaqtuŋa. Aglaan savagiaŋaitchuq.

english: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then he said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
inupiaq: Nalliakta nalautpauŋ aapami pisuutaa? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, aŋayukłium. Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, tax-iñik katitchirit akiitchullu isiqqaaġniaqtut atanniqsimavianun God-im sivuliglusi.

english: “What do you think? A man had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work in the vineyard today.’
inupiaq: Qanuq John Paptaiqsi qaiŋaruq ilivsiññun iḷisautivlusi nalaunŋaruakun iñuuniaġniġmik, aasii ilivsi ukpiġiŋaitkiksi. Aglaan tax-iñik katitchirit akiitchullu ukpiġiŋagaat, aasiiḷi ilivsi tautugluġisiunnii isumalitqiksuat, aquvatigununnii ukpiġiliŋaitkiksi isumalitqigḷusi.

english: The boy answered, ‘I will not.’ But later he had a change of heart and went.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Naalaksiuŋ allasuli uuktuun. Iñuqaŋaruq nunaqaqtuamik nautchirriiruamik siiġñaqaġviŋmik, aasii inillaiŋaruq saputinik avataagun kiavallakługu, nivaŋmivḷuni wine-liuġunnamik tavruŋa, nappaivḷuniḷu nasiqsruġviŋmik, aasii atukkirrutigivlugu napaaqsiqirinun, aasii ilaa aullaqłuni allamun nunamun.

english: The father went to the other son and said the same thing. This boy answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but did not go.
inupiaq: Tavra siiġñiviksraq qallimman, ilaan tiliŋagai kivgani napaaqsiqirinun, aitquvlugich autaaġusiaksrautini siiġñat.

english: Which of the two did his father’s will?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, tax collectors and prostitutes will go ahead of you into the kingdom of God!
inupiaq: Tavrali napaaqsiqirit tiguŋagaich kivgaŋi aasii anaumiŋagaat iḷaŋat, tuqunmivḷugu alla, uyaġagnik miḷuqtuġmivḷugu alla.

english: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe. Although you saw this, you did not later change your minds and believe him.
inupiaq: Tilisitqiŋalgitchuqsuli allanik kivganik, iñugianaaqługich sivulliġniñ, tainnatun piŋalgitkaich.

english: “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a pit for its winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went on a journey.
inupiaq: Aquatigun ilaa tilisiŋaruq iġñiġmiñik ilaiññun uqaqłuni, Taluġiniaġaat iġñiġa.

english: When the harvest time was near, he sent his slaves to the tenants to collect his portion of the crop.
inupiaq: Tavra napaaqsiqirit tautukamirruŋ iġñiq, uqaurrutiŋarut inmiŋnun, Tamarra kiŋuvaannaktuksraun. Qaisitchi, tuqullakput piññaktaaġiluguasii kiŋuvaannaktaaksrautaa.

english: But the tenants seized his slaves, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
inupiaq: Tavra tiguŋagaat aasii annisivlugu siiġñaqaġviŋmiñ, tuqunŋagaat.

english: Again he sent other slaves, more than the first, and they treated them the same way.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai, Iñua siiġñaqaġvium qaigumi, qanuġniaqpagich taapkua napaaqsiqirit?

english: Finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Ilaan taapkua iñumaqłuich naŋinnaqtuakun tuqunniaġai, aasii atukkirrutigilugu siiġñaqaġvik allanun napaaqsiqirinun aitchuiyumiñaġniaqtuanun inmiñun siiġñanik piviksraŋatigun.

english: But when the tenants saw the son, they said to themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and get his inheritance!’
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Qaŋaunnii taiguaġiŋaitpisiuŋ Bible uqaluŋiññi? “Kaŋiġalluŋmi uyaġagruaq, piitchuiññiqsrapiaq igluqpiruni, taamna igluqpirit iginŋagaat. Taamna piŋaruq nalaupiaqługu Atanġum sivunniuġutaa. Qanutun aliuġnaqtigirut ilaan piraŋi.”

english: So they seized him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
inupiaq: Tavrasuli Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, God-im atanniqsimaniaŋitkaasi, ukpiŋiññavsi, aasii atanniqsimalugich allat kamaksriyumiñaqtuat inmiñik, iñuatun siiġñaqaġvium qaitchiruatun siiġñaqaġviŋmiñik allanun aitchuiḷḷaruanun siiġñanik inmiñun piviksrakun.

english: Now when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
inupiaq: Aasii iñuk puukaqtuaq taavrumuŋa uyaġagmun kanuġġirauniaqtuq, aglaattauq taamna uyaġak kattaqinnikkumi iñuŋmik kanuġġiñiaġaa suksraunġipiaġlugu.

english: They said to him, “He will utterly destroy those evil men! Then he will lease the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his portion at the harvest.”
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu Pharisees-lu tusaakamisigik Jesus uuktuutiŋi, puttuqsriŋarut ilaanun uqautigitilaamiŋnik.

english: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the scriptures:
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaqsaġumagaluaqamirruŋ ilaa, sivuuġagiŋagaich iñusalaich, qanuq ilaisa Jesus uqaqtaurualiŋagaat God-mun.

english: ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
For this reason I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.
The one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls will be crushed.”
When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they realized that he was speaking about them.
They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, because the crowds regarded him as a prophet.
Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqarraqsitqiŋaruq uuktuutitigun iñuŋnun uqaqłuni,

english: “The kingdom of heaven can be compared to a king who gave a wedding banquet for his son.
inupiaq: Atanniqsimmataa Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam arriliñaġumiñaqtuq umialiŋmun katirrusiqutikun niqinaqipkairuamun iġñiġmiñik.

english: He sent his slaves to summon those who had been invited to the banquet, but they would not come.
inupiaq: Aasii tiliŋagai ilaan kivgani aiyugaaqtauŋaruat qaitquvlugich katirrusiqutikun niqinaqiruanun, aasii qaisuŋiñŋarut.

english: Again he sent other slaves, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “Look! The feast I have prepared for you is ready. My oxen and fattened cattle have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.”’
inupiaq: Tilisivsaaŋaruq allanik kivganik uqaqłuni, Uqallautiyumagisi tamatkua aiyugaaqtauruat, Uvva, itqanaiganikkiga niqinaqusiaġa, qimuktitka quiñiruallu tuttuqpaiyaagutitka tuqutaniktut, suli supayaaq itqanaiqsuq. Niqinaqiyyaġitchi katirrusiqiruanun.

english: But they were indifferent and went away, one to his farm, another to his business.
inupiaq: Tavra aiyugaaqtauruat suliqutigiŋaitkaat aasii aullaqsiññaqłutiŋ, iḷaŋich nunamiŋnun, allattauq tauqsiġñiaġviŋmiŋnun.

english: The rest seized his slaves, insolently mistreated them, and killed them.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisuli tigguġluŋagaich kivgaŋi, anaumikł̣ugich, suli tuquġaqługich.

english: The king was furious! He sent his soldiers, and they put those murderers to death and set their city on fire.
inupiaq: Umialik qinnaliŋaruq, aasii tilivḷugich aŋuyaktini tuquġaŋagaich taapkua iñuaqtit ikipkaqługulu iniqpaŋat.

english: Then he said to his slaves, ‘The wedding is ready, but the ones who had been invited were not worthy.
inupiaq: Tavrani uqallautilgitkai kivgani, katirrusiqutiksraq itqanaiqsuq, aglaan taipkua aiyugaaqtauŋagaluaqtuat nalliummatiŋitchut.

english: So go into the main streets and invite everyone you find to the wedding banquet.’
inupiaq: Aullaġitchi apqutinun aasii aiyugaaqłiiḷusi katirrusiqutikun niqinaqunmun iñugiaktilaaŋisitun kasukkasi.

english: And those slaves went out into the streets and gathered all they found, both bad and good, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua kivgat aullaŋarut apqutinun aasii katitchiaqsivḷutiŋ iluqaiññik kasukkaġmiŋnik, piḷuktuallu nakuuruallu ativlugich, tavraasi katirrusiqivik igluqpak inaiŋaruq aiyuġaaqtauruanik.

english: But when the king came in to see the wedding guests, he saw a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
inupiaq: Tavra umialgum isiqami qiñiġiaqługich aiyugaaqtauruat, tautuŋagaa iñuk tavrani katirrusiqutinik annuġaaŋaitchuaq.

english: And he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ But he had nothing to say.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Avilaitqaan, qanuqłutin isiqpich uvuŋa katirrusiqunmik annuġaaġaluaġnak. Tavra iñuum kiuŋiḷḷakkaa.

english: Then the king said to his attendants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth!’
inupiaq: Tavrani umialik uqallaŋaruq kivganun, Qiḷiqsruqsiuŋ argaŋigun isigaŋigullu, aasii anillugu taaġniqsrauruamun. Tavrani taaġniqsrauruami iñuich qianiaqtut suli tiriqtinniaġaich kigutitiŋ.

english: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq iñugiaktuat aiyugaaqtaugaluaqtut atanniqsimatquvlugich Taavrumuŋa qiḷaŋmiittuamun, aglaan iñukitchuat piksraqtaagurut.

english: Then the Pharisees went out and planned together to entrap him with his own words.
inupiaq: Tavrani Pharisees aullaqłutiŋ sivunniuŋarut uuktuġukługu Jesus apiqqutinik.

english: They sent to him their disciples along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful, and teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You do not court anyone’s favor because you show no partiality.
inupiaq: Tavra tilisiŋarut iḷaŋiññik iḷitchitquramiŋ ilaanun, piqasiqł̣ugich Herod-kuayaanik uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷisaurrii, iḷisimarugut pitqiksiġautaisilaaġnik, suli iḷisaurrirutin iḷumun ittuamik God-im pitqutaanik iñuŋmun suliqutigiugasuŋaġnagu qanuq iñuich isumaniaqtilaaŋat, qanuq piqutigiŋitkiñ iñuum surautilaaŋa.

english: Tell us then, what do you think? Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
inupiaq: Uqallauttutigut qanuq isumatilaaġnik. Paaqsaaŋava uvagut pitquraptiŋni naagga nalaunŋava akiḷiiruni taxes-nik Caesar-mun Rome-miut umialgannun?

english: But Jesus realized their evil intentions and said, “Hypocrites! Why are you testing me?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, iḷisimavlugu pigiitchuakun sivunniuġutaat uqallaŋaruq, Summan uuktuqpisiŋa? Ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii.

english: Show me the coin used for the tax.” So they brought him a denarius.
inupiaq: Tautuktitchiŋa maniŋmik tax-iutiksramik. Tavra qaġġirriŋagaat maniuramik.

english: Jesus said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai, Kiñauna maniurami, atqalu?

english: They replied, “Caesar’s.” He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
inupiaq: Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Caesar. Tavrali Jesus uqallautiŋagai, aitchuutigisigik Caesar-mun sut pigikkaŋi Caesar-m aasii God-mun sut pigikkaŋi God-im.

english: Now when they heard this they were stunned, and they left him and went away.
inupiaq: Tusaakamirruŋ taamna, aliuŋarut, aasii qimakługu aullaŋarut.

english: The same day Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to him and asked him,
inupiaq: Taavrumani suli uvlumi Sadducees qaiŋarut Jesus-mun, uqaġuuruat aŋŋisaiññivḷugu, aasii apiġivlugu apiqqunmik.

english: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and father children for his brother.’
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrii, Moses iḷisaurriŋaruq inna, Iñuk tuqukpan miqłiqsigaluaġnani, aniqataanun tuvaaqasiutitquvlugu uiḷgaqtuaq, aasii qitunġiuġluni aniqatini pisilugu.

english: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children he left his wife to his brother.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat malġuuŋarut aniqatigiich iñuuŋaruat akunnaptiŋni. Aŋayukłiq nuliaŋaruq aasii tuquvluni miqłiqsigaluaġnani, qimaŋagaa nuliani aniqanmiñun.

english: The second did the same, and the third, down to the seventh.
inupiaq: Tuquŋammiuq suli tuglia, piŋayuaglu, kiisaimma tallimat malġuk aniqatigiich tuquvut.

english: Last of all, the woman died.
inupiaq: Taapkua iluqaġmiŋ kiŋuatigun aġnaq tuquŋaruq.

english: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married her.”
inupiaq: Aŋŋiviŋmi, nallianun tallimat malġuuruat tuvaaqasiutiniaqpa? Iluqaġmiŋ tuvaaqatigianiŋagaat.

english: Jesus answered them, “You are deceived, because you don’t know the scriptures or the power of God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Qanutun killukuaqtigirusi. Killukuaġutigigiksi naluvlugich Bible uqaluŋich, God-tivlu suaŋŋataa.

english: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
inupiaq: Aŋigumiŋ tuqqunmiñ, aŋutillu aġnallu katitinniaŋitchut, aglaan inniaqtut isaġuliktitun qiḷaŋmiittuatun.

english: Now as for the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God,
inupiaq: Aasii sivuniġilugu uqaqta tuquŋaruat aŋiñiaġniŋat. Taiguaŋaitpisi qaŋaunnii qanuq God-im uqaluanik ilivsiññun? Ilaa uqallaŋaruq,

english: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living!”
inupiaq: Uvaŋa God-igigaaŋa Abraham, God-igigaaŋalu Isaac-gum, God-igimmigaaŋasuli Jacob-gum. Taapkua iñuich iñuurut suli. Ilaa God-auŋitchuq tuquruanun, aglaan God-igigaat iñuuruat.

english: When the crowds heard this, they were amazed at his teaching.
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich tusaakamirruŋ taamna kamasuuttaqaŋarut iḷisaurrutiŋiñik.

english: Now when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they assembled together.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees tusaakamiŋ Jesus-mun nipaiġiñivḷugich Sadducees, kasimaŋarut.

english: And one of them, an expert in religious law, asked him a question to test him:
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋata iḷisaurrauruam pitquranik apiġiŋagaa apiqqunmik uuktuaqsaqługu.

english: “Teacher, which commandment in the law is the greatest?”
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrii, nalliat qaukłiuva pitqurat iluqaiññiñ?

english: Jesus said to him, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Piviuttaġipiaqsaġiñ Ataniq God-igikkan, piviuttaġilugu iḷuŋniñ, iluqaaniḷu iñuuniaġniġni, iluqaaniḷu isumaniġni.

english: This is the first and greatest commandment.
inupiaq: Taamna tavra kamanaġniqsraq pitquraq.

english: The second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
inupiaq: Suli igḷua tainnainmiuq, Piviuttaġisaġiñ siḷalliñ iliktun iḷiḷugu.

english: All the law and the prophets depend on these two commandments.”
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun, iḷisaurrutiŋiḷḷu uqaqtiŋisa God-im kaŋiqaqtut taapkuŋniŋa malġugnik pitquragnik.

english: While the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus asked them a question:
inupiaq: Tavra kasimapkaqługich Pharisees atautchimi, Jesus apiġiŋagai apiqqunmik.

english: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said, “The son of David.”
inupiaq: Qanuq isummatigivisiuŋ Christ? Kia kiŋuniġivauŋ? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, kiŋuniġigaa David-gum.

english: He said to them, “How then does David by the Spirit call him ‘Lord,’ saying,
inupiaq: Ilaan apiġiŋagai, Qanuqłunimi David, puttuqsripkaġmani ilitqusiġiksuam, tuqłuŋavauŋ Ataniġmiñik, uqaqłuni,

english: ‘The Lord said to my lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
until I put your enemies under your feet”’?
If David then calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
No one was able to answer him a word, and from that day on no one dared to question him any longer.
Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq iñusalaŋnun iḷitchitquramiñullu,

english: “The experts in the law and the Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat.
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrit pitquranik Pharisees-lu ataniġnaqutiqaqtut iḷisaurriyumiñaqłutiŋ pitquranik qaisauruanik Moses-kun,

english: Therefore pay attention to what they tell you and do it. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they teach.
inupiaq: tavraasii kamagiraksraġigisi tuvraġlugiḷḷu supayaanik iḷisautikpasi. Aglaan pisuŋaġnasi piraŋiññik, qanuq alġaqsruisuugaluaqtut tuvralaitkaich alġaqsruutitiŋ.

english: They tie up heavy loads, hard to carry, and put them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing even to lift a finger to move them.
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrisuurut God-im pitquraŋiñik siġḷiġnaqsivḷugich iñuŋnun kamaksriñiksraŋat iluqaiññik, ikayuġniaġnagich suuramikunnii kamagitqulugich God-im pitquraŋi. Ikayulaitkaich.

english: They do all their deeds to be seen by people, for they make their phylacteries wide and their tassels long.
inupiaq: Iliŋich piut iluqaiññik tautuqusaaqsiññaqłutiŋ iñuŋnun. Tautuksigik qanutun aŋitigirut qauġmiutaŋich taliġmiutaŋiḷḷu kiguunnaurat imaqaqtuat Bible uqaluuraŋiññik. Qanutun niviŋaniqtutigimmiut nigraŋich akuŋiññi tautuqusaaqłutiŋ kamaginiḷugich God-im pitquraŋi.

english: They love the place of honor at banquets and the best seats in the synagogues
inupiaq: Suli inigillatugaich kamanaqtuat aquppiutat niqinaqimmata, salliġñiglu aquppiutaksrallatummiut aŋaiyyuviŋñi.

english: and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces, and to have people call them ‘Rabbi.’
inupiaq: Suli paġlatquturullu kasimmaviŋñi inini, suli taitqusuurut iḷisaurriñik iñuŋnun.

english: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher and you are all brothers.
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi inniaŋitchusi iliŋisitun. Tairauniaŋitchusi iḷisaurriñik, qanuq atautchimik iḷisaurriqaqtusi, aasii ilivsi iluqasi aniqatigiiksusi.

english: And call no one your ‘father’ on earth, for you have one Father, who is in heaven.
inupiaq: Suli tuqłuġnagu iñupayaaq aapavsiññik nunami, qanuq atautchimik Aapaqaqtusi, qiḷaŋmiittuamik.

english: Nor are you to be called ‘teacher,’ for you have one teacher, the Christ.
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii tairaunasi aullarriñik, qanuq atausiuruq aullarriksi, Christ-guruaq.

english: The greatest among you will be your servant.
inupiaq: Iñuk kamanaġniqsrauruaq akunnavsiññi kivgaġiniaġiksi.

english: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa kamanaqsiḷiqtuaq inmiñik kamanaiqsauniaqtuq, suli kiñaliqaa kamasaaŋitchuaq inmiñi kamanaqsiḷiqtauniaqtuq.

english: “But woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You keep locking people out of the kingdom of heaven! For you neither enter nor permit those trying to enter to go in.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi, iḷisaurriich pitquranik Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Ittusi pitchiġiiyaqsimammatun upkuaŋa atanniqsimaviata Taavruma qiḷaŋmiittuam, qanuq ilivsi atanniqsimatquŋitchusi God-mun, suli iñuich atanniqsimatqugaluaqtuat pitchaiḷiraġisi.

english: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You cross land and sea to make one convert, and when you get one, you make him twice as much a child of hell as yourselves!
inupiaq: [Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurriich pitquranik, Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanuq ivayaqtuġuugisi uiḷgaŋaruat, tigligaivḷugiḷḷu igluŋiññik, aasii taimma maniugaqsivḷusi nakuurualivḷusi takiruanik aŋaiyyuvlusi. Taamna pisigilugu, tatavsausiaksraqsi pigiił̣haaġniaqtuq.]

english: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple is bound by nothing. But whoever swears by the gold of the temple is bound by the oath.’
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurriich pitquranik, Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii, qanuq kukiḷuktusi immakullu nunakullu atausiuramik-unnii mumiksitchisukłusi. Aasii mumiksitanikavsiuŋ, ilivsi pasirauyumiñaqsiḷaavsaaqsiññaġiksi nagliksaaġviŋmuŋniksramun ilivsisuttauq.

english: Blind fools! Which is greater, the gold or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi, ayauŋaruatun aullarrit. Iḷisaurrisuurusi kiñaliqaa unniqsuqłiigumi ukpiġnaqsiḷiġlugu atuġlugu uqaluk aŋaiyyuvikpak, pasiñaġumiñaiññivḷugu taŋŋiŋitpagu unniqsuqłiisini. Suli iḷisaurrimmiusi kiñaliqaa aŋiuqsiyumiñaiññivḷugu unniqsuqłiiñmiñik atuqpagu uqaluk manik kaviqsuaq suġauttaġikkaŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaum.

english: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar is bound by nothing. But if anyone swears by the gift on it he is bound by the oath.’
inupiaq: Ilivsi isumalluaġiitchuasii. Sivuniqsiḷguitkisi iḷisaurrutisi. Nalliak naumałhaaqpa? Manik kaviqsuaq naagga aŋaiyyuvikpak maniŋmik kaviqsuamik ilaaguaqsiḷḷaruaq God-mun?

english: You are blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
inupiaq: Aasii iḷisaurrisuummiusisuli, Iñuk kiñaliqaa unniqsuqłiikpan ukpiġnaqsiḷiġlugu atuġlugu uqaluk ikipkaivik, pasiñaġumiñaiññivḷugu taŋŋiŋitpagu unniqsuqłiisini. Suli iḷisaurrimmiusi kiñaliqaa aŋiuqsiyumiñaiññivḷugu unniqsuqłiunmiñik atuqpagu uqaluk, aitchuutauruq ikipkaiviŋmi.

english: So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
inupiaq: Qanutun sivuniqsiḷguisigirusi iḷisaurrutivsiññik. Nalliak naumałhaaqpa? Aitchuun naagga ikipkaivik ilaaguaqsiḷḷaruaq aitchuunmik God-mun?

english: And whoever swears by the temple swears by it and the one who dwells in it.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuum atuqamiuŋ uqaluk ikipkaivik unniqsuqłiikami, tasamma taputigai aitchuutit ikipkaiviŋmiittuat.

english: And whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and the one who sits on it.
inupiaq: Suli iñuum unniqsuqłiikami atuqługu uqaluk aŋaiyyuvikpak, taputimmigaa God ittuaq tavrani.

english: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You give a tenth of mint, dill, and cumin, yet you neglect what is more important in the law – justice, mercy, and faithfulness! You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
inupiaq: Suli iñuum unniqsuqłiikami atuqługu uqaluk qiḷak, unniqsuqłiiruq taputivlugu God-im aquppiutaŋa taamnalu aquppiruaq tavrani.

english: Blind guides! You strain out a gnat yet swallow a camel!
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurriich pitquranik, Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Ilivsi quliŋŋuġutiŋiññik mikiniqsraqpiatchiat nauriavsi niġiñaqtuat aitchuisuurusi God-mun, aasii kamagiŋił̣ł̣ugich naumałhaaqtuat iḷisaurrutiŋich pitqurat, pitqiksiġautairrun nagliktuullu, ukpiġnaullu. Taapkua piraksraġiŋagaluaġisi, allallu tamatkua piḷugich.

english: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
inupiaq: Piḷġusiqsi tainnainman, iñuktun ittusi imiksriuqtuatun qupilġuiyautituġniallaan aasii iivḷugu pikukturuaq kakakti. Iḷumun ayauŋarusi aullarrit.

english: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup, so that the outside may become clean too!
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurriich pitquranik, Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanuq ittusi qallugauratun puggutauratullu salummaqtauruatun qaałhiñaŋich, iḷuvsiññi imaqallavsi salumaitchuamik ivayaqtuunmik piḷḷatunmiglu.

english: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs that look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of the bones of the dead and of everything unclean.
inupiaq: Ilivsi ayauŋaruasii Pharisees, salummaqqaaqsiuŋ iḷua qallugauram, aasii siḷataa salumaniaġmiuq.

english: In the same way, on the outside you look righteous to people, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurriich pitquranik Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanuq ittusi qatiqsaqtatun iḷuvviviksun, siḷatiŋich qiñiyunaqsaqługich, aasii iḷuanni siḷivinŋavlutiŋ iḷuvġich sauniŋiññik iluqaaniglu auruamik.

english: “Woe to you, experts in the law and you Pharisees, hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq ilivsi qaałhiñavsigun qiññaqaġmiusi nalaunŋaruaguvlusi iñuŋnun, aasii iḷuvsiññi siḷivinŋarusi ukpiŋŋuaġutinik piḷuutiniglu.

english: And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have participated with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi iḷisaurrit pitquranik, Pharisees-lu, ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanuq iḷuvviviḷiuqtusi nakuusivḷugich uqaqtiŋiñun God-im, suli qiñiyunaqsaqługich nappaqutaŋich iñuich nalaunŋaruat,

english: By saying this you testify against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
inupiaq: uqaqłusi, Iñuuqatauŋagupta taimani maŋŋuuptiŋnun, piqasiqsuutiyumiñaiñŋagaluaqtugut ilaiññun tuquġaiñiġmi uqaqtiŋiñik God-im.

english: Fill up then the measure of your ancestors!
inupiaq: Tainna uqaqavsi, ilivsiññik iḷaurualirusi maŋŋuuvsiññun iñuaqtuqtuanun uqaqtiŋiñik God-im.

english: You snakes, you offspring of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?
inupiaq: Kiasii naatitchiuŋ maŋŋuuvsi aullaġniikkaŋat.

english: “For this reason I am sending you prophets and wise men and experts in the law, some of whom you will kill and crucify, and some you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town,
inupiaq: Ilivsi nimiġiat. Ilivsi piayaaŋich tuqunaqaqtuat nimiġiat. Qanuġlugu naŋaġumiñaipiaġiksi nagliksaaġviŋmuktitauniksraq.

english: so that on you will come all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautigivsi. Tilisiñiaqtuŋa ilivsiññun uqaqtiŋiñik God-im isumaturuaniglu iñuŋnik, iḷisaurriñiglu. Iḷaŋich tuqunniaġisi kikiaktuutilugiḷḷu aŋarrauranun, aasiisuli iḷaŋich ipiġaqtuġniaġisi aŋaiyyuvivsiññi, suli pigruqtitaġlugich nunaaqqiñiñ nunaaqqiñun.

english: I tell you the truth, this generation will be held responsible for all these things!
inupiaq: Ilivsi iñuich tatavsaqtauyumausi iñuaqtuġnivsigun nalaunŋaruanik iñuŋnik iñuktauniŋaniñqaŋa patchisaitchuam Abel-gum iñuktauniŋanunaglaan Zechariah-m Barachiah-m iġñiŋata, iñuktaġikkavsi aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, akunġagni inivḷu ilaaguaqtauruam God-mun, ikipkaiviuvlu.

english: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have longed to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would have none of it!
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, tamatkunuuna iluqaisigun tatavsaqtauniaqtusi ilivsi iñuuruasii paŋmapak.

english: Look, your house is left to you desolate!
inupiaq: Jerusalem-miut. Yaqhii Jerusalem-miuguruasii, tuquġairuasii uqaqtiŋiñik God-im, uyaġagniglu miḷḷuuqługich tamatkua God-im tiliraŋi ilivsiññun. Qanutun akulaisigilugu katitchumiñaġaluaġaġigivsi iluqasi atautchimun, tiŋmiatun katitchiruatun piayaamiñik isaqquŋmi ataaŋnun, aasii pisulaitchusi.

english: For I tell you, you will not see me from now until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
inupiaq: Uvva, iglusi suksraaqtaupiallagniaqtut suġauttaiqsaulutiglu.

english: Now as Jesus was going out of the temple courts and walking away, his disciples came to show him the temple buildings.
inupiaq: Jesus qimaaqsimmagu aŋaiyyuvikpak, iḷitchitquraisa qaivḷutiŋ uvyaqiŋagaat aŋaiyyuvikpaum iniŋiññik.

english: And he said to them, “Do you see all these things? I tell you the truth, not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Tamarra tautukpisigik tamatkua iluqaisa? Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, uyaġaqaġumiñaitchuq atautchimikunnii qalliqaqtuamiktauq allamik uyaġagmik ulġutauyumiñaitchuamik.

english: As he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately and said, “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aquppipkaqtillugu Iġġiani Olives, iḷitchitqurat ullaŋagaat iñuił̣aami uqaqłutiŋ, Uqallauttutigut, qakugu taamna piñiaqpa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun? Suli sumik nalunaiñŋutaqaġniaqpa qaiñiksran, isuksraŋalu nunam?

english: Jesus answered them, “Watch out that no one misleads you.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Qaunagisitchi sagluqipkaġnasi.

english: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will mislead many.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñugiaktuat iñuich qaiñiaqtut uvaŋauŋŋuaqtuat uqaġlutiŋ Uvaŋa Christ-guruŋa, aasii iñugiaktuat sagluqilugich.

english: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. Make sure that you are not alarmed, for this must happen, but the end is still to come.
inupiaq: Tusaaguvsi aŋuyaktuanik, qanitkaluaqpata naagga uŋasikkaluaqpata, iłuiḷḷiuġutiginagich. Tamatkua piruksraurut, aglaan sivuniġiŋitkaat isuksraq tikiññiḷugu.

english: For nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
inupiaq: Nunauruat aŋuyagniaqtut allanun nunauruanun. Suli umialiqaqtuat aŋuyagniaqtut allanun umialiqaqtuanun. Nunasuli aularaġaġniaqtuq sumipayaaq, iñuiḷḷu paniġniaqtut niqaiḷḷiuġlutiŋ.

english: All these things are the beginning of birth pains.
inupiaq: Tamarra tamatkua aullaqisaaŋich isumaaġutit piruksrauruat Christ-guruaq qaiŋaiñŋaan.

english: “Then they will hand you over to be persecuted and will kill you. You will be hated by all the nations because of my name.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuich tigutaaġniaġaasi tatavsaqtautqulusi, tuqullusiḷu. Suli iñupayaat uumiginiaġaasi pisigiluŋa.

english: Then many will be led into sin, and they will betray one another and hate one another.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñugiaktuat iñuich ukpiġutaiġñiaqtut, suli aitchuutigiraġautilutiŋ avanmun, uumikkutiliġḷutiglu avanmun.

english: And many false prophets will appear and deceive many,
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq iñugiaktuat uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuat God-mun iñukpalliġñiaġmiut aasii sagluqilugich iñugiaktuat iñuich.

english: and because lawlessness will increase so much, the love of many will grow cold.
inupiaq: Suli pisigilugu piḷuusiqutim iñugiaksiñiŋa, iñugiaktuat iñuich piviuttaqqutaiqsaiññaġniaqtut.

english: But the person who endures to the end will be saved.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuk igḷutuutiruaq nagliksaaqtitauniġmik iñuuniqtutilaamisun, annaurrauniaqtuq.

english: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached throughout the whole inhabited earth as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
inupiaq: Aasii manna tusaayugaaġiksuaq God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun alġaqsruutauniaqtuq iluqaani nunapayaami, quliaqtuaguluni nunapayaanun, aasii tavrani nunam isua tikiññiaqtuq.

english: “So when you see the abomination of desolation – spoken about by Daniel the prophet – standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),
inupiaq: Taiguaqtuaq iñuk ukuniŋa kaŋiqsiḷi. Tautugniaġiksi naġġutchagnapiaġataqtuaq salumaiḷḷisauluni inillaummiruaq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi iniksraġiŋisamiñi, Daniel-gum uqaqtaata God-im uqautigiŋakkaŋa.

english: then those in Judea must flee to the mountains.
inupiaq: Tautukkuvsiuŋ taamna, tavrani tamatkua Judea-miittuat pigruġlich iġġiñun.

english: The one on the roof must not come down to take anything out of his house,
inupiaq: Iñuksuli aniiqsuaqtuaq iglumi qaaŋani iñaviqqutchiġñani atqaġumi saagaksraisuqsaġluni sumik iglumi iḷuaniñ.

english: and the one in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq iñuk nautchiaqaġviŋmi savaktuaq iglumiñuŋnani saakkiutiyaqtuġuglugu annuġaani.

english: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
inupiaq: Taipkua uvlut tikitpata, yaqhiikkaluaq aġnaq siŋaiyauniġumi, miqłiqtuuraqaqtuaġlu piḷgusiŋaitchuanik.

english: Pray that your flight may not be in winter or on a Sabbath.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyusitchi pigruġniksraqsi ukiukuaquŋiḷḷugu naagga Savaiññikun.

english: For then there will be great suffering unlike anything that has happened from the beginning of the world until now, or ever will happen.
inupiaq: Taipkunanikiataŋ uvluni iñuich nagliksaałhamaaġniaqtut qaŋapaŋmiñ God-imqaŋa savaŋmagu nuna. Aasii tainnatun nagliksaaqtigitqikkumiñaiñmiut aquagun taavruma.

english: And if those days had not been cut short, no one would be saved. But for the sake of the elect those days will be cut short.
inupiaq: Aasii Atanġum iñukłiḷaaŋisuaqpagich taipkua uvlut, kiñaliqaa iñuuyumiñaitchuq. Aglaan pisigilugich God-im piksraqtaani ilaan iñukłiḷaaġniaġai uvlut.

english: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘There he is!’ do not believe him.
inupiaq: Tavraasii kialiqaa uqallautikpasi inna, Tautuksiuŋ, uvva Christ, naagga, Ikka ikaniittuq, ukpiġinagu.

english: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
inupiaq: Qanuq Christ-guŋŋuaqtuat uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuallu God-mun iñukpalliġñiaqtut savaglutiŋ aliuġnaqtuanik kamanaqtuanik nalupqinaiġñiaqługu kiutilaaqtiŋ, asiñuutiniaqsaalugich God-im piksraqtaaŋi, sagluqiyumiñaġumisigik.

english: Remember, I have told you ahead of time.
inupiaq: Uvva, kilikkivsi piyumaaqtuat sivuanni.

english: So then, if someone says to you, ‘Look, he is in the wilderness,’ do not go out, or ‘Look, he is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe him.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuich uqallautikpasi, Amma, Christ nunagluktuamiittuq, ullaksaalugnagu. Uqallakpata, Amma, iriqsimaruq uvani, ukpiġinagu.

english: For just like the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaiñiaqtuq igniġuuqpatittuatun paaŋŋamiñ, aasii qaummaġiksivḷugu ualiñaaq.

english: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.
inupiaq: Sumipayaaq siḷu itpan, tavrani inniaġmiut tiŋmiaqpaich kasimalutiŋ.

english: “Immediately after the suffering of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will be shaken.
inupiaq: Tavra taipkunani uvluni, pianikpan taamna iłuiḷḷiuġutiqpak, siqiñiq taaqsiñiaqtuq, tatqiġḷu qaummaġiŋaiġñiaqtuq. Suli uvluġiat katagniaqtut, suli qaummatit siḷamiittuat uniuqtinniaqtut inimiŋniñ.

english: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man arriving on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
inupiaq: Tavrani nalunaiñŋutaŋa Iġñiŋata Iñuum niptaġniaqtuq qiḷaŋmi. Tavraniasii iluqaġmiŋ iñupayaaŋi nunam isumaaqpagniaqtut, tautukkumirruŋ Iġñiŋa Iñuum qairuaq nuvuyaŋigun qiḷaum, suaŋŋatiqaġluni qaumaniqpaqaġluniḷu.

english: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet blast, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
inupiaq: Aasii kamanaqtuaq nipauqłuktaun nivliqpan atautchimuquriḷuni, ilaan tiliñiaġai isaġuliŋni, aasii ilaisa katinniaġaich ilaan piksraqtaaŋi sumiḷḷiqaa nunapayauraniñ.

english: “Learn this parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
inupiaq: Fig-nik siiġñaqaqtuamiñ napaaqtumiñ iḷitchisitchi. Qisiqsiutiŋi qituglimmata, akutuqpalivḷuniḷu, iḷisimarusi upinġam qallisilaaŋanik.

english: So also you, when you see all these things, know that he is near, right at the door.
inupiaq: Tavra ilivsi tainnatuttauq tautukkuvsigik tamatkua nalaurraqsikpata, iḷisimaniaqtusi Iġñiŋa Iñuum qallisilaaŋanik qallipiaġataqłuni.

english: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ukua iñuich tuquanigniaŋitchut iluqaisa tamatkua nalaunŋaunnagich.

english: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
inupiaq: Qiḷaglu nunalu piiġñiaqtuk, aglaan uqalutka piiġumiñaitchut.

english: “But as for that day and hour no one knows it – not even the angels in heaven – except the Father alone.
inupiaq: Iñupayaam nalugaa taimña uvluq ikarraġlu tamatkua nalaurviksrautaat. Isaġulgitchunnii qiḷaŋmiittuat, Iġñiŋatalu Iñuum, nalugaat. Aapam kisimi iḷisimagaa.

english: For just like the days of Noah were, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
inupiaq: Iñuich iñuuniaġusiatiktun Noah iñuumman, iñuich iñuusiqaġniaġmiut Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaikpan.

english: For in those days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark.
inupiaq: Qanuq taipkunani uvluni sivuani uliqpaum iñuich niġigayuktut, imiġayuktullu, katirrusiqisuurullu, uvlumunaglaan Noah-m isiġvianun umiaqpaŋmun,

english: And they knew nothing until the flood came and took them all away. It will be the same at the coming of the Son of Man.
inupiaq: sumik naluŋarut piyumaaqtuamik uliqpaŋmun, pisaġilġataqtillutiŋ iluqaġmiŋ. Tainnatun inniaqtuq qaiñiŋa Iġñiŋata Iñuum.

english: Then there will be two men in the field; one will be taken and one left.
inupiaq: Tavra iññuk malġuk nautchiaqaġviŋmiinniaqtuk, igḷua tigurauniaqtuq, aasii igḷua qimaktauluni.

english: There will be two women grinding grain with a mill; one will be taken and one left.
inupiaq: Aġnak malġuk palauvaksriuġniaqtuk palauvviviŋmi, igḷua tigurauniaqtuq, aasii igḷua qimaktauluni.

english: “Therefore stay alert, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
inupiaq: Quviqtaiḷisitchiasii, qanuq iḷisimaŋitchusi uvluanik Atanivsi qaġġiviksraŋan.

english: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have been alert and would not have let his house be broken into.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷisimalugu una. Igluqpiraqti iḷisimaŋagumi suqpatigun unnuami tigligayuktim qaiñiaqtilaaŋanik, siqunayaitchuq, aasii igluni tigligayuktimun siqumutiluni isiqtinŋiḷḷugu.

english: Therefore you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq ilivsi itqanaitchuksraummiusi, qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaiñiaqtuq ikarrami niġiugvigiŋisavsiññi.

english: “Who then is the faithful and wise slave, whom the master has put in charge of his household, to give the other slaves their food at the proper time?
inupiaq: Kiuniaqpaasii ukpiġnaqtuaguvluni isumaturuaguvluniḷu kivgaq? Taamnauniaqtuq kivgaq atanġata qaukłiḷiutiniakkaŋa allanun kivganun niqiksritqulutiŋ piñaqsikpan.

english: Blessed is that slave whom the master finds at work when he comes.
inupiaq: Quviasugli taamna kivgaq atanġata qaigumi paqinniaqtaŋa tainna savaktuagulugu.

english: I tell you the truth, the master will put him in charge of all his possessions.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ilaan atanniutiniaġaa iluqaiññun suġaliġmiñun.

english: But if that evil slave should say to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’
inupiaq: Aglaan taamna piḷuktuaq kivgaq isumaaqsigumi inna, Ataniġaimña qaiḷḷaiġutiruq,

english: and he begins to beat his fellow slaves and to eat and drink with drunkards,
inupiaq: aasii anaumiaqsiḷugich kivgauqatini, niġimmiuquvva imiqatigivlugiḷḷu imiqtit,

english: then the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not foresee,
inupiaq: atanġa taavruma kivgam qaiñiaqtuq uvlumi niġiugiŋisilluni ilaanun, ikarramiḷu nalukkaŋani.

english: and will cut him in two, and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
inupiaq: Aasii atanġata qaigumi tatavsapiaġataġniaġaa, piqasiutilugu ukpiŋŋuaqtuanun. Tavrani iñuich qianiaqtut tiriqtinniaġaiḷḷu kigutitiŋ.

english: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
inupiaq: Taivrumani uvlumi, iñuich atanniqsimapkaqtuat Taavrumuŋa qiḷaŋmiittuamun inniaqtut qulitun niviaqsiatun, tiguvlugich qullisiŋ aullaqtuatun paaqsaqługu uiksraun.

english: Five of the virgins were foolish, and five were wise.
inupiaq: Tallimat taapkunani isumatupiaŋitchuat, aasii tallimattauq isumaturuaguvlutiŋ.

english: When the foolish ones took their lamps, they did not take extra olive oil with them.
inupiaq: Isumatupiaŋitchuat pikamisigiŋ qullisiŋ, uqsritqiutiksraiḷaġniqsut.

english: But the wise ones took flasks of olive oil with their lamps.
inupiaq: Aglaan isumaturualli uqsritqiutiksraligaaġniġaich qullisiŋ.

english: When the bridegroom was delayed a long time, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
inupiaq: Tavra uiksraun qaiḷḷaiġutipkaqługu niviaqsiat nayaŋaġaluaqamiŋ siquŋarut.

english: But at midnight there was a shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom is here! Come out to meet him.’
inupiaq: Tavra unnuaq qitiqqaġman nivliqsut, Marra uiksraun. Qaisitchi paaqsiuŋ.

english: Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
inupiaq: Tavra qulit niviaqsiat iluqaġmiŋ makinŋarut aasii tatqikł̣ugich qullisiŋ.

english: The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
inupiaq: Tavra isumatupiaŋitchuat uqallaŋarut isumaturuanun, uqsriutiksritchigut. Qullivut marra qamiaqsirut.

english: ‘No,’ they replied. ‘There won’t be enough for you and for us. Go instead to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
inupiaq: Isumaturuagutiŋisa kiugiññaŋagaich, Iḷaanniuvagut naamaniaŋitkisiuraaġmiugut uvaptiŋnullu ilivsiññullu. Aullaqsiññaġitchi tuniaksraliŋnun aasii tauqsiġḷusi uqsruksravsiññik.

english: But while they had gone to buy it, the bridegroom arrived, and those who were ready went inside with him to the wedding banquet. Then the door was shut.
inupiaq: Tavra isumatupiaŋitchuat niviaqsiat tauqsiġiaqtillugich uqsriutiksramiŋnik uiksraun qaiŋaruq, aasii taapkua tallimat itqanaitchuat isumaturuat isiqatigillaksiññaqługu katirrusiqinikun niqinaqiniaqtuanun, aasii upkuaq umikługu.

english: Later, the other virgins came too, saying, ‘Lord, lord! Let us in!’
inupiaq: Aquvatigulli alġaiŋich niviaqsiat qaiŋammiut. Ququulaŋarut, Ataniiq, Ataniiq, upkuiġutisigut.

english: But he replied, ‘I tell you the truth, I do not know you!’
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Nalupiaġivsi.

english: Therefore stay alert, because you do not know the day or the hour.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Quviqtaiḷisitchi, qanuq nalugiksi uvluq naagga ikarraq Iġñiŋan Iñuum qaġġiviksraŋa.

english: “For it is like a man going on a journey, who summoned his slaves and entrusted his property to them.
inupiaq: Taivrumani uvlumi, iñuich atanniqsimapkaqtuat Taavrumuŋa qiḷaŋmiittuamun inniaqtut kivgaŋisun iñuum aullaaqsiruam. Qaitquŋagai kivgani aasii qaunaksriḷiutivlugich suġauttamiñun.

english: To one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.
inupiaq: Iñullaa aitchuŋagaa piḷḷatilaallaaŋatun. Atausiq kivgaq aitchuŋagaa 5,000 taalanik. Tuglia aitchuŋagaa 2,000 taalanik. Aasii allasuli 1,000 taalanik. Aasii aullaqłuni.

english: The one who had received five talents went off right away and put his money to work and gained five more.
inupiaq: Taamna kivgaq aitchuusiaqaqtuaq 5,000 taalanik aullaqłuni tavrauvvaa tauqsiġñiutigiŋagai manniusiani, aasii piññautigivlugich 5,000 taalavsaanik.

english: In the same way, the one who had two gained two more.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq, taamna tugliuruaq kivgaq aitchuusiaqaqtuaq 2,000 taalanik piññaŋaruq 2,000 taalavsaanik.

english: But the one who had received one talent went out and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money in it.
inupiaq: Aglaan taamna kivgaq aitchuusiaqaŋaruaq 1,000 taalanik aullaŋaruq, nivakługu nuna iriŋagai ataniġmi maniŋi.

english: After a long time, the master of those slaves came and settled his accounts with them.
inupiaq: Tavra sulluataġman atanġat taapkua kivgat utiŋaruq aasii makpiġarriqutiaqsivḷugich.

english: The one who had received the five talents came and brought five more, saying, ‘Sir, you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.’
inupiaq: Tavra taamna kivgaq aitchuusiaqaŋaruaq 5,000 taalanik saavinŋaruq, qaitchivḷugu 5,000 taalavsaanik. Ataniiq, qaitchiŋakkaġma 5,000 taalanik, uvva piññavsaaqtuŋa 5,000 taalavsaanik.

english: His master answered, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful in a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
inupiaq: Ilaan atanġata uqallautiŋagaa, Piḷḷuataqtutin, nakuuruatiin ukpiġnaqtuatiillu kivgaaq. Ukpiġnaŋarutin aŋalatchiñipkun manił̣auranik, inillagniaġikpiñ aŋalatchiḷḷasiḷutin manisalagnik. Qaiḷutin quviasuqatigiyaqtuŋŋa.

english: The one with the two talents also came and said, ‘Sir, you entrusted two talents to me. See, I have gained two more.’
