inupiaq: Aasiivsauq taamna kivgaq aitchuusiaqaŋaruaġli 2,000 taalanik saavinŋammiuq. Ataniiq, qaitchiŋagiŋma 2,000 taalanik. Uvva piññavsaaqtuŋa 2,000 taalavsaanik.

english: His master answered, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave! You have been faithful with a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
inupiaq: Atanġata uqallautiŋagaa, Piḷḷuataġniqsutin, nakuuruatiin ukpiġnaqtuatiillu kivgaaq. Ukpiġnaŋarutin aŋalatchiñipkun manił̣auranik, inillagniaġikpiñ aŋalatchiḷḷasiḷutin manisalagnik. Qaiḷutin quviasuqatigiyaqtuŋŋa.

english: Then the one who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Sir, I knew that you were a hard man, harvesting where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter seed,
inupiaq: Tavrali kivgaq aitchuusiaqaŋaruaq 1,000 taalanik saavinŋammiuq, aasii uqallakłuni, Ataniiq, iḷisimagikpiñ suamaruatiin iñuk, kivrisuuvlutin palauvaksranik nautchirriġvigiŋaisaġnun, katitchisuuvlutillu palauvaksranik kanġaqsruivigiŋisaġniñ.

english: so I was afraid, and I went and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours.’
inupiaq: Tavraasii sivuuġavluŋa aullaŋaruŋa, aasii iriqługich manisalaktin nunamun. Uvva pisin pigigitin.

english: But his master answered, ‘Evil and lazy slave! So you knew that I harvest where I didn’t sow and gather where I didn’t scatter?
inupiaq: Tavra atanġata kiuŋagaa, Piḷuktuatiin iqiasuuruatillu kivgaaq. Iḷisimaŋagaluaqtutin kivrisuutilaamnik nautchirriġvigiŋaisamnun, suli katitchisuutilaamnik palauvaksranik kanġaqsruivigiŋisamnun.

english: Then you should have deposited my money with the bankers, and on my return I would have received my money back with interest!
inupiaq: Tavra ilivich manitka ikiyumiñaŋagaluaġitin naggutinnagnaqtuamun maniqaġviŋmun, aasii qaiguma aitchuusiaqaġluŋa taapkuniŋa uvaŋa pimñik, naggutiŋiññiglu.

english: Therefore take the talent from him and give it to the one who has ten.
inupiaq: Tavra pisigik taapkua manisalaich ilaaniñ, aasii aitchuutigilugich taavrumuŋa maniqaqtuamun 10,000 taalanik.

english: For the one who has will be given more, and he will have more than enough. But the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa aŋalatchiḷḷuataqtuaq aitchuusiamiñik aitchuusiaqavsaaġniaqtuq, aasii sippaksraqaġmiḷuni. Aglaan taamna naurrutinnaŋitchuaq mikiruuraqunnii pigikkaŋa piiqsauniaqtuq ilaaniñ.

english: And throw that worthless slave into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi una anniqsuutauŋitchuaq kivgaq igitchiuŋ taaġniqsramun. Tavrani iñuich qianiaqtut tiriqtinniaġaiḷḷu kigutitiŋ.

english: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.
inupiaq: Tavra Iġñiŋa Iñuum qaikpan umialiguġluni, piqatigilugich iluqaisa isaġulgich, tavrani ilaa aquvinniaqtuq kamanaqtuani umialgunikun aquppiutamiñi.

english: All the nations will be assembled before him, and he will separate people one from another like a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
inupiaq: Nation-guruat iñupayaat sivuġaanun katinniaqtut, aasii ilaan aviŋniaġai imnaiḷiqiri avgiruatun imnaiñik imnaiñiñ nagruliŋniñ,

english: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan inillagniaġai imnaich taliqpiŋmi tuŋaanun, aglaalli nagruqaqtuat saumiŋmi tuŋaanun.

english: Then the king will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
inupiaq: Tavrani Umialik uqallagniaqtuq taapkunuŋa taliqpiŋmi tuŋaaniittuanun, Qaisitchi, iviġaumakkusiaqaqtuasii Aapamniñ, kiŋuvaannaktaaġisiuŋ God-im atanniqsimavia ini itqanaiyaaguruaq ilivsiññun nunaqaŋa savaagumman.

english: For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,
inupiaq: Qanuq kaaktuaguŋaruŋa aasii niqiksriñŋagivsiŋa. Imiġuksiuŋaruŋa aasii imiksriñŋagivsiŋa. Iglaaguŋammiuŋa aasii paġlaŋagivsiŋa aimaaġvivsiññun.

english: I was naked and you gave me clothing, I was sick and you took care of me, I was in prison and you visited me.’
inupiaq: Annuġaagiñŋaruŋa aasii annuġaaqtinŋagivsiŋa. Naŋinŋaruŋa aasii qaunagiŋagivsiŋa. Tigutaaġviŋmiinŋaruŋa aasii ullaŋagivsiŋa.

english: Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuich nalaunŋaruat kiuniaġaat, Ataniiq, qaŋa tautuŋavisigiñ kaakavich aasii niġipkaqłutin, naagga imiġuktillutin aasii imiqtiłłutin?

english: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or naked and clothe you?
inupiaq: Suli qaŋa tautuŋavisigiñ iglaagukavich aasii paġlavlutin aimaaġvivsiŋñun, naagga annuġaaksraiññavich aasii annuġaaqłutin?

english: When did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’
inupiaq: Suli qaŋa tautuŋavisigiñ naŋinnavich naagga tigutaaġviŋmi innavich, aasii takuvlutin?

english: And the king will answer them, ‘I tell you the truth, just as you did it for one of the least of these brothers or sisters of mine, you did it for me.’
inupiaq: Tavrali Umialgum kiuniaġai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, savaaġikavsiuŋ atautchimununnii naglignaġniqsramun makua aniqatiima iḷaŋannun, ilivsi savaaġiŋagiksi uvamnun.

english: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you accursed, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the devil and his angels!
inupiaq: Tavraliasii ilaan uqallautiniaġai taapkua saumiŋmi tuŋaanniittuat, Aullaġitchi uvamniñ, ilivsi suksraunġiqsauniaqtuasii isuitchuamun igniġmun itqanaiyaaguŋaruamun Tuunġaġmun, isaġuliŋiñullu.

english: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink.
inupiaq: Qanuq kaaktuaguŋaruŋa aasii aitchuŋaitkivsiŋa niqimik, Imiġuksiuŋammiuŋa aasii aitchuŋaitkivsiŋa imiksramnik.

english: I was a stranger and you did not receive me as a guest, naked and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not visit me.’
inupiaq: Iglaaguŋagaluaqtuŋa paġlaŋaitkivsiŋa aimaaġvivsiññun. Annuġaagiḷḷiuŋaruŋa annuġaaksriñŋiñmigivsiŋa. Naŋinŋaruŋa, tigutaaġviŋmiinŋaruŋalu aasii takuŋaitkivsiŋa.

english: Then they too will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not give you whatever you needed?’
inupiaq: Tavraptauq iliŋisa kiuniaġaat, Ataniiq, qaŋa tautuŋavisigiñ kaaktillutin naagga imiġuksiupkaqłutin naagga iglaagupkaqłutin annuġaaksraisillutin naagga naŋinnavich, naagga tigutaaġviŋmi innavich aasii ikayuŋił̣ł̣utin?

english: Then he will answer them, ‘I tell you the truth, just as you did not do it for one of the least of these, you did not do it for me.’
inupiaq: Tavra umialgum kiuniaġai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ikayuġuŋiññavsiuŋ atausiqunnii makua iḷaŋat naglignaqtuat, ikayuġuŋiñŋagivsiŋa.

english: And these will depart into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich tatavsaqtauniaqtut isuitchuamun, aglaalli nalaunŋaruat isuitchuamun iñuuniaqtut.

english: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he told his disciples,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus naannamigich iluqaisa tamatkua iḷisaurrutit, ilaan uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani,

english: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi uvluk malġuk pianikpaŋnik Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun itqaun tikiññiaqtuq, aasii Iġñiŋa Iñuum aitchuutauniaqtuq kikiaktuurrautqulugu aŋarrauramun.

english: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people met together in the palace of the high priest, who was named Caiaphas.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich umialiŋnaŋiḷḷu Jew-guruat katinŋarut igluqpaŋanun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata, atiqaqtuam Caiaphas-mik.

english: They planned to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
inupiaq: Aasii sivunniugaqsivḷutiŋ atautchimi tigutaallasiñiaqsaqługu Jesus nalunautchiḷutiŋ, aasii tuqullugu.

english: But they said, “Not during the feast, so that there won’t be a riot among the people.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallaŋarut, Niqinaqiŋŋaisaaglaan piññagu, tuavaallakpiaqtut iñuich.

english: Now while Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus Bethany-miinman isiġmiupkaqługu igluani Simon kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuam,

english: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of expensive perfumed oil, and she poured it on his head as he was at the table.
inupiaq: aġnaq ullautiŋaruq ilaanun piqaqłuni misuġuqtuunmik uyaġagmik akisupiaġataqtuamik tivraġiksaunmik. Aasii kuviŋagaa Jesus niaquanun, niġipkaqtillugu.

english: When the disciples saw this, they became indignant and said, “Why this waste?
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat tautukamirruŋ, piavsaŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Summan asiñun tivraġiksaun atuqpa?

english: It could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor!”
inupiaq: Qanuq una tivraġiksaun tuniyumiñaŋagaluaqtuq manisalaŋnun, aasii aitchuutigilugich maniich iḷiappauruanun.

english: When Jesus learned of this, he said to them, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a good service for me.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, nalunaigivlugu taamna uqallautiŋagai, Summan isumaaluksaaqpisiuŋ aġnaq? Qanuq savaaqaŋaruq savaalluatapiamik uvamnun.

english: For you will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me!
inupiaq: Ataramik nayuqtigigisi iḷiappauruat, aglaan uvaŋa nayuqtiginiaŋitkivsiŋa ataramik.

english: When she poured this oil on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
inupiaq: Kuvikamiuŋ una tivraġiksaun timimnun savaaġigaa itqanaiyautauvlugu iḷuvġuniksramnun.

english: I tell you the truth, wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, sumipayaaq manna tusaayugaaġiksuaq alġaqsruutaukpan nunapayaani, aġnam savaaġiŋaraa quliaqtuaguniaqtuq itqaummatauluni ilaanun.

english: Then one of the twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋat qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat, atiqaqtuaq Judas Iscariot-mik, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnuŋaruq

english: and said, “What will you give me to betray him into your hands?” So they set out thirty silver coins for him.
inupiaq: aasii uqallakłuni, Sumik aitchuġniaqpisiŋa aitchuutigigupku Jesus ilivsiññun? Tavra akiḷiñŋagaat iñuiññaq qulitun maniŋñik.

english: From that time on, Judas began looking for an opportunity to betray him.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋaaglaan Judas ivaqłiaŋaruq piviksramik aitchuutigisukługu Jesus.

english: Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and said, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
inupiaq: Sivullianni uvluŋisa Niqinaqivium Puvlaksautaitchuamik punniġmik, iḷitchitqurat ullaŋagaat Jesus apiġivlugu, Sumi itqanaiyaquvisigut qulaurrusiqiviŋmi nullautchiġviksraġnik?

english: He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near. I will observe the Passover with my disciples at your house.”’”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Aullaġitchi nalaagun iñuŋmun iniqpaŋmiittuamun, aasii uqallautilugu, Iḷisaurri uqallaktuaq, Ikarraġa tikitchuq, qulaurrusiqiniq niġisukkiga uvaŋalu iḷitchitquratkalu igluŋni.

english: So the disciples did as Jesus had instructed them, and they prepared the Passover.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat piŋarut Jesus piraksriutaatun inmiŋnun, aasii itqanaiyaqługu qulaurrusiqiniġmi nullautchiġviksraqtiŋ.

english: When it was evening, he took his place at the table with the twelve.
inupiaq: Unnuksraaġmagu, Jesus aquvinŋaruq niġġiviŋñun piqatigivlugich qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurani.

english: And while they were eating he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiñiallaġmiŋ, Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, iḷavsi aitchuutiginiaġaaŋa.

english: They became greatly distressed and each one began to say to him, “Surely not I, Lord?”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich isumaalipiaġataŋarut, aasii uqallallaagaqsivḷutiŋ ilaanun, Ataniiq, sivuniġiviŋa uvaŋa?

english: He answered, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Ilaaguruq taamna misuksiqatauruaq punniġmik uvamnun puggutauramun, ilaan aitchuutiginiaġaaŋa.

english: The Son of Man will go as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if he had never been born.”
inupiaq: Iġñiŋa Iñuum tuquniaqtuq taŋŋiġḷugich aglausimaruat inmigun Bible-ni. Aglaan isumaaġutiqpaqaġli taamna iñuk aitchuutiginniktuaq Iġñiŋanik Iñuum. Iłuałhaaŋanayaqtuq taamna iñuk iñuuŋaitkumi.

english: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” Jesus replied, “You have said it yourself.”
inupiaq: Judas, aitchuutigiriksrautaa, uqallaŋaruq, Iḷisaurrii, Uvaŋauva? Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Tainna uqallaaniktutin.

english: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it, gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take, eat, this is my body.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiḷḷaġmiŋ Jesus tiguŋagaa punniq, aasii aŋaiyyuvluni quyyatigivlugu aviŋagaa, aasii aitchuutigivlugu iḷitchitquranun uqallakłuni, Tigulugu niġġisiuŋ, tavra timiga.

english: And after taking the cup and giving thanks, he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you,
inupiaq: Suli tiguŋagaa qallugauraq, aasii quyaanikami God-mun, qaiñŋagaa ilaiññun, uqallakłuni, Imiġitchi tavraŋŋa, iluqasi.

english: for this is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna auga maqipkaqtauyumaaqtuaq iñugiaktuanun. Taavrumuuna God-im nalupqinaiġñiaġaa sivunniuġutini iñuŋnun suliqutigiŋaiġḷugich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutiŋich.

english: I tell you, from now on I will not drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi imitqigñiaŋitchuŋa uumaŋŋa napaaqtuayaam siiġñaŋan ivsaŋaniñ, tikiḷġataqtillugu taamna uvluq imiġniksraq nutaulugu piqatigilusi Aapama atanniqsimaviani.

english: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
inupiaq: Tavra atuanikamiŋ aŋaiyyunmik aniŋarut, Iġġimuksaqłutiŋ Olives-mun.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “This night you will all fall away because of me, for it is written:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iluqasi qimaŋniaġivsiŋa suksraaġluŋa uumani unnuami, qanuq aglausimaruq Bible-ni God uqallagnivḷugu inna, “Uvaŋa tuqunniaġiga imnaiḷiqiri, aasii imnaich siaminniaqtut.”

english: ‘I will strike the shepherd,
inupiaq: Aglaan aŋipkaqtauganikkuma aullaġniaqtuŋa sivuvsiññi Galilee-mun.

english: and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
inupiaq: Peter uqallaŋaruq Jesus-mun, Iluqaġmiŋ qimakkaluaqpatin suksraaġlutin, uvaŋa sumikunnii qimakkumiñaitkikpiñ.

english: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷumun uqallautigikpiñ, Anaqapak uvva piiḷaaġiniaġiŋma piŋasuni naluniḷuŋa tiŋmiaq nipatkaluaqtinnagu.

english: Peter said to him, “If they all fall away because of you, I will never fall away!”
inupiaq: Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Tuquqatigiraksraġigupkiñunnii, piiḷaaġiyumiñaitkikpiñ sumikunnii. Tainnaptauq uqallagaŋammiut iluqaġmiŋ iḷitchitqurat.

english: Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, on this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaqatigiŋagai iḷitchitqurani inimun atiqaqtuamun Gethsemane-mik, aasii ilaan uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Aquvittitchi uvuŋa, ikuŋa aŋaiyyuyaqtuġniaqtuŋa.

english: Peter said to him, “Even if I must die with you, I will never deny you.” And all the disciples said the same thing.
inupiaq: Aasii piqasiutivlugich ilimiñun Peter-lu malġuglu iġñiŋik Zebedee-m, ilaa ipiqtutcharraqsiŋaruq iłuiḷḷiurraqsivḷuniḷu.

english: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
inupiaq: Tavrani uqallaŋaruq ilaiññun, Isumaaliqpaił̣ł̣uŋa tuquaqsiruatununnii iḷiruŋa, tavraniittitchi, aasii quviqtaiḷiqasiġḷuŋa.

english: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and became anguished and distressed.
inupiaq: Aasii taikuŋaqtaallakłuni isumaaqpaił̣ł̣uni ulġuŋaruq nunamun, aasii aŋaiyyuvluni inna, Aapaaŋ, piyumiñaqpan, piiġuŋ nagliksaaġutiqpak uvamniñ, aglaattauq uvaŋa pisuutiŋił̣aaptun, aglaan ilivich pisuutiptun.

english: Then he said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Remain here and stay awake with me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus utiŋaruq piŋasunun iḷitchitquramiñun aasii tautuŋagai siñiktuat. Tavra uqallautiŋagaa Peter, quviqtaiḷiyumiñaiñŋavich atautchimiunnii ikarraġmi?

english: Going a little farther, he threw himself down with his face to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if possible, let this cup pass from me! Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
inupiaq: Quviqtaiḷisitchi aŋaiyyusitchiḷu, iḷaanni payaripkaqpiaqtusi ikł̣igutchaktinniaġunmun. Iḷumun ilitqusisi piyummatiqaġaluaqtut, timisi sayaitchut.

english: Then he came to the disciples and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “So, couldn’t you stay awake with me for one hour?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullavsaaŋaruq igḷuvlugu aasii aŋaiyyuvluni, Aapaaŋ, pisuutigigupku nagliksaaqpaktuksrauluŋa, pisuutin piḷi.

english: Stay awake and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
inupiaq: Tavra utaqqikamigich, tautuvsaaŋagai siñiktillugich, qanuq iriŋich pillitchiŋarut.

english: He went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if this cup cannot be taken away unless I drink it, your will must be done.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qimatqiŋagai, aullaqłuni aŋaiyyuvsaaŋaruq piŋatchiqł̣ugik, uqalugivlugich taapkuasuli uqaluich.

english: He came again and found them sleeping; they could not keep their eyes open.
inupiaq: Tavra uttaqiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, aasii uqallautivlugich, Tavrasuli siñikpisi piḷaiŋaiqsiaqłusi. Uvva, aitchuutauniksraŋa Iġñiŋan Iñuum tikitchuq aŋalataġiyumiñaqsivḷugu piḷuktuanun iñuŋnun.

english: So leaving them again, he went away and prayed for the third time, saying the same thing once more.
inupiaq: Makittitchi. Aullaqta. Tautuksiuŋ uvva aitchuutigiriga uvaniittuq.

english: Then he came to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is approaching, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
inupiaq: Jesus uqaġniaqtillugusuli Judas qaiŋaruq, iḷaŋat qulit malġuk, piqatiqaqłuni iñusalaŋnik savikpiraqtuanik anautchiraqtuaniglu, qairuanik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋniñ umialiŋnaŋiññiḷḷu Jew-guruat.

english: Get up, let us go. Look! My betrayer is approaching!”
inupiaq: Tavra aitchuutiginniktuam piqatini nalunaiñŋutaksriñŋagai, uqallakłuni, Tavrauniaqtuq iñuk kisu kunikkupku, tigusaġiksi.

english: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests and elders of the people.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas qaiŋaruq Jesus-mun tavrauvvaa aasii uqallakłuni, Tutqigiñ Iḷisaurrii, aasii kunikł̣ugu.

english: (Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him!”)
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Avilaitqaan, piñasuaġuŋ piyaqtukkan. Tavra iliŋich qaivḷutiŋ tigguġluŋagaat Jesus.

english: Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi,” and kissed him.
inupiaq: Tavrali iḷaŋata taapkua tuvaaqatauruat Jesus-mun amuŋagaa savikpani, aasii anauvlugu kivgaŋa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata, aasii siutaiqł̣ugu.

english: Jesus said to him, “Friend, do what you are here to do.” Then they came and took hold of Jesus and arrested him.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Utiqtirruŋ savikpaiñ puuŋanun, qanuq tamatkua iluqaġmiŋ savikpagaqtuat tuquniaqtut savikpakun.

english: But one of those with Jesus grabbed his sword, drew it out, and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his ear.
inupiaq: Isumavich ikayuqtaiḷiqiyumiñaiññasugaluŋa Aapamnun, aasii ilaa tavrauvvaa tilisiḷuni uvamnun qulit malġugnik 6,000-gullaaruanik isaġulignik.

english: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back in its place! For all who take hold of the sword will die by the sword.
inupiaq: Aglaan taamna tainna pigaluaqpan qanuġlutiŋ Bible uqaluŋich taŋŋiġñiaqpat, uqaluqaqtuat aitchuutauniaġnivḷuŋa.

english: Or do you think that I cannot call on my Father, and that he would send me more than twelve legions of angels right now?
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus uqallautiŋagai iñusalaich, Qaiŋavisi tigligayuktimik pisaġmatun, savikpagnik anauttaniglu satkuqaqłusi tigusaqtuqłuŋa? Uvlumiñ uvlumun aquppigaluaġaqtuŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi iḷisaurrivḷuŋa, aasii tigguġlulaitkivsiŋa.

english: How then would the scriptures that say it must happen this way be fulfilled?”
inupiaq: Aglaan tamarra tamatkua pirraqsirut Bible uqaluŋich uqaqtiŋigun God-im taŋŋiqsautquvlugich. Tavrani iluqaġmiŋ iḷitchitqurat qimaŋagaat aasii pigruqłutiŋ.

english: At that moment Jesus said to the crowd, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me like you would an outlaw? Day after day I sat teaching in the temple courts, yet you did not arrest me.
inupiaq: Tavrani taapkua tiguriruat Jesus-mik aullautiŋagaat Caiaphas-mun, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiannun, iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik, umialiŋnallu katirviannun.

english: But this has happened so that the scriptures of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples left him and fled.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m maliŋagaa uŋasiuraaqługu, siḷalliġuaŋanunaglaan inaanun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata aasii isiqłuni ilaan aquptaaqatigiŋagai munaqsrich qiñiġukłuni isuanunaglaan.

english: Now the ones who had arrested Jesus led him to Caiaphas, the high priest, in whose house the experts in the law and the elders had gathered.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu iluqaġmiglu uqaqsitaaqtitchirit ivaqłiaŋarut patchisiksranik saglutigilugu uqautigisukługu Jesus, tuqutchukługu.

english: But Peter was following him from a distance, all the way to the high priest’s courtyard. After going in, he sat with the guards to see the outcome.
inupiaq: Tavra paqillaiġutiŋarut pasikkutiksranik, qanutun iñugiaktigigaluaqtut saglutikun uqautiginniktuat ilaanik. Kiisaimmaa malġuk saavitpuk,

english: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were trying to find false testimony against Jesus so that they could put him to death.
inupiaq: aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Uvvauna iñuk uqallaŋaruaq, Uvaŋa suksraunġiġumiñaġiga God-im aŋaiyyuvikpaŋa, aasii nappatqigḷugu uvluni piŋasuni.

english: But they did not find anything, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat makiłłuni uqallaŋaruq Jesus-mun, Kiggutiksraitpich sumik ukuak iññuk uqautikkutaagnik ilipkun?

english: and declared, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nipaiñŋaruq. Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata uqallautiŋagaa, Apiġipiaġikpiñ sivuġaani iñuuruam God-im, uqallauttutigut Christ-guvich, Iġñiŋa God-im?

english: So the high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer? What is this that they are testifying against you?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uqallaaniktutin tainna. Aglaan uqallautigivsi qakugukpan tautugniaġiksi Iġñiŋa Iñuum aquppiruaq taliqpiata tuŋaani Sapiġñaqtuam, aasii qaimmiḷuni nuvuyaŋigun qiḷaum.

english: But Jesus was silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God, tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
inupiaq: Tavrani aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaum aligaaŋagaa annuġaani, aasii uqallakłuni, Inmiñik iḷiuqtuq God-itun. Iñuvsaanik pasiññiktuksranik ilaanik piqaqtuksrauŋaiqsugut. Ilivsi paŋmapak tusaaganikkiksi uqamaqłuutaa.

english: Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself. But I tell you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
inupiaq: Qanuq sivunniivisi? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Tuquruksraġuqtuq.

english: Then the high priest tore his clothes and declared, “He has blasphemed! Why do we still need witnesses? Now you have heard the blasphemy!
inupiaq: Tavrani tivvuaqturraqsiŋagaat kiiñaŋagun, qakiqsimmaan, suli iḷaŋisa iqsraaqsimmaan,

english: What is your verdict?” They answered, “He is guilty and deserves death.”
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, Nalautchaġiñ, Christ-guruatiin, kia qakiqpatin?

english: Then they spat in his face and struck him with their fists. And some slapped him,
inupiaq: Tavrali Peter aquppiŋaruq siḷalliġmi. Aasii aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata niviaqsiaq kivgaŋa ullakługu Peter uqallautiŋagaa, Itqatigiŋammigiñ Jesus Galilee-ġmiu.

english: saying, “Prophesy for us, you Christ! Who hit you?”
inupiaq: Peter piiḷaaŋaruq takkuanni iluqaġmiŋ, uqallakłuni, Naluruŋa sumik uqautiqaqtilaavsiññik.

english: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A slave girl came to him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa animman qanitchaġuanun, allam niviaqsiam kivgam tautuŋagaa, aasii uqallautivlugich tamaani makitaruat, Uvvauna iñuk piqatauruaq Jesus-mun Nazareth-miumun.

english: But he denied it in front of them all: “I don’t know what you’re talking about!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter piiḷaatqiŋaruq suaŋasivḷugu, Nalugiga iñuk.

english: When he went out to the gateway, another slave girl saw him and said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus the Nazarene.”
inupiaq: Akkulivsaallagman tamaani makitaruat ullakługu uqallautilgitkaat Peter, Nalupqinaitchuamik iḷagigaatin taapkua, qanuq uvva uqausipkun iḷisimanaqtutin.

english: He denied it again with an oath, “I do not know the man!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter suammakłuni uqallaŋaruq, God-im tatavsaġliŋa uqaŋitkuma iḷumun ittuamik. Nalugiga kiutilaaŋa iñuk uqautigikkaqsi. Aasii tavrauvvaa tiŋmiaq nipanŋaruq.

english: After a little while, those standing there came up to Peter and said, “You really are one of them too – even your accent gives you away!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter itqaiŋaruq Jesus uqallautiŋiñik inmiñun inna, Tiŋmiaq nipanŋaunnagu, piiḷaaġiniaġiŋma piŋasuni. Tavra anivḷuni qiaqpaŋaruq.

english: At that he began to curse, and he swore with an oath, “I do not know the man!” At that moment a rooster crowed.
Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.
When it was early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people plotted against Jesus to execute him.
inupiaq: Uvlaatchaurami iluqaġmiŋ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich umialiŋnaŋiḷḷu Jew-guruat sivunniuqatigiiŋarut Jesus-kun tuqutchukługu.

english: They tied him up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate the governor.
inupiaq: Tavra qiḷiqsruiŋagaat, aasii aullautivlugu aitchuutigiŋagaat Pilate-mun kavanauruamun.

english: Now when Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus had been condemned, he regretted what he had done and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders,
inupiaq: Tavrali Judas, Jesus aitchuutigiriŋa, iḷitchuġikami Jesus tuqutaksraġuqtilaaŋanik nunuuraliŋaruq, aasii utiqtiłługich iñuiññaq qulit maniich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun, umialiŋnanullu,

english: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood!” But they said, “What is that to us? You take care of it yourself!”
inupiaq: uqallakłuni, Piḷuksiŋaruŋa aitchuutigivlugu tuqutautquvlugu patchisaitchuaq iñuk. Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Suliqutauva taamna uvaptiŋnun? Qaunakkuiḷḷi iliŋnik.

english: So Judas threw the silver coins into the temple and left. Then he went out and hanged himself.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas miḷuqsautivlugich maniich ilaaguaqtauŋaruamun aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, ilaa aullaqłuni qimiñŋaruq inmiñik.

english: The chief priests took the silver and said, “It is not lawful to put this into the temple treasury, since it is blood money.”
inupiaq: Tavrali aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich tiguvlugich maniich uqallaŋarut, Pitquratiguaŋaitchuq iksraukpata maniich aitchuutiqaġviŋmun aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, qanuq akigigai iñuktauruam.

english: After consulting together they bought the Potter’s Field with it, as a burial place for foreigners.
inupiaq: Tavra uqaaġutigiŋagaich, aasii tauqsiutigivlugich Utkutchirim Nunaŋanik, iḷuviġviksramik iglaaguruanun.

english: For this reason that field has been called the “Field of Blood” to this day.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna pisigivlugu taamna nuna atchiŋagaat Nunaŋa Augum paŋmapaŋmunaglaan.

english: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty silver coins, the price of the one whose price had been set by the people of Israel,
inupiaq: Tavrani taŋŋiqsauŋaruq uqautigiŋaraŋa uqaqtaata God-im Jeremiah-m, uqaqłuni, “Ilaisa tiguŋagaich iñuiññaq qulit maniich, aasii tauqsiutigivlugich utkutchirim nunaŋanun, piraksriutaatun Atanġum uvamnun. Tavra taapkua maniich iñugiaktilaaŋat Israel-guruat sivunniutigiŋakkaŋich akiḷiutigisukługich ilaanun.”

english: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus makitaŋaruq sivuġaani kavanauruam, aasii kavanauruam apiġiŋagaa, Umialigivatin Jew-guruat? Jesus kiuŋagaa, Tainna uqallaktutin.

english: Then Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus said, “You say so.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa saŋutkaluaġmanni aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu umialiŋnallu, kiulaiñŋagai.

english: But when he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he did not respond.
inupiaq: Kiisaimmaa Pilate uqallakpuq ilaanun, Tusaqsraġiŋitpigich qanutun iñugiaktigiruat uqautigikkaŋich ilipkun?

english: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many charges they are bringing against you?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋaitkaa sumikunnii, kavanauruaq aliuġutchapiaġataqługu.

english: But he did not answer even one accusation, so that the governor was quite amazed.
inupiaq: Tavra niqinaqilimaaġmata Itqaunmik qulaurrusiqiviŋmun, kavanauruaq piḷġusiqaŋaruq anipkaivḷuni nallipayaaŋannik tigutaaqtat, iñuich pisukkaŋannik.

english: During the feast the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd, whomever they wanted.
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaqtaqaŋarut iñugiiḷapiaġatamik, atiqaqtuamik Barabbas-mik.

english: At that time they had in custody a notorious prisoner named Jesus Barabbas.
inupiaq: Tavra katinmata Pilate apiġiŋagai, Kimik anipkaitquvisiŋa? Barabbas-mik, naagga Jesus-mik taggisiqaqtuamik Christ-mik?

english: So after they had assembled, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release for you, Jesus Barabbas or Jesus who is called the Christ?”
inupiaq: Qanuq Pilate iḷisimaŋaruq killuġivlugu Jesus ilaiññun aitchuutigiŋatilaaŋanik inmiñun.

english: (For he knew that they had handed him over because of envy.)
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate isivġiipkaqtillugu isivġiġvium aquppiutaŋiñi, nuliaŋan tilisivigiŋagaa uqaluŋmik, Iḷaksianagu taamna nalaunŋaruaq iñuk, qanuq iłuiḷḷiuġutigillakkiga ilaa unnuapak siññaktuġivlugu.

english: As he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent a message to him: “Have nothing to do with that innocent man; I have suffered greatly as a result of a dream about him today.”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu umialiŋnallu maliksuktitchiŋarut iñuŋnik annaktitquvlugu Barabbas aasii tuqullugu Jesus.

english: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus killed.
inupiaq: Tavra Kavanauruam apiġitqiŋagai, Nalliak ukuak iññuk anipkaquvisiuŋ? Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Barabbas.

english: The governor asked them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas!”
inupiaq: Pilate uqallautiŋagai, Aasii qanuġniaqpigu Jesus taggisiqaqtuaq Christ-mik? Iluqaġmiŋ uqallaŋarut, Kikiaktuutili aŋarrauramun.

english: Pilate said to them, “Then what should I do with Jesus who is called the Christ?” They all said, “Crucify him!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Summan, sumik pigiitchualiqiŋava? Tavra nipaallavsaaqsiññaŋarut, Kikiaktuutili aŋarrauramun.

english: He asked, “Why? What wrong has he done?” But they shouted more insistently, “Crucify him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate iḷitchuġikami qanuġluni piyumiñaiññiqami, piallagniksraŋat isagutiniuraaqsiññaaqsimman, ilaa tigusiŋaruq imiġmik aasii iqaġivlugich argagni takkuanni iñusalaich, uqallakłuni, Uvaŋa patchisauŋitchuŋa uuma iñuum tuqutauniksraŋagun. Ilivsi pisiuŋ.

english: When Pilate saw that he could do nothing, but that instead a riot was starting, he took some water, washed his hands before the crowd and said, “I am innocent of this man’s blood. You take care of it yourselves!”
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich kiuŋagaat, Tatavsausiaq tuqutauniŋagun uvaptiŋnun piḷi miqłiqtuptiŋnullu.

english: In reply all the people said, “Let his blood be on us and on our children!”
inupiaq: Tavrani Pilate-gum anipkaŋagaa Barabbas, aasii ipiġaqtuqtitqaaqługu Jesus, aitchuutigiŋagaa kikiaktuutitquvlugu aŋarrauramun.

english: Then he released Barabbas for them. But after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
inupiaq: Tavrani aŋuyaktiŋisa Pilate aullautiŋagaat Jesus kavanauruam igluqpaŋanun, aasii katinŋagaich tamatkiqł̣ugich aŋuyaktauqatigiich avataanun Jesus.

english: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the governor’s residence and gathered the whole cohort around him.
inupiaq: Tavra annuġaiyaŋagaat aasii atipkaqługu kavviġiksuamik annuġaanik umialiktun.

english: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe around him,
inupiaq: Aasii niaquġusiŋarut kakiḷḷaġnaqtuanik qisiqsiutinik, aasii iḷivḷugu niaquanun, suli saakkiqł̣ugu qirugmik taliqpianun. Tavra sitquqłutiŋ sivuġaanun kipagiŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ, Sivisuruamik iñuuli umialgat Jews.

english: and after braiding a crown of thorns, they put it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand, and kneeling down before him, they mocked him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
inupiaq: Tavra tivvuaqtuŋagaat, suli tiguvlugu qiruk tigumiaġikkaŋa anauŋagaat niaquagun.

english: They spat on him and took the staff and struck him repeatedly on the head.
inupiaq: Tavra kipautigianikamirruŋ, annuġaagiŋagaat, aasii atipkaqługich ilaan annuġaaŋi, aullautivlugu kikiaktuutisukługu aŋarrauramun.

english: When they had mocked him, they stripped him of the robe and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
inupiaq: Tavra iglaullaġmiŋ, paaŋagaat iñuk Cyrene-miu, atiqaqtuaq Simon-mik. Taamna iñuk nunurivḷugu iqsruktinŋagaat Jesus aŋarrauraŋanik.

english: As they were going out, they found a man from Cyrene named Simon, whom they forced to carry his cross.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññamiŋ inimun atiqaqtuamik Golgotha, sivuniqaqtuaq niaquġruam inaanik,

english: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means “Place of the Skull”)
inupiaq: tavrani aitchuŋagaat Jesus wine-mik imiksraŋanik, avuramik suŋŋamik. Tavra uullakkaluaqamiuŋ, imiġuŋiñŋagaa.

english: and offered Jesus wine mixed with gall to drink. But after tasting it, he would not drink it.
inupiaq: Tavra kikiaktuutianikamirruŋ aŋarrauramun, autaaŋagaich annuġaaŋi inmiŋnun saaptautigivlugich.

english: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothes by throwing dice.
inupiaq: Tavrani aquptaaqłutiŋ naipiqtuŋagaat.

english: Then they sat down and kept guard over him there.
inupiaq: Aasii qulaanun niaquan iḷiŋagaat pasikkun ilaagun, taiguaġnaqtuaq, Uvva Jesus Umialgat Jew-guruat.

english: Above his head they put the charge against him, which read: “This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.”
inupiaq: Tavraptauq malġuk tigligayuktik kikiaktuutiŋammigaich, igḷua taliqpian tuŋaanun, suli igḷua saumian tuŋaanun.

english: Then two outlaws were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
inupiaq: Suli iñuich tamaunnaaqtuat niaqulavigiraġaŋagaat nivliativlugulu pisaaŋŋatinik Jesus,

english: Those who passed by defamed him, shaking their heads
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, Ilivich siquvsiyumaaŋaruatin aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmik aasii nappatqigḷugu uvluni piŋasuni, annauttuiñ iliŋnik. Iġñiġikpatin God-im, atqaġiñ aŋarrauramiñ.

english: and saying, “You who can destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are God’s Son, come down from the cross!”
inupiaq: Tavraptauqsuli aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich, piqatigivlugich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik umialiŋnallu, kipagiŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ,

english: In the same way even the chief priests – together with the experts in the law and elders – were mocking him:
inupiaq: Annaurriŋagaluaqtuq allanik, annautilaitchuq inmiñik. Umialiginiqparruŋ Israel, atqaġli paŋmapak aŋarrauramiñ ukpiġiliġñiaġikput.

english: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself! He is the king of Israel! If he comes down now from the cross, we will believe in him!
inupiaq: Ukpiqtuq God-mun, uqaqłuniḷu Iġñiġinivḷuni God-mun. Kiasii tautuglakput God-mun annautisuŋmagaan paŋmapak.

english: He trusts in God – let God, if he wants to, deliver him now because he said, ‘I am God’s Son’!”
inupiaq: Taapkuaktauq tigligayuktik kikiaktuutiqatauruak ilaanun kipagiŋammigaak tainnatun.

english: The robbers who were crucified with him also spoke abusively to him.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlum qitiqqaġniŋaniñ piŋasunugataqtillugu taaqsiŋaruq nuna iluqani.

english: Now from noon until three, darkness came over all the land.
inupiaq: Tavra piŋasunukpalliġman Jesus nipatutilaamisun nivliŋaruq, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani. Taamna sivuniqaqtuaq, God-iiŋ, God-iiŋ, summan suksraaqpiŋa?

english: At about three o’clock Jesus shouted with a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” that is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋisa tamaani makitaruat tusaavlugu uqallaŋarut, Uvvauma ququulagaa Elijah.

english: When some of the bystanders heard it, they said, “This man is calling for Elijah.”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋat tavrauvvaa aqpamik tigusiŋaruq ivsaktaqtuamik, immiqł̣ugu wine-mik, iḷivḷugu qiruum nuvuanun, qaiñŋagaa ilaanun imiquvlugu.

english: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge, filled it with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi allat uqallaŋarut, Aannagu, naipiqtuġlakput Elijah qaiñiaġmagaan annautiyaqtuġlugu.

english: But the rest said, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah will come to save him.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nivlitqiŋaruq nipatuvluni aasii aniġniġiqł̣uni.

english: Then Jesus cried out again with a loud voice and gave up his spirit.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani, talukiyaaŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaum aliŋaruq malġuułłuni, qulimiñiñ anmun. Tavrasuli nuna aulaŋaruq, uyaġagruallu quvluŋarut.

english: Just then the temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom. The earth shook and the rocks were split apart.
inupiaq: Iḷuvviviiḷḷu aŋmaŋarut, suli iñugiaktuat God-im iñuŋi tuquŋaruat aŋiŋarut tuqqunmiñ.

english: And tombs were opened, and the bodies of many saints who had died were raised.
inupiaq: Suli qimaŋagaich iḷuvġuvisiŋ. Jesus aŋianiŋman tuqqunmiñ, Jerusalem-muŋarut aasii tautuŋagaich iñuich iñugiaktuat.

english: (They came out of the tombs after his resurrection and went into the holy city and appeared to many people.)
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata tamatkualu aŋuyaktauqatiŋisa munaqsriruat Jesus-mik, tautukługich nuna aularuaq sullu piraġaqtuat aliuġusuliŋarut aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Iḷumun una Iġñiġimagaa God-im.

english: Now when the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and what took place, they were extremely terrified and said, “Truly this one was God’s Son!”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani iñugiaŋammiut aġnat, qiñiqtuaqtuat uŋasiñiñ, maliŋaruat Jesus-mik Galilee-miñ, savautivlugu.

english: Many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee and given him support were also there, watching from a distance.
inupiaq: Iḷagiŋagaat Mary Magdalene, Mary suli aakaŋak James-lu Joseph-lu, aakaŋaglu iġñakisa Zebedee-m.

english: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
inupiaq: Tavra unnuksraaġman, suġalliruaq iñuk qaiŋaruq Arimatheamiñ, atiqaqtuaq Joseph-mik, iḷitchitquraummiñiqsuaq Jesus-mun.

english: Now when it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who was also a disciple of Jesus.
inupiaq: Ilaa ullautiŋaruq Pilate-mun aasii apiqsriaġivlugu timaa Jesus. Tavrani Pilate piraksriiŋaruq aitchuutigitquvlugu Jesus timaa Joseph-mun.

english: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
inupiaq: Tavra Joseph atqaqługu timi, nimmaaŋagaa nutauruamik ukił̣haaġiqsuamik.

english: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
inupiaq: Aasii iḷiŋagaa ilaan nanmiñiq nutaamun iḷuvviviŋmiñun, iḷuvviviḷiamiñun uyaġagruakun, aasii ilaan aksraliŋagaa uyaġagruaqpak upkurriutivlugu iḷuvviviŋmun, aasii aullaqłuni.

english: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut in the rock. Then he rolled a great stone across the entrance of the tomb and went away.
inupiaq: Mary Magdalene allalu Mary aquppiŋaruk tavrani sanmivḷugu iḷuvvivik.

english: (Now Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there, opposite the tomb.)
inupiaq: Siqiñiq nipianiŋman, Jew-guruat nutauruaq uvluat isagutimman, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich Pharisees-lu kasimaqatigiŋagaat Pilate,

english: The next day (which is after the day of preparation) the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled before Pilate
inupiaq: aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Kamanaaq, itqaumarugut qanuq taimña sagluqinnikti iñuuŋŋaġmi uqaŋatilaaŋanik, Uvlut piŋasut pianikpata aŋiñiaqtuŋa.

english: and said, “Sir, we remember that while that deceiver was still alive he said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu iḷuvvivik anayanaiyaqtillugu uvluk piŋayuaŋnunaglaan, iḷaanni iḷitchitquraŋisa qaiḷutiŋ tiglikpiaġaat aullautilugu, aasii iñuich uqautiaqsiḷugich, Ilaa aŋiñiḷugu tuqqunmiñ, aasii taimma aqulliq saglutaun pigiił̣haaġluni sivulliġmiñ.

english: So give orders to secure the tomb until the third day. Otherwise his disciples may come and steal his body and say to the people, ‘He has been raised from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
inupiaq: Pilate uqallautiŋagai, munaqsriqaqtusi aŋuyaktinik anayanaiyaġiaqsiuŋ piyumiñaqtilaavsisun.

english: Pilate said to them, “Take a guard of soldiers. Go and make it as secure as you can.”
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqłutiŋ anayanaiyaŋagaat iḷuvvivik aŋmaqsausiqaġnaiqł̣ugu nalunaiñŋutchiqsuqługu nalunaiñŋutamiŋnik munaqsriḷiqł̣ugulu aŋuyaktinik.

english: So they went with the soldiers of the guard and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone.
The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
inupiaq: Uvva tusaayugaaġiksuat aullaqisaaŋat Jesus Christ-kun, Iġñiŋagun God-im.

english: As it is written in Isaiah the prophet,
inupiaq: God-im uqaqtaa Isaiah aglaŋaruq taavrumuuna aglakamigich God-im uqaluŋi inna,

english: “Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
inupiaq: Tavraasii John Paptaiqsi iñukpalliŋaruq nunagluktuami, alġaqsruivḷuni iñuich paptaiqsautquvlugich isumalitqiqqaaġlutiŋ piḷuunmiŋniñ, God-mun suliqutigiŋaiqulugich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutitiŋ.

english: who will prepare your way,
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich ullaaŋagaat iluqaiññiñ nunaŋiñiñ Judea-m, Jerusalem-miḷḷu, aasii paptaiqsiłłutiŋ ilaanun kuuŋani Jordan, quliaqtuqługich piḷuutitiŋ God-mun.

english: the voice of one shouting in the wilderness,
inupiaq: Tavra John annuġaaqaŋaruq pikukturuam kakaktim amianik, tavsiqaqłuniḷu qisiŋmik, suli niqiqaqłuni nuttagayuŋnik qupilġunik, honey-miglu paqinnaqtuamik nunagluktuami.

english: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord,
inupiaq: Suli alġaqsruiŋaruq uqaqłuni, Imma qairuaqaqtuq aqupkun sapiġñałhaaqtuamik uvamniñ, siŋiqsuutiŋik aluġutikisa nalliummatiŋitchuŋa putchumiñaġluŋa siŋiiyaġuglugu.

english: make his paths straight.’”
inupiaq: Uvaŋa paptaiġivsi imiġmik, aglaan ilaan iḷiñiaġaa Ilitqusiġiksuaq iḷuvsiññun.

english: In the wilderness John the baptizer began preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
inupiaq: Taipkunani uvluni, Jesus qaiŋaruq iniqpaŋmiñ Nazareth-miñ, Galilee-miittuamiñ, aasii paptaiqsiłłuni John-mun kuuŋmi Jordan-mi.

english: People from the whole Judean countryside and all of Jerusalem were going out to him, and he was baptizing them in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa qakikami immamiñ, Jesus tautuŋagaa qiḷak aŋmaqtuaq, suli Ilitqusiġiksuaq tiŋmiatun atqaqtuaq inmiñun.

english: John wore a garment made of camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaaŋagaa nipi qiḷaŋmiñ, Ilivich piviuttaġivlutin Iġñiġigikpiñ, iviġaummatigilluataġikpiñ.

english: He proclaimed, “One more powerful than I am is coming after me; I am not worthy to bend down and untie the strap of his sandals.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa Ilitqusiġiksuam aullautiŋagaa nunagluktuamun.

english: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nunagluktuamiinŋaruq malġukipiani uvluni. Aasii Satan-gum ikł̣igutchaktinniaŋagaa. Iqsiñaqtuat niġrutit tavraniinŋammiut, aasii isaġulgich qaivḷutiŋ ikayuŋagaat Jesus.

english: Now in those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.
inupiaq: Tavra John tigutaaqtauganiŋman, Jesus Galilee-muŋaruq alġaqsruivḷuni tusaayugaaġiksuanik God-miñ,

english: And just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens splitting apart and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, Piviksraq nalautittuq, God-im atanniqsimasaaqsigai iñuich. Isumalitqigitchi. Ukpiġisiuŋ tusaayugaaġiksuaq.

english: And a voice came from heaven: “You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus pisuaġniallaġmi siñiqsraqługu tasia Galilee-m, tautuŋagaa Simon Andrew-lu aniqataa kuvriqsuak tatchimun, iqalugniaqtauvlutik.

english: The Spirit immediately drove him into the wilderness.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagik, Maliktinŋa. Iqalugniaġusiptiktun, iḷisautiniaġiptik iñunnagniaġniġmik.

english: He was in the wilderness forty days, enduring temptations from Satan. He was with wild animals, and angels were ministering to his needs.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa qimaŋagaik kuvratik, aasii malikługu.

english: Now after John was imprisoned, Jesus went into Galilee and proclaimed the gospel of God.
inupiaq: Ayuuġuraanilgiññami tavraŋŋa, tautuŋagik aniqatigiik James-lu, John-lu, iġñiŋik Zebedee-m, umiaqpauramiinniqsuat aapariglu, allaiyaqługich kuvratik.

english: He said, “The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God is near. Repent and believe the gospel!”
inupiaq: Tavra tautupqaqamigik ququaŋagik, aasii iliŋikta qimakługu aapariŋ Zebedee umiaqpauramun tuvaaqatiqaqługu akiññagniaqtuanik kivganik, maliŋagaak Jesus.

english: As he went along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, Simon’s brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishermen).
inupiaq: Tavra Capernaum-muŋarut. Aasii tavrauvva Jew-guruat Savairvianni, Jesus aŋaiyyuliaŋaruq, aasii iḷisaurrivḷuni.

english: Jesus said to them, “Follow me, and I will turn you into fishers of people.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich kamasuŋarut iḷisaurrutiŋigun, qanuq ilaan iḷisaurrutiŋi kamanaŋarut. Iḷisaurriŋaitchuq pitquranik iḷisaurritun.

english: They left their nets immediately and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuviŋmiinŋaruq iñuk ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuaq, aasii nipaalaŋaruq,

english: Going on a little farther, he saw James, the son of Zebedee, and John his brother in their boat mending nets.
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, Jesus Nazareth-miu, summan iḷaksiavisigut? Uvaniitpich suksraunġiġukłuta? Iḷisimagiga kiutilaan. Ilivich piḷuutaitchuaq God-im pia.

english: Immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus suaŋagaa uqaqłuni, Nipaisaaġiñ. Anniiñ ilaaniñ.

english: Then they went to Capernaum. When the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uum uuliksipkasugruŋagaa suli nipaalavluni aniŋaruq ilaaniñ.

english: The people there were amazed by his teaching, because he taught them like one who had authority, not like the experts in the law.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ kamanniuŋarut, kamasukpaił̣ł̣utiŋ apiqsruqtuutiŋarut ilimiŋnun, Sunauna? Nutauruaq iḷisaurrun? Ataniġnaqutiqaqłuni piraksriḷḷagai ilitqusiqł̣uich, aasii ilaisa kamagillavlugu.

english: Just then there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaaŋagaat aliuġnaġniŋa uqaluk siamiłłuni qilamik sumulliqaa nunaaqqiñun Galilee-mi.

english: “Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are – the Holy One of God!”
inupiaq: Tavra anikamiŋ aŋaiyyuviŋmiñ, tavrauvvaa isiŋarut igluagnun Simon-lu Andrew-vlu, tuvaaqatigivlugik James-lu John-lu.

english: But Jesus rebuked him: “Silence! Come out of him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Simon aakaruaŋa nalaŋaruq naŋiłłuni uunaqsivḷuni, aasii tavrauvvaa uqallautiŋagaat Jesus.

english: After throwing him into convulsions, the unclean spirit cried out with a loud voice and came out of him.
inupiaq: Tavra ullakługu tiguŋagaa argaŋigun, aasii makitiłługu. Suli tavrauvvaa uunnautaiŋaruq, aasii niqłiuġutiaqsivḷugich.

english: They were all amazed so that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He even commands the unclean spirits and they obey him.”
inupiaq: Tavra anaqaksraaġman, siqiñiq nipianiŋman, Jesus-muutiŋagaich iluqaisa naŋirrutilgich, tamatkualu ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuat.

english: So the news about him spread quickly throughout all the region around Galilee.
inupiaq: Tavra iñupayaaŋi iniqpaum katinŋarut sivuġaanun iglum.

english: Now as soon as they left the synagogue, they entered Simon and Andrew’s house, with James and John.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan iluaqsiŋagai iñugiaktuat naŋirrutilgich qanusiḷimaanik, suli aniłługich iñugiaktuat ilitqusiqł̣uich. Suli ilitqusiqł̣uich uqaqtaiḷivḷugich qanuq iḷisimaŋagaat kiutilaaŋanik.

english: Simon’s mother-in-law was lying down, sick with a fever, so they spoke to Jesus at once about her.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaami Jesus itiqłuni uvluġiaġituŋŋaan aniŋaruq, aasii aullaqłuni iñuił̣aamun aŋaiyyuŋaruq.

english: He came and raised her up by gently taking her hand. Then the fever left her and she began to serve them.
inupiaq: Tavra Simon piqatiniḷu aullaŋarut ivaġiaqługu,

english: When it was evening, after sunset, they brought to him all who were sick and demon-possessed.
inupiaq: aasii paqinnamirruŋ uqallautiŋagaat, Iñupayaat ivaqłiarut iliŋnik.

english: The whole town gathered by the door.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Aullaqta tuglivsiŋñun nunaaqqiñun alġaqsruimmiyumauŋa taamani. Tainnaġiaqłuŋa qaiŋaruŋa.

english: So he healed many who were sick with various diseases and drove out many demons. But he would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.
inupiaq: Tavra alġaqsruiŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋiññi iluqaani Galilee-mi, anittaqługiḷḷu ilitqusiqł̣uich iñuŋniñ.

english: Then Jesus got up early in the morning when it was still very dark, departed, and went out to a deserted place, and there he spent time in prayer.
inupiaq: Tavra kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuaq ullautiŋaruq ilaanun aasii sitquqłuni qasiḷivḷugu uqaqłuni, Pisukkuvich mamititchumiñaġiŋma.

english: Simon and his companions searched for him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nagliksratchakłuni isaaŋaruq, aasii aksiukługu uqallautiŋagaa, Piyummatiqaqtuŋa. Mamittin.

english: When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you.”
inupiaq: Tavrauvvaa kiḷḷiġruaŋi maminŋarut, aasii salummaqłuni.

english: He replied, “Let us go elsewhere, into the surrounding villages, so that I can preach there too. For that is what I came out here to do.”
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqtitchaqamiuŋ, uqaullaapiaġataŋagaa,

english: So he went into all of Galilee preaching in their synagogues and casting out demons.
inupiaq: Sumikunnii uqaġnak taavrumiŋa kimulliqaa. Aglaan aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋmugiñ qanuqitilaaġiaġlutin, aasii aitchuiḷutin ikipkautinik Moses piraksriutiŋiñik, ukpiġnaqsisaġlugu paŋmapak salumasisilaan.

english: Now a leper came to him and fell to his knees, asking for help. “If you are willing, you can make me clean,” he said.
inupiaq: Aglaan aullaqami quliaqtuaqsautigillaġmi piŋaruq sumulliqaa. Quliaqtuaqpaił̣ł̣uni Jesus isiġumiñaiŋagaa iniqpaŋnun takkuqsraġlugich iñuich. Tavra nunagluktuamiinŋaruq, aasii iñuich qaiguŋarut ilaanun sumiḷḷiqaa.

english: Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean!”
The leprosy left him at once, and he was clean.
Immediately Jesus sent the man away with a very strong warning.
He told him, “See that you do not say anything to anyone, but go, show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”

But as the man went out he began to announce it publicly and spread the story widely, so that Jesus was no longer able to enter any town openly but stayed outside in remote places. Still they kept coming to him from everywhere.
Now after some days, when he returned to Capernaum, the news spread that he was at home.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus utitqiŋaruq Capernaum-mun uvluġaaġruurat pianiŋmata. Aasii tusaaŋaniġaat aiŋatilaaŋanik.

english: So many gathered that there was no longer any room, not even by the door, and he preached the word to them.
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuat katinŋarut atautchimun, sumikunnii iniksraiġutivlutiŋ, paakkaluamiunnii. Tavra alġaqsruiŋaruq ilaiññun.

english: Some people came bringing to him a paralytic, carried by four of them.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich qaiŋarut ilaanun, qaġġisivlugu naŋittuaq avatiŋi tuquŋavlutiŋ, akigaqługu sisamat iñuich.

english: When they were not able to bring him in because of the crowd, they removed the roof above Jesus. Then, after tearing it out, they lowered the stretcher the paralytic was lying on.
inupiaq: Aasii qaninŋaġumiñaiññiqamirruŋ Jesus tativlutiŋ iñuich, qiḷaiŋagaat iglum qiḷaŋa nalaagun Jesus. Tavra qiḷaiganikamirruŋ niŋinŋagaat nalaruaq ikuvġamiñi aulasuił̣ł̣uni.

english: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
inupiaq: Jesus puttuqsrikamiuŋ ukpiġutaat, uqallautiŋagaa aulalaitchuaq, Iġñiiŋ, piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich.

english: Now some of the experts in the law were sitting there, turning these things over in their minds:
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich iḷisaurrit pitquranik aquppiruat tavrani isummatiqaŋarut inna,

english: “Why does this man speak this way? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
inupiaq: Qanuqłuniuna uqaġumiñaqpa tainna God-itun? Kiñaliqaa suliqutigiŋaiqsiyumiñaitchuq piḷuutinik itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich aglaan God kisimi.

english: Now immediately, when Jesus realized in his spirit that they were contemplating such thoughts, he said to them, “Why are you thinking such things in your hearts?
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa Jesus puttuqsrikami tainna isumaniġmata, uqallautiŋagai, Summan isumavisi tamatkuniŋa?

english: Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up, take your stretcher, and walk’?
inupiaq: Nalliak siġḷiġnaitpa uqallaksaqtuni, Piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut iliŋnun, naaggaunnii uqallaktuni, Makittin, tigulugich ikuvġatin, pisuaġiñ?

english: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” – he said to the paralytic –
inupiaq: Tavraasii ukpiġnaqsiḷiġniaġiga ilivsiññun Iġñiŋa Iñuum ataniġnaqutiqaqtilaaŋanik nunami suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaqługich piḷuutit. Ilaan aasii uqallautiŋagaa aulalaitchuaq iñuk,

english: “I tell you, stand up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
inupiaq: Uqallautigikpiñ, Makittin. Tigulugich ikuvġatin, aggiiñ iglugnun.

english: And immediately the man stood up, took his stretcher, and went out in front of them all. They were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaa makinŋaruq, tiguvlugich ikuvġani, aniŋaruq takkuanni iluqaġmiŋ. Iluqaġmiŋ kamasuŋarut, suli nanġaŋagaat God uqaqłutiŋ, Qaŋaunnii innatchimik tautuŋaitchugut.

english: Jesus went out again by the sea. The whole crowd came to him, and he taught them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus saavitqiŋaruq tatchim siñaanun, aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich ullautiŋarut ilaanun. Tavrani ilaan iḷisautiŋagai.

english: As he went along, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him. And he got up and followed him.
inupiaq: Pisuallaġmi Jesus tautuŋagaa tax-nik katitchiri, Levi iġñiŋa Alphaeus, aquppiruaq akiḷiiviŋmi tax-iñik. Jesus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Maliŋŋa. Levi-m makiłłuni maliŋagaa Jesus.

english: As Jesus was having a meal in Levi’s home, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
inupiaq: Qakugulimman Jesus niġiyaqtuŋaruq Levi-m igluanun. Tavrani iñugiaŋarut tax-nik katitchirit piḷuusiqirillu maliktuat Jesus-mun, aasii iḷaŋisa niġiñiaqasiqł̣ugu ilaa iḷitchitquraŋiḷu.

english: When the experts in the law and the Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they said to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurrit pitquranik Pharisee-guruat tautukługu niġiqatiqaqtuaq tax-nik katitchirinik, piḷuusiqiriniglu, uqallautiŋagaich iḷitchitquraŋi, Qanuqłuni niġiqatiqaqpa imiqatiqaqpalu tax-nik katitchirinik piḷuusiqiriniglu?

english: When Jesus heard this he said to them, “Those who are healthy don’t need a physician, but those who are sick do. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
inupiaq: Jesus tusaakamiuŋ taamna, uqallaŋaruq ilaiññun, Surruitchuat taaktituaksraitchut, aglaan naŋittuat. Qaiŋaitchuŋa ququaġiaġlugich nalaunŋaruat iñuich aglaan piḷuusiqirit isumalitqiquvlugich.

english: Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. So they came to Jesus and said, “Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
inupiaq: Iḷaanni qakugumman iḷitchitquraŋi John Paptaiqsim Pharisee-ḷḷu niġiḷaitkayuktut aŋaiyyuuqłutiŋ. Iñuich iḷaŋich ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun aasii apiġivlugu, Summan iḷitchitquraŋi John Paptaiqsim Pharisee-ḷḷu iḷitchitquraŋich niġiḷaitchuuvat aŋaiyyuuqłutiŋ, aasii ilivich iḷitchitquratin tainna piḷaił̣ł̣utiŋ?

english: Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot fast while the bridegroom is with them, can they? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they do not fast.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Isummatigivisigik tuyuġmiat katirrusiqiruani niġiḷaitquvlugich? Sivisutilaaŋatun uiksrautim nayuutiniŋata iliŋiññun, niġiḷaiññiaŋitchut.

english: But the days are coming when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and at that time they will fast.
inupiaq: Aglaan uiksrautim aullaurrauviksraŋa tikitchumaaqtuq, aasii taimanigu niġiḷaitpaallugniaqtut.

english: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; otherwise, the patch pulls away from it, the new from the old, and the tear becomes worse.
inupiaq: Iñuk iḷaaqtuutiqalaitchuq iḷiġniġmik nutauruamik ugliŋaitchuamik ukił̣haamik annuġaaluŋmun, qanuq nutauruaq iḷiġniq iḷaaġutauruaq ugligluni aligaaġutiniaqtuq utuqqauruamiñ annuġaamiñ, aasii allaq aglił̣haaġluni.

english: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins; otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the skins will be destroyed. Instead new wine is poured into new wineskins.”
inupiaq: Iñuum suli immiutilaitkaa nutauruaq wine puuġruanun, qanuq nutauruam wine-gum puvlagluni qaaġniaġaa puuġruaq, aasii wine maqiluni asiñun, aasiiḷi puut maqulutiŋ. Aglaan nutauruaq wine puugaksraupiaqtuq nutauruanik puunik.

english: Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples began to pick some heads of wheat as they made their way.
inupiaq: Savairvianni Jew-guruat, Jesus pisuaŋaruq palauvaksranik nautchiaqaġvikun, aasii iḷitchitquraŋi iglaullaġmiŋ nutchugairraqsiŋarut palauvaksranik.

english: So the Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is against the law on the Sabbath?”
inupiaq: Pharisees uqallautiŋagaat, Tautukkich. Iḷitchitquratin navgirut Savaiññikun pitquraptignik.

english: He said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and he and his companions were hungry –
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Taiguaġiŋaitpisiuŋ qaŋaunnii qanuq David piŋatilaaŋa, ilaalu iñuŋniḷu piiḷḷiuliqł̣utiŋ kaaksiuliqamiŋ?

english: how he entered the house of God when Abiathar was high priest and ate the sacred bread, which is against the law for any but the priests to eat, and also gave it to his companions?”
inupiaq: David isiŋaruq igluanun God-im aasii niġivḷugu punniq aitchuutauŋaruaq God-mun. Taamna piŋaruq Abiathar aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaumman. Pitqurat uqaluatigun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich kisimiŋ niġiyumiñakkaŋat taamna punniq.

english: Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for people, not people for the Sabbath.
inupiaq: Jesus suli uqallaŋaruq, Savaiññiq savaaguruq anniqsuqsaqługu iñuk, iñuk savaaguŋaitchuq pisigilugu Savaiññiq.

english: For this reason the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Iġñiŋa Iñuum ataniġnaqutiqałhaaqtuq pitquraniñ aŋalatchiruaniñ iñuŋnik Savaiññiġmi.

english: Then Jesus entered the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a withered hand.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isitqiŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋmun, tavra tavraniinniqsuq iñuk argakisuuraq.

english: They watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they could accuse him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus naipiqtuŋagaat, iluaqsiriñiaqtilaaŋanik Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋanni, pasisukługu.

english: So he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Stand up among all these people.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa iñuk argakisuuraq, Qaiñ uvuŋa.

english: Then he said to them, “Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or evil, to save a life or destroy it?” But they were silent.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iñuich, Pitquratiguaŋava Savaiññiġmi nakuurualiqiruni naagga pigiitchualiqiruni? Ikayugaksraġivisigik iñuich naagga iḷatchiġḷugich Savaiññiġmi? Tavra nivliŋiḷḷaŋarut.

english: After looking around at them in anger, grieved by the hardness of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiñiġaallakługich qinnaliŋaruq pisigivlugu sivunmuuniŋat killukuaġniŋallu, aglaattauq iḷunŋutchautigiŋagai. Ilaan uqallautiŋagaa iñuk, Isaakkich argaktin. Tavra isaaŋagai, aasii argaŋi iłuaqsirauŋarut igḷumiktun.

english: So the Pharisees went out immediately and began plotting with the Herodians, as to how they could assassinate him.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees aniŋarut, aasii tavrauvvaa sivunniuqatigiaqsivḷugich Herod-kuayaat Jesus-kun, qanuġlugu tuqutchukługu.

english: Then Jesus went away with his disciples to the sea, and a great multitude from Galilee followed him. And from Judea,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq iḷitchitquraniḷu tatchimun, aasii iñusalaich maliŋagaat Galilee-miñ Judea-miḷḷu,

english: Jerusalem, Idumea, beyond the Jordan River, and around Tyre and Sidon a great multitude came to him when they heard about the things he had done.
inupiaq: Jerusalem-miḷḷu, Idumea-miḷḷu uŋataaniḷḷu kuugum Jordan, avataanniḷḷu Tyre-vlu Sidon-lu. Iñusalaich ullaaŋagaat tusaaŋavlutiŋ sunik kamanaqtuanik savaaŋiñik.

english: Because of the crowd, he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him so the crowd would not press toward him.
inupiaq: Iñusalaich iñugiaksivaił̣ł̣utiŋ, Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani umiamik itqanaiqsitquvlugich, iñuŋnun saqigruginasugaluni.

english: For he had healed many, so that all who were afflicted with diseases pressed toward him in order to touch him.
inupiaq: Ilaan iluaqsiŋagai iñugiaktuat iñuich, aasii taamna pisigivlugu iluqaġmiŋ naŋittuat saqiraqłiŋarut tikiutiniatakłutiŋ ilaanun aksiḷḷasiñiatakługu.

english: And whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
inupiaq: Suli ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuat, tautukamirruŋ, sitquġaqtut sivuġaanun, aasii nipaalavlutiŋ, Ilivich Iġñiġigaatin God-im.

english: But he sternly ordered them not to make him known.
inupiaq: Tavra piraksripiaŋagai quliaqtuaġitquŋił̣ł̣ugu iliŋiññun kiutilaani.

english: Now Jesus went up the mountain and called for those he wanted, and they came to him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus mayuŋaruq iġġimun, aasii ququaqługich ilimiñun iñuich pigisukkani, aasii ullaŋagaat.

english: He appointed twelve (whom he named apostles), so that they would be with him and he could send them to preach
inupiaq: Tavra piksraqtaaġiŋagai qulit malġuk, iliŋiññun piqatigitquvluni, suli ilaan tilisukługich alġaqsruitquvlugich,

english: and to have authority to cast out demons.
inupiaq: suli suaŋŋatiqaquvlugich iłuaqsiyumiñaġlugich naŋirrutit, suli anitchumiñaġlugich ilitqusiqł̣uich.

english: He appointed twelve: To Simon he gave the name Peter;
inupiaq: Ukua piksraqtaaġiŋagai Simon atchikługu Peter-mik,

english: to James and his brother John, the sons of Zebedee, he gave the name Boanerges (that is, “sons of thunder”);
inupiaq: aasiiḷi James iġñiŋa Zebedee-m, John-lu aniqataa James, atchikł̣ugik Boanerges-mik, sivuniqaqtuamik kalluktun iññuk,

english: and Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot,
inupiaq: aasii Andrew-lu, Philip-lu, Bartholomew-lu, Matthew-lu, Thomas-lu, James-lu iġñiŋa Alpheus, Thaddaeus-lu, Simon-lu Zealot-guruaq,

english: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
inupiaq: Judas-lu Iscariot, aitchuutiginniktuaq ilaanik.

english: Now Jesus went home, and a crowd gathered so that they were not able to eat.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tavrani Jesus aiŋaruq. Aasii iñusalaich katitqiŋarut atautchimun niġiñiayunaiqsaallaisa Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu.

english: When his family heard this they went out to restrain him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”
inupiaq: Tavra nanmiñiq iḷaŋisa tusaakamirruŋ taamna, aullaqiŋarut aggisiyaqtuqługu Jesus, qanuq iñuich uqautigivlugu kinnaġuġnivḷugu.

english: The experts in the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebul,” and, “By the ruler of demons he casts out demons.”
inupiaq: Tavrali iḷisaurrit pitquranik qairuat Jerusalem-miñ uqaŋarut, Ilaa aŋalatiqaqtuq Beelzebul-mik, umialgannik ilitqusiqł̣uich, aasii taavrumuuna anittairuq ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik.

english: So he called them and spoke to them in parables: “How can Satan cast out Satan?
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurrit pitquranik ququaŋagai ilimiñun, aasii uqautiaqsivḷugich uuktuutitigun, Qanuġluni Satan anitchumiñaqpa inmiñik?

english: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom will not be able to stand.
inupiaq: Nunat iñuŋich atinġiġḷutiŋ inmikkuaŋasiḷutiŋ piyuutiaqsikpata, nunauniŋat siammayaaġniaqtut.

english: If a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq nanmiñiġiich atinġiġḷutiŋ piyuutiaqsikpata, taapkua nanmiñiġiikkaluat siammayaaġniaqtut.

english: And if Satan rises against himself and is divided, he is not able to stand and his end has come.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq Satan ilitqusiqł̣uŋi atinġiġumiŋ piyuutilutiŋ avanmun, ilaan suaŋŋataa isukłiññayaqtuq.

english: But no one is able to enter a strong man’s house and steal his property unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he can thoroughly plunder his house.
inupiaq: Iñuk suaŋarualuk qiḷiqsruiqqaaġlugu, iglua pakagnaġniaqtuq suġauttaiġḷugulu. Tainnatuttauq Satan payariraksrauqqaaġniaqtuq ilitqusiqł̣uŋi anitauniaqpata.

english: I tell you the truth, people will be forgiven for all sins, even all the blasphemies they utter.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi. God-im suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaġai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich iluqaisa iñuich piḷuutiŋich, iluqaisalu pigiitchuat uqallautiŋich,

english: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven, but is guilty of an eternal sin”
inupiaq: aglaan iñuk uqaqtuaq pigiitchuanik Ilitqusiġiksuaq sivuniġilugu sumikunnii suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaitchuq, qanuq pisigilugu taamna piḷuun, ilaa pasirauniaqtuq isuitchuamun.

english: (because they said, “He has an unclean spirit”).
inupiaq: Jesus taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa qanuq iñuich uqallausiġiŋagaat inna, Ilaa Jesus ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuq.

english: Then Jesus’ mother and his brothers came. Standing outside, they sent word to him, to summon him.
inupiaq: Tavra nukaaluŋi aakaŋalu qaiŋarut tavruŋa, aasii qikaqłutiŋ siḷami, tilisiŋarut ilaanun qaitquvlugu.

english: A crowd was sitting around him and they said to him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich aquppiruat avataani Jesus, uqallautiŋagaat, Qaŋma, aakaviḷḷu nukaaluuviḷḷu pisukkaatin.

english: He answered them and said, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Kiuva aakaga aniqatiitkalu?

english: And looking at those who were sitting around him in a circle, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
inupiaq: Tavra qiviaŋaruq tamatkunuŋa aquppiruanun avanmiñi, aasii uqallakłuni, Marra makua aniqatigimmatun aakagimmatullu itkitka.

english: For whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and mother.”
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñaliqaa nalautchiruaq pisuutaanik God-im, taamna aniqatigigiga, aakagigigalu.

english: Again he began to teach by the lake. Such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat on the lake and sat there while the whole crowd was on the shore by the lake.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisaurrisatqiŋaruq tatchim siñaani, aasii tavruŋa iñusalaich katinŋarut ikillasiḷaallaan umiaqpauramun aquviłłuni. Aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich siñaaniinŋarut tatchim.

english: He taught them many things in parables, and in his teaching said to them:
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan iḷisautiŋagai iñugiaktuanik sunik uuktuutitigun. Aasii iḷisaurrunmiñi uqallautivlugich,

english: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
inupiaq: Naalaġnisiŋa. Nunaliqiri aullaqtuq kanġaksruiyaqtuqłuni nautchiaksranik palauvaksraġuġniaqtuanik.

english: And as he sowed, some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
inupiaq: Tavra kanġaqsruipkaqtillugu iḷaŋich kataŋarut apqutinun, aasii tiŋmiat qaivḷutiŋ niġiŋagaich.

english: Other seed fell on rocky ground where it did not have much soil. It sprang up at once because the soil was not deep.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich aasii kataŋarut uyaġauruamun nunamun nunaqapiaŋitchuamun. Tavrauvvaa naurut, qanuq mapturuamik nunaitchuq.

english: When the sun came up it was scorched, and because it did not have sufficient root, it withered.
inupiaq: Siqiñiq salapqiġman maŋŋuił̣ł̣utiŋ, panaqłuŋagai aasii tuquvlutiŋ.

english: Other seed fell among the thorns, and they grew up and choked it, and it did not produce grain.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋich nautchiaksrat kataŋarut akunġannun kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauruat, aasii kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauvlutiŋ nagguviksraiŋagaich nautchiaksrat.

english: But other seed fell on good soil and produced grain, sprouting and growing; some yielded thirty times as much, some sixty, and some a hundred times.”
inupiaq: Allat kataŋarut nunagiksuamun, aasii nauvlutiŋ palauvaksrat iñugiaksivḷutiŋ. Iḷaŋich nauŋarut iñuiññaq qulinik palauvaksranik, iḷaŋich aasii piŋasukipiamik, aasii iḷaŋich tallimakipiamik.

english: And he said, “Whoever has ears to hear had better listen!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksraŋnik, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: When he was alone, those around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kisiŋŋuġman, tamatkua avataaniittuat piqatigivlugich qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat apiġiŋagaat uuktuutikun.

english: He said to them, “The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those outside, everything is in parables,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, God-im kaŋiqsipkaŋagaa ilivsiññun kaŋiqsiñaiñŋaruaq atanniqsimmatini iñuŋnun. Aglaalli allat iñuich tusaqsraġigaat uuktuutitigun.

english: so that although they look they may look but not see,
inupiaq: Tamatkua iñuich taŋŋiġaich Isaiah-m uqaluŋi Bible-ni,

english: and although they hear they may hear but not understand,
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, kaŋiqsiŋitkuvsiuŋ una uuktuun, qanuġlusi kaŋiqsiñiaqpisigik uuktuutipayaat?

english: so they may not repent and be forgiven.”
inupiaq: Nunaliqiri kanġaqsruimmatun nautchiaksranik palauvaksraġuġniaqtuanik, tainnatun uqalua God-im alġaqsruutauruq iñuŋnun.

english: He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? Then how will you understand any parable?
inupiaq: Nautchiaksrat iḷaŋich kataŋmatun apqutinun, tainnatuttauq iñuich iḷaŋich tusaaruat uqaluanik God-im siqquqsimmiraqtut. Tusaaganipqaġmarruŋ uqaluk Satan-gum piiguipkaġai qilamik tusaakkaŋannik.

english: The sower sows the word.
inupiaq: Allalli iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun uyaġauruamun nunamun. Tusaapqauraqamirruŋ uqaluk, quyyatigivlugu akuqtuġaat.

english: These are the ones on the path where the word is sown: Whenever they hear, immediately Satan comes and snatches the word that was sown in them.
inupiaq: Aglaan akuqtuaġiŋiññiġaat uqaluk naamasiḷugu tuniqsimmatiksraqtiŋ, nautchiaksratun maŋŋuqavigruaŋitchuatun iłłutiŋ. Tavraasii iłuiḷḷiuġutit nagliksaaqtirrusiallu, qaimmata uqaluk pisigivlugu, iliŋich tavrauvvaa nikatchaktut aasii qapiqłutiŋ.

english: These are the ones sown on rocky ground: As soon as they hear the word, they receive it with joy.
inupiaq: Allalli iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun akunġannun kakiḷḷaġnat nauruat. Tamatkua iñuich tusaagaluaqtuat uqaluŋmik,

english: But they have no root in themselves and do not endure. Then, when trouble or persecution comes because of the word, immediately they fall away.
inupiaq: uŋiarrisit mattumuuna iñuuniaġnikun, piviuttaqsriñġuvlu suġaliġnik, allallu qanusipayaat kipiġniuġutit nagguviksraiġaat uqaluk, aasii iliŋisa iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauŋił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: Others are the ones sown among thorns: They are those who hear the word,
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi allat iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun nunagiksuamun. Iliŋisa tusaagaat uqaluk akuqtupiaġataqługu, aasii iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauvlutiŋ, nautchiaksratun kataktuatun nunagiksuamun, aasii naurivḷuni palauvaksranik, iḷaŋiññik iñuiññaq qulitun, iḷaŋich piŋasukipiatun, suli iḷaŋich tallimakipiatun.

english: but worldly cares, the seductiveness of wealth, and the desire for other things come in and choke the word, and it produces nothing.
inupiaq: Qulliq inimuutisuuvarruŋ matusukługu utkusiŋmik, naagga atautitchukługu siñigviŋñun? Naumi. Iḷisuugaat qulliqaġviŋmun.

english: But these are the ones sown on good soil: They hear the word and receive it and bear fruit, one thirty times as much, one sixty, and one a hundred.”
inupiaq: Sunapayaaq matutuqtuaq paŋmapak sivunniqsauŋaruq salapqiġumaaqługu taimanigu, suli sunapayaaq iḷisimapkaqtauŋitchuaq paŋmapak sivunniqsauŋaruq iḷitchuġipkaqtauyumaaqługu iñupayaanun taimanigu.

english: He also said to them, “A lamp isn’t brought to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? Isn’t it to be placed on a lampstand?
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu, siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksraŋnik naalaġnisiŋa.

english: For nothing is hidden except to be revealed, and nothing concealed except to be brought to light.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagai, Naalaġnimmaġiksaaqsiuŋ tusaakkaqsi. Qanutun kaŋiqsisilaaqsi aktilaaqaqtuq naammaŋatun naalaġniḷḷuataqtilaavsi, suli kaŋiqsisaiññaġniaqtusi.

english: If anyone has ears to hear, he had better listen!”
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk naalaġniḷḷuataqtuaq kaŋiqsipkavsaaqtitauniaqtuq, aasiiḷi iñuk naalaġniḷḷuatalaitchuaq tammaiñiaqtuq kaŋiqsił̣auraġaluakkamiñik.

english: And he said to them, “Take care about what you hear. The measure you use will be the measure you receive, and more will be added to you.
inupiaq: Suli Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun arriliñaġumiñaqtuq nunaliqirimun, palauvaksranullu nautchirriutikkaŋiñun.

english: For whoever has will be given more, but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.”
inupiaq: Nunaliqiri siñiksaġaktuq unnuaġman, aasii itiqami uvluġman kukiḷuaqsivḷuni. Aasiivsauq tainna pipkaqługu, palauvaksrat nauyugaqtut nakautchivḷutiŋ. Nunaliqirim nalugai qanuqłutiŋ nautilaaŋat.

english: He also said, “The kingdom of God is like someone who spreads seed on the ground.
inupiaq: Nunam naupkaġai iñugiaksipkaqługich palauvaksrat atautchimiñ palauvaksramiñ. Qitutuuraq nakautaq nausaqqaaġaqtuq, nakautami nauraqtuq puuŋa palauvaksram, aasii iḷuani puuŋan nauraksraiqsuat palauvaksrat itkayuktut.

english: He goes to sleep and gets up, night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
inupiaq: Palauvaksrat nauganigluataġmata iñuk kivriñmiñik kivrisaġaqtuq palauvaksranik qanuq kivrivikaaq tikitchuq.

english: By itself the soil produces a crop, first the stalk, then the head, then the full grain in the head.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Sumun arriḷiñiaqpigu God-im Atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun? Sumik uuktuusiġñiaqpigu nausaiññaġniŋa?

english: And when the grain is ripe, he sends in the sickle because the harvest has come.”
inupiaq: Arriqaqtuq mustard-mik nautchiaksramik, mikiniqsrapiaġataŋannik nautchiaksrat. Nunaliqirim nautchirriutigaa nunamun.

english: He also asked, “To what can we compare the kingdom of God, or what parable can we use to present it?
inupiaq: Qakugulimman nauruq taaniqtusił̣haaqłuni nauriapayaaniñ. Qisiqsiutiġluksivaił̣ł̣uni tiŋmiat ugluliuġvigiŋagaich qisiqsiutiŋi.

english: It is like a mustard seed that when sown in the ground, even though it is the smallest of all the seeds in the ground –
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus alġaqsruituiññaŋaruq iñuŋnun, atuqłuni iñugiaktuanik uuktuutinik allaniglu taapkunatun. Uqautiŋagai kaŋiqsiyumiñaqtilaaŋatiktun.

english: when it is sown, it grows up, becomes the greatest of all garden plants, and grows large branches so that the wild birds can nest in its shade.”
inupiaq: Uqautilaiñŋagai uuktuutaiḷḷuni. Aglaan kisiŋŋuqamiŋ supayaat uqautini sivunniuġaġigai iḷitchitquramiñun.

english: So with many parables like these, he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear.
inupiaq: Tavra taavrumanisuli uvlumi, unnuksaġman, Jesus iḷitchitqurani uqallautiŋagai, Ikaaqta auŋatchianun tatchim.

english: He did not speak to them without a parable. But privately he explained everything to his own disciples.
inupiaq: Tavra qimaŋagaich iñusalaich, aasii aullautiŋagaat Jesus umiaqpauramun ikianiŋman. Tavraptauq tuvaaqatiqaŋammiut allanik umiaqpauranik.

english: On that day, when evening came, Jesus said to his disciples, “Let’s go across to the other side of the lake.”
inupiaq: Tavra anuqqakpaŋaruq, suli malgich iksruġaŋagaat umiaqpauraq, siḷivitkaqsivḷugu.

english: So after leaving the crowd, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat, and other boats were with him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aquaniinŋaruq umiaqpauram, siñikłuni akisiqaqłuni. Aasii itiqsaŋagaat, uqallautivlugu, Iḷisaurrii, suliqutigiŋitpiuŋ ipigupta?

english: Now a great windstorm developed and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that the boat was nearly swamped.
inupiaq: Tavra makinŋaruq, suli suaŋagaa anuġi uqallakłuni, Anuġaiġiñ, uqallakłuniḷu immamun, Quunniġuġiñ. Tavra anuġaiŋaruq, quunniġuqłuni.

english: But he was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him up and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are about to die?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Summan iqsisuvaitpisi? Qanuqimña ukpiġutaitpisi?

english: So he got up and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Be quiet! Calm down!” Then the wind stopped, and it was dead calm.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich aliuŋarut atqunaqłutiŋ, suli uqaqłutiŋ avanmun, Qanusiq una Iñuk? Anuġimunnii immavlu kamagillavatku.

english: And he said to them, “Why are you cowardly? Do you still not have faith?”
They were overwhelmed by fear and said to one another, “Who then is this? Even the wind and sea obey him!”
So they came to the other side of the lake, to the region of the Gerasenes.
