inupiaq: Tavra ikaaŋarut taaguŋatchianun tatchim Galilee-m, nunaŋannun Gerasenes.

english: Just as Jesus was getting out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came from the tombs and met him.
inupiaq: Aasii niumman Jesus umiaqpauramiñ, tavrauvvaa paaŋagaa iñuum ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuam iḷuviġniñ.

english: He lived among the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.
inupiaq: Taamna iñuk iñuuniqsuaq akunġanni iḷuvviviich, aasii kialiqaa qiḷiqsruiḷaiññiġaa, kalimñanikunnii.

english: For his hands and feet had often been bound with chains and shackles, but he had torn the chains apart and broken the shackles in pieces. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaa akulaił̣ł̣ugu qiḷiqsruigaluaġaġniġaat kalimñanik isigaŋigullu tayaġniŋigullu. Kalimñat kiktuġaaġaġniġai, suli kalimñat isigagmiñiittuat kanuqqivḷugich. Iñulimaam ittuayusipkalaiññiġaa.

english: Each night and every day among the tombs and in the mountains, he would cry out and cut himself with stones.
inupiaq: Aasii ataramik unnuamiḷu uvlumiḷu qimialuŋniitkayugniqsuq iḷuvviviŋniḷu nipaalavluni, kiḷḷiaqłuni ilimiñik uyaġagnun.

english: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down before him.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tautukamiuŋ Jesus uŋasiñun, aqpanŋaruq, aasii pułłuni sivuġaanun.

english: Then he cried out with a loud voice, “Leave me alone, Jesus, Son of the Most High God! I implore you by God – do not torment me!”
inupiaq: Suli nipaalaqpaŋaruq, Jesus, Iġñiŋa sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im, suniaqpiŋa? Apiġipiaġikpiñ God-ikun, tatavsaġnaŋa.

english: (For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of that man, you unclean spirit!”)
inupiaq: Qanuq Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Ilitqusiqł̣uuk anniiñ iñuŋmiñ.

english: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
inupiaq: Suli Jesus apiġiŋagaa, Sumik atiqaqpich? Tavra kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa atiġa Legion, qanuq iñugiaktugut.

english: He begged Jesus repeatedly not to send them out of the region.
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuam apiġipiaġataŋagaa Jesus aullaqtitquŋił̣ł̣ugich ilitqusiqł̣uich tamattumaŋŋa nunamiñ.

english: There on the hillside, a great herd of pigs was feeding.
inupiaq: Aasii tuttuqłusalaich tavraniinniqsut qaniłłutiŋ qimialuŋni niġiñiaqtuat.

english: And the demonic spirits begged him, “Send us into the pigs. Let us enter them.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uich iluqaġmiŋ apiġipiaġataŋagaat, Tillisigut tuttuqługnun, isiġumagivut.

english: Jesus gave them permission. So the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs. Then the herd rushed down the steep slope into the lake, and about two thousand were drowned in the lake.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋa Jesus aullaqtinŋagai. Aasii ilitqusiqł̣uich aniŋarut iñuŋmiñ isiqłutiŋ tuttuqługnun. Tavra tuttuqłuich paŋaliŋarut suamavlutiŋ anmun qutaŋŋiaġiksuakun immamun, aasii ipivlutiŋ. Iñugiaktilaaqaqpalliŋarut 2,000-tun.

english: Now the herdsmen ran off and spread the news in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
inupiaq: Tavrali qaunaksriruat tuttuqługnik pigruŋarut, aasii quliaqtuaġivlugu taamna iniqpaŋmi nunaaqqiñiḷu. Tavra iñuich qaiŋarut tautugiaqługu suna pisilaaŋanik.

english: They came to Jesus and saw the demon-possessed man sitting there, clothed and in his right mind – the one who had the “Legion” – and they were afraid.
inupiaq: Tavra ullaaŋagaat Jesus, suli tautukługu ilitqusiqł̣uqaŋaruaq iñugiaktuanik, aquppiruaq annuġaaŋavluni qauriŋavluniḷu. Tavra iliŋich iqsitchaŋarut.

english: Those who had seen what had happened to the demon-possessed man reported it, and they also told about the pigs.
inupiaq: Aasii tamatkua tautuktuat quliaqtuaġutiŋagaich iñuich, qanuq pirauŋatilaaŋanik taamna ilitqusiqł̣uqaŋaruaq, tuttuqłuktigullu.

english: Then they asked Jesus to leave their region.
inupiaq: Tavra apiġipiaŋagaat Jesus aullaquvlugu nunamiŋniñ.

english: As he was getting into the boat the man who had been demon-possessed asked if he could go with him.
inupiaq: Tavra ikiaqsimman umiaqpauramun, taavruma ilitqusiqł̣uqaŋaruam apiġipiaŋagaluaġaa nayuġukługu.

english: But Jesus did not permit him to do so. Instead, he said to him, “Go to your home and to your people and tell them what the Lord has done for you, that he had mercy on you.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus pipkaŋaitkaa, aglaan uqallautiŋagaa, Aggiiñ avilaitqatiŋnun, aasii quliaqtuaġutilugich qanuq kamanaqtigiruanik Atanġum piraŋiñik iliŋnun, suli naglikkutiqaŋatilaaŋanik iliŋnun.

english: So he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis what Jesus had done for him, and all were amazed.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk aullaŋaruq, aasii quliaqtuagaqsivḷuni qulinun nunaaqqiñun qanuq kamanaqtuanik Jesus savaaġikkaŋiñik ilimiñun. Aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñuich kamasuŋarut.

english: When Jesus had crossed again in a boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around him, and he was by the sea.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ikaatqianiŋman umiaqpaurakun taaguŋatchiġmun, iñusalaich katinŋarut ilaanun. Aasii ilaa tatchim siñaaniinŋaruq.

english: Then one of the synagogue rulers, named Jairus, came up, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.
inupiaq: Tavra qaiŋaruq iḷaŋat umialiŋnaŋat Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviata, Jairus-mik atilik. Aasii tautukamiuŋ Jesus punŋaruq sivuġaanun.

english: He asked him urgently, “My little daughter is near death. Come and lay your hands on her so that she may be healed and live.”
inupiaq: Aasii qiññuaqtupiaŋaruq uqaqłuni, Paniuraġa amma tuquaqsiuraqtuq. Qaiḷutin aksiugiapiaqugiga iliŋnun iłuaqsitquvlugu iñuuyumauq.

english: Jesus went with him, and a large crowd followed and pressed around him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus piqasiŋagaa. Suli iñugaaġruich malikługu tatiŋagaat.

english: Now a woman was there who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq suniġluqaqtuaq auŋmik qulit malġugni ukiuni tamaaniinŋaruq.

english: She had endured a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all that she had. Yet instead of getting better, she grew worse.
inupiaq: Taamna aġnaq nagliksaaqtuaq sapunniaqtiqaŋagaluaqtuq iñugiaktuanik taaktinik. Ilaa maniiġutiŋagaluaqtuqunnii nakuusipayaaŋaitchuq, aglaan pigiiḷisaiññaŋaruq.

english: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
inupiaq: Tusaaganiŋavluni Jesus-mik, qaiŋaruq tatiruatigun tunuaniñ, aasii aksiukługu Jesus annuġaaŋa,

english: for she kept saying, “If only I touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
inupiaq: isumavluni, aksiuksiññaġupkich unnii annuġaaŋi, iłuaqsiyumiñaqtuŋa.

english: At once the bleeding stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her disease.
inupiaq: Tavra aksiuŋagaa Jesus annuġaaŋa, aasii aunaaqsruŋaiqł̣uni tavrauvvaa. Timimiñi iḷitchuġigaa iłuaqsisilaani naŋirrunmiñiñ.

english: Jesus knew at once that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched my clothes?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, tavrauvvaa iḷitchuġivluni ilimiñiñ suaŋŋan aullaqtilaaŋanik, kiŋiaŋaruq tatiruani, aasii uqallakłuni, Kia aksiukpagich annuġaatka?

english: His disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing against you and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitquraŋisa kiuŋagaat, Tautukkitin iñusalaich tatiruat iliŋnun. Summan aasii apiqsrivich kimun aksiuŋmagaaqpich?

english: But he looked around to see who had done it.
inupiaq: Tavra alaqiñŋaruq avanmun tautugniaqługu kimun aksiuktilaani.

english: Then the woman, with fear and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq sivuuġallaġmi uulillaġmiḷu, qaiŋaruq Jesus-mun iḷisimavluni iluaqsisilaamiñik, aasii pułłuni sivuġaanun, uqautivlugu iluqaanik iḷumun ittuamik.

english: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your disease.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Paniuruatiin, ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin. Aullaġiñ tutqiksiḷutin, suli iłuaqsiraulutin naŋirrutiŋniñ.

english: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter has died. Why trouble the teacher any longer?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqaġniaqtillugu, qaiŋarut iḷaŋich kivgat Jairus igluaniñ aasii uqallautivlugu, Paniiñ tuquaniktuq. Iḷaksiaŋaiġuŋ Iḷisaurri.

english: But Jesus, paying no attention to what was said, told the synagogue ruler, “Do not be afraid; just believe.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus suliqutigisuŋaġnagu uqallautaat, uqallautiŋagaa umialiŋnaq, Iqsiñak, ukpiqsiññaġiñ.

english: He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James, and John, the brother of James.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iñuŋmun maliktinŋaitchuq, aglaan Peter-mun James-mullu John-mullu aniqataanun James.

english: They came to the house of the synagogue ruler where he saw noisy confusion and people weeping and wailing loudly.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa tikiñŋaruq igluanun umialiŋnaŋata aŋaiyyuvium, aasii tautukługich tuavaalaruat, tamatkualu qiaqpaktuat.

english: When he entered he said to them, “Why are you distressed and weeping? The child is not dead but asleep.”
inupiaq: Tavra isiqami ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Summan inna pivisi qiavisiḷu? Niviaqsiaġruk tuquŋaitchuq. Siñiksiññaqtuq.

english: And they began making fun of him. But he put them all outside and he took the child’s father and mother and his own companions and went into the room where the child was.
inupiaq: Tavra iglautigiŋagaat kipagivlugu. Aasii ilaan anitanikkamigich iluqaisa, piŋagik aapaŋalu aakaŋalu niviaqsiaġruum, taapkualu piŋasut iḷitchitqurani, aasii isiqłutiŋ niviaqsiaġruum irvianun.

english: Then, gently taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, get up.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tiguŋagaa niviaqsiaġruk argaŋigun, aasii uqallautivlugu, Talitha koum, sivuniqaqtuamik, Niviaqsiaġruuk, uqallautigikpiñ, makittin.

english: The girl got up at once and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). They were completely astonished at this.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa niviaqsiaġruk makinŋaruq, aasii pisuaqłuni. Ukiuqaŋaruq qulit malġugnik. Tavra kamasupiaġataŋarut iñuich.

english: He strictly ordered that no one should know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.
inupiaq: Tavra uqautipiaŋagai iñuŋmun iḷitchuġitquŋił̣ł̣ugu. Aasii niġipkaquŋagaa.

english: Now Jesus left that place and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa, aasii tikił̣ł̣uni nunamiñun. Suli iḷitchitquraŋisa maliŋagaat.

english: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue. Many who heard him were astonished, saying, “Where did he get these ideas? And what is this wisdom that has been given to him? What are these miracles that are done through his hands?
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋat tikiñman, iḷisaurrirraqsiŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋmi. Tavra iñugiaktuat tusaavlugu kamasuŋarut, uqaqłutiŋ, Sumiñ una iḷisimmatinikpa? Qanuqłuni isumattutinikpa? Qanuqłuni suli aliuġnaqtuanik piva?

english: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And aren’t his sisters here with us?” And so they took offense at him.
inupiaq: Kaamniġuŋitpauna, Mary-m iġñiŋa, aapiyaŋa James-gum Joses-lu Judas-lu Simon-lu? Aasiisuli nayaaluŋi uvaniinŋitpat itqatigivluta? Tavra iliŋich qanuqpaaŋaliŋarut ilaanun.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown, and among his relatives, and in his own house.”
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi Jesus uqallautiŋagai, God-im uqaqtaa nanġausiaqallaruq sumiḷiqaa, nunamiñiaglaan iḷamiñiḷu.

english: He was not able to do a miracle there, except to lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tavrani savakkumiñaiñŋaruq aliuġnaqtuanik, aglaan aksiuŋagai iñukitchuat naŋittuat aasii iłuaqsivḷugich.

english: And he was amazed because of their unbelief. Then he went around among the villages and taught.
inupiaq: Pisigivlugu ilaisa arguasuutaat, Jesus aliuŋaruq.

english: Jesus called the twelve and began to send them out two by two. He gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
inupiaq: Aasii Jesus kukiḷuŋaruq nunaaqqiñi iḷisaurrivḷuni.

english: He instructed them to take nothing for the journey except a staff – no bread, no bag, no money in their belts –
inupiaq: Tavra qaitquŋagai ilimiñun qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat, aasii aullaqtitchaaqsivḷugich malġuullaavlugich. Ilaan suaŋŋasiŋagai ilitqusiqł̣uiyaiḷḷasivḷugich.

english: and to put on sandals but not to wear two tunics.
inupiaq: Suli piraksriŋagai upaluŋaiyaquŋił̣ł̣ugich sunik iglauniksramiŋnun, aglaan ayauppiuraq kisian, puukataiḷaaġlugich, taquagiḷaaġlugich, maniiḷaaġlugich maniqaġviŋmiŋni,

english: He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave the area.
inupiaq: aluġutiqaquvlugich, aglaan malġugnik qaliġuuraqaquŋił̣ł̣ugiḷḷu.

english: If a place will not welcome you or listen to you, as you go out from there, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagai, Nunaaqqiñun tikitkuvsi tukkuġiyumagisi iñuich aiyugaaqtisi aullaġataġnivsiññun aglaan.

english: So they went out and preached that all should repent.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuich paġlaŋitpasi naalaġnisuŋitpatigiglu uqalusi, qimakkisigiksi taamna ini aasii piiyaġlugu avyuq isigavsiññiñ. Taamna kilgutauniaqtuq ilaiññun pisuŋisilaaŋanik tusaayugaaġiksuaq.

english: They cast out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaŋarut, aasii alġaqsruivḷutiŋ iñuich isumalitqiksuksraunivḷugich piḷuunmiŋniñ.

english: Now King Herod heard this, for Jesus’ name had become known. Some were saying, “John the baptizer has been raised from the dead, and because of this, miraculous powers are at work in him.”
inupiaq: Suli anittaiŋarut iñugiaktuanik ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik, suli uqsruqtiqługich olive uqsruanik iñugiaktuat naŋittuat iłuaqsivḷugich.

english: Others said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets from the past.”
inupiaq: Tavra umialik Herod tusaaŋaruq iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa, qanuq Jesus uqautigivlugu uqaluk siaminŋaruq sumulliqaa. Iñuich iḷaŋich uqaŋarut, John Paptaiqsi aŋiruq tuqqunmiñ, Tainnaqłuni aliuġnaqtuanik piḷḷaruq.

english: But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised!”
inupiaq: Allalli uqaŋarut Elijah-univḷugu. Allallivsauq uqaŋarut, uqaqtigigaa God-im, iḷaŋatitun taipkua iŋiḷġaan kamanaqtuat uqaqtiŋisun God-im.

english: For Herod himself had sent men, arrested John, and bound him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, because Herod had married her.
inupiaq: Tavrali Herod tusaakami uqallaŋaruq, John-guruq aŋiruq tuqqunmiñ, niaquiŋakkaġa.

english: For John had repeatedly told Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Herod tilisivḷuni aŋuyaktinik tigupkaŋagaa John, aasii qiḷiqsruivḷugu tigutaaġviŋmi pisigivlugu Herodias, aniqanmi Philip nuliaŋa, ilaan nulialiutikkani.

english: So Herodias nursed a grudge against him and wanted to kill him. But she could not
inupiaq: John Paptaiqsim Herod uqallautigaluamiiŋagaa, Nalaunŋaitchuq ilivich tuvaaqasiutigupku aniqarvich nuliaŋa.

english: because Herod stood in awe of John and protected him, since he knew that John was a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard him, he was thoroughly baffled, and yet he liked to listen to John.
inupiaq: Herodias isumamaqłuutiqaŋaruq John-mun tuqutitchumaliqsaallaan. Aglaan Herod-mik piñaiḷutaqaŋaruq.

english: But a suitable day came, when Herod gave a banquet on his birthday for his court officials, military commanders, and leaders of Galilee.
inupiaq: Qanuq Herod-gum John sivuuġagiŋagaa, iḷisimavluni iñulluatautilaaŋanik suli nalaunŋavluni iñuk, piyaqquqtaiḷiŋagaa. Herod-gum John naalaġniḷḷatuŋagaa tutqiiḷiqpaguugaluaŋŋaġmi naalaktuapayauraqamiuŋ.

english: When his daughter Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you.”
inupiaq: Kiisaimmaa Herodias piviksraŋa nalautitpuq. Herod annivia tikiñman niqinaqutimmagich iluqaisa qaukłiich kavamauruat, aŋuyaktillu qaukłiŋich, suġalliruallu Galilee-mi.

english: He swore to her, “Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
inupiaq: Tavra Herodias pania isiqłuni kanaakkiumman, Herod iviġaktauŋaruq tuyuġmianiḷu. Aasii umialik uqallaŋaruq niviaqsiamun, Sumik piqaġukkaluaqpich? Aitchuġumiñaġikpiñ supayaamik pigisukkaġnik.

english: So she went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” Her mother said, “The head of John the baptizer.”
inupiaq: Tavra unniqsuqłiiŋagaa nalupqinaiqł̣ugu, Supayaamik apiqsriguvich uvamniñ, aitchuutiginiaġiga iliŋnun, avvaġiluġaa unnii umialgunma.

english: Immediately she hurried back to the king and made her request: “I want the head of John the Baptist on a platter immediately.”
inupiaq: Tavra niviaqsiaq aniŋaruq, aasii uqallautivlugu aakani, Sumik piqaġugniaqpik? Tavra Herodias uqallaŋaruq, Niaquanik John Paptaiqsim.

english: Although it grieved the king deeply, he did not want to reject her request because of his oath and his guests.
inupiaq: Tavra utiŋaruq qilamiqsruqłuni umialiŋmun, aasii apiqsrivḷuni, Aitchuŋŋa akkupak niaquanik John Paptaiqsim puggutauramun.

english: So the king sent an executioner at once to bring John’s head, and he went and beheaded John in prison.
inupiaq: Tavra umialik atqunaqłuni isumaaŋaruq, aasii unniqsuqłiisini pisigivlugu, pisigivlugiḷḷu tuyuġmiani, ilaan itigaurraqtitchumiñaiñŋagaa.

english: He brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa umialik tilisiŋaruq qaunaksrimik, piraksriivḷuni John niaqua qaġġisitquvlugu. Tavra aullaqłuni, niaquiŋagaa John tigutaaġviŋmi.

english: When John’s disciples heard this, they came and took his body and placed it in a tomb.
inupiaq: Aasii qaġġisivlugu niaqua puggutauramun, aitchuutigiŋagaa niviaqsiamun, aasiiḷi niviaqsiam aitchuutigivlugu aakamiñun.

english: Then the apostles gathered around Jesus and told him everything they had done and taught.
inupiaq: Tavra John iḷitchitquraŋi tusaakamiŋ taavrumiŋa, qaivḷutiŋ piŋagaat timaa aasii iḷuviqługu.

english: He said to them, “Come with me privately to an isolated place and rest a while” (for many were coming and going, and there was no time to eat).
inupiaq: Tavra tilirauŋaruat iḷitchitqurat utiŋarut Jesus-mun, aasii quliaqtuaġutivlugu supayaanik, savaamiŋniglu, suniglu iḷisaurrutigikkamiŋnik.

english: So they went away by themselves in a boat to some remote place.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iñuich qairaġaŋarut aullaqsimmaġmiglu niġiḷḷaiqsitaallaisa Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu kiisaimmaa Jesus uqallautivai iḷitchitqurani, Aullallakta sumun iñuił̣aamun kisimġiuqtuallakkumaugut piḷaiŋaiqsiallagluta.

english: But many saw them leaving and recognized them, and they hurried on foot from all the towns and arrived there ahead of them.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaŋarut umiaqtuqłutiŋ iñuił̣aamun kisimiŋ.

english: As Jesus came ashore he saw the large crowd and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he taught them many things.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iñuich tautukługich aullaġmata, iḷisaġiŋagaich kitkuutilaaŋat. Tavraasii iñuich aullaaŋarut iluqaiññiñ nunaaqqiñiñ aqpamik qutaaguqłutiŋ, aasii tikitqaaqłutiŋ inimun sivulikługich Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu.

english: When it was already late, his disciples came to him and said, “This is an isolated place and it is already very late.
inupiaq: Jesus niukami, tautuŋagai iñusalaich suli nagliksratchaŋaruq iliŋiññik, qanuq imnaisun inŋarut munaqsraitchuatun. Tavra ilaan iḷisautirraqsiqpaŋagai.

english: Send them away so that they can go into the surrounding countryside and villages and buy something for themselves to eat.”
inupiaq: Tavra uvlukłiaqsimman iḷitchitquraŋisa ullakługu uqallautiŋagaat, uvlukłivigruaqtuq nunaaqqiiñmiuq maani.

english: But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said, “Should we go and buy bread for two hundred silver coins and give it to them to eat?”
inupiaq: Aullaqtitkich iñuich, aullaġlutiŋ nunaaqqiñun qanipayaaqtuanun tauqsiġumaut niqiksramiŋnik.

english: He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five – and two fish.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, ilivsi niġipkaqsigik. Ilaisali apiġiŋagaat, Aullaquvisigut tauqsiġiaquluta 200 taalatun niqiksraŋiññik aasii niġipkaġlugich?

english: Then he directed them all to sit down in groups on the green grass.
inupiaq: Jesus apiġiŋagai, Qavsiñik punniġutiqaqpisi? Tautugiaqsigik. Tavra iḷitchuġianikamiŋ uqallaŋarut, Tallimanik iqallugniglu malġugnik.

english: So they reclined in groups of hundreds and fifties.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Qavsiuttaaġlugich aquvititquvlugich iñuich suŋaaqtuanun iviŋnun.

english: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. He gave them to his disciples to serve the people, and he divided the two fish among them all.
inupiaq: Tavra aquptiŋarut qavsiuttaaqłutiŋ, tallimakipiaguttaqłutiglu, malġukipiaq quliguttaqłutiglu.

english: They all ate and were satisfied,
inupiaq: Tavra tiguanikamigich tallimat punniġich iqalluglu, aaġluŋaruq qiḷaŋmun, aasii quyyavigivlugu God. Aasii avguqqaaqługich punniġich, qaiñŋagai iḷitchitquramiñun, niqłiqsuutigitquvlugich iñuŋnun. Iqalluk autaaŋammigik iluqaiññun.

english: and they picked up the broken pieces and fish that were left over, twelve baskets full.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ niġiŋarut, niqinŋuġataqłutiŋ.

english: Now there were five thousand men who ate the bread.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat katitchiŋarut qulit malġugnik aguummaŋnik siḷiviłługich iḷakunik punniġnik iqallugniglu.

english: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he dispersed the crowd.
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua niġiruat 5,000-guŋarut aŋutit.

english: After saying good-bye to them, he went to the mountain to pray.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa Jesus ikitqupiaŋagai iḷitchitqurani umiaqpauramun ayutquvlugich Bethsaida-mun, tatchim taaguŋatchianun, ilaa iñuŋnik aullaqtitchipkaqtilluni.

english: When evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea and he was alone on the land.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich aullaqtitanikamigich, ilaa aullaŋaruq iġġimun aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłuni.

english: He saw them straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. As the night was ending, he came to them walking on the sea, for he wanted to pass by them.
inupiaq: Tanuġaksimman, umiaqpauraq qitqanuiḷiŋaruq tatchim, aasii Jesus kisimġiuqłuni nunami.

english: When they saw him walking on the water they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
inupiaq: Tautuŋagai iḷitchitqurani siġġaqiruat ipuqsruqłutiŋ anuġi arguġiannaqłuni. Tavra uvluyasimman ilaan ullaŋagai pisuaqłuni immam qaaŋagun. Qaaŋiqsaġumaruatun piŋagai.

english: for they all saw him and were terrified. But immediately he spoke to them: “Have courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”
inupiaq: Tavra tautukamirruŋ pisuaqtuaq qaaŋagun immam, ilitqusiunasugiŋagaat, aasii nipaalavlutiŋ.

english: Then he went up with them into the boat, and the wind ceased. They were completely astonished,
inupiaq: Qanuq iluqaġmiŋ tautuŋagaat, aasii iqsitchapiaġataŋarut. Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Quviatchaktitausitchi. Uvaŋauruŋa. Iqsiñasi.

english: because they did not understand about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.
inupiaq: Tavra ikiŋaruq umiaqpauramun, suli anuġaiŋaruq. Tavra iḷitchitquraŋi kamanniupiaġataŋarut sivuniksraqsiḷḷaiŋarut,

english: After they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and anchored there.
inupiaq: qanuq kaŋiqsiŋaitkaat sivuniŋa aliuġnaqtuaq savaaŋa punniġnik, ukpiġilguił̣ł̣ugu.

english: As they got out of the boat, people immediately recognized Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra ikaaganikamiŋ, tikiñŋarut nunaŋannun Gennesaret aasii tulakłutiŋ nunamun.

english: They ran through that whole region and began to bring the sick on mats to wherever he was rumored to be.
inupiaq: Tavra niuganiŋmata umiaqpauramiñ, tavrauvvaa iñuich iḷisaġiŋagaat Jesus.

english: And wherever he would go – into villages, towns, or countryside – they would place the sick in the marketplaces, and would ask him if they could just touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
inupiaq: Aasii aqpanŋarut iluqaagun nunakun sumulliqaa, qaġġisivḷugich nallaviksuummaisa naŋittuat, tusaaraġikamiŋ sumiitilaaŋanik.

english: Now the Pharisees and some of the experts in the law who came from Jerusalem gathered around him.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees-lu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik qairuat Jerusalem-miñ katirvigiŋagaat Jesus.

english: And they saw that some of Jesus’ disciples ate their bread with unclean hands, that is, unwashed.
inupiaq: Tavra tautuŋagaich Jesus iḷitchitquraŋisa iḷaŋich niġiruat iqaġiqqaaġaluaġnagich argatiŋ Pharisees piraksriutaatitun iñuŋnun.

english: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they perform a ritual washing, holding fast to the tradition of the elders.
inupiaq: Qanuq Pharisees, iluqaġmiglu Jews, Iqaġigaluamiiŋaunnagich argatiŋ, niġiḷaitchut, kamagivlugu taimaŋŋaqtaq iḷisaurrutaat maŋŋuuruat.

english: And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. They hold fast to many other traditions: the washing of cups, pots, kettles, and dining couches.)
inupiaq: Aasii tauqsiġñiaġviŋñiñ aikamiŋ niġiḷaitchut iqaġiŋaunnatiŋ. Suli iñugiaktuat allat akuqtuaġiŋagaich piḷġusiġisukługich, iqaġiniŋich qallugaurat, niuqqiutillu, uvluyuiḷallu utkusiich.

english: The Pharisees and the experts in the law asked him, “Why do your disciples not live according to the tradition of the elders, but eat with unwashed hands?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees-lu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik Jesus apiġiŋagaat, Summan iḷitchitquravich kamagilaitpatigik iḷisaurrutiŋich maŋŋuupta, niġivḷutiŋ iqaġiqqaaġaluaġnagich argatiŋ?

english: He said to them, “Isaiah prophesied correctly about you hypocrites, as it is written:
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Ilivsi ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii. Qanutun nalautigiŋaruq Isaiah uqaqtaa God-im uqallausiġikamisi. Ilaan aglaŋagai God-im uqaluŋi inna,

english: ‘This people honors me with their lips,
inupiaq: Suli uqallautivsaaqługich, Ayyaksaasuġisi pitquraŋi God-im piupkaġniałhaaqługich ilivsi iḷisaurrutisi.

english: but their heart is far from me.
inupiaq: Moses piraksriiŋaruq, Suuŋiḷaġinagik aapallu aakallu. Kiñaliqaa uqallautiqaqtuaq pigiitchuamik aapamigun naagga aakamigun tuqutaksraupiaqtuq.

english: They worship me in vain,
inupiaq: Ilivsiḷiasii iḷisaurrirusi iñuk piqaġniqpan sumik ikayuutigiyumiñaġaluakkamiñik aapamiñun naagga aakamiñun, aglaan uqallausiġikpagu, Taamna Corban-guruq, sivuniqaqtuamik taamna God-im pia,

english: teaching as doctrine the commandments of men.’
inupiaq: ilaa pasirauyumiñaiññigiksi ikayuŋitkaluaġumigik aapaniḷu aakaniḷu.

english: Having no regard for the command of God, you hold fast to human tradition.”
inupiaq: Tainna pikavsi, God-im uqalua anniqsuutauŋaiġiksi taimaŋŋaqtatigun iḷisaurrutivsigun iḷisaurrutigikkavsigun. Suli tainnatchiñik iñugiaktuanik piusi.

english: He also said to them, “You neatly reject the commandment of God in order to set up your tradition.
inupiaq: Tavra ququaganikamigich iluqaisa iñuich ilimiñun, Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Naalaġnisiŋa iluqapayauravsi, kaŋiqsiḷusiḷu.

english: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever insults his father or mother must be put to death.’
inupiaq: Sumik piitchuq siḷataaniñ iñuum, niġikkaŋatun, isiqtuamik ilaanun piḷuksipkaġumiñaġlugu, aglaan aniaruam iñuum iḷuaniñ, uqaluusiatun piḷġusiatullu, tamatkua iñuk piḷuksipkaġumiñagaat.

english: But you say that if anyone tells his father or mother, ‘Whatever help you would have received from me is corban’ (that is, a gift for God),
inupiaq: [Taamna pisigilugu, siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksraŋnik naalaġnisiŋa.]

english: then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or mother.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich qimakługich isiġman iglumun, iḷitchitquraŋisa apiġiŋagaat taavrumuuna uuktuutikun.

english: Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like this.”
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Kaŋiqsisaiñmivisivsauq? Kaŋiqsiŋitpisi? Supayaam iḷuanuktuam iñuum siḷanmiñ piḷuksiŋitkaa,

english: Then he called the crowd again and said to them, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand.
inupiaq: qanuq isiŋitchuq isumaqaġvianun aglaan aqiaġuanun, aasii anivḷuni timaaniñ. Tainna uqallakami, Jesus niġiñaqtualigai niqipayaurat.

english: There is nothing outside of a person that can defile him by going into him. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles him.”
inupiaq: Suli uqallavsaaŋaruq, Sum aniruam iñuŋmiñ, pigiitchuakun uqaluan piḷġusiġiitchuavlu, piḷuksipkaġaa,

english: Now when Jesus had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about the parable.
inupiaq: qanuq qamaŋŋamiñ iñuum isumaqaġvianiñ salapqiġaqtut piḷuktuat isumat, tigligaġniġich, iñuaġniġich,

english: He said to them, “Are you so foolish? Don’t you understand that whatever goes into a person from outside cannot defile him?
inupiaq: allatuutit, Kaviuqqutit, pigiitchualiqutit, sagluqqutit, pitquraiḷaġniġich, killuqsraġniġich, uqautikłiġñiġich pigiitchuamik, kamasaaġun, isumalluaġiirrun.

english: For it does not enter his heart but his stomach, and then goes out into the sewer.” (This means all foods are clean.)
inupiaq: Tamatkua iluqaġmiŋ pigiitchuat qairut iñuum iḷuaniñ, aasii piḷuksipkaqługu.

english: He said, “What comes out of a person defiles him.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋa Jesus aullaŋaruq nunaŋiññun Tyre-vlu Sidon-lu. Isiqami iglumun iḷisimatquyumaŋaitkaluaġaa sumiitilaani. Iñuich aasii iḷisimaŋagaat sumiitilaaŋa.

english: For from within, out of the human heart, come evil ideas, sexual immorality, theft, murder,
inupiaq: Tavra tamaani aġnaq paniqaġniqsuaq ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuamik tusaakami Jesus-mik, ullaŋagaa tavrauvvaa, aasii pułłuni sivuġaanun.

english: adultery, greed, evil, deceit, debauchery, envy, slander, pride, and folly.
inupiaq: Taamna aġnaq Jew-guŋitchuq, aniŋaruaq Phoenicia-mi Syria-miittuami. Ilaan apiġipiaŋagaa Jesus anitquvlugu ilitqusiqł̣uk paniŋmiñiñ.

english: All these evils come from within and defile a person.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Miqłiqtut Jew-guruat niqiksritqaaġlavut, qanuq nalaunŋaitchuq aitchuutigiruni miqłiqtum niqautaa qimmiñun.

english: After Jesus left there, he went to the region of Tyre. When he went into a house, he did not want anyone to know, but he was not able to escape notice.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnam kiuŋagaa, Aaŋ iḷisaurrii, qimmich niġisuummiut niġġiviich ataanni miqłiqtut iḷakuŋiññik.

english: Instead, a woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit immediately heard about him and came and fell at his feet.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa aġnaq, Pisigilugu kiggutin, aggiiñ. Ilitqusiqł̣uk aniŋaruq paniŋniñ.

english: The woman was a Greek, of Syrophoenician origin. She asked him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq aikami, tautuŋagaa paniñi nalaruaq siñigviŋñi, ilitqusiqł̣uk aniŋavluni ilaaniñ.

english: He said to her, “Let the children be satisfied first, for it is not right to take the children’s bread and to throw it to the dogs.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq Tyre-miñ Sidon-kuaqłuni aasii tavraŋŋa tasianun Galilee-m apqusaaqługich qulit nunaaqqich.

english: She answered, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich qaġġisiŋagaat Jesus-mun tusiḷḷaqtuaq, iptuġiqł̣uniḷu. Aasii apiġipiaŋagaat Jesus aksiuquvlugu.

english: Then he said to her, “Because you said this, you may go. The demon has left your daughter.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus asivaqtaaġutiŋagaa iñusalaŋniñ, aasii iḷiŋagai argagni siuttaŋnun, suli tivvuaqqaaqłuni, aksiuŋagaa uqaŋa.

english: She went home and found the child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.
inupiaq: Tavra aaġluqłuni qiḷaŋmun, Jesus aniqsaapaŋaruq aasii uqallautivlugu, Ephphatha, sivuniqaqtuamik, aŋmaġiñ.

english: Then Jesus went out again from the region of Tyre and came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee in the region of the Decapolis.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa siuttak aŋmaŋaruk, suli uqaŋa iłuaqsivḷuni, aasii uqaŋaruq kaŋiqsiñaqsivḷuni.

english: They brought to him a deaf man who had difficulty speaking, and they asked him to place his hands on him.
inupiaq: Tavra piraksriŋagai quliaqtuaquŋił̣ł̣ugich iñuŋmun, tavra piraksrimmaġiksaaġuraġniaġmatiŋ, tainnatułhaavsaaq atqunaqługu quliaqtuaġiŋagaat.

english: After Jesus took him aside privately, away from the crowd, he put his fingers in the man’s ears, and after spitting, he touched his tongue.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ tusaaruat kamasupiaġataŋarut, uqaqłutiŋ, Ilaa savaŋaruq supayaanik piḷḷuataqługich. Ilaan tusiḷḷaqtuat tusaallasigai, uqayuitchuallu uqallasivḷugich.

english: Then he looked up to heaven and said with a sigh, “Ephphatha” (that is, “Be opened”).
And immediately the man’s ears were opened, his tongue loosened, and he spoke plainly.
Jesus ordered them not to tell anything. But as much as he ordered them not to do this, they proclaimed it all the more.
People were completely astounded and said, “He has done everything well. He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”
In those days there was another large crowd with nothing to eat. So Jesus called his disciples and said to them,
inupiaq: Taavruma aquqiatchiaŋagun iñusalaich katinŋarut. Niqiksraiñmata, Jesus ququaŋagai iḷitchitqurani inmiñun aasii uqallautivlugich.

english: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have already been here with me three days, and they have nothing to eat.
inupiaq: Nagligigitka ukua iñuich, qanuq nayuġaanŋa uvluni piŋasuni aasii paŋmapak niqiksraiġutirut.

english: If I send them home hungry, they will faint on the way, and some of them have come from a great distance.”
inupiaq: Aisaqtitkupkich niġipkaġaluaġnagich, sayaiġñiaqtut apqunmi, qanuq iḷaŋich qaiŋarut uŋasiksuamiñ.

english: His disciples answered him, “Where can someone get enough bread in this desolate place to satisfy these people?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitquraŋisa kiuŋagaat, Sumiñ iñuum niġisuiqsinniaqpagich ukua iñuich maani nunagluktuami?

english: He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They replied, “Seven.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai, Qavsiñik punniġutiqaqpisi? Iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Tallimat malġugnik.

english: Then he directed the crowd to sit down on the ground. After he took the seven loaves and gave thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples to serve. So they served the crowd.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich piraksriŋagai aquvitquvlugich nunamun. Tiguvlugich tallimat malġuk punniġich quyyavigiqqaaqługu God, avguŋagai aasii aitchuutigivlugich iḷitchitquramiñun autaaquvlugich iñuŋnun. Tavra iḷitchitqurat tainna piŋarut.

english: They also had a few small fish. After giving thanks for these, he told them to serve these as well.
inupiaq: Suli iqaluutiqaŋarut iñukitchuanik iqalukułłuuranik. Jesus quyyavigiqqaaqługu God, piraksriŋagai iḷitchitqurani niqłiksuutigitquvlugich iñuŋnun.

english: Everyone ate and was satisfied, and they picked up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
inupiaq: Iñupayaat niġiŋarut niqinŋuġataqłutiŋ. Iñugiaktilaaqaqpalliŋarut 4,000-tun.

english: There were about four thousand who ate. Then he dismissed them.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat katitchiŋarut iḷakunik tallimat malġuk aguummakpaich siḷiviłługich. Taamna pianiŋman, Jesus aullaqtinŋagai iñuich.

english: Immediately he got into a boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaa ikiŋaruq umiaqpauramun piqatigivlugich iḷitchitqurani, aasii tikiñŋarut Dalmanutha-mun.

english: Then the Pharisees came and began to argue with Jesus, asking for a sign from heaven to test him.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisa Pharisees ullaŋagaat Jesus aasii uqavaaġutiaqsivḷugu. Uuktuġukługu apiġiŋagaat tautuktitquvlutiŋ aliuġnaqtuamik qiḷaŋmiñ, iḷisimanaqsisaġlugu God-mun iviġaumagitilaaŋa.

english: Sighing deeply in his spirit he said, “Why does this generation look for a sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to this generation.”
inupiaq: Tavra aniqsaapaŋaruq atqunaq, aasii uqallakłuni, Summan makua iñuich apiqsrivat tautugukłutiŋ aliuġnaqtuamik? Uqallautigivsi, tainnasiq aliuġnaqtuaq tautuktitauniaŋitchuq taapkunuŋa iñuŋnun.

english: Then he left them, got back into the boat, and went to the other side.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan qimaŋagai, aasii ikitqikł̣uni umiaqpauramun, ikaaŋarut taaguŋatchianun tatchim.

english: Now they had forgotten to take bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat puiguiŋarut punniliraaksramiŋnik, aglaan punniġutiqaŋarut atautchimik umiaqpauramiŋñi.

english: And Jesus ordered them, “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷitchitqurani kiliŋagai uqaqłuni, Qaunagisitchi imaksrautiŋiññiñ Pharisees-lu umialguvlu Herod-gum.

english: So they began to discuss with one another about having no bread.
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat uqarraqsiŋarut avanmun, Ilaa uqallaktuq tainna, punniġutaiññapta.

english: When he learned of this, Jesus said to them, “Why are you arguing about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Have your hearts been hardened?
inupiaq: Jesus iḷisimavlugu uqautigikkaŋat uqallautiŋagai, Summan uqaaġutigivisiuŋ punniġutaiññiq? Iḷitchuġiŋaitpisi kaŋiqsiŋaił̣ł̣usiḷu? Puqiisigivisi tainnatun?

english: Though you have eyes, don’t you see? And though you have ears, can’t you hear? Don’t you remember?
inupiaq: Iriqaġaluaqłusi tautuksiḷaitpisi? Siutiqaġaluaqłusi tusaalaitpisi? Piiguturusi.

english: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They replied, “Twelve.”
inupiaq: Avguqapkich tallimat punniġich 5,000-nun iñuŋnun, qavsiñik aguummagnik siḷiviłługich iḷakunik katitchiŋavisi? Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Qulit malġugnik.

english: “When I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They replied, “Seven.”
inupiaq: Suli avguqapkich tallimat malġuk punniġich 4,000-nun iñuŋnun, qavsiñik aguummakpaŋnik siḷiviłługich iḷakunik katitchiŋavisi? Tavra kiuŋagaat, Tallimat malġugnik.

english: Then he said to them, “Do you still not understand?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Naaggasuliuvva kaŋiqsiŋaitchusi uqautiqaqtilaamnik iḷisaurrutiŋiññik Pharisees-lu Herod-lu.

english: Then they came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to Jesus and asked him to touch him.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut Bethsaida-mun, suli qaġġisiŋagaat iñuk ayauŋaruaq Jesus-mun, apiġipiaqługu aksiuquvlugu.

english: He took the blind man by the hand and brought him outside of the village. Then he spit on his eyes, placed his hands on his eyes and asked, “Do you see anything?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tiguŋagaa ayauŋaruaq argaŋigun, aasii aullativlugu annisiŋagaa nunaaqqimiñ. Tavra tivvuaganikamiuŋ irrakkun, suli aksianikamiuŋ apiġiŋagaa, Sumik tautullasivich?

english: Regaining his sight he said, “I see people, but they look like trees walking.”
inupiaq: Tavra aaġluŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Tautukkitka iñuich pisuaqtuat ilaapkua napaaqtut.

english: Then Jesus placed his hands on the man’s eyes again. And he opened his eyes, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
inupiaq: Taamna pianiŋman Jesus aksiutqiŋagaa irrakkun. Tavrani iñuk qiñimmaġiksaapiaŋaruq aasii tautuksiḷḷasiŋaruq takpiksivḷuni.

english: Jesus sent him home, saying, “Do not even go into the village.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aipkaŋagaa igluanun, uqallautivlugu, Nunaaqqimugnak.

english: Then Jesus and his disciples went to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu aullaŋarut nunaaqqiŋiñun Caesarea Philippi-m. Iglaullaġmiŋ iḷitchitqurani apiġiŋagai, Uqallautisiŋa iñuich kiunisuuvanŋa?

english: They said, “John the Baptist, others say Elijah, and still others, one of the prophets.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Iñuich iḷaŋisa John-gunisuugaatin Paptaiqsi, allalli Elijah-univḷutin, aasiivsauq allat iḷaginivḷutin uqaqtiŋiñun God-im.

english: He asked them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him, “You are the Christ.”
inupiaq: Jesus apiġiŋagai, ilivsiḷiasii kiunivisiŋa? Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Ilivich Christ-gurutin God-im Tiliraŋa.

english: Then he warned them not to tell anyone about him.
inupiaq: Jesus piraksriŋagai, Uqautiginagu taamna kimulliqaa.

english: Then Jesus began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisautirraqsiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Iġñiŋa Iñuum nagliksaaqpaktuksrauruq, pisuŋiññiaġaallu Jew-guruat atanauraŋisa, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu, iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik. Aasiisuli tuqutauluŋa, piŋayuagniasii uvluk aŋiḷuŋa.

english: He spoke openly about this. So Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqautigiŋagaa taamna iliŋiññun kaŋiqsiñaqsipiaqługu. Tavra Peter-m asivaqtaaġutivlugu uqallautiŋagaa, Tainna uqaqtuksrauŋitchutin.

english: But after turning and looking at his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan. You are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but on man’s.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaqługich iḷitchitqurani, suaŋagaa Peter, Satan, piiġiñ uvamniñ. Isumaŋitchutin God-im isummasianik, aglaan iñuich isumaŋannik.

english: Then Jesus called the crowd, along with his disciples, and said to them, “If anyone wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ququaganikamigich iñuich ilimiñun iḷitchitquraniḷu, uqallautiŋagai, Kialiqaa maligukkumiŋa, piruksrauŋitchuq ilaan pisukkamiñik, iqsriutilugu aŋarraurani, itqanaitchuksrauruq tuqutautigiyumiñaġluŋaunnii.

english: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and for the gospel will save it.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk iñuullatuvaił̣aktuaq tammaiñiaqtuq iñuggunmiñik, aglaalli iñuk sullatuaġumiḷu atiruaq tuqqutiyumiñaġluŋaunnii, tusaayugaaġiksuaġlu, tammaiyumiñaipiaġaa iñuggutini.

english: For what benefit is it for a person to gain the whole world, yet forfeit his life?
inupiaq: Iñuk suġallakkaluaġumi supayauranik nunamiittuanik aasii tammautigilugich, ilaa suuramik-unnii anniqsuġumiñaitchuq inmiñik.

english: What can a person give in exchange for his life?
inupiaq: Sumik piitchuq iñuum simmiutiksraŋanik iñuggunmiñun.

english: For if anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”
inupiaq: Qanuġviitchuq. Iñuum kanŋugikpaŋa iḷisaurrutitkalu iñuŋnun ukpiġutaitchuanun piḷuktuanullu, uvaŋaptauq Iġñiŋan Iñuum kanŋuginiaġmigiga qaiguma qaumanġani Aapama piqatigilugich piḷuutaitchuat isaġulgich.

english: And he said to them, “I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the kingdom of God come with power.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq. Iḷumun uqallautigivsi. Marra iñuich iḷaŋich ittut tuquniaŋitchuat tautuŋaiñŋaan kamanaqtuakun atanniqsimannigniksraŋa God-im.

english: Six days later Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John and led them alone up a high mountain privately. And he was transfigured before them,
inupiaq: Tavra itchaksrat uvlut pianiŋmata, Jesus piqasiutiŋagai Peter-lu James-lu John-lu, aasii mayuutivlugich qutchiksuamun iġġimun kisiisa. Tavrani ilaan qiññaŋa allaŋuŋaruq takkuanni.

english: and his clothes became radiantly white, more so than any launderer in the world could bleach them.
inupiaq: Suli annuġaaŋi qaummaġiksiŋarut, qatiqsipiaġataqłutiŋ aputitun, qatiqpaił̣ł̣utiŋ kialiqaa nunami salummaġumiñaiñŋagai qatiqsił̣haaġlugich.

english: Then Elijah appeared before them along with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra niptaŋaruk Elijah-lu Moses-lu, aasii iliŋikta uqaqatigiŋagaak Jesus.

english: So Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three shelters – one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaguliqsiŋaruq Jesus-mun, Iḷisaurrii, nakuuruq maaniinnapta. Tupiqta piŋasunik iḷaŋat iliŋnun, iḷaŋat suli Moses-mun, atausiqsuli Elijah-mun.

english: (For they were afraid, and he did not know what to say.)
inupiaq: Ilaa naluŋaruq sumik uqallautiksramik, iqsivaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: Then a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came from the cloud, “This is my one dear Son. Listen to him!”
inupiaq: Tavra nuvuyam qulaunŋagai, aasii nuvuyamiñ iġiña, uqallaŋaruq. Uvva piviuttaġiraġa Iġñiġa. Naalaġnisiuŋ, aasii kamagilugu.

english: Suddenly when they looked around, they saw no one with them any more except Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvva, alaqisanikamiŋ tautuŋaitchut iñuŋmik, aglaan Jesus kisian iliŋiḷḷu.

english: As they were coming down from the mountain, he gave them orders not to tell anyone what they had seen until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
inupiaq: Tavra atqallaġmiŋ iġġimiñ, piraksriŋagai quliaqtuaquŋił̣ł̣ugich iñuŋmun sunik tautuŋakkamiŋnik, Iġñiŋa Iñuum aŋiḷġataqtillugu tuqqunmiñ.

english: They kept this statement to themselves, discussing what this rising from the dead meant.
inupiaq: Tavra quliaqtuaġiŋaitkaat taamna. Apiqsruqtuutirraqsiŋarut avanmun sumik aŋiñiq tuqqunmiñ sivuniqaġmagaan.

english: Then they asked him, “Why do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
inupiaq: Tavra apiġiŋagaat Jesus, Summan iḷisaurrit pitquranik uqaġuuvat Elijah qaiqqaaqtuksraunivḷugu qaiŋaiñŋaan Christ-guruaq?

english: He said to them, “Elijah does indeed come first, and restores all things. And why is it written that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be despised?
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷumun ittuq Elijah qaiqqaaġniaqtuq Christ-miñ aasii itqanaiġñiaġai supayaat. Aglaalli qanuq Bible uqaluŋich uqaluqaqpat Iġñiŋagun Iñuum? Inna uqaluqaqtut, nagliksaaqpaktuksraunivḷugu suli pisuŋisauluni.

english: But I tell you that Elijah has certainly come, and they did to him whatever they wanted, just as it is written about him.”
inupiaq: Aglaalli uqallautigivsi, Elijah qaiganiŋaruq, aasii iñuich piŋagaat qanupayauraq pisukamirruŋ, nalautiłługich aglausimaruat Bible-ni ilaagun.

english: When they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and experts in the law arguing with them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiññami iḷitchitquramiñun pairuanun, tautuŋagai iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñusalaich avataanni iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik uqavaaqtuat iḷitchitquranun.

english: When the whole crowd saw him, they were amazed and ran at once and greeted him.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa iluqaġmiŋ iñuich, tautukamirruŋ Jesus, atqunaqłutiŋ niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut, aasii aqpałłutiŋ ilaanun paġlaŋagaat.

english: He asked them, “What are you arguing about with them?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan apiġiŋagai, Sunik uqavaaġutiqaqpisi?

english: A member of the crowd said to him, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that makes him mute.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋata iñusalaich kiuŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, qaġġisiŋagiga iliŋnun iġñiġa. Ilaa uqalaitchuq ilitqusiqł̣uqaqłuni.

english: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they were not able to do so.”
inupiaq: Ilitqusiqł̣uum aŋalataġirraqsimmagu, ilaan iqł̣ataġiraġigaa, innuliqiraqtuġlu, tiriqtitakługiḷḷu kigutini, tiggaqsivluniḷu. Aasii apiġiŋagaluaġitka iḷitchitquratin ilaiññun anitquvlugu ilitqusiqł̣uk aasii anilaiñŋagaat.

english: He answered them, “You unbelieving generation! How much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I endure you? Bring him to me.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, qanutun uvva ukpiġutaisigirusi iñuich. Qanutun sivisutigiruamik nayugaksraġivisi ukpiliġataqtillusi? Qanutun igḷutugaksraġivisi? Qaġġitchuuŋ nukatpiaġruk uvamnun.

english: So they brought the boy to him. When the spirit saw him, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell on the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa qaġġisiŋagaat Jesus-mun. Tautugmagu Jesus, tavrauvvaa ilitqusiqł̣uum qiiqsruqtinŋagaa, aasii ulġuŋaruq nunamun, suli aksralikłuni innuliqivluni qaniġmiñi.

english: Jesus asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said, “From childhood.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagaa aapaŋa, Qaŋaaglaan tainnaiḷiŋava? Ilaan kiuŋagaa, Miqłiqtuurauniġmiñiñaglaan.

english: It has often thrown him into fire or water to destroy him. But if you are able to do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
inupiaq: Akulaitchuami ulġuttaġigaa igniġmun, immamullu, tuqutchukługu. Piḷḷaguvich supayaamik, nagligilunuk ikayuqtiguk.

english: Then Jesus said to him, “‘If you are able?’ All things are possible for the one who believes.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Apiqsrivich piḷḷatilaamnik? Supayaaq piḷḷaruq ukpiġutiqaqtuamun.

english: Immediately the father of the boy cried out and said, “I believe; help my unbelief!”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa aapaŋa miqłiqtum uqallaŋaruq nipatuvluni, Ataniiq, ukpiqtuŋa. Ikayuŋŋa ukpilivsaaquluŋa.

english: Now when Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamigich iñuich qairuat aqpamik atautchimun, ilaan suaŋagaa ilitqusiqł̣uk, Ilivich ilitqusiqł̣uuk, uqalaisitchiruatiin tusaalaisitchiruatiillu anitqugikpiñ nukatpiaġruŋmiñ. Isitqigñak ilaanun.

english: It shrieked, threw him into terrible convulsions, and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, “He is dead!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uk nipaalaŋaruq, suli iqł̣ataġiqqaaqługu atqunaq nukatpiaġruk, aniŋaruq ilaaniñ. Tavra iḷiŋaruq tuquŋaruatun iñugiaktuat uqallallasivḷugich, Tuquruq.

english: But Jesus gently took his hand and raised him to his feet, and he stood up.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tiguŋagaa argaŋigun, aasii ikayuqługu makitiłługu, aasii makinŋaruq.

english: Then, after he went into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isiġman iglumun, iḷitchitquraŋisa apiġiŋagaat suiḷaurivḷutiŋ, Summan uvagut ilitqusiqł̣uk anilaitpisigu?

english: He told them, “This kind can come out only by prayer.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Aŋaiyyutim kisimi anillagaa tainnasiq ilitqusiqł̣uk, sum allam piyumiñaitkaa.

english: They went out from there and passed through Galilee. But Jesus did not want anyone to know,
inupiaq: Tavra aullaŋarut tavraŋŋa, aasii iglauvlutiŋ Galilee-kun. Ilaan iñupayaamun iḷisimatquŋaitkaa sumiitilaani,

english: for he was teaching his disciples and telling them, “The Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.”
inupiaq: qanuq iḷisautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, suli uqallautiŋagai, Iġñiŋa Iñuum aitchuutauniaqtuq iñuŋnun, aasii tuqunniaġaat. Tuqutauganikkumi, ilaa aŋiñiaqtuq piŋayuagni uvluk.

english: But they did not understand this statement and were afraid to ask him.
inupiaq: Tavra kaŋiqsiŋaitkaat taamna uqaluk, suli taluqsraŋarut apiġiniaġniksraŋagun.

english: Then they came to Capernaum. After Jesus was inside the house he asked them, “What were you discussing on the way?”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut Capernaum-mun. Iglumiillaġmiŋ Jesus apiġiŋagai, Sumik uqavaaġutiqaqtuasii avanmun iglaullapta?

english: But they were silent, for on the way they had argued with one another about who was the greatest.
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat kiuŋaitkaat, qanuq iglaullaġmiŋ uqaŋarut avanmun kiña kamanaġniqsrauniaġmagaan.

english: After he sat down, he called the twelve and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”
inupiaq: Tavra aquvinŋaruq, aasii qaitquŋagai qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat, aasii uqallautivlugich, Kiñaliqaa iluqaiññiñ kamanaqsił̣haaġukkumi, kamanaił̣haaqtuksrauruq inmiñik, kivgaliutiluni iluqaiññun.

english: He took a little child and had him stand among them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tiguŋagaa miqłiqtuq, aasii inillakługu akunġannun, aasii saġlirriutianikamiuŋ, uqallautiŋagai,

english: “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.”
inupiaq: Iñuum paġlakpauŋ miqłiqtuuraq uvaŋa pisigiluŋa, uvaŋa paġlagaaŋa. Kialiqaa paġlakamiŋa uvaŋałhiñaq paġlaŋitkaaŋa aglaallu tilisiŋaruaq uvamnik.

english: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he was not following us.”
inupiaq: Tavra John uqallautiŋagaa Jesus, Iḷisaurrii, tautuktuaguut iñuŋmik anittairuamik ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik atuqługu atqiñ, aasii iñiqtikkaqput, qanuq uvaptiŋnun piqatauŋiñman.

english: But Jesus said, “Do not stop him, because no one who does a miracle in my name will be able soon afterward to say anything bad about me.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iñiqtiġnagu. Qanuq aliuġnaqtuamik savakkumiñaqtuamik iñuitchuq atuġlugu atiġa, pigiitchuamik uqautigiyumiñallaġmiŋa.

english: For whoever is not against us is for us.
inupiaq: Qanuq akiḷḷiḷiqsuutiŋitchuaq uvaptiŋnun iḷagigikput.

english: For I tell you the truth, whoever gives you a cup of water because you bear Christ’s name will never lose his reward.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa aitchuġumisi qallugauramun imiġmik imigaksravsiññik Christ pigimmasi, iḷumun uqallautigivsi, akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtuq.

english: “If anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a huge millstone tied around his neck and to be thrown into the sea.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa piḷuksipkaqpauŋ iḷaŋat makua miqłiqtuuratun iḷivḷutiŋ ukpiqtuat uvamnun, iłuałhaaġayaqtuq uyaġagruamik quŋusiġutchiġḷugu taamna iñuk igitaukpan taġiumun.

english: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better for you to enter into life crippled than to have two hands and go into hell, to the unquenchable fire.
inupiaq: Argakpich piḷuksipkaqpatin, iñuugiñ argaiqsuatun piḷutin. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq isiġuvich atanniqsimavianun God-im atautchimikunnii argaqaġlutin, iluqaaktun argaqaġniġmiñ aasii nagliksaaġviŋmuktitaulutin, igniġmun qamilaił̣aamun.

english: If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better to enter life lame than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
inupiaq: [Taavrumani inimi, qupilġut niġiruat tuqulaitchut, suli igniq sumikunnii qamilaitchuq.]

english: If your eye causes you to sin, tear it out! It is better to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli isigakpich piḷuksipkaqpatin, iñuugiñ isigaiqsuatun piḷutin. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq isiġuvich atanniqsimavianun God-im isigaitkaluaŋŋaqpich malġugnik isigaqaġniġmiñ aasii nagliksaaġviŋmuktitaulutin.

english: where their worm never dies and the fire is never quenched.
inupiaq: [Taavrumani inimi, qupilġut niġiruat tuqulaitchut, suli igniq sumikunnii qamilaitchuq.]

english: Everyone will be salted with fire.
inupiaq: Suli irivich piḷuksipkaqpatin, iñuugiñ iraiqsuatun piḷutin. Iłuałhaaġayaqtuq isiġuvich God-im atanniqsimavianun iriqaġlutin atautchimik malġugnik iriqaġniġmiñ aasii nagliksaaġviŋmuktitaulutin.

english: Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with each other.”
inupiaq: Taavrumani inimi qupilġut niġiruat timiŋiññik tuqulaitchut, suli igniq sumikunnii qamilaitchuq.

english: Then Jesus left that place and went to the region of Judea and beyond the Jordan River. Again crowds gathered to him, and again, as was his custom, he taught them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa, aullaqłuni nunanun Judea-miittuanun, taavuŋatchianullu kuugum Jordan. Iñusalaich ullaŋagaat aasii ilaan iḷisautiŋagai piḷġusikaamisun.

english: Then some Pharisees came, and to test him they asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees ullaŋagaat, aasii killuqsaqtinniaqługu apiġiŋagaat. Pitquraptigni nalaunŋava iñuum avitpagu nuliani?

english: He answered them, “What did Moses command you?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Qanuq pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun piraksriŋavasi?

english: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of dismissal and to divorce her.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Moses suŋiññiŋagaa iñuk aglagluni nalupqinaiġutinik makpiġaamun avirrusiuqpan, aasii aullaqtillugu nuliani.

english: But Jesus said to them, “He wrote this commandment for you because of your hard hearts.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Taamna pitquraq qaisauruaq Moses-kun aglaaguŋaruq ilivsi pisigivlusi iḷisautitchiġiiññavsi.

english: But from the beginning of creation he made them male and female.
inupiaq: Supayaat savaaguqqaaġmata, God savaŋaruq aŋunmiglu aġnamiglu.

english: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother,
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu aŋutim qimaguuniġik aapaniḷu, aakaniḷu, aasii nayuqsiutivlugu nuliani.

english: and the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two, but one flesh.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋik malġuuruak atautchisun iñuktun iḷiñiaqtuk. Tavraŋŋaaglaan malġuuŋaiqsuk, aglaan atausiŋŋuqtuk.

english: Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu, iñuum avinŋaiḷḷiuŋ tuvaaqatini God-im atautchimuktinŋammatik.

english: In the house once again, the disciples asked him about this.
inupiaq: Tavra iglumi iḷitchitquraŋisa apiġitqiŋagaat taavrumiŋa.

english: So he told them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Kialiqaa avitkumiuŋ nuliani, aasii nuliaġluni allamik, allattuqtuq, piḷuksivḷuni nuliaqqaamiñun.

english: And if she divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli aġnaq allattuqtuq avinnamiuŋ uiñi allamik uiñitqikł̣uni.

english: Now people were bringing little children to him for him to touch, but the disciples scolded those who brought them.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋisa qaġġisiŋagaich miqłiqtut, Jesus-mun aksiuquvlugich. Tavra iḷitchitquraŋisa suaŋagaich tamatkua qaġġirriruat iliŋiññik.

english: But when Jesus saw this, he was indignant and said to them, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi Jesus iḷitchuġikamiuŋ taamna, iviġaumaiñŋaruq atqunaqłuni, aasii uqallautivlugich, Miqłiqtuurat qaipkaqsigik uvamnun, suli pitquŋiññagich. Tainnaiḷiŋaruat God-im atanniqsimagai.

english: I tell you the truth, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter it.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi. Kialiqaa ukpiġiŋitpagu God miqłiqtuuram ukpiqsrausiatun, isiġumiñaitchuq God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: After he took the children in his arms, he placed his hands on them and blessed them.
inupiaq: Tavra tigumirriutiŋagai miqłiqtuurat, iḷivḷugich argagni ilaiññun aŋaiyyutiŋagai.

english: Now as Jesus was starting out on his way, someone ran up to him, fell on his knees, and said, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
inupiaq: Tavra aullaġman apqutitigun, qaiŋaruq iñuk aqpamik, aasii sitquqłuni apiġivlugu, Iḷisaurrigiksuaq, sumik piñiaqpik isuitchuamik iñuggutinnagugluŋa?

english: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Summan taiviŋa nakuuruamik? Nakuuruagitchuq iñuŋmik, God kisimi.

english: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony, do not defraud, honor your father and mother.’”
inupiaq: Iḷisimagitin pitqurat, Allatuġnak, Iñuaġnak, Tigliŋnak, Saglunak, Saglutaġniŋnak, Suuŋiḷaġinagik aapallu aakallu.

english: The man said to him, “Teacher, I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws since my youth.”
inupiaq: Iñuum kiuŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, iluqaisa tamatkua kamagiŋagitka nutaġaunnamniñ.

english: As Jesus looked at him, he felt love for him and said, “You lack one thing. Go, sell whatever you have and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiñillaan piviuttaġivlugu, uqallautiŋagaa, Atausivsaamik piruksraurutin. Aullaġiñ, tunikkich supayaat pisin, aasii aitchuutigilugich maniich iḷiappauruanun, tavra piiḷḷiuġniaŋitchutin qiḷaŋmi. Aasii qaiḷutin, maliŋŋa.

english: But at this statement, the man looked sad and went away sorrowful, for he was very rich.
inupiaq: Tavra ipiqtutchautigiŋagaa taamna uqaluk, aasii aullaqłuni nikatchakłuni, qanuq iñugiaktuanik suġaliqaŋaruq.

english: Then Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus alaqiñŋaruq avanmun, aasii uqallautivlugich iḷitchitqurani, Qanutun siġḷiġnaqtiginiaqtuq suġalliruat iñuich isiġniaġniksraŋat God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: The disciples were astonished at these words. But again Jesus said to them, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut taapkunuuna Jesus uqaluŋigun, aasii ilaan uqallautivsaaŋagai, Miqłiqtuut, qanutun siġḷiġnaqtigiruq isiġniaġniksraŋat God-im atanniqsimavianun, tamatkua nayummatiqaqtuat suġaliġnik.

english: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Siġḷiġnaił̣haaqtuq pikukturuaq kakakti iraaguaġumi mitqutim, suġalliruam isiġniaġniŋaniñ God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: They were even more astonished and said to one another, “Then who can be saved?”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiiḷḷaqtaupiaġataŋarut uqaqłutiŋ ilimiŋnun, Kiñaasiiñ annaurrauniaqpa?

english: Jesus looked at them and replied, “This is impossible for mere humans, but not for God; all things are possible for God.”
inupiaq: Jesus takunnaqługich uqallaŋaruq, Taamna piyumiñaitkaluaġaat iñuich, aglaan God-im piyumiñaġaa. God supayaanik piḷḷaruq.

english: Peter began to speak to him, “Look, we have left everything to follow you!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqarraqsiŋaruq ilaanun, Iḷisimarutin uvagut qimaiŋarugut supayaanik, aasii malikłutin.

english: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, there is no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for my sake and for the sake of the gospel
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, pisigiluŋa tusaayugaaġiksuaġlu iñuk qimairuaq iglumiñik, naagga aniqatiinik, naagga aapamik, aakamiglu, naagga miqłiqtunik, naagga nunamiñik,

english: who will not receive in this age a hundred times as much – homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, fields, all with persecutions – and in the age to come, eternal life.
inupiaq: aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq tallimakipiatun iḷiḷugich paŋmapaŋmi qimakkani, iglut, aniqatit, aakat, miqłiqtut, nunat, iḷalugich nagliksaaqtirrusianik. Suli taimanigu iñuggutinnagniaqtuq isuitchuamik.

english: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
inupiaq: Aglaan qaunagisitchi. Iñugiaktuat paŋmapak salliuniataktuat qamalliġuurrauniaqtut. Suli iñugiaktuat paŋmapak qamalliuruat salliġuutiniaqtut.

english: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem. Jesus was going ahead of them, and they were amazed, but those who followed were afraid. He took the twelve aside again and began to tell them what was going to happen to him.
inupiaq: Tavra iglauŋarut aullaqłutiŋ Jerusalem-mun, Jesus sivulliuŋagai. Aasii iḷitchitqurat allayuaŋarut. Suli allat iñuich maliġuaġniallaan, taluqsratchaŋarut. Tavra Jesus qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurani ilaaguaġutitqiŋagai, aasii uqautivlugich sutigun piyumaaqtuatigun inmiñun.

english: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and experts in the law. They will condemn him to death and will turn him over to the Gentiles.
inupiaq: Naalaġnisiŋa, Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iglaurugut uvva Jerusalem-mun Iġñiŋan Iñuum aitchuutauviksraŋanun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun, pitquraniglu iḷisaurriñun. Tuqutaksrauniñiaġaat aasii qaiḷḷugu Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: They will mock him, spit on him, flog him severely, and kill him. Yet after three days, he will rise again.”
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua kipaginiaġaat, tivvuaqtuġniaġaallu ipiġaqtuġlugulu, suli tuqunniaġaat. Aasii uvluk piŋayuaŋni, ilaa aŋiñiaqtuq.

english: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him and said, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
inupiaq: Tavra James-lu John-lu iġñak Zebedee-m qaiŋaruk Jesus-mun aasii uqallautivlugu, Iḷisaurrii, sumik samma pisitqugaluaqtuguk iliŋnun.

english: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagik, Sumik pisitquyumavisik uvamnun?

english: They said to him, “Permit one of us to sit at your right hand and the other at your left in your glory.”
inupiaq: Iliŋikta kiuŋagaak, aquvitkuvich umialguniġni iksivautaġnun kamanaqtuami atanniqsimmanmi, iliŋnun aquvititquruguk avatiŋnun, aippaqpuk taliqpiŋñun aasii igḷukpuk saumiŋñun.

english: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I experience?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagik, nalurutik sumik apiqsrisilaaptiŋnik. Isumaaqtigiyumiñaqpisik isumaaġutiginiakkaptun, imiġmatun qallugauramniñ? Suli igḷutuġumiñaqpitku nagliksaaqtirrusiaġa, paptaiqsaummatun paptaiġusiamnik?

english: They said to him, “We are able.” Then Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink, and you will be baptized with the baptism I experience,
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋik uqallaŋaruk ilaanun, Piyumiñaqtuguk. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagik, Iḷumun imiġniaqtutik qallugauramniñ imiġvimñiñ, suli paptaiġusiamnik paptaiqsauniaqtutik,

english: but to sit at my right or at my left is not mine to give. It is for those for whom it has been prepared.”
inupiaq: aglaan uvaŋa piksraqtuksrautauŋitchuŋa aquppiruksranik taliqpimñi saumimñiḷu. God-im aitchuutiginiaġik taapkuak inik kisunun itqanaiyautikkaġmiñun inigitquvlugik.

english: Now when the other ten heard this, they became angry with James and John.
inupiaq: Tavra allat qulit iḷitchitqurat tusaakamirruŋ taamna, uumitchautiqpaŋagaich James-lu John-lu.

english: Jesus called them and said to them, “You know that those who are recognized as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in high positions use their authority over them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ququaŋagai iluqaisa iḷitchitqurat atautchimun, aasii uqallautivlugich, Iḷisimarusi iñuich atanaurauruat iñuŋnun suaŋŋatiqaqtut iliŋiññun, suli aullarriŋisa atanniqsimavlugich.

english: But it is not this way among you. Instead whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant,
inupiaq: Aglaan tainna piñiaŋitchusi ilivsi. Kiñaliqaa kamanaġuktuaq akunnavsiññi, kivgauruksrauruq ilivsiññun.

english: and whoever wants to be first among you must be the slave of all.
inupiaq: Suli kiñapayauraq ilivsiññi qaukłiusuktuaq, kivgauruksrauruq iluqavsiññun.

english: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋaunnii Iñuum qaiŋaruq kivgaqaġiaqsaŋaiqł̣uni. Ilaa qaiŋaruq kivgauyaqtuqłuni tuquyaqtuqłuniḷu tasuġukługich iñugiaktuat iñuich.

english: They came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples and a large crowd were leaving Jericho, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut Jericho-mun, aasii aullaqsaġman Jericho-miñ iḷitchitquraniḷu iñusalaiḷḷu, ayauŋaruaq Bartimaeus, iġñiŋa Timaeus, aquppiŋaruq apqutit saniġaanni piatchiaqtaqłuni.

english: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakami Jesus-gutilaaŋanik Nazareth-miu, ilaa ququularraqsiŋaruq, Jesus, iġñiġuruatiin David-mun, nagligiŋŋa.

english: Many scolded him to get him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuat iñiqtiŋagaat nipattuksrauŋiññivḷugu. Aglaan ilaa ququulavsaaqsiññaŋaruq atqunaq, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun, nagligiŋŋa.

english: Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” So they called the blind man and said to him, “Have courage! Get up! He is calling you.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nutqaqłuni qikaŋaruq, aasii iñuich uqallautivlugich, qaitqusiuŋ. Tavra ququaŋagaat ayauŋaruaq uqallautivlugu, Quviasugiñ. Makittin. Qaitqugaatin.

english: He threw off his cloak, jumped up, and came to Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan, mattaqługu uligaani, makinŋaruq aasii Jesus-mukłuni.

english: Then Jesus said to him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man replied, “Rabbi, let me see again.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagaa, Sutquvich uvamnun? Ayauŋaruam kiuŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, tautullasisuktuŋa.

english: Jesus said to him, “Go, your faith has healed you.” Immediately he regained his sight and followed him on the road.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aullaġiñ. Ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin. Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaa tautullasiŋaruq, aasii malikługu Jesus apqutitigun.

english: Now as they approached Jerusalem, near Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples
inupiaq: Tavra qallivḷutiŋ Jerusalem-mun tikiñŋarut Bethphage-mullu Bethany-mullu maniñġaniittuagnun iġġim Olives. Jesus tiliŋagik malġuk iḷitchitquraŋni sivumiŋni,

english: and said to them, “Go to the village ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there that has never been ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugik, aullaġitchik ininun sivuniptiŋnun. Aasii tikipqaġuptik, paqinniaqtutik kakaktim nuġġaŋanik pituqaqtuamik, iñuum kakaksiġvigiŋaisaŋanik. Pituiġḷugu qaġġisiyumagiktik.

english: If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here soon.’”
inupiaq: Aasii iñuum apiġikpatik, Summan tainna pivisik? Uqallakkumautik, Atanġum atuġukkaa, tavrauvvaa utiqtinniaġaa atuanikkumiuŋ.

english: So they went and found a colt tied at a door, outside in the street, and untied it.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaŋaruk sivuniġmiŋnun. Suli paqinŋagaak kakaktim nuġġaŋa pituqaqtuaq siḷami apqutini saniġaani upkuam. Pituiġñiaqsaqtillugu,

english: Some people standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
inupiaq: iḷaŋisa qikaqtuat tavrani uqallautiŋagaik, Summan pituiqpitku kakaktim nuġġaŋa?

english: They replied as Jesus had told them, and the bystanders let them go.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋikta uqallautiŋagaich, Jesus piraksriutaatun. Tavra iliŋisa aullaqtinŋagaich.

english: Then they brought the colt to Jesus, threw their cloaks on it, and he sat on it.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus-mun qaġġisiŋagaak kakaktim nuġġaŋa. Aasii iḷiŋagaich annuġaatiŋ kakaktimun, tavra Jesus kakaksirraqsiŋaruq.

english: Many spread their cloaks on the road and others spread branches they had cut in the fields.
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuat iñuich isivinŋagaich annuġaatiŋ apqunmun. Allalli kivriŋarut qisiqsiutinik napaaqtuniñ, aasii iḷiuqqaqługich apqutinun.

english: Both those who went ahead and those who followed kept shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich sivulliuruat, aquaguaqtuallu nipaallaŋarut, Hosanna, nanġaqtauli God. God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ qairuaq pisivlugu Ataniq.

english: Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”
inupiaq: God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ atanniqsimannikkumaaqtuaq maŋŋuptiktun David-tun. Nanġaqtauli God.

english: Then Jesus entered Jerusalem and went to the temple. And after looking around at everything, he went out to Bethany with the twelve since it was already late.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiñŋaruq Jerusalem-mun, aasii isiqłuni aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun. Tavra qiñiġaaganikami supayaanun aniŋaruq. Tanuġaksivḷuni, aullaŋaruq Bethany-mun piqatigivlugich qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat.

english: Now the next day, as they went out from Bethany, he was hungry.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaakumman, qaikamiŋ Bethany-miñ, Jesus kaaliŋaruq.

english: After noticing in the distance a fig tree with leaves, he went to see if he could find any fruit on it. When he came to it he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
inupiaq: Tavra tautukługu fig napaaqtuat uŋasiñiñ akutuqpalik, ilaan ullaŋagaa, iḷaanni paqinnasugaluni fig-nik tavraŋŋa. Tavra tikiññamiuŋ paqinŋaitchuq sumik, aglaan akutuqpaich, qanuq nauviksraŋat fig-gich tikiñŋaitchuq.

english: He said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard it.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Iñupayaam siiġñaqtuġvigiŋaiḷḷisin tavraŋŋaaglaan. Iḷitchitquraŋisa tusaaŋagaat uqallaŋman.

english: Then they came to Jerusalem. Jesus entered the temple area and began to drive out those who were selling and buying in the temple courts. He turned over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves,
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut Jerusalem-mun, aasii Jesus isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun. Ilaan anittaŋagai tuniuqqairuat tauqsiqsuqtuallu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, suli ulġuuŋagai aglagviŋich maniḷiqirit, aquppiutaŋiḷḷu tuniuqqairuat tiŋmianik.

english: and he would not permit anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.
inupiaq: Suli iñupayaaq saagaqtitchumiñaiñŋagaa supayaamik aŋaiyyuvikuaġlugu.

english: Then he began to teach them and said, “Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have turned it into a den of robbers!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan iḷisautiŋagai iñuich, Aglausimaruq Bible-ni God-im uqallautaa inna, “Uvaŋa igluqpaga taggisiqaġniaqtuq iñupayaat aŋaiyyuyaqtuġviannik.” Aglaalli ilivsi iriqtuġviḷiutiŋagiksi tigligayuktinun.

english: The chief priests and the experts in the law heard it and they considered how they could assassinate him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed by his teaching.
inupiaq: Tavra pitquranik iḷisaurrit, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu taamna tusaaŋagaat, aasii ivaqłiaŋarut qanuġlugu tuqutchukługu sivuuġagiliqł̣ugu, qanuq iñupayaat aliuŋarut iḷisaurrutiŋigun.

english: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.
inupiaq: Tavra tanuġaksimman, Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu aullaŋarut iniqpaŋmiñ.

english: In the morning as they passed by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaami, nalautchaaqługu fig napaaqtuq tautuŋagaat tuquliŋaruaq maŋŋuġmiñunaglaan.

english: Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m itqautivlugu uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, tautuguŋ, fig napaaqtuq tuquliŋaruq uqallautiŋaran siiġñaqtuġvigitquŋił̣ł̣ugu tavraŋŋaaglaan.

english: Jesus said to them, “Have faith in God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, God-mun ukpiġutiqaġitchi.

english: I tell you the truth, if someone says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷumun uqallautigivsi, kialiqaa uqallautikpagu una iġġiq, Nuuttin, igitaugiñ taġiumun. Nalupqisuŋipiaġuvich, aglaan ukpiġlutin tamatkua sut uqallausiġikkatin nalaunniaġniḷugich, tavra taamna pirauniaqtuq iliŋnun.

english: For this reason I tell you, whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautigivsi, supayaat kipiġniuġutigikkasi, aŋaiyyutigiguvsigik ukpiġitchi aitchuusiaġiniḷugich, tavra piginiaġisi.

english: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father in heaven will also forgive you your sins.”
inupiaq: Suli qikaqavsi aŋaiyyuvlusi, suliqutigiŋaiġñigitchi itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich sunŋutiqaġuvsi kimulliqaa, Aapavsivsauq qiḷaŋmiittuam suliqutigiŋaiġumagai piḷuutisi itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich.

english: They came again to Jerusalem. While Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the elders came up to him
inupiaq: [Ilivsi suliqutigiŋaiġñiŋitkuvsi itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich, Aapavsivsauq qiḷaŋmiittuam suliqutigiŋaiġñiaŋiñmigai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutisi.]

english: and said, “By what authority are you doing these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
inupiaq: Utiġmata Jerusalem-mun, Jesus pisuaqtillugu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, qaiŋarut ilaanun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich, iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik, umialiŋnallu,

english: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me and I will tell you by what authority I do these things:
inupiaq: aasii apiġivlugu, Sum ataniġnaqutaagun tamatkua pivigich? Kia taavrumiŋa ataniġnaqusiqpatin tamatkua pitquvlugich?

english: John’s baptism – was it from heaven or from people? Answer me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Apiqsriñiaqtuŋalivsauq ilivsiññiñ atautchimik apiqqunmik. Kiuguvsiŋa, uqallautiniaġivsi qanutchikun ataniġnaqutikun uvaŋa pisilaamnik tamatkuniŋa.

english: They discussed with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
inupiaq: Kia ataniġnaqutiksriñŋavauŋ John paptaiqsiñiksraŋagun, God-im naagga iñuum?

english: But if we say, ‘From people – ’” (they feared the crowd, for they all considered John to be truly a prophet).
inupiaq: Tavra uqavaaŋarut avanmun uqaqłutiŋ, Uqallakkupta God-miŋŋaqtauniḷugu ilaa uqallagniaqtuq, Summanmi ilivsi John ukpiġiŋaitpisiuŋ?

english: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
inupiaq: Suli uqaġumiñaitchugut ataniġnaqutaa iñuŋniñ piñiḷugu. Iliŋisa sivuuġagiŋagaich iñuich, qanuq iñupayaat nalupqigiŋaitkaat John God-mun uqaqtautilaaŋa.

english: Then he began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a pit for its winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went on a journey.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqautirraqsiŋagai iñuich uuktuutitigun. Iñuqaŋaruq nautchirriiruamik siiġñat grapes nagguviksraŋannik, kaŋiqqivḷugu avataagun, suli nivakłuni ivsaiyaiviksramik, nasiqsruġviḷivḷuniḷu, aasii atukkirrutigivlugu napaaqsiqirinun, aullaŋaruq allamun nunamun.

english: At harvest time he sent a slave to the tenants to collect from them his portion of the crop.
inupiaq: Katitchiñiksraq siiġñanik nalautinman nunaqaqtuaq tilisiŋaruq kivgamik napaaqsiqirinun pisukługich autaaġusiaksrautini siiġñat.

english: But those tenants seized his slave, beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.
inupiaq: Tavra napaaqsiqirit tigguġluŋagaat kivgaq, aasii anaullaqługu. Suli aullaqtinŋagaat saagaiḷaaqługu.

english: So he sent another slave to them again. This one they struck on the head and treated outrageously.
inupiaq: Tavra iñua siiġñaqaġvium tilisiŋaruq allamik kivgamik. Napaaqsiqirit anaumiŋagaat niaquagun aulataġivlugulu kanŋunaqtuakun.

english: He sent another, and that one they killed. This happened to many others, some of whom were beaten, others killed.
inupiaq: Tavra tilisitqiḷgitchuq allamik kivgamik aasii napaaqsiqirit tuqunŋagaat. Allanik iñugiaktuanik tilisiŋaruq aasii iḷaŋich anauttaŋagaich, iḷaŋich suli tuqułługich.

english: He had one left, his one dear son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
inupiaq: Tavra iġñiqaqłuni atautchimik, piviuttaġipiakkamiñik, ilaan tiliŋammigaa napaaqsiqirinun aqulliuvlugu, uqaqłuni, Taluġiniaġaat iġñiġa.

english: But those tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and the inheritance will be ours!’
