inupiaq: Tavra taapkua uqaŋarut inmiŋni, Tavra kiŋuvaannaktuksraun. Qaisitchi. Tuqullakput, aasii kiŋuvaannaktaksrautaa piginiaġikput.

english: So they seized him, killed him, and threw his body out of the vineyard.
inupiaq: Tavra tigguġluŋagaat iġñiq tuqunŋagaat, aasii annisivlugu timaa siiġñaqaġviŋmiñ.

english: What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.
inupiaq: Qanuġniaqpaasiiñ iñua siiġñaqaġvium? Qaiñiaqtuq aasii tuqullugich napaaqsiqirit, aasii atukkirrutigilugu siiġñaqaġvik allanun.

english: Have you not read this scripture:
inupiaq: Qaŋaunnii taiguaŋaitpisi uqaluŋnik Bible-ni inna?

english: ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich Pharisees iḷaŋiḷḷu Herod-kuayaat tilirauŋarut Jesus-mun uuktuġukługu apiqsruqtuutinik.

english: This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
inupiaq: Tavra ullakamirruŋ uqallautiŋagaat, Iḷisaurrii, iḷisimarugut pitqiksiġautaisilaaġnik. Suliqutigiŋitkiñ qanuq iñuich isumapkaġniaqtilaaŋat, qanuq piqutigiŋitkiñ iñuum surautilaaŋa, aglaan iḷisaurrutigigiñ iḷumun ittuaq God-im pitqutaa iñuŋmun. Uqallautitigut paaqsaaŋava uvagut pitquraptiŋni, naagga nalaunŋava akiḷiiruni taxes-nik Caesar-mun Rome-miut umialgannun?

english: Now they wanted to arrest him (but they feared the crowd), because they realized that he told this parable against them. So they left him and went away.
inupiaq: Akiḷiiruksrauvisa, naagga akiḷiiñiaŋitpisa? Tavra Jesus, iḷisimavlugu pisaaŋŋuaġutaat, uqallautiŋagai, Summan uuktuqpisiŋa? Qaġġirrisiŋa maniuramik tautukkumagiga.

english: Then they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to trap him with his own words.
inupiaq: Tavra maniuraq qaġġisiŋagaat. Aasii ilaan apiġiŋagai, Kiñauna maniurami atqalu? Tavra iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Caesar.

english: When they came they said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and do not court anyone’s favor, because you show no partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not? Should we pay or shouldn’t we?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Aitchuutigisigik Caesar-mun sut pigikkaŋi Caesar-m, aasii God-mun sut pigikkaŋi God-im. Tavra ilaa kamasuutigiŋagaat.

english: But he saw through their hypocrisy and said to them, “Why are you testing me? Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
inupiaq: Tavra Sadducees ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun. Taapkua iñuich uqaġuuruat aŋiniaŋiññivḷugich iñuich tuqqunmiñ.

english: So they brought one, and he said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?” They replied, “Caesar’s.”
inupiaq: Iliŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Iḷisaurrii, uvaptiŋnun Jew-guruanun Moses aglaŋaruq uumiŋa pitquramik, Iñuum aniqataa tuqukpan, qimaglugu nuliani miqłiqsigaluaġnani, aniqataanun tuvaaqasiutitquvlugu nuliaŋa, aasii qitunġiuġluni aniqatini pisilugu.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were utterly amazed at him.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat malġuuŋarut aniqatigiich. Aasii aŋayukłiq nuliaŋaruq, aasii tuquvluni kiŋuvaaligaluaġnani.

english: Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) also came to him and asked him,
inupiaq: Tavra tugliata nuliaŋagaa, aasii tuquŋaruq, kiŋuvaaligaluaġnanisuli. Piŋayuak suli tuquŋammiuq.

english: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us: ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, that man must marry the widow and father children for his brother.’
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat malġuk nuliaŋagaat, aasii kiŋuvaaliŋaitchut. Aqulliuvluni iluqaŋiññiñ aġnaq tuquŋammiuq.

english: There were seven brothers. The first one married, and when he died he had no children.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋŋiviŋmi, aŋikpata nalliata nuliaġiniaqpauŋ? Qanuq tallimat malġuk nuliaġiŋagaat.

english: The second married her and died without any children, and likewise the third.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Qanutun killukuaqtigirusi. Killukuaġutigigiksi naluvlugich Bible uqaluŋich, God-ivlu suaŋŋataa.

english: None of the seven had children. Finally, the woman died too.
inupiaq: Qanuq aŋigumiŋ tuqqunmiñ, aŋutillu aġnallu katitinniaŋitchut, aglaan inniaqtut isaġuliktitun qiḷaŋmiittuatun.

english: In the resurrection, when they rise again, whose wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
inupiaq: Aasii sivuniġilugu uqaqta tuquŋaruat aŋiñiaġniŋat. Taiguaŋaitpisi makpiġaani Moses aglaaŋiñi quliaqtuamik uqpiksigun ikualaruatigun? Taavrumani quliaqtuami aglausimaruq God-im uqallautaa Moses-mun inna, “Uvaŋa God-igigaaŋa Abraham, God-igigaaŋalu Isaac-gum, God-igimmigaaŋasuli Jacob-gum.” Taapkua iñuich iñuurut suli.

english: Jesus said to them, “Aren’t you deceived for this reason, because you don’t know the scriptures or the power of God?
inupiaq: Ilaa God-auŋitchuq tuquŋaruanun, aglaan God-igigaat iñuuruat. Ilivsiasiiñ killukuapaluktusi.

english: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurri pitquranik tavraniinŋaruq naalaġniruaq uqaaġutiŋiññik. Iḷitchuġivluni Jesus-mun kiulluataqtilaaŋiññik Sadducees, ilaan ullaŋagaa Jesus apiqqutiksraqaqłuni, Nalliat qaukłiuva pitqurat iluqaiññiñ?

english: Now as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Qaukłiat pitqurapayaat innaittuq, Naalaġnisiŋa Israel-guruasii. Ataniq God-ikput kisimisualuk Atanġuruq.

english: He is not the God of the dead but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
inupiaq: Aasii piviuttaġipiaqsaġiñ Ataniq God-igikkan, piviuttaġilugu iḷuŋniñ, iluqaaniḷu iñuuniaġniġni, iluqaaniḷu isumaniġni, iluqaaniḷu piḷġusiġñi.

english: Now one of the experts in the law came and heard them debating. When he saw that Jesus answered them well, he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of all?”
inupiaq: Aasii tuglia qaukłiuruam pitquram innaittuq, Piviuttaġisaġiñ siḷalliñ iliktun iḷiḷugu. Allamik pitquraitchuq qaukłiułhaaqtuamik taapkuŋnaŋŋa.

english: Jesus answered, “The most important is: ‘Listen, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurrim pitquranik uqallautiŋagaa, Nalauttutin Iḷisaurrii. Uqallausiġigiñ iḷumun ittuaq, qanuq God atausiuruq. God-aitchuq allamik aglaan God kisimi.

english: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
inupiaq: Suli iñuum piviuttaġipiagaksraġigaa God iḷumiñiñ, iluqaani isumaniġmiñi, iluqaaniḷu piḷġusimiñi, aasiisuli piviuttaġipiaġmiḷugu siḷalliñi ilimisun iḷiuġlugu. Iłuałhaasaktaqtuq kamagiruni taapkuak malġuk pitqurak qaġġirriñiġmiñ niġrutinik ikipkautiksranik ikipkaiviŋmi, allaniglu ikipkautinik God-mun.

english: The second is: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsrikamiuŋ kiggutaa isumattutikun, ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Itqanaitkavsakkaluaqtutin God-mun atanniqsimapkaġniksraġnun. Taavruma uqallautaata aquagun kialiqaa iñuum apiqsruqsausiiŋagaa Jesus apiqqunmik.

english: The expert in the law said to him, “That is true, Teacher; you are right to say that he is one, and there is no one else besides him.
inupiaq: Jesus iḷisaurriñiallaġmi Aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi apiqsriŋaruq, Qanuqłutiŋ iḷisaurrit pitquranik uqallakkumiñaqpat Christ-guruaq kiŋuniġiniaġnivḷugu David-mun?

english: And to love him with all your heart, with all your mind, and with all your strength and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallaktinŋagaa David inna,

english: When Jesus saw that he had answered thoughtfully, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” Then no one dared any longer to question him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisaurriḷḷaġmi iñuŋnik uqallautiŋagai, Qaunagisitchi iḷisaurriñiñ pitquranik kukiḷullaturuaniñ akuqturuanik annuġaaqaqłutiŋ iḷisimatquvlutiŋ suutilaamiŋnik aasii iñupayaanun purvigitquvlutiŋ tauqsiqsuġviŋñi.

english: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he said, “How is it that the experts in the law say that the Christ is David’s son?
inupiaq: Iliŋich aquppiutaksrallatummiut kamanaqtuat aquppiutaŋiññik aŋaiyyuviŋñi, suli kamanaqtuat aquppiutaŋiññi aquppiḷḷatuvlutiŋ niqinaqimmata.

english: David himself, by the Holy Spirit, said,
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisasuli ivayaqtuġmiraġigaich uiḷgaŋaruat igluŋiññiglu tigligaivḷugich, aasii taimma maniugaqsivḷutiŋ nakuurualivḷutiŋ takiruanik aŋaiyyuvlutiŋ. Tamatkua pisigilugich, tatavsausiaŋat pigiił̣haaġniaqtuq.

english: ‘The Lord said to my lord,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aquppiŋaruq akiani aŋaiyyuvikpaum maniqaġviata, aasii qiñiqługich iñuich ikisiruat manigñik maniqaġviŋmun, suli iñugiaktuat suġalliruat ikisiviiññaqtaŋarut manisalagnik.

english: “Sit at my right hand,
inupiaq: Tavra iḷiappauruaq uiḷgaŋaruaq qaiŋaruq, aasii ikisivḷuni malġugnik kannuyagnik maniuragnik akiiññiqsrapiamik maniuramik.

english: until I put your enemies under your feet.”’
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ququaŋagai ilimiñun iḷitchitqurani, aasii uqallautivlugich, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, taamna iḷiappauruaq uiḷgaŋaruaq ikisił̣haaŋaruq iluqaŋiññiñ ikisiŋaruaniñ maniqaġviŋmun.

english: If David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him with delight.
inupiaq: Qanuq iluqaġmiŋ ikisiŋarut piukkaġniġmiŋniñ, aasiiḷi uiḷgaŋaruaq pisuksiuniġmiñiñ ikisiŋaruq iluqaanik pimiñik, iñuusautiksratualuŋmiñikunnii.

english: In his teaching Jesus also said, “Watch out for the experts in the law. They like walking around in long robes and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces,
and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
They devour widows’ property, and as a show make long prayers. These men will receive a more severe punishment.”
Then he sat down opposite the offering box, and watched the crowd putting coins into it. Many rich people were throwing in large amounts.
And a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, worth less than a penny.
He called his disciples and said to them, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put more into the offering box than all the others.
For they all gave out of their wealth. But she, out of her poverty, put in what she had to live on, everything she had.”
Now as Jesus was going out of the temple courts, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look at these tremendous stones and buildings!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aniñiaqtillugu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ, iḷaŋat iḷitchitquraŋisa uqallaŋaruq ilaanun kamatchakłuni, Iḷisaurrii, tautukkich, qanutun kamanaqtigirut makua uyaġaich. Qanutun qiñiyunaqtigirut init aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi.

english: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Tautukpigich tamatkua kamanaqtuat init aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi? Kisiŋŋuqtaqaġumiñaitchuq uyaqqagnik qaliġiiksuagnik ulġutauniaŋitchuagnik.

english: So while he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aquppiŋaruq iġġiani Olives qiñiqługu aŋaiyyuvikpak. Peter-lu James-lu John-lu Andrew-lu ullautiŋarut ilaanun iñuiġman.

english: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that all these things are about to take place?”
inupiaq: Uqallauttutigut qakugu tamatkua piñiaqpat? Suna suli iḷitchuqłiutauniaqpa iluqaġmiŋ tamatkua nalautkaqsikpata?

english: Jesus began to say to them, “Watch out that no one misleads you.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqautirraqsiŋagai, Qaunagisitchi. Iñuŋmun sagluqipkaġnasi.

english: Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and they will mislead many.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñugiaktuat iñuich qaiñiaqtut uvaŋauŋŋuaqtuat uqaġlutiŋ, Uvaŋa Christ-guruŋa, aasii iñugiaktuat sagluqilugich.

english: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. These things must happen, but the end is still to come.
inupiaq: Tusaaguvsi aŋuyaktuanik qanitkaluaqpata naagga uŋasikkaluaqpata iłuiḷḷiuġutiginagich. Tamatkua piruksraurut, aglaan sivuniġiŋitkaat isuksraq tikiññiḷugu.

english: For nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines. These are but the beginning of birth pains.
inupiaq: Nunauruat aŋuyagniaqtut allanun nunauruanun. Suli umialiqaqtuat aŋuyagniaqtut allanun umialiqaqtuanun. Nunasuli aularaġaġniaqtuq sumipayaaq, iñuiḷḷu paniġniaqtut niqaiḷḷiuġlutiŋ. Tamarra tamatkua aullaqisaaŋich isumaaġutit piruksrauruat Christ-guruaq qaiŋaiñŋaan.

english: “You must watch out for yourselves. You will be handed over to councils and beaten in the synagogues. You will stand before governors and kings because of me, as a witness to them.
inupiaq: Aasii qaunagiyumausi ilivsiññun, qanuq aitchuutiginiaġaasi uqaqsitaaġviŋñun, suli Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviŋiññi anaullaqtauniaqtusi, suli qaġġirrauraġaġniaqtusi sivuġaŋiññun atanaurallu umialgiḷḷu pisigiluŋa, ilivsi quliaqtuaġumiñaqsiḷusi tusaayugaaġiksuanik iliŋiññun.

english: First the gospel must be preached to all nations.
inupiaq: Christ-guruaq qaiŋaiñŋaan, tusaayugaaġiksuaq alġaqsruutauqqaaqtuksrauruq iñupayaanun.

english: When they arrest you and hand you over for trial, do not worry about what to speak. But say whatever is given you at that time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tigutaaqpasi, aullautilusi uqaqsitaaġviŋñun, uŋiarrisaqaġnasi sivuani piviksram sunik uqaluksravsiññik. Uqaġnaqsikpasi uqaġumausi qanupayaaq uqaluksriusiavsiññik tavraġuqpan. Qanuq uqaluginiakkasi ilivsi uqalugiŋitkisi, aglaan uqaluksriusiaġiniaġisi Ilitqusiġiksuamiñ.

english: Brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich aniqatitiŋ aitchuutiginiaġaich tuqutautqulugich. Suli tainnatun aapauruam iġñini. Suli miqłiqtut makivsaallaktaġniaqtut aŋayuqaamiŋnun, aasii tuqutillugich.

english: You will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
inupiaq: Suli uumigitchiġñiaqtusi iñupayaaniñ pisigiluŋa, aasii iñuk igḷutuutiruaq nagliksaaqtitauniġmik iñuuniqtutilaamisun, annaurrauniaqtuq.

english: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then those in Judea must flee to the mountains.
inupiaq: Taiguaqtuaq iñuk ukuniŋa kaŋiqsiḷi. Tautukkuvsiuŋ naġġutchagnapiaġataqtuaq salumaiḷḷisauluni inillaummiruaq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi iniksraġiŋisamiñi, tamatkua iñuuruat Judea-mi pigruġlich iġġiñun.

english: The one on the roof must not come down or go inside to take anything out of his house.
inupiaq: Iñuksuli aniiqsuaqtuaq iglumi qaaŋani iñaviqqutchiġñani atqaġluni saagaksraisuqsaġluni sumik iglumi iḷuaniñ.

english: The one in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq iñuk nautchiaqaġviŋmi savaktuaq iglumiñuŋnani saakkiutiyaqtuġuglugu annuġaani.

english: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days!
inupiaq: Taipkua uvlut tikitpata, yaqhiikkaluaq aġnaq siŋaiyauniġumi, miqłiqtuuraqaqtuaġlu piḷgusiŋaitchuanik.

english: Pray that it may not be in winter.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyutitchi pigruġniksraqsi ukiukuaquŋiḷḷugu.

english: For in those days there will be suffering unlike anything that has happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until now, or ever will happen.
inupiaq: Taipkunanikiataŋ uvluni iñuich nagliksaałhamaaġniaqtut qaŋapaŋmiñ God-im qaŋa savaŋmagu nuna. Aasii tainnatun nagliksaaqtigitqikkumiñaiñmiut aquagun taavruma.

english: And if the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would be saved. But because of the elect, whom he chose, he has cut them short.
inupiaq: Aasii Atanġum iñukłiḷaaŋisuaqpagich taipkua uvlut, kiñaliqaa iñuuyumiñaitchuq. Aglaan pisigilugich God-im piksraqtaani, ilaan iñukłiḷaaġniaġai uvlut.

english: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe him.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuum uqallautikpasi, Tautuksiuŋ, uvva Christ, naagga, Tautuksiuŋ, ikaniittuq, ukpiġinagu,

english: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, the elect.
inupiaq: qanuq Christ-guŋŋuaqtuat, uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuallu God-mun iñukpalliġñiaqtut savaglutiŋ aliuġnaqtuanik nalupqinaiġñiaqługu kiutilaaqtiŋ, asiñuutiniaqsaalugich God-im piksraqtaaŋi, sagluqiyumiñaġumisigik.

english: Be careful! I have told you everything ahead of time.
inupiaq: Aglaan nipuŋaitchitchi ilivsi. Kilikkivsi sivuani supayaanik piŋaiñŋaisa.

english: “But in those days, after that suffering, the sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light;
inupiaq: Tavra taipkunani uvluni, pianikpan taamna iłuiḷḷiuġutiqpak, siqiñiq taaksiñiaqtuq, tatqiġḷu qaummaġiŋaiġñiaqtuq.

english: the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
inupiaq: Suli uvluġiat katagniaqtut, suli qaummatit siḷamiittuat uniuqtinniaqtut inimiŋniñ.

english: Then everyone will see the Son of Man arriving in the clouds with great power and glory.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich tautugniaġaat Iġñiŋa Iñuum qairuaq nuvuyani kamanaqtuamik suaŋŋatiqaġluni qaumaniqaġluniḷu.

english: Then he will send angels and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.
inupiaq: Tavra tiliñiaġai isaġuliŋni, aasii katillugich atautchimun ilaan piksraqtaani sumiḷḷiqaa nunapayauraniñ.

english: “Learn this parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
inupiaq: Fig-nik siiġñaqaqtuamiñ napaaqtumiñ iḷitchisitchi. Qisiqsiutiŋi qituglimmata, akutuqpalivḷuniḷu iḷisimarusi upinġaam qallisilaaŋanik.

english: So also you, when you see these things happening, know that he is near, right at the door.
inupiaq: Tavra ilivsi tainnatuttauq, tautukkuvsigik tamatkua nalaurraqsikpata, iḷisimaniaqtusi Iġñiŋa Iñuum qallisilaaŋanik, qallipiaġataqtilaaŋanik.

english: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ukua iñuich tuquanigniaŋitchut, iluqaisa tamatkua nalaunŋaunnagich.

english: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
inupiaq: Qiḷaglu nunalu piiġñiaqtuk, aglaan uqalutka piiġumiñaitchut.

english: “But as for that day or hour no one knows it – neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son – except the Father.
inupiaq: Iñupayaam nalugaa taimña uvluq ikarraġlu tamatkua nalaurviksrautaat. Isaġulgich unnii qiḷaŋmiittuat, Iġñiġuvlu nalugaat. Aapam kisimi iḷisimagaa.

english: Watch out! Stay alert! For you do not know when the time will come.
inupiaq: Qaunakkutitchi, quviqtaiḷisitchiḷu, qanuq iḷisimaŋitchusi qakugu taimña uvluq tikisilaaksraŋanik.

english: It is like a man going on a journey. He left his house and put his slaves in charge, assigning to each his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to stay alert.
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum ittuq iñuktun uŋasiksuamun iglauruatun. Qimaaqsikamiuŋ igluni kivgani savaaksriḷḷaaŋagai, suli piraksriqł̣ugu upkuamik qaunaksri quviqtaiḷitquvlugu utiqtilaaksramiñun.

english: Stay alert, then, because you do not know when the owner of the house will return – whether during evening, at midnight, when the rooster crows, or at dawn –
inupiaq: Quviqtaiḷisitchiḷi, qanuq iḷisimaŋitchusi qakugu atanġa iglum qaiñiaqtilaaŋanik, tanuġaksiruami, naagga unnuaq qitiqqaqpan, naagga qauyasiaqsikpan, naagga uvlaami.

english: or else he might find you asleep when he returns suddenly.
inupiaq: Iḷaanni qaił̣ł̣agluni siñiktillusi qaiviaqtuq.

english: What I say to you I say to everyone: Stay alert!”
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautiga ilivsiññun, uqallausiġigiga iluqaiññun, Quviqtaiḷisitchi.

english: Two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find a way to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
inupiaq: Tavra malġuk uvluk pianikpaŋnik tikitchumaaŋaruq Niqinaqivia Itqautim qulaurrusiqinikun iñuich niġimmata puvlaksautaitchuamik punniġmik. Tavralivsauq tainnaiḷimman aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik piviksraqsiuŋarut qanuġlugu nalunautchiḷutiŋ tigutaaġukługu Jesus tuqulluguasii.

english: For they said, “Not during the feast, so there won’t be a riot among the people.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqaŋarut avanmun, Piraksraġiŋitkikput taamna niqinaqipkaġlugich, iñuich makivsaallautiviaġaatigut.

english: Now while Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, reclining at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of costly aromatic oil from pure nard. After breaking open the jar, she poured it on his head.
inupiaq: Jesus-li Bethany-mi, igluani Simon kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuam, aquppipkaqtillugu niġivḷutiŋ qaiŋaruq aġnaq piqaqłuni uyaġagmik misuġuqtuunmik tivraġiksaunmik akisupiaġataqtuamik atiqaqtuamik Nard. Tavra siqummaŋagaa puuŋa, aasii kuvivḷugu Jesus niaquanun.

english: But some who were present indignantly said to one another, “Why this waste of expensive ointment?
inupiaq: Tavra tavraniinŋarut iñuich iḷaŋich piavsaktuat uqaqłutiŋ, Summan una asiñuksiññaqpa tivraġiksaun?

english: It could have been sold for more than three hundred silver coins and the money given to the poor!” So they spoke angrily to her.
inupiaq: Tuniyumiñaġaluaqtuaq qaaŋiġḷugu 300 taala, aasii aitchuutigiyumiñaġlugich iḷiappauruanun. Tavra aġnaq pisaaŋaŋagaat suammativlugu.

english: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She has done a good service for me.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iḷaksianagu. Summan isumaalluksaaqpisiuŋ? Savaŋaruq savaalluatamik uvamnun.

english: For you will always have the poor with you, and you can do good for them whenever you want. But you will not always have me!
inupiaq: Qanuq itqatigigisi iḷiappauruat ilivsiññi ataramik, aasii qakuguliqaa pisukkuvsi anniqsuġumiñaġisi. Aglaan uvaŋa nayuqtigiŋitkivsiŋa ataramik.

english: She did what she could. She anointed my body beforehand for burial.
inupiaq: Aġnaq piŋaruq piyumiñakkamiñik. Ilaan tivraġiksaŋagaa timiga itqanaiyaqługu iḷuvġuniksraŋanun piviksram sivuani.

english: I tell you the truth, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Sumipayaaq manna tusaayugaaġiksuaq alġaqsruutaukpan nunapayaani, aġnam savaaġiŋaraa quliaqtuaguniaqtuq itqaummatauluni ilaanun.

english: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus into their hands.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas Iscariot, iḷaŋat qulit malġuk, aullaŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun, aitchuutigisukługu Jesus iliŋiññun.

english: When they heard this, they were delighted and promised to give him money. So Judas began looking for an opportunity to betray him.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamirruŋ, quyaŋarut, suli unniqsuqłiiŋagaat aitchuġukługu manigñik. Tavra Judas ivaqłiaŋaruq piviksramik qanuġlugu aitchuutigisukługu.

english: Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, Jesus’ disciples said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
inupiaq: Sivullianni uvluŋisa Niqinaqivium Puvlaksautaitchuamik punniġmik imnaiyaaq tuqutaugayuktuq itqanaiyautauvlugu qulaurrusiqiviŋmi Niqinaqiniksramun. Taavrumani uvlumi iḷitchitqurat apiġiŋagaat Jesus, Sumi itqanaiyaquvisigut qulaurrusiqiviŋmi nullautchiġviksraġnik?

english: He sent two of his disciples and told them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
inupiaq: Tavra tiliŋagik malġuk iḷitchitquramiñiñ, uqallautivlugik, Aullaġitchik iniqpaŋmun, aasii paaġniaġaatik iñuum saagaqtuam qattamun imiġmik. Malikkumagiktik,

english: Wherever he enters, tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is my guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
inupiaq: aasii sumupayaaq isiqpan, uqallautiyumagiktik iñua iglum, Iḷisaurri uqallaktuaq, Sumiitpa tuyuġmiaqaġvik, niġiviksraqput iḷitchitquratkalu qulaurrusiqunmik?

english: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisautiniaġaatik inituruamik qiḷaguamik upaluŋaitchuamik. Tavrani itqanaiyautiyumagiptigut.

english: So the disciples left, went into the city, and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan iḷitchitqurak aullaŋaruk, aasii tikił̣ł̣utik iniqpaŋmun, paqinŋagaich supayaat uqausiatun Jesus ilimiŋnun. Suli itqanaiyaŋaruk qulaurrusiqiniksramun.

english: Then, when it was evening, he came to the house with the twelve.
inupiaq: Tavra unnuksraaġman Jesus tikiñŋaruq piqatigivlugich qulit malġuk.

english: While they were at the table eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you eating with me will betray me.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiḷḷaġmiŋ niġġiviŋñi, Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Iḷavsi niġiqatigikkaġma aitchuutiginiaġaaŋa.

english: They were distressed, and one by one said to him, “Surely not I?”
inupiaq: Tavra isumaalirraqsiŋarut, aasii apiqsruqtuaqsivḷugu ilaanun atausiullaavlutiŋ, Uvaŋauva? Allat suli uqaqłutiŋ, Sivuniġiviŋa uvaŋa?

english: He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who dips his hand with me into the bowl.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷagigiksi qulit malġuk, misuksiqatauruaq punniġmik uvamnun puggutauramun.

english: For the Son of Man will go as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for him if he had never been born.”
inupiaq: Iġñiŋa Iñuum tuquniaqtuq taŋŋiġḷugich aglausimaruat inmigun Bible-ni. Aglaan isumaaġutiqpaqaġli taamna iñuk aitchuutiginniktuaq Iġñiŋanik Iñuum. Iłuałhaaŋanayaqtuq taamna iñuk iñuuŋaitkumi.

english: While they were eating, he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take it. This is my body.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiñiallaġmiŋ Jesus tiguŋagaa punnik, aasii aŋaiyyuvluni quyyatigivlugu, suli avikługu aitchuutigivlugu iḷitchitquramiñun, uqallakłuni, Tigulugu niġġisiuŋ tavra timiga.

english: And after taking the cup and giving thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
inupiaq: Suli ilaan tiguŋagaa qallugauraq, aasii quyaanikami God-mun, ilaan aitchuutigiŋagaa ilaiññun. Aasii iluqaġmiŋ imiġvigiŋagaat.

english: He said to them, “This is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that is poured out for many.
inupiaq: Suli Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Tavra auga maqipkaqtauyumaaqtuaq iñugiaktuanun. Taavrumuuna God-im nalupqinaiġñiaġaa sivunniuġutini iñuŋnun.

english: I tell you the truth, I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Imitqigñiaŋitchuŋa siiġñaŋan ivsaŋaniñ napaaqtuayaam, tikiḷġataqtillugu taamna uvluq imiġniksraġa nutaulugu God-im atanniqsimaviani.

english: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
inupiaq: Tavra atuanikamiŋ aŋaiyyunmik, aullaŋarut iġġianun Olives.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, for it is written,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iluqasi qimagniaġivsiŋa suksraaġluŋa uumani unnuami. Aglausimaruq Bible-ni God uqallagnivḷugu inna, “Uvaŋa tuqunniaġiga imnaiḷiqiri aasii imnaich siamillutiŋ.”

english: ‘I will strike the shepherd,
inupiaq: Aasii aŋianikkuma, aullaġniaqtuŋa sivuvsiññi Galilee-mun.

english: and the sheep will be scattered.’
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Iluqaġmiŋ qimakkaluaqpatin uvaŋa qimakkumiñaitkikpiñ suksraaġlutin.

english: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷumun uqallautigikpiñ, Anaqapak uvva piiḷaaġianiŋniaġiŋma piŋasuiqsuaġlutin naluniḷuŋa, tiŋmiaq malġuiqsuaġluni nipanŋaiñŋaan.

english: Peter said to him, “Even if they all fall away, I will not!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq qapiŋaivsaaqłuni, Tuquqatigiraksraġigupkiñunnii, piiḷaaġiyumiñaitkikpiñ sumikunnii. Tainnatuttauq iluqaġmiŋ iḷitchitqurat uqallaŋarut.

english: Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today – this very night – before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut inimun atiqaqtuamun Gethsemane-mik, aasii Jesus uqallaŋaruq iḷitchitquramiñun, Aquvittitchi uvuŋa, aŋaiyyuyaqtuqtilluŋa.

english: But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I must die with you, I will never deny you.” And all of them said the same thing.
inupiaq: Tavra piqasiutiŋagai ilimiñun Peter-lu James-lu John-lu, Suli atqunaq iłuiḷḷiurraqsiŋaruq, ipiqtusuliqpakłuniḷu,

english: Then they went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
inupiaq: aasii uqallautiŋagai, Isumaaliqpaił̣ł̣uŋa tuquaqsiruatununnii iḷiruŋa. Tavraniittitchi aasii quviqtaiḷiḷusi.

english: He took Peter, James, and John with him, and became very troubled and distressed.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa taikuŋaqtaallaŋaruq, aasii isumaaqpaił̣ł̣uni ulġuŋaruq nunamun aasii aŋaiyyuvluni, Piñaġumiñaqpan, nagliksaaġuŋitkaluaqłuni.

english: He said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to the point of death. Remain here and stay alert.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Aapaaŋ, supayaat piḷḷagitin. Piiġuŋ nagliksaaġutiqpak uvamniñ. Aglaattauq uvaŋa pisuutiŋił̣aapkun, aglaan ilivich pisuutipkun.

english: Going a little farther, he threw himself to the ground and prayed that if it were possible the hour would pass from him.
inupiaq: Jesus utiŋaruq piŋasunun iḷitchitquramiñun, aasii tautukługich siñiktuat. Peter uqallautiŋagaa, Simon, siñikpich? Quviqtaiḷiyumiñaiñŋavich atautchimiunnii ikarraġmi?

english: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Take this cup away from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
inupiaq: Quviqtaiḷisitchi aŋaiyyusitchiḷu, iḷaanni payarirauviaqtusi ikł̣igutchaktinniaġunmun. Iḷumun ilitqusisi piyummatiqaġaluaqtut, timisi sayaitchut.

english: Then he came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you stay awake for one hour?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullatqiŋaruq, aasii aŋaiyyuvluni taapkuniŋasuli uqaluŋnik.

english: Stay awake and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
inupiaq: Tavra utiqami, ilaan tautuŋagai siñiktuat suli qanuq pillitchiŋarut. Suli iḷisimaŋaitchut kiggutiksramiŋnik ilaanun.

english: He went away again and prayed the same thing.
inupiaq: Tavra qaiŋaruq piŋayuaŋni, aasii uqallautivlugich, Siñikpisisuli unaŋuiqsiqł̣usiḷu? Siñikpaaniktusi. Uvva aitchuutauniksraŋa Iġñiŋan Iñuum tikitchuq aŋalataġiyumiñaqsivḷugu piḷuktuanun iñuŋnun.

english: When he came again he found them sleeping; they could not keep their eyes open. And they did not know what to tell him.
inupiaq: Makittitchi. Aullaqta. Tautuksiuŋ uvva. Aitchuutiginniktuaq uvamnik tikitchuq.

english: He came a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough of that! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa uqaġniaqtillugusuli, qairuq Judas, iḷaŋat qulit malġuk. Piqatigiŋagai iñusalaich savikpaliraqtuat anauttaksraligaaqtuallu, tiliraŋich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik umialiŋnallu.

english: Get up, let us go. Look! My betrayer is approaching!”
inupiaq: Tavra taavruma aitchuutiginniktuam ilaanik nalunaiñŋutaksriñŋagai, uqaqłuni, Kiñaliqaa kunikkaġa taamna ilaaguruq. Tigugisigiksi aasii aullatilugu qaunagilugu.

english: Right away, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived. With him came a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests and experts in the law and elders.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas tikipqauraqami, tavrauvvaa ullaŋagaa Jesus aasii uqallakłuni, Iḷisaurrii. Suli kuniŋagaa.

english: (Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him and lead him away under guard.”)
inupiaq: Tavra tiguniqłaŋagaat.

english: When Judas arrived, he went up to Jesus immediately and said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋata qikaqtuat tamaani amuŋagaa savikpak, aasii anauvlugu kivgaŋa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata aasii siutaiqł̣ugu.

english: Then they took hold of him and arrested him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Qaivisi tigligayuktimun pimmatun, savikpaqaqłusi anaullautiniglu tiguyaqtuqłuŋa?

english: One of the bystanders drew his sword and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his ear.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa uvlutuaġman piqatigigivsi aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi iḷisaurrivḷuŋa, aasii tigulaitkivsiŋa. Aglaan Bible uqaluat nalauttuksrauruq.

english: Jesus said to them, “Have you come with swords and clubs to arrest me like you would an outlaw?
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iḷitchitqurat qimagruiññaqługu pigruŋarut.

english: Day after day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, yet you did not arrest me. But this has happened so that the scriptures would be fulfilled.”
inupiaq: Tavra nukatpiam Jesus maliŋagaa ukił̣haaġiksuamik uligaaqtuqłuni annuġaiññami. Tavra tiguŋagaluaġmigaat,

english: Then all the disciples left him and fled.
inupiaq: aglaan ilaan qimaŋagaa uligaani, aasii pigruqłuni iliŋiññiñ annuġaiḷaq.

english: A young man was following him, wearing only a linen cloth. They tried to arrest him,
inupiaq: Tavra aullautiŋagaat Jesus aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata igluanun, suli piqatigivlugu kasimaŋarut iluqaġmiŋ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu umialiŋnallu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik.

english: but he ran off naked, leaving his linen cloth behind.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m maliŋagaa Jesus aquagun uŋasikł̣ugu aasii isiqłuni siḷallianun igluata aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata. Tavruŋa aquvinŋaruq piqatigivlugich munaqsrich pasiaqłuni igniġmi.

english: Then they led Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests and elders and experts in the law came together.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iluqaġmiglu uqaqsitaaqtitchirit pasikkutiksraqsiuŋagaat Jesus tuqutchumiñaqsisukługu. Aglaan paqitchiḷaiñŋarut.

english: And Peter had followed him from a distance, up to the high priest’s courtyard. He was sitting with the guards and warming himself by the fire.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iñuich sagluuŋarut iḷisimaniruat ilaagun pasikkutiksranik. Suli uqaluŋich atilaiñŋarut.

english: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find anything.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋich makinŋarut, aasii saglunik uqaqłutiŋ ilaagun.

english: Many gave false testimony against him, but their testimony did not agree.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋagikput uqallaŋman, Suksraunġiġñiaġiga una aŋaiyyuvikpak savaaŋat iñuich, aasii uvlut piŋasut sippiġaluaġnagich savagniaqtuŋa allamik aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmik iñuich savaaġiŋisaŋannik.

english: Some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
inupiaq: Naaggaptauqsuli uqaluŋich atiŋaitchut.

english: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands and in three days build another not made with hands.’”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat makinŋaruq qitqannun, aasii apiġivlugu Jesus, Kiggutiksraitpich ukua iñuich uqaluŋiññun ilipkun?

english: Yet even on this point their testimony did not agree.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nivliŋaitchuq, suli kiuŋaitkaa sumik. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata apiġitqiŋagaa, Ilivich Christ-guvich, Iġñiŋa Nanġaqtauruam?

english: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is this that they are testifying against you?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Tavrauruŋa. Aasii ilivsi tautugniaġiksi Iġñiŋa Iñuum aquppiruaq taliqpiata tuŋaani Sapiġñaqtuam, suli qairuaq nuvuyaŋigun qiḷaum.

english: But he was silent and did not answer. Again the high priest questioned him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata aliktuŋagai annuġaani suli uqaqłuni, Iñuvsaanik pasiññiktuksranik ilaanik piqaqtuksrauŋaiqsugut.

english: “I am,” said Jesus, “and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
inupiaq: Tusaaganikkiksi God-itun iḷiuqtuaq inmiñik. Qanuq sivunniqpisiuŋ? Tavra iluqaġmiŋ sivunniŋagaat tuqutauruksraġuqługu.

english: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋisa tivvuaqturraqsiŋagaat Jesus, suli matuvlugu kiiñaŋa qakiqtaqługu uqaqłutiŋ, Nalautchaġiñ kimun qakiqtilaaġnik. Suli qaunaksrit tiguvlugu pattaŋagaat.

english: You have heard the blasphemy! What is your verdict?” They all condemned him as deserving death.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter siḷalliġmiitillugusuli, iḷaŋat Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata niviaqsiaq kivgaŋa tavruunnaaŋaruq.

english: Then some began to spit on him, and to blindfold him, and to strike him with their fists, saying, “Prophesy!” The guards also took him and beat him.
inupiaq: Aasii tautukamiuŋ Peter pasiaqtuaq, takunnaŋagaa aasii uqallautivlugu, Ilivitchauq piqatigimmikkan Jesus Nazareth-miu.

english: Now while Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the high priest’s slave girls came by.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter piiḷaaŋaruq, Nalugiga. Kaŋiqsiŋitchuŋaunnii sumik uqaqtilaaġnik. Tavra aniŋaruq aniiġviŋmun, aasii tiŋmiaq nipanŋaruq.

english: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked directly at him and said, “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus.”
inupiaq: Tavra niviaqsiam kivgam taututqiŋagaa, aasii uqautiaqsivḷugich tamaani qikaqtuat, Unauvva iḷaŋat.

english: But he denied it: “I don’t even understand what you’re talking about!” Then he went out to the gateway, and a rooster crowed.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter piiḷaatqiŋaruq. Suli akkuliurallaŋman, tamatkua qikaqtuat saniġaani uqallatqiŋarut Peter-mun, Iḷumun iḷagigaatin, qanuq Galilee-ġmiugummiutin.

english: When the slave girl saw him, she began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter suammakłuni uqallaŋaruq, God-im tatavsaġliŋa uqaŋitkuma iḷumun ittuamik. Nalugiga kiutilaaŋa iñuk uqautigikkaqsi.

english: But he denied it again. A short time later the bystanders again said to Peter, “You must be one of them, because you are also a Galilean.”
inupiaq: Tavra tiŋmiam nipannini aippiŋagaa. Aasii Peter-m itqaŋagaa uqalua Jesus inmiñun inna, Tiŋmiaq nipatkaluaqtinnagu malġugni, ilivich piiḷaaġiniaġiŋma piŋasuni. Tavra taamna itqaqamiuŋ, ilaa qiaġutiŋaruq.

english: Then he began to curse, and he swore with an oath, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”
Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him: “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
Early in the morning, after forming a plan, the chief priests with the elders and the experts in the law and the whole Sanhedrin tied Jesus up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaatchaurami aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich umialiŋnallu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik iluqaġmiglu uqaqsitaaqtitchirit kasimaliqtuayaaŋarut sivunniuqłutiŋ. Iliŋisa qiḷiqsruivḷugu Jesus, aullautiŋagaat qaitchukługu Pilate-mun.

english: So Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate apiġiŋagaa, Umialigivatin Jews? Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uqallausiġigiñ.

english: Then the chief priests began to accuse him repeatedly.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich pasiŋagaat iñugiaktuatigun sutigun.

english: So Pilate asked him again, “Have you nothing to say? See how many charges they are bringing against you!”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum apiġitqiŋagaa, Kiggutiksraitpich? Qanutun uvva iñugiaktigiruanik pasigaatin.

english: But Jesus made no further reply, so that Pilate was amazed.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋiḷgitchuqsuli. Tavra Pilate kamatchaktuq.

english: During the feast it was customary to release one prisoner to the people, whomever they requested.
inupiaq: Tavra niqinaqilimaaġmata qulaurrusiqiviŋmik, Pilate annaktitkayukkaa atausiq tigutaaqtaq, kiñapayaaq pisuŋmarruŋ.

english: A man named Barabbas was imprisoned with rebels who had committed murder during an insurrection.
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuk inŋaruq atilik Barabbas-mik tigutaaqtauqatauruaq iñuŋnun tuavaallaktitchiññiktuanun iñuaŋavlutiŋ.

english: Then the crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to release a prisoner for them, as was his custom.
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich nipaalavlutiŋ qasiḷiaqsiŋagaat Pilate pitquvlugu piḷġusikaamisun ilimiŋnun.

english: So Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to release the king of the Jews for you?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum apiġiŋagai, Tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitquvisiuŋ uvamnun umialgat Jews?

english: (For he knew that the chief priests had handed him over because of envy.)
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaa iḷisimalluataŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun aitchuutigiŋatilaaŋanik killuġivlugu.

english: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas instead.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich aulayyaŋagaich iñuich, ilaanun tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitquvlugu Barabbas.

english: So Pilate spoke to them again, “Then what do you want me to do with the one you call king of the Jews?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum apiġitqiŋagai, Qanuquvisiuŋ aasii uvamnun ilivsi taikkaqsi Umialgannik Jews?

english: They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
inupiaq: Iliŋisa saqłautiŋagaat, kikiaktuutili.

english: Pilate asked them, “Why? What has he done wrong?” But they shouted more insistently, “Crucify him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum uqallautiŋagai, Summan? Sumik pitquramik navgiŋava? Tavra saqłautivsaaqsiññaŋagaat atqunapiaġataq, Kikiaktuutili.

english: Because he wanted to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas for them. Then, after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum, iviġagumavlugich iñuich, tigutaaqtauŋaiqsinŋagaa Barabbas. Aasii aitchuutigiŋagaa Jesus ipiġaqtuqtitanikamiuŋ kikiaktuutitquvlugu aŋarrauramun.

english: So the soldiers led him into the palace (that is, the governor’s residence) and called together the whole cohort.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit itqutiŋagaat Jesus Pilate-gum igluqpaŋanun, aasii katitquŋagaich iḷakut aŋuyaktit atautchimun.

english: They put a purple cloak on him and after braiding a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
inupiaq: Tavra atipkaŋagaat annuġaanik suŋauraammaġiksuanik umialiktun, suli niaquġusiŋarut kakiḷḷaġnaqtuanik qisiqsiutinik, aasii iḷivḷugu niaquanun.

english: They began to salute him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa kipagivlugu nanġarraqsiŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ, Sivisuruamik iñuuli Umialgat Jews.

english: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Then they knelt down and paid homage to him.
inupiaq: Suli anaullaŋagaat niaquagun qiruatchiamik, tivvuaqtuqługulu. Suli kipagivlugu sitquġvigiŋagaat purvigivlugulu.

english: When they had finished mocking him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
inupiaq: Tavra kipagianikamirruŋ, mattaqtinŋagaich suŋauraammaġiksuat annuġaat ilaaniñ, aasii annuġaaqługu ilaan annuġaaŋiñik, aasii aullautivlugu kikiaktuutiyaqtuqługu.

english: The soldiers forced a passerby to carry his cross, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country (he was the father of Alexander and Rufus).
inupiaq: Iglaullaġmiŋ aŋuyaktit paaŋagaat iñuk atiqaqtuaq Simon-mik, tikitchaqtuqtuaq iniqpaŋmun imaŋŋa nunamiñ. Tavra nunuriŋagaat iqsruquvlugu ilaanun Jesus aŋarrauraŋa. Taamna Simon Cyrene-miu, aapaŋak Alexander-vlu Rufus-lu.

english: They brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha (which is translated, “Place of the Skull”).
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiutiŋagaat inimun Golgotha-mun, sivuniqaqtuamun Inaanik Niaquġruam.

english: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
inupiaq: Tavra imiksriñŋagaat wine-mik avuuŋaruamik Myrrh-mik, aasii imiŋaitkaa.

english: Then they crucified him and divided his clothes, throwing dice for them, to decide what each would take.
inupiaq: Tavra kikiaktuutianikamirruŋ, autaaŋagaich annuġaaŋi, saaptautigivlugich nalliannik iñullaa piñiaqtilaaŋanik.

english: It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified him.
inupiaq: Nainukłaaġman uvlaami kikiaktuutiŋagaat.

english: The inscription of the charge against him read, “The king of the Jews.”
inupiaq: Suli aglaich pasikkusiaŋi iḷiŋagaich niaquata qulaanun uqaluqaqtuat inna, “Umialgat Jews.”

english: And they crucified two outlaws with him, one on his right and one on his left.
inupiaq: Suli tuvaaqasiqł̣ugu kikiaktuutiŋagaich malġuk tigligayuktik, atausiq taliqpiata tuŋaanun, suli igḷua saumiata tuŋaanun.

english: Those who passed by defamed him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! You who can destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
inupiaq: [Tavra Bible uqaluat taŋŋiŋaruq, uqaluqaqtuaq, “Ilaa kisiuqatauŋaruq piḷuktualiqirinun.”]

english: save yourself and come down from the cross!”
inupiaq: Iñuich tamaunnaaqtuat Jesus niaqulavigiraġaŋagaat nivliativlugulu pisaaŋŋatinik, Yaqhii, suksraunġiiyumaaqtuatiin imña aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmik aasii nappatqigḷugu uvluni piŋasuni,

english: In the same way even the chief priests – together with the experts in the law – were mocking him among themselves: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself!
inupiaq: annauttuiñ iliŋnik, atqaġiḷḷu aŋarrauramiñ.

english: Let the Christ, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now, that we may see and believe!” Those who were crucified with him also spoke abusively to him.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik, kipagivlugu uqaŋarut ilimiŋnun, Annaurriŋagaluaqtuq allanik, ilimiñik annautilaitchuq.

english: Now when it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
inupiaq: Tautuglakput Christ umialgat Israel, atqaġli aŋarrauramiñ akkupak ukpiġiliġumagikput. Suli malġuk kikiaktuurrauqatauruak Jesus-mun pisaaŋaŋammigaak.

english: Around three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
inupiaq: Tavra uvluq qitiqqaġman, taaqsiŋaruq iluqani nuna piŋasunugataqtillugu.

english: When some of the bystanders heard it they said, “Listen, he is calling for Elijah!”
inupiaq: Tavra piŋasunuŋman Jesus nivliŋaruq nipatuvluni, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani, sivuniqaqtuaq, God-iiŋ, God-iiŋ, summan suksraaqpiŋa?

english: Then someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah will come to take him down!”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋisa qikaqtuat saniġaani tusaakamirruŋ, uqallaŋarut, Ququulagaa Elijah.

english: But Jesus cried out with a loud voice and breathed his last.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk aqpanŋaruq aasii immiqł̣ugu ivsaktaqtuaq wine-mik, iḷivḷugu qiruum nuvuanun, aitchuŋagaa imiquvlugu uqallautivlugich, Aannagu. Naipiqtuġlakput Elijah qaiñiaġmagaan atqaġiaġlugu.

english: And the temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nivliŋaruq nipatuvluni, aasii aniġniġiqł̣uni.

english: Now when the centurion, who stood in front of him, saw how he died, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
inupiaq: Tavra talukiyaaŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaum aliŋaruq malġuułłuni qulimiñiñ ataanun.

english: There were also women, watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata, qikaqtuam akiani, tusaakamiuŋ tainna nivliqsuaq aniġniġiġmallu, uqallaŋaruq, Iḷumun una iñuk Iġñiġiniġaa God-im.

english: When he was in Galilee, they had followed him and given him support. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were there too.
inupiaq: Tavranivsauq aġnat qiñiŋarut uŋasiñiñ. Iḷagiŋagaich Salome, Mary-ḷu Magdalene, suli Mary aakaŋak James-lu kamanaiññiqsram Joses-lu.

english: Now when evening had already come, since it was the day of preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
inupiaq: Taapkua aġnat maliġiŋakkaŋat Jesus Galilee-miinman pamaġivlugu. Allattauq iñugiaktuat aġnat tavraniinŋarut maliŋaruat Jerusalem-muŋman.

english: Joseph of Arimathea, a highly regarded member of the council, who was himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
inupiaq: Tanuġaksiaqsimman Joseph Arimathea-ġmiu tikiñŋaruq.

english: Pilate was surprised that he was already dead. He called the centurion and asked him if he had been dead for some time.
inupiaq: Ilaa isumakkusiaqaġluataqłuni iḷauruaq aŋaiyyuvikpaum uqaqsitaaqtitchiriŋiñun, niġiuktuaguruaq tikiññiksraŋanun God-im atanniqsimannigniksraŋanik iñuŋnun. Taamna uvluq Itqanaiyaġviuruaq sivuani Jew-guruat Savairviata. Tavra Joseph sivuuqqataiqł̣uni Pilate-muŋaruq, aasii apiqqusiġivlugu Jesus timaa.

english: When Pilate was informed by the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
inupiaq: Pilate niġiiḷḷaqtauŋaruq tusaakamiuŋ Jesus tuquaniktilaaŋa. Tavra qaitquŋagaa aŋuyaktit atanauraŋat aasii apiġivlugu tuquaniŋmagaan Jesus.

english: After Joseph bought a linen cloth and took down the body, he wrapped it in the linen and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock. Then he rolled a stone across the entrance of the tomb.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchuġianikamiuŋ aŋuyaktit atanauraŋanniñ, pitquŋagaa timaa Jesus Joseph-mun.

english: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where the body was placed.
inupiaq: Tavra Joseph tauqsiŋaruq qatiqtuamik ukił̣haaġiksuamik, aasii atqaqługu Jesus timaa, suli nimmaaqługu qatiqtuamik ukił̣haaġiksuamik iḷiŋagaa iḷuvviviŋmun nayuurramun uyaġakun. Tavra aksraŋagaa uyaġagruaq upkurriutivlugu iḷuvviviŋmun.

english: Now many have undertaken to compile an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us,
inupiaq: Iñulluatapiaġatamun Theophilus-mun.

english: like the accounts passed on to us by those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iñuich pisuqtilaamiktun aglautiŋagaich sut piŋaruat akunnaptiŋni.

english: So it seemed good to me as well, because I have followed all things carefully from the beginning, to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
inupiaq: Tamatkuniŋa quliaqtuaġutiŋagaatigut iñuich qiñiŋaruat tamatkua pimmata isuaniñqaŋa. Iñuich tamatkua paŋmapak alġaqsruiraurut tamattumiŋa tusaayugaaġiksuamik.

english: so that you may know for certain the things you were taught.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋnun, Theophilus, isummatigiŋammigiga nakuurualivḷugu aglautigupkich tamatkua iłuaqsruaġlugich, qanuq qaŋapasugruuraq qaunakłaaqłuŋa iḷitchuġiniataŋagiga iḷumun ittuaq iliŋisigullaa piruatigun.

english: During the reign of Herod king of Judea, there lived a priest named Zechariah who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah, and he had a wife named Elizabeth, who was a descendant of Aaron.
inupiaq: Aasiuvva aglautiŋagitka tamatkua, iḷisimatquvlutin iḷumun itilaaŋannik iḷisausiaġiŋakkatin.

english: They were both righteous in the sight of God, following all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly.
inupiaq: Herod iñuuŋŋaan umialguruaq Judea-mi, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik Zechariah-mik. Aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi savaqatauŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun taiguutiqaqtuanun Abijah-m piqatiŋiñik. Zechariah nuliaqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik Elizabeth-mik, maŋŋuqaqtuamik Aaron-miñ, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich maŋŋuanniñ.

english: But they did not have a child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both very old.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqatik nalaunŋarualiqirauŋaruk sivuġaani God-im, kamagivlugich iluqaisa pitquraŋi Atanġum pasiñaġumiñaił̣ł̣utik.

english: Now while Zechariah was serving as priest before God when his division was on duty,
inupiaq: Aglaan miqłiqtuiñŋaruk, qanuq Elizabeth miqłiqsiḷaiñŋaruq, suli iluqatik utuqqaliŋaruk.

english: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to enter the holy place of the Lord and burn incense.
inupiaq: Abijah-m piqatiŋi tikiutimmagich savaŋniksraŋata aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, Zechariah-m savautiŋagaa God aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauvluni.

english: Now the whole crowd of people were praying outside at the hour of the incense offering.
inupiaq: Aasii aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich piḷġusiatigun, Zechariah nalunaiqsauŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauruksrauvluni ikipkaiḷuni tivraġiksaunmik. Ilaa isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋanun Atanġum ikipkaiviŋmun tivraġiksaunmik.

english: An angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense, appeared to him.
inupiaq: Tavra Zechariah ikipkaipkaqtillugu tivraġiksaunmik, iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich aŋaiyyuŋarut siḷataani.

english: And Zechariah, visibly shaken when he saw the angel, was seized with fear.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani Atanġum isaġulga niptaŋaruq, makitavluni taliqpiata tuŋaani ikipkaivium tivraġiksaunmik.

english: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son; you will name him John.
inupiaq: Tavra Zechariah-m tautukkamiuŋ isaġulik tupaŋaruq, iqsitchaŋaruġlu.

english: Joy and gladness will come to you, and many will rejoice at his birth,
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum uqallautiŋagaa, Iqsiñak Zechariah, qanuq God-im tusaaŋagaa aŋaiyyutin, aasii nulian Elizabeth iġñiqaġniaqtuq. John-mik atchiġñiaġiñ.

english: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He must never drink wine or strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even before his birth.
inupiaq: Tavra quviasuutiqpaqaġniaqtutin, suli iñugiaktuat iñuich quviasuutiqpaqaġniaqtut anikpan.

english: He will turn many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaa kamanaġniaqtuq sivuġaani Atanġum, suli imiġniaŋitchuq wine-mik naaggaunnii imiŋasiñaqtuamik, suli immiqsauniaqtuq Ilitqusiġiksuamik aniñiġmiñiñqaŋa.

english: And he will go as forerunner before the Lord in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him.”
inupiaq: Ilaan utiġuliqsinniaġai iñugiaktuat Israel-guruat ukpiġuliqsillugich Ataniġmun God-iŋannun.

english: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is old as well.”
inupiaq: Tavra Ataniq qaiŋaiñŋaan, taamna John alġaqsruiñiaqtuq Elijah-m alġaqsruisiatun suaŋŋatiqaġniŋatullu. Ilaan aŋayuqaaguruat atisipkaġniaġai miqłiqtuŋiññun. Tamatkua uqaqsiġiitchuat ukpiliqsinniaġai nalaunŋaruatun iñuktun. Tainna piḷuni, ilaan itqanaiyaġniaġai iñuich akuqtuġumiñaqsiḷugu Ataniq.

english: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
inupiaq: Tavra Zechariah uqallaŋaruq isaġuliŋmun, Qanuġlugu iḷisimaniaqpigu taamna piñiaqtilaaŋanik? Qanuq aŋayuqaaŋaruŋa, nuliaġasuli aaquaŋammiuq.

english: And now, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time, you will be silent, unable to speak, until the day these things take place.”
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa Gabriel-guruŋa, savaktiŋa God-im iviġaumagivluŋa, aasii tilirauŋaruŋa uqautitquvlutin taavrumiŋa tusaayugaaġiksuamik.

english: Now the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they began to wonder why he was delayed in the holy place.
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiġiŋiññapkich uqalutka, nalaunniaqtuat piviksramikkun, nipaiññiaqtutin uqalaitchuatun iñuktun tikiḷġataġlugu uvluq tamatkua nalaurviksraŋat.

english: When he came out, he was not able to speak to them. They realized that he had seen a vision in the holy place, because he was making signs to them and remained unable to speak.
inupiaq: Tavrali iñuich utaqqiŋagaat Zechariah, suli isummatigiŋagaat muluvluni isiġmiuniŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi.

english: When his time of service was over, he went to his home.
inupiaq: Tavraasii anikami, uqautiyumiñaiñŋagai iñuich. Tavrani iḷitchuġiŋarut tautuktilaaŋanik qiñiqtuuraamik aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi. Tavra urriqaŋagai argagmiñik uqallaiŋavluni.

english: After some time his wife Elizabeth became pregnant, and for five months she kept herself in seclusion. She said,
inupiaq: Tavra Abijah-m piqatiŋisa savagviksraŋat naannamiuŋ aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, Zechariah aiŋaruq.

english: “This is what the Lord has done for me at the time when he has been gracious to me, to take away my disgrace among people.”
inupiaq: Tamatkua pianiŋmata, Zechariah-m nuliaŋa Elizabeth siŋaiyauŋaruq, aasii tallimani tatqiñi aimmiŋaruq isumalaaqłuni,

english: In the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a town of Galilee called Nazareth,
inupiaq: Ataniq savaŋaruq aliuġnaqtuamik uvamnun. Paŋmapak kanŋusukkumiñaiqsuŋa miqłiqtuiññiġa pisigilugu.

english: to a virgin engaged to a man whose name was Joseph, a descendant of David, and the virgin’s name was Mary.
inupiaq: Tavra itchaksrat tatqich pianiŋmata Elizabeth siŋaiyausaaniŋman, isaġulik Gabriel tiliŋagaa God-im iniqpaŋmun atiqaqtuamun Nazareth-mik, Galilee-miittuamun.

english: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one, the Lord is with you!”
inupiaq: God-im tiliŋagaa niviaqsiamun aŋusiuŋaitchuamun atiqaqtuamun Mary-mik, piksrautiniŋaruamun aŋunmik atiqaqtuamik Joseph-mik, kiŋunġuruaq umialiŋmun David-mun.

english: But she was greatly troubled by his words and began to wonder about the meaning of this greeting.
inupiaq: [Tavra Gabriel-gum ullaŋagaa aasii uqallautivlugu, Tutqiutiqaġiñ, iviġaumagiraupiaqtuatiin, Atanġum itqatigigaatin. Quviatchaktitaurutin naamaruamik aġnapayaaniñ.]

english: So the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God!
inupiaq: Tavra Mary-m atqunaqłuni tupauttaġiŋagaa uqalua isaġulgum, suli isumalaaġutigivlugu sumik paġlatiŋi sivuniqaġniaqtilaaŋannik.

english: Listen: You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum uqallautiŋagaa, Iqsiñak Mary. God-im iviġaummatigigaatin.

english: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
inupiaq: Uvvaasii siŋaiyauniaqtutin aasii iġñiqaġlutin. Atchiġumagiñ Jesus-mik.

english: He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”
inupiaq: Ilaa kamanaġniaqtuq. Iġñiġiniaġaa sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im. Suli Atanġum God-im umialiguqtinniaġaa David-tun maŋŋuuruatun ilaanun.

english: Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have not had sexual relations with a man?”
inupiaq: Aasii ilaa umialguniaqtuq isuitchuamun kiŋuniŋiñun Jacob, aasiisuli ilaan atanniqsimmataa isuiññiaqtuq.

english: The angel replied, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called the Son of God.
inupiaq: Mary-m uqallautiŋagaa isaġulik, Qanuġluni taamna piyumiñaqpa uigiḷḷaġma?

english: “And look, your relative Elizabeth has also become pregnant with a son in her old age – although she was called barren, she is now in her sixth month!
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum kiuŋagaa, Ilitqusiġiksuaq qaiñiaqtuq iliŋnun, aasii suaŋŋataata sapiġñaqtuam God-im itqatiginiaġaatin nalautillasiḷugu. Taamnaasii pisigilugu piḷuutaitchuaq miqłiqtuq tairauniaqtuq Iġñiŋanik God-im.

english: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
inupiaq: Aasiuvva, nanmiñiq iḷan Elizabeth aaquaŋagaluaqtuq, siŋaiyausaaniŋammiuq aŋunmik. Uvvaasii iḷisimanaqtuam miqłiqsiḷaitchuaguvlugu itchaksriġai tatqich siŋaiyausaqami.

english: So Mary said, “Yes, I am a servant of the Lord; let this happen to me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.
inupiaq: Qanuq God piḷḷaruq supayaamik.

english: In those days Mary got up and went hurriedly into the hill country, to a town of Judah,
inupiaq: Tavra Mary uqallaŋaruq, Uvva Atanġum kivgaġigaaŋa. Piḷi uvamnun tuvraġlugu uqaluiñ. Tavra isaġulik aullaŋaruq ilaaniñ.

english: and entered Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun, Mary aullaġnasuaŋaruq qimialuuruamun nunamun, nunaaqqich iḷaŋannun Judea-miittuamun.

english: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Aasii isiŋaruq igluanun Zechariah-m, paġlavlugu Elizabeth.

english: She exclaimed with a loud voice, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child in your womb!
inupiaq: Tavrali Elizabeth tusaakamiuŋ paġlataa Mary-m, miqłiqtuq aulaliqtuŋaruq iḷuani, suli Elizabeth Ilitqusiġiksuam aŋalałługu,

english: And who am I that the mother of my Lord should come and visit me?
inupiaq: uqallaŋaruq nipatuvluni, God-im iviġaumagiłhaaŋagaatin aġnapayauraniñ God-im iviġaumagigaa siŋaiyaan.

english: For the instant the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
inupiaq: Qanutun iviġaumakkusiaqaqtigivik aakaŋata Ataniġma ullakkumiñaġmaŋa.

english: And blessed is she who believed that what was spoken to her by the Lord would be fulfilled.”
inupiaq: Qanuq uvva, paġlatin tusaapqauraqapku, miqłiqtuuraq iḷumni aulaliqtuŋaruq quviatchaktuatun.

english: And Mary said,
inupiaq: Aasii quviatchaktitaugiñ ukpiliŋarutin taŋŋiqsauniaġnivḷugich uqausiusiatin Ataniġmiñ.

english: “My soul exalts the Lord,
inupiaq: Tavra Mary uqallaŋaruq, Uummatimniñ iluqaaniñ nanġaġiga Ataniq,

english: and my spirit has begun to rejoice in God my Savior,
inupiaq: suli iḷumni quviasukpaktuŋa qanuq God-im annaurrigikkaġma

english: because he has looked upon the humble state of his servant.
inupiaq: piksraqtaaġiŋagaaŋa kamanaił̣ł̣uŋa kivgaġigaluaqłuŋa. Qanuq uvva, tavraŋŋaaglaan iñupayaat taiñiaġaanŋa iviġaumakkusiaqaqtuamik.

english: For from now on all generations will call me blessed,
inupiaq: Qanuq taavruma sapiġñaqtuam God-im savautiŋagaaŋa kamanaqtuakun aliuġnaqtuamik. God piḷuutaitchuq.

english: because he who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is his name;
inupiaq: Suli ilaan nagliktuutaa ittuq iñupayaanun qiksiksrautiqaqtuanun inmiñun kiŋuniġiipayaani.

english: from generation to generation he is merciful to those who fear him.
inupiaq: Ilaa savaŋaruq aliuġnaqtuanik. Kamanaiŋagai kamasaaqtuat taputivlugich sivunniuġutiŋich.

english: He has demonstrated power with his arm; he has scattered those whose pride wells up from the sheer arrogance of their hearts.
inupiaq: Tamatkua atanniqsimanniktuat suaŋŋataiŋagai, suli kamanaitchuat kamanaqsipkaqługich.

english: He has brought down the mighty from their thrones, and has lifted up those of lowly position;
inupiaq: Tamatkua ikayuqtisiuqtuat piqaqtuksrauvlutiŋ pisuġuiqsitkai, aasiiḷi ikayuqtisiuŋitchuat pigiraksraġikkaġmikkun ilaan pisuŋitkai.

english: he has filled the hungry with good things, and has sent the rich away empty.
inupiaq: Ilaan ikayuŋagai kivgani Israel-guruat, suli nagliktuqługich, unniqsuqłiisimisun maŋŋuptiŋnun Abraham-mun kiŋuniŋiñullu isuitchuamun.

english: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering his mercy,
inupiaq: Tavra Mary-m nayuŋagaa Elizabeth miksraułługich tatqich piŋasut, aasii utiŋaruq aimaaġviŋmiñun.

english: as he promised to our ancestors, to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiutiŋagaa Elizabeth iġñiviksraŋanun, aasii iġñiqaŋaruq.

english: So Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then returned to her home.
inupiaq: Tavra siḷalliŋisa nanmiñiŋisalu tusaaŋagaat Ataniq kamanaqtuamik nagliktuiñivḷugu Elizabeth-mun, aasii quviasukpaqatigiŋagaat.

english: Now the time came for Elizabeth to have her baby, and she gave birth to a son.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat piŋasuanni uvlut, iliŋikta nalunaiñŋutchiqsitchaqtuŋagaak miqłiqtuq, aasii atchiġuŋagaluaġaat Zechariah-mik aapaŋatun.

english: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
inupiaq: Tavra aakaŋa uqallaŋaruq, Taavrumiŋa atiqaġniaŋitchuq. Ilaan atiġiniaġaa John.

english: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they wanted to name him Zechariah after his father.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Nalliat-unnii nanmiñiq iḷavich atiqaŋaitchuq taavrumiŋa atiġmik.

english: But his mother replied, “No! He must be named John.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich urriqaŋarut aapaŋanun, apiqsrivḷutiŋ sumik ilaanun atchiqummagaan nukatpiaġruk.

english: They said to her, “But none of your relatives bears this name.”
inupiaq: Tavra Zecharias apiqsriŋaruq aglagviksramik, aasii aglakłuni uumiŋa. Ilaan atqa John. Tavra iliŋich aliuŋarut.

english: So they made signs to the baby’s father, inquiring what he wanted to name his son.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq Zechariah uqallasiŋaruq, aasii uqallakłuni, nanġaqługu God.

english: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they were all amazed.
inupiaq: Tavra aliuġutchaŋarut iluqaġmiŋ siḷalliŋi. Suli tamatkua iluqaisa uqautigiŋagaich iluqaani qimialuŋiññi Judea-m nunaaqqiŋisa.

english: Immediately Zechariah’s mouth was opened and his tongue released, and he spoke, blessing God.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ tusaaruat tamatkuniŋa piiguitkaaġiŋagaich, uqaurrutiŋarut avanmun, Qanutun aliuġnaqtiginiaqpa una miqłiqtuq. Qanuq nalunaiñŋaruq Ataniġmun itqatigitilaaŋa.

english: All their neighbors were filled with fear, and throughout the entire hill country of Judea all these things were talked about.
inupiaq: Tavra John-gum aapaŋa Zechariah Ilitqusiġiksuam aŋalałługu uqaqtinŋagaa nanġautinik piyumaaqtuaniglu.

english: All who heard these things kept them in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be?” For the Lord’s hand was indeed with him.
inupiaq: Nanġaġlakput Ataniq God-iŋat Israel-guruat, qanuq ilaan ikayuġiaŋagai aasii annautivlugich iñuŋni.

english: Then his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied,
inupiaq: Akunġanniñ kiŋuniŋisa David, God piksraŋaruq Iñuŋmik suaŋŋatiqaqtuamik annautiyumiñaqłuta.

english: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
inupiaq: Taimaŋŋaqaŋa uqausiġmisun ilaan nanmiñiq uqaqtimigun,

english: because he has come to help and has redeemed his people.
inupiaq: annaurrauniaġnivḷuta akiḷḷivsiŋñiñ, suli iluqaiññiñ uumikłiqsuaniñ uvaptiŋnik.

english: For he has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,
inupiaq: God nagliktauruq aŋayuqaaptiŋnun taŋŋiqł̣ugich unniqsuqłiisini miqłiqtuŋiññun.

english: as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from long ago,
inupiaq: Uvva unniqsuqłiiñ nalupqinaiŋaraŋa maŋŋuptiŋnun Abraham-mun.

english: that we should be saved from our enemies,
inupiaq: Uvagut ilaan annautiniaġnivḷuta akiḷḷivsiŋñiñ uvaptiŋnun savautitquvluni iqsiŋaiġḷuta.

english: and from the hand of all who hate us.
inupiaq: Suli savautilugu iñuuniqtutilaaptiktun piḷuutaitchuakun nalaunŋaruakullu.

english: He has done this to show mercy to our ancestors,
inupiaq: Aasii ilivich miqłiqtuuŋ, tairauniaqtutin uqaqtaanik sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im, qanuq aulaniaqtutin sivuani Atanġum itqanaiyaġlugich iñuich akuqtuġumiñaqsiḷugu Ataniq,

english: and to remember his holy covenant –
inupiaq: iḷitchuġipkaġlugich God-mun annautiniḷugich, suliqutigiŋaiqł̣ugich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutiŋich.

english: the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham.
inupiaq: Qanuq God-ikput nagliktuutiqpaqaqtuq piaqłuktautiqaŋitchuġlu uvaptiŋnun. Uvlum nutauruam qausaġatauraġniŋatun inniaqtuq uvaptiŋnun, tilikpagu Annaurri.

english: This oath grants
inupiaq: Tamatkua paŋmapak taaqtuamiittuat sivuuġagivlugu tuqqun, iñuurraqsiñiaqtut qaummaġmi, ukpiġlutiŋ ilaanun, aasii ilaan iñuupkaġluta tutqiksilluta.

english: that we, being rescued from the hand of our enemies,
inupiaq: Tavra miqłiqtuq agliŋaruq suaŋasisaiññaqłuniḷu nalaunŋarualiqiniġmun. Suli nunagluktuami iñuuŋaruq uvluanunaglaan satqummiġñiksrami Israel-guruanun.

english: may serve him without fear,
in holiness and righteousness before him for as long as we live.
And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High.
For you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
to give his people knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins.
Because of our God’s tender mercy
the dawn will break upon us from on high
to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
And the child kept growing and becoming strong in spirit, and he was in the wilderness until the day he was revealed to Israel.
Now in those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus to register all the empire for taxes.
inupiaq: Taipkunani uvluni Caesar Augustus pitquraliŋaruq nunam iñupayauraŋi atanniqsimakkani atchiitquvlugich.

english: This was the first registration, taken when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
inupiaq: Taamna atchiiñiq piqqaaŋaruq Quirinius atanauraumman Syria-mi.

english: Everyone went to his own town to be registered.
inupiaq: Tavra iñupayaat atchiiyaqtuaŋarut ilaisa nanmiñiq iniqpaŋmiŋñun.

english: So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family line of David.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq Joseph aullaŋammiuq Galilee-miñ, iniqpaŋmiñ Nazareth-miñ, Judea-mun iniqpaŋanun David, atiqaqtuamun Bethlehem-mik, qanuq ilaa David-gum kiŋuniġivlugu.

english: He went to be registered with Mary, who was promised in marriage to him, and who was expecting a child.
inupiaq: Joseph atchiiyyaqatigiŋagaa Mary, tuvaaqatiksrautini, siŋaiyauruaq.

english: While they were there, the time came for her to deliver her child.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraniillaġmiŋ, iġñiviksraŋan tikiutiŋagaa.

english: And she gave birth to her firstborn son and wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.
inupiaq: Tavra iġñiŋaruq aŋayukłiġmik aŋunmik aasii nimmaaŋagaa miquŋaitchuanik ukił̣haanik, aasii iḷivḷugu niġrutit niġġiviannun, qanuq iniksraiñŋarut tukkumaviŋmi.

english: Now there were shepherds nearby living out in the field, keeping guard over their flock at night.
inupiaq: Tavra tamaani nunami imnaiḷiqirit qaunaksriŋarut imnaimiŋnik unnuami.

english: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were absolutely terrified.
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum isaġulgata niptaġvigiŋagai, suli qaumanġa Atanġum qaummaġiksinŋaruq avataannun, aasii iqsiḷiŋarut.

english: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid! Listen carefully, for I proclaim to you good news that brings great joy to all the people:
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum uqallautiŋagai, Iqsiñasi, qanuq uvva, quliaqtuaġutiyaqtuġivsi tusaayugaaġiksuanik iñupayaat quviasuutiqpaginiakkaŋiññik.

english: Today your Savior is born in the city of David. He is Christ the Lord.
inupiaq: Qanuq uumani unnuami aniruq annaurriksi, iniqpaŋani David, Christ-guruaq Ataniq.

english: This will be a sign for you: You will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
inupiaq: Aasiuvva iḷitchuqqutiksraqsi ilaagutilaaŋanik. Ilivsi paqinniaġiksi miqłiqtuuraq nimmaaŋaruaq miquŋaitchuanik ukił̣haanik, suli nalavluni niġrutit niġġivianni.

english: Suddenly a vast, heavenly army appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq isaġulik piqasiŋagaat isaġulisalaich nanġaqługu God, suli uqaqłutiŋ,

english: “Glory to God in the highest,
inupiaq: Nanġaqtauli God qiḷaŋmiittuaq, suli nunami aŋuyautairrutiqaġli akunġanni iñuich ilaan iviġaumagikkaŋisa.

english: and on earth peace among people with whom he is pleased!”
inupiaq: Isaġulgich qiḷaŋmuaniŋmata, imnaiḷiqirit uqaŋarut inmiŋnun, Aullaqtauvagut Bethlehem-mun tautugiaġlugu taamamna piruaq, Atanġum kilgutigikkaŋa uvaptiŋnun.

english: When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go over to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, that the Lord has made known to us.”
inupiaq: Tavra qilamiqsruqłutiŋ aullaŋarut, aasii paqiłługich Mary-ḷu Joseph-lu miqłiqtuuraġlu nalaruaq niġrutit niġġivianni.

english: So they hurried off and located Mary and Joseph, and found the baby lying in a manger.
inupiaq: Tavra tautuqqaaqługu, uqautigiŋagaat uqaluk uqausiusiaqtik taavrumuuna miqłiqtukun.

english: When they saw him, they related what they had been told about this child,
inupiaq: Aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñuich tusaaruat imnaiḷiqiriniñ uqaluusiamiŋnik aliuŋarut.

english: and all who heard it were astonished at what the shepherds said.
inupiaq: Mary-vḷiasii itqaumagiŋagai isumalaaġutigivlugich iluqaisa piruat.

english: But Mary treasured up all these words, pondering in her heart what they might mean.
inupiaq: Tavra imnaiḷiqirit utiŋarut, kamanaqsiḷiqługu nanġaqługulu God iluqaisigun tusaaramikkun tautukkamikkullu uqausiusiamiktun.

english: So the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen; everything was just as they had been told.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat piŋasut uvlut naanmata, nalunaiñŋutchiqsauganiŋman, atchiqsauŋaruq Jesus-mik, atchiutiksrirrutaanik isaġulgum siŋaiyaagusaŋaiñŋaan.

english: At the end of eight days, when he was circumcised, he was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
inupiaq: Nalautinman Mary-vḷu Jesus-lu aullaġviksraŋak aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun nalautitchiyaqtuġlutiŋ Moses pitquraŋiñik miqłiqtuq animman, Jerusalem-muŋarut aitchuutigiyaqtuqługu miqłiqtuqtiŋ Ataniġmun.

english: Now when the time came for their purification according to the law of Moses, Joseph and Mary brought Jesus up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
inupiaq: Taavrumuuna aglausimaruq God-im pitquraŋiñi inna, “Aŋugaiyaaq aŋayukłiq ilaaguaqtauniaqtuq Ataniġmun.”

english: (just as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male will be set apart to the Lord”),
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññamiŋ aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun, aitchuiŋaruk ikipkautinik, Atanġum pitquraŋisa uqaluatigun, “Malġugnik nuyuaqturuagnik tiŋmiaŋnik, naagga malġugnik tiŋmiayaaŋnik nuyuitchuaŋnik.”

english: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is specified in the law of the Lord, a pair of doves or two young pigeons.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk inŋaruq Jerusalem-mi atiqaqtuaq Simeon-mik. Taamna iñuk nalaunŋaruaguŋaruq sivuġaani God-im, iñulluatauvluniḷu, aasii niġiuŋaruq qakugu God tilisiñiaqtilaaŋanik Annaurrimik Israel-nun, suli Ilitqusiġiksuam aŋalanŋagaa.

english: Now there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon who was righteous and devout, looking for the restoration of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
inupiaq: Ilitqusiġiksuam iḷitchuġipkaŋagaa tuquniaŋiññivḷugu tautukkaluaġnagu Annaurri Atanġum tiliñiakkaŋa.

english: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
inupiaq: Tavra Ilitqusiġiksuam isummiŋagaa aŋaiyyuviŋmuguliqsiłługu. Tavraasii aŋayuqaaguruak itqutimmatku miqłiqtuq Jesus, pisisaqtuqługu piḷġusiatigun pitqurat,

english: So Simeon, directed by the Spirit, came into the temple courts, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what was customary according to the law,
inupiaq: Simeon tigumirriutiŋagaa aasii nanġaaqsivḷugu God uqaqłuni.

english: Simeon took him in his arms and blessed God, saying,
inupiaq: Ataniiq, paŋmapak uvaŋa kivgan tuquyumiñaqsiruŋa tutqigḷuŋa, qanuq taŋŋiŋagiñ unniqsuqłiisin uvamnun.

english: “Now, according to your word, Sovereign Lord, permit your servant to depart in peace.
inupiaq: Qanuq uvamnik tautuanikkiga Annaurri,

english: For my eyes have seen your salvation
inupiaq: ilivich tiliŋakkan annautitquvlugich iñuich sumipayaaq.

english: that you have prepared in the presence of all peoples:
inupiaq: Tusaayugaaġiksuat ilaagun inniaqtut qaummaqtun Jew-guŋitchuanun, satqummiġḷugu iliŋiññun iḷumun ittuaq God-ikun, suli iñuktin Israel isumakkusiaqallasiḷugich qutchiksuakun.

english: a light,
inupiaq: Tavra Joseph-lu Mary-vḷu aliuġiŋagaich Simeon uqautiŋi miqłiqtukun.

english: for revelation to the Gentiles,
inupiaq: Suli Simeon qiññuaġutiŋagik quviasuunmik, suli uqallautivlugu Mary aakaŋa. Sivunniutauŋaruq una miqłiqtuq agvisauniaġnivḷugu annagniksraŋannun iñugiaktuat Israel-guruani, suli iñugiaktuat tammaġniksraŋannun. Suli pisigilugu ilaan suutilaaŋa, iñugiaktuat akiḷḷiḷiqsuġniaġaat uqaluŋmiŋni,

english: and for glory to your people Israel.”
inupiaq: salapqialugu qanuq isummatiqaqtilaaqtiŋ ilaagun. Aasiiḷi ilivich isumaaġutiqpaum nagliksaaqtiniaġaatin.

english: So the child’s father and mother were amazed at what was said about him.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq aġnaq atiqaqtuaq Anna-mik inmiñiqsuq, uqaqtaa God-im pania Phanuel-gum maŋŋuqaqtuam Asher-mik. Anna aaquaŋaniqsuq, tuvaaqatiqaŋaniqsuaq tallimat malġugni ukiuni, aasii uiŋa tuquvluni.

english: Then Simeon blessed them and said to his mother Mary, “Listen carefully: This child is destined to be the cause of the falling and rising of many in Israel and to be a sign that will be rejected.
inupiaq: Taimaŋŋaaglaan iñuuŋaruq uiḷgaŋavluni, aasii sisamakipiaq sisamanik ukiuniŋaruq. Aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ piiḷaiḷaaguŋaruq unnuakkaluami uvlukkaluamiḷu niġiḷaiḷaaguraġaluni nanġaqługu aŋaiyyuvigivlugu Ataniq.

english: Indeed, as a result of him the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed – and a sword will pierce your own soul as well!”
inupiaq: Aasii tavruŋa ullakługich taavrumanivsauq ikarraġmi, quyyavigiŋagaa God. Quliaqtuaġisaġataŋagaa miqłiqtuq iluqaiññun Jerusalem-miittuanun niġiuktuaguruanun annaunmik.

english: There was also a prophetess, Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old, having been married to her husband for seven years until his death.
inupiaq: Tavra taŋŋianikamitkik supayaurat pitquraŋiguaqtuat Atanġum, utiŋarut Galilee-mun, aimaaġviŋmiŋnun Nazareth-mun.

english: She had lived as a widow since then for eighty-four years. She never left the temple, worshiping with fasting and prayer night and day.
inupiaq: Tavra miqłiqtuq Jesus agliŋaruq saŋŋisivḷuniḷu, isumattusiqpakłuniḷu. Suli God-im iviġaummatigiŋagaa.

english: At that moment, she came up to them and began to give thanks to God and to speak about the child to all who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aŋayuqaak aullaġaqtuk Jerusalem-mun ukiutuaġman niqinaqiviani Qulaurrusiqutikun Itqautim.

english: So when Joseph and Mary had performed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qulit malġugnik ukiuniŋman, aullaŋalgitchuk piḷġusikaamiktun niqinaqiyaqtuqłutiŋ.

english: And the child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon him.
inupiaq: Tavra niqinaqivik isukłiñman, utiqsaġmaŋnik nukatpiaġruk Jesus qimaktinŋaruq Jerusalem-mun. Aŋayuqaak aasii naluŋaruk.

english: Now Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem every year for the feast of the Passover.
inupiaq: Tavra isummatigivlugu iglaani iglauqataunasugivlugu, iglauŋaruk uvluqtutilaaŋatun, aasii ivaŋagaluaġaak nanmiñiġmiŋni aunniuġusimakkamiŋniḷu.

english: When he was twelve years old, they went up according to custom.
inupiaq: Tavraasii paqinŋisanikamitku, utiqsaŋaruk Jerusalem-mun ivaqługu.

english: But when the feast was over, as they were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it,
inupiaq: Uvlut piŋasut pianiŋmata paqinŋagaak aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, aquppiruaq akunġanni iḷisaurrit pitquranik, naalaġnivḷugich apiqsruqtuqługiḷḷu.

english: but (because they assumed that he was in their group of travelers) they went a day’s journey. Then they began to look for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ tusaaruat ilaanik kamasuŋarut kaŋiqsisuġniŋanik kiggutiŋiñiglu.

english: When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem to look for him.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋayuqaakisa tautukamitku, niġiiḷḷaqtauŋaruk. Aasii aakaŋata uqallautiŋagaa, Iġñiiŋ, summan inna piŋiksraqtitpisiguk? Uvva, aapallu uvaŋalu ivaŋagiptigiñ uŋiarrisigivlutin.
