english: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagik, Qanuq imña ivaġniqpisiñŋa? Puttuqsriŋayumiñaŋagaluaqtutik ittuksrautilaamnik Aapama igluani.

english: And all who heard Jesus were astonished at his understanding and his answers.
inupiaq: Tavra kaŋiqsiŋaitkaak ilaan uqallautaa inmiŋnun.

english: When his parents saw him, they were overwhelmed. His mother said to him, “Child, why have you treated us like this? Look, your father and I have been looking for you anxiously.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus utiqatigiŋagik Nazareth-mun. Suli kamakkutiqaŋaruq iliŋiŋnun, aasiiḷi aakaŋan tamatkua iluqaisa itqagiŋagai.

english: But he replied, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isumatusisaiññaŋaruq aglivḷuniḷu, suli iñuuŋaruq nalaunŋaruakun iviġaumavlugu God iñuiḷḷu.

english: Yet his parents did not understand the remark he made to them.
Then he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them. But his mother kept all these things in her heart.
And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature, and in favor with God and with people.

In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
inupiaq: Tavra una piŋaruq akimiaŋanni ukiut umialguniŋani Tiberius Caesar-m, Pontius Pilate kavanaupkaqługu Judea-mi, aasiiḷi Herod atanauraumman Galilee-mi, ilaan aniqataa Philip atanauraumman nunaŋiññun Ituraea-m Trachonitis-lu, suli Lysanias atanauraumman Abilene-mi.

english: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaummaŋnigli Annas-lu Caiaphas-lu. Taavrumani ukiumi, God-im uqaluksriñŋagaa John, iġñiŋa Zecharias-gum, nunagluktuamiitillugu.

english: He went into all the region around the Jordan River, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
inupiaq: Tavra John kukiḷuŋaruq iluqaiññun nunanun avataani kuuŋan Jordan ittuanun, alġaqsruivḷuni iñuich paptaiqsautquvlugich, isumalitqiqqaaġlutiŋ piḷuunmiŋniñ, God-mun suliqutigiŋaiqulugich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutitiŋ.

english: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
inupiaq: Taamna sivuniġivlugu aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna. Isaiah uqallaŋaruq,

english: “The voice of one shouting in the wilderness:
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai iñusalaich ullautiruat paptaiquvlutiŋ ilaanun, Tuqunaliktun nimiġiatun ittusi, pisaasuqtusi. Isumanasi paptaiqsaugiññaġlusi pillugniaġasugalugu God-im tatavsautaa.

english: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord,
inupiaq: Iñuusitchi nalunaiġḷugu isumalitqiksilaaqsi piḷuutivsiññiñ. Suli isumasaġnasi pillugniaġasugalugu God-im tatavsautaa pisigilugu Abraham-mun kiŋuniġiniḷusi. Qanuq uqallautigivsi, God miqłiqtuliḷḷaruq Abraham-mun makkunaŋŋa uyaġagniñ.

english: make his paths straight.
inupiaq: God-im isivġiutaa qallipiaġataqtuq, iñuktun itqanaiqsuatun kipisałhiñaaġuqługu napaaqtuq kaŋiagun. Napaaqtupayaaq siiġñiḷḷuatalaitchuaq kipirausuuruq, aasii qirugivlugu igniġmun. Tainnatun God-im suksraunġiġñiaġai iñuich nalaunŋarualiqiŋitchuat.

english: Every valley will be filled,
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich apiqsruqtuŋagaat, Aasiuvva Qanuġniaqpisa?

english: and every mountain and hill will be brought low,
inupiaq: Tavra John kiuŋagai, Iñuk una malġugnik quppiġaaqaqtuaq, aitchuiḷi igḷuanik piitchuamun, suli iñuk niqautiqaqtuaq, tainnatuttauq piḷi.

english: and the crooked will be made straight,
inupiaq: Tax-iñik katitchirit qaiŋammiut paptaiqsauyyaqłutiŋ, aasii apiġivlugu, Iḷisaurrii, qanuġniaqpisa?

english: and the rough ways will be made smooth,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Katitchiñiaŋitchusi qaaŋiġḷugu piraksriusiaqsi.

english: and all humanity will see the salvation of God.’”
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktittauq apiġiŋagaat, Aasiiḷi uvagut qanuġniaġmivisa? Tavra John kiuŋagai, Tigligiñagu iñupayaaq. Saglutigilugich iñuich uqautiginagich. Apaigisigik akiññaktaasi.

english: So John said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich niġiuktuaguvlutiŋ Christ-mik qaiyumaaqtuamik, iluqaġmiŋ nalupqisuutiqaŋarut John-kun, iḷaanni Christ-gunasugalugu.

english: Therefore produce fruit that proves your repentance, and don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that God can raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
inupiaq: John-gum uqallautiŋagai iluqaisa, Ilaaguŋitchuŋa. Alla imma iñuk qaiñiaqtuq sapiġñałhaaqtuaq uvamniñ. Nalliummatiŋitchuŋa siŋiiġumiñaġlugik aluġutiŋik. Uvaŋa paptaiġivsi imiġmik, aglaan ilaan iḷiñiaġaa Ilitqusiġiksuaq iḷuvsiññun, aasii piiġḷugu piḷuun.

english: Even now the ax is laid at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
inupiaq: Ilaa arrilisauniaqtuq iñuŋmun ilaaguaqsiruamun palauvaksranik amiġaŋiññiñ. Katitchuugaich palauvaksrat aasii tutquqługich, aglaalli katitchuugaich amiġaiyaġniġich aasii ikipkaqługich. Tainnatun Ilaa qaiyasiruq isivġiġiaġlugich iñupayaurat, annautiyaqtuġlugich nalaunŋaruat aasii suksraunġiġḷugich piḷuktuat igniġmun qamilaitchuamun.

english: So the crowds were asking him, “What then should we do?”
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuanik allaniglu siḷġiqsuutinik, John alġaqsruiŋaruq tusaayugaaġiksuanik iñuŋnun.

english: John answered them, “The person who has two tunics must share with the person who has none, and the person who has food must do likewise.”
inupiaq: Tavra John uqautigiŋagaa naġġuksruqługu atanauraq Herod pisigivlugu tuvaaqasiutimmagu Herodias aniqanmi tuvaaqataa, suli sutigun allatigun iluqaisigun pigiitchuatigun Herod piraŋigun.

english: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
inupiaq: Aasii Herod piŋaruq pigiił̣hamaaqtuamiksuli, John tigutaaqtiłługu.

english: He told them, “Collect no more than you are required to.”
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich paptaiqsauganiŋmata, Jesus-tauq paptaiqsauŋammiuq. Paptaiqsauganikłuni aŋaiyyupkaqtillugu, qiḷak aŋmaŋaruq.

english: Then some soldiers also asked him, “And as for us – what should we do?” He told them, “Take money from no one by violence or by false accusation, and be content with your pay.”
inupiaq: aasii Ilitqusiġiksuaq atqaŋaruq ilaanun timiqaqłuni tiŋmiatun. Aasii nipi tusaġnaŋaruq qiḷaŋmiñ, Ilivich piviuttaġivlutin Iġñiġigikpiñ, iviġaummatigilluataġikpiñ.

english: While the people were filled with anticipation and they all wondered whether perhaps John could be the Christ,
inupiaq: Jesus isagutimmagu savaani iḷisaurriñiq ukiuqtutilaaqaqpalliŋaruq iñuiññaq qulitun. Iñuich isummatigiŋagaat Joseph-mun iġñiġivlugu. Joseph iġñiġigaa Heli-m,

english: John answered them all, “I baptize you with water, but one more powerful than I am is coming – I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
inupiaq: Heli-ḷi iġñiġigaa Matthat-gum, Matthat-li iġñiġigaa Levi-m, Levi-ḷi iġñiġigaa Melchi-m, Melchi-ḷi iġñiġigaa Jannai-m, Jannai-ḷi iġñiġigaa Joseph-gum,

english: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clean out his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his storehouse, but the chaff he will burn up with inextinguishable fire.”
inupiaq: Joseph-li iġñiġigaa Mattathias-gum, Mattathias-li iġñiġigaa Amos-gum, Amos-li iġñiġigaa Nahum-gum, Nahum-li iġñiġigaa Esli-m, Esli-ḷi iġñiġigaa Naggai-m,

english: And in this way, with many other exhortations, John proclaimed good news to the people.
inupiaq: Naggai-ḷi iġñiġigaa Maath-gum, Maath-li iġñiġigaa Mattathias-gum, Mattathias-li iġñiġigaa Semein-gum, Semein-li iġñiġigaa Josech-gum, Josech-li iġñiġigaa Joda-m,

english: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother’s wife, and because of all the evil deeds that he had done,
inupiaq: Joda-li iġñiġigaa Joanan-gum, Joanan-li Rhesa-m, Rhesa-li iġñiġigaa Zerubabbel-gum, Zerubabbel-li iġñiġigaa Shealtiel-gum, Shealtiel-li iġñiġigaa Neri-m,

english: Herod added this to them all: He locked up John in prison.
inupiaq: Neri-ḷi iġñiġigaa Melchi-m, Melchi-ḷi iġñiġigaa Addi-m, Addi-ḷi iġñiġigaa Cosam, Cosam-li iġñiġigaa Elmadam, Elmadam-li iġñiġigaa Er-gum,

english: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also was baptized. And while he was praying, the heavens opened,
inupiaq: Er-li iġñiġigaa Joshua-m, Joshua-li iġñiġigaa Eliezer-m, Eliezer-li iġñiġigaa Jorim, Jorim-li iġñiġigaa Matthat, Matthat-li iġñiġigaa Levi-m,

english: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven, “You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”
inupiaq: Levi-ḷi iġñiġigaa Simeon, Simeon-li iġñiġigaa Judah, Judah-li iġñiġigaa Joseph-gum, Joseph-li iġñiġigaa Jonam, Jonam-li iġñiġigaa Eliakim,

english: So Jesus, when he began his ministry, was about thirty years old. He was the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
inupiaq: Eliakim-li iġñiġigaa Melea-m, Melea-li iġñiġigaa Menna-m, Menna-li iġñiġigaa Mattatha-m, Mattatha-li iġñiġigaa Nathan-gum, Nathan-li iġñiġigaa David-gum,

english: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
inupiaq: David-li iġñiġigaa Jesse-m, Jesse-ḷi iġñiġigaa Obed-gum, Obed-li iġñiġigaa Boaz-gum, Boaz-li iġñiġigaa Shelah-m, Shelah-li iġñiġigaa Nahshon,

english: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
inupiaq: Nahshon-li iġñiġigaa Amminadab-gum, Amminadab-li iġñiġigaa Admin, Admin-li iġñiġigaa Arni-m, Arni-ḷi iġñiġigaa Hezron, Hezron-li iġñiġigaa Perez-gum, Perez-li iġñiġigaa Judah-m,

english: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
inupiaq: Judah-li iġñiġigaa Jacob-gum, Jacob-li iġñiġigaa Isaac-gum, Isaac-li iġñiġigaa Abraham-gum, Abraham-li iġñiġigaa Terah-m, Terah-li iġñiġigaa Nahor-m,

english: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
inupiaq: Nahor-li iġñiġigaa Serug-gum, Serug-li iġñiġigaa Reu-m, Reu-li iġñiġigaa Peleg-um, Peleg-li iġñiġigaa Eber-m, Eber-li iġñiġigaa Shelah-m,

english: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
inupiaq: Shelah-li iġñiġigaa Cainan, Cainan-li iġñiġigaa Arphaxad-gum, Arphaxad-li iġñiġigaa Shem, Shem-li iġñiġigaa Noah-m, Noah-li iġñiġigaa Lamech-gum,

english: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
inupiaq: Lamech-li iġñiġigaa Methuselah-m, Methuselah-li iġñiġigaa Enoch-gum, Enoch-li iġñiġigaa Jared-gum, Jared-li iġñiġigaa Mahalaleel-gum, Mahalaleel-li iġñiġigaa Cainan,

english: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
inupiaq: Cainan-li iġñiġigaa Enos-gum, Enos-li iġñiġigaa Seth-gum, Seth-li iġñiġigaa Adam, Adam-li iġñiġigaa God.

english: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,
the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,
the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
Then Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aŋalałługu Ilitqusiġiksuam, aullaŋaruq kuugmiñ Jordan-miñ aasii Ilitqusiġiksuam aullaqtinŋagaa

english: where for forty days he endured temptations from the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and when they were completed, he was famished.
inupiaq: nunagluktuamun. Tavrani ikł̣igutchaktinniaŋagaa tuunġaum malġukipiani uvluni. Aasii taapkunani uvluni, niġiŋaitchuq sumikunnii. Aasii isukłiñmata, Jesus kaaliŋaruq.

english: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
inupiaq: Tuunġaum uqallautiŋagaa, Iġñiġipiaqpatin God-im, una uyaġak punniġuquuŋ.

english: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man does not live by bread alone.’”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Aglausimaruq Bible-ni, Iñuk iñuuniaŋitchuq niqikun kisiagun, [aglaallu ukpiġilugich uqalupayaaŋi God-im.]

english: Then the devil led him up to a high place and showed him in a flash all the kingdoms of the world.
inupiaq: Tavrasuli tuunġaum mayuutiŋagaa qutchiksuamun iġġimun, aasii satqummiutivlugu iluqaiññik umialgutiŋiñik nunam akkupauraq.

english: And he said to him, “To you I will grant this whole realm – and the glory that goes along with it, for it has been relinquished to me, and I can give it to anyone I wish.
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautivlugu, iliŋnun aitchuutiginiaġiga iluqaan taamna ataniġnaqun kamanautaallu, qanuq aitchuutauŋaruq uvamnun, aasii kimulliqaa pisukkuma aitchuutigiyumiñaġiga.

english: So then, if you will worship me, all this will be yours.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilivich sitquġlutin aŋaiyyuvigigumŋa, iluqaisa aitchuutiginiaġitka tamatkua iliŋnun.

english: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘You are to worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, [Aullaġiñ Satan.] Aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, Aŋaiyyuvigisaġiñ Ataniq God-in, suli kisian savautilugu.

english: Then the devil brought him to Jerusalem, had him stand on the highest point of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
inupiaq: Tavra Tuunġaum aullautiŋagaa Jerusalem-mun, aasii inillakługu nuvuquyuanun aŋaiyyuvikpaum, aasii uqallautivlugu, Iġñiġipiaqpatin God-im, tavraŋŋa nautkiaġiñ,

english: for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you, to protect you,’
inupiaq: qanuq aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, “God-im tiliñiaġai isaġuliŋni munaġitqulutin.”

english: and ‘with their hands they will lift you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
inupiaq: Aasii isaġulgich qaunaginiaġaatin piyaqququŋiḷḷutin.

english: Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uqallautauŋaruq Bible-ni, Uuktuġniaŋitkiñ Ataniq God-in.

english: So when the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until a more opportune time.
inupiaq: Tavra Tuunġaum aġiuganikkamigich iluqaisa ikł̣igutchaktinniutit, ilaa qimautiŋaruq ilaaniñ nalautitchiaġisaqługu uuktuatqigviksrani.

english: Then Jesus, in the power of the Spirit, returned to Galilee, and news about him spread throughout the surrounding countryside.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aŋalałługu Ilitqusiġiksuam Galilee-mun utiŋaruq aasii quliaqtuaġiŋagaat nunaaqqipayaanun sumulliqaa.

english: He began to teach in their synagogues and was praised by all.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa iḷisaurriŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋiññi, aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñuich nanġaŋagaat.

english: Now Jesus came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
inupiaq: Tavra Nazareth-muŋaruq iñuguġviŋmiñun, aasii aŋaiyyuviŋmuŋaruq piḷġusikaamisun Jew-guruat savairvianni. Tavra makinŋaruq taiguaġniaqłuni.

english: and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written,
inupiaq: Aasii qaiñŋagaich makpiġaaŋi Isaiah-m uqaqtaata God-im. Ilaan isivinŋagai makpiġaat aasii paqiłługu aglausimaruaq inna,

english: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus imuŋagai makpiġaat, aasii utiqtiłługich kivgamun tutququvlugich, aasii aquviłłuni. Tavrani iluqaġmiŋ iñuich aŋaiyyuviŋmiittuat takunnaakkiutiŋagaat.

english: because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor.
inupiaq: Tavra uqautirraqsiŋagai, Uvlupak taamna tusaakkaqsi Bible-niñ taŋŋiqsauganiktuq.

english: He has sent me to proclaim release to the captives
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ uqautigilluataŋagaat, suli kamasuutigiŋagaich uqalulluatat uqautigiraŋi. Uqallaŋammiut, Uvvauna Joseph-gum iġñiġigaa.

english: and the regaining of sight to the blind,
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautiŋagai, Nalupqinaitchuamik uqallagviginiaġivsiŋa uumiŋa uqalugaamik. Taaktii, iliŋnik iłuaqsiiñ. Tusaaŋaravut kamanaqtuat savaatin Capernaum-mi maaniḷu savaaġikkich ilivich nunaŋni.

english: to set free those who are oppressed,
inupiaq: Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, uqaqtaa God-im akuqtuqtaulaitchuq nanmiñiq iñuŋmiñi.

english: to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷumun uqallautigivsi, iñugiaktuat uiḷgaŋaruat iñuuŋarut Israel-mi Elijah iñuumman. Sialulaiñŋaruq ukiuni piŋasuni itchaksraniḷu tatqiñi, kaaksiuqpaŋmata iñuich iluqaani nunaŋanni.

english: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him.
inupiaq: Tavra Elijah tilirauŋaitchuq nalliannun unnii taapkua iñuich, aglaan uiḷgaŋaruamun Jew-guŋitchuamun, iñuuruamun Zarepheth-mi nunaaqqimi Sidon-miittuami.

english: Then he began to tell them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled even as you heard it being read.”
inupiaq: Suli God-im uqaqtaa Elisha iñuumman iñugiaŋarut kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuat Israel-mi, aasii nalliŋich unnii iłuaqsirauŋaitchut. Aglaan Naaman, Syria-ġmiu kisimi iłuaqsirauŋaruq.

english: All were speaking well of him, and were amazed at the gracious words coming out of his mouth. They said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamirruŋ taamna, iluqaġmiŋ aŋaiyyuviŋmiittuat qinnapiaġataŋarut.

english: Jesus said to them, “No doubt you will quote to me the proverb, ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ and say, ‘What we have heard that you did in Capernaum, do here in your hometown too.’”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich maksriŋarut aasii tiguniqłakługu annisiŋagaat Jesus iniqpaŋmiñ, saqigrugivlugu siñaanun qimiqqam siŋitchukługu. Iniqpaŋat ittuaq qimiqqam qaaŋani.

english: And he added, “I tell you the truth, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
inupiaq: Tavra akunniraqługich iñusalaich, Jesus aullaŋaruq.

english: But in truth I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s days, when the sky was shut up three and a half years, and there was a great famine over all the land.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus Capernaum-muŋaruq iniqpaŋmun Galilee-mi. Tavraasii ilaan iḷisautiŋagai Jew-guruat savairvianni.

english: Yet Elijah was sent to none of them, but only to a woman who was a widow at Zarephath in Sidon.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich kamasuutiqaŋarut iḷisaurriñiŋanik, qanuq ilaan uqaluŋi kamanaŋarut.

english: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, yet none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuviŋmi inŋaruq iñuk ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuaq, aasii nipatutilaamisun nivliŋaruq,

english: When they heard this, all the people in the synagogue were filled with rage.
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, Jesus Nazareth-miu, summan iḷaksiavisigut? Uvaniitpich suksraunġiġuqłuta? Iḷisimagiga kiutilaan. Ilaa Piḷuutaitchuaq God-im pia.

english: They got up, forced him out of the town, and brought him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could throw him down the cliff.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus suaŋagaa uqallautivlugu, Nipaisaaġiñ. Anniiñ ilaaniñ. Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uum ulġutqaaqługu sivuġaanun Jesus, aniŋaruq ilaaniñ anniġaluaġnagu.

english: But he passed through the crowd and went on his way.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ aliuŋarut aasii avanmun uqaagaqsivḷutiŋ, Sunauna uqallaun? Qanuq sumiñ ataniġnaqutiqaqłuni suaŋŋatiqaqłuniḷu piraksriḷḷagai ilitqusiqł̣uich, aasii ilaisa kamagillavlugu.

english: So he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he began to teach the people.
inupiaq: Tavra uqaluk ilaagun siaminŋaruq inipayaanun tamatkunani nunani.

english: They were amazed at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus anivḷuni aŋaiyyuviŋmiñ Simon aimaaġvianuŋaruq. Tavra Simon aakaruaŋa naŋinŋaruq uunnautiqpaqaqłuni, aasii ilaisa ikayuqtaiḷiqutiŋagaat ilaanun.

english: Now in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus makitchaqtuŋaruq siñigviŋisa saniġaannun, aasii suakługu uunnautaa, aasii uunnautaiŋaruq. Tavrauvvaa makiłłuni niqłiuġutirraqsiŋagai.

english: “Ha! Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are – the Holy One of God.”
inupiaq: Tavra siqiñiq nipisaġataaqsimman, iluqaġmiŋ tamatkua naŋittuaqaqtuat qanusiḷimaanik naŋirrutinik qaġġisiŋagaich Jesus-mun. Tavra ilaan aksiuŋagai iluqaisa aasii iłuaqsivḷugich.

english: But Jesus rebuked him: “Silence! Come out of him!” Then, after the demon threw the man down in their midst, he came out of him without hurting him.
inupiaq: Suli ilitqusiqł̣uich unnii animmiraqtut iñugiaktuaniñ iñuŋniñ nipaalavlutiŋ, Ilivich Iġñiġigaatin God-im. Tavra Jesus suagaġigai, suli uqaqtitchaiḷivḷugich, qanuq iḷisimagaat Christ-gutilaaŋanik, Iġñiŋa God-im.

english: They were all amazed and began to say to one another, “What’s happening here? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaaġmagu Jesus aullaŋaruq aasii iñuił̣aamukłuni. Tavra iñuich ivaŋagaat. Aasii paqinnamirruŋ, qimaktaiḷiŋarut ilaanun.

english: So the news about him spread into all areas of the region.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Alġaqsruiruksrauruŋa tusaayugaaġiksuanik atanniqsimmataata God-im, allanullu iniqpaŋnun, qanuq God-im tiliŋagaaŋa taamna savaaġitquvlugu.

english: After Jesus left the synagogue, he entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa alġaqsruiŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋiññi Judea-m.

english: So he stood over her, commanded the fever, and it left her. Immediately she got up and began to serve them.
As the sun was setting, all those who had any relatives sick with various diseases brought them to Jesus. He placed his hands on every one of them and healed them.
Demons also came out of many, crying out, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them, and would not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
The next morning Jesus departed and went to a deserted place. Yet the crowds were seeking him, and they came to him and tried to keep him from leaving them.
But Jesus said to them, “I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns too, for that is what I was sent to do.”
So he continued to preach in the synagogues of Judea.
Now Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, and the crowd was pressing around him to hear the word of God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus makitaŋaruq siñaani tasiata Gennesaret. Tavrani iñuich katilġataviŋarut naalagumavlutiŋ uqaluanik God-im.

english: He saw two boats by the lake, but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautuŋagik malġuk umiaqpaurak amummiruak. Iqaluŋniaqtit qimakkaŋich salummaivḷutiŋ kuvranik.

english: He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little way from the shore. Then Jesus sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.
inupiaq: Ikivluni igḷuanun umiaqpauram Simon pigikkaŋanun, Jesus apiġiŋagaa kaimitaallaquvlugu nunamiñ. Aasii ilaa aquptaaqłuni iḷisautirraqsiŋagai iñuich umiaqpauramiñ.

english: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and lower your nets for a catch.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaŋaiqami, uqallautiŋagaa Simon, Saavittitchi itiruamun aasii niŋillugich kuvraŋi qaaksaġlusi.

english: Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing! But at your word I will lower the nets.”
inupiaq: Tavra Simon-gum kiuŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii iqaluŋniallakkaluaqtugut tavra unnuaqtutilaaŋatun aŋiiññallaktugut. Aglaan uqallautin pisigilugu kuvriġñiaqtuŋa.

english: When they had done this, they caught so many fish that their nets started to tear.
inupiaq: Tavra kuvrianikamiŋ, qaaŋagaich iqalusalaich, aasii kuvraŋich aligaġnialaŋarut.

english: So they motioned to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they were about to sink.
inupiaq: Nuluġaŋagaich alġaisiŋ igḷuani umiaqpauramiittuat qaiḷugich ikayuġiaquvlutiŋ. Aasii qaivḷutiŋ usiḷḷiŋagaik iluqaaktun umiaqpaurak, pukłipiaġataqługik.

english: But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Go away from me, Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
inupiaq: Tavra Simon Peter-m iḷitchuġikamiuŋ taamna, sitquŋaruq sivuġaanun Jesus aasii uqallakłuni, Aullaġiñ uvamniñ Ataniiq, qanuq uvaŋa piḷuktuaguruŋa iñuk.

english: For Peter and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish that they had taken,
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaalu taapkualu piqatini niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut taapkunuuna iqaluktamikkun.

english: and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons, who were Simon’s business partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching people.”
inupiaq: Taapkuagluami James-lu John-lu iġñiŋik Zebedee-m alġaiguruak Simon-mun. Tavra Jesus uqallautigaa Simon, Iqsiñak. Iqalugniaġusiqsun, tavraŋŋaaglaan iñunnagniaġniaqtutin.

english: So when they had brought their boats to shore, they left everything and followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra amuanikamisigik umiaqpauratik, qimaŋagaat sunapayaaq aasii malikługu Jesus.

english: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came to him who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he bowed down with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus itillugu iniqpaich iḷaŋanni, iñuk qaiŋaruq kiḷḷiġruaqtuqpaktuaq. Tautukamiuŋ Jesus sitquŋaruq sivuġaanun aasii apiġivlugu, Ataniiq, pisukkuvich mamititchumiñaġiŋma.

english: So he stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean!” And immediately the leprosy left him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isaaqłuni aksiuŋagaa uqallakłuni, Piyummatiqaqtuŋa. Mamittin. Tavraŋŋatchiaq kiḷḷiġruaŋi maminŋarut.

english: Then he ordered the man to tell no one, but commanded him, “Go and show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaullaapiaŋagaa quliaqtuaquŋił̣ł̣ugu kimulliqaa, aglaan uqallautivlugu, Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋmugiñ qanuqitilaaġiaġlutin, aasii aitchuiḷutin ikipkautinik Moses piraksriutiŋiñik, ukpiġnaqsisaaġlugu paŋmapak salumasisilaan.

english: But the news about him spread even more, and large crowds were gathering together to hear him and to be healed of their illnesses.
inupiaq: Tavra siamiłhaaqsiññaŋaruq uqaluk ilaagun, aasii iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich katinŋarut naalagiaqłutiŋ suli iłuaqsipkaġiaqłutiŋ naŋirrutimiŋniñ.

english: Yet Jesus himself frequently withdrew to the wilderness and prayed.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaġuuruq iñuił̣aamun aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłuni.

english: Now on one of those days, while he was teaching, there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting nearby (who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem), and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua uvlut iḷaŋanni, Jesus iḷisaurripkaqtillugu, iḷaŋich Pharisees-lu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik aquppiŋarut saniġaani, qaiŋaruat nunaaqqipayaaŋiñiñ Galilee-m Judea-vlu, Jerusalem-miḷḷu, tavra Atanġum God-im suaŋŋasiŋagaa Jesus iłuaqsiyumiñaqsivḷugich naŋittuat.

english: Just then some men showed up, carrying a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They were trying to bring him in and place him before Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq iñuich iḷaŋich qaġġirriŋarut aulalaitchuamik nalaruamik ikuvġamiñi, aasii itqutisaġaluaŋagaat iglumun iḷisukługu sivuġaanun Jesus.

english: But since they found no way to carry him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down on the stretcher through the roof tiles right in front of Jesus.
inupiaq: Aasii itqutiyumiñaiññamirruŋ, iñuich tativlutiŋ, mayuŋarut iglum qaaŋanun, qiḷaŋa aasii aŋmaqqaaqługu niŋiłługu ikuvġaqtuummaan qitqannun iñuich sivuġaanun Jesus.

english: When Jesus saw their faith he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsrikamiuŋ ukpiġutaat taapkua iñuich, ilaa uqallaŋaruq aulalaitchuamun, Iñuuk, piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich.

english: Then the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to think to themselves, “Who is this man who is uttering blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik Pharisees-lu apiqsruqtuutirraqsiŋarut avanmun, Kiñauna iñuk uqaqpa tainna God-itun? Kiñaliqaa suliqutigiŋaiqsiyumiñaitchuq itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutinik aglaan God kisimi.

english: When Jesus perceived their hostile thoughts, he said to them, “Why are you raising objections within yourselves?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsrikami tainna isumaniġmata, uqallautiŋagai, Summan isumavisi tamatkuniŋa?

english: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
inupiaq: Nalliak siġḷiġnaił̣haaqpa uqallaktuni, Piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut iliŋnun, naagga uqallaktuni, Makillutin pisuaġiñ?

english: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” – he said to the paralyzed man – “I tell you, stand up, take your stretcher and go home.”
inupiaq: Ukpiġnaqsiḷiġniaġiga ilivsiññun Iġñiŋa iñuum ataniġnaqutiqaqtilaaŋanik nunami suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaqługich piḷuutit. Tavrani uqallautiŋagaa iñuk aulalaitchuaq, uqallautigikpiñ, makittin. Tigulugich ikuvġatin, aggiiñ.

english: Immediately he stood up before them, picked up the stretcher he had been lying on, and went home, glorifying God.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaa makinŋaruq sivuġaanni, aasii tiguvlugich ikuvġani aiŋaruq nanġaqługu God.

english: Then astonishment seized them all, and they glorified God. They were filled with awe, saying, “We have seen incredible things today.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich aliuġutchapiaŋarut kamatchakłutiŋ, nanġaŋagaat God uqaqłutiŋ, Qiñiŋarugut aliuġnaqtuanik sunik uvlupak.

english: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Jesus aniŋaruq, aasii tautuŋagaa tax-iñik katitchiri atiqaqtuaq Levi-mik, aquppiñiqsuaq tax-iḷiqiviŋmi. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Maliŋŋa.

english: And he got up and followed him, leaving everything behind.
inupiaq: Tavra Levi-m makiłłuni qimaŋagai supayaat, aasii malikługu Jesus.

english: Then Levi gave a great banquet in his house for Jesus, and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others sitting at the table with them.
inupiaq: Tavra Levi-m niqinaqusiuġutiqpaŋagaa Jesus iglumiñi. Aasii tavrani iñusalaich inŋarut tax-iñik katitchirit iḷaqaqłutiŋ allaniglu aquppiqatauruanik niġġiviŋñi piqatigivlugich.

english: But the Pharisees and their experts in the law complained to his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees iḷisaurriŋiḷḷu pitquranik uqamayuutiŋagaich Jesus iḷitchitquraŋi, Summan niġiqatiqaġuuvisi imiqatiqaqłusiḷu tax-iñik katitchirinik piḷuusiqiriniglu?

english: Jesus answered them, “Those who are well don’t need a physician, but those who are sick do.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Surruitchuat taaktituaksraitchut, aglaan naŋittuat.

english: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
inupiaq: Qaiŋaitchuŋa ququaġiaġlugich nalaunŋaruat iñuich, aglaan piḷuusiqirit isumalitqiquvlugich.

english: Then they said to him, “John’s disciples frequently fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours continue to eat and drink.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋisa uqallautiŋagaat Jesus, John-gum iḷitchitquraŋi akulaitchuami niġiḷaitchuurut aŋaiyyuuqłutiŋ, tamatkualu iḷitchitquraŋich Pharisees, aasiiḷi ilivich iḷitchitquratin niġiugaqtut imiqłutiglu.

english: So Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus kiuŋagai, Isummatigivisigik tuyuġmiat katirrusiqiruani niġiḷaitquvlugich sivisutilaaŋatun uiksrautim nayuutiniŋata iliŋiññun? Tainna piñiaŋitchut.

english: But those days are coming, and when the bridegroom is taken from them, at that time they will fast.”
inupiaq: Aglaan uiksrautim aullaurrauviksraŋa tikitchumaaqtuq, aasii taimanigu niġiḷaitpaallugniaqtut.

english: He also told them a parable: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old garment. If he does, he will have torn the new, and the piece from the new will not match the old.
inupiaq: Jesus uqautivsaaŋammigai uuktuunmik. Kiñaliqaa aliksiḷaitchuq iḷaviñiŋanik nutauruam annuġaam aasii iḷaaġutivlugu annuġaaluŋmun. Tainna pigumi, aligniaġaa nutauruaq annuġaaq, suli iḷaaksraqtaaguruaq nutauruamiñ annuġaamiñ allakaagusugniaġmiuqsuli utuqqauruamiñ.

english: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins and will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
inupiaq: Iñuum suli immiutilaitkaa nutauruaq wine puuġruanun, qanuq nutauruam wine-gum puvlagluni qaaġniaġaa puuġruaq, aasii wine maqiluni asiñun, aasiiḷi puut maqulutiŋ.

english: Instead new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
inupiaq: Aglaan nutauruaq wine puugaksraupiaqtuq nutauruanik puunik.

english: No one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, ‘The old is good enough.’”
inupiaq: Suli iñuktun kipiġniuŋitchuatun imiġugluni nutauruamik wine-mik imianiŋavluni utuqqauruamik wine-mik, tainnatun iñuich uqaġuurut utuqqauruat piḷġutchich nakuułhaaġnivḷugich nutauruaniñ piḷġutchiñiñ.

english: Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples picked some heads of wheat, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat savairvianni, Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu pisuallaġmiŋ palauvaksrat nautchiaqaġviatigun, ilaan iḷitchitquraŋisa nutchugaŋagaich nauganiktuat palauvaksrat, amiġaiyaqługich argaŋmiŋnik, aasii niġivḷugich.

english: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is against the law on the Sabbath?”
inupiaq: Tavrali iḷaŋich Pharisees uqallaŋarut, Summan uvva inna pivisi? Qanuq pitquŋisauruq taamna pitquraptiŋni savaiññiptigun.

english: Jesus answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry –
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Nalupqinaitchuamik taiguaŋarusi qanuq David piŋatilaaŋanik kaaksiuliqamiŋ piqatiniḷu.

english: how he entered the house of God, took and ate the sacred bread, which is not lawful for any to eat but the priests alone, and gave it to his companions?”
inupiaq: Ilaa isiŋaruq God-im igluanun aasii punniksraqłuni ilaaguaqtauŋaruanik God-mun, niġitquŋisauruanik iñuŋnun aglaan aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun kisian. David niġiŋaruq suli aitchuqługich piqatini.

english: Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iġñiŋa iñuum ataniġnaqutiqałhaaqtuq pitquraniñ aŋalatchiruaniñ iñuŋnik savaiññiġmi.

english: On another Sabbath, Jesus entered the synagogue and was teaching. Now a man was there whose right hand was withered.
inupiaq: Allamisuli Jew-guruat savairvianni, Jesus isiġman aŋaiyyuviŋmun suli iḷisaurrivḷuni, iñuk tavraniinŋammiñiqsuq taliqpia argakisuuraq.

english: The experts in the law and the Pharisees watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so that they could find a reason to accuse him.
inupiaq: Tavra pitquranik iḷisaurriḷḷu Pharisees-lu naipiqtuŋagaat, iłuaqsiriñiaqtilaaŋanik savaitchuani, pasisukkaluaqługu.

english: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Get up and stand here.” So he rose and stood there.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisimaŋagai ilaisa isumaŋich, aasii uqallautiŋagaa iñuk argakisuurauniqsuaq, Qaiñ. Makittin uvuŋa. Tavra tavruŋa makinŋaruq.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai. Apiġigivsi uumiŋa, pitquratiguaŋava Savaiññiġmi nakuurualiqiruni naagga pigiitchualiqiruni? Ikayugaksraġivisigik iñuich naagga iḷatchiġḷugich Savaiññiġmi?

english: After looking around at them all, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand was restored.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan qiñiġaallakkaluaqamigich iluqaisa kiutchiaġivluni, uqallautiŋagaa, Isaakkich argaktin. Tavra isaaŋaruq, aasii argaŋi iłuaqsirauŋarut.

english: But they were filled with mindless rage and began debating with one another what they would do to Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurriḷḷu Pharisees-lu piavsapiaġataŋarut, aasii uqaagaqsivḷutiŋ avanmun qanuġukkaluaqługu Jesus.

english: Now it was during this time that Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and he spent all night in prayer to God.
inupiaq: Taipkunani uvluni Jesus aullaŋaruq qimialuŋnun aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłuni, aasii unnuaqtutilaaŋatun ilaa aŋaiyyuuŋaruq God-mun.

english: When morning came, he called his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also named apostles:
inupiaq: Tavraasii uvluġman, ilaan qaitquŋagai iḷitchitqurani, aasii piksraġvigivlugich qulit malġugnik, tairauruanik ilaan tiliraŋiñik.

english: Simon (whom he named Peter), and his brother Andrew; and James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
inupiaq: Ilaan piksraqtaaġiŋagai ukua, Simon ilaan taiguusiŋagaa Peter-mik, Andrew-lu aniqataa, suli James-lu John-lu Philip-lu Bartholomew-lu,

english: Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,
inupiaq: Matthew-lu Thomas-lu James-lu iġñiŋa Alphaeus, Simon-lu tairauruaq Zealot-mik,

english: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
inupiaq: Judas-lu iġñiŋa James, suli Judas Iscariot aitchuutiginniktuaq ilaanik.

english: Then he came down with them and stood on a level place. And a large number of his disciples had gathered along with a vast multitude from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus atqaqatigiŋagai iḷitchitqurani qimialuŋmiñ, aasii makiłłuni qaiqsuami nunami piqatigivlugich iñusalaich iḷitchitquraliutiruat inmiñun. Allallu iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich qairuat iluqaaniñ Judea-miñ Jerusalem-miḷḷu taġium siñaaġmiullu Tyre-miñ Sidon-miḷḷu.

english: and those who suffered from unclean spirits were cured.
inupiaq: Tamatkua iñuich qaiŋarut naalagiaqłutiŋ Jesus-mik, suli iłuaqsipkaġiaqtuallu naŋirrunmiŋniñ. Tamatkualu ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuat iłuaqsirauŋarut.

english: The whole crowd was trying to touch him, because power was coming out from him and healing them all.
inupiaq: Suli iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich aksiugniataŋagaat, qanuq ilaa suaŋŋatiqaŋaruq inmiñi iłuaqsiḷḷavlugich, aasii iluqaġmiŋ qairuat ilaanun iłuaqsirauŋarut.

english: Then he looked up at his disciples and said:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaŋagai iḷitchitqurani, aasii uqallakłuni, Quviasugitchi ilivsi iḷiappauruasii, qanuq pigigisi God-im umialgutiŋi.

english: “Blessed are you who are poor, for the kingdom of God belongs to you.
inupiaq: Quviasugitchi ilivsi kipiġniuġutiqałhaaqtuat pisukługich God-im pitqutiŋi iñuktun kaaktuatun paŋmapak, qanuq pisuġuiqsitauniaqtusi. Quviasugitchi ilivsi isumaaqtuasii pisigivlugu piḷuun, qanuq taimanigu isumaaŋaiġñiaqtusi.

english: “Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied.
inupiaq: Quviasugitchi iñuich uumikkiutikpasi, pisuŋitpasiḷu uqamaqłuutilusiḷu, suli uqaġlutiŋ pigiiññiḷusi pisigilugu uvamnik maliġuaġniqsi Iġñiŋanik Iñuum.

english: “Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
inupiaq: Quviasukpagitchi taavrumani uvlumi, minŋiqtaġitchiunnii quviasuglusi, qanuq akiḷiusiaksraqsi kamanaqtuq qiḷaŋmi. Itqaumasigik tainnatuttauq maŋŋuuŋisa piyuaŋagaich uqaqtiŋi God-im.

english: “Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and insult you and reject you as evil on account of the Son of Man!
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtusiuvva ilivsi suġalliruasii paŋmapak, qanuq quviasaaġusiaqaaniktusi suġalivsiññiñ.

english: Rejoice in that day, and jump for joy, because your reward is great in heaven. For their ancestors did the same things to the prophets.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi pisuksiuŋitchuasii sumik nakuuruamik paŋmapak, iñuktun niqinŋuruatun, qanuq pisuksiuliġñiaqtusi. Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi aliasuŋisaaqsiññaqtuasii paŋmapak, qanuq ipiqtutchagniaqtusi, qialusiḷu.

english: “But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your comfort already.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi iñupayaat uqausiġilluataqpasi. Tainnaptauq maŋŋuuŋisa uqautigilluataŋammigaich uqaqtauŋŋuaqtuat God-mun.

english: “Woe to you who are well satisfied with food now, for you will be hungry.
inupiaq: Aglaalli naalaġniruasii uqallautigivsi ukuniŋa. Piviuttaġisigik akiḷḷiḷiqsuqtisi. Nakuuruamik pisigik tamatkua uumikłiqsuat ilivsiññik.

english: “Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
inupiaq: Apiġisiuŋ God nagligitqulugich tamatkua uqamaqłuurriruat ilivsiññik. Aŋaiyyutilugich pimaqłuktairuat ilivsiññik.

english: “Woe to you when all people speak well of you, for their ancestors did the same things to the false prophets.
inupiaq: Iñuum qakiqpasi iqsravsigun, akisaġaluaġnasi mannisiuŋ igḷuanik. Iñuum suli quppiġaagiqpasi, qaliġuuraqsiḷu piḷiuŋ.

english: “But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
inupiaq: Aitchuisitchi iñupayaanun piatchiaqtuanun ilivsiññiñ. Suli iñuk aannikpan suġauttaġnik, katchuŋairrutiginagich tasuġuglugich.

english: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.
inupiaq: Tavra qanuq pitquyumaguvsi iñuŋnun, tainnatulli pisigik.

english: To the person who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other as well, and from the person who takes away your coat, do not withhold your tunic either.
inupiaq: Piviuttaġiguvsigik kisiisa piviuttaġirisi, kamanałhaaqtuamik piŋitchusi piḷuusiqiriniñ, qanuq piḷuusiqirit unnii piviuttaġimmigaich piviuttaġiritiŋ.

english: Give to everyone who asks you, and do not ask for your possessions back from the person who takes them away.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli anniqsuisuuguvsi tamatkunuŋa kisiiññun anniqsuqtikaavsiññun, kamanałhaaqtuamik piŋitchusi piḷuusiqiriniñ, qanuq piḷuusiqirit unnii tainna pisuummiut.

english: Treat others in the same way that you would want them to treat you.
inupiaq: Suli atukkiññikkuvsi tamatkunuŋa kisiiññun niġiugvigikkavsiññun paaqłiusiaksramik, kamanałhaaqtuamik piŋitchusi piḷuusiqiriniñ, qanuq piḷuusiqirit unnii atukkiññiguummiut piḷuusiqirinun, atukkirrutimiktun aktigiruamik utiqtitchivigitquvlutiŋ.

english: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi piḷḷuatałhaaqtuksraurusi tamatkunaŋŋa piḷuusiqiriniñ. Tavra piviuttaġisigik uumigirisi, anniqsuġlugiḷḷu. Atukkiññigitchi paaqłiusiaksramik niġiuŋaiġḷusi, aasii akiḷiusiaqsi kamanaġniaqtuq, suli miqłiqtuġiniaġaasi sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im, qanuq ilaa piaqłuktaŋitchuq quyyataitchuanun unnii anniqsrauruanullu.

english: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do the same.
inupiaq: Nagliktausitchi Aapavsisuttauq nagliksrauruatun.

english: And if you lend to those from whom you hope to be repaid, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, so that they may be repaid in full.
inupiaq: Qanuqinniġaqłiġñasi allanik, God-ivli qanuqinniġaġniaŋiñmigaasi. Uqallausiġinagich iñuich anniqsuutauŋiññiḷugich, God-ivli uqallausiġiniaŋiñmigaasi anniqsuutauŋiññiḷusi. Suliqutigiŋaiqsigik itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich iñuich piḷuutiŋich, God-ivli suliqutigiŋaiġñiaġmigai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutisi.

english: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to ungrateful and evil people.
inupiaq: Aitchuisitchi iñuŋnun sigñataiḷḷusi aasiiḷi God-im aitchuġniaġmigaasi inuaŋaiġḷugu. Aitchuusiaqaġniaqtusi imaqtutilaaġutiqaqtuamik naqittaqługu, tunniġiksaqługulu ukpitaalallasiḷaallaan. Qanuq imaqtutilaaġutitun atukkavsisun aitchuikavsi iñuŋnun, God-iptauq atuġniaġmigaa uuktuutigikkaqsi ilivsiññi.

english: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
inupiaq: Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋammigai uuktuunmik. Ayauŋaruam iñuum aullatiyumiñaitkaa ayauŋaruaq iñuk. Iluqatik qargisaġniaqtuk iḷuqsramun.

english: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged; do not condemn, and you will not be condemned; forgive, and you will be forgiven.
inupiaq: Iḷisaqtuaguruaq iḷisimałhaaŋitchuq iḷisaurrimiñiñ, aglaan iḷisaqtuaguruaq naatchigumi iḷisaamiñik, iḷisimatigiliġñiaqtuq iḷisaurrimisun.

english: Give, and it will be given to you: A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be poured into your lap. For the measure you use will be the measure you receive.”
inupiaq: Summan pasiviuŋ aniqatin killuliqirualivḷugu ilivich pigiił̣haaġaluaŋŋaqpich?

english: He also told them a parable: “Someone who is blind cannot lead another who is blind, can he? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
inupiaq: Tainna pikavich, iñuktun ittutin qirugruaġmik irimiutaqallaġmi irriugauramik piiqsiñiataktuatun aniqanmi iraaniñ. Ukpiŋŋuaqtuatiin, iłuaqsruqqaaġiñ iliŋnun, aasii ikayuġumiñaqsivaalluglugu aniqatin killukuaġutiŋiñik.

english: A disciple is not greater than his teacher, but everyone when fully trained will be like his teacher.
inupiaq: Napaaqtuġiksuapayaaq siiġñiḷaitchuq piḷuktuanik, naaggaunnii napaaqtuġiitchuaq siiġñiḷaiñmiuq siiġñaġiksuanik.

english: Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye, but fail to see the beam of wood in your own?
inupiaq: Qanuq napaaqtullaat iḷisimanaqtut siiġñiaŋisigun. Fig-gich pukulaitkisi kakiḷḷaġnaniñ napaaqtuniñ, naaggaunnii grapes-nik pukulaiñmiusi uqpiłhuniñ.

english: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while you yourself don’t see the beam in your own? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
inupiaq: Iñulluataq nakuurualiqiruq qanuq nakuuvluni isumaqaġviŋmiñi. Aasiisuli pigiitchuaq iñuk pigiitchualiqivluni, pigiitchuamik isumaqaqłuni. Tavra iñuk uqaqami uqaluŋmigun salapqiagaa irrusipiani.

english: “For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,
inupiaq: Tuqłuġagaksraġiŋitkivsiŋa Atanivsiññik kamagiyumaŋitkuvsigik iḷisaurrutitka ilivsiññun.

english: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes picked from brambles.
inupiaq: Iñupayaaq qairuaq uvamnun aasii tusaavlugich uqalutka kamagivlugiḷḷu, iḷisautiniaġivsi sumik arriqaqtilaaŋanik.

english: The good person out of the good treasury of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasury produces evil, for his mouth speaks from what fills his heart.
inupiaq: Arriqaqtuq iñuŋmik igluqpiruamik nivakłuni itisivḷugu, maŋŋuliivḷuniasii uyaġaum qaaŋanun. Tavraasii uliqpaŋman, kuugaluich ulutimmarruŋ taamna igluqpak, aulayyaŋaitchuq, qanuq maŋŋuliġḷuataŋaruq.

english: “Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do what I tell you?
inupiaq: Aglaalli iñuktauq tusaagaluaqłuni kamaksriŋiññami uqaluŋnik, arriqaqtuq igluqpiruamik nunam qaaŋanun maŋŋuił̣aaqługu. Tavraasii kuugaluich ulutimmarruŋ, tavraŋŋatchiaq ulġuvluni suksraunġipaluŋaruq.

english: “Everyone who comes to me and listens to my words and puts them into practice – I will show you what he is like:
He is like a man building a house, who dug down deep, and laid the foundation on bedrock. When a flood came, the river burst against that house but could not shake it, because it had been well built.

But the person who hears and does not put my words into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river burst against that house, it collapsed immediately, and was utterly destroyed!”
After Jesus had finished teaching all this to the people, he entered Capernaum.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaŋaiqami iluqaiññik uqalugiramiñik iñuŋnun, ilaa Capernaum-muŋaruk.

english: A centurion there had a slave who was highly regarded, but who was sick and at the point of death.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata kivgaŋa piqpagikkaŋa naŋinŋaruq tuquyasivḷuni.

english: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, asking him to come and heal his slave.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata tusaakamiuŋ Jesus qaisilaaŋanik, tilisiŋaruq ilaanun umialiŋnaŋiñik Jew-guruat apiġitquvlugu qaiḷuni iłuaqsiyaqtuaquvlugu kivgani.

english: When they came to Jesus, they urged him earnestly, “He is worthy to have you do this for him,
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññamirruŋ Jesus, apiġiŋagaat kipiġnaqsivḷugu, uqaqłutiŋ, Ilaa nalliummatiruq ilivich ikayuġupku taavrumiŋa,

english: because he loves our nation, and even built our synagogue.”
inupiaq: qanuq ilaan nakuaġipiallakkai iñuvut, suli aŋaiyyuviḷiŋagaatigut.

english: So Jesus went with them. When he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to say to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to have you come under my roof.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aullaqatigiŋagai. Tavra qallimman iglumun, aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata tiliŋagai avilaitqatit ilaanun, uqallautitquvlugu, Ataniiq, isumaalluksaaġnak iliŋnik, qanuq uvaŋa nalliummatiŋitchuŋa qaiguvich isiġlutin iglumnun.

english: That is why I did not presume to come to you. Instead, say the word, and my servant must be healed.
inupiaq: Uvva isummatigiŋił̣ł̣uŋa nalliummatiluŋa ullakkumiñaġlutin uqallaksiññaġiñ uqaluŋmik, aasii kivgaġa iłuaqsirauniaqtuq.

english: For I too am a man set under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
inupiaq: Uvvaliuvaŋa ataniqaġmiuŋa atanauranik, aasii aŋuyaktiqaġmiuŋa aŋalatamnik. Uqallakama iḷaŋannun, Aullaġiñ, tavra aullaqtuq, suli allamun, Qaġġiiñ, qaimmiraqtuq, suli kivgamnun uqallakama, Una piuŋ, ilaan pisuummigaa.

english: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him. He turned and said to the crowd that followed him, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaakamiuŋ taamna, ilaan aliuġusuutigiŋagaa, aasii kiŋiaqłuni uqallautiŋagai iñusalaich maliktuat, Uqallautigivsi, Israel-guruaniunnii kasuiŋaitchuŋa iñuŋmik tainnatun ukpiġutiqaqtuamik.

english: So when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the slave well.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua tilirauŋaruat utiqamiŋ iglumun, tautuŋagaat kivgaq iłuaqsiŋavlugu.

english: Soon afterward Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went with him.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman Jesus aullaŋaruq iniqpaŋmun atiqaqtuamun Nain-mik, aasii iḷitchitquraisa iñusalaiḷḷu maliŋagaat.

english: As he approached the town gate, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother (who was a widow), and a large crowd from the town was with her.
inupiaq: Tavra qallimmiuġlu paaqpaŋanun iniqpaum, aatchiŋarut iñuich tuquruamik akigaqługu, iġñitualuaptauq aġnam uiḷgaŋaruam, aasii iñusalaich iniqpaŋmiñ piqasiġñikkaŋat.

english: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion for her and said to her, “Do not weep.”
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum tautukkamiuŋ uiḷgaŋaruaq, nagliksratchaŋaruq ilaanik aasii uqallautiŋagaa, Qianak.

english: Then he came up and touched the bier, and those who carried it stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
inupiaq: Tavra ullakługu aksiuŋagaa akigautaat, aasii akigaqtiŋi nutqaŋarut. Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Nukatpiaq, uqallautigikpiñ, makittin.

english: So the dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.
inupiaq: Tavra tuquŋaruaq iñuk aquvinŋaruq, aasii uqarraqsivḷuni. Tavra Jesus qaiñŋagaa aakaŋanun.

english: Fear seized them all, and they began to glorify God, saying, “A great prophet has appeared among us!” and “God has come to help his people!”
inupiaq: Kamatchapiaġataŋarut iluqaġmiŋ iñuich, aasii ilaisa nanġaŋagaat God uqaqłutiŋ, Kamanaqtuaq uqaqtaa God-im iñukpalliŋaruq akunnaptiŋni, uqaqłutiglu God-im annautiyaqtuġai iñuŋni.

english: This report about Jesus circulated throughout Judea and all the surrounding country.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna Jesus piraŋa tusaaŋagaat iluqaġmiŋ Judea-mi, avataaniḷu iluqaiññi nunaaqqiñi.

english: John’s disciples informed him about all these things. So John called two of his disciples
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraŋisa John quliaqtuaġutiŋagaat tamatkuniŋa iluqaiññik.

english: and sent them to Jesus to ask, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
inupiaq: Tavrali John, qaitquŋagik malġuk iḷitchitquraŋni, aasii tilivḷugik Ataniġmun, apiġiyaqtuquvlugu uumiŋa apiqqunmik, Iliviuvich taimña qaiyumaaqtuaguruaq, naagga allamik niġiuvsaaġniaqpisa?

english: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?’”
inupiaq: Tavra iññuk tikiññamitku Jesus, iliŋik uqallaŋaruk, John Paptaiqsim tiliŋagaatiguk iliŋnun, iḷisimasukłuni ilivich taimñaummagaan qaiyumaaqtuaq, naagga allamik niġiuvsaaġniaqpisa?

english: At that very time Jesus cured many people of diseases, sicknesses, and evil spirits, and granted sight to many who were blind.
inupiaq: Taavrumani ikarraġmi Jesus iłuaqsiŋagai iñugiaktuat naŋirrutiniñ, suaqłiuġutiniḷḷu, ilitqusiqł̣uŋniḷḷu, suli iñugiaktuat ayauŋaruat qiñillasipkaŋagai.

english: So he answered them, “Go tell John what you have seen and heard: The blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have good news proclaimed to them.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagik John iḷitchitqurak, Aullaġlutik quliaqtuaġutiyaqtuatku John sunik tautukkaptiŋnik tusaaŋaraptiŋniglu, ayauŋaruat qiñillasirut, tusiattuat pisuallasirut, kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuat mamittut, suli tusaalaitchuat tusaallasirut, tuquruat aŋipkaqtaummiut, piqaqtuksrauruat tusaayugaaġiksuaq alġaqsruusiaġigaat.

english: Blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me.”
inupiaq: Quviasugli iñuk ukpiŋaiŋitchuaq uvamnun.

english: When John’s messengers had gone, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
inupiaq: Tavra John iḷitchitquraŋik aullaaniŋmaŋnik, Jesus uqautirraqsiŋagai iñugiaktuat iñuich sivuniġivlugu John. Sunaimña tautugiaqtaġuuvisiuŋ nunagluktuamun? Tautugiaqtaqpisiuŋ iñuk maliksuktaqsiññaqtuaq ivigruatun anuġim aulataġikkaŋatun? Naumi.

english: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fancy clothes? Look, those who wear fancy clothes and live in luxury are in kings’ courts!
inupiaq: Suna tautugiaqtaġuuvisiuŋ? Tautugiaqtaqpisiuŋ iñuk annuġaaġiksuaq akisuruanik? Iḷisimarusi tamatkua annuġaaġipiaqtuanik annuġaaqaqtuat suli iñuuruat sunik ayuqsraŋił̣ł̣utiŋ umialgich igluqpaŋiññiittut.

english: What did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
inupiaq: Suna tavra tautugiaqtaġaġniqpisiuŋ? Tautugiaqtaġuuvisiuŋ God-im uqaqtiŋa? Aaŋ. Nalupqinaitchuq, kamanałhaaqtuq unnii uqaqtiŋiñiñ God-im.

english: This is the one about whom it is written, ‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’
inupiaq: John taimñauruq aglausimaruaq Bible-ni inna, “Uvva, tiligiga kivgaġa sivuŋni, itqanaiyaġniaġai iñuich akuqtuiyumiñaqsiḷugich iliŋnik.”

english: I tell you, among those born of women no one is greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he is.”
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik uqallautigivsi, John kamanaġniqsrauruq iñuŋniñ aniŋaruaniñ nunami. Paŋmapaŋmiñaglaan iñuk kamanaiññiqsrauruaq tamatkunaŋŋa atanniqsimapkaqtuaniñ God-mun, kamanałhaaqtuq John-miñ, qanuq iḷitchuġiłhaaġniaqtuq sunik God-im salapqiġñiakkaŋiñik uvapkun.

english: (Now all the people who heard this, even the tax collectors, acknowledged God’s justice, because they had been baptized with John’s baptism.
inupiaq: John uqaġman iluqaġmiŋ iñuich, tax-iñiglu katitchirit naalaġniŋagaat. Iliŋich kamaksriŋarut God-im nalaunŋaruamik piraksriutaanik, paptaiqsiłłutiŋ John-mun.

english: However, the Pharisees and the experts in religious law rejected God’s purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.)
inupiaq: Aglaalli Pharisees-lu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik paptaiquŋitchuat John-mun, pisuŋiñŋagaat sivuniġikkaŋa God-im inmiŋnun.

english: “To what then should I compare the people of this generation, and what are they like?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq. Sumun aasii arriḷiñiaqpik ukua iñuuruat paŋmapak? Suli sutun itpat?

english: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling out to one another,
inupiaq: Miqłiqtutun ittut avutqautiruatun piuraaqłutiŋ kasimaraġaġviŋñi, katirrusiqiŋŋuaqłutiglu, tuquruaniglu aŋaiyyurriŋŋuaqtuatun. Piuraallaġmiŋ ququullativlutiŋ avanmun inna, Atuqtuurautigaluaġivsi uaminŋitchusi. Kiŋunġuŋŋuaqłuta qiaŋŋuaqapta, qiaŋitchusi.

english: ‘We played the flute for you, yet you did not dance;
inupiaq: John Paptaiqsi qaiŋaruq. Qaikami niġiḷaitqataŋaruq imiġaluaġnaniḷu wine-mik, aasii uqautigigiksi ilaa ilitqusiqł̣uqaġnivḷugu.

english: we wailed in mourning, yet you did not weep.’
inupiaq: Iġñiŋa iñuum qaiŋaruq niġivḷuni imiqłuniḷu allatun iñuktitun, aasii uvyauġiksi, Marra niġġiqsuruaq wine-tuqtiqpaglu, avilaitqataat tax-iñik katitchirit, piḷuusiqirillu.

english: For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon!’
inupiaq: Suliqutauŋitchuq qanuq uqaġaluaġuvsi, qanuq isumaturuat iñuich puttuqsriḷḷagaat God-im isumattutaa.

english: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata Pharisees aiyugaaŋagaa niġiqatigitquvluni. Jesus aiyugaaqtauŋaruq Pharisee-m igluanun, aasii aquvinŋaruq niġiñiaqłuni.

english: But wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani iniqpaŋmi, aġnaq piḷuusiqirauruaq iñuuŋaruq. Tusaakami Jesus niġiqataunivḷugu Pharisee-m igluani, qaġġirriŋaruq tivraġiksaunmik puuqaqtuamik uyaġagmik misuġuqtuunmik.

english: Now one of the Pharisees asked Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went into the Pharisee’s house and took his place at the table.
inupiaq: Aasii makinŋaruq tunuani Jesus isigaŋiñi qiavluni, ilaan aiḷaqtirraqsiŋagai isigaŋi qulvimiñik, aasii tilaktuqługich nutchamiñik, suli kunikł̣ugich isigaŋi tivraġiksaŋagai.

english: Then when a woman of that town, who was a sinner, learned that Jesus was dining at the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster jar of perfumed oil.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisee-m aiyugaaqłiqsuam Jesus-mik taamna tautukkamiuŋ, isumallaŋaruq, Iñuk una iḷumutun uqaqtaugumi God-mun, iḷisimayumiñaŋagaluaqtuq qanusiutilaaŋanik una aġnaq aksiugniktuaq ilaanik, qanuq piḷuusiqirauruq.

english: As she stood behind him at his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. She wiped them with her hair, kissed them, and anointed them with the perfumed oil.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus-gum uqallautiŋagaa, Simon, uqallautiksraqaqtuŋa iliŋnun. Aasiiḷi ilaan kiuŋagaa, Sumik Iḷisaurrii?

english: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who and what kind of woman this is who is touching him, that she is a sinner.”
inupiaq: Iñuk akiiḷaqtuqtitchiri malġugnik akiiḷaqtuqtiqaŋaruq, igḷuata akiiḷaŋagaa 500 taalamik, aasii igḷuata 50 taalamik.

english: So Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” He replied, “Say it, Teacher.”
inupiaq: Akiḷiiyumiñaiñmaŋnik, ilaan suliqutigiŋaiŋagik akiiḷaŋik. Tavra nalliakta piviuttaġiłhaaġniaqpauŋ?

english: “A certain creditor had two debtors; one owed him five hundred silver coins, and the other fifty.
inupiaq: Simon kiuŋagaa, Isumaruŋa, taavruma suliqutigiŋaiqsauruam iñugiałhaanik. Aasii Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Kiggutin nalauttuq.

english: When they could not pay, he canceled the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”
inupiaq: Tavrani qiviaġutigillaan aġnaq Jesus uqallaŋaruq Simon-mun, Tautukpiuŋ una aġnaq? Isiqama igluŋnun, imiġmik aitchuŋitkiŋma isigaŋma iqaqqutiksraŋannik, aasii uuma iqaġiŋagai isigatka qulvimiñik suli saluaqtiqługich nutchamiñik.

english: Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the bigger debt canceled.” Jesus said to him, “You have judged rightly.”
inupiaq: Paġlaŋaitkiŋma kunigḷuŋa isiqama, aasiiḷi uuma aġnam kunikkaluamiiŋagai isigatka.

english: Then, turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house. You gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
inupiaq: Ilivich uqsruġutiksriñŋaitkiŋma niaqqumnun piḷġusikaatun, aglaalli uuma aġnam tivraġiksaŋagai isigatka.

english: You gave me no kiss of greeting, but from the time I entered she has not stopped kissing my feet.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautigikpiñ, kamanaqtuaq piviuttaqqutaa iḷitchuqqutauruq iñugiaktuat piḷuutiŋi suliqutigiŋaiqsautilaaŋannik itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich. Iñuk isumaruaq piḷuutiqapiaŋiññasugaluni suliqutigiŋaigaksranik piviuttaqsripiaġniaŋitchuq.

english: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with perfumed oil.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Jesus uqallautiŋagaa aġnaq, Piḷuutitin suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich.

english: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which were many, are forgiven, thus she loved much; but the one who is forgiven little loves little.”
inupiaq: Tavrani tavra tamatkua niġiñiaqatauruat piqatigivlugu Jesus uqarraqsiŋarut inmiŋnun, Uvvauna kiña suliqutigiŋaiqsiḷḷaniqpa piḷuutinik?

english: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq aġnamun, Ukpiġurvich annautigaatin. Aullaġiñ tutqiksiḷutin.

english: But those who were at the table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this, who even forgives sins?”
He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
Some time afterward he went on through towns and villages, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The twelve were with him,
inupiaq: Taavruma aquuraŋagun Jesus kukiḷuŋaruq iniqpaktigun nunaaqqiuratigullu, alġaqsruivḷuni tusaayugaaġiksuanik God-im atanniqsimmataagun iñuŋnun. Suli qulit malġuk kukiḷuqatigiŋagaat.

english: and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and disabilities: Mary (called Magdalene), from whom seven demons had gone out,
inupiaq: Suli iḷaŋisa aġnat kukiḷuqatigiŋammigaat iłuaqsirauŋaruat iḷitqusiqł̣uŋniñ suaŋairrutiniḷḷu. Iḷagiŋagaat Mary, tairauruaq Magdalene, ilitqusiqł̣uiqsauŋaruaq tallimat malġugnik,

english: and Joanna the wife of Cuza (Herod’s household manager), Susanna, and many others who provided for them out of their own resources.
inupiaq: Joanna-lu, nuliaŋa Chuzam, Herod-gum suġautchiqiriŋata, Susanna-lu, iñugiaktuallu allat aġnat ikayuiruat Jesus-mik iḷitchitquraŋiñiglu ilaisa pimiŋniñ.

english: While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from one town after another, he spoke to them in a parable:
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñuich katinmata atautchimun suli iñuich sumiḷḷiqaa nunaaqqiñiñ ullautimmata inmiñun, Jesus uqaŋaruq uuktuusiqł̣uni.

english: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled on, and the wild birds devoured it.
inupiaq: Nunaliqiri aullaŋaruq kanġaqsruiyaqtuqłuni nautchiaksranik palauvaksraġuġniaqtuanik. Kanġaqsruimman nautchiaqaġviŋmun, iḷaŋich kataŋarut apqutinun, aasii iñuich tunmalugiŋagaich, tiŋmiaġruiḷḷu qaivḷutiŋ niġiŋagaich.

english: Other seed fell on rock, and when it came up, it withered because it had no moisture.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋich nautchiaksrat kataŋammiut uyaġauruanun nunamun, aasii naummata panaqłuŋagai, qanuq nuna paliumavluni.

english: Other seed fell among the thorns, and they grew up with it and choked it.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋich nautchiaksrat kataŋarut kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauruat akunġannun, aasii kakiḷḷaġnaqtuat nauqasiqł̣ugich nautchiaksrat nagguviksraiñŋagaich.

english: But other seed fell on good soil and grew, and it produced a hundred times as much grain.” As he said this, he called out, “The one who has ears to hear had better listen!”
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋich kataŋammiut nunagiksuamun aasii nauvlutiŋ palauvaksrat, naurivḷutiŋ tallimakipiatun atautchimiñ. Taamna uqausiġillaan nipatusivḷuni uqallaŋaruq, Siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksraŋnik, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: Then his disciples asked him what this parable meant.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurami apiġimmanni qanuq taamna uuktuun sivuniqaġmagaan,

english: He said, “You have been given the opportunity to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but for others they are in parables, so that although they see they may not see, and although they hear they may not understand.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, God-im kaŋiqsipkaŋagaa ilivsiññun kaŋiqsiñaiñŋaruaq sivuani atanniqsimmatini iñuŋnun, aglaalli allat iñuich tusaqsraġigaat uuktuutitigun, qiñiġaluaqłutiŋ iḷisaqsriḷaitquvlugich, suli naalaġnigaluaqłutiŋ, kaŋiqsiḷaitquvlugich.

english: “Now the parable means this: The seed is the word of God.
inupiaq: Uuktuun inna sivuniqaqtuq. Nautchiaksrat palauvaksraġuġniaqtuat God-im uqaluatun ittut.

english: Those along the path are the ones who have heard; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
inupiaq: Nautchiaksrat iḷaŋich kataŋmatun apqutinun, tainnatuttauq iñuich iḷaŋich tusaaruat uqaluanik God-im siqquqsimmiraqtut. Tuunġaum qaivḷuni, piiguipkaġai tusaakkaŋannik, ukpiġlutiŋ annaurrautquŋił̣ł̣ugich.

english: Those on the rock are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in a time of testing fall away.
inupiaq: Allalli iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun uyaġauruamun nunamun. Tusaapqauraqamirruŋ uqaluk, quyyatigivlugu akuqtuġaat. Aglaan akuqtuaġiŋiññiġaat uqaluk naamasiḷugu tuniqsimmatiksraqtiŋ, nautchiaksratun maŋŋuqavigruaŋitchuatun iłłutiŋ. Ukpiliḷḷakkaluaqłutiŋ uuktuaġusiat qaimmata nikatchaktut aasii qapiqłutiŋ.

english: As for the seed that fell among thorns, these are the ones who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by the worries and riches and pleasures of life, and their fruit does not mature.
inupiaq: Allalli iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun akunġannun kakiḷḷaġnat nauruat. Tamatkua iñuich tusaagaluaqtuat uqaluŋmik, uŋiarrisit mattumuuna iñuuniaġnikun, piviuttaqsriñġuvlu suġaliġnik, aliasuŋisaaġutiniglu nagguviksraiġaat uqaluk, aasii iliŋisa iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauŋił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: But as for the seed that landed on good soil, these are the ones who, after hearing the word, cling to it with an honest and good heart, and bear fruit with steadfast endurance.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi allat iñuich ittut nautchiaksratun kataktuatun nunagiksuamun. Iliŋisa tusaagaat uqaluk akuqtupiaġataqługu kamagivlugulu, aasii iñuusiŋich allaŋŋuqtauvlutiŋ.

english: “No one lights a lamp and then covers it with a jar or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand so that those who come in can see the light.
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa ikitanikkamiuŋ naniq matulaitkaa utkusiŋmik, naaggaunnii iḷiḷaitkaa ataannun siñigviich, aglaan iḷisuugaa naniqaġviŋmun, tamatkua isiqtuat tautuquvlugich qaummaġmik.

english: For nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing concealed that will not be made known and brought to light.
inupiaq: Sunapayaaq matutuqtuaq paŋmapak sivunniqsauŋaruq salapqiġumaaqługu taimanigu, suli sunapayaaq iḷisimapkaqtauŋitchuaq paŋmapak sivunniqsauŋaruq iḷitchuġipkaqtauyumaaqługu iñupayaanun taimanigu.

english: So listen carefully, for whoever has will be given more, but whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken from him.”
inupiaq: Naalaġnimmaġiksaaqsiuŋ tusaakkaqsi. Qanuq iñuk naalaġniḷḷuataqtuaq kaŋiqsipkavsaaqtitauniaqtuq, aasiiḷi iñuk naalaġniḷḷuatalaitchuaq tammaiñiaqtuq kaŋiqsił̣auraġasugigaluakkaġmiñik.

english: Now Jesus’ mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not get near him because of the crowd.
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus aakaŋallu aniqatiiŋisalu ullaŋagaat, aglaan tikiḷaiñŋagaat iñugiakpaił̣ł̣uni.

english: So he was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuum uqallautiŋagaa, Aakavich aniqatiiviḷḷu qaŋma siḷami tautugukkaatin.

english: But he replied to them, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and do it.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iluqaisa, Tamatkua tusaaruat uqaluanik God-im kamagivlugulu aakaptun aniqatiiptullu ittut.

english: One day Jesus got into a boat with his disciples and said to them, “Let’s go across to the other side of the lake.” So they set out,
inupiaq: Uvlut iḷaŋanni Jesus ikiŋaruq umiaqpauramun piqatigivlugich iḷitchitqurani, aasii uqallautivlugich, Ikaaqta aŋmuŋatchianun tatchim. Tavra ayaksaaŋarut.

english: and as they sailed he fell asleep. Now a violent windstorm came down on the lake, and the boat started filling up with water, and they were in danger.
inupiaq: Tavra tiŋinnaaġniallaġmiŋ Jesus siquŋaruq. Tavra anuqqaŋaruq tasiq, aasii iksruġaliqł̣ugu imiġmik umiaqpauraŋat, navianniuliŋarut.

english: They came and woke him, saying, “Master, Master, we are about to die!” So he got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waves; they died down, and it was calm.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat ullakługu Jesus itiqsaŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷisaurrii, Iḷisaurrii, kiviaqsirugut. Tavra itiŋaruq aasii suakługu anuġi ulivrigaqtuallu qaiḷḷiġich, aasii anuġaiŋaruq quunniġuqłuniḷu.

english: Then he said to them, “Where is your faith?” But they were afraid and amazed, saying to one another, “Who then is this? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him!”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Ukpiġutaipiaqtusiimña. Tavra taluqsratchaŋarut, suli kamanniuqłutiŋ uqaurrutiŋarut avanmun, Uvvauna kiuva? Anuġivlu immavlu kamagillaniġaak.

english: So they sailed over to the region of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
inupiaq: Tavrani tikiñŋarut nunaŋannun Gerasenes, akianiittuamun Galilee-m.

english: As Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man from the town met him who was possessed by demons. For a long time this man had worn no clothes and had not lived in a house, but among the tombs.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus niummiuġlu nunamun, iñuum ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuam paaŋagaa iniqpaŋmiitchuuŋaruam. Sivisuruamik annuġaiḷaġniqsuq, suli iñuuniaqtuaguŋił̣ł̣uni iglumi, aglaan akunġanni iḷuvviviich.

english: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before him, and shouted with a loud voice, “Leave me alone, Jesus, Son of the Most High God! I beg you, do not torment me!”
inupiaq: Tautukkamiuŋ Jesus, ilaa nipaalaŋaruq aasii punŋaruq sivuġaanun, uqallakłuni nipatutilaamisun, Jesus, Iġñiŋa sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im, suniaqpiŋa? Apiġipiaġikpiñ, tatavsaġnaŋa.

english: For Jesus had started commanding the evil spirit to come out of the man. (For it had seized him many times, so he would be bound with chains and shackles and kept under guard. But he would break the restraints and be driven by the demon into deserted places.)
inupiaq: Qanuq Jesus anitquaniŋagaa ilitqusiqł̣uk ilaaniñ. Iñugiaktuani ilitqusiqł̣uum piyugaġniġaa. Tigutaaqtaugaluaġaqtuq argaŋiḷu isigaŋiḷu qiḷiqsruqługich kalimñanik kiktuġaġuuniġai, aasii ilitqusiqł̣uum nunagluktuamuktitaqługu.

english: Jesus then asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.
inupiaq: Jesus tavrani apiġiŋagaa, Kiña atqiñ. Aasii ilaan kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa atiġa Legion. Qanuq iñugiaktuat ilitqusiqł̣uich isiġmiuvigiŋagaat.

english: And they began to beg him not to order them to depart into the abyss.
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uich apiġipiaŋagaat Jesus tilitquŋił̣ł̣utiŋ nagliksaaġviŋmun.

english: Now a large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside, and the demonic spirits begged Jesus to let them go into them. He gave them permission.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani iñugiaktuat tuttuqłuich niġiñiaŋarut maniñġani qimialuum. Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uich apiġipiaŋagaat Jesus isiqtitquvlutiŋ tuttuqłuŋnun. Tainnaasii pipkaŋagai.

english: So the demons came out of the man and went into the pigs, and the herd of pigs rushed down the steep slope into the lake and drowned.
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uich aniŋarut iñuŋmiñ aasii isiġvigivlugich tuttuqłuich. Tavraasii tuttuqłuich arviksuŋarut qutaitchuakun ikpikun tatchimun, aasii ipivlutiŋ.

english: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran off and spread the news in the town and countryside.
inupiaq: Tavra qaunaksriruat tuttuqługnik tautukkamirruŋ taamna piruaq, pigruŋarut, aasii quliaqtuaġiaqsivḷugu iniqpaŋmi nunaaqqiñiḷu.

english: So the people went out to see what had happened, and they came to Jesus. They found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuich aullaaŋarut tautugiaqsaqłutiŋ suna pisilaaŋanik. Ullakamirruŋ Jesus, tautuŋagaat iñuk ilitqusiqł̣uich anniviat, aquppiruaq sivuġaani Jesus, annuġaaqaqłuni suli qaurimmaaġikł̣uni. Aasii iñuich iqsitchaŋarut.

english: Those who had seen it told them how the man who had been demon-possessed had been healed.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuich tautuktuat taavrumiŋa quliaqtuaġutiŋagaich allat iñuich qanuq taamna ilitqusiqł̣uqaŋaruaq iłuaqsirautilaaŋanik.

english: Then all the people of the Gerasenes and the surrounding region asked Jesus to leave them alone, for they were seized with great fear. So he got into the boat and left.
inupiaq: Tavrani iluqaġmiŋ iñuich avataanni nunaaqqiŋisa Gerasenes apiġiŋagaat Jesus aullaquvlugu, qanuq iliŋich iqsitchakpaŋarut. Tavraasii ilaa ikiŋaruq umiaqpauramun aasii aullaqłutiŋ.

english: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
inupiaq: Iñuum taavruma ilitqusiqł̣uiqsauŋaruam qasiḷiŋagaluaġaa maligukługu, aasii Jesus aitqugiññaŋagaa uqallautivlugu,

english: “Return to your home, and declare what God has done for you.” So he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole town what Jesus had done for him.
inupiaq: Utiġiñ aimaaġviŋñun, aasii quliaqtuaġlutin qanutun God-mun ikayuŋatilaaġnik. Tavra ilaa aullaŋaruq, quliaqtuaġivlugu iluqaani iniqpaŋmi qanutun Jesus-mun ikayuŋatilaani.

english: Now when Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, because they were all waiting for him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus utiġman taaguŋatchianun tatchim, iñusalaich paġlaŋagaat, qanuq iluqaġmiŋ utaqqiuŋagaat.

english: Then a man named Jairus, who was a ruler of the synagogue, came up. Falling at Jesus’ feet, he pleaded with him to come to his house,
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani iñuk qaiŋaruq atiqaqtuaq Jairus-mik, umialiŋnauruaq aŋaiyyuviŋmun, aasii pułłuni Jesus sivuġaanun, apiġipiaŋagaa iglumiñuquvlugu.

english: because he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying.
inupiaq: Panisualuqaġniqsuaq, qulit malġugnik ukiuliŋmik, tuquaqsiruamik. Tavra Jesus aullaŋaruq aasii igliqtillugu, iñuich tatiŋarut avataanun.

english: As Jesus was on his way, the crowds pressed around him.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnaq suniġluqaqtuaq auŋmik qulit malġugni ukiuni iłuaqsiḷaiññikkaŋat taaktit,

english: Now a woman was there who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years but could not be healed by anyone.
inupiaq: tunuŋiutiŋaruq ilaanun iñusalaŋni, aasii aksiukługu siñiġutaa annuġaaŋan, aasii aunaaqsruŋaiqł̣uni tavrauvvaa.

english: She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his cloak, and at once the bleeding stopped.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiqsriŋaruq, Kia aksiukpaŋa? Tavra iluqaġmiŋ piiḷaaġmata, Peter uqallaŋaruq, Iḷisaurrii, iñusalaich uvva avanŋagaatin suli tatimmiraġaatin.

english: Then Jesus asked, “Who was it who touched me?” When they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are surrounding you and pressing against you!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallalgitchuq, Iñuum imma aksiŋagaaŋa qanuq iḷisimagiga suaŋŋan aullaqtuaq uvamniñ.

english: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, for I know that power has gone out from me.”
inupiaq: Tavrali aġnaq iḷitchuġikami ilaa iriqsimayumiñaisilaamiñik, qaiŋaruq uullaġruaqtun, aasii pułłuni sivuġaanun Jesus. Takkuanni iñupayaat quliaqtuaŋaruq suvluni aksiuktilaaŋanik, quliaqtuaqłuniḷu qanuq iłuaqsirautilaamiñik tavrauvvaa.

english: When the woman saw that she could not escape notice, she came trembling and fell down before him. In the presence of all the people, she explained why she had touched him and how she had been immediately healed.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Aġnaaq, ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin. Aullaġiñ tutqiksiḷutin.

english: Then he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqaġataviksillugusuli, kivgaŋa umialiŋnam igluaniñ qaiŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Paniiñ tuquruq. Iḷaksianagu Iḷisaurri.

english: While he was still speaking, someone from the synagogue ruler’s house came and said, “Your daughter is dead; do not trouble the teacher any longer.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaavlugu taamna uqallautiŋagaa Jairus, Ipiqtusugnak. Ukpiqsiññaġiñ iłuaqsiñiaqtuq.

english: But when Jesus heard this, he told him, “Do not be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed.”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññamiuŋ iglu, isiqasiqsinŋaitchuq iñuŋmun, aglaan Peter-lu John-lu James-lu, aapaŋalu aakaŋalu miqłiqtum.

english: Now when he came to the house, Jesus did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John, and James, and the child’s father and mother.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich qiaqpaŋarut, aasii Jesus uqallaŋaruq, qiaŋaiġitchi. Miqłiqtuq tuquŋaitchuq, siñiksiññaqtuq.

english: Now they were all wailing and mourning for her, but he said, “Stop your weeping; she is not dead but asleep.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa iglautigiŋagaat, iḷisimavlutiŋ miqłiqtum tuquŋatilaaŋanik.

english: And they began making fun of him, because they knew that she was dead.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tiguvlugu argaŋigun ilaa uqallaŋaruq, “Miqłiqtuuq, makittin.”

english: But Jesus gently took her by the hand and said, “Child, get up.”
inupiaq: Tavra miqłiqtuq iñuusatqiŋaruq, aasii makinŋaruq tavrauvvaa. Jesus piraksriŋagai sumik niġipkaquvlugu.

english: Her spirit returned, and she got up immediately. Then he told them to give her something to eat.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan aŋayuqaak aliuŋaruk, aasii Jesus piraksriŋagik uqaquŋił̣ł̣ugik kimulliqaa taavrumiŋa piruamik.

english: Her parents were astonished, but he ordered them to tell no one what had happened.
After Jesus called the twelve together, he gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qaitquŋagai qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurani atautchimun, aasii aitchuqługich ataniġnaqunmik, suaŋŋasiqł̣ugich payariyumiñaqsivḷugich iluqaisa ilitqusiqł̣uich, suli iłuaqsiyumiñaqsivḷugich naŋirrutiqaqtuat.

english: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan tiliŋagai alġaqsruitquvlugich God-im atanniqsimmataanik iñuŋnun, suli iłuaqsiritquvlugich naŋittuanik.

english: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey – no staff, no bag, no bread, no money, and do not take an extra tunic.
