inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Saagaġnasi supayaamik iglauniksravsiññun, ayauppiagiḷḷusi, puukataiḷḷusiḷu, taquagiḷaaġlusiḷu, maniiḷaaġlusiḷu, suli malġugnik qaliġuuraqaġnasi.

english: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave the area.
inupiaq: Suli kisumulliqaa iglumun tukkuliqpasi, tavraniitchumausi, aullaġnivsiññunaglaan.

english: Wherever they do not receive you, as you leave that town, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
inupiaq: Suli sumipayaaq tukkuliŋitpasi, aullaġuvsi taavrumaŋŋa nunaaqqimiñ, ivsuktuġumagiksi avyuq isigavsiññiñ kiliksaġlugich killuliqitilaaŋannik.

english: Then they departed and went throughout the villages, proclaiming the good news and healing people everywhere.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat aullaŋarut aasii iglauvlutiŋ nunaaqqisigun, alġaqsruivḷutiŋ tusaayugaaġiksuamik, iłuaqsirivḷutiglu naŋittuanik sumiḷiqaa.

english: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening, and he was thoroughly perplexed, because some people were saying that John had been raised from the dead,
inupiaq: Tavra Herod Atanaurauruaq Galilee-mi, tusaakami iluqaiññik savaaguruanik, ilaa alapinŋaruq, pisigivlugu iñuich iḷaŋisa uqautigikkaŋat John Paptaiqsi aŋipkaqtaunivḷugu tuqqunmiñ,

english: while others were saying that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had risen.
inupiaq: iḷaŋisali Elijah niptaġnivḷugu, aasii allattauq uqaqłutiŋ iḷaŋat taipkua uqaqtiŋisa God-im aŋiñivḷugu.

english: Herod said, “I had John beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” So Herod wanted to learn about Jesus.
inupiaq: Herod uqallaŋaruq, John niaquiŋagiga, aasiuvva kiuva taimña iñuk tusaqsraġikkaġa uqautigikkaŋat? Tavra ilaan kasuġumaŋagaluaġaa Jesus.

english: When the apostles returned, they told Jesus everything they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew privately to a town called Bethsaida.
inupiaq: Tavra tilirauŋaruat iḷitchitqurat utiqamiŋ, quliaqtuaġutiŋagaat Jesus savaamikkun. Tavra ilaan piqasiutiŋagai aasii aullautivlugich iñuił̣aamun qaniŋanun nunaaqqim Bethsaida-m.

english: But when the crowds found out, they followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and cured those who needed healing.
inupiaq: Iñusalaich iḷitchuġikamirruŋ Jesus maliŋagaat. Aasiivsauq ilaan paġlaŋagai suli uqautivlugich God-im atanniqsimmataanik iñuŋnun, iłuaqsivḷugiḷḷu tamatkua iłuaqsiraksrauruat.

english: Now the day began to draw to a close, so the twelve came and said to Jesus, “Send the crowd away, so they can go into the surrounding villages and countryside and find lodging and food, because we are in an isolated place.”
inupiaq: Tavra siqiñiq nipiaqsimman, qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat ullakługu uqallautiŋagaat Jesus, Aullaqtitkich iñusalaich, aullaqulugich nunaaqqiñun sumulliqaa, siñiktaġviksranun taquaksraġviksranullu. Qanuq uvva maaniittugut iñuił̣aami.

english: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They replied, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish – unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Ilivsi niqiksritchigik. Iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Tallimatualuŋnik punniġutiqaqtugut malġugniglu iqalluŋnik. Aullaġluta tauqsiġiaŋisuaġupta niqiksraŋiññik ukua iluqaġmiŋ iñuich naamayumiñaitchugut.

english: (Now about five thousand men were there.) Then he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
inupiaq: Iñugiaktilaaqaqpalliŋarut 5,000-tun aŋutit. Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Aquvititchigik iñuich malġukipiaq quligullaalugich atautchiich.

english: So they did as Jesus directed, and the people all sat down.
inupiaq: Tavra aquvitinŋagaich iluqaisa.

english: Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven he gave thanks and broke them. He gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
inupiaq: Tavra tiguvlugich tallimat punniġich malġuglu iqalluk, Jesus qiviaŋaruq qiḷaŋmun, aasii quyyavigivlugu God. Aasii avguqqaaqługich aitchuutigivlugich iḷitchitquranun niqłiqsuutigitquvlugich iñusalaŋnun.

english: They all ate and were satisfied, and what was left over was picked up – twelve baskets of broken pieces.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich niġiŋarut niqinŋuqłutiŋ. Aasii iḷitchitqurat katinŋagaich iḷakut, qulit malġugnun aguummaŋnun.

english: Once when Jesus was praying by himself, and his disciples were nearby, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
inupiaq: Tavra uvlut iḷaŋanni Jesus kisimi aŋaiyyuŋaruq iḷitchitqurat saniġaanni. Aasii aŋaiyyuaniŋman, iḷitchitquraŋisa ullaŋagaat, aasii ilaan apiġiŋagai, Iñuich kiunisuuvanŋa?

english: They answered, “John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others that one of the prophets of long ago has risen.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa kiuŋagaat, John-gunisuugaatin Paptaiqsi, aglaan allat uqaġuummiut Elijah-univḷutin, suli allat uqaqłutiŋ iḷaŋat taipkua uqaqtiŋisa God-im aŋiñivḷugu.

english: Then he said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus apiġiŋagai, Ilivsiḷimi kiunivisiŋa? Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Ilivich God-im Tiliraŋa, Christ-guruaq.

english: But he forcefully commanded them not to tell this to anyone,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus piraksriŋagai iḷitchitqurani quliaqtuaquŋipiallakługich taavrumiŋa kimulliqaa.

english: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Iġñiŋa iñuum nagliksaaqtuksrauruq atqunaq, suli umialiŋnallu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik pisuŋiññiaġaat suli tuqutauluni. Aasii aŋipkaqtauniaqtuq uvluk piŋayuaŋni.

english: Then he said to them all, “If anyone wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow me.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa maligukkumiŋa, piruksrauŋitchuq ilaan pisukkamiñik, iqsriutilugu aŋarraurani, itqanaitchuksrauruq tuqutautigiyumiñaġluŋa unnii.

english: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk iñuullatuvaił̣aktuaq tammaiñiaqtuq iñuggunmiñik, aglaalli iñuk sullatuaġumiḷu atiruaq tuqqutiyumiñaġluŋaunnii, tammaiyumiñaipiaġaa iñuggutini.

english: For what does it benefit a person if he gains the whole world but loses or forfeits himself?
inupiaq: Iñuk suġallakkaluaġumi supayauranik nunamiittuanik aasii tammautigilugich, ilaa suuramik-unnii anniqsuġumiñaitchuq inmiñik. Simmiutigimmatun iñuggutini pigaa.

english: For whoever is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
inupiaq: Qanuġviitchuq, iñuum kanŋugikpaŋa iḷisaurrutitkalu iñuŋnun, uvaŋaptauq Iġñiŋan iñuum kanŋuginiaġmigiga qaiguma qaumanġani Aapama piqatigilugich piḷuutaitchuat isaġulgich.

english: But I tell you most certainly, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi iḷumun. Iñuqaqtuq iḷaŋiññik uvani makitaruanik, tuquŋaiñŋaġmiŋ tautugniaqtuanik God-im atanniqsimmataanik iñuŋnun.

english: Now about eight days after these sayings, Jesus took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up the mountain to pray.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat piŋasut uvlut pianikpalliġmata aquatigun taapkua uqaluuruat, Jesus piqasiutiŋagai Peter-lu John-lu James-lu, aasii mayuqłutiŋ iġġimun aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłutiŋ.

english: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was transformed, and his clothes became very bright, a brilliant white.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa aŋaiyyupkaqtillugu, kiiñaŋa allaŋŋuŋaruq, suli annuġaaŋi qivliatitaliqł̣utiŋ qatiġruaqtun.

english: Then two men, Moses and Elijah, began talking with him.
inupiaq: Tavrasuli malġuk iññuk uqaqatigirraqsiŋagaak Moses-lu Elijah-vlu.

english: They appeared in glorious splendor and spoke about his departure that he was about to carry out at Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Niptaŋaruk qaumaniqaqłutiŋ, aasii uqautigiaqsivḷugu tuqutauniksraŋa nalautinniakkaŋa Jerusalem-mi.

english: Now Peter and those with him were quite sleepy, but as they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-lu iḷagikkaŋniḷu siñiŋarut. Itiqłutiŋ tautuŋagaat Jesus qaumanġa taapkuaglu iññuk malġuk makitaruak saniġaani.

english: Then as the men were starting to leave, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah” – not knowing what he was saying.
inupiaq: Tavra iññuk aullaqsaġmagnik ilaaniñ, Peter uqallaŋaruq Jesus-mun, Iḷisaurrii, iłuaqtuq uvaniinnapta. Piŋasunik tupiqta, atautchimik iliŋnun, atautchimik Moses-mun, suli atautchimik Elijah-mun. Iḷisimaŋitchuq sumik uqaqtilaamiñik.

english: As he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
inupiaq: Uqaqtillugu Peter taavrumiŋa, nuvuya qaiŋaruq aasii qulaŋiqł̣ugich. Tavra iqsitchaŋarut nuvuyamun maġġutisaġniallaġmik.

english: Then a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, my Chosen One. Listen to him!”
inupiaq: Tavra nivliŋaruq nuvuyamiñ uqallakłuni, Uvva Iġñiġa, uvaŋa Piksraqtaaġa. Naalaġnisiuŋ.

english: After the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. So they kept silent and told no one at that time anything of what they had seen.
inupiaq: Tavra nipi uqallaaniŋman, Jesus kisiŋŋuqtauŋaruq. Taipkunani uvluni iliŋich quliaqtuaqsaiḷiŋarut kisupayaamun supayaamik tautukkaġmiŋnik.

english: Now on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaakumman, atqaaniŋmata iġġimiñ, iñusalaich ullaŋagaat Jesus.

english: Then a man from the crowd cried out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son – he is my only child!
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk akunġanniñ iñusalaich saqłaŋaruq, Iḷisaurrii, qiññuvigipiallakkikpiñ iłuaqsitquvlugu iġñiġa, qanuq iġñitualugigiga.

english: A spirit seizes him, and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions and causes him to foam at the mouth. It hardly ever leaves him alone, torturing him severely.
inupiaq: Ilitqusiqł̣uum aŋalattaġiaqsiraġigaa, aasii tavraŋŋatchiaq nipaallakłuni, qiiqsruaqsiraqtuq innuġrualiqiliġataqłuni, suli iqł̣ataġivlugu. Ilitqusiqł̣uum qimaummipialaitkaa.

english: I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not do so.”
inupiaq: Qiññuaġvigiŋagaluaġitka iḷitchitquratin anitquvlugu ilitqusiqł̣uk, aasii anilaiñŋagaat.

english: Jesus answered, “You unbelieving and perverse generation! How much longer must I be with you and endure you? Bring your son here.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq. Qanutun ukpiġutaisigirusi killukuaqtigirusiḷu. Qanutun sivisutigiruamik nayuġniaqpisi igḷutuġlusiḷu? Qaġġitchuuŋ iġñiġiñ uvuŋa.

english: As the boy was approaching, the demon threw him to the ground and shook him with convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
inupiaq: Qaisaġniaqtillugu, ilitqusiqł̣uum iqł̣ataġiŋagaa nukatpiaġruk qiiqsruqtiłługulu. Tavra Jesus suaŋagaa ilitqusiqł̣uk. Aasii iłuaqsikamiuŋ nukatpiaġruk, qaitqikł̣ugu aapaŋanun.

english: Then they were all astonished at the mighty power of God.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich kamatchaŋarut God-im suaŋŋatiqpaŋanik.

english: But while the entire crowd was amazed at everything Jesus was doing, he said to his disciples,
inupiaq: Tavrali iñuich iluqaġmiŋ kamasualapkaqługich supayaatigun piraigun, Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani,

english: “Take these words to heart, for the Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
inupiaq: ukua uqaluich piiguġnagich uqautigikkatka ilivsiññun, qanuq Iġñiŋa Iñuum aitchuutauniaqtuq iñuŋnun tuqutqulugu.

english: But they did not understand this statement; its meaning had been concealed from them, so that they could not grasp it. Yet they were afraid to ask him about this statement.
inupiaq: Iliŋisa kaŋiqsiŋaitkaat taamna uqallaun, suli kaŋiqsipkaqtitauŋaitchuq iliŋiññuñ, puttuqsriyumiñaiqł̣ugich taavrumiŋa, suli iliŋisa apiġisausiiñŋagaat taavrumuuna uqallautaagun.

english: Now an argument started among the disciples as to which of them might be the greatest.
inupiaq: Tavra uqavaarraqsiŋarut iḷitchitqurat nalliqsiŋ kamanałhaaġniaqtilaaŋagun.

english: But when Jesus discerned their innermost thoughts, he took a child, had him stand by his side,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsrikamiuŋ isumaŋat kamanaġumaruaq, ilaan tiguŋagaa miqłiqtuq aasii saniqqamiñun inillakługu.

english: and said to them, “Whoever welcomes this child in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me, for the one who is least among you all is the one who is great.”
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautiŋagai, Kialiqaa paġlakpagu piaqłuktaŋiḷḷugu una miqłiqtuq uvaŋa pisigiluŋa, paġlagaaŋa uvaŋa. Aasiisuli kialiqaa paġlagumiŋa paġlammigaa tiliriga. Iñuk kamasaaŋiññiqsrauruaq iluqavsiññiñ kamanaġniqsrauruq.

english: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he is not a disciple along with us.”
inupiaq: John uqallaŋaruq, Iḷisaurrii, tautuŋarugut iñuŋmik anittairuamik ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik atuqługu atqiñ, aasii iñiqtikkaqput qanuq piqatigiŋitkaatigut.

english: But Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him, for whoever is not against you is for you.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Iñiqtiġnagu, qanuq akiḷḷiḷiqsuiŋitchuaq ilivsiññik iḷagigiksi.

english: Now when the days drew near for him to be taken up, Jesus set out resolutely to go to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Tavra qallimman Jesus qiḷaŋmugviksrani, qapiŋaipiaŋaruq aullaġukłuni Jerusalem-mun. Aasii tilisiŋaruq kivganik sivumiñi.

english: He sent messengers on ahead of him. As they went along, they entered a Samaritan village to make things ready in advance for him,
inupiaq: Taapkua aullaŋarut aasii tikił̣ł̣utiŋ nunaaqqiannun Samaria-ġmiut, itqanaiyautisukługu Jesus.

english: but the villagers refused to welcome him, because he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich tukkuliŋaitkaat Jesus, qanuq iḷitchuġivlutiŋ Jerusalem-muksaqtilaaŋanik.

english: Now when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
inupiaq: Tavra James-lu John-lu iḷitchitqurak iḷitchuġikamitku taamna, uqallaŋaruk, Ataniiq, qiññuaquvisiguk igniġmik qiḷaŋmiñ aasii ikipkaġlugich Elijah-m piraŋatun.

english: But Jesus turned and rebuked them,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaqługik suaŋagik uqallautivlugik, [kaŋiqsiŋaitchutik qanuq piḷġusiksramik,

english: and they went on to another village.
inupiaq: qanuq Iġñiŋa iñuum qaiŋaitchuq suksraunġiġiaġlugich iñuich aglaan annautiyaqtuqługich.] Aasii iliŋich iglauŋarut allamun nunaaqqimun.

english: As they were walking along the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
inupiaq: Tavra iglaupkaqtillugich, iñuum uqallautiŋagaa, Maliġuaġniaġikpiñ sumulliqaa aullaġuvich.

english: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens and the birds in the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Pisukkaat sisiqaqtut, suli tiŋmiat ugluqaqtut, aglaan Iġñiŋa iñuum aimaaġviitchuq pimaaqtuġumiñakkamiñik.

english: Jesus said to another, “Follow me.” But he replied, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
inupiaq: Allamulli Jesus uqallaŋammiuq, Maliŋŋa. Aasii iñuum kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, iḷuviġiallaktiqqaaġlagu aapaga.

english: But Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Tamatkua tuquŋaruatun ittuat iḷuvviuġlich tuquŋaruanik. Aglaalli ilivich, aullaġlutin quliaqtuaġiyaqtuġuŋ God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun.

english: Yet another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say goodbye to my family.”
inupiaq: Allasuli iñuk uqallaŋaruq, Ataniiq uvaŋa maliġuaġniaġikpiñ, aglaan takuruġuiqsuaġiallaglagich iglumniittuat.

english: Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, kiñaliqaa saqutittuaq savaamiñ uvaŋa sivunniutigikkamniñ ilaanun, nalliummatiŋitchuq atanniqsimapkaġumiñaġluni God-mun.

english: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them on ahead of him two by two into every town and place where he himself was about to go.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Ataniq piksraŋaruq 70 allanik iḷitchitquranik, aasii aullaqtiłługich sivumiñi malġuullaavlugich, nunaaqqipayaanun ilaan ullakkumakkamiñun.

english: He said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Iñusalaich utaqqirut tusaayumavlutiŋ tusaayugaaġiksuanik, palauvaksratun nauganiktuatun kipisałhiñaaġuqługich, aglaan savaktit iñukitchut. Tavraasii qiññuaqtuġitchi Atanġannun savaktit tilisivsaaqulugu savaktiksravsaamiñik.

english: Go! I am sending you out like lambs surrounded by wolves.
inupiaq: Aullaġitchi. Uvva, tiligivsi imnaiyaatun akunġannun amaqqut.

english: Do not carry a money bag, a traveler’s bag, or sandals, and greet no one on the road.
inupiaq: Saagaġnasi maniqaġviŋñik, puukataniglu, aluġutiniglu, suli paġlannigḷusi iñaviqqutchiġñasi apqunmi.

english: Whenever you enter a house, first say, ‘May peace be on this house!’
inupiaq: Kisupayaaq iglu isiġvigiguvsiuŋ, uqallaqqaaġitchi inna, Tutqiutiqaġitchi.

english: And if a peace-loving person is there, your peace will remain on him, but if not, it will return to you.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tutqiḷḷaturuaq iñuk tavraniitpan, tutqiun inniaqtuq. Aasii tutqiutiqallaturuamik iñuitpan, tutqiun inniaŋitchuq tavrani.

english: Stay in that same house, eating and drinking what they give you, for the worker deserves his pay. Do not move around from house to house.
inupiaq: Nayuutiyumausi taavrumani iglumi, niġiḷusi sunik niqiksritpasi imiġlusiḷu, qanuq savakti nalliummatiruq akiḷiusiaksramiñun. Nuktaġnasi iglumiñ iglunun.

english: Whenever you enter a town and the people welcome you, eat what is set before you.
inupiaq: Qakugupayaaq tikitkuvsi nunaaqqiñun aasii paġlakpasi, niġiyumausi sunik niqłiqsuqpasi.

english: Heal the sick in that town and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come upon you!’
inupiaq: Iłuaqsiḷugich naŋittuat taavrumani nunaaqqimi, suli uqallautilugich, God-im atanniqsimmataata qallipiaġataġaasi.

english: But whenever you enter a town and the people do not welcome you, go into its streets and say,
inupiaq: Aglaan qakugupayaaq tikitkuvsi nunaaqqimun aasii paġlaŋitpasi, aullaġumausi apqutiŋiññun aasii uqallaglusi,

english: ‘Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this: The kingdom of God has come.’
inupiaq: Avyuŋaunnii nunaaqqiunivsi niviruaq isigaptiŋnun, uvagut tilaktiġikput akiḷḷiḷiutivlugu ilivsiññun. Aglaan una iḷisimasiuŋ, God-im atanniqsimmataata qallipiaġataŋagaluaġaasi.

english: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town!
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, uvluani isivġiġvium, God naglikkutiqałhaaġniaqtuq iñuŋiññun Sodom taavrumaŋŋa nunaaqqimiñ tukkuliiŋitchuamiñ ilivsiññik.

english: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtigirusi ilivsi, Chorazin-miut. Qanutun naglignaqtigimmiusi ilivsi Bethsaida-ġmiut. Qanuq aliuġnaqtuat savaat savaaguruat ilivsiññi savaaguŋakpata Tyre-miḷu Sidon-miḷu, taimaniuvvaa isumalitqikkumiñaŋagaluaqtut annuġaaġlutiŋ miitchuŋnik suli aquppiḷutiŋ aġrani.

english: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you!
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautigivsi, uvluani isivġiġvium isivġiusiaksraŋak Tyre-vlu Sidon-lu tunikił̣haaġniaqtuq ilivsi isivġiusiaksravsiññiñ.

english: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to Hades!
inupiaq: Aasii ilivsi Capernaum-miut, isumavisi tugliqsruutinasugalusi qiḷaŋmun kamanaunmi? Nunaaqqiqsi suksraunġiqsauniaqtuq. Qanuq aliuġnaqtuat savaaguruat iliŋni savaaguŋakpata Sodom-mi, napanayaġaluaqtuq uumuŋaaglaan uvlumun.

english: “The one who listens to you listens to me, and the one who rejects you rejects me, and the one who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, kialiqaa naalaġnigumisi naalaġnimmigaaŋa. Suli kialiqaa pisuŋitchuam ilivsiññik pisuŋiñmigaaŋa. Aasiisuli kialiqaa pisuŋiññamiŋa, pisuŋiñmigaa tiliriga.

english: Then the seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name!”
inupiaq: Utiŋarut 70 iḷitchitqurat quviasuutiqpaqaqłutiŋ, uqaqłutiŋ, Ataniiq ilitqusiqł̣uich unnii kamagigaatigut anittaqaptigik atqiñ atuqługu.

english: So he said to them, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Tautuŋagiga Satan kataktuaq igniġuuqpatittuatun qiḷaŋmiñ.

english: Look, I have given you authority to tread on snakes and scorpions and on the full force of the enemy, and nothing will hurt you.
inupiaq: Uvva, suaŋŋasiŋagivsi tunmaġumiñaqsivḷusi nimiġianun igutchaqpaŋnullu kapputiliŋnun, suli payariyumiñaqsivḷugu iluqaan suaŋŋataa uumigirim, suli sum anniġumiñaitkaasi.

english: Nevertheless, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names stand written in heaven.”
inupiaq: Aglaattauq quviatchakpautiginagu ilitqusiqł̣uich kamaksriñiŋat ilivsiññik, aglaan quviasukpagitchi atisi aglautiŋammata qiḷaŋmi.

english: On that same occasion Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this was your gracious will.
inupiaq: Taavrumani ikarraġmi Ilitqusiġiksuam quviatchaktinniġaa Jesus, aasii uqallaktiłługu, Aapaaŋ, Atanġuruatiin qiḷaŋmun nunamullu, quyyavigigikpiñ tamatkua iriqsimaŋakapkich isumaturuaniñ kaŋiqsisiqaqtuaniḷḷu, aasii satqummiqł̣ugich iñuŋnun ukpiġutiqaqtuanun miqłiqtutun. Aaŋ, Aapaaŋ, taamna piŋagiñ ilivich pisuutigivlugu iviġaumagivlugulu.

english: All things have been given to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, or who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son decides to reveal him.”
inupiaq: Aapama supayaat qaiñŋagai uvamnun, aasii kialiqaa iḷisimaŋitkaa Iġñiq aglaan kisimi Aapam. Kialiqaa suli iḷisimaaġiŋitkaa Aapa aglaan Iġñiġum kisimi, kiapayaaġlu Iġñiġum iḷitchuġipkakkaŋa Aapamik.

english: Then Jesus turned to his disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
inupiaq: Tavrani qiviaqługich iḷitchitqurani Jesus uqallautiŋagai iñuił̣aami, Quviasugitchi tautukavsi tautuavsiññik.

english: For I tell you that many prophets and kings longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.”
inupiaq: Qanuq uqallautigivsi, iñugiaktuat uqaqtiŋisa God-im umialgiḷḷu kipiġniuŋagaluaqtut tautugukługich ilivsi tautukkasi, aasii tautuŋaitkaich, suli tusaayumavlugich sut tusaakkasi, aasii tusaaŋaitkaich.

english: Now an expert in religious law stood up to test Jesus, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
inupiaq: Tavra pitquranik iḷisaurri makinŋaruq uuktuaqsaqługu, apiġivlugu Jesus, Iḷisaurrii, sumik piruksrauvik iñuuyumiñaqsisaġluŋa isuitchuamun?

english: He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you understand it?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Qanuq God-im pitquraŋi iñuutqurivat? Sunik taiguaġuuvich taapkunani?

english: The expert answered, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind, and love your neighbor as yourself.”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagaa, Piviuttaġipiaqsaġiñ Ataniq God-igikkan, piviuttaġilugu iḷuŋniñ, iluqaaniḷu iñuuniaġniġni, iluqaaniḷu piḷġusiġñi, iluqaaniḷu isumaniġni, suli piviuttaġiraksraġigiñ siḷalliñ iliktun iḷiuġlugu.

english: Jesus said to him, “You have answered correctly; do this, and you will live.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Kiggutin nalaunŋaruq. Tainna iñuuniaġiñ aasii iñuuniaqtutin isuitchuamun.

english: But the expert, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurri pitquranik, kipiġniuqłuni patchisaitchukłuni inmiñi, apiġiŋagaa Jesus, Kiuva siḷalliġa?

english: Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell into the hands of robbers, who stripped him, beat him up, and went off, leaving him half dead.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iñuk aullaŋaruq Jerusalem-miñ Jericho-mun. Aasii kasuivḷuni tigligayuktinik, ilaisaasii annuġaiyaŋagaat anaumikł̣ugulu aasii qimakługu tuquanŋuqługu.

english: Now by chance a priest was going down that road, but when he saw the injured man he passed by on the other side.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpak iglaummiñiqsuq tamatkunuuna apqutitigun, aasii tautukamiuŋ ikiḷik iñuk, qaaŋiqsaaŋagaa taavuunatchikun.

english: So too a Levite, when he came up to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli Levite, tikiññami tavruŋa qiñiqtuallakkaluaqamiuŋ, qaaŋiqsaaŋaruq taavuunatchikun.

english: But a Samaritan who was traveling came to where the injured man was, and when he saw him, he felt compassion for him.
inupiaq: Tavrali Samaritan-guruaq, iglauniallaġmi tikiññiqsuq ikiḷiŋmun iñuŋmun, aasii tautukługu nagliksratchaŋaruq.

english: He went up to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring oil and wine on them. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
inupiaq: Aasii ullakługu mamitaqtuŋagai kiḷḷiaġniŋi, kuviġaqługich uqsrumik wine-miglu, aasii qakiłługu kakaktimiñun, qaġġisiŋagaa tukkumaviŋmun, aasii qaunagiaqsivḷugu.

english: The next day he took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper, saying, ‘Take care of him, and whatever else you spend, I will repay you when I come back this way.’
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman tigusiŋaruq malġugnik maniuraŋnik aasii aitchuutigivlugik tukkumavium qaunaksriŋanun uqallautivlugu, Qaunagiyumagiñ, aasii qanutupayaaq maniksuutigigupku, utiqtitchiviginiaġikpiñ utiġuma.

english: Which of these three do you think became a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of the robbers?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagaa, Isummatigiviuŋ nalliat taapkua piŋasut iñuich nalupqinaiqpa siḷalliutilaamiñik iñuŋmun kasuiruamun tigligayuktinik?

english: The expert in religious law said, “The one who showed mercy to him.” So Jesus said to him, “Go and do the same.”
inupiaq: Iḷisaurri pitquranik uqallaŋaruq, Taamna nagliktuiruaq ilaanik. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aullaġlutin tainnatulli piyaqtuġiñ.

english: Now as they went on their way, Jesus entered a certain village where a woman named Martha welcomed him as a guest.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷitchitquraniḷu iglauvlutiŋ suli tikiñŋarut nunaaqqimun. Tavrani aġnam atiqaqtuam Martha-mik paġlaŋagaa aimaaġviŋmiñun.

english: She had a sister named Mary, who sat at the Lord’s feet and listened to what he said.
inupiaq: Aasii aniqatiqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik Mary-mik. Mary aquppiŋaruq sivuġaani Atanġum naalaġnivḷuni iḷisaurrutiŋiñik.

english: But Martha was distracted with all the preparations she had to make, so she came up to him and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do all the work alone? Tell her to help me.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Martha isumanŋutaniŋaruq pisigivlugu atqunaq savaŋnini, aasii ullakługu uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, suliqutigiŋitpiuŋ aniqanma kisima savaurripkaġmaŋa? Tilliuŋ ikayuquluŋa.

english: But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things,
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum kiuŋagaa, Martha, Martha, uŋiarirutin isumaalukpaitchutillu sutigun iñugiaktuatigun.

english: but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the best part; it will not be taken away from her.”
inupiaq: Atausiq piraksraupiaqtuq. Mary-m piksraqtaaġiŋagaa nalaunŋaruaq. Piiġumiñaitchuq ilaaniñ.

english: Now Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he stopped, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷaanni aŋaiyyuŋalgitchuq, aasii aŋaiyyuaniŋman iḷaŋata iḷitchitquraŋisa uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, iḷisauttutigut aŋaiyyuniġmik, John-tuttauq iḷisaurriruatun iḷitchitquraġmiñik aŋaiyyuniġmik.

english: So he said to them, “When you pray, say:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Aŋaiyyuyumausi inna, Aapavut qiḷaŋmiittuatiin, iñuich qiksigilisin. Ilivich Atanniqsimakkich iñupayaat. Ilivich pisuutin taŋŋiqsauli nunami iluqaani qiḷaŋmi pimmatun.

english: Father, may your name be honored;
inupiaq: Aitchuqtigut uvluġaġimman niqiksraptiŋnik.

english: may your kingdom come.
inupiaq: Suli suliqutigiŋaikkich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutivut, qanuqtauq suliqutigiŋaiġuummigivut itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich iñupayaat piḷuutiŋich uvaptiŋnun. Ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtinnatigut, [annautilutalu piḷuktuamiñ.]

english: Give us each day our daily bread,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Nalliqsi avilaitqatiqaqtuaq ullautiyumiñaqpa ilaanun unnuam qitqani aasii uqallautilugu, Avilaitqaan, atukkiñŋa piŋasunik punniġnik,

english: and forgive us our sins,
inupiaq: qanuq amma avilaitqatiga iglaaq tikitchuaq, aasii niqłiqsuutiksraitchuŋa.

english: for we also forgive everyone who sins against us.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan kiulugu tatqamaŋŋamiñ. Iḷaksianaŋa. Upkuaq pitchiġiiyaŋaruq, miqłiqtutkalu uvaŋalu tuttaaŋarugut. Makitiġniaŋitchuŋa aitchuġuglutin supayaamik.

english: And do not lead us into temptation.”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, makitiġniaŋiññiḷuqtum unnii aitchuġuglugu supayaamik avilaitqatigigiññaġniḷugu, aglaan pisigilugu katchuŋaiññiŋa, ilaa makitiġniaqtuq aasii aitchuġlugu qanutupayauraq piqaġuktilaaŋatun.

english: Then he said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuguvsi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi qiññuaqtuġitchi aitchuusiaqaġniaqtusi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi ivaqłiasitchi paqinniaġiksi ivakkaqsi, qapiŋaiḷḷusi tigluktuġitchi aasii upkuiġutiniaġaasi.

english: because a friend of mine has stopped here while on a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’
inupiaq: Qanuq iñupayaaq qiññuaqtuqtuiññaqtuaq aitchuusiaqallaruq, suli ivaqłiatuiññaqtuaq paqitchivḷuni, iñuk suli tigluktuqtuiññaqtuaq upkuiġurriqaġniaqtuq.

english: Then he will reply from inside, ‘Do not bother me. The door is already shut, and my children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’
inupiaq: Iḷasi aapaurut. Iġñisi apiqsrikpata iqaluktuġuglutiŋ, aitchuġniaŋitkisi nimiġiamik.

english: I tell you, even though the man inside will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of the first man’s sheer persistence he will get up and give him whatever he needs.
inupiaq: Naagga apiqsrikpata manniksuġuglutiŋ, aitchuġniaŋitkisi igutchaqpaŋmik kapputiliŋnik.

english: “So I tell you: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilivsi, nakuuŋitkaluaŋŋavsi, aitchuisuurusi nakuuruamik miqłiqtuvsiññun, qanutułhaaq aasii Aapari qiḷaŋmiittuaq aitchuiyumiñaqtigiruq Ilitqusiġiksuamik tamatkunuŋa apiqsriruanun inmiñun.

english: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus anitchiŋaruq ilitqusiqł̣uŋmik uqalaitchuamik. Aasii ilitqusiqł̣uk animman uqalaitchuaq iñuk uqallasiŋaruq, aasii iñuich aliuŋarut.

english: What father among you, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead of a fish?
inupiaq: Tavrali iḷaŋich iñuich uqallaŋarut, Jesus anittairuq ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik suaŋŋataagun Beelzebul, umialgata ilitqusiqł̣uich.

english: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
inupiaq: Allalli uuktuqsiññaqługu apiġiŋagaat aliuġnaqtuamik tautuktitquvlutiŋ qiḷaŋmiñ, iḷisimanaqsisaġlugu God-mun iviġaumagitilaaŋa.

english: If you then, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsrivḷugich isumaŋich, uqallautiŋagai, Nunauruat atinġiqł̣utiŋ aŋuyautikamiŋ inmiŋnun suksraunġiġuurut. Qitunġaġiich atinġiqamiŋ inmiŋni suksraunġiġñiaqtut inmiŋnik.

english: Now he was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon had gone out, the man who had been mute began to speak, and the crowds were amazed.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq Satan ilitqusiqł̣uŋi atinġiġumiŋ piyuutilutiŋ avanmun, Satan suaŋŋataa isukłiññayaqtuq. Ilivsi uqaqtusi anittaiñivḷuŋa ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik suaŋŋataagun Beelzebul.

english: But some of them said, “By the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, he casts out demons.”
inupiaq: Aasii uvaŋa anittaġupkich ilitqusiqł̣uich Beelzebul-kun, kikulli maliġuaqtivsi anittaġuuvatigik? Tavra iliŋich isivġiqsiginiaġisi iḷisimanaqsiḷugu killukuapiaġataqtilaaqsi.

english: Others, to test him, began asking for a sign from heaven.
inupiaq: Tavraaglaan anittaikama ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik suaŋŋataagun God-im, nalupqinaitchuq God-im atanniqsimmataa maaniittuq.

english: But Jesus, realizing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and a divided household falls.
inupiaq: Suaŋaruam iñuum, satkuaġigḷuataqłuni ittuam, munaġigaa igluqpakpani, aasii ilaan suġaliŋi iñuich iḷaksianiaŋitkaich.

english: So if Satan too is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? I ask you this because you claim that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq iñuum saŋŋił̣haaqtuam ilaaniñ aŋuyakpagu payariḷugu, aatchumiñaġaa satkuŋiñik arguaŋŋatigikkaŋiñiglu, autaaġmiḷugich suġaliŋi piqatimiñun.

english: Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
inupiaq: Iñuk piqatauŋitchuaq uvamnun akiḷḷiuruq uvamnun, iñuktun ittuq kivriñaqsimman palauvaksranik, katitchiqataugaluaġnani siavsigiññaqtuatun.

english: But if I cast out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has already overtaken you.
inupiaq: Ilivsi pigiitchuasii iñuuruat paŋmapak ittusi iñuktun ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuatun. Ilitqusiqł̣uk anikami iñuŋmiñ, ilaa kukiḷuktuq imiġitchuakun nunakun ivaqłiavluni piḷaiŋaiqsiaġviksramiñik, aasii paqitchiŋitchuq. Tavraniasii uqallaktuq, Utiġniaqtuŋa iñuŋmun, annivimñun.

english: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his possessions are safe.
inupiaq: Tavra utiqami paqitkaa inigiŋakkani imaiḷaaq, tilaiŋaraatchiaq, sut iłuaqsruqtat.

english: But when a stronger man attacks and conquers him, he takes away the first man’s armor on which the man relied and divides up his plunder.
inupiaq: Tavraasii aullaqłuni qaġġirriruq tallimat malġugnik allanik ilitqusiqł̣ugnik pigiił̣haaqtuanik inmiñiñ, aasii isiqłutiŋ iñuuvigiaqsivḷugu. Tainna pimmata, iñuk taamna pigiiḷił̣haaŋaruq aqulliġmi sivulliġmiñ.

english: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
inupiaq: Taavrumiŋa Jesus uqaġniaqtillugu, aġnaq nivliŋaruq nipatusivḷuni akunġanniñ iñuich uqallakłuni ilaanun, Quviasugli aġnaq taimña aniaqaqtuaq iñukkuksaaqaqtuaġlu iliŋnik.

english: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it passes through waterless places looking for rest but not finding any. Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I left.’
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Quviasułhaaġlich iñuich tusaaruat God-im uqaluŋiññik kamagivlugiḷḷu.

english: When it returns, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.
inupiaq: Iñuich iñugiaksisaiññaaqsimmata, Jesus uqarraqsiŋaruq, Ukua iñuuruat paŋmapak pigiitchuagurut, apiqsrirut aliuġnaqtuamik tautugukłutiŋ nalupqinaiyautiksramik God-mun iviġaumagitilaamnik. Aliuġnaqtuatualuk savaaguniaqtuaq piñiaqtuq Jonah-mun piŋaruatun.

english: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there, so the last state of that person is worse than the first.”
inupiaq: Nineveh-mi iñuuŋaruatitun iḷitchuġivlugu aliuġnaqtuaq God-im Piŋaraŋa Jonah-mun, tainnatun iñuich paŋmapak iñuuruat iḷitchuġiniaqtut God-im aliuġnaqtuamik savaaŋanik Iġñiŋanun iñuum.

english: As he said these things, a woman in the crowd spoke out to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts at which you nursed!”
inupiaq: Isivġiġviŋmi aġnam umialgum akiḷḷiḷiġñiaġai iñuich iñuuruat paŋmapak aasii pasirauyumiñaqsiḷugich. Qanuq ilaa qaiŋaruq uŋallam tuŋaaniñ nunamiñ uŋasiksuamiñ tusaayaqtuqługu isumattutaa Solomon. Uqallautigivsi, aasiimma iñuk maaniittuq kamanałhaaqtuaq Solomon-miñ.

english: But he replied, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it!”
inupiaq: Isivġiġviŋmi iñuŋisa Nineveh-m akiḷḷiḷiġñiaġaasi ilivsi iñuuruasii paŋmapak aasii pasirauyumiñaqsiḷusi, qanuq iliŋich isumalitqiŋavlutiŋ alġaqsruimman Jonah, aasiimma iñuk kamanałhaaqtuaq Jonah-miñ maaniittuq.

english: As the crowds were increasing, Jesus began to say, “This generation is a wicked generation; it looks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa ikitanikamiuŋ qulliq matulaitkaa, naagga inillalaitkaa utkusium ataanun, aglaan iḷisuugaa qulliqaġviŋmun, tamatkua isiqtuat qaummaġiquvlugich.

english: For just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.
inupiaq: Irisi nannisun ittut timivsiññun. Irisi surruitpata tautullagiksi pisuaġviksi. Aglaan irisi inŋitpata surruiḷḷutiŋ, tautukkumiñaitkiksi pisuaġviksi. Tainnatun ittut isumasi. Isumasi surruitpata, iñuulluataġumiñaġniaqtusi.

english: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon – and now, something greater than Solomon is here!
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi kaŋiqsiḷḷuataġuglugu iñuulluataġniksraqsi.

english: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them – and now, something greater than Jonah is here!
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuulluataġuvsi, timisi inniaqtut imaqaqtuatun qaummaġmik, taaqtuamik piiḷḷuni. Kaŋiqsiḷḷuataġniaqtusi, naniqaqtuatun qaummatiksramik iglauviksravsiññun.

english: “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a hidden place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.
inupiaq: Jesus uqaaniŋman taapkuniŋa, Pharisee-m tuyuġmiaqsaŋagaa niġiqatigitquvluni. Tavra isiqłuni aquvinŋaruq niġisaqłutiŋ.

english: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but when it is diseased, your body is full of darkness.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisee allasuŋaruq Jesus iqaġiqqaaġaluaġnagich argagni niġisaġumaaqsimman, tuvraġaluaġnagu Pharisees piḷġusiat.

english: Therefore see to it that the light in you is not darkness.
inupiaq: Tavra Ataniq uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Ilivsiuvva Pharisees salummaisuurusi kisianik qaaŋanik timivsi, salummaġmatun qallugauram, naagga puggutauram qaałhiñaŋa. Aasii piḷḷatupiaġataqtusi, pigiipiaġataqłusiḷu.

english: If then your whole body is full of light, with no part in the dark, it will be as full of light as when the light of a lamp shines on you.”
inupiaq: Isumalluaġiitchuasii. Puttuqsriŋaitpisiuŋsuli God savaŋaruaq iñuich timiŋiññik savaŋatilaaŋaniktauq uummatiŋiññik.

english: As he spoke, a Pharisee invited Jesus to have a meal with him, so he went in and took his place at the table.
inupiaq: Savaaġisigik nagliktuiñisi uummativsiññiñ iluqaaniñ. Tainna piguvsi, iḷisimanaqtinniaġiksi uummativsi salumatilaaŋa.

english: The Pharisee was astonished when he saw that Jesus did not first wash his hands before the meal.
inupiaq: Naglignaqtusiuvva ilivsi Pharisees, qanuq aitchuisuurusi God-mun quliŋŋuġutiŋiññik mikiniqsraqpiatchiat nauriavsi niġiñaqtuat, aasii naluruuraaġisi pitqiksiġautairrullu piviuttaqsriñiġlu God-mik. Taapkuak piraksraġigisi, aasii aitchuimmiḷusi quliŋŋuġutinik.

english: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
inupiaq: Naglignaqtusiuvva ilivsi Pharisees, qanuq aquppiḷḷaturusi kamanaqtuat aquppiutaŋiññi aŋaiyyuviŋñi, paġlalluataquvlusiḷu tauqsiqsuġviŋñi inini.

english: You fools! Didn’t the one who made the outside make the inside as well?
inupiaq: Naglignaqtusiuvva ilivsi Pharisees, qanuq iḷuvviviktun ittusi nalunaiñŋutaitchuatun. Iñuich pisuaġvigikkaŋisun qaaŋatigun naluvlugich, aasii salumaiḷivḷutiŋ pitqurat uqaluatigun. Ukpiŋŋuaġnivsigun asiñuutigisi iñuich.

english: But give from your heart to those in need, and then everything will be clean for you.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata iḷisaurrich pitquranik uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, uqallakkavich tainna pisaaŋammigiptigut.

english: “But woe to you Pharisees! You give a tenth of your mint, rue, and every herb, yet you neglect justice and love for God! But you should have done these things without neglecting the others.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Naglignaqtusi ilivsi iḷisaurrich, qanuq iḷisaurrutisi God-im pitquraŋigun siġḷiġnaqsisuugisi iñuich kamaksriñiksraŋannun iluqaiññik, ikayuġniuraġniaġnagich suuramik-unnii kamagitqulugich God-im pitquraŋi. Ikayulaipiaġisi.

english: Woe to you Pharisees! You love the best seats in the synagogues and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces!
inupiaq: Naglignaqtusi ilivsi, qanuq qaunagilluatapiaġisi iḷuviŋich uqaqtiŋisa God-im, iñuktaġikkaŋisa maŋŋuuvsi.

english: Woe to you! You are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without realizing it!”
inupiaq: Iḷisimaraurusi iviġaumagigisiḷu maŋŋuuvsi pikkaŋich, qanuq ilaisa iñuktaġiŋagaluaġaich, ilivsiḷi qaunagilluataġisi iḷuvviviŋich.

english: One of the experts in religious law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things you insult us too.”
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu God isumaturuaq uqallaŋaruq inna, Tilisiñiaqtuŋa iliŋiññun uqaqtimnik alġaqsruiriñiglu. Iḷaŋich ilaisa iñuktaġiniaġaich, suli nagliksaaqtillugich iḷaŋich.

english: But Jesus replied, “Woe to you experts in religious law as well! You load people down with burdens difficult to bear, yet you yourselves refuse to touch the burdens with even one of your fingers!
inupiaq: God-im tatavsaġniaġaasi iluqasi iñuuruasii paŋmapak, qanuq pasiñaġumiñaqtusi iluqaisigun uqaqtiŋigun God-im, iñuktauruatigun nunaqaŋa isagutimman.

english: Woe to you! You build the tombs of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
inupiaq: Pasiraurusi iluqaisigun nalaunŋaruatigun iñuktauruatigun, Abel-miñqaŋa Zechariah-mun, tuqutauruaq akunġagni ikipkaiviuvlu inivḷu ilaaguaqtauruam God-mun. Uqallautigivsi taavrumiŋa, qanuq iñuktauruat iluqaisa pisigilugich, tatavsaqtauniaqtusi iñuuruasii makkunani uvluni.

english: So you testify that you approve of the deeds of your ancestors, because they killed the prophets and you build their tombs!
inupiaq: Naglignaqtusiuvva ilivsi iḷisaurrich pitquranik. Qanuq ilivsi nalaullugu kaŋiqsiŋaitkiksi, iḷisaurrutigiŋaitkiksiḷu isumattutaa God-im. Ilivsi iñuuŋaitchusi God-im isumattutaagun, aasii piñaiḷutchiqsuġmivḷugich iñuusukkaluaqtuat God-im isumattutaagun.

english: For this reason also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’
inupiaq: Tavra aullaġman tavraŋŋa, iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik Pharisees-lu suammautiniarraqsiŋagaat, suli alapitinnialavlugu apiqsruqtuqługu iñugiaktuanik apiqqutinik.

english: so that this generation may be held accountable for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,
inupiaq: Taamna piŋagaat uqallaktinniaġaluaqługu killukuaŋaruamik, iliŋisa pasisukługu.

english: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
Woe to you experts in religious law! You have taken away the key to knowledge! You did not go in yourselves, and you hindered those who were going in.”
When he went out from there, the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to oppose him bitterly, and to ask him hostile questions about many things,
plotting against him, to catch him in something he might say.

Meanwhile, when many thousands of the crowd had gathered so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
inupiaq: Iñuich iñugiaksiqpapiaġataqłutiŋ iḷimmata katittuat atautchimun tunmautillasiḷaaqamik unnii, Jesus uqautirraqsiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Qaunagisitchi imaksrautiŋiññiñ Pharisees, sivuniġigiga ukpiŋŋuaġutaat.

english: Nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known.
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiŋŋuaġun satqummiġumaaqtuq, iriqsimagaluaġumi paŋmapak.

english: So then whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in private rooms will be proclaimed from the housetops.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq ilivsi iḷumun ittuq, sunapayaaq iñuił̣aami uqallautigikkaqsi satqummiġñiaġmiuq. Suli isivruutigikkaqsi inaurani quliaqtuaguniaqtuq iglut qaaŋiññiñ.

english: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have nothing more they can do.
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, uvaŋa avilaitqatiitkaa, sivuuġaginagich tuqutchiruat timimik, taavruma aquagun sunnikkumiñaitchuat.

english: But I will warn you whom you should fear: Fear the one who, after the killing, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him!
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva kilikkivsi sivuuġagiraksravsiññik. Sivuuġagisiuŋ God, tuqupkaiganikami suaŋŋatiqaqtuaq nagliksaaġviŋmuktitchiyumiñaqłuni. Aaŋ, uqallautigivsi, sivuuġagisiuŋ.

english: Aren’t five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten before God.
inupiaq: Tallimat tiŋmiaġruurat tuniñaitpat malġugnun maniuraŋnun? Aasiuvva atausiq unnii iḷaŋat God-im piigulaitkaa.

english: In fact, even the hairs on your head are all numbered. Do not be afraid; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
inupiaq: Nutchasiunnii niaquvsiññiittuat kisisaaqtaurut. Tavraasii iqsiñasi, akisułhamaaqtusi iñugiaktuaniñ unnii tiŋmiaġruuraniñ.

english: “I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before God’s angels.
inupiaq: Aasii uqallautigivsi, kialiqaa quliaqtuaġigumiŋa iñuŋnun piginiḷuni uvamnun, Iġñiŋattauq iñuum tainnatun quliaqtuaġiniaġmigaa isaġuliŋiñun God-im.

english: But the one who denies me before men will be denied before God’s angels.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq kialiqaa piiḷaaġikpaŋa iñuŋnun pigiŋiññiḷuni uvamnun, Iġñiŋataptauq iñuum piiḷaaġiniaġmigaa isaġuliŋiñun God-im.

english: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the person who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
inupiaq: Suli kiñapayaaq uqallakkumi pigiitchuamik Iġñiŋagun iñuum, suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaqtuq itqaumayumiñaiġḷugu, aglaan kiñaliqaa uqallaktuaq pigiitchuamik Ilitqusiġiksuakun, suliqutigiŋaiqsauyumiñaitchuq.

english: But when they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, do not worry about how you should make your defense or what you should say,
inupiaq: Aasii qaġġisikpasi isivġiġuglusi Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviŋiññun kavanauruallu atanaurallu, uŋiariñasi isumalusi sumik kiggutiksravsiññik, naagga patchisaiññiksravsiññik.

english: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that moment what you must say.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Ilitqusiġiksuam iḷisautiniaġaasi taavrumani ikarraġmi sunik uqaqtuksrautilaavsiññik.

english: Then someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata iñusalaich uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷisaurrii, uqallauttuuŋ aniqatiga autaaqatigitquluŋa kiŋuvaannaktaaksrautiptiŋnik.

english: But Jesus said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or arbitrator between you two?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iñuuk, kia isivġiqsiġuqpaŋa naagga autaaqtiliutivluŋalu suġautavsiññun.

english: Then he said to them, “Watch out and guard yourself from all types of greed, because one’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iñuich, Qaunagisitchi piḷḷatuvaił̣aŋniġmiñ, qanuq iñuk suġallakkaluaqami unnii sippakuutaallasivḷuni suġaliŋisa iñuggutiksriḷaitkaat.

english: He then told them a parable: “The land of a certain rich man produced an abundant crop,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uuktuunmik uqaqłuni, Nunaŋa iñuum suġalliruam nauriqpaŋaruq.

english: so he thought to himself, ‘What should I do, for I have nowhere to store my crops?’
inupiaq: Aasii isumaŋaruq, Sulaŋatuġuvaŋa, qanuq uvva tutquqsiviksraitkaqsiruŋa sumun nauriamnik.

english: Then he said, ‘I will do this: I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
inupiaq: Tavra uqallaŋaruq, Innauvva piñiaqtuŋa. Iguminniaġitka suġalliqpitka, aasii nappaiḷuŋa aŋiłhaaqtuanik, aasii tavruŋa tutquġlugich palauvaksrat nauriatka, iluqaisalu suġalitka.

english: And I will say to myself, “You have plenty of goods stored up for many years; relax, eat, drink, celebrate!”’
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautiniaqtuŋa uvamnun, Piḷḷuataqtuŋaasuuvaŋa. Iḷaŋaniñ suġaliġmik tutquqsiruŋa ukiuksranun iñugiaktuanun. Siġġaqiŋaiġḷaŋa, niġiugaġlaŋa, imiġluŋalu, aliasuŋiḷḷuŋalu.

english: But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded back from you, but who will get what you have prepared for yourself?’
inupiaq: Tavrali God-im uqallautiŋagaa suġalliruaq, Isumalluaġiitchuatiin. Unnuapak iñuggutaiqsauniaqtutin, aasii kia piginiaqpagich suġalġich katitatin?

english: So it is with the one who stores up riches for himself, but is not rich toward God.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uuktuun aġiusausiŋagaa, uqallakłuni, Tainnauvva iñuk ittuq nulauksiruaq suġaliġnik piksramiñik, ukpiġigaluaġnagu God.

english: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat, or about your body, what you will wear.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Taapkuniŋa uqallautigivsi, uŋiarrisiginagu iñuggurri, sumik niġiñiaqtilaaksraqsi, naaggaunnii sumik annuġaaġniaqtilaavsiññik.

english: For there is more to life than food, and more to the body than clothing.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuggun naumałhaaqtuq niqiksraqsiuqsiññaġniġmiñ, timisuli naumałhaaqtuq annuġaaniñ.

english: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn, yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than the birds!
inupiaq: Qiñiqsigik tulukkat. Kanġaqsruiḷaitchut nautchiaksranik kivriḷaitchullu. Suġalliqpiitchut, tutquqsiviiñmiut, naaggauvva God-im niġipkaqsimaaġai. Ilivsi akisułhaaqtusi tiŋmianiñ.

english: And which of you by worrying can add an hour to his life?
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi nalliqsi iñuuniqtusiḷaaġumiñaitchuq uŋiarigiññaġluni.

english: So if you cannot do such a very little thing as this, why do you worry about the rest?
inupiaq: Tavraasii piḷḷayumiñaiññiġuvsiuŋ tainnatun mikitigiruaqunnii, summan uŋiarrisaġivisigik tamatkua.

english: Consider how the flowers grow; they do not work or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these!
inupiaq: Qiñiqsigik nauriat qanuq nausuutilaaŋat, siġġaqilaitchut annuġarriulaitchullu, uqallautigivsi naaggauvva Solomon unnii qanutun kamanaqtigigaluaqłuni annuġaaŋaitchuq atautchisun-unnii tamatkunatun nauriatun qiñiyunaqtigiliġḷuni.

english: And if this is how God clothes the wild grass, which is here today and tomorrow is tossed into the fire to heat the oven, how much more will he clothe you, you people of little faith!
inupiaq: Tainnatun God-im qaunagillaniqpagich nauriallu ivgiḷḷu uvlupałhiñaq nauruat aasii uvlaakun qirriutivlugich igniġviŋmun, nalupqinaitchuq annuġaaksraqaqtinniaġaasi. Qanutun ilivsi ukpiġutikisigirusi.

english: So do not be overly concerned about what you will eat and what you will drink, and do not worry about such things.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uŋiariñasi. Apiqsruqtuġnasi inna, sumik niġiñiaqpisa? Sumik imiġniaqpisa? Uŋiarrisiqaġnasi.

english: For all the nations of the world pursue these things, and your Father knows that you need them.
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiŋaitchuat mattumani nunami piññagnialarut iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa. Aapari iḷisimaruq ilivsiññun pigiraksraġitilaaŋannik tamatkua.

english: Instead, pursue his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.
inupiaq: Tavraasii piqaqtinniaġaasi iluqaiññik tamatkuniŋa ilivsi atanniqsimapkaqqaaġuvsi God-mun.

english: “Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father is well pleased to give you the kingdom.
inupiaq: Iqsiñasi iñukitchuasii imnaich, qanuq Aapari iviġaumaruq atanniqsimasukłusi aasii qaunagilusi.

english: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide yourselves purses that do not wear out – a treasure in heaven that never decreases, where no thief approaches and no moth destroys.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tunisigik suġalisi, aasii nagliktuutigilugich. Tainna piguvsi maniqaġviqaġmatun maqulaitchuanik inniaqtusi, suġaliqaġmatun qiḷaŋmi nuŋulaiḷaanik. Tatpagmani tigligayuktit piyumiñaitkaich, qupilġullu maqunniaŋitkaich.

english: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
inupiaq: Qanuq irvianni suġaliqpich, tavraniitchugniaġmiutin.

english: “Get dressed for service and keep your lamps burning;
inupiaq: Itqanaitchitchi annuġaaqtummaġiksaaŋalusi, nannisi ikumalugich, ataramik niġiugilugu Ataniqsi utiġumaaqtuaq.

english: be like people waiting for their master to come back from the wedding celebration, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.
inupiaq: Irrusiqaġlusi kivgatun niġiuktuatun ataniġmiŋnik aiyumaaqtuamik niqinaqiruaniñ katirrusiqivlutiŋ, upkuiġutiyumavlugu tavrauvvaa qaiḷuni tigluktuqpan.

english: Blessed are those slaves whom their master finds alert when he returns! I tell you the truth, he will dress himself to serve, have them take their place at the table, and will come and wait on them!
inupiaq: Quviasuglich taapkua kivgat atanġata paqinniakkaŋi itqumalugich qaigumi. Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ilaa qalliġñik annuġaaġiksuanik annuġaagiyaġluni aquvitillugich niġġiviŋñun, niqłiqsuġniaġai.

english: Even if he comes in the second or third watch of the night and finds them alert, blessed are those slaves!
inupiaq: Qanutun quviasuglich kivgat Atanġata iḷitchuġikkaŋi itqanaił̣ł̣ugich unnuam qitqani naagga aksraksaaġaluaqpan.

english: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.
inupiaq: Una suli iḷisimalugu. Igluqpiraqti iḷisimaŋagumi suqpatigun tigligayukti siqumutiluni qaiñiaqtilaaŋanik, isiqtinnayaitkaa.

english: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.”
inupiaq: Ilivsivsauq itqanaitchitchi, qanuq Iġñiŋa iñuum qaiñiaqtuq ikarrami niġiugvigiŋisavsiññi.

english: Then Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable for us or for everyone?”
inupiaq: Peter uqallaŋaruq, Ataniiq, quliaqtuaġiviuŋ taamna uuktuun sivuniġivluta naagga sivuniġivlugich iñupayaat?

english: The Lord replied, “Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his household servants, to give them their allowance of food at the proper time?
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum kiuŋagaa, kiuniaqpaasii ukpiġnaqtuaguvluni isumaturuaguvluniḷu kivgaq? Taamnauniaqtuq kivgaq atanġata qaukłiḷiutiniakkaŋa allanun kivganun niqiksritqulutiŋ piñaqsikpan.

english: Blessed is that slave whom his master finds at work when he returns.
inupiaq: Quviasugli taamna kivgaq atanġata qaigumi paqinniaqtaŋa tainna savaktuagulugu.

english: I tell you the truth, the master will put him in charge of all his possessions.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ilaan atanġata atanniutiniaġaa iluqaiññun suġaliġmiñun.

english: But if that slave should say to himself, ‘My master is delayed in returning,’ and he begins to beat the other slaves, both men and women, and to eat, drink, and get drunk,
inupiaq: Tavraaglaan taamna kivgaq isummiġumi, Ataniġa qaiḷḷaiġutiruq, aasii anaumiaqsiḷugich aŋutit kivgat aġnallu kivgat, niġivḷuni imiqłuniḷu imiŋasivḷuniḷu.

english: then the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not foresee, and will cut him in two, and assign him a place with the unfaithful.
inupiaq: Atanġa taavruma kivgam qaiñiaqtuq uvlumi ilaanun niġiugvigiŋisaŋani suli kisumi ikarraġmi nalukkaŋani, aasii tatavsapiaġataġniaġaa, piqasiutilugu kamakkutaitchuanun.

english: That servant who knew his master’s will but did not get ready or do what his master asked will receive a severe beating.
inupiaq: Aasii taamna kivgaq iḷisimaŋagaluaqłuni ataniġmi pisuutaanik, aasii itqanaiyaŋitchuaq kamagiŋił̣ł̣ugulu pisuutaa ataniġmi, ipiġaqtuusiaqapalugniaqtuq.

english: But the one who did not know his master’s will and did things worthy of punishment will receive a light beating. From everyone who has been given much, much will be required, and from the one who has been entrusted with much, even more will be asked.
inupiaq: Aglaan kivgaq naluruaq ataniġmi piraksriutaanik, pigaluaqtuaq ipiġaqtuusiaqaġnaġumiñaqtuamik, ipiġaqtuusiaqapiaġniaŋitchuq. Iñupayaaq savaaksriusiaqpaqaqtuaq Atanġum niġiugviginiaġaa tainnatun pitqulugu, suli iñupayaaq savaaksriusiaqavsaaqtuaq niġiugvigirauvsaaġniaġmiuq tainnatuttauq pitqulugu.

english: “I have come to bring fire on the earth – and how I wish it were already kindled!
inupiaq: Nunamuŋaruŋa isumaaluutauyyaqłuŋa. Qaiñiġa ittuq igniqsuġmatun nunamun, ami igniq ikuallaaniquyumagaluaġiga.

english: I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is finished!
inupiaq: Nalautchaagaksraġigitka isumaaluutit paptaiġutigimmatun piḷugich, aasii qanutun iłuiḷḷiuġutigisaġataġitka pilluŋniŋannun aglaan.

english: Do you think I have come to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division!
inupiaq: Isumavisi nunamuŋanasugaluŋa atisipkaġiaqsaqługich iñuich? Naagga, uqallautigivsi, qaiŋaruŋa atinġiġiaqługich.

english: For from now on there will be five in one household divided, three against two and two against three.
inupiaq: Qanuq paŋmapaŋmiñ aglaan iglumi atautchimi tallimat atinġiġñiaqtut, piŋasut akiḷḷiulutiŋ malġugnun, suli malġuk piŋasunun.

english: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
inupiaq: Atinġiġñiaqtut aapa iġñiġmun suli iġñiq aapamun, aaka paniŋmiñun suli paniuruaq aakamiñun, aakaruaq ukuamiñun suli ukuaguruaq aakaruamiñun.

english: Jesus also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you say at once, ‘A rainstorm is coming,’ and it does.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋammigai iñusalaich, Tautukavsiuŋ nuvuya nausaġataqtuaq ualiñaami, uqallagnasaalaitchusi sialuguġniaġaa, taimmaasii sialuguġuuruq.

english: And when you see the south wind blowing, you say, ‘There will be scorching heat,’ and there is.
inupiaq: Suli tautukavsiuŋ uŋalaq anuqłiqsuaq, uqallagmiraqtusi, pasigñaqsiḷuguunnii uunnaġuġniaġaa, taimmaasii uunnaġuġuuruq.

english: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how can you not know how to interpret the present time?
inupiaq: Ilivsi ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii, iḷisimagaluaqtusi siḷaksramik qiññaŋagun nunam qiḷauvlu, aglaan kaŋiqsiḷaiññiġiksi suliqitilaaġa.

english: “And why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
inupiaq: Summan aasii kaŋiqsiḷaitpisi ilivsiññik, sum nalaunŋatilaaŋanik piraksravsi?

english: As you are going with your accuser before the magistrate, make an effort to settle with him on the way, so that he will not drag you before the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
inupiaq: Iñuum pasikpasi pitquratigun aasii aullautilusi uqaqsitaaġviŋmun, atisiqatiginiḷuksiuŋ pasiriksi uqaqsitaaġviŋmullavsi. Iḷaanni aitchuutigiviaġaasi isivġiqsimun, aasiiḷi isivġiqsim aitchuutigilusi tigurimun, aasii tigurim tigutaaġviŋmuglusi.

english: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid the very last cent!”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, aniḷġataġumiñaitchusi tigutaaġviŋmiñ akiḷiġaluaġnagich akiḷiaksrapayaurasi.

english: Now there were some present on that occasion who told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
inupiaq: Jesus uqaġataviksillugu iñuich tavraniinŋarut. Iḷaŋisa uqallautiŋagaat Jesus Galilee-ġmiutigun Pilate tuqunŋaraŋigun aitchuipkaqtillugich ikipkautinik God-mun, auŋich iḷḷativlugich niġrutit auŋiññun.

english: He answered them, “Do you think these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered these things?
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiuŋagai, Isumavisi taapkua Galilee-ġmiut piḷułhaaġasugalugich iluqaiññiñ Galilee-ġmiuniñ, tainna tuqutaummata?

english: No, I tell you! But unless you repent, you will all perish as well!
inupiaq: Naumi, aglaalli uqallautigivsi, ilivsi isumalitqiŋisuaġuvsi iluqasi, tainnatun suksraunġiġñiaġmiusi.

english: Or those eighteen who were killed when the tower in Siloam fell on them, do you think they were worse offenders than all the others who live in Jerusalem?
inupiaq: Qanuqtauq aasii taipkua 18-guruat kattaqikkaŋi nasiqsruġviata Siloam tuqułługich, Isummatigivisigik piḷułhaaqłutiŋ tuqutaunasugalugich iluqaiññiñ iñuuruaniñ Jerusalem-mi?

english: No, I tell you! But unless you repent you will all perish as well!”
inupiaq: Naumi. Uqallautigivsi, ilivsivsauq isumalitqiŋisuaġuvsi iluqasi, tainnatun suksraunġiġñiaġmiusi.

english: Then Jesus told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came looking for fruit on it and found none.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uumiŋa uuktuunmik sivuniġivlugu uqautigianikkani. Iñuk fig napaaqtuanik nautchirriŋaruq siiġñaqaġviŋmiñun, aasii qaivḷuni ivaqłiavigiŋagaa siiġñanik aasii paqinŋaitchuq.

english: So he said to the worker who tended the vineyard, ‘For three years now, I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and each time I inspect it I find none. Cut it down! Why should it continue to deplete the soil?’
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagaa napaaqtumik qaunaksri, Uvva, piŋasuni ukiuni ullaguugaluaġiga ivaqłiavluŋa siiġñanik mattumaŋŋa fig napaaqtuaniñ, aasii paqilaitchuŋa. Kippuuŋ. Summan nunaiġutchautauniaqpa?

english: But the worker answered him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year too, until I dig around it and put fertilizer on it.
inupiaq: Tavra qaunaksrim napaaqtunik kiuŋagaa, Aŋuun, iḷaksianagu ukiivsaallagli. Nivaŋniaqtuŋa avataagun aasii iḷḷiqilugu nagguksautinik.

english: Then if it bears fruit next year, very well, but if not, you can cut it down.’”
inupiaq: Aasii siiġñikpan ukiutqigu piḷḷuataġniaqtuq, aglaan siiġñiŋiḷgitpan, kipiyumiñaġniaġiñ.

english: Now he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath,
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋanni Jew-guruat savaiññiŋata Jesus iḷisaurriŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋmi.

english: and a woman was there who had been disabled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten herself up completely.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraniinŋaruq aġnaq ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuaq naŋititchiruamik ilaanik 18 ukiuni. Taamna aġnaq isivilaiñŋaniqsuq tainnatun sivisutigiruamik.

english: When Jesus saw her, he called her to him and said, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamiuŋ aġnaq, ququaŋagaa aasii uqallautivlugu, Aġnaaq, atanġiqsitaurutin naŋirrutiŋniñ.

english: Then he placed his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aksiŋagaa aġnaq, aasii tavrauvvaa isivvaġiksiŋaruq, suli nanġaŋagaa God.

english: But the president of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the crowd, “There are six days on which work should be done! So come and be healed on those days, and not on the Sabbath day.”
inupiaq: Tavrali umialiŋnaŋa aŋaiyyuvium, piavsaŋaruq pisigivlugu Jesus iłuaqsiriñiŋa Jew-guruat savaiññiŋanni. Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai iñuich, Itchaksrat uvlut ittut savagviksravut, qairaġutitchi taapkunani uvluni iłuaqsirauyaqtuġlusi, savaiññiġum uvluŋiḷaaŋiñi.

english: Then the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from its stall, and lead it to water?
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum kiuŋagaa, Ilivsi ukpiŋŋuaqtuasii, atausiullaavlusi savaitchuani pituiqł̣ugich qimuktisi naagga kakaktisi niġrutiqaġviŋmiñ tasikuaqługich imiqtitchaqtuġuugisi savaitchuani.

english: Then shouldn’t this woman, a daughter of Abraham whom Satan bound for eighteen long years, be released from this imprisonment on the Sabbath day?”
inupiaq: Aasiiḷivsauq una aġnaq, Abraham kiŋuniŋa, Satan-gum nagliksaaqtinŋaraŋa 18 ukiuni, atanġiqsitaksrauŋitpa nagliksaaqtitauniŋaniñ savaitchuani?

english: When he said this all his adversaries were humiliated, but the entire crowd was rejoicing at all the wonderful things he was doing.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġimmagu iluqaġmiŋ akiḷḷiḷiqsuqtiŋi kanŋutchaŋarut aasiiḷi iñuich iluqaġmiŋ quviasukpaŋarut pisigivlugich iluqaisa quvianaqtuat sut ilaan savaaġiŋaraŋi.

english: Thus Jesus asked, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what should I compare it?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Sutun itpa God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun? Sumik uuktuusiġñiaqpigu nausaiññaġniŋa?

english: It is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the wild birds nested in its branches.”
inupiaq: Arriqaqtuq mustard-mik nautchiaksramik mikiniqsrapiaġataŋannik nautchiaksrat. Nunaliqirim nautchirriutigaa nunamiñun, kanġaqsruutigivlugu nautchiaqaġviŋmiñun, aasii nauŋaruq napaaqtuqpaġuqłuni, aasii tiŋmiat ugluliuqłutiŋ qisiqsiutiŋiñun.

english: Again he said, “To what should I compare the kingdom of God?
inupiaq: Suli Jesus uqallatqiŋaruq, Sutun itpa God-im atanniqsimmataata nausaiññaġniŋa?

english: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all the dough had risen.”
inupiaq: Arriqaqtuq imaksratun aġnam akutaŋatun palauvaŋmun. Imaksram puvlaktitkaa iluqaan akutaq.

english: Then Jesus traveled throughout towns and villages, teaching and making his way toward Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Jesus iglauŋaruq nunaaqqisigun nunaaqqiuratigullu iḷisaurrivḷuni, suli iglauvluni tuŋaanun Jerusalem.

english: Someone asked him, “Lord, will only a few be saved?” So he said to them,
inupiaq: Tavra iñuum uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, annaurrauruat iñukitchumaaqpat? Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai,

english: “Exert every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.
inupiaq: Isiġniaġniq qiḷaŋmun ittuq isiġniataŋmatun kapittuakun isiġiakun. Isiġniḷupiaġitchi kapittuakun isiġiakun, qanuq uqallautigivsi, iñugiaktuat isiġniaqsaaniaġaluaqtut isiġumiñaiññiaqtut.

english: Once the head of the house gets up and shuts the door, then you will stand outside and start to knock on the door and beg him, ‘Lord, let us in!’ But he will answer you, ‘I don’t know where you come from.’
inupiaq: Taimanigu piñiaqtuq iñuktun igluqpiraqtuatun makinniaqtuatun aasii umiglugu upkuaq. Upkuaqpagu makitasaġataġniaqtusi siḷami aasii tigluktuaqsiḷusi upkuamun uqaġlusi, Ataniiq, upkuiġuttutigut. Ilaan kiuniaġaasi, Nalugivsi sumiŋŋaqtuagutilaavsiññik.

english: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
inupiaq: Tavraasii kiuniaġiksi, Niġisuusugaugut imiqłutalu piqatigivlutin, suli iḷisaurrivḷutin nunaaqqivsiŋni.

english: But he will reply, ‘I don’t know where you come from! Go away from me, all you evildoers!’
inupiaq: Ilaa uqallatqigñiaqtuq, Uqallautigivsi, nalugivsi sumiñ qairuagutilaavsiññik. Aullaġitchi uvamniñ, iluqasi piḷuusiqirit.

english: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God but you yourselves thrown out.
inupiaq: Tavrani qianiaqtusi suli tiriqtillugich kigutisi, tautukkuvsiuŋ Abraham Isaac-lu Jacob-lu iluqaisalu uqaqtiŋi God-im atanniqsimaviani God-im, ilivsiḷi siḷamiutaupkaġlusi.

english: Then people will come from east and west, and from north and south, and take their places at the banquet table in the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: Suli iñuich qaiñiaqtut nunapayauraniñ aasii aquvitqataulutiŋ niġġiviŋñun God-im atanniqsimaviani.

english: But indeed, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii, iḷaŋich aqulliurut paŋmapak isiqqaaġniaqtuat qiḷaŋmun, suli iḷaŋich sivulliurut aqulliuniaqtuat.

english: At that time, some Pharisees came up and said to Jesus, “Get away from here, because Herod wants to kill you.”
inupiaq: Taavrumanipiallak ikarraġmi iḷaŋich Pharisees qaiŋarut, aasii uqallautivlugu Jesus, Aullaġiñ maaŋŋa, qanuq amma Herod tuqutchukkaatin.

english: But he said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Look, I am casting out demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will complete my work.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Aullaġlusi uqallautiyaqtuqsiuŋ taamamna pisukkaaq, anittaiñiḷuŋa ilitqusiqł̣uŋnik suli iłuaqsiriñiḷuŋa naŋirrutinik uvlupak uvlaakullu, aasii uvluk piŋayuaŋni naallugu savaaġa.

english: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, because it is impossible that a prophet should be killed outside Jerusalem.’
inupiaq: Iglauruksraupiaqtuŋa Jerusalem-mun uvlupak uvlaakullu uŋaliagullu, qanuq uqaqtaa God-im tuqutauruksrauŋitchuq uniuġlugu Jerusalem.

english: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have longed to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would have none of it!
inupiaq: Jerusalem-miut. Yaqhii Jerusalem-miuguruasii, tuquġairuasii uqaqtiŋiñik God-im uyaġagniglu miḷḷuuqługich tamatkua God-im tiliraŋi iliŋnun. Qanutun akulaisigilugu katitchumiñaġaluaġaġigivsi iluqasi atautchimun, tiŋmiatun katitchiruatun piayaamiñik isaqquŋmi ataaŋnun, aasii tainna pitqulaitchusi.

english: Look, your house is forsaken! And I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
inupiaq: Uvva, iglusi suksraaqtaupiallaŋniaqtut. Aasii uqallautigivsi, taututqikkumiñaitkivsiŋa uqallakkumiñaqsiḷġataġlusi, God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ iñuk qairuaq pisivlugu Ataniq.

english: Now one Sabbath when Jesus went to dine at the house of a leader of the Pharisees, they were watching him closely.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋanni Jew-guruat savairvianni, Jesus niġiqatauyaqtuġman igluanun atanaurauruam iḷauvluni Pharisee-ñun, iñuich Jesus naipiqtupiaŋagaat.

english: There right in front of him was a man suffering from dropsy.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani, iñuk qaiŋaruq Jesus-mun immaqaġniqsuaq iluqaani timimiñi.

english: So Jesus asked the experts in religious law and the Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai pitquranik iḷisaurrich Pharisee-ḷḷu, uqallakłuni, Nalaunŋava iłuaqsiriruni Savaiññiġmi, naagga nalaunŋaitpa?

english: But they remained silent. So Jesus took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
inupiaq: Tavra kiuŋaitkaat. Tavraniasii Jesus aksiuŋagaa naŋittuaq aasii iłuaqsivḷugu aullaqtiłługulu.

english: Then he said to them, “Which of you, if you have a son or an ox that has fallen into a well on a Sabbath day, will not immediately pull him out?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iñuich, Nalliqsi iġñiqaġumi naagga qimuktiqaġumi kataktuamik nivviamun savaiññivsiññi, tavrauvvaa nuqitchaqtuġniaŋitpauŋ?

english: But they could not reply to this.
inupiaq: Iliŋisa kiuŋaitkaat taavrumuuna.

english: Then when Jesus noticed how the guests chose the places of honor, he told them a parable. He said to them,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷitchuġivlugich iḷaŋich aiyugaaqtauruat, iniksraqtuqtuat inigigñiqsranik, quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uuktuunmik iluqaisa.

english: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, because a person more distinguished than you may have been invited by your host.
inupiaq: Qakuguliqaa aiyugaaqpasi katirrusiqivlutiŋ niqinaqiruat, aquvinnasi inigigñiqsramun. Iḷaanni naumalluktuat ilivsiññiñ aiyugaaŋaviaġmigai.

english: So the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then, ashamed, you will begin to move to the least important place.
inupiaq: Aasii taimma taavruma aiyugaaqłiŋaruam iluqavsiññik ullaglusi uqallautilusi, Iniksritchiuŋ una iñuk, taimaasii ilivsi kanŋutchautigillaan inillaaqsiḷusi kamanaiññiqsramun inimun.

english: But when you are invited, go and take the least important place, so that when your host approaches he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up here to a better place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who share the meal with you.
inupiaq: Aglaan aiyugaaqtauguvsi, aquvitchumausi kamanaiññiqsramun inimun, taavruma aiyugaaqtivsi qaiḷuni uqallautiyumagaasi, Avilaitqaan, qaiḷaaġiñ inigipayaamun. Tavraniasii kamanaqsiḷaaqtauniaqtutin takkuanni iluqaġmiŋ aiyugaaqtauruat.

english: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñaliqaa kamanaqsiḷiqtuaq inmiñik kamanaiqsauniaqtuq, suli kiñaliqaa kamasaaŋitchuaq inmiñi kamanaqsiḷiqtauniaqtuq.

english: He said also to the man who had invited him, “When you host a dinner or a banquet, don’t invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors so you can be invited by them in return and get repaid.
inupiaq: Jesus suli uqallautiŋagaa aiyugaaqtini, Niġipkaiguvich naagga niqinaqurriguvich, aiyugaaġnagich avilaitqatitin naagga aniqatiitin, naagga nanmiñiq iḷatin naagga suġalliruat siḷallisin, ilaisaptauq aiyugaaqpiaġmigaatin paaqłiqsaġlutin.

english: But when you host an elaborate meal, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.
inupiaq: Aglaan niqinaqurriguvich, aiyugaakkich iḷiappaich, qilluutituqtuat, tusiattuat, ayauŋaruat,

english: Then you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you, for you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”
inupiaq: aasii quviatchaktitauniaqtutin, qanuq ilaisa paaqłiġumiñaitkaatin. Tavra God-im paaqłiġñiaġaatin aŋikpata tuqqunmiñ nalaunŋaruat.

english: When one of those at the meal with Jesus heard this, he said to him, “Blessed is everyone who will feast in the kingdom of God!”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋata niġġiviŋñi aquppiqatauruam Jesus-mun tusaakamiuŋ taamna, uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Quviasuglich iñuich niġiyumiñaġniaqtuat God-im atanniqsimaviani.

english: But Jesus said to him, “A man once gave a great banquet and invited many guests.
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus kiuŋagaa uuktuusiqł̣uni, Iñuk iḷaanni niqinaqusiuqpaŋaruq, aasii aiyugaaqługich iñugiaktuat iñuich.

english: At the time for the banquet he sent his slave to tell those who had been invited, ‘Come, because everything is now ready.’
inupiaq: Tavra piñaqsimman niqinaqiniksraq, ilaan tiliŋagaa kivgani uqallautitquvlugich aiyugaaqtauŋaruat, Qaiñaqsigaasi. Supayaat paŋmapak itqanaiqsut.

english: But one after another they all began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go out and see it. Please excuse me.’
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ atisivḷutiŋ patchisiqsurraqsiŋarut. Sivulliq uqallaŋaruq kivgamun, Nunasiŋaruŋa, aullaqtuksraupiaqtuŋa tautugiaġlugu. Apiġigikpiñ suliqutiginaŋa.

english: Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going out to examine them. Please excuse me.’
inupiaq: Allasuli uqallaŋaruq, Tauqsiŋaruŋa tallimaiñik igḷugiiñik qimuktinik, aullaqtuksrauruŋa uuktuaġiaġlugich. Apiġigikpiñ suliqutiginaŋa.

english: Another said, ‘I just got married, and I cannot come.’
inupiaq: Allasuli uqallaŋaruq, Nuliaqqammiqsuŋa. Taamna pisigivlugu, aiyugaaqtauyumiñaitchuŋa.

english: So the slave came back and reported this to his master. Then the master of the household was furious and said to his slave, ‘Go out quickly to the streets and alleys of the city, and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
inupiaq: Tavra kivgam utiqami quliaqtuaġiŋagai taapkua ataniġmiñun. Tavrani atanġa iglum qinnaliŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni kivgamiñun, Aullaġiñ qilamik apqutiŋiñun apqugauraŋiñullu iniqpaum, aasii qaġġisilugich iḷiappauruat qilluutituqtuallu ayauŋaruallu tusiattuallu.

english: Then the slave said, ‘Sir, what you instructed has been done, and there is still room.’
inupiaq: Tavra kivgam utiqami uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, piraksriutin pianiktuq, aasii iniqaqtuq suli.

english: So the master said to his slave, ‘Go out to the highways and country roads and urge people to come in, so that my house will be filled.
inupiaq: Tavra atanġa uqallaŋaruq kivgamun, Aullavsaaġiñ apqutinun apqugauranullu siḷataanun iniqpaum aasii araglugich iñuich qaipkakkich, igluga siḷivitchumauq iñuŋnik.

english: For I tell you, not one of those individuals who were invited will taste my banquet!’”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, nalliat unnii taipkua aiyugaaqtaugaluaqtuat niġiyumiñaiññiaqtut niqinaqusiuqtamnik. Tainna piñiaġmiuq God-im atanniqsimaviani.

english: Now large crowds were accompanying Jesus, and turning to them he said,
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñusalaich iglauqasiŋagaat Jesus, aasii ilaan kiŋiaqługich uqallautiŋagai,

english: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa qairuaq uvamnun iḷitchitquraġiyumiñaitkiga piviuttaġiłhaaġumiñaitpaŋa ilaan aapamiñiñ, aakamiñiḷḷu, nuliamiñiḷḷu, miqłiqtumiñiḷḷu, aniqatiimiñiḷḷu, inmiñiñunniiḷu.

english: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa iqsriutiŋitkumiuŋ aŋarraurani tuqutauyumaliġḷuniunnii pisigiluŋa, nalliummatiŋitchuq iḷitchitqurauyumiñaġluni uvamnun.

english: For which of you, wanting to build a tower, doesn’t sit down first and compute the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?
inupiaq: Qanuq nalliqsi, nappaiyumaalliġumi nasiqsruġviŋmik, aquptaaġluni kisitchiqqaaġniaŋitpa qanutun akisutilaaksraŋanik naamaniaġaluaġmagaaġmi naatchumiñaġlugu?

english: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish the tower, all who see it will begin to make fun of him.
inupiaq: Tainna piŋisuaġumi, maŋŋuliqsiññaġlugu naatchiyumiñaiññiqpan, iñuich tautukkumirruŋ kipautigirraqsiñiaġaat,

english: They will say, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish!’
inupiaq: uqaġlutiŋ, Iñugliuna nappaisaġaluaqłuni, naatchiyumiñaiḷḷaġmi pimmiñiqsuq.

english: Or what king, going out to confront another king in battle, will not sit down first and determine whether he is able with ten thousand to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?
inupiaq: Naagga kisu umialik, aŋuyaqatiqaqsaġumaagaqsigumi allamik umialiŋmik, naipiqtuqqaaġniaŋitpa isumalaaġutigiaqsiḷugu igḷutuutiyumiñaġniaqtilaamiñik 10,000-mik aŋuyaktiqaġluni 20,000-mik aŋuyaktiqaqtuamun.

english: If he cannot succeed, he will send a representative while the other is still a long way off and ask for terms of peace.
inupiaq: Igḷutuutiyumiñaiññiaġumi, uŋasisugruŋŋaan akiḷḷiñi, ilaa tilisiñiaqtuq kivgamik umialiŋmun apiqsrisaqłuni aŋuyaŋirrutiksramik.

english: In the same way therefore not one of you can be my disciple if he does not renounce all his own possessions.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Tainnatun kiñaliqaa ilivsiññi suksraaġiŋitkumi supayaanik pigikkaġmiñik, iḷitchitqurauyumiñaitchuq uvamnun.
