english: “Salt is good, but if salt loses its flavor, how can its flavor be restored?
inupiaq: Taġiuq nakuuruq, aglaattauq taġiuq taġiuġniiġumi, qanuġlugu taġiuġniḷitqikkumiñaitchuq.

english: It is of no value for the soil or for the manure pile; it is to be thrown out. The one who has ears to hear had better listen!”
inupiaq: Anniqsuutauyumiñaitchuq nunamun naagga nagguksautauyumiñaġluni nunamun. Aglaan naavitaksrauruq asiñun. Ilivsi iḷitchitquratka taġiutun ittusi nunam iñuŋiñun. Tavraasii siutiqaqtusi tusaggatiksragnik, Naalaġnisiŋa.

english: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming to hear him.
inupiaq: Iḷaanni tax-iñik katitchirit piḷuusiqirillu qaiŋarut Jesus naalaktuaġukługu.

english: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law were complaining, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik uqamayuŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Uuma iñuum paġlasuugai piḷuusiqirit niġiqatigivlugiḷḷu.

english: So Jesus told them this parable:
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqautiŋagai uumiŋa uuktuunmik.

english: “Which one of you, if he has a hundred sheep and loses one of them, would not leave the ninety-nine in the open pasture and go look for the one that is lost until he finds it?
inupiaq: Nalliqsi qanuġayaqpa tallimakipiamik imnaiqaqtuaq tammaigumi atautchimik? Qimakkayaġai tallimakipiaġuutaitchuat, aasii ivaaqsiḷugu atausiq tammaqtuaq imnaiq paqilġataġlugu.

english: Then when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
inupiaq: Tavraasii paqinnamiuŋ quviasukpaŋaruq. Aasii iqsriutivlugu aggisivlugu.

english: Returning home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, telling them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost.’
inupiaq: Tavra aikami, ququaŋagai atautchimun avilaitqatini siḷalliñiḷu, uqallautivlugich, Quviasuqasiqsiŋa, qanuq paqinŋagiga imnaiġa tammaŋaruaq.

english: I tell you, in the same way there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who have no need to repent.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Uqallautigivsi, tainnatuttauq quviasuutigiłhamaaġniaġaat qiḷaŋmi atausiq piḷuusiqiri isumalitqiksuaq taapkunaŋŋa tallimakipiaġuutaitchuaniñ nalaunŋaruaniñ iñuŋniñ isumalitqiaksraitchuaniñ.

english: “Or what woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one of them, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search thoroughly until she finds it?
inupiaq: Naagga aġnaq qanuġayaqpa qulinik maniuraqaqtuaq tammaigumiuŋ atausiq iḷaŋat maniŋmi? Ikinnayaġaa qulliq aasii tilaiḷugu igluni ivammaġiksaapiaġataġlugu paqilġataġlugu.

english: Then when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I had lost.’
inupiaq: Aasii paqitanikamiuŋ, ququaqługich atautchimun avilaitqatini siḷalliñiḷu uqallakłuni, Quviasuqasiqsiŋa qanuq paqinŋagiga maniuraq tammaikkaġa.

english: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of God’s angels over one sinner who repents.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Uqallautigivsi tainnatuttauq quviasuŋmiut isaġuliŋi God-im pisigivlugu atausiq piḷuusiqiri isumalitqiŋman.

english: Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, Iñuk malġugnik iġñiqaŋaruq.

english: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate that will belong to me.’ So he divided his assets between them.
inupiaq: Nukaqłiq uqallaŋaruq aapamiñun, Aapaaŋ, aitchuŋŋa kiŋuvaannaktaaksrautimnik. Tavra Aapaŋakta autaaŋagai suġaliġni iġñagmiñun.

english: After a few days, the younger son gathered together all he had and left on a journey to a distant country, and there he squandered his wealth with a wild lifestyle.
inupiaq: Uvliupasakkaluaġnani, nukaqłium tuniŋagai autaaġusiani maniŋñun, aasii aullaqłuni uŋasiksuamun nunamun. Taamaniasii kinniqutigiaqsivḷugich maniŋñi iñuumaqłuktaqłuni.

english: Then after he had spent everything, a severe famine took place in that country, and he began to be in need.
inupiaq: Tavra suiġutianiŋmiuġlu, kaaksiuqparraqsiŋarut taavrumani nunami, aasii ilaa suiġutiŋaruq.

english: So he went and worked for one of the citizens of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa aullaqłuni iḷaliutiŋaruq iḷaŋannun nutim iñuŋisa taavruma nunam, aasii taavruma iñuum tiliŋagaa nautchiaqaġviŋmiñun qaunaksritquvlugu tuttuqłuŋnik.

english: He was longing to eat the carob pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
inupiaq: Tavra kaaliqpaił̣ł̣uni niġiyumiñaġaluaġaqtuq tuttuqłuich niqiŋiññik, suli iñuich aitchulaitkaat.

english: But when he came to his senses he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have food enough to spare, but here I am dying from hunger!
inupiaq: Tavra qauriḷġataqami uqallaŋaruq, Qanutun iñugiaktigiruanik aapaga akiññagniaqtuanik kivgaqaqtuq niqaiḷḷisaaŋitchuanik aitchuutiksraqallavlutiglu, uvvaliasiuvaŋa maani paniaqsiruŋa.

english: I will get up and go to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
inupiaq: Aiñiaqtuŋa aapamnun aasii uqallautilugu, Aapaaŋ, piḷuksiŋaruŋa God-mun iliŋnullu.

english: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; treat me like one of your hired workers.”’
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋaaglaan nalliummatiŋaiqsuŋa iġñiġuyumiñaġluŋa iliŋnun. Aŋalataġiŋŋa iḷaŋatitun akiññagniaqtuat kivgavich.

english: So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way from home his father saw him, and his heart went out to him; he ran and hugged his son and kissed him.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa utiqsaŋaruq aapamiñun. Tavrali uŋasisugruktillugusuli, aapaŋan tautuŋagaa aasii naglikkiutivlugu, aqpamik iqimmaaġiaqtuŋagaa iġñini kunikł̣ugulu.

english: Then his son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you; I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
inupiaq: Tavra iġñiŋan uqallautiŋagaa, Aapaaŋ, piḷuksiŋaruŋa God-mun iliŋnullu. Nalliummatiŋaiqsuŋa iġñiġuyumiñaġluŋa iliŋnun.

english: But the father said to his slaves, ‘Hurry! Bring the best robe, and put it on him! Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet!
inupiaq: Tavra aapaŋa uqallaksiññaŋaruq kivgamiñun, Qilamik qaġġirisitchi annuġaaġigñiqsranik, aasii atipkaġlugich ilaanun, qitiqłiaġusiġḷugulu anŋiqpaglugulu.

english: Bring the fattened calf and kill it! Let us eat and celebrate,
inupiaq: Suli qaġġirisitchi quiññaksaqtamik tuttuqpaiyaamik aasii tuqullugu, niġiyumaugut aliasuŋiḷḷutalu.

english: because this son of mine was dead, and is alive again – he was lost and is found!’ So they began to celebrate.
inupiaq: Qanuq uvvauna iġñiġa tuquŋaruatun itkaluaqtuaq iñuusatqiksuq, tammaŋagaluaqtuaq paqitauruq. Tavra niqinaqirraqsiŋarut.

english: “Now his older son was in the field. As he came and approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋayukłiq iġñiŋa nautchiaqaġviŋmiinŋaruq. Tavraasii aiñiallaġmi qallikami iglumun, tusaaŋaruq atuqtuuraqpaaluŋmik kanaakkiuruaniglu.

english: So he called one of the slaves and asked what was happening.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan qaitquŋagaa kivgat iḷaŋat aasii apiġivlugu summagaisa.

english: The slave replied, ‘Your brother has returned, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he got his son back safe and sound.’
inupiaq: Aasii kivgam kiuŋagaa, Aniqatin airuaq aasii aapan tuqutchiruaq quiññaksaqtamik tuttuqpaiyaamik, pisigivlugu aiñiŋa sugaluaġnani.

english: But the older son became angry and refused to go in. His father came out and appealed to him,
inupiaq: Tavra aŋayukłiq qinnaliŋaruq isiġunġiqł̣uniḷu. Aapaŋata anivḷuni arakkaluaġmigaa isiquvlugu.

english: but he answered his father, ‘Look! These many years I have worked like a slave for you, and I never disobeyed your commands. Yet you never gave me even a goat so that I could celebrate with my friends!
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan aapani kiuŋagaa, Uvva, aippaapak savautiŋagaluaġikpiñ kivgatun iḷivḷuŋa, aasii sumikunnii kipuqłaŋaitkaluaġiga piraksriutin, naaggauvva aitchuŋaitkiŋmaunnii imnaiyaamik nagruliŋmik, quviasuqatiqaquluŋa avilaitqatimnik.

english: But when this son of yours came back, who has devoured your assets with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
inupiaq: Aasiuvvauna iġñiġiñ qaimman, kinniqutigiqqaaqługich suġaliqtin akiitchunullu, tuqutchisiŋagiñ quiññaksaqtamik tuttuqpaiyaamik.

english: Then the father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and everything that belongs to me is yours.
inupiaq: Tavra aapaŋan kiuŋagaa, Iġñiiŋ, ataramik nayuġiŋma, suli sunapayaaq piga pigimmigiñ.

english: It was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for your brother was dead, and is alive; he was lost and is found.’”
inupiaq: Nalautittuq quviasualaniksraqput quyaniksraqpullu, qanuq aniqatin tuquŋaruatun itkaluaqtuaq iñuusatqiksuq, suli tammaŋagaluaqtuaq paqitauruq.

english: Jesus also said to the disciples, “There was a rich man who was informed of accusations that his manager was wasting his assets.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagai iḷitchitqurani uuktuusiqł̣uni, Iñuqaŋaruq suġalliruamik suġautchiqiriqaqtuamik. Aasii uqallautiŋagaat suġalliruaq suġautchiqiriŋa aŋalatchiḷḷuataŋiññivḷugu maniŋiñik.

english: So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Turn in the account of your administration, because you can no longer be my manager.’
inupiaq: Tavra suġalliruam ququaqługu uqallautiŋagaa, Sunaimña tusaavigu ilipkun? Qaitkich aglaich suġautchiqiraunipkun, qanuq tavraŋŋaaglaan suġautchiqirigiŋaiġñiaġikpiñ.

english: Then the manager said to himself, ‘What should I do, since my master is taking my position away from me? I’m not strong enough to dig, and I’m too ashamed to beg.
inupiaq: Tavra suġautchiqiri isumalaaŋaruq, Suniaqpik? Umialiŋma anitkaqsigaaŋa savaamniñ. Kurriḷguiñmiuŋa, kanŋugimmigiga piatchiaqtaġniq.

english: I know what to do so that when I am put out of management, people will welcome me into their homes.’
inupiaq: Sivunnianiktuŋa suniaqtilaaksramnik, savaagiġuma avilaitqatiqaġumiñaqsiḷuŋa paġlariksramnik aimaaġviŋiññun.

english: So he contacted his master’s debtors one by one. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
inupiaq: Tavra qaitquŋagai umialiŋmi akiiḷaqtuqtiŋi atausiullaavlugich. Sivulliq uqallautiŋagaa, Qanutun akiiḷaqpiuŋ umialiga?

english: The man replied, ‘A hundred measures of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write fifty.’
inupiaq: Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Tallimakipiatun qattaġruayaanik olive uqsrunik. Tavra suġautchiqirim uqallautiŋagaa, Uvva akiiḷatin, aquvillutin qilamik aglakkich akiiḷatin avvaŋich piiyaġlugich.

english: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ The second man replied, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautilgitkaa alla, Qanutulli akiiḷaqaqpich? Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, 1,000-tun bushels palauvaksranik. Suġautchiqirim uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷaŋich piiyaġlugich aglagiñ 800-mik.

english: The master commended the dishonest manager because he acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their contemporaries than the people of light.
inupiaq: Tavra atanġata pisaasuġniŋagaa pitqiksiġayuktuaq suġautchiqiri sivunniuġutaagun. Iñuŋi mattuma nunam aŋalatchisułhaaqtut suġaliġmiŋnik ukpiqtuaniñ.

english: And I tell you, make friends for yourselves by how you use worldly wealth, so that when it runs out you will be welcomed into the eternal homes.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallavsaaŋaruq, Uqallautigivsi, avilaitqasiuġitchi ilivsiññun nagliktuġlugich iñuich suġalivsiññiñ. Tavraasii suġalisi nuŋukpata, paġlapiaġniaġaasi isuitchuamun aimaaġviŋmi.

english: “The one who is faithful in a very little is also faithful in much, and the one who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa ukpiġnaqtuaq mikiruurakkaluakun, ukpiġnaqtuagummiuq aŋiruakun. Aasiivsauq kiñaliqaa pitqiksiġaġuuruaq mikiruurakkaluakun, pitqiksiġaqtuagusuummiuq aŋiruatigun.

english: If then you haven’t been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will entrust you with the true riches?
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilivsi ukpiġnaġniaŋaitkuvsi aŋalatchiñivsiññi nunami suġaliġnik, qanuġlusi ukpiġnaġniaqpisi aŋalatchisaġuvsi qiḷaum iḷumun ittuanik suġaliŋiñik?

english: And if you haven’t been trustworthy with someone else’s property, who will give you your own?
inupiaq: Suli ukpiġnaŋaitkuvsi aŋalatchiñivsigun God-im piŋiñik maani, aitchuusiaqaġniaŋitchusi ilivsi pivsiññik taimanigu.

english: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.”
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa savakkumiñaitchuq malġugnik ataniqaġluni atautchikun, qanuq ilaan uumiginiaġaa igḷua aasii piviaġilugu igḷua. Naaggaunnii qiksiksrautiqaġluni igḷuanun aasii suuŋiḷaġilugu igḷua. Savautiyumiñaitkiksi God suġallagniaġniġlu atautchikun.

english: The Pharisees (who loved money) heard all this and ridiculed him.
inupiaq: Pharisees piqpaksriruat maniŋmik, tusaaŋagaich taapkua iluqaisa uqaluich aasii ilaisa Jesus kipagiŋagaat.

english: But Jesus said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves in men’s eyes, but God knows your hearts. For what is highly prized among men is utterly detestable in God’s sight.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Ilivsi patchisaiññisuurusi takkuanni iñuich, aglaan God-im iḷisimapiaġai iñuutchisi, qanuq suna kamanaqsiḷiqtauruaq akunġanni iñuich naġġugipiaġataġaa God-im.

english: “The law and the prophets were in force until John; since then, the good news of the kingdom of God has been proclaimed, and everyone is urged to enter it.
inupiaq: John Paptaiqsim alġaqsruisaġniŋanun aglaan, Moses aglaaŋi uqaqtiŋisalu God-im uqaluŋich aŋalatigiŋagisi. Aglaan John aullaqisaaŋagai tusaayugaaġiksuat God-im atanniqsimmataagun qaigaqsiruakun. Aasii paŋmapak piyumalaaqtuat iñusalaich siġġaqiŋarut God-mun atanniqsimatquvlutiŋ.

english: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tiny stroke of a letter in the law to become void.
inupiaq: Aglaan siġḷiġnaił̣haaqtuq qiḷaglu nunalu piiqsaqpaŋnik, atausiuraqunnii God-im pitquraŋiñi naumaŋiññiqsrauruaq piiġñiksraŋaniñ.

english: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery, and the one who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa avittuaq nuliamiñiñ aasii tuvaaqasitqikł̣uni allamik allatuqtuaguruq, suli iñuk tuvaaqasiqsuaq aġnamik avitaŋanik uiŋata, allatuqtuaguruq.

english: “There was a rich man who dressed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
inupiaq: Suġalliruaqaŋaruq annuġaaqaqtuamik akisupiaġataqtuanik, suli uvlutuaġman niqinaqiugaqłuni iḷaŋaniñ.

english: But at his gate lay a poor man named Lazarus whose body was covered with sores,
inupiaq: Aasii iñuk iḷiappak kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuaq atiqaqtuaq Lazarus-mik, qaġġisisuuniġaat uvlutuaġman paaŋanun suġalliruam.

english: who longed to eat what fell from the rich man’s table. In addition, the dogs came and licked his sores.
inupiaq: Niġiyumasuugaluaġniqsuq kataktuanik unnii suġalliruam niġġiviŋiñiñ. Aasii qimmich qaimmiraġniqsut aluktuqługich kiḷḷiŋi.

english: “Now the poor man died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷiappauruaq iñuk tuquŋaruq suli isaġulgich aullautiŋagaat Abraham saniġaanun niqinaqiruanun qiḷaŋmi. Suġalliruaq tuquŋammiuq aasii iḷuviŋagaat.

english: And in hell, as he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far off with Lazarus at his side.
inupiaq: Tavra Nagliksaaġviŋmi nagliksaaqłuni, aaġluŋaruq aasii tautukługu Abraham uŋasiñun Lazarus-lu saniġaaniittuaq.

english: So he called out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in anguish in this fire.’
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa ququulaŋaruq, Aapauruatiin Abraham, nagligiŋŋa. Tilliuŋ Lazarus misullagiaqulugu argani imiġmun aasii niglaqtaaġlugu qaniġa, qanuq uvva iłuiḷḷiuqpaktuŋa uumani igniġmi.

english: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things and Lazarus likewise bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in anguish.
inupiaq: Tavra Abraham uqallaksiññaŋaruq, Iġñiiŋ, itqaġiñ iñuuniġni aitchuusiaqaġuuruatiin nakuuruanik sunik, aasiiḷi Lazarus tainnatuttauq pigiitchuanigli. Aasii paŋmapak quviasaaġusiaqaqtuq uvani, aasiiḷi ilivich nagliksaaġnami ittutin.

english: Besides all this, a great chasm has been fixed between us, so that those who want to cross over from here to you cannot do so, and no one can cross from there to us.’
inupiaq: Aasii taamnatualuuŋitchuq, akunnaptiŋni uvagullu iliviḷḷu kamanaqtuaq qutaiḷaq ittuq savaaq, tamatkua ikaaġukkaluaqtuat maaŋŋa ilivsiññun piyumiñaiqsaqługich, suli kiñaunnii ikaaġumiñaiqł̣ugu ilivsiññiñ uvaptiŋnun.

english: So the rich man said, ‘Then I beg you, father – send Lazarus to my father’s house
inupiaq: Tavra suġalliruaq uqallaŋaruq, Tainnaitpan aapauruatiin, qiññuaġvigigikpiñ tilitquvlugu Lazarus aapama igluanun,

english: (for I have five brothers) to warn them so that they don’t come into this place of torment.’
inupiaq: qanuq samma tallimanik aniqatiqaqtuŋa, ilaan kiliktuġumagai, iḷaanni uvuŋaqpiaġmiut nagliksaaġviŋmun.

english: But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; they must respond to them.’
inupiaq: Tavra Abraham uqallautiŋagaa, Aniqatiivich pigigaich aglaaŋi Moses uqaqtiŋisalu God-im kiliktuiruat iliŋiññik. Aniqatiivich naalaġniḷisigik taiguaqpatigik.

english: Then the rich man said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
inupiaq: Suġalliruam kiuŋagaa, Aapauruatiin Abraham, naalaġniyumiñaitchut, aglaan iñuk ullautikpan inmiŋnun tuquŋaruaniñ aŋiluni, isumalitqigñiaqtut.

english: He replied to him, ‘If they do not respond to Moses and the prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.’”
inupiaq: Abraham kiuŋagaa, kamagiyumiñaitkumisigik aglaaŋi Moses uqaqtiŋisalu God-im, qanuqpisiiḷḷirauyumiñaiñmiut iñuk aŋigaluaqpan tuqqunmiñ.

english: Jesus said to his disciples, “Stumbling blocks are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Nalupqinaitchuq, ikł̣igutchaktinniutit piḷuksiñiksramun qaiyumaaqtut, aglaan qanutun naglignaqtigiruq taamna iñuk patchisauruaq tamatkunuŋa.

english: It would be better for him to have a millstone tied around his neck and be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa ukpiġutaiqsitpagu iḷaŋat makua miqłiqtuuratun iḷivḷutiŋ ukpiqtuat uvamnun, iłuałhaaġayaqtuq uyaġagruaġmik quŋusiġutchiġḷugu aasii ipipkaġlugu taġiumun.

english: Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi. Aniqatiksi piḷuksikpan, suaksiuŋ. Aasii isumalitqikpan, suliqutigiŋaiqsiuŋ itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich.

english: Even if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times returns to you saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
inupiaq: Aasii piḷuksikpan ilivsiññun tallimat malġuiqsuaġlugu uvluq, aasii isumalitqikpan tallimat malġuiqsuaġluni uqallautilusi, Isumalitqiksuŋa. Suliqutigiŋaigaksraġigiksi.

english: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraunikun tilirauruat uqallautiŋagaat Ataniq, Suaŋasiḷaaġuŋ ukpiġutikput.

english: So the Lord replied, “If you had faith the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this black mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled out by the roots and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
inupiaq: Tavra Ataniq uqallaŋaruq, Ukpiġutiqaġuvsi nautchiaksratun mustard-tun, mikipiaġaluaqłuni naullaruatun napaaqtuqpaġuqłuni, uqallautiyumiñaġiksi manna napaaqtuq, Maŋŋupkun nusugiñ aasii nautchirriutaulutin taġiumi. Tavra kamagiyumiñaġaluaġaasi.

english: “Would any one of you say to your slave who comes in from the field after plowing or shepherding sheep, ‘Come at once and sit down for a meal’?
inupiaq: Nalliqsi kivgaqaqtuaq nunaliqiruamik naagga qaunaksriruamik imnaiñik, aimman uqallautilaitkiksi inna, Aquvillutin niġiñiaġiñ.

english: Won’t the master instead say to him, ‘Get my dinner ready, and make yourself ready to serve me while I eat and drink. Then you may eat and drink’?
inupiaq: Aglaan uqallautisuugiksi, Itqanaiyaġiñ nullautaksramnik. Saaġuaġlutin savautiŋŋa niġipkaqtilluŋa imiġluŋalu. Aasiiḷi taavruma aquagun niġiñiaqtutin imiġlutillu.

english: He won’t thank the slave because he did what he was told, will he?
inupiaq: Kivgaq quyanaagaksraitchuq kamaksriñiḷugu piraksriusiamiñik.

english: So you too, when you have done everything you were commanded to do, should say, ‘We are slaves undeserving of special praise; we have only done what was our duty.’”
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq ilivsi, pianikkaluaġuvsiuŋ iluqaan piraksriusiaqsi, uqallagitchi, Uvagut nalliummatiŋitchugut kivgat, pigiññaqtugut piraksriusiaptiŋnik.

english: Now on the way to Jerusalem, Jesus was passing along between Samaria and Galilee.
inupiaq: Iglauyaamiñi Jerusalem-mun, Jesus akunġakkuaŋaruq Samaria-vlu Galilee-vḷu.

english: As he was entering a village, ten men with leprosy met him. They stood at a distance,
inupiaq: Tavra tikitchaġataviksillugich nunaaqqiñun, paaŋagaat qulit kiḷḷiġruaqtuqtuat, qikausiŋarut uŋasiuraqłutiŋ

english: raised their voices and said, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.”
inupiaq: aasii ququulaŋarut, Jesus Ataniiq nagligitigut.

english: When he saw them he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went along, they were cleansed.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamigich uqallautiŋagai, Aullaġitchi aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich mamitilaaġumagaasi. Tavra iglauniallaġmiŋ maminŋarut.

english: Then one of them, when he saw he was healed, turned back, praising God with a loud voice.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋat, iḷitchuġikami iłuaqsirautilaamiñik, utiqsaŋaruq, nanġaqługu God nipatuvluni.

english: He fell with his face to the ground at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. (Now he was a Samaritan.)
inupiaq: Tavra punŋaruq sivuġaanun Jesus, quyyavigivlugu. Taamna iñuk Samaria-ġmiu.

english: Then Jesus said, “Were not ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, quliguŋitpat ipkua mamittuat? Nauŋ ipkua quliŋŋuġutaiḷat?

english: Was no one found to turn back and give praise to God except this foreigner?”
inupiaq: Utiġumiñaŋagaluaġmiut quyyavigisuglugu God. Aglaan uvvauna Samaria-ġmiu utiŋaruq.

english: Then he said to the man, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has made you well.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Makillutin aullaġiñ. Ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin.

english: Now at one point the Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God was coming, so he answered, “The kingdom of God is not coming with signs to be observed,
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisa Pharisees apiġiŋagaat Jesus qakugu atanniqsimmataa God-im isagutiniaġmagaan. Ilaan kiuŋagai, Atanniqsimmataa God-im isagutiyumaaŋitchuq tautuŋnaġluni.

english: nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ For indeed, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii uqallagniaŋiñmiut, Uvva uvaniittuq. Naagga taikka taikaniittuq, qanuq atanniqsimmataa God-im ittuq uvaniittuani kamaksriruani.

english: Then he said to the disciples, “The days are coming when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq iḷitchitquramiñun, Uvlut qaiyumaaqtut kipiġniuliġviksrautisi tautugumaliġḷugu atanniqsimmataa Iġñiŋan iñuum nunami, aglaan tautukkumiñaitkiksi.

english: Then people will say to you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or ‘Look, here he is!’ Do not go out or chase after them.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuich uqallautiniaġaasi qaiñiḷuŋa aasii amaniinniḷuŋa naagga maaniinniḷuŋa. Ukpiġinagich, ivaqsaġnaŋa.

english: For just like the lightning flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his day.
inupiaq: Qanuq igniġuuqpatittuaq qaummaatinmatun qaummaġiksiviñaqługu qiḷak igḷuaniñ igḷuanun, tainnatun piñiaqtuq Iġñiŋa iñuum qaigumi.

english: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
inupiaq: Aglaan nagliksaaqqaaqtuksrauniaqtuŋa iñugiaktuatigun sutigun suli pisuŋiḷḷuŋa iñuich paŋmapak iñuuruat.

english: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so too it will be in the days of the Son of Man.
inupiaq: Taimani Noah iñuumman iñuuruatitun, tainnatuttauq iñuusiqaġniaġmiut qaiyasikpan Iġñiŋa iñuum.

english: People were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were being given in marriage – right up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
inupiaq: Iñuich niġigayuktut, imiqłutiglu katirrusiqivlutiglu Noah isiġataqtillugu umiaqpaŋmiñun, aasii uliqpaum tuqunŋagai iluqaisa.

english: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot, people were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building;
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq iñuumman Lot, niġigayuŋammiut imiqłutiglu tauqsiqsuqłutiglu tuniuqqaivḷutiglu nautchirriqsuivḷutiglu igluqpiuqłutiglu

english: but on the day Lot went out from Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
inupiaq: aullaġataqtillugu Lot Sodom-miñ. Tavra igniq tivluktuaġlu isiq sialuuŋaruk qiḷaŋmiñ aasii tuqułługich iluqaisa iñuŋi Sodom.

english: It will be the same on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
inupiaq: Tavra tainnatun piñiaqtuq Iġñiŋa iñuum qiñiġnaqsikpan.

english: On that day, anyone who is on the roof, with his goods in the house, must not come down to take them away, and likewise the person in the field must not turn back.
inupiaq: Taimanigu iñuk aniiqsuaqtuaq iglumi qaaŋani atqaġnani suġauttani iglum iḷuaniittuat aisuglugich. Tainnatuttauq iñuk nautchiaqaġviŋmiittuaq utiqsaġnani iglumiñun.

english: Remember Lot’s wife!
inupiaq: Itqaumasiuŋ suna piruaq Lot-gum nuliaŋanun.

english: Whoever tries to keep his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will preserve it.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa annautiniaqsaagumigich iñuuniutini tammaiñiaġaa iñuggutini, aglaan kialiqaa tammaigumigich iñuuniutini annautiniaġaa iñuggutini.

english: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, taavrumani unnuami malġuk aŋutik inniaqtuk atautchiiñi siñigviŋñi, igḷua aullaurrauniaqtuq aasii igḷua qimaktauluni.

english: There will be two women grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left.”
inupiaq: Malġuk aġnak palauvaksiuġniaġmiuk atautchimi, igḷua aullaurrauniaqtuq aasii igḷua qimaktauluni.

english: Then the disciples said to him, “Where, Lord?” He replied to them, “Where the dead body is, there the vultures will gather.”
inupiaq: Malġuk aŋutik nautchiaqaġviŋmi savaŋniaqtuk, igḷua aullaurrauniaqtuq aasii igḷua qimaktauluni.

english: Then Jesus told them a parable to show them they should always pray and not lose heart.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uumiŋa uuktuunmik, iḷisautisaqługich ataramik aŋaiyyuruksraunivḷugich nikatchalaiḷḷutiŋ.

english: He said, “In a certain city there was a judge who neither feared God nor respected people.
inupiaq: Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Iniqpaŋmi isivġiqsiqaŋaruq qiksiksrautaitchuamik God-mun naaggaunnii suliqutiksraaqtuaŋitchuamik iñuŋnik.

english: There was also a widow in that city who kept coming to him and saying, ‘Give me justice against my adversary.’
inupiaq: Tavra inŋaruq uiḷgaŋaruaq taavrumani iniqpaŋmi ullaaġautiruaq isivġiqsimun nalaunŋaruakun ikayuquvluni iñuŋmiñ ivayaġniaqtimiñiñ.

english: For a while he refused, but later on he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God nor have regard for people,
inupiaq: Sivisuuraqtuami isivġiqsi pisuŋiñŋaruq. Aglaan aquvatigun isumallaktuq inna, Qiksigiŋiḷḷuġigaunnii God naagga suliqutigiŋił̣ł̣ugich iñuich,

english: yet because this widow keeps on bothering me, I will give her justice, or in the end she will wear me out by her unending pleas.’”
inupiaq: pisigigiññaġlugu uuma uiḷgaŋaruam iḷaksianniŋniŋa uvamnik, ikayuġniaġiga nalaunŋaruakun ilaanun, qanuq ikayuŋisuaġupku piḷaiqsinniaġaaŋa ataramik qaiguġluni.

english: And the Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says!
inupiaq: Tavra Ataniq uqallaŋaruq, Isummatigisiuŋ qanuq nalaunŋaitchuaq isivġiqsim isumallautaa.

english: Won’t God give justice to his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he delay long to help them?
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq God isivġiiñiaqtuq pisilugich ilaan iñuksraqtaani nipauqtuat inmiñun ikayuqtaiḷiqivlutiŋ uvlukkaluami unnuamiḷu. Ikayukallaŋisauraaġniaqpagich?

english: I tell you, he will give them justice speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi, ilaa isivġiiñiaqtuq qilamik pisilugich iñuksraqtaani. Aglaattauq, Iġñiŋa iñuum qaikpan nunamun, qanutun iñugiaktigiruat ukpiġutiqaġniaqpat aŋaiyyuuqtuagulutiglu?

english: Jesus also told this parable to some who were confident that they were righteous and looked down on everyone else.
inupiaq: Jesus quliaqtuavsaaŋammiuq uumiŋa uuktuunmik iñuŋnun nalupqisuŋitchuanun nalaunŋanivḷutiŋ aasii suuŋiḷaqsruqługich allat iñuich.

english: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
inupiaq: Malġuk iññuk aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmuŋaruk aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłutik. Igḷua Pharisee aasii igḷua tax-iñik katitchiri.

english: The Pharisee stood and prayed about himself like this: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people: extortionists, unrighteous people, adulterers – or even like this tax collector.
inupiaq: Pharisee makitavluni aŋaiyyuŋaruq inna, God, quyanaaġikpiñ iñuusiqaŋiññama allatun iñuktitun, piḷḷaturuatun, pitqiksiġaqtitun, allatuqtitun, naaggaunnii uumatun tax-iñik katitchiritun.

english: I fast twice a week; I give a tenth of everything I get.’
inupiaq: Niġiḷaitchuuruŋa aŋaiyyuuġnimni malġuiqsuaqługu savaiññaak akunġak. Aitchuisuummiuŋa quliŋŋuġutiŋiññik supayaat piġġaktaaġma.

english: The tax collector, however, stood far off and would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, ‘God, be merciful to me, sinner that I am!’
inupiaq: Tavrali tax-iñik katitchiri, makitavluni taavanisaaq, aaġluqsausiiñŋaruq unnii qiḷaŋmun, aglaan patiksiññaqługu satqani aŋaiyyuŋaruq inna, God nagligiŋŋa uvaŋa piḷuusiqiri.

english: I tell you that this man went down to his home justified rather than the Pharisee. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Uqallautigivsi, taamna tax-iñik katitchiri airuq nalaunŋasivḷuni God-mun igḷumiñiñ, qanuq kiñaliqaa kamanaqsiḷiqtuaq inmiñik kamanaiqsauniaqtuq, suli iñuk kamasaaŋitchuaq inmiñi kamanaqsipkaqtauniaqtuq.

english: Now people were even bringing their babies to him for him to touch. But when the disciples saw it, they began to scold those who brought them.
inupiaq: Tavrani iñuich iḷaŋisa qaġġisiŋagaich miqłiqtuuratiŋ Jesus-mun, aksiuquvlugich ilaanun. Tavra iḷitchitqurat tautukamisigik, suaŋagaich iñuich.

english: But Jesus called for the children, saying, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qaitquŋagai miqłiqtut inmiñun, uqallakłuni, Miqłiqtuurat qaipkaqsigik uvamnun, suli pitquŋiññagich. Tainnaiḷiŋaruat God-im atanniqsimagai.

english: I tell you the truth, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter it.”
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Kialiqaa ukpiġiŋitpagu God miqłiqtuuram ukpiqsrausiatun, isiġumiñaitchuq God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: Now a certain ruler asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat umialiŋnaŋata apiġiŋagaa Jesus, Iḷisaurrigiksuatiin, sumik piñiaqpik isuitchuamik iñuggutinnagugluŋa?

english: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Summan taiviŋa nakuuruamik. Nakuuruagitchuq iñuŋmik God kisimi.

english: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”
inupiaq: Iḷisimagitin Pitqurat, Allatuġnak, Iñuaġnak, Tiglignak, Saglutiginniŋnak, Suuŋiḷaġinagik aapallu aakallu.

english: The man replied, “I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws since my youth.”
inupiaq: Tavra umialiŋnam kiuŋagaa, Tamatkua iluqaisa kamagiŋagitka nutaġaunnamniñ.

english: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “One thing you still lack. Sell all that you have and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus taamna tusaakamiuŋ, ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Atautchimik piraksraqavsaaqtutin suli. Aullaġiñ, tunikkich supayaat pisin, aasii aitchuutigilugich maniich iḷiappauruanun, tavra piiḷḷiuġniaŋitchutin qiḷaŋmi. Aasii qaiḷutin maliŋŋa.

english: But when the man heard this he became very sad, for he was extremely wealthy.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna tusaakamiuŋ ipiqtutchaŋaruq, qanuq suġalliqpaktuaguvluni.

english: When Jesus noticed this, he said, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!
inupiaq: Jesus qiviaqługu ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Qanutun siġḷiġnaqtigiva tamatkunuŋa suġalliruanun isiġniaġniksraq God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: In fact, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Siġḷiġnaił̣haaqtuq pikukturuaq kakakti iraaguaġumi mitqutim, suġalliruam isiġniaġniksraŋaniñ God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: Those who heard this said, “Then who can be saved?”
inupiaq: Iñuich tusaaruat taavrumiŋa uqallaŋarut, Kiñami annaurrauniaġniqpa?

english: He replied, “What is impossible for mere humans is possible for God.”
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus kiuŋagai, Suna iñuich piyumiñaisaŋat God-im piḷḷagaa.

english: And Peter said, “Look, we have left everything we own to follow you!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Uvva, uvagut qimaŋagivut aimaaġvivut maliġuaġuqłutin.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, there is no one who has left home or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of God’s kingdom
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, Iñuk kiñaliqaa qimairuaq aimaaġviŋmiñik, naagga nuliamiñik naagga aniqatiimiñik naagga aŋayuqaamiñik naagga miqłiqtumiñik, pisigivlugu God-im atanniqsimmataa,

english: who will not receive many times more in this age – and in the age to come, eternal life.”
inupiaq: aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq iñugiaksił̣haasugruglugich paŋmapaŋmi, suli taimanigu iñuggutinnagniaqtuq isuitchuamik.

english: Then Jesus took the twelve aside and said to them, “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written about the Son of Man by the prophets will be accomplished.
inupiaq: Tavra asivaqtaaġutivlugich qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat, Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Uvva, Jerusalem-muksaaqsirugut, aasii supayaat uqaqtiŋisa God-im aglaaġiŋaraŋich Iġñiŋagun iñuum nalautitauniaqtut.

english: For he will be handed over to the Gentiles; he will be mocked, mistreated, and spat on.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa aitchuutauniaqtuq Jew-guŋitchuanun, suli kipaginiaġaat kanŋunaqsipiaġlugu aŋalataġilugu tivvuaqtuġlugulu.

english: They will flog him severely and kill him. Yet on the third day he will rise again.”
inupiaq: Ipiġaqtuġniaġaat suli tuqullugu, aasii uvluk piŋayuaŋni ilaa aŋiñiaqtuq.

english: But the twelve understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they did not grasp what Jesus meant.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat kaŋiqsiŋaitkaich nalliat unnii tamatkua uqaluich, taamna uqaluk kaŋiqsiŋaitkaat sumik sivuniqaqtilaaŋa, puttuqsriŋiḷḷakkaat sumik Jesus uqautiqaqtilaaŋanik.

english: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the road begging.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qallimmiuġlu Jericho-mun, ayauŋaruaq aquppiŋaruq apqutit saniġaanni piatchiaqtaqłuni.

english: When he heard a crowd going by, he asked what was going on.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaavlugich iñusalaich tamaunnaaqtuat, ilaa apiqsriŋaruq summagaisa.

english: They told him, “Jesus the Nazarene is passing by.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa uqallautiŋagaat, Jesus Nazareth-miu tamaunnaaqtuq.

english: So he called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa nipaalaŋaruq, Jesus, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun, nagligiŋŋa.

english: And those who were in front scolded him to get him to be quiet, but he shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua salliuruat suaŋagaat, uqallautivlugu nipaisaaquvlugu. Tavra ilaa nipattuvsaaqsiññaŋaruq, Iġñiġuruatiin David-mun, nagligiŋŋa.

english: So Jesus stopped and ordered the beggar to be brought to him. When the man came near, Jesus asked him,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nutqaŋaruq, aasii piraksriivḷuni qaġġisitquvlugu inmiñun. Tavra qallimman Jesus apiġiŋagaa,

english: “What do you want me to do for you?” He replied, “Lord, let me see again.”
inupiaq: Sumik pisitquvich uvamnun. Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Ataniiq, tautuksiḷḷasisuktuŋa.

english: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has healed you.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Tautuksiḷḷasiiñ, ukpiġurvich iłuaqsipkaġaatin.

english: And immediately he regained his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they too gave praise to God.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrauvvaa ilaa tautullasiŋaruq aasii Jesus malikługu, nanġaqługu God. Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuich tautukamirruŋ, God nanġaŋagaat.

english: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through it.
inupiaq: Jesus tikiñŋaruq Jericho-mun aasii iglauvigiaqsivḷugu.

english: Now a man named Zacchaeus was there; he was a chief tax collector and was rich.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik Zacchaeus-mik, umialguniqsuamik tax-iñik katitchirauruanun, suli suġalliruaguvluni.

english: He was trying to get a look at Jesus, but being a short man he could not see over the crowd.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tautuŋniataŋagaa Jesus tautulaiñmivḷugulu, iñuich iñugiakpaił̣ł̣utiŋ ilaalu mikivluni.

english: So he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, because Jesus was going to pass that way.
inupiaq: Tavra aqpamik isagutiŋaruq sivuniksraŋannun aasii mayuqłuni Sikamuam napaaqtuanun tautugukługu Jesus, qanuq tamaunnaaġumaaqtuq.

english: And when Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, come down quickly, because I must stay at your house today.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiññami tavruŋa, aaġluqłuni uqallautiŋagaa, Zacchaeus, atqaġiñ qilamik, qanuq igluŋniittuksrauruŋa uvlupak.

english: So he came down quickly and welcomed Jesus joyfully.
inupiaq: Tavra Zacchaeus atqaqsaaluŋaruq, aasii aiyugaaŋagaa Jesus quviasuutigivlugu.

english: And when the people saw it, they all complained, “He has gone in to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich tautukamirruŋ taamna iluqaġmiŋ uqamayurraqsiŋarut, Taamna iñuk tuyuġmiaguyyaqtuq piḷuusiqirimun.

english: But Zacchaeus stopped and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, half of my possessions I now give to the poor, and if I have cheated anyone of anything, I am paying back four times as much!”
inupiaq: Aglaalli Zacchaeus makiłłuni sivuġaanun uqallaŋaruq Ataniġmun, Ataniiq, avvaŋich suġaliġma aitchuutiginiaġitka iḷiappauruanun, suli saglutaġniġupku kiñapayaaq supayaakun, utiqtitchiviginiaġiga sisamaŋŋuġlugu.

english: Then Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this household, because he too is a son of Abraham!
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Taamna pisigivlugu, uvlupak una iñuk igluqatiniḷu annaurrausaqtut, ilaaptauq kiŋunġuvluni Abraham-mun.

english: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋa iñuum qaiŋaruq ivaġiaqługich annautiyaqtuqługiḷḷu tammaŋaruat iñuich.

english: While the people were listening to these things, Jesus proceeded to tell a parable, because he was near to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear immediately.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua tusaaruat uqaluŋnik, Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uuktuunmik. Ilaa qalliŋaruq Jerusalem-mun, aasii iñuich isumaqaŋarut atanniqsimmataa God-im satqummiyasiñasugalugu.

english: Therefore he said, “A nobleman went to a distant country to receive for himself a kingdom and then return.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Iñuk umialiŋniñ kaŋiqaqtuaq aullaŋaruq uŋasiksuamun nunamun umialguqtitausukłuni, aasii utiġmiḷuni.

english: And he summoned ten of his slaves, gave them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Do business with these until I come back.’
inupiaq: Aullaŋaiñŋaġmi qaitquŋagai qulit kivgani, aasii aitchullaavlugich atausiḷḷaanik kaviqsuanik maniŋñik, aasii uqallautivlugich, Naggutinnagniaġitchi ukuniŋa maniŋñik qaiñimnun aglaan.

english: But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to be king over us!’
inupiaq: Tavra nunatqatiŋisa uumigiŋagaat aasii tilisiŋarut kivgamik inmiŋniñ aquagun, uqaqłutiŋ, Uvagut umialigisuŋitkikput taamna iñuk.

english: When he returned after receiving the kingdom, he summoned these slaves to whom he had given the money. He wanted to know how much they had earned by trading.
inupiaq: Umialiguġiaqtuaq umialiguanikami utiŋaruq. Tavrauvvaa qaitquŋagai taapkua kivgani aitchuŋarani maniŋñik, iḷitchuġisukłuni qanutun naggutinnaktilaaŋannik.

english: So the first one came before him and said, ‘Sir, your mina has made ten minas more.’
inupiaq: Sivulliq kivgaq qaiŋaruq sivuġaanun uqallakłuni, Ataniiq, maniich aitchuutitin uvamnun naggutinnautigigitka qulitun maniksun.

english: And the king said to him, ‘Well done, good slave! Because you have been faithful in a very small matter, you will have authority over ten cities.’
inupiaq: Tavra umialgata uqallautiŋagaa, Piḷḷuataqtutin, kivgaġiksuatiin. Pisigivlugu piḷḷuataġniġiñ mikiruurakkaluakun, ataniġnaqutiqaġniaqtutin qulinun iniqpaŋnun.

english: Then the second one came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has made five minas.’
inupiaq: Igḷua kivgam qaiŋaruq uqallakłuni, Ataniiq, maniich aitchuutitin uvamnun naggutinnautigigitka tallimatun maniksun.

english: So the king said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
inupiaq: Tavra umialgata uqallautiŋagaa, Iliviḷḷi atanniqsimaniaġitin tallimat iniqpaich.

english: Then another slave came and said, ‘Sir, here is your mina that I put away for safekeeping in a piece of cloth.
inupiaq: Tavrali allaptauq kivgaq qaiŋaruq uqaqłuni, Ataniiq, Uvva maniksin aitchuutitin uvamnun. Iriqsimaŋagitka puuqługich kakkiiyaunmik.

english: For I was afraid of you, because you are a severe man. You withdraw what you did not deposit and reap what you did not sow.’
inupiaq: Sivuuġagiŋagikpiñ qanuq suamarutin. Tigusisuurutin pigiŋisaġnik, suli kivrivḷutin palauvaksranik nautchirriutigiŋisaġnik.

english: The king said to him, ‘I will judge you by your own words, you wicked slave! So you knew, did you, that I was a severe man, withdrawing what I didn’t deposit and reaping what I didn’t sow?
inupiaq: Umialgata uqallautiŋagaa, Piḷuktuatiin kivgaaq. Atuġniaġitka ilivich uqaluktin uvapkun suksraunġiutigilugich iliŋnun. Iḷisimaŋagaluaqtutin suamatilaamnik tigusisuunimniglu pigiŋisamnik, suli kivrisuuvluŋa palauvaksranik nautchirriutigiŋaisamnik.

english: Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank, so that when I returned I could have collected it with interest?’
inupiaq: Summan aasiuvva ikuŋitpigich manitka maniqaġviŋmun, aasii qaiguma tasuġayakkatka naggutituummaisa.

english: And he said to his attendants, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to the one who has ten.’
inupiaq: Tavra umialik uqallaŋaruq tamatkunuŋa makitaruanun saniġaani, Pisigik kaviqsuat maniich ilaaniñ, aasii qaiḷḷugich taavrumuŋa kivgamun qulinik maniqaqtuamun.

english: But they said to him, ‘Sir, he has ten minas already!’
inupiaq: Tavra kivgat uqallautigaluaġaat, Umialiik, qulitun maniqaaniŋaruq.

english: ‘I tell you that everyone who has will be given more, but from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
inupiaq: Umialgata kiuŋagai, Uqallautigivsi, iñupayaaq aŋalatchiḷḷuataqtuaq aitchuusiaqavsaaġniaqtuq, aglaan taamna naurrutinnaŋitchuaq mikiruuraqunnii pigikkaŋa, piiqsauniaqtuq ilaaniñ.

english: But as for these enemies of mine who did not want me to be their king, bring them here and slaughter them in front of me!’”
inupiaq: Taipkualiasii uumigiritka, umialiqaġuŋitchuat uvamnik, uvuŋautisigik aasii tuquġaġlugich sivuqqamni.

english: After Jesus had said this, he continued on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Taamna uqausiġianikamiuŋ, Jesus aullaqivsaaŋaruq Jerusalem-mun sivuanni iñuich.

english: Now when he approached Bethphage and Bethany, at the place called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of the disciples,
inupiaq: Tavra qallikami Bethphage-mun Bethany-mullu, tikiññamiŋ iġġimun atiqaqtuamun Olives, ilaa tilisiŋaruq malġugnik iḷitchitquramiñiñ,

english: telling them, “Go to the village ahead of you. When you enter it, you will find a colt tied there that has never been ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugik, Aullaġitchik ininun sivuniptiŋnun. Aasii tikipqaġuptik, paqinniaqtutik kakaktim nuġġaŋanik pituqaqtuamik, iñuum kakaksiġvigiŋaisaŋanik. Pituiġḷugu qaġġisiyumagiktik.

english: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ just say, ‘The Lord needs it.’”
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa apiġikpatik, Summan pituigaqsivitkuuna, uqallautiyumagiktik inna, Atanġum atuġukkaa.

english: So those who were sent ahead found it exactly as he had told them.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkuak tilirauruak aullaŋaruk aasii paqinŋagaak Jesus uqausiatun inmiŋnun.

english: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying that colt?”
inupiaq: Tavra pituiqsisaġniaqtillugik kakaktimik, iñuŋisa kakaktim uqallautiŋagaik, Summan pituigaqsivitku kakakti?

english: They replied, “The Lord needs it.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋik uqallaŋaruk, Atanġum atuġukkaa.

english: Then they brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt, and had Jesus get on it.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋikta qaġġisiŋagaak kakakti Jesus-mun, aasii iñuich qalliqsuutivlugich annuġaatiŋ kakaktimun, Jesus kakaksirraqsiŋaruq.

english: As he rode along, they spread their cloaks on the road.
inupiaq: Tavra kakaksiqsillugu, iñuich siaminŋagaich annuġaatiŋ apqutinun.

english: As he approached the road leading down from the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of his disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen:
inupiaq: Tavra qallimman Jerusalem-mun, atqaġiaŋanun iḷimman iġġimun Olives-mun, iñusalaich iḷitchitquraŋi quviatcharraqsiŋarut suli nanġaqługu God nipatuvlutiŋ, pisigivlugich iluqaisa kamanaqtuat savaat tautuŋaratiŋ,

english: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ Umialik qairuaq pisivlugu Ataniq. Nanġaqtauli God qiḷaŋmiittuaq tutqiutiqaqtitchiruaq.

english: But some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples.”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋisa Pharisees iñusalaŋniittuat uqallautiŋagaat Jesus, Iḷisaurrii, suakkich iḷitchitquratin nipaisaaqulugich.

english: He answered, “I tell you, if they keep silent, the very stones will cry out!”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Uqallautigivsi, ukua nipaiġaluaqpata, uyaġaich nipaallakkumiñaqtut.

english: Now when Jesus approached and saw the city, he wept over it,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qallikami tautukługu iniqpak qirratigiŋagai Jerusalem iñuŋi,

english: saying, “If you had only known on this day, even you, the things that make for peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, Uvvaunnii uvlupak puttuqsriyumiñaġaluaqtusi suruksrautilaavsiññik tutqiutiqaġukkuvsi. Aglaan paŋmapak puttuqsriŋitchusi.

english: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and surround you and close in on you from every side.
inupiaq: Qanuq uvlut tikiññiaqtut uumigirivsi avanniaġaat iniqpaksi, saulugu avatiksi aniyumiñaiyaġlusi, quġġutilusiḷu sumiḷḷiqaa.

english: They will demolish you – you and your children within your walls – and they will not leave within you one stone on top of another, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation from God.”
inupiaq: Aasii iliŋisa suksraunġipiallagniaġaasi iniqpaksiḷu, katchisiḷu, suli uyaġak atausiq unnii nuunniaġaat inaaniñ, qanuq puttuqsriŋaitkiksi God qaigaluaġman annautisukłusi.

english: Then Jesus entered the temple courts and began to drive out those who were selling things there,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun, aasii anittaaqsivḷugich tamatkua tauqsiqsuqtuat,

english: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have turned it into a den of robbers!”
inupiaq: uqallautivlugich, Aglausimaruq Bible-ni God-im uqallautaa inna, “Uvaŋa igluqpaga taggisiqaġniaqtuq iñupayaat aŋaiyyuyaqtuġviannik.” Aglaalli ilivsi iriqtuġviḷiutiŋagiksi tigligayuktinun.

english: Jesus was teaching daily in the temple courts. The chief priests and the experts in the law and the prominent leaders among the people were seeking to assassinate him,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisaurriraqtuq uvlutuaġman aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik umialiŋnaŋisalu iñuich tuqutchukkaluaŋagaat,

english: but they could not find a way to do it, for all the people hung on his words.
inupiaq: aglaan qanuġlugu pisausiiñŋagaat, qanuq iluqaġmiŋ iñuich masaġnisigiŋagaich ilaan uqaluŋi.

english: Now one day, as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaiming the gospel, the chief priests and the experts in the law with the elders came up
inupiaq: Uvlut iḷaŋanni, Jesus iḷisaurripkaqtillugu iñuŋnik aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi suli alġaqsruivḷuni tusaayugaaġiksuamik, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik, piqatigivlugich Jew-guruat umialiŋnaŋich ullaŋagaat Jesus.

english: and said to him, “Tell us: By what authority are you doing these things? Or who it is who gave you this authority?”
inupiaq: Aasii apiġivlugu, Uqallautitigut sum ataniġnaqutaagun tamatkua pivigich? Kia taavrumiŋa ataniġnaqusiqpatin tamatkua pitquvlugich?

english: He answered them, “I will also ask you a question, and you tell me:
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uvaŋaptauġli apiġiniaġivsi apiqqunmik. Paŋmapak uqallautisiŋa,

english: John’s baptism – was it from heaven or from people?”
inupiaq: Kia ataniġnaqutiksriñŋavauŋ John paptaiqsiñiksraŋagun, God-im naagga iñuum?

english: So they discussed it with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa uqaaġutigiŋagaat taamna avanmun, Uqallakkupta God-miñ piñiḷugu, ilaa uqallagniaqtuq, Summan John ukpiġiŋaitpisiuŋ?

english: But if we say, ‘From people,’ all the people will stone us, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
inupiaq: Aglaattauq uqallakkupta, Iñuŋniñ piñiḷugu, iñuich iluqaġmiŋ miḷuqtuġniaġaatigut uyaġaŋnik, qanuq iliŋisa ukpiġipiallakkaat John uqaqtautilaaŋa God-mun.

english: So they replied that they did not know where it came from.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa kiuŋagaat nalunivḷutiŋ sumiñ pisilaaŋanik John paptaiqsiñiŋa.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by whose authority I do these things.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Uvaŋaptauq uqallautiyumiñaiñmigivsi kimun ataniġnaqutiksrisilaamnik tamatkuniŋa piyumiñaqsivḷuŋa.

english: Then he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey for a long time.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqautirraqsiŋagai iñuich uumiŋa uuktuunmik, Iñuk nautchirriiruaq siiġñaqaġviŋmik, aasii atukkirrutigivlugu napaaqsiqirinun, aasii aullaqłuni allamun nunamun sivisuuraqtuami.

english: When harvest time came, he sent a slave to the tenants so that they would give him his portion of the crop. However, the tenants beat his slave and sent him away empty-handed.
inupiaq: Tavra piviksraq tikiñman, ilaa tilisiŋaruq kivgamik napaaqsiqirinun, ilaiññun aitchuquvluni piksraunmiñik siiġñiaŋiññiñ. Tavra napaaqsiqirit anaumiŋagaat kivgaq, aasii aullaqtiłługu aitchuġaluaġnagu.

english: So he sent another slave. They beat this one too, treated him outrageously, and sent him away empty-handed.
inupiaq: Tavra iñua siiġñaqaġvium tilisivsaaŋaruq allamik kivgamik. Taamnasuli anaumiŋagaat aŋalataġivlugulu kanŋunaqtuakun, aasii aullaqtiłługusuli aitchuġaluaġnagu.

english: So he sent still a third. They even wounded this one, and threw him out.
inupiaq: Tilisivsaalgitchuq suli piŋatchiqł̣ugu, taamna anniaŋalgitkaat aniłługulu.

english: Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I will send my one dear son; perhaps they will respect him.’
inupiaq: Tavra iñua siiġñaqaġvium uqallaŋaruq, Qanuġniaqpik uvaŋa? Tiliñiaġiga piviuttaġikkaġa iġñiġa. Nalupqinaitchuamik taluġiniaġaat.

english: But when the tenants saw him, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir; let’s kill him so the inheritance will be ours!’
inupiaq: Tavra napaaqsiqirit tautukamirruŋ, uqaqatigiiŋarut avanmun, Tamarra kiŋuvaannaktuksraun. Tuqullakput kiŋuvaannaktaaksraun uvagut pigiyumagikput.

english: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
inupiaq: Tavra aninŋagaat siiġñaqaġviŋmiñ aasii tuqułługu. Tavraasii Jesus apiġiŋagai, Qanuq aasii piñiaqpa iñua siiġñaqaġvium napaaqsiqirinun?

english: He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” When the people heard this, they said, “May this never happen!”
inupiaq: Ilaan qaiḷuni tuqunniaġai taapkua napaaqsiqirit, aasii aitchuutigilugu siiġñaqaġvik allanun napaaqsiqirinun. Taamna iñuich tusaakamirruŋ, iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Tainna piññani.

english: But Jesus looked straight at them and said, “Then what is the meaning of that which is written: ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone’?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiviaqługich iñuich uqallaŋaruq, Sunamiuvvauna aglausimava Bible-ni inna? “Kaŋiġalluŋmi uyaġagruaq, piitchuiññiqsrapiaq igluqpiñiġmi, taamna igluqpirit iginŋagaat.”

english: Everyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls will be crushed.”
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa puukaqtuaq taavrumuŋa uyaġaŋmun kanuġġirauniaqtuq. Aasiisuli uyaġak kattaqinnikkumi iñuŋmik kanuġġiñiaġaa suksraunġipiaġlugu.

english: Then the experts in the law and the chief priests wanted to arrest him that very hour, because they realized he had told this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu tigutaaqsaġumaalliŋagaluaġaat Jesus tavrauvvaa, qanuq ilaisa puttuqsriŋagaat ilaan quliaqtuaġikkaŋa uuktuun inmiŋnun tuttiłługu, aglaan sivuuġagivlugich iñuich tiguŋaitkaat.

english: Then they watched him carefully and sent spies who pretended to be sincere. They wanted to take advantage of what he might say so that they could deliver him up to the authority and jurisdiction of the governor.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich nalautitchiiŋarut piviksramik. Tavra tilisiŋarut suiḷaukkirinik ukpiġnaqsisaqługich, Jesus uuktuġukługu apiqsruqtuutinik aitchuutigillasisukkaluaqługu kavanamun.

english: Thus they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach correctly, and show no partiality, but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.
inupiaq: Taapkua suiḷaukkirit apiġiŋagaat Jesus, Iḷisaurrii, iḷisimarugut uqaġuutilaaġnik iḷisaurrisuutilaaġniglu nalaunŋaruanik. Suli iḷisimarugut suliqutigiŋitkiñ iñuum surautilaaŋa aglaan iḷisaurrutigigiñ iḷumutun ittuaq God-im pitqutaa iñuŋmun.

english: Is it right for us to pay the tribute tax to Caesar or not?”
inupiaq: Uqallautitigut paaqsaaŋava uvagut pitquraptiŋni naagga nalaunŋava akiḷiiruni taxes-nik Caesar-mun Rome-miut umialgannun?

english: But Jesus perceived their deceit and said to them,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus puttuqsriŋagaa iñuich savituġmiaġutaat, aasii uqallautivlugich,

english: “Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?” They said, “Caesar’s.”
inupiaq: Mannisiuŋ uvamnun maniuraq. Kia una arriŋa aglaŋiḷu. Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Caesar-m.

english: So he said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Tavra aitchuutigisigik Caesar-mun sut Caesar-m piŋi, aasiiḷi God-mun sut God-im piŋi.

english: Thus they were unable in the presence of the people to trap him with his own words. And stunned by his answer, they fell silent.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa pisaġiŋaitkaat apiqsruqtuunmiŋnik takkuanni iñuich. Aasii nipaiġutiŋarut aliuġivlugich kiggutiŋi.

english: Now some Sadducees (who contend that there is no resurrection) came to him.
inupiaq: Tavrani ullautiŋarut Jesus-mun iḷaŋich Sadducees, tamatkua uqaġuuruat aŋŋisaiññivḷugu tuqqunmiñ. Tavra ilaisa apiġiŋagaat Jesus apiqqunmik.

english: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies leaving a wife but no children, that man must marry the widow and father children for his brother.
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrii, Moses aglaŋaruq uumiŋa pitquramik maŋŋuuptiŋnun uvaptiŋnullu. Iñuum aniqataa tuqukpan, qimaglugu nuliani miqłiqsigaluaġnani, aniqataanun tuvaaqasiutitquvlugu nuliaŋa, aasii qitunġiuġluni aniqatini pisilugu.

english: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died without children.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat malġuuŋarut aniqatigiich. Tavra aŋayukłiq nuliaŋaruq, aasii tuquvluni kiŋuvaaligaluaġnani.

english: The second
inupiaq: Tavra tugliata nuliaŋagaa, aasii tuquŋammiuq kiŋuvaaligaluaġnanisuli.

english: and then the third married her, and in this same way all seven died, leaving no children.
inupiaq: Piŋayuak suli tuquŋammiuq. Tavra tallimat malġuk nuliaŋagaat, aasii kiŋuvaaliŋaitchut.

english: Finally the woman died too.
inupiaq: Aqulliuvluni iluqaŋiññiñ aġnaq tuquŋammiuq.

english: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For all seven had married her.”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋŋiviŋmi, aŋikpata nalliata nuliaġiniaqpauŋ? Qanuq tallimat malġuk nuliaġiŋagaat.

english: So Jesus said to them, “The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Aŋutillu aġnallu katititchuurut mattumani nunami,

english: But those who are regarded as worthy to share in that age and in the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
inupiaq: aglaan tamatkua nalliummatiruat aŋipkaqtauniġmun tuqqunmiñ, aasii iñuulutiŋ taimanigu katitinniaŋitchut.

english: In fact, they can no longer die, because they are equal to angels and are sons of God, since they are sons of the resurrection.
inupiaq: Tuqutqikkumiñaitchut qanuq irrusiñiktut isaġuliktun. Suli iġñiġiliutiŋagai God-im qanuq aŋipkaqtauŋarut tuqqunmiñ.

english: But even Moses revealed that the dead are raised in the passage about the bush, where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
inupiaq: Moses nalupqinaiqł̣ugu ukpiġnaqsiŋagaa tuquŋaruat aŋipkaqtauniaġnivḷugich. Tautukługich ikualaruat uqpiich tusaaŋagaa God uqallaktuaq, “God-auruŋa Abraham-mun Isaac-mullu Jacob-mullu.” Taapkua iñuich iñuurut suli.

english: Now he is not God of the dead, but of the living, for all live before him.”
inupiaq: Ilaa God-auŋitchuq tuquŋaruanun, aglaan God-igigaat iñuuruat. Qanuq iluqaġmiŋ iñuurut ilaanun.

english: Then some of the experts in the law answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well!”
inupiaq: Tavra Iḷaŋich iḷisaurrit pitquranik uqallaŋarut, Iḷisaurrii, Kiulluataġitin.

english: For they did not dare any longer to ask him anything.
inupiaq: Aasii iliŋich apiqsriyummataiŋarut ilaanun qanusipayaamik apiqqunmik.

english: But he said to them, “How is it that they say that the Christ is David’s son?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus apiġiŋagai, Qanuġlutiŋ uqallausiġiyumiñaqparruŋ Christ iġñiġiniḷugu David-mun.

english: For David himself says in the book of Psalms,
inupiaq: Qanuq David ilaa uqallaŋaruq makpiġaani Psalms-ni inna, “Ataniq uqallaŋaruq Atanimnun, Aquvittin taliqpiŋma tuŋaanun

english: ‘The Lord said to my lord,
inupiaq: uumigiritin uvamnun akiiḷitchiaġilugich.”

english: “Sit at my right hand,
inupiaq: David ilaata taigaa Ataniġmiñik. Qanuqłuni Christ-guruaq David-gum taikkaŋa Ataniġmiñik kiŋuniġiyumiñaqpauŋ?

english: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’
inupiaq: Suli tusaġnaqsivḷugu iluqaiññun iñuŋnun, Jesus uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani,

english: If David then calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi iḷisaurriñiñ pitquranik kukiḷullaturuaniñ akuqturuanik annuġaaqaqłutiŋ, iḷisimatquvlutiŋ suutilaamiŋnik aasii iñupayaanun purvigitquvlutiŋ tauqsiqsuġviŋñi. Iliŋich aquppiutaksrallatummiut kamanaqtuat aquppiutaŋiññik aŋaiyyuviŋñi, suli kamanaqtuat aquppiutaŋiññi aquppiḷḷatuvlutiŋ niqinaqimmata.

english: As all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisasuli ivayaqtuġmiraġigaich uiḷgaŋaruat igluŋiññiglu tigligaivḷugich, aasii taimma maniugaqsivḷutiŋ nakuurualivḷutiŋ takiruanik aŋaiyyuvlutiŋ. Tamatkua pisigilugich, tatavsausiaŋat pigiił̣haaġniaqtuq.

english: “Beware of the experts in the law. They like walking around in long robes, and they love elaborate greetings in the marketplaces and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
They devour widows’ property, and as a show make long prayers. They will receive a more severe punishment.”
Jesus looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the offering box.
inupiaq: Jesus qiviaqłuni tautuŋagai suġalliruat iksriruat aitchuunmiŋnik aŋaiyyuvikpaum maniqaġvianun.

english: He also saw a poor widow put in two small copper coins.
inupiaq: Suli tautuŋammigaa iḷiappauruaq uiḷgaŋaruaq iksriruaq malġugnik kannuyaŋnik maniuraŋnik.

english: He said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, una iḷiappauruaq uiḷgaŋaruaq ikisił̣hamaaqtuq iluqaiññiñ allaniñ iñuŋniñ.

english: For they all offered their gifts out of their wealth. But she, out of her poverty, put in everything she had to live on.”
inupiaq: Qanuq iluqaġmiŋ ikisiŋarut piukkaġniġmiŋniñ, aasii ilaa pisuksiuniġmiñiñ ikisiŋaruq iluqaanik pimiñik, iñuusautiksratualuŋmiñikunnii.

english: Now while some were speaking about the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and offerings, Jesus said,
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋisa uqallausiġimmarruŋ aŋaiyyuvikpak, qanutun qiñiyunaġniŋa uyaġagruaġiksuanik aitchuutiniglu God-mun piqaqłuni, Jesus uqallaŋaruq,

english: “As for these things that you are gazing at, the days will come when not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”
inupiaq: Tautuksigik tamatkua iluqaisa. Taimanigu kisiŋŋuqtaqaġumiñaitchuq uyaqqaŋnik qaliġiiksuaŋnik ulġutauniaŋitchuaŋnik.

english: So they asked him, “Teacher, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that these things are about to take place?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Iḷisaurrii, qakugu taamna piñiaqpa? Suli sumik nalunaiñŋutaqaġniaqpa taamna piyumaagaqsikpan?

english: He said, “Watch out that you are not misled. For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them!
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Qaunagisitchi. Iñuŋmun sagluqipkaġnasi. Qanuq iñugiaktuat iñuich qaiñiaqtut uvaŋauŋŋuaqtuat uqaġlutiŋ, Uvaŋa Christ-guruŋa, uqaġlutiglu, Tavraġuutigaatigut. Ilivsi malignagich.

english: And when you hear of wars and rebellions, do not be afraid. For these things must happen first, but the end will not come at once.”
inupiaq: Suli tusaaguvsi aŋuyaŋnik suli piallakłutiŋ sivuniksraiḷḷitchuanik, iqsiñasi, qanuq tamatkua piqqaaqtuksraurut, aglaan isuksraq tikiñŋaitchuq suli.

english: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagai, Nunauruat aŋuyaŋniaqtut allanun nunauruanun. Suli umialiqaqtuat aŋuyaŋniaqtut allanun umialiqaqtuanun.

english: There will be great earthquakes, and famines and plagues in various places, and there will be terrifying sights and great signs from heaven.
inupiaq: Nunalu aulaviñaqtaġniaqtuq, suli sumiḷiqaa inini niqaiḷḷiuqtaġniaqtut naŋirrutiqpaiḷḷu, suli piñiaqtut iqsiñaqtuat kamanaqtuallu allayuaġnaqtuat siḷami.

english: But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you, handing you over to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and governors because of my name.
inupiaq: Aglaan tamatkua iluqaġmiŋ sivuanni, iñuich tiguniaġaasi nagliksaaqtillusiḷu. Aitchuutiginiaġaasiḷu aŋaiyyuviŋñun tigutaaġviŋñullu, qaġġirrauraġaġniaġmiusi sivuġaannun umialgich atanaurallu pisigiluŋa.

english: This will be a time for you to serve as witnesses.
inupiaq: Tavrani nalautinniaqtuq ilivsi quliaqtuaġviksraqsi tusaayugaaġiksuanik.

english: Therefore be resolved not to rehearse ahead of time how to make your defense.
inupiaq: Tigukpasi uŋiarrisiginagu sivuani qanuq uqaġniksraqsi.

english: For I will give you the words along with the wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to withstand or contradict.
inupiaq: Qanuq aitchuġniaġivsi uqaluksravsiññik isumattutiksravsiññiglu. Nalliataunnii uumigirivsi igḷutuġumiñaisaŋannik qapiqtaġumiñaisaŋanniglu.

english: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will have some of you put to death.
inupiaq: Aitchuutigiraġaġniaġaasi unnii aŋayuqaavsi aniqatiivsiḷu nanmiñikkaluavsiḷu avilaitqatikkaluavsiḷu, aasiisuli iḷasi tuqunniaġaich.

english: You will be hated by everyone because of my name.
inupiaq: Uumiginiaġaasi iñupayaat pisigiluŋa.

english: Yet not a hair of your head will perish.
inupiaq: Aglaan nalupqinaitchuamik annaurrauniaqtusi, nusaqsiunnii atausiq tammaŋiñmatun.

english: By your endurance you will gain your lives.
inupiaq: Qapiġnasi suuramik-unnii, qanuq qapiŋitkuvsi, annautiniaġisi iñuggutisi.

english: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation has come near.
inupiaq: Tavraaglaan tautukkuvsiuŋ Jerusalem avanniqparruŋ aŋuyaich, tavrani iḷisimayumausi suksraunġiqsauniksraŋa qallisilaaŋanik.

english: Then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains. Those who are inside the city must depart. Those who are out in the country must not enter it,
inupiaq: Tavraniasii tamatkua Judea-miittuat pigruġlich iġġiñun, suli tamatkua iniqpaŋmiittuat aullaġlutiŋ, suli tamatkua nunamiittuat isiġnagu iniqpak.

english: because these are days of vengeance, to fulfill all that is written.
inupiaq: Qanuq tavrani isagutiniaqtut tatavsausiaksraŋich iñuich nalautitchaġlugich iluqaisa Bible uqaluŋich.

english: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days! For there will be great distress on the earth and wrath against this people.
inupiaq: Qanutun naglignaqtiginiaqtut aġnat siŋaiyauruat, aakauruallu miqłiqtuuraqaqłutiŋ. Qanuq kamanaqtuaq iłuiḷḷiuġutiqpak qaiñiaqtuq nunamun qinnautaalu God-im ukunuŋa iñuŋnun.

english: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be led away as captives among all nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
inupiaq: Iñuich savikpaŋnik tuquġaġniaġaich, suli iñuich tigutaaqtaulutiŋ nunapayaani. Suli Jerusalem aŋalanniaġaat Jew-guŋitchuat, piviksraŋat Jew-guŋitchuat nalaulġataqtillugu.

english: “And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars, and on the earth nations will be in distress, anxious over the roaring of the sea and the surging waves.
inupiaq: Tavra siqiñiġmi tatqimiḷu uvluġianiḷu allanaqtuat piyumaaqtut kiliktuutit iñuŋnun. Suli nunami iluqaani nunauruat tutqiiḷiñiaqtut qanuqsausiiġḷutiglu sutigun iqsitchautaullaruatigun ulivrigaqpaktuatun taġiutun qasaqtaqtuatullu qaiḷḷiqsun.

english: People will be fainting from fear and from the expectation of what is coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
inupiaq: Iñuich sayaiġñiaqtut sivuuġavaiḷḷutiŋ sutigun piruatigun nunami iluqaani, qanuq qaummatit siḷamiittuat uniuqtinniaqtut inimiŋniñ.

english: Then they will see the Son of Man arriving in a cloud with power and great glory.
inupiaq: Tavraniasiiñ tautugniaġaat Iġñiŋa iñuum qairuaq nuvuyakun suaŋŋatiqaġluni suli kamanaqtuamik qaumaniġmik.

english: But when these things begin to happen, stand up and raise your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua piraġaaqsikpata, qiviaġitchi qunmun suli aaġluġlusi, qanuq annaurrauniksraqsi qalliruq.

english: Then he told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the other trees.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus quliaqtuaġutiŋagai uuktuunmik. Tautuksiuŋ fig napaaqtua, iluqaisalu napaaqtut.

english: When they sprout leaves, you see for yourselves and know that summer is now near.
inupiaq: Tavra tautukavsigik napaaqtut akutuqpaŋich nausaġataaqsimmata, iḷisimarusi upinġayasisilaaŋanik.

english: So also you, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq, tautukkuvsigik tamatkua iqsiñaqtuat nalaurraqsikpata, iḷisimaniaqtusi God-im atanniqsimmataa qallisilaaŋanik.

english: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
inupiaq: Iḷumun uqallautigivsi, ukua iñuich tuquaniŋniaŋitchut iluqaisa tamatkua nalaunŋaunnagich.

english: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
inupiaq: Qiḷaglu nunalu piiġñiaqtuk, aglaan uqalutka piiġñiaŋitchut.

english: “But be on your guard so that your hearts are not weighed down with dissipation and drunkenness and the worries of this life, and that day close down upon you suddenly like a trap.
inupiaq: Aglaan qaunagisitchi ilivsiññun. Aptatiqaġnasi niqinaqivaił̣aglusi imiŋasiḷusiḷu, suli uŋiarrisigilugich iñuggutisi, qanuq iḷaanni taamna uvlua Atanġum qaiñiaqtuq tavraŋŋatchiaq niġiuŋisillusi.

english: For it will overtake all who live on the face of the whole earth.
inupiaq: Qanuq taamna uvluq qaiyumaaqtuq iluqaiññun iñupayaanun nunamiittuanun, niġiiḷḷautiluni naniġiaq umiksaġmatun.

english: But stay alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that must happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi quviqtaiḷiyumausi ataramik, aŋaiyyuuġlusi suaŋŋatiqaġuglusi pillukkumiñaġlugich sugaluaġnasi iluqaisa tamatkua piyumaaqtuat, suli makitayumiñaġuglusi sivuġaani Iġñiŋata iñuum.

english: So every day Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, but at night he went and stayed on the Mount of Olives.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uvlutuaġman iḷisaurriŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, aasii unnuaġmagu unnuiyaqtuqłuni iġġimun atiqaqtuamun Olives-mik.

english: And all the people came to him early in the morning to listen to him in the temple courts.
inupiaq: Aasii uvlaatchaurami iñuich iluqaġmiŋ ullagaġigaat aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun naalagiaqługu.

english: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
inupiaq: Niqinaqivik Puvlaksiŋaitchuamik Punniġmik qalliŋaruq, atiqaqtuaq Itqaunmik Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun.

english: The chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find some way to execute Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.
inupiaq: Aasii aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik piviksraqsiuŋarut qanuġlugu tuqutchukługu Jesus, suiḷauriḷutiŋ sivuuġagivlugich iñuich.

english: Then Satan entered Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.
inupiaq: Tavra Satan isiŋaruq Judas-mun taggisiqaqtuamun Iscariot-mik, iḷauruaq qulit malġuŋnun iḷitchitquranun.

english: He went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers of the temple guard how he might betray Jesus, handing him over to them.
inupiaq: Ilaa aullaŋaruq aasii uqaqatigiaqsivḷugich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu atanauraŋiḷḷu aŋaiyyuvikpaum munaqsriŋisa, qanuġlugu aitchuutigisukługu Jesus iliŋiññun.

english: They were delighted and arranged to give him money.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich quyatchaŋarut, suli aitchuġuŋagaat maniŋñik.

english: So Judas agreed and began looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus when no crowd was present.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas aŋiŋammiuq, aasii piviksraqsiugaqsivḷuni aitchuutigisukługu Jesus ilaiññun iñuich quviġlugich.

english: Then the day for the feast of Unleavened Bread came, on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋaruq uvlua Puvlaksiŋaitchuam Punniġum, taamna qulaurrusiqutim imnaiyaam tuqutauviksraŋa.

english: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us to eat.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tiliŋagik Peter-lu John-lu uqallakłuni, Aullaġlutik itqanaiyautiyaqtuqtigut qulaurrusiqinikun niġiyumaugut.

english: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
inupiaq: Iliŋikta apiġiŋagaak, Sumun itqanaiyaġiaquvisiguk taavrumiŋa.

english: He said to them, “Listen, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagik, Naalaġnisitchik. Aullaġitchik iniqpaŋmun, aasii paaġniaġaatik iñuum saagaqtuam qattamun imiġmik. Malikkumagiktik,

english: and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
inupiaq: aasii sumupayaaq isiqpan, uqallautiyumagiktik iñua iglum, Iḷisaurri uqallaktuaq, Sumiitpa tuyuġmiaqaġvik, niġġiviksraqput iḷitchitquratkalu qulaurrusiqunmik?

english: Then he will show you a large furnished room upstairs. Make preparations there.”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisautiniaġaatik inituruamik qiḷaguamik upaluŋaitchuamik. Tavrani itqanaiyautiyumagiptigut.

english: So they went and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
inupiaq: Tavra aullaŋaruk, aasii paqinŋagaak Jesus uqausiatun inmiŋnun, aasii iliŋik itqanaiyaŋaruk qulaurrusiqutiksramik.

english: Now when the hour came, Jesus took his place at the table and the apostles joined him.
inupiaq: Tavra ikarraq tikiñman, Jesus aquvinŋaruq niġġiviŋñun piqatigivlugich tilirat iḷitchitqurani.

english: And he said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Piyummatigipiallakługu niġiqatigiyumaŋagivsi uumiŋa Qulaurrusiqunmik nagliksaaŋaiñŋaġma.

english: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Qanuq uqallautigivsi, niġitqigñiaŋitkiga tikitchiaġilugu sivunipiaŋa atanniqsimaviani God-im.

english: Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks he said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tiguŋagaa qallugauraq, aasii quyaanikami God-mun, uqallaŋaruq, Tigulugu taamna, autaaqsiuŋ ilivsiññun.

english: For I tell you that from now on I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautigivsi paŋmapaŋmiñ aglaan, imiġniaŋitchuŋa uumiŋa wine-mik qaiñiŋanun aglaan atanniqsimavia God-im.

english: Then he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
inupiaq: Jesus tiguŋagaa punniq, aasii quyaanikami God-mun, aviŋagaa aitchuutigivlugu ilaiññun uqallakłuni, Tavra taamna timiga aitchuutauruaq ilivsiññun. Taamna pisiuŋ itqaummatigilugu uvamnun.

english: And in the same way he took the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This cup that is poured out for you is the new covenant in my blood.
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli aitchuŋagai qallugauramik nullautchianikamiŋ, uqallakłuni, Una qallugauraq imaqaqtuq uvaŋa aumnik maqipkaqtauruamik pisigivlusi. Taavrumuuna God-im nalupqinaiġñiaġaa sivunniuġutini iñuŋnun.

english: “But look, the hand of the one who betrays me is with me on the table.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq uvva iñuk uvaniittuq niġġiviŋñi aitchuutiginniktuaq uvamnik.

english: For the Son of Man is to go just as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”
inupiaq: Qanuq Iġñiŋa iñuum tuqutinniaqtuq God-im sivunniutaatun, aglaan qanutun naglignaqtigiruq taamna iñuk aitchuutiginniktuaq ilaanik.

english: So they began to question one another as to which of them it could possibly be who would do this.
inupiaq: Tavra apiqsruqtuutirraqsiŋarut avanmun nalliqsiŋ aitchuutiginnigniaġmagaan ilaanik.

english: A dispute also started among them over which of them was to be regarded as the greatest.
inupiaq: Uqavaarraqsiŋarut iḷitchitqurat, nalliqsiŋ isumakkusiaqaġniaqtilaaksraŋanik kamanaġniqsraulugu.

english: So Jesus said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq ilaiññun, umialiŋich Jew-guŋitchuat atanniqsimasuugaich iñutiŋ suli tamatkua umialgich tairauvlutiŋ anniqsuiriñik.

english: Not so with you; instead the one who is greatest among you must become like the youngest, and the leader like the one who serves.
inupiaq: Aglaan tainna ilivsi piñiaŋitchusi. Aglaan kamanaġniqsrauruaq akunnavsiññi iḷiḷi nukaqłiqsun, suli aullarriruaq kivgatun.

english: For who is greater, the one who is seated at the table, or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is seated at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
inupiaq: Nalliak kamanaġniqsrauva, iñuk aquppiruaq niġġiviŋñi, naagga niqłiqsuqtuaq? Taamna aquppiruaq niġġiviŋñi. Aglaan uvaŋa kivgaġimmatun itkivsiŋa.

english: “You are the ones who have remained with me in my trials.
inupiaq: Ilivsi nayuŋagivsiŋa iluqaiññi uuktuaġusiamni.

english: Thus I grant to you a kingdom, just as my Father granted to me,
inupiaq: Aapamali aitchuŋammaŋa atanniqsimmanmik, tainnatulli aitchuġniaġmigivsi atanniqsimmanmik,

english: that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
inupiaq: aasii niġiñiaqtusi imiġlusiḷu niġġivimñi atanniqsimavimñi, suli aquppiḷusi umialgich aquppiutaŋiññi isivġiġḷugich qulit malġuk maŋŋuġiich Israel-guruat.

english: “Simon, Simon, pay attention! Satan has demanded to have you all, to sift you like wheat,
inupiaq: Simon, Simon, naalaġniiñ. Satan uuktuaġumiñaqsiŋagaasi iluqasi, nunaliqiritun palauvaksranik amiġaiyairuatun.

english: but I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. When you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”
inupiaq: Aglaan Simon, aŋaiyyutiŋagikpiñ ukpiġutaiquŋił̣ł̣utin, aasii isumalitqianikkuvich, suaŋasiḷaagaksraġigitin aniqatiitin.

english: But Peter said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, itqanaitchuŋa tigutaaqtauqatigiyumiñaqłutin tuquqatigiyumiñaqłutillu.

english: Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know me.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Uqallautigikpiñ Peter, tiŋmiaq nipanniaŋitchuq uumani uvlumi, ilivich piŋasuiqsuaġlutin piiḷaaganiksiaġilutin naluniḷuŋa.

english: Then Jesus said to them, “When I sent you out with no money bag, or traveler’s bag, or sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?” They replied, “Nothing.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Taimani aullaqtinnavsi maniqaġviił̣aaqłusi puukataiḷaaqłusiḷu aluġuġutaiḷaaqłusiḷu, sumik inuqtuŋavisi? Iḷitchitqurat kiuŋagaat, Inuqtuuraŋaitchugut sumik.

english: He said to them, “But now, the one who has a money bag must take it, and likewise a traveler’s bag too. And the one who has no sword must sell his cloak and buy one.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Aglaan paŋmapak, kiñaliqaa maniqaġviqaqtuaq puukataqaqtuaġlu saagaġligik. Suli kiñaliqaa savikpaitchuaq tauqsiġḷi savikpaŋmik tuniḷugu quppiġaani.

english: For I tell you that this scripture must be fulfilled in me, ‘And he was counted with the transgressors.’ For what is written about me is being fulfilled.”
