inupiaq: Qanuq uqallautigivsi, Bible uqaluat sivuniqaqtuaq uvamnik inna nalauttuksrauruq, “Ilaa kisiuqatauŋaruq piḷuusiqirinun.” Suli supayaat aglausimaruat Bible-ni uvapkun taŋŋiġñiaqtut.

english: So they said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” Then he told them, “It is enough.”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat uqallaŋarut, Tautugiñ Ataniiq, uvva malġuk savikpaak. Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Naamaruk.

english: Then Jesus went out and made his way, as he customarily did, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aniŋaruq, aasii aullaqłuni piḷġusikaamisun iġġimun atiqaqtuamun Olives-mik. Iḷitchitqurat maliŋammigaat.

english: When he came to the place, he said to them, “Pray that you will not fall into temptation.”
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññami inimun ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Aŋaiyyusitchi payaritquŋiḷḷusi ikł̣igutchaktinniaġunmun.

english: He went away from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and prayed,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa taikuŋaqtaallavsaaŋaruq iliŋiññiñ uyaġaŋmik miḷuqsalgutilaavalliqsun, aasii sitquqłuni aŋaiyyuŋaruq.

english: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Yet not my will but yours be done.” [
inupiaq: Aapaaŋ, pisuutigigupku, piiġuŋ nagliksaaġutiqpak uvamniñ. Aasiivsauq uvaŋa pisuutiŋiḷaaptun, aglaan ilivich pisuutin piḷi.

english: Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
inupiaq: Tavra tavrani isaġulik qiḷaŋmiñ niptaŋaruq ilaanun aasii suaŋŋasiqł̣ugu.

english: And in his anguish he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.]
inupiaq: Aasii iłuiḷḷiuġutiqpaqaqłuni ilaa aŋaiyyuŋaruq qapiŋaipiaġataqłuni, suli ilaan siiqsipkaġniŋa kutaaŋaruq nunamun auktun kusiqsuatun.

english: When he got up from prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping, exhausted from grief.
inupiaq: Tavra makinnami aŋaiyyuŋaiqł̣uni, ilaan ullaŋagai iḷitchitqurat suli tautuŋagai siñiktuat, isumaaqpaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: So he said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not fall into temptation!”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Summan siñikpisi? Makillusi aŋaiyyusitchi payariŋitchumagaasi ikł̣igutchaktinniaġutim.

english: While he was still speaking, suddenly a crowd appeared, and the man named Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He walked up to Jesus to kiss him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqaġniaqtillugusuli, iñusalaich qaiŋarut, suli taamna Judas-mik atilik, iḷaŋat qulit malġuk iḷitchitqurat, aullarrivḷuni iliŋiññik. Ilaan ullaŋagaa Jesus kunigiaqługu.

english: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, would you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Judas, aitchuutigiyumaviuŋ Iġñiŋa iñuum kunigḷugu?

english: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said, “Lord, should we use our swords?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat avataaniittuat Jesus, iḷitchuġikamiŋ suna piaqsisilaaŋanik, uqallaŋarut, Ataniiq, savikpagaġniaqpisa?

english: Then one of them struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his right ear.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋata anauŋagaa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaum kivgaŋa, aasii siutaiqł̣ugu taliqpianik.

english: But Jesus said, “Enough of this!” And he touched the man’s ear and healed him.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iñiqtiŋagai, Tavraaġitchi. Aasii ilaan aksiuŋagaa siutaa iłuaqsivḷugu.

english: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders who had come out to get him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs like you would against an outlaw?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun atanauraŋiññullu aŋaiyyuvikpaum munaqsriŋisa umialiŋnanullu tiguriyaqtuqtuanun inmiñik, Qaiŋavisi tigligayuktimik pisaġmatun, savikpaŋnik anauttaniglu satkuqaqłusi tigusaqtuqłuŋa?

english: Day after day when I was with you in the temple courts, you did not arrest me. But this is your hour, and that of the power of darkness!”
inupiaq: Nayuqtigiraġikavsi uvlumiñ uvlumun aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi tigulaitkivsiŋa. Aglaan piviksraqsi nalautittuq, taavrumalu suaŋŋataata taaqtuam.

english: Then they arrested Jesus, led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter was following at a distance.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa tigutaaŋagaat Jesus suli aullautivlugu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaum igluanun. Peter maliġuaŋaruq aquatigun uŋasikł̣uni.

english: When they had made a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
inupiaq: Tavraasii igniqsuaniŋmata qitqanun siḷalliata kasimavium suli aquptaaqłutiŋ atautchimun, Peter aquvinŋammiuq akunġannun.

english: Then a slave girl, seeing him as he sat in the firelight, stared at him and said, “This man was with him too!”
inupiaq: Tavrani niviaqsiam kivgam, tautukługu Peter aquppipkaqtillugu igniġum qaummaŋani uqallaŋaruq, Una iñuk tuvaaqatauŋammiruaq Jesus-mun.

english: But Peter denied it: “Woman, I don’t know him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m piiḷaaġiŋagaa taamna uqallakłuni, Aġnaaq, ilaa uvaŋa nalugiga.

english: Then a little later someone else saw him and said, “You are one of them too.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
inupiaq: Akkuliurallaksiññaġman iñuum tamaaŋŋa tautulgitkaa Peter aasii uqallakłuni, Ilivich uvva iḷagimmigaatin. Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Aŋuun, iḷagiŋitkaanŋa.

english: And after about an hour still another insisted, “Certainly this man was with him, because he too is a Galilean.”
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun ikarraq pianikpalliġman, allasuli iñuk katchuŋaiqsruqłuni uqallaŋaruq, Nalupqinaitchuamik una iñuk piqatauŋaruq Jesus-mun qanuq Galilee-ġmiugummiuq.

english: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” At that moment, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Aŋuun, naluruŋa sumik uqautiqaqtilaaġnik. Tavra tavrauvvaa, uqaġniaqtillugusuli, tiŋmiaq nipanŋaruq.

english: Then the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter, and Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said to him, “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.”
inupiaq: Aasiisuli Ataniq qiviaqłuni qiñiŋagaa Peter. Tavra Peter itqaiŋaruq uqaluanik Atanġum uqallautaanik inmiñun, Sivuani tiŋmiam nipanniksraŋan uvlupak, piiḷaaġiniaġiŋma piŋasuni naluniḷuŋa.

english: And he went outside and wept bitterly.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter aniŋaruq aasii qiapiaġataŋaruq.

english: Now the men who were holding Jesus under guard began to mock him and beat him.
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua munaqsriruat Jesus-mik kipagiŋagaat anaullaqługu.

english: They blindfolded him and asked him repeatedly, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”
inupiaq: Suli irrak mattutchiqł̣ugik apiġiraġaŋagaat, Kia qakiqpatin? Nalautchaġiñ.

english: They also said many other things against him, reviling him.
inupiaq: Suli iliŋich uqallaŋarut iñugiaktuanik uqaluŋnik pisaaŋavlugu uqamaqłuutivlugulu.

english: When day came, the council of the elders of the people gathered together, both the chief priests and the experts in the law. Then they led Jesus away to their council
inupiaq: Tavra uvluġman, umialiŋnaŋich Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik katinŋarut atautchimun, aasii qaġġisiŋagaat Jesus uqaqsitaaġviŋmiŋnun.

english: and said, “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe,
inupiaq: Apiġiŋagaat, Ilivich Christ-guvich? Uqallautitigut. Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Uqallautigaluaġuvsi ukpiġiniaŋitkivsiŋa.

english: and if I ask you, you will not answer.
inupiaq: Suli apiġigaluaġmiguvsi kiummagaaġma, kiuniaŋiñmigivsiŋa nalaunŋaruamik.

english: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
inupiaq: Aglaan paŋmapaŋmiñ Iġñiŋa iñuum aquppiutchiqsauniaqtuq taliqpiata tuŋaanun Sapiġñaqtuam God-im.

english: So they all said, “Are you the Son of God, then?” He answered them, “You say that I am.”
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ uqallaŋarut, Uvvailivich Iġñiġivatin God-im? Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Uqallaktusi Iġñiġinivḷuŋa.

english: Then they said, “Why do we need further testimony? We have heard it ourselves from his own lips!”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Iñuvsaanik pasiññiktuksranik ilaanik piqaqtuksrauŋaiqsugut. Uvagut paŋmapak tusaaganikkivut ilaan uqaluŋi Iġñiġinivḷuni God-mun.

english: Then the whole group of them rose up and brought Jesus before Pilate.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ piqatigiich makinŋarut, aasii qaġġisivlugu Jesus Pilate-mun.

english: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man subverting our nation, forbidding us to pay the tribute tax to Caesar and claiming that he himself is Christ, a king.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa uqautigirraqsiŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷitchuġigikput una iñuk asiñuurriñiaqtuaguvlugu iñuptiŋnik, suli aitchuitquriŋił̣ł̣uni akiḷiutinik taxes-nik Caesar-mun, uqaqłuni ilaa Christ-gunivḷuni umialik.

english: So Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate-gum apiġiŋagaa Jesus, Umialigivatin Jew-guruat? Tavra ilaan kiuŋagaa, Tainna uqallaktutin.

english: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for an accusation against this man.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate uqallaŋaruq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun iñusalaŋnullu, Patchisiksramik iḷitchuġiŋitchuŋa uumani iñuŋmi.

english: But they persisted in saying, “He incites the people by teaching throughout all Judea. It started in Galilee and ended up here!”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich katchuŋaiñŋarut uqaqłutiŋ, Ilaan aŋalayyauġai iñuich, iḷisaurrivḷuni iluqaani Judea-mi, Galilee-miñqaŋa uumuŋaaglaan inimun.

english: Now when Pilate heard this, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate taamna tusaakamiuŋ, apiqsriŋaruq iñuk taamna Galilee-ġmiugummagaan.

english: When he learned that he was from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who also happened to be in Jerusalem at that time.
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate iḷitchuġikami Jesus Herod atanniqsimakkaŋani inniġman, ilaan Herod-muktinŋagaa, Herod Jerusalem-miinmimman taavrumani piviksrami.

english: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, for he had long desired to see him, because he had heard about him and was hoping to see him perform some miraculous sign.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod tautukamiuŋ Jesus, ilaa quyapiaġataŋaruq, qanuq sivisuruami tautugumalaaŋavlugu, pisigivlugich tusaasuukkani ilaagun, suli tautugumaŋagaluaqtuq qanutchimik aliuġnaqtuamik savakpan.

english: So Herod questioned him at considerable length; Jesus gave him no answer.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod-gum sivisuuraqtuami apiqsruqtuŋagaa Jesus, aglaan ilaan kiulaiñŋagaa.

english: The chief priests and the experts in the law were there, vehemently accusing him.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iḷisaurriḷḷu pitquranik makitaruat tamaani, suammakłutiŋ saŋunŋagaat Jesus.

english: Even Herod with his soldiers treated him with contempt and mocked him. Then, dressing him in elegant clothes, Herod sent him back to Pilate.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod-gum aŋuyaktiŋisalu aŋalataġiŋagaat pisaaŋŋatikun kipagivlugulu, kiisaimma annuġaalgitpaat annuġaaġipiaġataqtuanik umialiktun, aasii utiqtiłługu Pilate-mun.

english: That very day Herod and Pilate became friends with each other, for prior to this they had been enemies.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Herod-lu Pilate-lu avilaitqatigiiksinŋaruk avanmun taavrumanipiallak uvlumi, qanuq sivuani taavruma uumikkutiŋagaluaqtuak avanmun.

english: Then Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
inupiaq: Pilate tavrani ququaŋagai atautchimun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu umialiŋnallu iñuiḷḷu,

english: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was misleading the people. When I examined him before you, I did not find this man guilty of anything you accused him of doing.
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugich, Qaġġirriŋagivsiŋa uumiŋa iñuŋmik asiñuurriñiaqtualivḷugu iñuŋnik. Aasii qanuġitilaaqqaaqługu sivuqqavsiññi, iḷitchuġiŋitkiga una iñuk piḷuutiqaġlugu nalliannik unnii pasikkutivsi ilaanun.

english: Neither did Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing deserving death.
inupiaq: Herod unnii iḷitchuġiŋiñmiuq pasikkutiksramik, qanuq utiqtisiññaŋammigaa uvaptiŋnun. Una iñuk piitchuq sumik tuqurrutauyumiñaqtuamik ilaanun.

english: I will therefore have him flogged and release him.”
inupiaq: Tavra ipiġaqtuqtisiññaġniaġiga aasii tigutaaqtauŋaiqsillugu.

english: But they all shouted out together, “Take this man away! Release Barabbas for us!”
inupiaq: [Tavra Pilate tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitchiruksrausuuruq atautchimik tigutaaqtamik niqinaqimmata qulaurrusiqiviŋmun itqaunmi.]

english: (This was a man who had been thrown into prison for an insurrection started in the city, and for murder.)
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich atautchikun nipaallaŋarut, Tuqutauli taamna iñuk, aasii tigutaaqtauŋaiqsillugu Barabbas.

english: Pilate addressed them once again because he wanted to release Jesus.
inupiaq: Barabbas tigutaaqtauruaq pisigivlugu tuavaallaktitchiŋaniŋa iniqpaŋmi iñuaqłuniḷu.

english: But they kept on shouting, “Crucify, crucify him!”
inupiaq: Pilate-gum nivliutitqikkalualgitkai atausivsaami, kipiġniuġaluaqłuni tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitchukługu Jesus.

english: A third time he said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I have found him guilty of no crime deserving death. I will therefore flog him and release him.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich saqłarraqsigiññaŋarut, Kikiaktuutili, kikiaktuutili aŋarrauramun.

english: But they were insistent, demanding with loud shouts that he be crucified. And their shouts prevailed.
inupiaq: Piŋayuaŋni Pilate-gum uqallautigalualgitkai, Summan? Sumik pigiitchuamik piŋava? Iḷitchuġiŋitchuŋa ilaani qanusipayaamik patchisiksramik tuqurrutauyumiñaqtuamik. Tavra ipiġaqtuqtisiññaġlugu tigutaaqtauŋaiqsinniaġiga.

english: So Pilate decided that their demand should be granted.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich katchuŋaiñŋarut, saqłakłutiŋ Jesus kikiaktuutiraksraupiaġnivḷugu aŋarrauramun. Kiisaimmaa saqłakłutiŋ akimavut.

english: He released the man they asked for, who had been thrown in prison for insurrection and murder. But he handed Jesus over to their will.
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate sivunniiŋaruq piruksraġuqługu kipiġniuġutaat.

english: As they led him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country. They placed the cross on his back and made him carry it behind Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan tigutaaqtauŋaiqsinŋagaa iñuk isiqtitauruaq tigutaaġviŋmun tuavaallaktitchiñikun iñuaġnikullu, ilaisa apiqsriaġikkaŋat, aglaan Jesus ilaan aitchuutigiŋagaa ilaiññun qanuq pisukparruŋ pitquvlugu.

english: A great number of the people followed him, among them women who were mourning and wailing for him.
inupiaq: Tavra aullautisaġniallaan Jesus, paaŋagaat iñuk Simon Cyrene-miu, tikitchaġataviksuaq iniqpaŋmun. Tigguġluŋagaat aasii iqsriqł̣ugu aŋarrauramik, iqsruquvlugu aquagun Jesus.

english: But Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
inupiaq: Tavra iñusalaich, maliŋagaat aquagun aġnallu qiaqpakługu Jesus.

english: For this is certain: The days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore children, and the breasts that never nursed!’
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiŋiaqługich uqallautiŋagai, Aġnaat Jerusalem-mi, qirratigiŋaiqsiŋa uvaŋa. Qirratigisitchi ilivsiññun miqłiqtuvsiññullu.

english: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
inupiaq: Qanuq uvlut tikiññiaqtut iñuich uqallagniaġmata, Quviasuglich miqłiqsiḷaitchuat, siŋaiyaulaitchuallu, miluktitchiŋaitchuallu qaŋaunnii.

english: For if such things are done when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
inupiaq: Taimanigu iñuich uqaġniaqtut iġġiñun, Kattaqisigut, Qimiqqamullu iriqtigut.

english: Two other criminals were also led away to be executed with him.
inupiaq: Qanuq tainna pikparruŋ iñuk patchisaitchuaq paŋmapak, qanutun piñiaġmivat iñuŋnun taimanigu?

english: So when they came to the place that is called “The Skull,” they crucified him there, along with the criminals, one on his right and one on his left.
inupiaq: Malġuktauq allak, pitquranik kamaksriŋitchuaq, tuqutauruksraġuŋammigaich piqatigilugu Jesus.

english: [But Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.”] Then they threw dice to divide his clothes.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññamik inimun atiqaqtuamun Niaquġruamik, tavrani kikiaktuutiŋagaat Jesus aŋarrauramun, malġuglu pitquranik kamaksriḷaitchuak ilaan avatiŋnun.

english: The people also stood there watching, but the rulers ridiculed him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Aapaaŋ, suliqutigiŋaiġuŋ itqaumayumiñaiġḷugu piḷuutaat, qanuq nalurut suliqitilaamiŋnik. Suli saaptautigiŋagaich autaaġukługich ilaan annuġaaŋi.

english: The soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine,
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich makitaŋarut tamaani takunnaqłutiŋ. Aglaalli Jew-guruat umialiŋnaŋich kipakłiŋarut ilaanik uqaqłutiŋ, Ilaa annaurriŋaruq allanik, annautimmiḷi inmiñik, ilaa Christ-gugumi God-im Piksraqtaaŋa.

english: and saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit kipagiŋammigaat, ullakługu aitchuŋagaat wine-mik,

english: There was also an inscription over him, “This is the king of the Jews.”
inupiaq: uqallautivlugulu, Umialigikpatin Jew-guruat, annauttuiñ iliŋnik.

english: One of the criminals who was hanging there railed at him, saying, “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
inupiaq: Ukua uqaluich aglautiŋammigaich qulaanun, Unauvva Umialgat Jew-guruat.

english: But the other rebuked him, saying, “Don’t you fear God, since you are under the same sentence of condemnation?
inupiaq: Igḷuata pitquranik kamaksriḷaitchuam niviŋaruam pisaaŋaŋammigaa, uqaqłuni, Christ-guguvich, annautuiñ iliŋnik uvaguglu annautilunuk.

english: And we rightly so, for we are getting what we deserve for what we did, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
inupiaq: Tavra igḷuata suaŋagaa igḷuni uqaqłuni, Sivuuġagiŋitpiuŋ God tainnatuttauq tuquaqsiḷḷamnuk?

english: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come in your kingdom.”
inupiaq: Uvaguk iḷumun piḷḷuataġaatiguk, qanuq aitchuusiaqaqtuguk nalaunŋaruamik savaaptiŋnun, aglaan una iñuk piŋaitchuq sumik pigiitchuamik.

english: And Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq Jesus-mun, Jesus, itqaumayumagiŋma qaiguvich umialiguġlutin.

english: It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷumun uqallautigikpiñ, uvlupak itqatiginiaġiŋma Nakuuvlutiŋ Ayuruat Irvianni.

english: because the sun’s light failed. The temple curtain was torn in two.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluq qitiqqaqpalliġman siqiñiq taaqsiŋaruq nunalu iluqani piŋasunugataqtillugu.

english: Then Jesus, calling out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” And after he said this he breathed his last.
inupiaq: Tavra talukiyaaŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaum aliŋaruq malġuułłuni.

english: Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he praised God and said, “Certainly this man was innocent!”
inupiaq: Tavrani Jesus nipatusivḷuni uqallaŋaruq, Aapaaŋ, qaitkiga ilitqusiġa iliŋnun munaġitquvlugu. Aasii taamna uqallausiġianikługu aniġniġiŋaruq.

english: And all the crowds that had assembled for this spectacle, when they saw what had taken place, returned home beating their breasts.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata iḷitchuġikami taapkuniŋa piruanik, ilaan nanġaŋagaa God uqallakłuni, Nalupqinaitchuamik una iñuk patchisaiñŋaruq.

english: And all those who knew Jesus stood at a distance, and the women who had followed him from Galilee saw these things.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñusalaich kasimaruat qiñiqtuaġiaqłutiŋ, tautuanikamiŋ taapkuniŋa piruanik, utiŋarut aiyaavlutiŋ, atqunaq iłuiḷḷiuġutiqaqłutiŋ.

english: Now there was a man named Joseph who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man.
inupiaq: Suli iluqaġmiŋ Jesus aunniuqsimakkaŋisa, aġnallu maliktuat ilaanik Galilee-miñ, makitaŋarut taavaniqpani qiñiqłutiŋ tamatkuniŋa.

english: (He had not consented to their plan and action.) He was from the Judean town of Arimathea, and was looking forward to the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuqaŋammiuq atiqaqtuamik Joseph-mik qairuamik Jew-guruat nunaaqqianniñ Arimathea-miñ. Ilaa iḷaugaluaqłuni aŋaiyyuvikpaum uqaqsitaaqtitchiriŋiñun, iviġaumagiŋaitkaa sivunniutaat savaaŋallu. Joseph iñulluatauŋaruq isumakkusiaqaġluataqłuniḷu niġiugivlugulu tikiññiksraŋa God-im atanniqsimmataa nunami.

english: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
inupiaq: Taamna iñuk ullautiŋaruq Pilate-mun aasii apiqsriaġivlugu Jesus timaa.

english: Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock, where no one had yet been buried.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan atqaŋagaa timaa, aasii nimaaqługu ukił̣haaġiksuamik iḷuvviuġunmik, aasii iḷuviqługu uyaġagruakun iḷuvviviḷiamun, iñuum qaŋaunnii iḷuviqtauvigiŋaisaŋanun.

english: It was the day of preparation and the Sabbath was beginning.
inupiaq: Taamna uvluq Jew-guruat Itqanaiyaġviat, savaiññiq isagutiaqsivḷuni.

english: The women who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee followed, and they saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnat maliŋaruat Jesus-mik Galilee-miñ piqasiŋagaat Joseph, aasii tautukługu iḷuvvivik, qanuġlu Jesus timaa iḷisilaaŋanik.

english: Then they returned and prepared aromatic spices and perfumes.
inupiaq: Tavraniasii aiŋarut, aasii itqanaiyaqłutiŋ tivraġiksautinik uqsruġutiniglu atugaksramiŋnik Jesus timaanun. Savairraqsimmata iliŋich minġuiqsiŋarut kamagivlugich pitqurat.

english: On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was fully God.
inupiaq: Aullaqisaamiñqaŋa, taamna taggisiqaqtuaq Uqaluŋmik itaniŋaruq supayaat savaaguŋaiñŋaisa. Uqaluk itqatauŋaruq God-mun. Suli Uqaluk God-auŋaruq.

english: The Word was with God in the beginning.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Uqaluk itqatauŋaruq God-mun aullaqisaamiñqaŋa,

english: All things were created by him, and apart from him not one thing was created that has been created.
inupiaq: aasii taavrumuuna Uqalukun God-im savaŋagai supayaat, suli atausiuraq-unnii savaaguŋaruaq savaaguŋaitchuq ilaa piiḷḷugu.

english: In him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.
inupiaq: Uqaluŋmiñ kaŋiqaŋaruq iñuggun, aasii taavruma iñuggutim qaġġirrigai iñuich qaummaġmik, iḷisautivlugich God-im iḷumun ittuaŋanik.

english: And the light shines on in the darkness, but the darkness has not mastered it.
inupiaq: Qaummaqtun qaummaġiksuatun taaqtuami, suli taaqtuam qamilaiñmatun qaummaq, ilaalli iḷisautiŋagai iñuich God-im iḷumun ittuaŋanik aasii tamatkua akiḷḷiḷiqsuutiruat ilaanun payariŋaitkaat ilaa.

english: A man came, sent from God, whose name was John.
inupiaq: Iñuqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik John-mik tiliŋaraanik God-im.

english: He came as a witness to testify about the light, so that everyone might believe through him.
inupiaq: John qaiŋaruq quliaqtuaġiyaqtuqługu ilaa taamna qaummaqtun ittuaq, iñuich iluqaġmiŋ ukpiquvlugich.

english: He himself was not the light, but he came to testify about the light.
inupiaq: John taamnauŋaitchuq qaummaqtun ittuatun, aglaan qaiŋaruq quliaqtuaġisukługu taamna qaummaqtun ittuaq,

english: The true light, who gives light to everyone, was coming into the world.
inupiaq: iḷisaurriruaq iḷumun ittuamik, qaigaqsiruaq nunamun qaġġirriḷuni qaummaġmik iñupayaanun.

english: He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not recognize him.
inupiaq: Ilaa nunamiinŋaruq, ilaan savaŋagaa nuna, aasiiḷi nunapayaat naluŋagaat.

english: He came to what was his own, but his own people did not receive him.
inupiaq: Ilaa qaiŋaruq pimiñun, aasii nanmiñiq iñuŋisa akuqtuŋaitkaat.

english: But to all who have received him – those who believe in his name – he has given the right to become God’s children
inupiaq: Aglaan iluqaisa akuqtuqtini ukpiqtuat inmiñun, ilaan miqłiqtuliutipkaŋagai God-mun.

english: – children not born by human parents or by human desire or a husband’s decision, but by God.
inupiaq: Tamatkua aniŋaitchut iñugruiññaum aniñiŋa tuvraġlugu, naaggaunnii pisuutaa iñuum. Iliŋich anitqiŋarut pisuutaagun God-im.

english: Now the Word became flesh and took up residence among us. We saw his glory – the glory of the one and only, full of grace and truth, who came from the Father.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna taggisiqaqtuaq Uqaluŋmik iñuġuŋaruq aasii iñuuqataullakłuni uvaptiŋni, naamaruamik nagliktuutiqpaqaqłuni iḷumun ittuaguvluniḷu. Uvagut tautuŋagikput kamanautaa, kamanaun kisimisualuk Iġñitualuuruam Aapamun pigikkaŋa.

english: John testified about him and shouted out, “This one was the one about whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’”
inupiaq: John quliaqtuaqaŋaruq ilaanik, suli nipatuvluni uqaqłuni, Uvva taimña quliaqtuaġiŋaraġa, iñuk qairuaq aqupkun kamanałhaaqtuq uvamniñ, qanuq sivumni inŋaruq.

english: For we have all received from his fullness one gracious gift after another.
inupiaq: Suli naammataaniñ ilaan nagliktuutiqpaŋmi, nagliktuġayukkaatigut iluqata, aitchuqtuaqłuta nagliktuutinik maligiikł̣ugich.

english: For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came about through Jesus Christ.
inupiaq: God-im qaiñŋagai pitqurat Moses-kun, aglaalli nagliktuutiqpak iḷumun ittuaġlu qaisauŋaruk Jesus Christ-kun.

english: No one has ever seen God. The only one, himself God, who is in closest fellowship with the Father, has made God known.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa tautuŋaitkaa God qaŋaunnii, aglaan Iġñitualuum piviuttaġitchiqsuam Aapamiñ iḷitchuġipkaŋagaa.

english: Now this was John’s testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
inupiaq: Uvvali uqaluktuaŋi John. Jew-guruat tilisiŋarut aŋaiyyuliqsimiŋnik Levi-ñiglu Jerusalem-miñ apiqsruġiaqługu kiummagaan.

english: He confessed – he did not deny but confessed – “I am not the Christ!”
inupiaq: John-gum kiuŋagai nalupqinaiqł̣ugu, Uvaŋa Christ-guŋitchuŋa.

english: So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not!” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No!”
inupiaq: Tavra apiġiŋagaat, Kiuviñmi? Elijah-uvich? Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Elijah-uŋitchuŋa. Uqaqtauvich God-mun Moses-tun itchumaaqtuaq? Ilaan kiuŋagai, Naagga.

english: Then they said to him, “Who are you? Tell us so that we can give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
inupiaq: Ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Kiuviñmi? Kiggutiksraqaġumaugut tilisiruanun uvaptiŋnik. Qanuq uqallausiġiyumiñaqpich ilipkun?

english: John said, “I am the voice of one shouting in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way for the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”
inupiaq: Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Uvaŋa nipatuvluŋa uqaqtuŋa nunagluktuami, uqaluatun Isaiah-m God-im uqaqtaata uqallaŋamman, “Sivukkiksaqsiuŋ apqutaa Atanġum.”

english: (Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.)
inupiaq: Taapkua apiqsruqtuiruat John-mik tilirauŋaniqsut Pharisee-ñiñ.

english: So they asked John, “Why then are you baptizing if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
inupiaq: Ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Christ-guŋitkuvich, naaggaunnii Elijah-uŋitkuvich, naagga taimñauŋitkuvich uqaqtaa God-im, summan paptaiqsivich?

english: John answered them, “I baptize with water. Among you stands one whom you do not recognize,
inupiaq: John kiuŋagai, Uvaŋa paptaiġutiqaqtuŋa imiġmik. Akunnavsiññi imma makitaruq nalukkaqsi,

english: who is coming after me. I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandal!”
inupiaq: taimña qaiyumaaqtuaq aqupkun, aasii nalliummatiŋitchuŋa siŋiiġumiñaġlugik unnii siŋiŋik aluġutiŋikta.

english: These things happened in Bethany across the Jordan River where John was baptizing.
inupiaq: Tamatkua piŋarut Bethany-mi Perea-mi taavanitchiani Jordan, John paptaiqsiviani.

english: On the next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
inupiaq: Uvlutqiŋman John-gum tautuŋagaa Jesus qairuaq tuŋimiñun, aasii uqallaŋaruq, Avva, Imnaiyaaŋa God-im piiqsiruaq piḷuutiŋiññik nunam iñuŋisa.

english: This is the one about whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’
inupiaq: Taavva taimña uqallausiġiŋaraġa, aqupkun iñuk qaiñiaqtuq kamanałhaaqtuaq uvamniñ, qanuq aniŋaiñŋaġma sivumni inŋaruq.

english: I did not recognize him, but I came baptizing with water so that he could be revealed to Israel.”
inupiaq: Naluŋagaluaġiga uvaŋaġruiññaq kisuutilaaŋanik taimña iñuk, naaggauvva tilirauŋaruŋa paptaiġutiqaquvluŋa imiġmik iḷitchuġipkaquvlugu Israel-guruanun kisuutilaaŋanik.

english: Then John testified, “I saw the Spirit descending like a dove from heaven, and it remained on him.
inupiaq: Tavra John quliaqtuaŋaruq uqaqłuni, Tautuŋagiga Ilitqusiġiksuaq atqaqtuaq tiŋmiatun qiḷaŋmiñ, aasii ilaaniiłłuni.

english: And I did not recognize him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining – this is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
inupiaq: Taamna piŋaiñŋaan, naluŋagaluaġiga kisuutilaaŋa, aglaan God-im tilisiruam uvamnik paptaiqsitquvluŋa paptaiġutiqaġluŋa imiġmik uqallautiŋagaaŋa, Iñuk tautukkupku Ilitqusiġiksuam atqaġvigikpagu aasii nayuġlugu, taamnauruq iḷisiñiaqtuaq Ilitqusiġiksuamik iḷuvsiññun.

english: I have both seen and testified that this man is the Chosen One of God.”
inupiaq: Aasii tautuŋavlugu quliaqtuaġigiga ilaa Iġñiġinivḷugu God-mun.

english: Again the next day John was standing there with two of his disciples.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman John makitaqatigiŋagik iḷitchitquraŋni,

english: Gazing at Jesus as he walked by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
inupiaq: aasii qiñiqługu Jesus pisuaqtillugu uqallaŋaruq, Avva God-im Imnaiyaaŋa.

english: When John’s two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurak tusaaŋagaak taamna uqallausiġimmagu, aasii maliŋagaak Jesus.

english: Jesus turned around and saw them following and said to them, “What do you want?” So they said to him, “Rabbi” (which is translated Teacher), “where are you staying?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiŋiaqłuni tautuŋagik maliktuak, aasii uqallautiŋagik, Suvisik? Iliŋikta apiġiŋagaak, Rabbi, (sivuniqaqtuaq Iḷisaurrii), sumi iniqaqpich?

english: Jesus answered, “Come and you will see.” So they came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. Now it was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagik, Qaiḷutik tautugiatku. Tavra tautugiaŋagaak sumi iniqaqtilaaŋa, aasii nayuŋagaak taavrumani uvlumi, qanuq sisamanukpalliqł̣uni.

english: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard what John said and followed Jesus.
inupiaq: Andrew, Simon Peter-m aniqataa igḷuuŋaruq maliktuamun Jesus-mik tusaaqqaaqługu John uqallaŋman.

english: He first found his own brother Simon and told him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is translated Christ).
inupiaq: Ilaan paqitqaaŋagaa aniqatini Simon, aasii uqallautivlugu, Paqinŋagikput Messiah (sivuniqaqtuaq Christ-mik).

english: Andrew brought Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon, the son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).
inupiaq: Ilaan qaġġisiŋagaa Jesus-mun. Jesus qiñiqługu uqallautiŋagaa, Simon-gurutin, iġñiŋa John. Tavraŋŋaaglaan atiqaġniaqtutin Cephas-mik (sivuniqaqtuamik Peter-mik Uyaġagmiglu).

english: On the next day Jesus wanted to set out for Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman Jesus sivunniŋaruq Galilee-mugukłuni. Paqiłługu Philip uqallautiŋagaa, Maliŋŋa.

english: (Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.)
inupiaq: Philip Bethsaida-ġmiuguŋaniqsuq, iniqpaŋmi Andrew-vlu Peter-vlu iñuuviaŋni.

english: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets also wrote about – Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
inupiaq: Tavra Philip paqinŋagaa Nathanael, aasii uqallautivlugu, Paqinŋagikput iñuk Moses-gum pitqurani uqaqtiŋisalu God-im aglautiŋaraat. Taamnauruq Jesus Nazareth-miu, Joseph-gum iġñiŋa.

english: Nathanael replied, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip replied, “Come and see.”
inupiaq: Nathanael-gum uqallautiŋagaa, Sunapayaaq nakuuruaq qaiyumiñaqpa Nazareth-miñ? Philip-gum kiuŋagaa, Qaiḷutin tautugiaġuŋ.

english: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and exclaimed, “Look, a true Israelite in whom there is no deceit!”
inupiaq: Jesus tautukamiuŋ Nathanael ullautiruaq inmiñun, uqallautiŋagaa, Uvva Israel-miupiaġataq, inmiñi sagluqqutaitchuaq.

english: Nathanael asked him, “How do you know me?” Jesus replied, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
inupiaq: Nathanael-gum uqallautiŋagaa Jesus, Qanuqłutin iḷisimaviŋa? Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Philip-mun qaitquŋaiñŋaqpich tautuŋagikpiñ ataaniitillutin fig napaaqtuata.

english: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the king of Israel!”
inupiaq: Nathanael-gum kiuŋagaa, Rabbi, Iġñiġigaatin God-im. Umialigigaatin Israel-guruat.

english: Jesus said to him, “Because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uvva uqallautikapkiñ tautugnivḷutin fig napaaqtuata ataani ukpiliqpich? Tautukkumaaqtutin kamanałhaaqtuanik taavsrumaŋŋa.

english: He continued, “I tell all of you the solemn truth – you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
inupiaq: Suli Jesus uqallautivsaaŋagaa, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigikpiñ, tautugniaġiñ qiḷak aŋmaqtuaq, suli God-im isaġuliŋi mayuqtuat atqaqtuallu Iġñiŋanun Iñuum.

english: Now on the third day there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
inupiaq: Tavra uvluk piŋayuaŋni katirrusiqiŋarut nunaaqqimi Cana-mi Galilee-miittuami, aasii Jesus aakaŋa tavraniinŋaruq.

english: and Jesus and his disciples were also invited to the wedding.
inupiaq: Jesus-tauq iḷitchitquraniḷu aiyugaaqtauŋammiut katirrusiqiruanun.

english: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine left.”
inupiaq: Tavra wine nuŋumman Jesus aakaŋata uqallautiŋagaa wine-gutaiġñivḷugich.

english: Jesus replied, “Woman, why are you saying this to me? My time has not yet come.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aġnaaq uŋiarrisigikkan uvaŋa uŋiarrisaġiŋitkiga. Ikarraġa tikiñŋaitchuqsuli.

english: His mother told the servants, “Whatever he tells you, do it.”
inupiaq: Aakaŋa uqallaŋaruq kivganun, Pisitchi qanupayaaq pitqukpasi.

english: Now there were six stone water jars there for Jewish ceremonial washing, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
inupiaq: Tavra itchaksrat uyaġaich qattat tavrani inŋarut. Atausiq immaqtutilaaqallaavluni 20 naagga 30 gallon-tulluunnii. Aasii taapkua qattat imaŋich atuġuuruat Jew-guruat piraġausiannun salummaqtauniġmi.

english: Jesus told the servants, “Fill the water jars with water.” So they filled them up to the very top.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Immiqsigik qattat imiġmik. Tavra immiŋagaich qaqłuqpiuraqługich.

english: Then he told them, “Now draw some out and take it to the head steward,” and they did.
inupiaq: Suli uqallautiŋagai, Qalusiñaqsigaasi aasii qaiḷḷugu qaukłiannun niqłiqirit. Tavra aanŋagaat ilaanun.

english: When the head steward tasted the water that had been turned to wine, not knowing where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), he called the bridegroom
inupiaq: Niqinaqiruani niqłiqirit qaukłiata uukamiuŋ wine-ġuqtitauruaq naluŋaniqsuq sumiñ pisilaaŋanik, kivgat aglaan imiqtaŋaruat iḷisimagaluaqtut. Niqłiqirit qaukłiata niqinaqiruani ququaŋagaa uiksraun

english: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and then the cheaper wine when the guests are drunk. You have kept the good wine until now!”
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugu, Iñupayaam sivulliġisuugaa nakuuruaq wine aasii iñuich imianiŋmata iḷaŋaniñ, kiŋummuuruaq wine pivaallukługu, aglaan uvva tutquqtaġiniġiñ nakuuruaq wine paŋmapaŋmun aglaan.

english: Jesus did this as the first of his miraculous signs, in Cana of Galilee. In this way he revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
inupiaq: Taamna aliuġnaqtuaq Jesus pikkaŋa Cana-mi Galilee-miittuami sivulliuŋaruq nalupqinaiyautinun kamanautiqaqtilaaŋanun, aasii iḷitchitquraŋi ukpiliŋarut ilaanun.

english: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother and brothers and his disciples, and they stayed there a few days.
inupiaq: Taavsruma aquagun Jesus aullaŋaruq Capernaum-mun, piqatigivlugich aakaniḷu aniqatiiniḷu iḷitchitquraniḷu, aasii tavrani uvliuqtuallaŋarut.

english: Now the Jewish feast of Passover was near, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Tavra Itqaivik Qulaurrusiqiviannik Jew-guruat tikiñŋaruq, aasii Jesus aullaŋaruq Jerusalem-mun.

english: He found in the temple courts those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers sitting at tables.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi paqinŋagai iñuich tuniuqqairuat immuliviich aŋusalluŋiññik imnaiñiglu tiŋmianiglu, suli simmiqsuqtit maniŋñik aquppiruat inimiŋni.

english: So he made a whip of cords and drove them all out of the temple courts, with the sheep and the oxen. He scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
inupiaq: Tavra ipiġaqtuusivḷuni akłunaamik uŋuraŋagai iluqaisa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ, iñuiḷḷu imnaiḷḷu immuliviiḷḷu aŋusalluŋich, suli naavinŋagai simmiqsuqtit maniŋich ulġuuqługiḷḷu aglagviŋich.

english: To those who sold the doves he said, “Take these things away from here! Do not make my Father’s house a marketplace!”
inupiaq: Suli uqallautiŋagai tamatkua tuniuqqairuat tiŋmianik, Aullautisigik tamatkua, tauqsiqsuġviġuġniaŋitkiksi Aapama iglua.

english: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will devour me.”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraŋi itqaŋarut aglaaguŋaruamik Bible-ni, “Siġñiksrautiqpaum igluŋnun God payarigaaŋa.”

english: So then the Jewish leaders responded, “What sign can you show us, since you are doing these things?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat apiġiniqłaŋagaat, Sumik aliuġnaqtuamik piyumiñaqpich nalupqinaiyautiksraġnik ataniġnaqutiqaqtilaaġnik tainna piyumiñaqłutin.

english: Jesus replied, “Destroy this temple and in three days I will raise it up again.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Suksraunġiqsiuŋ una aŋaiyyuvikpak aasii uvluni piŋasuni nappatqigñiaġiga.

english: Then the Jewish leaders said to him, “This temple has been under construction for forty-six years, and are you going to raise it up in three days?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqallaŋarut, 46 ukiuni savaaguŋaruq una aŋaiyyuvikpak, aasii ilivich piŋasuni uvluni nappaġniaqpiuŋ?

english: But Jesus was speaking about the temple of his body.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqautigikamiuŋ aŋaiyyuvikpak sivuniġiŋagaa ilaan timini.

english: So after he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the saying that Jesus had spoken.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋipkaqtauganiŋman tuqqunmiñ, iḷitchitquraŋisa itqaŋagaat taamna uqallautaa, aasii ukpiġiŋagaat Bible uqaluat uqaluiḷḷu Jesus uqausiġiŋaraŋi.

english: Now while Jesus was in Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover, many people believed in his name because they saw the miraculous signs he was doing.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa Jerusalem-miinman Itqautaanni Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun niqinaqiviŋmi, iñugiaktuat ukpiŋarut ilaanun tautukamisigik aliuġnaqtuat pikkaŋi nalupqinaiyautit kiutilaaŋanun.

english: But Jesus would not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus ukpiġiŋaitkai ukpipiaġniḷugich inmiñun, qanuq iḷisimaŋagai iñupayaat.

english: He did not need anyone to testify about man, for he knew what was in man.
inupiaq: Iñuŋmik uqallaurrituŋitchuq qanuq iñuich isummatiqaqtilaaŋannik inmigun, inmiñi iḷisimavluni qanuq isumaqaqtilaaŋannik.

english: Now a certain man, a Pharisee named Nicodemus, who was a member of the Jewish ruling council,
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk inŋaruq Pharisee-guruaq atiqaqtuaq Nicodemus-mik, atanauraq Jew-guruani.

english: came to Jesus at night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the miraculous signs that you do unless God is with him.”
inupiaq: Taamna iñuk qaiŋaruq Jesus-mun unnuami aasii uqallautivlugu, Rabbi, iḷisimarugut iḷisaurrautilaaġnik qairuaq God-miñ, qanuq kialiqaa piyumiñaitkai tamatkua aliuġnaqtuat nalupqinaiyautauruat savaaġiratin, God-im itqatigiŋisuaqpani.

english: Jesus replied, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born from above, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigikpiñ. Iñuk anitqiŋisuaġumi, iḷitchuġiyumiñaitchuq God-im atanniqsimmataanik.

english: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter his mother’s womb and be born a second time, can he?”
inupiaq: Nicodemus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Qanuġluni iñuk aniyumiñaqpa utuqqalikami? Isitqikkumiñaqpa aakami iḷuanun aasii aniḷuni?

english: Jesus answered, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born of water and spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigikpiñ. Iñuk aniŋisuaġumi imikun Ilitqusiġiksuakullu, isiġumiñaitchuq God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
inupiaq: Tamatkua aniruat iñuŋniñ iñugruiññaurut. Tamatkualiasii kisiisa Ilitqusiġiksuam anitqiksitaŋi iñuuniaqtut Ilitqusiġiksuatun.

english: Do not be amazed that I said to you, ‘You must all be born from above.’
inupiaq: Aliuġnak uqallautikapkiñ inna, Anitqiksuksraupiaqtutin.

english: The wind blows wherever it will, and you hear the sound it makes, but do not know where it comes from and where it is going. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
inupiaq: Anuġi anuqłiġuuruq suŋnamun pisukami, aasii tusaallagiñ anuġivaalua, aglaan nalurutin sumiñ qaisilaaŋanik naagga sumun aullaqtilaaŋanik. Tainnatun ittuq iñupayaaq aniruaq Ilitqusiġiksuakun.

english: Nicodemus replied, “How can these things be?”
inupiaq: Nicodemus uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Qanuġluni taamna piyumiñaqpa?

english: Jesus answered, “Are you the teacher of Israel and yet you don’t understand these things?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷisaurraugaluaqłutin Israel-nun taamna kaŋiqsiḷaitpiuŋ?

english: I tell you the solemn truth, we speak about what we know and testify about what we have seen, but you people do not accept our testimony.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigikpiñ. Uqautiqaqtugut iḷisimaraptiŋnik suli iḷitchuġipkairugut tautuŋakkaptigun, aasii akuqtuŋitkisi uqaluktuavut.

english: If I have told you people about earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
inupiaq: Uqautiŋagupkiñ nunamiŋŋaqtauruanik aasii ilivich arguagivlugich, qanuġlutin ukpiġiyumiñaqpigich quliaqtuaġutigupkiñ qiḷaŋmiŋŋaqtauruanik?

english: No one has ascended into heaven except the one who descended from heaven – the Son of Man.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa mayuŋaitchuq qiḷaŋmun aglaan taamna atqaŋaruaq qiḷaŋmiñ, Iġñiŋa Iñuum.

english: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
inupiaq: Aasii Moses kiviŋmatun nimiġiaq nunagluktuami, tainnatun Iġñiŋa Iñuum kiviktaksraupiaqtuq,

english: so that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life.”
inupiaq: kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq ilaanun iñuggutiqaquvlugu isuitchuamik.

english: For this is the way God loved the world: He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
inupiaq: God-im piviuttaġivaił̣ł̣ugich nunam iñuŋi aitchuutigiŋagaa Iġñitualuni, kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq iġñiŋanun tammaquŋił̣ł̣ugu aglaan iñuggutiqaquvlugu isuitchuamik.

english: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world should be saved through him.
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im tiliŋaitkaa Iġñiq nunamun isivġiqsigitqulugu nunam iñuŋiñun, aglaan annaurrigitquvlugu.

english: The one who believes in him is not condemned. The one who does not believe has been condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
inupiaq: Iñuk ukpiqtuaq ilaanun isivġiqsauŋitchuq. Iñuk ukpiŋitchuaq isivġiqsauganiktuq, qanuq ukpiŋaitchuq Iġñitualuanun God-im.

english: Now this is the basis for judging: that the light has come into the world and people loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuich isivġiqsaurut qanuq qaummaq qaiŋagaluaqtuq nunamun, aasii iñuich piviuttaġiłhaaġaat taaqtuaq qaummaġmiñ qanuq piḷġusiŋich pigiitchuaguvlutiŋ.

english: For everyone who does evil deeds hates the light and does not come to the light, so that their deeds will not be exposed.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñupayaam piḷġusiqaqtuam pigiitchuamik uumigigaa qaummaq, suli qaiḷaitchuq qaummaġmun, piḷġusiñi satqummiġasugalugich.

english: But the one who practices the truth comes to the light, so that it may be plainly evident that his deeds have been done in God.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuk iñuusiqaqtuaq iḷumun ittuamik qairuq qaummaġmun, iñuusiñi salapqiquvlugu qaummaġmun kamaksrisilaamiñik God-mik.

english: After this, Jesus and his disciples came into Judean territory, and there he spent time with them and was baptizing.
inupiaq: Taavsruma aquagun Jesus iḷitchitquraniḷu aullaŋarut Judea-mun, aasii tavraniinŋaruq itqatigivlugich iḷitchitqurani suli paptaiqsivḷuni.

english: John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because water was plentiful there, and people were coming to him and being baptized.
inupiaq: John-tauq paptaiqsiŋammiuq Aenon-mi qaniŋani Salim, qanuq ayuġnaiñŋaruq imiq tavrani. Iñuich qaiŋarut tavruŋa aasii paptaiqsauvlutiŋ,

english: (For John had not yet been thrown into prison.)
inupiaq: qanuq John tigutaaqtauŋaił̣ł̣uni suli.

english: Now a dispute came about between some of John’s disciples and a certain Jew concerning ceremonial washing.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruaq John-lu iḷitchitquraŋi uqavaaŋarut pisigivlugu salummaqtauniq aŋaiyyuliqiniġmi.

english: So they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the one who was with you on the other side of the Jordan River, about whom you testified – see, he is baptizing, and everyone is flocking to him!”
inupiaq: Tavra qaiŋarut John-mun aasii uqallautivlugu, Rabbi, taimña iñuk piqatauŋaruaq iliŋnun taavanitchiani Jordan iḷitchuġipkaŋaran iñuŋnun, amma paptaiqsiruq aasii iluqaġmiŋ iñuich ullakkaat.

english: John replied, “No one can receive anything unless it has been given to him from heaven.
inupiaq: John kiuŋagai, Iñupayaaq piyumiñaqtuq kisianik God-im pitqukpani.

english: You yourselves can testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but rather, ‘I have been sent before him.’
inupiaq: Ilivsi quliaqtuaġumiñaqsiŋarusi uqallakama Christ-guŋiññivḷuŋa, aglaan tilirauŋaruŋa itqanaiyautitquvlugu.

english: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom, who stands by and listens for him, rejoices greatly when he hears the bridegroom’s voice. This then is my joy, and it is complete.
inupiaq: Iñuk tuvaaqatiksrautiniŋaruaq uiksrautauruq, aasii uiksrautim avilaitqataa makitaruaq saniġaani, quviasuktuq atqunaqłuni tusaakamiuŋ uiksrautim nipaa. Tavra uiksrautim avilaitqataatun, paŋmapak quviasupiaġataqtuŋa.

english: He must become more important while I become less important.”
inupiaq: Ilaa kamanaqsisaiññaqtuksrauruq, aasii uvaŋa kamanaiqsaiññaqtuksrauruŋa.

english: The one who comes from above is superior to all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is superior to all.
inupiaq: Iñuk qairuaq paŋmaŋŋa kamanałhaaqtuq iluqaiññiñ. Aasii iñugruiññaq nunam pigigaa, suli nunamiŋŋaqtanik uqaluqaqtuq. Iñuk qairuaq qiḷaŋmiñ kamanałhaaqtuq iluqaiññiñ,

english: He testifies about what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.
inupiaq: aasii quliaqtuaqaqtuq tautuŋaramiñik tusaaŋaraġmiñiglu, naaggauvva kiapayaaq akuqtuŋitkaa quliaqtuaŋa.

english: The one who has accepted his testimony has confirmed clearly that God is truthful.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuum akuqtuiruam uqaluanik nalupqinaiġaa God iḷumun innivḷugu.

english: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for he does not give the Spirit sparingly.
inupiaq: Iñuk God-im tiliraŋa uqaqtuq uqaluŋiñik God-im, qanuq God-im aitchuġaa iluqaanik suaŋŋataanik Ilitqusiġiksuam.

english: The Father loves the Son and has placed all things under his authority.
inupiaq: Aapam piviuttaġigaa Iġñiq, aasii aitchuutigiŋagai supayaat ilaanun.

english: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life. The one who rejects the Son will not see life, but God’s wrath remains on him.
inupiaq: Iñuk ukpiqtuaq Iġñiġmun isuitchuamik iñuggutiqaqtuq, aasii iñuk kamaksriŋitchuaq Iġñiġmik iñuggutiqaġniaŋitchuq, aglaan God-im tatavsaġniaġaa.

english: Now when Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard that he was winning and baptizing more disciples than John
inupiaq: Pharisees tusaaŋarut Jesus iḷitchitquraukkałhaaqsiñivḷugu paptaiqsił̣haaġnivḷugulu John-miñ. (

english: (although Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disciples were),
inupiaq: Ilaa ami Jesus paptaiqsiŋitkaluaqtuq, aglaan iḷitchitquraŋi kisimiŋ.)

english: he left Judea and set out once more for Galilee.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaakami taavrumiŋa, qimaŋagaa Judea aullatqikł̣uni Galilee-mun,

english: But he had to pass through Samaria.
inupiaq: aasii ilaa Samaria-kuaqtuksrauŋaruq.

english: Now he came to a Samaritan town called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋaruq iniqpaŋmun, atiliŋmun Sychar-mik, Samaria-miittuami qanittuaq nautchiaqaġviŋmun Jacob aitchuutigiŋaraanun iġñiġmiñun Joseph-mun.

english: Jacob’s well was there, so Jesus, since he was tired from the journey, sat right down beside the well. It was about noon.
inupiaq: Jacob nivviaŋa tavraniinŋaruq, aasii Jesus piḷaiqł̣uni iglauvlutiŋ aquptaaŋaruq saniġaanun nivviam, uvluq qitiqqaqpalliŋman.

english: A Samaritan woman came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me some water to drink.”
inupiaq: Aġnaq Samaria-ġmiu imiqtaŋaruq aasii Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Imiksriñŋa.

english: (For his disciples had gone off into the town to buy supplies.)
inupiaq: Iḷitchitquraŋi iniqpaŋmuŋarut tauqsiġiaqłutiŋ niqiksramiŋnik.

english: So the Samaritan woman said to him, “How can you – a Jew – ask me, a Samaritan woman, for water to drink?” (For Jews use nothing in common with Samaritans.)
inupiaq: Tavra Samaria-ġmium aġnam kiuŋagaa, Qanuġimña ilivich Jew-guruatiin qasiḷivich imiksraġnik uvamniñ, aġnamiñ Samaria-ġmiumiñ? Qanuq Jew-guruat piñiaqatiqalaitchut Samaria-ġmiunik.

english: Jesus answered her, “If you had known the gift of God and who it is who said to you, ‘Give me some water to drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iḷisimaŋagupku suutilaaŋa aitchuutaa God-im, suli kiutilaaŋa qasiḷiruaq iliŋniñ imiksritquvluni, tavra qasiḷiqqaaġumiñaŋagaluaqtutin ilaanun aasii aitchuġumiñaŋagaluaġaatin iñuunaqtuamik imiġmik.

english: “Sir,” the woman said to him, “you have no bucket and the well is deep; where then do you get this living water?
inupiaq: Aġnam uqallautiŋagaa, Aŋuun, imiqtautiksraitchutin, nivviam imġa atchiksuq. Sumiñ piyumiñaqpiuŋ taamna iñuunaqtuaq imiq?

english: Surely you’re not greater than our ancestor Jacob, are you? For he gave us this well and drank from it himself, along with his sons and his livestock.”
inupiaq: Kamanałhaaqpich maŋŋuptiŋniñ Jacob-miñ? Ilaan aitchuŋagaatigut uumiŋa nivviamik imiġvigisuuŋaraġmiñik iġñiŋisalu pamiqsaaŋisalu.

english: Jesus replied, “Everyone who drinks some of this water will be thirsty again.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iñupayaaq imiqtuaq uumaŋŋa imiġmiñ, imiġulitqigñiaqtuq,

english: But whoever drinks some of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again, but the water that I will give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up to eternal life.”
inupiaq: aglaan kiñapayaaq imiqtuaq imiġmiñ aitchuutiginiakkamniñ imiġulitqigñiaŋitchuq. Imiq aitchuutiginiakkaġa ilaanun, nivviatun imaiḷaitchuatun inniaqtuq iḷuani iñuupkaġlugu isuitchuamun.

english: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not be thirsty or have to come here to draw water.”
inupiaq: Aġnam uqallautiŋagaa, Aŋuun, aitchuŋŋa taavrumiŋa imiġmik, imiġuliŋitchumauŋa imiqtallaiġḷuŋalu uvuŋa.

english: He said to her, “Go call your husband and come back here.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aullaġlutin qaitquyaqtuaġuŋ uiñ, aasii utiġlutik uvuŋa.

english: The woman replied, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “Right you are when you said, ‘I have no husband,’
inupiaq: Aġnam kiuŋagaa, Uigitchuŋa. Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Nalauttutin uqallakkavich uigiññivḷutin,

english: for you have had five husbands, and the man you are living with now is not your husband. This you said truthfully!”
inupiaq: qanuq uiqaŋagaluaqtutin tallimanik, aasii taamna paŋmapak pigikkan uigiŋitkiñ. Tainna uqallakkavich nalauttutin.

english: The woman said to him, “Sir, I see that you are a prophet.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnam uqallautiŋagaa, Aŋuun, iḷitchuġiruŋa uqaqtautilaaġnik God-mun.

english: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you people say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem.”
inupiaq: Maŋŋuvut Samaria-ġmiut aŋaiyyusuurut uumani iġġimi, aasiiḷi ilivsi Jew-guruasii uqaġuurusi Jerusalem-mi iñuich aŋaiyyuruksraunivḷugich.

english: Jesus said to her, “Believe me, woman, a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aġnaaq, ukpiġiŋŋa, piviksraq qaiḷiqtuq aŋaiyyuvigiŋaiġñiaġmarruŋ Aapa uumani unnii iġġimi, naaggaunnii Jerusalem-mi.

english: You people worship what you do not know. We worship what we know, because salvation is from the Jews.
inupiaq: Ilivsi Samaria-ġmiuguruasii iḷisimapiaŋitkiksi aŋaiyyuvigikkaqsi. Uvagut Jew-guruaguut iḷisimagikput aŋaiyyuvigikkaqput, qanuq annautiksraŋat iñuich kaŋiqaqtuq Jew-guruaniñ.

english: But a time is coming – and now is here – when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such people to be his worshipers.
inupiaq: Piviksraq qaiḷiqtuq paŋmapaglu itaniktuq, iḷumutun aŋaiyyurit aŋaiyyuviginiaġmarruŋ Aapa, qaałhiñakun piraġausiŋiḷaatigun, aglaan ilitqutchikun iḷumun ittuakullu. Qanuq tainna piruanun God aŋaiyyuvigitquruq.

english: God is spirit, and the people who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
inupiaq: God ilitqusiuruq, aasii tamatkua aŋaiyyuruat ilaanun aŋaiyyuruksraupiaqtut ilitqutchikun iḷumun ittuakkullu.

english: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (the one called Christ); “whenever he comes, he will tell us everything.”
inupiaq: Aġnaq uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Iḷisimaruŋa Messiah taggisiqaqtuaq Christ-mik qaiyumaaqtuq. Aasii qaigumi quliaqtuaġutiniaġaatigut supayaanik.

english: Jesus said to her, “I, the one speaking to you, am he.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa uqaqtuaŋaa iliŋnun ilaaguruŋa.

english: Now at that very moment his disciples came back. They were shocked because he was speaking with a woman. However, no one said, “What do you want?” or “Why are you speaking with her?”
inupiaq: Tavrani iḷitchitquraŋi qaiŋarut. Niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut ilaan uqaqatigimammagu aġnaq, aglaan nalliat unnii apiqsriŋaitchuq, Susukpich? naagga, Summan uqaqatigiviuŋ aġnaq?

english: Then the woman left her water jar, went off into the town and said to the people,
inupiaq: Tavra aġnam qimaŋagaa qattani, aasii aivḷuni iniqpaŋmun, aasii uqallautiŋagai iñuich,

english: “Come, see a man who told me everything I ever did. Surely he can’t be the Messiah, can he?”
inupiaq: Qaiḷusi tautugiaqsiuŋ iñuk uqaurriga supayaanik piŋaramnik. Christ-guŋitkaluaqpa?

english: So they left the town and began coming to him.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich aullaŋarut iniqpaŋmiñ, aasii qaivḷutiŋ Jesus-mun.

english: Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, eat something.”
inupiaq: Aġnaq aullaaniŋman, iḷitchitquraŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Rabbi, niġġiiñ.

english: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kiuŋagai, Niqiqaqtuŋa niġiramnik nalukkavsiññik.

english: So the disciples began to say to one another, “No one brought him anything to eat, did they?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat apiqsruqtuutiŋarut, Iñuum una qaġġirriŋavauŋ niqiksraŋanik?

english: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of the one who sent me and to complete his work.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Niqigauvva kamagilugu pisuutaa tilisiruam uvamnik, suli naatchiḷuŋa savaaŋanik.

english: Don’t you say, ‘There are four more months and then comes the harvest?’ I tell you, look up and see that the fields are already white for harvest!
inupiaq: Uqaġuurusi inna, kivriviksraq nautchianik tikiññiaqtuq sisamat tatqich pianikpata. Uvaŋaliasii uqallautigivsi, aaġluġlusi tautuksigik avva iñuich ittut palauvaksratun nauganiktuatun kivraksraġuqłutiŋ katillugiḷḷu.

english: The one who reaps receives pay and gathers fruit for eternal life, so that the one who sows and the one who reaps can rejoice together.
inupiaq: Iñuktun kivrikami katitchikamiḷu palauvaksranik akiññaktuatun aasii quviasuqatigivlugu nautchirriiŋaruaq, tainnatuttauq iñuk ukpiqtitchiruaq iñuŋnik uvamnun, akiññagniaġmiuq isuitchuamun, suli quviasuqatigilugu quliaqtuaqtuaq sumulliqaa tusaayugaaġiksuanik.

english: For in this instance the saying is true, ‘One sows and another reaps.’
inupiaq: Innauvva uqaluusuuruaq nalautitchuuruq. Iñuum igḷua nautchirriiruq palauvaksranik, aasiiḷi alla kivrivḷuni katitchivḷuniḷu palauvaksranik.

english: I sent you to reap what you did not work for; others have labored and you have entered into their labor.”
inupiaq: Tiliŋagivsi quliaqtuaġitquvlugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq. Ittusi iñuktitun kivriruatun katitchivḷutiglu palauvaksranik ilivsi nautchirriutigiŋisavsiññik. Allat iñuich nautchirriiŋarut, aasiiḷi ilivsi piqasiutivlusi savaaŋannun.

english: Now many Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the report of the woman who testified, “He told me everything I ever did.”
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat Samaria-ġmiut iniqpaŋmiñ ukpiŋarut Jesus-mun, aġnaq quliaqtuaġman inna, Ilaan uqautiŋagaaŋa supayaanik piŋaramnik.

english: So when the Samaritans came to him, they began asking him to stay with them. He stayed there two days,
inupiaq: Tavra Samaria-ġmiut qaikamiŋ ilaanun, apiġiŋagaat Jesus itqatigitquvlutiŋ, aasii uvliŋaruq malġuŋni uvluŋni.

english: and because of his word many more believed.
inupiaq: Aasii iñugiavsaaqtuat ukpiliŋarut pisigivlugich uqaluŋi.

english: They said to the woman, “No longer do we believe because of your words, for we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this one really is the Savior of the world.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautiŋagaat aġnaq, Ukpiliŋaitchugut uqaluktin pisigigiññaġlugich, qanuq naalaġniŋagikput uvaptiŋnik, aasii iḷitchuġirugut ilaa iḷumutun Annaurriginiġaat iñuich.

english: After the two days he departed from there to Galilee.
inupiaq: Pianiŋmaŋnik uvluk malġuk ilaa aullaŋaruq Galilee-mun.

english: (For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.)
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, God-im uqaqtaa nanġausiaqalaitchuq ilaan nunamiñi.

english: So when he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him because they had seen all the things he had done in Jerusalem at the feast (for they themselves had gone to the feast).
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñman Galilee-mun, Galilee-ġmiut paġlaŋagaat, tautuŋavlugich iluqaisa savaaŋi Jerusalem-mi niqinaqimmata, qanuq iliŋitchauq niqinaqiyaqtuŋavlutiŋ.

english: Now he came again to Cana in Galilee where he had made the water wine. In Capernaum there was a certain royal official whose son was sick.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus Cana-mutqiŋaruq Galilee-miittuamun, imiġmik wine-guqtitchiviŋmiñun. Aasii Capernaum-mi ataniġnaqutilgum iġñiŋa naŋinniqsuq.

english: When he heard that Jesus had come back from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and begged him to come down and heal his son, who was about to die.
inupiaq: Tusaakamiuŋ Jesus qaiñivḷugu Judea-miñ Galilee-mun, aullaqłuni apiġiŋagaa Jesus qaitquvlugu Capernaum-mun, aasii iłuaqsiḷugu iġñini tuquaqsiruaq.

english: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders you will never believe!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Tautuŋisuaġuvsi aliuġnaqtuanik nalupqinaiyautinik kiutilaamnun, ukpiġumiñaitchusi.

english: “Sir,” the official said to him, “come down before my child dies.”
inupiaq: Ataniġnaqutilgum uqallautiŋagaa, Aŋuun, qaiñasuaġiñ miqłiqtuġa tuquŋaiñŋaan.

english: Jesus told him, “Go home; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and set off for home.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aggiiñ, iġñiġiñ iñuuniaqtuq. Tavra iñuum ukpiġiŋagaa uqaluk Jesus uqallautaa inmiñun, aasii aullaqłuni.

english: While he was on his way down, his slaves met him and told him that his son was going to live.
inupiaq: Aiñiaqtillugu, kivgaŋisa paaŋagaat aasii uqallautivlugu iġñiŋa iñuunivḷugu.

english: So he asked them the time when his condition began to improve, and they told him, “Yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon the fever left him.”
inupiaq: Tavra apiġiŋagai qavsiñuŋman iłuaqsiñmuksaġmagaan aasii kiuŋagaat, Ikpaksraq uanukłaaġman uunnautaiŋaruq.

english: Then the father realized that it was the very time Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live,” and he himself believed along with his entire household.
inupiaq: Aapaŋa iḷisimaŋaruq tainnaiḷimman Jesus uqallaŋatilaaŋanik inmiñun, Iġñiġiñ iñuuniaqtuq. Tavra ilaa ukpiliŋaruq, igluqatipayaaniḷu.

english: Jesus did this as his second miraculous sign when he returned from Judea to Galilee.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna igḷua aliuġnaqtuam Jesus piraata qaikami Judea-miñ Galilee-mun.

english: After this there was a Jewish feast, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun niqinaqiviat Jews tikiñŋaruq, aasii Jesus Jerusalem-muŋaruq.

english: Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool called Bethzatha in Aramaic, which has five covered walkways.
inupiaq: Tavra Jerusalem-mi imaqsuk inŋaruq tallimanik taġġisimaviḷik saniġaani paaqpaŋata, imnaich Hebrew-tun uqaluanni taggisilik Bethzatha.

english: A great number of sick, blind, lame, and paralyzed people were lying in these walkways.
inupiaq: Taapkunani iñugiaktuat aulasuitchuat nalaŋarut, ayauŋaruat, tusiattuat, avatiŋich tuquŋaruallu. [

english: Now a man was there who had been disabled for thirty-eight years.
inupiaq: Utaqqiugaġayugniqsut tavrani aulayyaksiaġivlugu imaq, qanuq pivikaakun isaġulik atqaġayugniqsuq tavruŋa aasii aulapkaqługu imaq, aasii immamuqqaaqtuaq imaq nutqapqaġman iłuaqsirauraqtuq qanusipayauramiñ naŋirrunmiñiñ.]

english: When Jesus saw him lying there and when he realized that the man had been disabled a long time already, he said to him, “Do you want to become well?”
inupiaq: Iñuk tavraniinŋammiñiqsuq, naŋinŋaruaq 38 ukiuni.

english: The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up. While I am trying to get into the water, someone else goes down there before me.”
inupiaq: Jesus tautukamiuŋ iḷisimavlugu sivisuruamik nalaruagutilaaŋa tavrani, ilaan uqallautiŋagaa, Iłuaqsirausukpich?

english: Jesus said to him, “Stand up! Pick up your mat and walk.”
inupiaq: Naŋittuam uqallautiŋagaa, Aŋuun, imaq aularaġimman iñuqalaitchuŋa iḷiriksramnik imaqsuŋmun aasii piñiuraġniaqtilluŋa allam sivuligaġigaaŋa.

english: Immediately the man was healed, and he picked up his mat and started walking. (Now that day was a Sabbath.)
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Makittin. Tigulugich ikuvġatin. Pisuaġiñ.

english: So the Jewish leaders said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath, and you are not permitted to carry your mat.”
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq iñuk iłuaqsirauŋaruq, aasii tiguvlugich ikuvġani pisuaŋaruq. Taamna uvluq Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋat.

english: But he answered them, “The man who made me well said to me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”
inupiaq: Tavraasii Jew-guruat uqallautiŋagaat iñuk iłuaqsirauruaq, Uvlupak Savaitchut. Pitquratiguaŋitchuq saagaġupkich ikuvġatin.

english: They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick up your mat and walk’?”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Iñuum iłuaqsirima uqallautiŋagaaŋa, tigulugich ikuvġatin pisuaġiñ.

english: But the man who had been healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped out, since there was a crowd in that place.
inupiaq: Ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Kisuimma iñuk uqallaktuaq iliŋnun, tigulugich ikuvġatin pisuaquvlutin?

english: After this Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “Look, you have become well. Don’t sin any more, lest anything worse happen to you.”
inupiaq: Tavra taamna iñuk iłuaqsirauruaq naluŋaruq kiutilaaŋanik iłuaqsirini. Qanuq Jesus piiŋaruq tavraŋŋa, iñuich iñugiakpaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: The man went away and informed the Jewish leaders that Jesus was the one who had made him well.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Jesus paqinŋagaa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, aasii uqallautivlugu, Uumaa, iłuaqsirutin. Piḷuksitqigñak iḷaanni pigiił̣haaqtuam kasuqpiaġaatin.

english: Now because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jewish leaders began persecuting him.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk aullaŋaruq aasii uqallautivlugich Jews Jesus-gunivḷugu iłuaqsirini.

english: So he told them, “My Father is working until now, and I too am working.”
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu Jew-guruat pimaqłuktaġniaŋagaat Jesus, taamna piñivḷugu Savaitchuani.

english: For this reason the Jewish leaders were trying even harder to kill him, because not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was also calling God his own Father, thus making himself equal with God.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagai, Aapaga savaktuq ataramik, aasiivsauq savaktuksraummiuŋa.

english: So Jesus answered them, “I tell you the solemn truth, the Son can do nothing on his own initiative, but only what he sees the Father doing. For whatever the Father does, the Son does likewise.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu Jew-guruat tuqutchumalipiaŋagaat Jesus, kisian navguiñiŋa pitquramik Savaiññikun pisigisuŋaġnagu, aglaan pisigivlugulu taimmagu God Aapamiñik, nalliummatirualiñivḷugu God-mun.

english: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything he does, and will show him greater deeds than these, so that you will be amazed.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, Iġñiq sumik piḷaitchuq ilimisun, aglaan piḷḷatualuktuq tautukkami Aapami piraŋiñik. Supayaanik Aapani pimman, Iġñiq tainnatun pimmiuq.

english: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to whomever he wishes.
inupiaq: Qanuq Aapam piviuttaġigaa Iġñiq, suli iḷisautivlugu supayaanik piramiñik, aasii iḷisautiniaġaa kamanałhaaqtuanik savaanik tamatkunaŋŋa ilivsi aliuquvlusi.

english: Furthermore, the Father does not judge anyone, but has assigned all judgment to the Son,
inupiaq: Qanuq Aapa aŋipkairuq tuquŋaruanik aasii aitchuqługich iñuggunmik, tainnatuttauq Iġñiq aitchuimmiuq iñuggunmik kimun pisukami.

english: so that all people will honor the Son just as they honor the Father. The one who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
inupiaq: Aapa isivġiiŋitchuq iñuŋmik, aglaan Iġñiġmiñun aitchuutigiŋagaa iluqaan ataniġnaqun isivġiiyumiñaqsivḷugu.

english: “I tell you the solemn truth, the one who hears my message and believes the one who sent me has eternal life and will not be condemned, but has crossed over from death to life.
inupiaq: Iñupayaanun taluġitquvlugu Iġñiq, tainnatuttauq taluġimmatun Aapa. Iñuum taluqsraŋitchuam Iġñiġmik taluġiŋiñmigaa Aapa tilisiruaq ilaanik.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, a time is coming – and is now here – when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi. Iñuk tusaaruaq uqalumnik ukpiġivlugulu tiliriga, iñuggutiqaqtuq isuitchuamik. Ilaa isivġiqsauniaŋitchuq suksrauniaŋitchuġlu, qanuq iñuggutiqaaniŋaruq isuitchuamik.

english: For just as the Father has life in himself, thus he has granted the Son to have life in himself,
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, ikarraq qaiḷiqtuq paŋmapaglu itaniktuq, tuquruat tusaaniaġmarruŋ nipaa Iġñiŋata God-im, aasii tamatkua tusaaruat iñuuniaqtut.

english: and he has granted the Son authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of Man.
inupiaq: Aapatun inmiñi kaŋiuruatun iñuggunmun, tainnatulli aitchuŋagaa Iġñini suaŋŋanmik kaŋiuyumiñaqsivḷugu iñuggunmun ilaaniillugu.

english: “Do not be amazed at this, because a time is coming when all who are in the tombs will hear his voice
inupiaq: Suli Aapam aitchuŋagaa ataniġnaqunmik isivġiitquvlugu iñuŋnik, qanuq Iġñiġimmagu Iñuum iñuuqatauvluni iñuŋni.

english: and will come out – the ones who have done what is good to the resurrection resulting in life, and the ones who have done what is evil to the resurrection resulting in condemnation.
inupiaq: Aliuġinagu una, qanuq ikarraq qaiḷiqtuq iluqaġmiŋ iḷuvviviŋmiituat tusaaniaġaat ilaan nipaa

english: I can do nothing on my own initiative. Just as I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just, because I do not seek my own will, but the will of the one who sent me.
inupiaq: aasii aŋipkaqtaulutiŋ. Tamatkua piḷġusiqaqtuat nakuuruamik aŋipkaqtauniaqtut iñuggunmun. Aasiiḷi tamatkua piḷġusiqaqtuat pigiitchuamik aŋipkaqtauniaqtut suksraunġiunmun.

english: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.
inupiaq: Sumik piḷaitchuŋa uvaptuġruiññaq, aglaan isivġiiruŋa God-im uqallautaagun uvamnun aasii isivġiutiga nalaunŋaruq, qanuq nalaunniataŋitkiga uvaŋa pisuutiga, aglaan pisuutaa tilisiŋaruam uvamnik.

english: There is another who testifies about me, and I know the testimony he testifies about me is true.
inupiaq: Quliaqtuaġiguma uvamnik, quliaqtuaġa arguanaqtuq ilivsiññun.

english: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.
inupiaq: Alla imma quliaqtuaqaqtuaq uvapkun, aasii iḷisimaruŋa quliaqtuaŋa uvapkun iḷumun ittuq.

english: (I do not accept human testimony, but I say this so that you may be saved.)
inupiaq: Tilisiŋarusi iñuŋnik John-mun, aasii ilaan quliaqtuaġutiŋagai iḷumun ittuamik.

english: He was a lamp that was burning and shining, and you wanted to rejoice greatly for a short time in his light.
inupiaq: Piqutigiŋitkiga iñułhiñat quliaqtuaŋat uvapkun, aglaan taamna uqallausiġigiga annaurrautquvlusi.

english: “But I have a testimony greater than that from John. For the deeds that the Father has assigned me to complete – the deeds I am now doing – testify about me that the Father has sent me.
inupiaq: John inŋaruq ikualaruatun qaummaġiksuatullu qulliqsun, aasii quviasuutigillakkaluaġiksi qaummaŋa.

english: And the Father who sent me has himself testified about me. You people have never heard his voice nor seen his form at any time,
inupiaq: Aglaan savaatka ukpiġnałhamaaqtut John unnii quliaqtuaŋiñiñ uvapkun, qanuq savaat Aapam piraksriutigikkaŋi naatquvlugich iḷitchuġipkautaurut iñuŋnun Aapamun tiliŋatilaamnik.

english: nor do you have his word residing in you, because you do not believe the one whom he sent.
inupiaq: Aapa ilaa tilisiŋaruaq uvamnik iḷitchuġipkairuq uvapkun. Ilaan nipaa qaŋaunnii tusaaŋaitkiksi, suli kiiñaŋa tautuŋaitkiksi qaŋaunnii,

english: You study the scriptures thoroughly because you think in them you possess eternal life, and it is these same scriptures that testify about me,
inupiaq: aasii ilivsi iñuutuiññaŋitchusi kamagilugich uqaluŋi, qanuq ukpiġiŋitkiksi ilaan tiliŋaraŋa.

english: but you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.
inupiaq: Taiguammaġiksaaġuugisi Bible uqaluŋich, isumavlusi taapkunuŋa aitchuġniaġasugalusi iñuggunmik isuitchuamik. Bible uqaluŋich quliaqtuaqaqtut uvapkun,

english: “I do not accept praise from people,
inupiaq: naaggauvva qaisuŋitchusi uvamnun iñuggutinnaguglusi isuitchuamik.

english: but I know you, that you do not have the love of God within you.
inupiaq: Nanġausiaqaġniataŋitchuŋa iñuŋniñ.

english: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me. If someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷisimagivsi piviuttaġiŋisilaaŋanik God iḷuvsiññiñ.

english: How can you believe, if you accept praise from one another and don’t seek the praise that comes from the only God?
inupiaq: Qaiŋaruŋa Aapama ataniġnaqutaagun, aasii ilivsi akuqtuŋitkivsiŋa. Alla qaikpan ilaan ataniġnaqunmigun akuqtuġayaġiksi.

english: “Do not suppose that I will accuse you before the Father. The one who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have placed your hope.
inupiaq: Nanġautisuuruasii avanmun aasii suliqutigiŋił̣ł̣ugu nanġausiaksraqsi God-miñ kisianiñ, qanuġlusi ukpiġumiñaqpisi?

english: If you believed Moses, you would believe me, because he wrote about me.
inupiaq: Isumanasi uvamnun pasiñiaġasugalusi Aapamun. Moses-mik nalupqisuŋirrutigikkavsiññik pasiriqaqtusi.

english: But if you do not believe what Moses wrote, how will you believe my words?”
inupiaq: Ukpiġipiaŋaguvsigik Moses aglaaŋi, ukpiġiyumiñaġaluaġivsiŋa, qanuq aglaŋaruq quliaqtuaġivluŋa.

english: After this Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (also called the Sea of Tiberias).
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Jesus ikaaŋaruq taaguŋatchianun tasiata Galilee-m. Taamna tasiq taggisiqaġmiruaq Tiberias-mik.

english: A large crowd was following him because they were observing the miraculous signs he was performing on the sick.
inupiaq: Aasii iñusalaich maliŋagaat tautuŋavlutiŋ aliuġnaqtuanik nalupqinaiyautinik kiutilaamiñik iłuaqsivḷugich naŋirrutiqaqtuat.

english: So Jesus went on up the mountainside and sat down there with his disciples.
inupiaq: Jesus mayuŋaruq qimiqqamun, aasii tamauŋa aquptaaqłuni iḷitchitquraniḷu.

english: (Now the Jewish feast of the Passover was near.)
inupiaq: Tavra Itqaun Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun niqinaqiviat Jews qalliŋaruq.

english: Then Jesus, when he looked up and saw that a large crowd was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread so that these people may eat?”
inupiaq: Qiviaqami tautuŋagai iñusalaich qairuat inmiñun, Jesus uqallautiŋagaa Philip, Sumiñ tauqsiġñiaqpisa punniġnik makua iñuich niġitqulugich?

english: (Now Jesus said this to test him, for he knew what he was going to do.)
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa uuktuaqsaqługu Philip, qanuq ilaa ilimiñi iḷisimaŋaruq suyumaaqtilaamiñik.

english: Philip replied, “Two hundred silver coins worth of bread would not be enough for them, for each one to get a little.”
inupiaq: Philip kiuŋagaa, 200 taala naamayumiñaitchut punniqsisigisaġuptigik iñullaa mikiruuramikunnii niġiyumiñaqsiḷugu.

english: One of Jesus’ disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata iḷitchitquraŋisa, Andrew-m Simon Peter-m aniqataata, uqallautiŋagaa Jesus.

english: “Here is a boy who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what good are these for so many people?”
inupiaq: Imma nukatpiaġruk maaniittuq tallimanik barley-ñik punniġutilik malġugniglu iqalluŋnik. Suliqutauniaqpat innatun iñugiaktigiruanun?

english: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” (Now there was a lot of grass in that place.) So the men sat down, about five thousand in number.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Aquptaaqtitchigik iñuich. Taamna ini ivgukkaŋaruq. Tavraasii iñuich iluqaġmiŋ aquvinŋarut. Iñugiaktilaaqaqpalliŋarut 5,000-tun aŋutit.

english: Then Jesus took the loaves, and when he had given thanks, he distributed the bread to those who were seated. He then did the same with the fish, as much as they wanted.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tiguŋagai punniġich, aasii quyaanikami God-mun, autaaŋagai aquppiruanun, tainnatun suli iqalluk, qanutun niġisuktilaaŋatiktun.

english: When they were all satisfied, Jesus said to his disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces that are left over, so that nothing is wasted.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġianigataġmata pisuġuiqł̣utiŋ, ilaan uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurani, Katitchigik iḷakut kisiŋŋuqtauruat iksaluquŋiḷḷugich.

english: So they gathered them up and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves left over by the people who had eaten.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa katinŋagaich iḷakut aasii immiqł̣ugich qulit malġuk aguummaich tallimaniñ barley-ñiñ punniġniñ, iḷakuŋich taapkua niġiruat.

english: Now when the people saw the miraculous sign that Jesus performed, they began to say to one another, “This is certainly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
inupiaq: Iñuich tautukamirruŋ Jesus savaktuaq taavrumiŋa aliuġnaqtuamik nalupqinaiġutauruamik kiutilaamiñun, uqallaŋarut, Tavra iḷumun uqaqtaa God-im qaiyumaaŋaruaq nunamun.

english: Then Jesus, because he knew they were going to come and seize him by force to make him king, withdrew again up the mountainside alone.
inupiaq: Puttuqsrivḷuni iñuŋnun qaiḷutiŋ tigguġlugluni umialiguqtitchaaqsimmanni, Jesus kisimi aullatqiŋaruq qimiqqanun.

english: Now when evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
inupiaq: Unnugiaġman, iḷitchitquraŋi atqaŋarut tatchimun.

english: got into a boat, and started to cross the lake to Capernaum. (It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.)
inupiaq: Ikivlutiŋ umiaqpauramun, ikaaqsaŋagaat tasiq Capernaum-mun. Taaqsigaluaqtillugu Jesus ullaŋaitkai suli.

english: By now a strong wind was blowing and the sea was getting rough.
inupiaq: Tasiq qaiḷḷiġuŋaruq qanuq anuġiqpak anuqqaŋaruq.

english: Then, when they had rowed about three or four miles, they caught sight of Jesus walking on the lake, approaching the boat, and they were frightened.
inupiaq: Ipuqsruanikamiŋ piŋasutulluunnii naagga sisamatun mile-luuġutitun, tautukamirruŋ Jesus pisuaqtuaq immam qaaŋagun qalliruaq umiaqpauramun, iliŋich iqsitchapiaġataŋarut.

english: But he said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Uvaŋauruŋa, iqsiñasi.

english: Then they wanted to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat came to the land where they had been heading.
inupiaq: Tavra quyatchaŋarut ikitquyumavlugu umiaqpauramun, aasii tavrauvvaa nunaliñŋarut sivuniġikkamiŋnun.

english: The next day the crowd that remained on the other side of the lake realized that only one small boat had been there, and that Jesus had not boarded it with his disciples, but that his disciples had gone away alone.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman iñusalaich taaganitchianiinŋaruat tatchim, iḷitchuġiŋagaat atausisualuk umiaqpauraq tavraniinŋatilaaŋanik. Iḷisimaŋagaat Jesus ayaqatauŋaisilaaŋanik iḷitchitquramiñun, aglaan qimakługu aullaŋatilaaŋat.

english: But some boats from Tiberias came to shore near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq allat umiaqpaurat Tiberias-miñ nunaliñŋarut qaniŋanun inim niġġivigiŋaraata iñuich punniġnik Atanġum quyyatiŋaraiññik.

english: So when the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and came to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷitchuġikamiŋ Jesus piisilaaŋanik, iḷitchitquraŋiḷu, iliŋich iksruŋammiut umiaqpauranun aasii aullaqłutiŋ Capernaum-mun, ivaqługu Jesus.

english: When they found him on the other side of the lake, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
inupiaq: Paqinnamirruŋ taaganitchiani tatchim, ilaisa uqallautiŋagaat, Rabbi, qaŋa mauŋaqpich?

english: Jesus replied, “I tell you the solemn truth, you are looking for me not because you saw miraculous signs, but because you ate all the loaves of bread you wanted.
