inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, ivaġivsiŋa niqinŋuġniqsi punniġnik pisigivlugu, pisigisuŋaġnagich tautukkasi aliuġnaqtuat nalupqinaiyautit kiutilaamnun.

english: Do not work for the food that disappears, but for the food that remains to eternal life – the food which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has put his seal of approval on him.”
inupiaq: Siġġaqutiginagu niqiłhiñaq nuŋuraġaqtuaq, aglaallu siġġaqutigisiuŋ taamna nuŋulaitchuaq, niqitun ittuaq iñuupkaġumiñaqłusi isuitchuamun. Iġñiŋata Iñuum aitchuġumiñaġaasi taavrumiŋa niqimik, qanuq God-im Aapam ataniġnaqusiŋagaa tainna piḷḷasivḷugu.

english: So then they said to him, “What must we do to accomplish the deeds God requires?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Suruksrauvisa siġġaqutiqaġniaġupta savaaġitquraŋiñik God-im?

english: Jesus replied, “This is the deed God requires – to believe in the one whom he sent.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uvva savaaq savaaġitqukkaŋa God-im ilivsiññun, ukpiquvlusi Aapam tiliraŋanun.

english: So they said to him, “Then what miraculous sign will you perform, so that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Sumik piñiaqpich aliuġnaqtuamik nalupqinaiġuglugu kiutilaan uvagut tautuaksraptiŋnik aasii ukpiġluta? Sumik piñiaqpich?

english: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
inupiaq: Maŋŋuuvut niqiqaqtitautuiññaŋarut maana-mik nunagluktuamiinnamiŋ, aglausimaruq Bible-ni, “Ilaan niqiqaqtituiññaŋagai qiḷaŋmiñ.”

english: Then Jesus told them, “I tell you the solemn truth, it is not Moses who has given you the bread from heaven, but my Father is giving you the true bread from heaven.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, Moses pamanŋaitkai taipkua maŋŋuusi punniġmik qiḷaŋmiñ, aglaan Aapama. Suli paŋmapak-unnii aitchuutigituiññaġaa taamna punniq qiḷaŋmiñ punnipiaguruaq.

english: For the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im pigikkaŋa punnipiaq ilaaguruq atqaqtuaq qiḷaŋmiñ aasii aitchuivḷuni iñuggunmik isuitchuamik nunam iñuŋiñun.

english: So they said to him, “Sir, give us this bread all the time!”
inupiaq: Tavra uqallautiŋagaat, Ataniiq, aitchuqsimaaqtigut taavrumiŋa punniġmik.

english: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one who comes to me will never go hungry, and the one who believes in me will never be thirsty.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Taamnauruŋa punniq iñuupkairuaq iñuŋnik isuitchuamun. Iñuk qairuaq uvamnun kaakkumiñaipiaqtuq, suli iñuk ukpiqtuaq uvamnun imiġuksiuyumiñaipiaqtuq.

english: But I told you that you have seen me and still do not believe.
inupiaq: Aglaan uqallautiŋagaluaqtillusi tautuŋanivḷuŋa aasiuvva ukpiŋitchusi.

english: Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me, and the one who comes to me I will never send away.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ iñuich Aapam qaisaŋi qaiñiaqtut uvamnun, aasii iñuk qairuaq uvamnun pisuŋiññiaŋitkiga.

english: For I have come down from heaven not to do my own will but the will of the one who sent me.
inupiaq: Qanuq atqaŋaruŋa qiḷaŋmiñ piyaqtuqługu pisuutaa tilisiruam uvamnik, uvaŋa pisuutiŋiḷaaġa.

english: Now this is the will of the one who sent me – that I should not lose one person of every one he has given me, but raise them all up at the last day.
inupiaq: Aasiuvva pisuutaa tilisiruam uvamnik, tammaitquŋił̣ł̣uŋa sumikunnii ilaan qaisaŋanik uvamnun, aglaan aŋipkaġlugich iluqaisa aqulliġmi uvlumi.

english: For this is the will of my Father – for everyone who looks on the Son and believes in him to have eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.”
inupiaq: Uvva pisuutaa Aapama, iñupayaat tautuktuat Iġñiŋanik ukpiġvigivlugulu iñuggutiqaġniaqtut isuitchuamik, aasii uvaŋa aŋipkaġniaġitka aqulliġmi uvlumi.

english: Then the Jews who were hostile to Jesus began complaining about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven,”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqamayuutigirraqsiŋagaat pisigivlugu uqallautaa, Taamnauruŋa punniq atqaqtuaq qiḷaŋmiñ.

english: and they said, “Isn’t this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
inupiaq: Iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Jesus-guŋitpauna, iġñiŋa Joseph-gum? Iḷisimagivut aapaŋalu aakaŋalu. Suvluniasii paŋmapak uqaqpa, Uvaŋa atqaŋaruŋa qiḷaŋmiñ?

english: Jesus replied, “Do not complain about me to one another.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Uqamayuŋaiġitchi.

english: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up at the last day.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa qaiyumiñaitchuq uvamnun Aapam tilisiruam uvamnik qaisuliqsinŋisuaqpani. Aasii uvaŋa aŋipkaġniaġiga uvlumi aqulliġmi.

english: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who hears and learns from the Father comes to me.
inupiaq: Aglautiŋagaat uqaqtiŋisa God-im inna, “Iliŋiyguuq iluqaisa iḷisautiniaġai God-im.” Iñupayaaq naalaġniŋaruaq Aapamik iḷitchivḷuniḷu ilaaniñ qairuq uvamnun.

english: (Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God – he has seen the Father.)
inupiaq: Taamna sivuniqaŋitchuq iñupayaamun tautuŋaniḷugu Aapa aglaan kisima God-miŋŋaqtuaŋaa tautuŋagiga Aapa.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, the one who believes has eternal life.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñuk ukpiqtuaq iñuggutiqaqtuq isuitchuamik.

english: I am the bread of life.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa taamnauruŋa punniq iñuunaqtuaq.

english: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
inupiaq: Maŋŋuusi niġiŋarut maana-mik nunagluktuami aasii tuquŋarut.

english: This is the bread that has come down from heaven, so that a person may eat from it and not die.
inupiaq: Aglaan punniq uqautigikkaġa, atqaqtuaq qiḷaŋmiñ aasii iñuum niġigumiuŋ tuquniaŋitchuq.

english: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats from this bread he will live forever. The bread that I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
inupiaq: Uvaŋauvva iñuunaqtuaq punniq atqaqtuaq qiḷaŋmiñ. Kialiqaa niġigumiuŋ taamna punniq ilaa iñuuniaqtuq isuitchuamun, aasii uvaŋa timiga punniġuruq aitchuutiginiakkaġa nunam iñuŋi iñuggutiqaquvlugich.

english: Then the Jews who were hostile to Jesus began to argue with one another, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat tavrani uqavaaqatigiirraqsiŋarut avanmun uqaqłutiŋ, Qanuġluni uuma iñuum aitchuġumiñaqpatigut timimiñik niġitquluta?

english: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in yourselves.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, niġiŋisuaġuvsi timaanik Iġñiŋata Iñuum suli imiġlugu auŋa, iñuggutaitchusi.

english: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
inupiaq: Iñuk niġiruaq timimnik suli imiqtuaq aumnik iñuggutiqaqtuq isuitchuamik, aasii aŋipkaġniaġiga aqulliġmi uvlumi.

english: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
inupiaq: Qanuq timiga niqipiaġatauruq, suli auga imipiaġatauruq.

english: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood resides in me, and I in him.
inupiaq: Iñuk niġiruaq timimnik suli imiqtuaq aumnik atausiŋŋuqatauruq uvamnun, uvaŋalu ilaanun.

english: Just as the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father, so the one who consumes me will live because of me.
inupiaq: Iñuupkaġaaŋa suaŋŋataata iñuuruam Aapam tilisiruam uvamnik, tainnatulliasii iñuich niġiruat uvamnik iñuupkaġniaġmigai suaŋŋanma.

english: This is the bread that came down from heaven; it is not like the bread your ancestors ate, but then later died. The one who eats this bread will live forever.”
inupiaq: Taamnauruŋa punniq atqaŋaruaq qiḷaŋmiñ, iñuum niġigumiuŋ iñuuniaqtuq taimuŋa. Inŋitchuq maana-tun maŋŋuuvsi niqigituiññaŋagaluaqługu aasii tuquvlutiŋ.

english: Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
inupiaq: Taapkua Jesus uqalugiŋagai Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianni, iḷisaurriḷḷaġmi Capernaum-mi.

english: Then many of his disciples, when they heard these things, said, “This is a difficult saying! Who can understand it?”
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iḷitchitquraŋisa tusaakamisigik tamatkua uqaluich uqallaŋarut, Siġḷiġnaqtut taapkua uqaluich. Kiña kaŋiqsiyumiñaqpa sumik sivuniqaqtilaaŋanik?

english: When Jesus was aware that his disciples were complaining about this, he said to them, “Does this cause you to be offended?
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, puttuqsrivḷuni iḷitchitqurani uqamayuktilaaŋannik taavrumuuna, uqallautiŋagai, Taapkua uqaluich ukpiġutaiqsitkaqsivasi?

english: Then what if you see the Son of Man ascending where he was before?
inupiaq: Qanuq aasii piñiaqpisi tautuaqsiguvsiuŋ Iġñiŋa mayuqtuaq irvigiŋaramiñun sivuani?

english: The Spirit is the one who gives life; human nature is of no help! The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
inupiaq: Ilitqusiq aitchuiruq iñuggunmik, timi aitchuiḷaitchuq iñuggunmik. Uqaluich uqautigiŋaratka ilivsiññun sivuniqaqtut ilitqusivsiññun aasii aitchuivḷutiŋ iñuggunmik.

english: But there are some of you who do not believe.” (For Jesus had already known from the beginning who those were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray him.)
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷasi ukpiŋitchut. Jesus isuaniñqaŋa iḷisimaŋagai kisuutilaaŋat ukpiŋitchuat kiutilaaŋalu aitchuutiginnigniaqtuaq inmiñik.

english: So Jesus added, “Because of this I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has allowed him to come.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Taamna pisigivlugu uqallautiŋagivsi kiñaliqaa qaiyumiñaiññivḷugu Aapam qaiyumaliqsinŋisuaqpagu uvamnun.

english: After this many of his disciples quit following him and did not accompany him any longer.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun iñugiaktuat iḷitchitquraŋiñiñ qapiŋarut aasii kukiḷuqatigiŋaiqł̣ugu tavraŋŋaaglaan.

english: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You don’t want to go away too, do you?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq qulit malġugnun, Ilivsivsauq aullaġniaġmivisi?

english: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.
inupiaq: Simon Peter-m kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, kimun aullaġniaqpisa? Ilivich uqaluqaqtutin iñuunaqtuanik isuitchuamun.

english: We have come to believe and to know that you are the Holy One of God!”
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi uvagut ukpiliŋarugut, suli iḷitchuġianiŋagiptigiñ Piḷuutaitchuaġigaatin God-im.

english: Jesus replied, “Didn’t I choose you, the twelve, and yet one of you is the devil?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Piksraqtaaġiŋagivsi, ilivsi qulit malġuk, naaggauvva iḷari tuunġauruq.

english: (Now he said this about Judas son of Simon Iscariot, for Judas, one of the twelve, was going to betray him.)
inupiaq: Uqautigiŋagaa Judas iġñiŋa Simon Iscariot, qanuq iḷaŋata qulit malġuk aitchuutigiyumaaŋagaa.

english: After this Jesus traveled throughout Galilee. He stayed out of Judea because the Jewish leaders wanted to kill him.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Jesus kukiḷuŋaruq Galilee-mi. Kukiḷuguŋiñŋaruq Judea-mi, qanuq Jew-guruat tuqurviksraqsiuŋagaat.

english: Now the Jewish feast of Tabernacles was near.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat niqinaqiviat tupiġni tikiyasiŋaruq.

english: So Jesus’ brothers advised him, “Leave here and go to Judea so your disciples may see your miracles that you are performing.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nukaaluŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Aullaġiñ maaŋŋa aasii Judea-muglutin, iḷitchitquratin taamani qiñiġumaut savaanik pikkaġnik.

english: For no one who seeks to make a reputation for himself does anything in secret. If you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”
inupiaq: Qanuq iñulimaaq nalunautchiḷuni savalaitchuq iḷisimatqugumi salapqiruakun. Tamatkua savaaġikapkich, salapqiġiñ iliŋnik iñupayaanun.

english: (For not even his own brothers believed in him.)
inupiaq: Qanuq nukaaluŋi unnii ukpiŋaitchut ilaanun.

english: So Jesus replied, “My time has not yet arrived, but you are ready at any opportunity!
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Nalautinŋaitchuq aullaġviksraġa. Aglaan ilivsi aullaġumiñaqtusi qakuguliqaa,

english: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I am testifying about it that its deeds are evil.
inupiaq: qanuq nunam iñuŋisa uumigiŋitkaasi. Aglaan uvaŋa nunam iñuŋisa uumigigaanŋa, qanuq uqautigaluamiiġuugitka ilaisa piḷġusiŋich pigiiññivḷugich.

english: You go up to the feast yourselves. I am not going up to this feast because my time has not yet fully arrived.”
inupiaq: Ilivsi niqinaqiyaqtuġitchi. Uvaŋa niqinaqiyaqtuŋitchuŋa paŋmapak, qanuq nalautinŋaitchuq suli aullaġviksraġa.

english: When he had said this, he remained in Galilee.
inupiaq: Tainna uqallaqqaaqłuni, Galilee-miinŋaruq suli.

english: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then Jesus himself also went up, not openly but in secret.
inupiaq: Tavra nukaaluŋi aullaaniŋmata niqinaqiyyaqłutiŋ, Jesus-tauq aullaŋammiuq nalunautchivḷuni.

english: So the Jewish leaders were looking for him at the feast, asking, “Where is he?”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat ivaġaluaŋagaat niqinaqiviŋmi uqaqłutiŋ, Sumiitpaimña?

english: There was a lot of grumbling about him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He is a good man,” but others, “He deceives the common people.”
inupiaq: Iñuich atqunaqługu uqamayuutigiŋagaat avanmun, iḷaŋich uqaqłutiŋ, Iñulluatauruq. Allalli uqaŋarut, Naumi, ilaa asiñuurriruq iñuŋnik.

english: However, no one spoke openly about him for fear of the Jewish leaders.
inupiaq: Tavra sivuuġavlutiŋ Jew-guruanik, iñuich uqaġiŋagaat nalunautchivḷutiŋ.

english: When the feast was half over, Jesus went up to the temple courts and began to teach.
inupiaq: Niqinaqivik qitiqquiḷivalliġman, Jesus aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmuŋaruq aasii iḷisaurrivḷuni.

english: Then the Jewish leaders were astonished and said, “How does this man know so much when he has never had formal instruction?”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat aliuŋarut iḷisaurrutaagun uqaqłutiŋ, Qanuqłuni una iñuk iḷisimatigiva iḷisaurriqaŋaitkaluaŋŋaġmi?

english: So Jesus replied, “My teaching is not from me, but from the one who sent me.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷisaurrutiga uvaŋa pigiŋitkiga, aglaan pigigaa tilisiruam uvamnik.

english: If anyone wants to do God’s will, he will know about my teaching, whether it is from God or whether I speak from my own authority.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa pisukkumi tuvraġuglugu God-im pisuutaa, ilaa iḷisimayumiñaqtuq iḷisaurrutiga God-miŋŋaqtautilaaŋanik naaggaqaa uvamniġruiññaq.

english: The person who speaks on his own authority desires to receive honor for himself; the one who desires the honor of the one who sent him is a man of integrity, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
inupiaq: Iñuk iḷisaurriruaq ilaan isummatimiñik ivaqłiaruq nanġausiaksramiñik iñuŋniñ, aglaan taamna ivaqłiaruaq nanġausiaksraŋanik God-im tilirimi iḷumun ittuaguruq nalaunŋaruġlu.

english: Hasn’t Moses given you the law? Yet not one of you keeps the law! Why do you want to kill me?”
inupiaq: Moses aitchuŋaitpasi pitquranik? Naaggauvva nallivsiunnii kamagiŋitkai pitqurat. Summan tuqurviksraqsiuqpisiŋa?

english: The crowd answered, “You’re possessed by a demon! Who is trying to kill you?”
inupiaq: Iñuich kiuŋagaat, Ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtutin. Kia tuqurviksraqsiuqpatin?

english: Jesus replied, “I performed one miracle and you are all amazed.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Piŋaruŋa atautchimik savaamik, aasii iluqasi aliuġiŋagiksi.

english: However, because Moses gave you the practice of circumcision (not that it came from Moses, but from the forefathers), you circumcise a male child on the Sabbath.
inupiaq: Moses piraksriŋagaasi nukatpiaġruich nalunaiñŋutchiqsuksrauvlugich. Nalunaiñŋutchiqsauviksraŋat miqłiqtut uvluq nalaurrutimman Savaiññiġmun nalunaiñŋutchiqsisuurusi Savaiññiġmi. Isagutiŋaitkaluaġmiuq taamna pitquraq Moses-miñ, aglaan maŋŋuuvsiññiñ sivuani Moses.

english: But if a male child is circumcised on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses is not broken, why are you angry with me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
inupiaq: Nalunaiñŋutchiḷḷakavsiuŋ nukatpiaġruk Savaiññiġmi, Moses pitquraŋi naviguŋił̣ł̣ugich, summan qinnautivisiŋa pisigivlugu iłuaqsikapku iñuum timaa surruipiaqługu Savaiññiġmi?

english: Do not judge according to external appearance, but judge with proper judgment.”
inupiaq: Isivġiiñasi qiññałhiñakun, aglaan isivġiisitchi nalaunŋaruakun.

english: Then some of the residents of Jerusalem began to say, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich Jerusalem-miut uqallaŋarut, Tavrauŋitpauna iñuk tuqurviksraqsiukkaŋat?

english: Yet here he is, speaking publicly, and they are saying nothing to him. Do the rulers really know that this man is the Christ?
inupiaq: Aasiuvva maaniittuq, uqaqtuq salapqiruami, aasii qanuq nivliutilaitkaat. Iḷaanniipkua ataniġnaqusiraqtuat iḷitchuġipiaġisiuraaġaat Christ-gutilaaŋanik.

english: But we know where this man comes from. Whenever the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
inupiaq: Christ niptaqpan kiñapayaaq iḷisimayumiñaitchuq sumiñ qaisilaaŋanik, aglaan una iñuk iḷisimagikput sumiñ qaisilaaŋanik.

english: Then Jesus, while teaching in the temple courts, cried out, “You both know me and know where I come from! And I have not come on my own initiative, but the one who sent me is true. You do not know him,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisaurrivḷuni aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi nipatuvluni uqallaŋaruq. Iḷisimagivsiŋaliqaa sumiñ qaisilaamnik. Aglaan qaiŋaitchuŋa uvaptuġruiññaq. Ilaa tilisiruaq uvamnik iḷumun ittuq. Ilivsi nalugiksi.

english: but I know him, because I have come from him and he sent me.”
inupiaq: Uvaŋaaglaan iḷisimagiga, qanuq qairuŋa ilaaniñ, suli ilaan tiliŋagaaŋa.

english: So then they tried to seize Jesus, but no one laid a hand on him, because his time had not yet come.
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaġviksraqsiurraqsiŋagaat, aasii kialiqaa tiguŋaitkaa, qanuq aitchuutauviksraŋa tikiñŋaitchuq.

english: Yet many of the crowd believed in him and said, “Whenever the Christ comes, he won’t perform more miraculous signs than this man did, will he?”
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq iñugiaktuat iñuich ukpiliŋarut ilaanun, uqallakłutiŋ, Christ niptaġumi pił̣hamaniaqpa aliuġnaqtuanik uuma iñuum piŋaraŋiñiñ?

english: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about Jesus, so the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees tusaakamisigik iñusalaich uqautiqaqtuat Jesus-mik, iliŋich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu tilisiŋarut tigurinik tigutaaquvlugu.

english: Then Jesus said, “I will be with you for only a little while longer, and then I am going to the one who sent me.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Nayuvsaallagniaġivsi aasii aullaġluŋa tilirimnun.

english: You will look for me but will not find me, and where I am you cannot come.”
inupiaq: Ivaġniaġaluaġivsiŋa aasii paqinniaŋitkivsiŋa, aullaġviksrautimnun qaiyumiñaiñmiusi.

english: Then the Jewish leaders said to one another, “Where is he going to go that we cannot find him? He is not going to go to the Jewish people dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, is he?
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqaurrutiŋarut avanmun, Sumuaqsivauna uvaptiŋnun paqitchumiñaiġḷuni? Ilaa sivuniqaqpa aullaġumavluni Jew-guŋitchuat nunaŋiññun, siaminŋaruat Jew-guruat iñuuviŋiññun, aasii iḷisautilugich Jew-guŋitchuat?

english: What did he mean by saying, ‘You will look for me but will not find me, and where I am you cannot come’?”
inupiaq: Sumik sivuniqaqpauŋ uqallakami, Ivaġniaġaluaġivsiŋa paqitchumiñaitkivsiŋa? Sumik suli sivuniqaqpauŋ, Aullaġviksrautimnun qaiyumiñaitchusi?

english: On the last day of the feast, the greatest day, Jesus stood up and shouted out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me, and
inupiaq: Aqulliġmi uvluani niqinaqivium, naumaniqsrami uvlumi, Jesus makinŋaruq aasii nipatuvluni uqallakłuni, Kiñaliqaa imiġuliġumi, qaiḷuni uvamnun imiġli.

english: let the one who believes in me drink. Just as the scripture says, ‘From within him will flow rivers of living water.’”
inupiaq: Innauvva Bible uqaluŋich uqaqtut iñukun ukpiqtuakun uvamnun, Iḷuaniñ maqiniaqtut kuuŋi iñuunaqtuam imġum.

english: (Now he said this about the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were going to receive, for the Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.)
inupiaq: Tavra taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa sivuniqaqługu Ilitqusiġiksuamik, tamatkua ukpiqtuat ilaanun aitchuusiaġiyumaakkaŋat, qanuq Ilitqusiġiksuaq aitchuutauganiŋaitchuq suli, Jesus aŋipkaqtauŋaił̣ł̣uni utiqtitauŋaił̣ł̣uniḷu qiḷaŋmun.

english: When they heard these words, some of the crowd began to say, “This really is the Prophet!”
inupiaq: Tusaakamisigik taapkua uqaluich, iḷaŋich iñuich uqallaŋarut, Una uqaqtigipiaġaa God-im qaiyumaaqtuaq sivuani Christ.

english: Others said, “This is the Christ!” But still others said, “No, for the Christ doesn’t come from Galilee, does he?
inupiaq: Allalli uqallaŋarut, Ilaa Christ-gupiaqtuq. Aglaan iḷaŋich uqallaŋammiut, Christ qaiyumaaqpa Galilee-miñ?

english: Don’t the scriptures say that the Christ is a descendant of David and comes from Bethlehem, the village where David lived?”
inupiaq: Bible uqaluŋich uqaŋaitpat Christ maŋŋuqaġnivḷugu David-mik, aasii qaiḷuni Bethlehem-miñ, nunaaqqimiñ David iñuuvigiŋaraaniñ?

english: So there was a division in the crowd because of Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra atinġiŋarut iñuich ilaa pisigivlugu.

english: Some of them were wanting to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisa tigutaaġumalliŋagaluaġaat, aglaan iñuum tiguŋaitkaa.

english: Then the officers returned to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why didn’t you bring him back with you?”
inupiaq: Tavra tiguriŋich utiŋarut aŋaiyyuliqsiqpagnun Pharisee-ñullu, uqallautipkaqłutiŋ aasii, Summan qaġġisiŋitpisiuŋ?

english: The officers replied, “No one ever spoke like this man!”
inupiaq: Tigurit kiuŋagaich, Qaŋaunnii iñuk uqaŋaitchuq taavrumatun iñuktun.

english: Then the Pharisees answered, “You haven’t been deceived too, have you?
inupiaq: Pharisees kiuŋagaich, Asiñuurrauvisivsauq ilivsi?

english: None of the rulers or the Pharisees have believed in him, have they?
inupiaq: Nalliŋich ataniġnaqusiraqtuat naagga Pharisee-ñiñ ilaanun ukpiliŋavat?

english: But this rabble who do not know the law are accursed!”
inupiaq: Aglaan makua iñuaġruich asiñuurraurut naluvlugich pitqurat iḷisimakkavut uvagut. Iliŋich suksraunġiqsauyumaaqtut.

english: Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus before and who was one of the rulers, said,
inupiaq: Nicodemus, sivuani uqaqatiqaŋaruaq Jesus-mik, iḷagikkaŋat Pharisees, uqallaŋaruq ilaiññun,

english: “Our law doesn’t condemn a man unless it first hears from him and learns what he is doing, does it?”
inupiaq: Pitqurapta isivġiqusuuvarruŋ iñuk uqaqtitqaaŋaunnagu suli iḷitchuġigaluaġnagu sumik piŋatilaaŋa?

english: They replied, “You aren’t from Galilee too, are you? Investigate carefully and you will see that no prophet comes from Galilee!”
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Ilivitchauq Galilee-miñ pimmivich? Taiguammaġiksaaġiñ Bible-niñ iḷitchuġiyumautin uqaqtaa God-im iñukpalliġumaaŋisilaaŋanik Galilee-miñ.

english: And each one departed to his own house.
But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
inupiaq: Tavra aiyaaŋarut iglullaamiŋnun, aasii Jesus aullaŋaruq Iġġianun Olives.

english: Early in the morning he came to the temple courts again. All the people came to him, and he sat down and began to teach them.
inupiaq: Uvlaatchaurami Jesus qaitqiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun. Iñuich iluqaġmiŋ qaiŋarut ilaanun, aasii aquviłłuni iḷisautiŋagai.

english: The experts in the law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught committing adultery. They made her stand in front of them
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrit pitquranik Pharisees-lu qaġġisiŋagaat aġnaq paqitauruaq allatuqłuni, aasii inillakługu qitiġmun.

english: and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.
inupiaq: Uqallautiŋagaat ilaa, Iḷisaurrii, una aġnaq paqitauruq allatuqtillugu.

english: In the law Moses commanded us to stone to death such women. What then do you say?”
inupiaq: Moses pitqurani piraksriŋagaatigut tainnasiq uyaġaktautquvlugu. Qanuġli una aġnaq uqallausiġiviuŋ?

english: (Now they were asking this in an attempt to trap him, so that they could bring charges against him.) Jesus bent down and wrote on the ground with his finger.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaat uuktuaġutigisaqługu ilaanun, piqaġukkaluaqłutiŋ qanutchimik pasisukługu Jesus aġnakun qaġġirraġmikkun. Jesus pułłuni nunamun aglaŋaruq argagmiñik.

english: When they persisted in asking him, he stood up straight and replied, “Whoever among you is guiltless may be the first to throw a stone at her.”
inupiaq: Apiqsruqtuġaluaġmanni, ilaan qiviaŋagai aasii uqallautivlugich, Nallivsi piḷuutaitchuam miḷuqsaqqaaġliuŋ uyaġaŋmik.

english: Then he bent over again and wrote on the ground.
inupiaq: Atausivsaami putqiŋaruq aasii aglakłuni nunamun.

english: Now when they heard this, they began to drift away one at a time, starting with the older ones, until Jesus was left alone with the woman standing before him.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamirruŋ taamna, aullaŋarut atausiullaavlutiŋ, sivulliġivlugu utuqqauniqsraq, aasii Jesus kisiŋŋuqatauŋaruq aġnamun qikaqtuamun sivuqqamiñi.

english: Jesus stood up straight and said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”
inupiaq: Jesus qiviaŋaruq aasii uqallautivlugu, Aġnaaq nauŋ ipkua iñuich? Nalliata unnii isivġiŋitpatin suksraunġiqsauyumiñaqsiḷutin?

english: She replied, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I do not condemn you either. Go, and from now on do not sin any more.”]]
inupiaq: Aġnam kiuŋagaa, Aaŋ Ataniiq. Aasii Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Uvaŋaptauq isivġiŋitkikpiñ suksraunġiqsauyumiñaqsiḷutin. Aullaġiñ piḷuksitqigñak.]

english: Then Jesus spoke out again, “I am the light of the world. The one who follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqautivsaaŋagai iñuich uqaqłuni, Uvaŋa qaummatauruŋa iñupayaanun. Iñuk maliktuaq uvamnik pisuaġniaŋitchuq taaqtuami, aglaan pisuaġniaqtuq qaummaġmi iḷitchuġipkaqtitauluni iḷumun ittuakun iñuuniaġniġmik.

english: So the Pharisees objected, “You testify about yourself; your testimony is not true!”
inupiaq: Pharisees uqallautiŋagaat, Quliaqtuaġirutin iliŋnun, uqaluktuaġiran iḷumun inŋitchuq.

english: Jesus answered, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I am going. But you people do not know where I came from or where I am going.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Quliaqtuaġaluaġumaunnii uvapkun, uqaluktuaġiraġa iḷumun ittuq, qanuq iḷisimaruŋa sumiñ qaiŋatilaamnik suli sumun aullaġniaqtilaamnik. Aglaan ilivsi nalurusi sumiñ qaiŋatilaamnik naagga sumun aullaġniaqtilaamnik.

english: You people judge by outward appearances; I do not judge anyone.
inupiaq: Ilivsi isivġiirusi iñugruiññaqtun, uvaŋa isivġiiŋitchuŋa iñuŋmik kimigliqaa.

english: But if I judge, my evaluation is accurate, because I am not alone when I judge, but I and the Father who sent me do so together.
inupiaq: Isivġiigaluaġmiguma, isivġiutiga iḷumun ittuq, qanuq kisima isivġiiŋitchuŋa, aglaan Aapalu tiliriga isivġiiruguk.

english: It is written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
inupiaq: Aglausimaruq pitquravsiññi uqaluktuaŋak malġuk iññuk iḷumun innivḷugu.

english: I testify about myself and the Father who sent me testifies about me.”
inupiaq: Quliaqtuaġiruŋa uvamnun, suli Aapa tilisiruaq uvamnik quliaqtuaqaqtuq uvapkun.

english: Then they began asking him, “Who is your father?” Jesus answered, “You do not know either me or my Father. If you knew me you would know my Father too.”
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋisa apiġiŋagaat, Aapan sumiitpa? Jesus kiuŋagai, nalugiptiguk Aapagalu. Iḷitchuġiŋaguvsiŋa iḷisimayumiñaġaluaġmigiksivsauq Aapaga.

english: (Jesus spoke these words near the offering box while he was teaching in the temple courts. No one seized him because his time had not yet come.)
inupiaq: Taapkua uqaluich ilaan uqautigiŋagai inimi aitchuutiqaġviŋmi, iḷisaurrivḷuni aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi. Iñuum tigutaalaiñmigaa, qanuq ikarraŋa tikiñŋaił̣ł̣uni.

english: Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will look for me but will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautitqiŋagai, Aullaġniaqtuŋa. Ivaġniaġaluaġivsiŋa aasii tuquniaqtusi piḷuusiqiraulusi. Qaiyumiñaitchusi aullaġviksrautimnun.

english: So the Jewish leaders began to say, “Perhaps he is going to kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going you cannot come.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqallaŋarut, Tuqunniaqpa ilimiñik? Uqallaktukkiuvva qaiyumiñaitchusi aullaġviksrautimnun.

english: Jesus replied, “You people are from below; I am from above. You people are from this world; I am not from this world.
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Maaŋŋaqtaurusi, uvaŋa paŋmaŋŋaqtauruŋa. Ilivsi qairuagurusi mattumaŋŋa nunamiñ, uvaŋaasii qairuaguŋitchuŋa mattumaŋŋa nunamiñ.

english: Thus I told you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”
inupiaq: Uqallautiŋagivsi tuquniaġnivḷusi piḷuusiqiraulusi. Qanukkiuvva ukpiŋisuaġuvsi Christ-gutilaamnik, tuquniaqtusi piḷuusiqiraulusi.

english: So they said to him, “Who are you?” Jesus replied, “What I have told you from the beginning.
inupiaq: Iliŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Kiña ilivich? Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Taavrumiŋauruŋa uqallautiŋasugaavsi isuaniñqaŋa.

english: I have many things to say and to judge about you, but the Father who sent me is truthful, and the things I have heard from him I speak to the world.”
inupiaq: Qanuqinniġaġumiñaġaluaġivsi iḷisautilusiḷu sutigun iñugiaktuatigun, aglaan uqautigivsi iñupayaallu kisianik sunik tusaaŋakkamnik ilaaniñ iḷumun ittuaguruamiñ, tilisiŋaruamiñ uvamnik.

english: (They did not understand that he was telling them about his Father.)
inupiaq: Iliŋich kaŋiqsiŋitchut ilaanun uqautitilaamiŋnik Aapakun.

english: Then Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing on my own initiative, but I speak just what the Father taught me.
inupiaq: Kiisaimmaa Jesus uqallakpuq, Kivianikkuvsiuŋ Iġñiŋa Iñuum iḷitchuġiniaqtusi Christ-gutilaamnik, suli pisuisilaamnik sunik ataniġnaqutipkun aglaan uqaqłuŋa Aapam iḷisaurrutaagun.

english: And the one who sent me is with me. He has not left me alone, because I always do those things that please him.”
inupiaq: Aasii tilisiruam uvamnik itqatigigaaŋa. Kisiŋŋuŋaitkaaŋa, qanuq uvaŋa ataramik pisuuruŋa iviġaummatauruanik ilaanun.

english: While he was saying these things, many people believed in him.
inupiaq: Uqaġman tamatkuniŋa, iñugiaktuat ukpiliŋarut ilaanun.

english: Then Jesus said to those Judeans who had believed him, “If you continue to follow my teaching, you are really my disciples
inupiaq: Jesus tavra uqallaŋaruq Jew-guruanun ukpiliqsuanun inmiñun, Iḷitchitquraġipiaġivsi kamagituiññaġuvsigik uqalutka,

english: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
inupiaq: aasii iḷitchuġiniaġiksi iḷumun ittuaq, suli iḷumun ittuam atanġiqsinniaġaasi.

english: “We are descendants of Abraham,” they replied, “and have never been anyone’s slaves! How can you say, ‘You will become free’?”
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Uvagut maŋŋuqaqtugut Abraham-mik, aasii kivgauŋaitchugut kimulliqaa. Qanuqłutin uqallakpich, Atanġiqsitauniaqtusi?

english: Jesus answered them, “I tell you the solemn truth, everyone who practices sin is a slave of sin.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñupayaaq piḷuusiqiruaq kivgauruq piḷuunmun.

english: The slave does not remain in the family forever, but the son remains forever.
inupiaq: Kivgałhiñauruaq-aasii nayuutiłhaiññalaitchuq igluani ataniġmi isuitchuamun, aglaan atanġuruam iġñiŋa nayuutiruq isuitchuamun.

english: So if the son sets you free, you will be really free.
inupiaq: Tavra Iġñiġum atanġiqsitpasi, ilivsi atanġiqsitauniaqtusi nalupqinaitchuamik.

english: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants. But you want to kill me, because my teaching makes no progress among you.
inupiaq: Iḷisimagivsi maŋŋuqaqtilaavsiññik Abraham-mik, naaggauvva tuqurviksraqsiuġivsiŋa qanuq ukpiġiŋitkisi uqalutka.

english: I am telling you the things I have seen while with the Father; as for you, practice the things you have heard from the Father!”
inupiaq: Uqautiqaqtuŋa tautuŋaramnik Aapamniinnama, aasiiḷi ilivsi piusi tusaaŋaravsiññik aapavsiññiñ.

english: They answered him, “Abraham is our father!” Jesus replied, “If you are Abraham’s children, you would be doing the deeds of Abraham.
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Abraham aapagigikput. Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Ilivsi Abraham miqłiqtuġikpasi, piyumiñaġaluaqtusi Abraham piraiñik,

english: But now you are trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth I heard from God. Abraham did not do this!
inupiaq: aasii paŋmapak tuqurviksraqsiuġivsiŋa, iñuk uqaurriruaq ilivsiññik iḷumun ittuamik tusaaŋakkamnik God-miñ. Tainna piŋaitchuq Abraham.

english: You people are doing the deeds of your father.”
inupiaq: Ilivsi piusi aapavsi piŋaraŋanik. Tavra uqallautiŋagaat, Uvagut aapaiḷḷiaguŋitchugut. Aapaqaqtugut atautchimik God-mik.

english: Then they said to Jesus, “We were not born as a result of immorality! We have only one Father, God himself.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, God Aapagiguvsiuŋ, piviuttaġiniaġaluaġivsiŋa. Qaiŋaruŋa God-miñ aasii paŋmapak maaniittuŋa. Qaiŋaitchuŋa uvaptuġruiññaq, aglaan God-im tiliŋagaaŋa.

english: Jesus replied, “If God were your Father, you would love me, for I have come from God and am now here. I have not come on my own initiative, but he sent me.
inupiaq: Summan kaŋiqsiḷaitpisiuŋ uqautigikkaġa? Qanuq uqalumnik naalaġniḷguitchusi.

english: Why don’t you understand what I am saying? It is because you cannot accept my teaching.
inupiaq: Tuunġaq aapaksi, aasii pisuutigigiksi pisukługu aapavsi kipiġniuġutaa. Ilaa iñuaqtauruq aullaqisaamiñqaŋa, suli suksraġiŋitkaa iḷumun ittuaq, qanuq iḷumun ittuagitchuq ilaani. Saglukami ilaa uqaqtuq nanmiñiq irrutchimiñiñ, qanuq sagluturuq suli aapauruq sagluruanun.

english: You people are from your father the devil, and you want to do what your father desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not uphold the truth, because there is no truth in him. Whenever he lies, he speaks according to his own nature, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva ukpiġiŋitkivsiŋa uvaŋa uqaqtuaŋaa iḷumun ittuamik.

english: But because I am telling you the truth, you do not believe me.
inupiaq: Nallivsi qanuqpisiiḷḷiyumiñaitkaaŋa piḷuusiqiniḷuŋa. Summan aasii ukpiġisuŋitpisiŋa uqautikavsi iḷumun ittuamik?

english: Who among you can prove me guilty of any sin? If I am telling you the truth, why don’t you believe me?
inupiaq: Iñuum piruam God-miñ kaŋiqsigai uqaluŋi God-im. Ilivsi piŋił̣ł̣usi God-miñ kaŋiqsiḷaitkisi tamatkua.

english: The one who belongs to God listens and responds to God’s words. You don’t listen and respond, because you don’t belong to God.”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat kiuŋagaat, Nalauttugut uqallakapta Samaria-ġmiugunivḷutin aasii ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtutin.

english: The Judeans replied, “Aren’t we correct in saying that you are a Samaritan and are possessed by a demon?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Ilitqusiqł̣uitchuŋa. Aglaan iviġaumagiga Aapaga kamagivlugu, aasiiḷi ilivsi suksraġiŋitkivsiŋa.

english: Jesus answered, “I am not possessed by a demon, but I honor my Father – and yet you dishonor me.
inupiaq: Nanġaqtinniataŋitchuŋa iñuŋnun. Imma kamanaqsipkaiñiaqtuaqaqtuq uvamnik nalaunŋaruakun isivġiiruamik.

english: I am not trying to get praise for myself. There is one who demands it, and he also judges.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, kialiqaa kamagikpagich uqalutka tuquyumiñaipiaqtuq.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, if anyone obeys my teaching, he will never see death.”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat uqallautiŋagaat, Paŋmapak iḷitchuġirugut ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtilaaġnik. Abraham tuquŋaruq, uqaqtiŋiḷu God-im, aasii ilivich uqallaktutin, kialiqaa kamagikpagich uqaluktin tuquyumiñaipiaġnivḷugu.

english: Then the Judeans responded, “Now we know you’re possessed by a demon! Both Abraham and the prophets died, and yet you say, ‘If anyone obeys my teaching, he will never experience death.’
inupiaq: Kamanałhaaqpich aapaptiŋniñ Abraham-miñ tuquŋaruamiñ? Suli uqaqtiŋi God-im tuquŋammiut. Kiunasugivich uvva?

english: You aren’t greater than our father Abraham who died, are you? And the prophets died too! Who do you claim to be?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Kamanaqsiḷiġuma uvamnik, kamanaqsiḷġutiga suuŋitchuq. Aapama kamanaqsiḷġusiaqaqtitkaaŋa, taavruma uqautigikkavsi God-iginivḷugu ilivsi.

english: Jesus replied, “If I glorify myself, my glory is worthless. The one who glorifies me is my Father, about whom you people say, ‘He is our God.’
inupiaq: Aasii ilaa nalugiksi aglaan iḷisimagiga. Uqallakkaluaġuma naluniḷugu, saglurauniaġaluaġmiuŋa ilivsisun. Aglaan iḷisimagiga suli kamagivlugich uqaluŋi.

english: Yet you do not know him, but I know him. If I were to say that I do not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I obey his teaching.
inupiaq: Aapari Abraham quviatchaŋaruq tautukkumaaġniqamiuŋ niptaġniksraġa. Paŋmapak tautuŋagaa qaisilaaġa aasii quyatchaŋaruq.

english: Your father Abraham was overjoyed to see my day, and he saw it and was glad.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqallautiŋagaat, 50-nik ukiuniŋaitchutin suli, aasii tautuŋaviuŋ Abraham?

english: Then the Judeans replied, “You are not yet fifty years old! Have you seen Abraham?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñuusaŋaiñŋaan Abraham, Inŋaruŋa.

english: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, before Abraham came into existence, I am!”
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġimmagu, tigusiŋarut uyaġagnik miḷḷuuġukługu qanuq inmiñik nalliummatirualiñivḷugu God-mun. Tavra Jesus iriŋaruq, aasii anivḷuni aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ.

english: Then they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus hid himself and went out from the temple area.
Now as Jesus was passing by, he saw a man who had been blind from birth.
inupiaq: Iglauvluni, Jesus tautuŋagaa iñuk anikamiqaŋa ayauŋaruaq.

english: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who committed the sin that caused him to be born blind, this man or his parents?”
inupiaq: Aasii iḷitchitquraisa apiġiŋagaat, Rabbi, kiña piḷuksiŋava, una iñuk naagga aŋayuqaak, aniŋaniqpauna ayauŋavluni?

english: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but he was born blind so that the acts of God may be revealed through what happens to him.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Una iñuk piḷuksiŋaitchuq naaggaunnii aŋayuqaaŋik, aglaan tainnaittuq savaaŋa God-im qiñiġnaqsitquvlugu iłuaqsiḷugu.

english: We must perform the deeds of the one who sent me as long as it is daytime. Night is coming when no one can work.
inupiaq: Savaktuiññaqtuksraurugut savaaŋiñik tilisiruam uvamnik uvluuŋŋaan. Taaqsimman iñuk savakkumiñaitchuq.

english: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
inupiaq: Sivisutilaaŋatun nunamiinniġma, qaummatauruŋa nunapayaanun.

english: Having said this, he spat on the ground and made some mud with the saliva. He smeared the mud on the blind man’s eyes
inupiaq: Uqaġniallaġmi taavrumiŋa, tivvuaŋaruq nunamun aasii qikuyyalivḷuni tivvuaġunmiñik aasii nanukługik iñuum irrak qikuyyamik,

english: and said to him, “Go wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated “sent”). So the blind man went away and washed, and came back seeing.
inupiaq: uqallautivlugu ilaanun, Aullaġiñ iqaġiyaqtuaġiñ imaqsuanun Siloam, sivuniqaqtuam Tiliramik. Tavra ilaa aullaŋaruq aasii iqaġivluni. Utiŋaruq tautullasivḷuni.

english: Then the neighbors and the people who had seen him previously as a beggar began saying, “Is this not the man who used to sit and beg?”
inupiaq: Siḷalliŋisa tamatkualu tautuktikaaŋisa piatchiaqtaqtauvlugu, uqallausiġiŋagaat, Uvvauna taimñauŋitpa iñuk aquppisuuŋaruaq piatchiaqtaqłuni?

english: Some people said, “This is the man!” while others said, “No, but he looks like him.” The man himself kept insisting, “I am the one!”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich uqallaŋarut, Tavrauruq. Allat uqallaŋarut, Naumi, aglaan taivrumatun uvva inniqsuq. Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Taimñauruŋa.

english: So they asked him, “How then were you made to see?”
inupiaq: Iliŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Qanuqłutin ayauŋaiqpich?

english: He replied, “The man called Jesus made mud, smeared it on my eyes and told me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash.’ So I went and washed, and was able to see.”
inupiaq: Tavra kiuŋagai, Iñuum atiqaqtuam Jesus-mik qikuyyalivḷuni nanuŋagik irraka uqallautiŋagaaŋa, aullaġiñ Siloam-mun aasii iqaġilutin. Tavra aullaqłuŋa iqaġivluŋa ayauŋaiqsitauŋaruŋa.

english: They said to him, “Where is that man?” He replied, “I don’t know.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Sumiitpaimma? Ilaan uqallautiŋagai, Naluruŋa.

english: They brought the man who used to be blind to the Pharisees.
inupiaq: Ilaisa qaġġisiŋagaat Pharisee-ñun iñuk sivuani ayauŋaruaq.

english: (Now the day on which Jesus made the mud and caused him to see was a Sabbath.)
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋanni Jesus qikuyyaliŋaruq aasii ayauŋaiqł̣ugik irrak.

english: So the Pharisees asked him again how he had gained his sight. He replied, “He put mud on my eyes and I washed, and now I am able to see.”
inupiaq: Pharisees apiġitqiŋagaat qanuqłuni ayauŋaiġmagaan. Aasii uqallautiŋagai, Ilaan iḷiŋagaa qikuyyaq irramnun, aasii iqaġikama tautullasiruŋa.

english: Then some of the Pharisees began to say, “This man is not from God, because he does not observe the Sabbath.” But others said, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such miraculous signs?” Thus there was a division among them.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich Pharisees uqallaŋarut, Taimña iñuk God-miŋŋaqtuaguŋitchuq, qanuq kamaksriḷaitchuq Savaiññikun pitquranik. Allalli uqallaŋarut, Qanuġluni iñuk piḷuusiqirauruaq piyumiñaqpa tainnatchiñik aliuġnaqtuanik? Tavrani atinġiŋarut.

english: So again they asked the man who used to be blind, “What do you say about him, since he caused you to see?” “He is a prophet,” the man replied.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees apiġitqiŋagaat ayauŋaŋaruaq, Qanuġli uqallausiġiviuŋ ilaa ayauŋaiqsinŋammatin? Ilaan kiuŋagai, uqaqtauruq God-mun.

english: Now the Jewish religious leaders refused to believe that he had really been blind and had gained his sight until at last they summoned the parents of the man who had become able to see.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat arguagiŋagaat ayauŋaniŋa suli qiñillasiñiŋa, kiisaimmaa ququaqpaik aŋayuqaak ayauŋaiqsitauruam.

english: They asked the parents, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
inupiaq: Aasii apiġiŋagaik, Una iġñiġivitku, uqausiġikkaqtik aniŋanivḷugu ayauŋavluni? Qanuqłuni paŋmapak qiñillasiva?

english: So his parents replied, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
inupiaq: Ilaan aŋayuqaaŋikta kiuŋagaich, Iḷisimaruguk una iġñiġigikpuk, aniŋatilaaŋalu ayauŋavluni,

english: But we do not know how he is now able to see, nor do we know who caused him to see. Ask him, he is a mature adult. He will speak for himself.”
inupiaq: aglaan nalugikpuk qanuqłuni paŋmapak qiñillasisilaaŋa, naaggaunnii iḷisimaŋitchuguk kimun ayauŋaiqsilaaŋanik. Apiqsruqsiuŋ. Ukiuqtusiŋaruq. Uqautiginiaqtuq inmiñik.

english: (His parents said these things because they were afraid of the Jewish religious leaders. For the Jewish leaders had already agreed that anyone who confessed Jesus to be the Christ would be put out of the synagogue.
inupiaq: Aŋayuqaak uqallaŋaruk tainna sivuuġavlutik Jew-guruanik, qanuq Jew-guruat sivunnianiŋarut atisivḷutiŋ kialiqaa iḷisimanirualikpagu Jesus Christ-guniḷugu, ilaa anitauniaġnivḷugu Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianniñ.

english: For this reason his parents said, “He is a mature adult, ask him.”)
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu aŋayuqaak uqallaŋaruk, Ukiuqtusiŋaruq apiqsruqsiuŋ.

english: Then they summoned the man who used to be blind a second time and said to him, “Promise before God to tell the truth. We know that this man is a sinner.”
inupiaq: Tavra igḷuŋagaat qaitquriñiqtiŋ ayauŋaŋaruamik, aasii uqallautivlugu, Uqaġiñ iḷumun ittuamik. God nanġaġuŋ iłuaqsiraukavich. Iḷisimagikput iñuk taimña piḷuusiqirauruq qiñillasipkairuaq iliŋnik.

english: He replied, “I do not know whether he is a sinner. I do know one thing – that although I was blind, now I can see.”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Piḷuusiqirautilaaŋa nalugiga. Aglaan atausiq iḷisimagiga, ayauŋagaluaqtuaŋaa paŋmapak qiñillasiruŋa.

english: Then they said to him, “What did he do to you? How did he cause you to see?”
inupiaq: Ilaisa apiġiŋagaat, Qanusiġaqpatin? Qanuqłuni ayauŋaiqsitpatin?

english: He answered, “I told you already and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You people don’t want to become his disciples too, do you?”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagai, Quliaqtuaġutianiŋasugaavsi, aasii naalaġnisuŋitchusi. Summan tusaatqigukpisiuŋ? Ilivsivsauq iḷitchitquraliutisukpisi ilaanun?

english: They heaped insults on him, saying, “You are his disciple! We are disciples of Moses!
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa kiuŋagaat suammautivlugu, Ilivitkiuvva iḷitchitquraġiniġaatin, aglaan uvagut iḷitchitquraġigaatigut Moses.

english: We know that God has spoken to Moses! We do not know where this man comes from!”
inupiaq: Iḷisimarugut God-mun uqautisuuŋatilaaŋanik Moses, aglaan taimña iñuk nalugikput sumiñ qaisilaaŋa.

english: The man replied, “This is a remarkable thing, that you don’t know where he comes from, and yet he caused me to see!
inupiaq: Iñuum kiuŋagai, Allayuaġnapaluktuq una naluniqavsiuŋ sumiñ qaisilaaŋa, naaggauvva ayauŋaiŋagaaŋa.

english: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but if anyone is devout and does his will, God listens to him.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarugut God naalaġniḷaitchuq piḷuusiqirinun, aglaan kiñaliqaa aŋaiyyuraumman God-mun suli kamagivlugu pisuutaa, God-im naalaġniḷḷagaa.

english: Never before has anyone heard of someone causing a man born blind to see.
inupiaq: Nuna isagutilġataġmanqaŋa tusaġnaŋaitchuq iñuk aŋmaiñiḷugu irraŋnik iñuum aniŋaruam ayauŋavluni.

english: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
inupiaq: Taimña iñuk God-miŋŋaqtuaguŋaitkumi, sumik piyumiñaiñŋagaluaqtuq.

english: They replied, “You were born completely in sinfulness, and yet you presume to teach us?” So they threw him out.
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Aniŋapiallaktutin piḷuutikun. Aasiuvva iḷisautiniaqsaavisigut? Tavra ilaisa aninŋagaat aŋaiyyuviŋmiñ.

english: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, so he found the man and said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
inupiaq: Jesus tusaaŋagaa ilaiññun anitilaaŋa, aasii paqiłługu uqallautiŋagaa, Ukpiqpich Iġñiŋanun Iñuum?

english: The man replied, “And who is he, sir, that I may believe in him?”
inupiaq: Ilaan kiuŋagaa, Aŋuun, imma kiuva ukpiġvigiyumagiga?

english: Jesus told him, “You have seen him; he is the one speaking with you.” [
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Tautuaniŋagiñ, suli ilaaguruq uqaqtuaq iliŋnun.

english: He said, “Lord, I believe,” and he worshiped him.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Ataniiq, ukpiqtuŋa. Suli ilaan qiksiksrautikun sitquġvigiŋagaa.

english: Jesus said,] “For judgment I have come into this world, so that those who do not see may gain their sight, and the ones who see may become blind.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Pisigilugu qaiŋaniġa nunamun, iñuich isivġiqsauyumiñaqsirut. Ayauŋaruat qiñillasipkaġmatun ittuq kaŋiqsipkaqtitaummata iḷumun ittuamik. Aasiiḷi tamatkua tautuksiḷḷaruat ayaupkaqtitaummatun kaŋiqsiḷaił̣ł̣ugu iḷumun ittuaq iḷisimagaluakkaqtiŋ.

english: Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard this and asked him, “We are not blind too, are we?”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisa Pharisees qanittuat ilaanun tusaaŋagaat taamna, aasii apiġiŋagaat, Uvaguttauq ayauŋammivisa?

english: Jesus replied, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin, but now because you claim that you can see, your guilt remains.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Ayauŋaguvsi piḷuutaiññiaġaluaqtusi. Aglaan paŋmapak uqaqtusi, Tautullarugut, tavra piḷuutiqaqtusi.

english: “I tell you the solemn truth, the one who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs in some other way, is a thief and a robber.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñuk isiŋitchuaq paakun imnaiqaġviŋmun aglaan mayuqtuaq allakun isiġiaqłuni, taamna iñuk tigguuraqtuaguruq tigligayuktiqpauruġlu.

english: The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
inupiaq: Aglaan isiqtuaq paakun imnaiḷiqirauruq imnaiñun.

english: The doorkeeper opens the door for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
inupiaq: Upkurriqirim upkuiġutigaa. Imnaich tusaagaat nipaa, suli tuksiaġai imnaiñi atiŋisigun, aasii sivulliuqługich annisigai.

english: When he has brought all his own sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they recognize his voice.
inupiaq: Annisianikamigich iluqaisa ilaan piñi, sivulliuġai aasii imnaich malikkaat, qanuq iḷisaġimaagaat nipaa.

english: They will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him, because they do not recognize the stranger’s voice.”
inupiaq: Alla iñuk maliŋniaŋitkaat, aglaan pigruġniaqtut ilaaniñ, qanuq nalugaich nipiŋich allat iñuich.

english: Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.
inupiaq: Taamna uuktuun Jesus uqalugiŋagaa ilaiññun, aasii iliŋich kaŋiqsiŋitchut sumik uqautitilaamiŋnik.

english: So Jesus said to them again, “I tell you the solemn truth, I am the door for the sheep.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallatqiŋaruq ilaiññun, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, uvaŋa paatun ittuŋa imnaimñun.

english: All who came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ qairuat sivumni sagluqinnigiaqłutiŋ tigguuraqtuatullu tigligayuktiqpaktullu ittut, aglaan imnaima naalaġniŋaitkaich.

english: I am the door. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved, and will come in and go out, and find pasture.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa paaguruŋa. Iñupayaaq isiġumi uvapkun annaurrauniaqtuq, suli imnaisun isiġniaqtuq aniñiaqtuġlu aasii paqilluni niqaanik nauruanik.

english: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come so that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.
inupiaq: Tiggukti qaisuuruq tigligiaqsiññaqłuni tuqutchiyyaqłuniḷu suli maqutchiyyaqłuni. Uvaŋa qaiŋaruŋa iñuggutiqaquvlugich, suli iñuggusimmaġiksaaġukługich.

english: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa imnaiḷiqirigiksuaguruŋa. Imnaiḷiqirigiksuaq tuqutauyumaruq pisigivlugich imnaiñi.

english: The hired hand, who is not a shepherd and does not own sheep, sees the wolf coming and abandons the sheep and runs away. So the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.
inupiaq: Iñuk akiññagniaqtuaguruaq imnaiḷiqirauŋił̣ł̣uni, nanmiñiq imnaich pigiŋił̣ł̣ugich, tautukkaa amaġuq qairuaq, aasii qimakkai imnaich pigruqłuni, aasii amaqqum kiŋmaġai imnaich siamiłługiḷḷu.

english: Because he is a hired hand and is not concerned about the sheep, he runs away.
inupiaq: Ilaa pigruqtuq qanuq akiññagniaqtuaguruq suli suksraġiŋitkai imnaich.

english: “I am the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me –
inupiaq: Uvaŋa imnaiḷiqirigiksuaguruŋa. Aapam iḷisimmasiatun uvamnik uvaŋalu iḷisimmasivsun Aapamik, tainnatuttauq iḷisimagitka imnaitka, aasiivsauq ilaisa iḷisimagaanŋa. Aasii tuqqutiyumaaqtuaġitka imnaitka.

english: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father – and I lay down my life for the sheep.
inupiaq: Aasii allanik imnaiqaġmiuŋa inŋitchuanik uumani imnaiqaġviŋmi. Qaġġisiraksraġimmigitkaptauq, aasii naalaġniñiaġaat nipiga. Tavra atautchiiguniaqtut imnaich, suli atausiuluni imnaiḷiqiri.

english: I have other sheep that do not come from this sheepfold. I must bring them too, and they will listen to my voice, so that there will be one flock and one shepherd.
inupiaq: Aapam piviuttaġigaaŋa pisigivlugu tuqqurriyumaniġa iñuŋnik suli aŋipkaqtauluŋa.

english: This is why the Father loves me – because I lay down my life, so that I may take it back again.
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa tuqutchumiñaitkaaŋa. Uvamnik tuqutausaaġiruŋa tainna pisukłuŋa. God-im ataniġnaqutiksriñŋagaaŋa tuqquriḷḷasivḷuŋa suli aŋiḷuŋa tuqqunmiñ. Tainna ilaan piraksriŋagaaŋa.

english: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down of my own free will. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it back again. This commandment I received from my Father.”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat atinġitqiŋarut pisigivlugich taapkua uqaluich.

english: Another sharp division took place among the Jewish people because of these words.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat uqaŋarut, Ilaa ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuq aasii kinnaġuqłuni. Summan naalaġniraksrauva?

english: Many of them were saying, “He is possessed by a demon and has lost his mind! Why do you listen to him?”
inupiaq: Allat uqallaŋarut, Makua uqalugiŋitkai iñuum ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuam. Ilitqusiqł̣uk qiñillasipkaiḷḷava ayauŋaruanik?

english: Others said, “These are not the words of someone possessed by a demon. A demon cannot cause the blind to see, can it?”
inupiaq: Niqinaqiŋarut Jerusalem-mi, itqaunmik salummaġniŋanun aŋaiyyuvikpaum.

english: Then came the feast of the Dedication in Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Ukiuguŋaruq aasii Jesus pisuaŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, taġġisimaaġviŋmi atiqaqtuami Solomon-mik.

english: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple area in Solomon’s Portico.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat katinŋarut avataanun aasii uqallautivlugu, Qanutun sivisutigiruamik nalautchuġaqtinniaqpisigut? Christ-guguvich, uqallautitigut nalupqinaiġḷugu.

english: The Jewish leaders surrounded him and asked, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uqallautianiŋagaluaġivsi arguagigivsiŋa. Savaama ataniġnaqutaagun Aapama nalupqinaiyaġaluaġaa kiutilaaġa,

english: Jesus replied, “I told you and you do not believe. The deeds I do in my Father’s name testify about me.
inupiaq: aasii ukpiŋitchusi qanuq imnaiġiŋitkivsi.

english: But you refuse to believe because you are not my sheep.
inupiaq: Imnaima naalaġnigaat nipiga, aasii iḷisimagitka, aasiiḷi maliġuaġaanŋa.

english: My sheep listen to my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
inupiaq: Aasii isuitchuamik iñuupkaġniaġitka, iliŋich aasii nalupqinaitchuamik tammaġumiñaipiaqtut. Suli supayaam aqsaaġniktaaġiyumiñaitkai uvamniñ.

english: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish; no one will snatch them from my hand.
inupiaq: Aapaga qaitchiŋaruaq iliŋiññik uvamnun, kamanałhaaqtuq iluqaiññiñ, aasii supayaam aqsaaġniktaaġiyumiñaitkai Aapamniñ.

english: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one can snatch them from my Father’s hand.
inupiaq: Uvaŋalu Aapagalu atausiuruguk.

english: The Father and I are one.”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat tigusitqiŋagalualgitchut uyaġaŋnik miḷḷuuġukługu.

english: The Jewish leaders picked up rocks again to stone him to death.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Qiñiqtinŋagivsi iñugiaktuanik savaalluatanik Aapamiñ, nalliatigun tamatkua uyaġagniaqpisiŋa?

english: Jesus said to them, “I have shown you many good deeds from the Father. For which one of them are you going to stone me?”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat kiuŋagaat, Uyaġagniaqsaaŋitkiptigiñ nalliatigun savaaġiksuat aglaan uqamaqłuutipkun God-ikun. Qanuq ilivich, iñugruiññauvlutin, iḷiuqtutin iliŋnik God-aunivḷutin.

english: The Jewish leaders replied, “We are not going to stone you for a good deed but for blasphemy, because you, a man, are claiming to be God.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Aglautiŋaruq ilivsi nanmiñiq pitquravsiññi God uqallaŋanivḷugu inna, “Ilivsi god-aurusi.”

english: Jesus answered, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’?
inupiaq: Iḷisimarugut Bible uqaluŋich iḷumun itilaaŋannik isuitchuamun, aasii ilaan taiŋagai god-inik tamatkua akuqtuiruat God-im uqaluŋiñik.

english: If those people to whom the word of God came were called ‘gods’ (and the scripture cannot be broken),
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainman, summan pasivisiŋa uqamaqłuŋnivḷuŋa uqallakama Iġñiġinivḷuŋa God-mun? Taamnauruŋa Aapam piksraqtaaġiŋakkaŋa aasii tilivḷuŋa nunamun.

english: do you say about the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
inupiaq: Savaaqaŋitkuma savaaŋiñik Aapama ukpiġinasiŋa.

english: If I do not perform the deeds of my Father, do not believe me.
inupiaq: Aglaan savaaġigupkich God-im savaaŋi ukpiliutigisigik uvaŋaġruiññaq ukpiġiŋitkaluaġuvsiŋa. Tavraasii puttuqsriñiaqtusi nalupqisuŋaiġḷusi Aapam uvamniitilaaŋanik suli uvaŋa Aapamiitilaamnik.

english: But if I do them, even if you do not believe me, believe the deeds, so that you may come to know and understand that I am in the Father and the Father is in me.”
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaqsatqikkalualgitkaat, aasii ilaa tigupkaŋitchuq.

english: Then they attempted again to seize him, but he escaped their clutches.
inupiaq: Jesus aullatqiŋaruq ikaaqługu Jordan, inimun John paptaiqsivigiqqaaŋaraŋanun, aasii tavraniitkaqsivḷuni.

english: Jesus went back across the Jordan River again to the place where John had been baptizing at an earlier time, and he stayed there.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat iñuich ullaŋagaat aasii uqaŋarut, John piŋaitchuq aliuġnaqtuanik, aglaan supayaat John uqalugiŋakkaŋi uumuuna iñukun iḷumun ittut.

english: Many came to him and began to say, “John performed no miraculous sign, but everything John said about this man was true!”
inupiaq: Tavra iñugiaktuat tavrani ukpiŋarut Jesus-mun.

english: And many believed in Jesus there.
Now a certain man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village where Mary and her sister Martha lived.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk naŋiliŋaruq atiqaqtuaq Lazarus-mik iñuuruaq Bethany-mi, aniqatigiik Mary-vḷu Martha-vlu iñuuviaŋni.

english: (Now it was Mary who anointed the Lord with perfumed oil and wiped his feet dry with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
inupiaq: Taamna Mary tivraġiksaiŋaruaq Ataniġmik, aasii tilaktiqługich isigaŋi nutchamiñik. Aniqatiginiġaa naŋittuam Lazarus-gum.

english: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus, “Lord, look, the one you love is sick.”
inupiaq: Tavra aniqatigiik tilisiŋaruk Jesus-mun uqaqłutik, Ataniiq, taimña piviuttaġikkan naŋiliqsuq.

english: When Jesus heard this, he said, “This sickness will not lead to death, but to God’s glory, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tusaakamiuŋ uqallaŋaruq, Taamna naŋirrun tuqqunmun isuqaŋitchuq, aglaan ittuq kamanaqsiḷġutigitquvlugu God-mun, taamna Iġñiŋa God-im kamanaqsiḷiqtautquvlugu taavrumuuna naŋirrutikun.

english: (Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.)
inupiaq: Jesus piviuttaġiŋagai Martha-lu aniqataalu Mary Lazarus-lu.

english: So when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he remained in the place where he was for two more days.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamiuŋ Lazarus naŋinnivḷugu, uvlivsaaŋaruq malġugnik inimi irvigiramiñi.

english: Then after this, he said to his disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa uqallaŋaruq iḷitchitquramiñun, Utiqta Judea-mun.

english: The disciples replied, “Rabbi, the Jewish leaders were just now trying to stone you to death! Are you going there again?”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat uqallautiŋagaat, Rabbi, Jew-guruat uyaġagnik miḷḷuuġniaqqammiŋasugaatin, aasiuvva taamuŋatqiaqsiḷgitpich?

english: Jesus replied, “Are there not twelve hours in a day? If anyone walks around in the daytime, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Qulit malġugnik ikarraqaŋitpa qaummaġiksuaq uvluq? Kiñaliqaa pisuaqtuaq uvlumi putukkitchuitchuq, qanuq tautuksipkallagaa qaummaŋata mattuma nunam.

english: But if anyone walks around at night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa pisuaqtuaq unnuami putukkiññiaqtuq, qanuq qaummaġmik piitchuq.

english: After he said this, he added, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep. But I am going there to awaken him.”
inupiaq: Taavrumiŋa uqallaŋaruq. Aasii uqallautivlugich, Avilaitqatikput Lazarus siñiksaaniŋaruq, aglaan aullaġniaqtuŋa itiqtitchaqtuġlugu.

english: Then the disciples replied, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”
inupiaq: Iḷitchitqurat uqallautiŋagaat, Ataniiq, siñiksaaniŋagumi iłuaqsiñiaqtuq.

english: (Now Jesus had been talking about his death, but they thought he had been talking about real sleep.)
inupiaq: Jesus uqautigiŋagaa tuquniŋa, aasiiḷi isumaŋarut sivuniġinasugalugu piḷaiŋaiqsiaġniŋa siñikłuni.

english: Then Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus has died,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai nalupqinaiqł̣ugu, Lazarus tuquŋaruq.

english: and I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
inupiaq: Quyaruŋa pisigivlusi taamaniinŋiññama ukpiquvlusi. Ullaglakput.

english: So Thomas (called Didymus) said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go too, so that we may die with him.”
inupiaq: Thomas taggisiqaqtuaq igḷuanik Malġim uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitqurauqatini, Uvagullu aullaqta tuquqatigiyumagikput Ataniq.

english: When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had been in the tomb four days already.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikiññami, iḷitchuġiŋagaa Lazarus iḷuvviviŋmiitanikługu uvluni sisamani.

english: (Now Bethany was less than two miles from Jerusalem,
inupiaq: Bethany qaninŋaruq Jerusalem-mun, malġuktuvalliq mile-luuġutiktun.

english: so many of the Jewish people of the region had come to Martha and Mary to console them over the loss of their brother.)
inupiaq: Aasii iñugiaktuat Jew-guruaniñ qaiŋaniqsut Martha-mullu Mary-mullu quviasaaġiaqługik aniqataakkun.

english: So when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary was sitting in the house.
inupiaq: Martha tusaakami Jesus qalliñivḷugu, aullaqłuni paaŋagaa, Mary aimmipkaqługu.

english: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
inupiaq: Martha-m uqallautiŋagaa Jesus, Ataniiq, maaniinŋaguvich aniqatiga tuqunayaitchuq.

english: But even now I know that whatever you ask from God, God will grant you.”
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak-unnii iḷisimaruŋa supayaamik apiqsriguvich God-miñ, God-im aitchuġniaġaatin.

english: Jesus replied, “Your brother will come back to life again.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Aniqatin aŋiñiaqtuq.

english: Martha said, “I know that he will come back to life again in the resurrection at the last day.”
inupiaq: Martha-m uqallautiŋagaa, Iḷisimaruŋa ilaa aŋitqigñiaqtilaaŋanik aŋŋiviŋmi aqulliġmi uvlumi.

english: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live even if he dies,
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Uvaŋa aŋŋisauruŋa iñuggutauruŋalu. Iñuk ukpiqtuaq uvamnun tuqugaluaġluqtum-unnii iñuuniaqtuq.

english: and the one who lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
inupiaq: Suli kiñaliqaa iñuuruaq ukpiqtuaġlu uvamnun tuquyumiñaipiaqtuq. Taamna ukpiġiviuŋ?

english: She replied, “Yes, Lord, I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God who comes into the world.”
inupiaq: Martha-m kiuŋagaa, Aaŋ Ataniiq, ukpiqtuŋa Christ-gutilaaġnik, Iġñiŋa God-im, qaiyumaaŋaruaq nunamun.

english: And when she had said this, Martha went and called her sister Mary, saying privately, “The Teacher is here and is asking for you.”
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, Martha aullaŋaruq aasii ququaqługu aniqatini Mary, uqautiŋagaa nipikisuuraqłuni, Iḷisaurri tikitchuq aasiamma qaitqugaatin.

english: So when Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
inupiaq: Aasii Mary-m tusaakamiuŋ taamna, qilamik makinŋaruq aasii ullakługu Jesus.

english: (Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was still in the place where Martha had come out to meet him.)
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tikipiaġataŋaitchuq suli nunaaqqimun, aglaan inimiinŋaruq-suli Martha-m kasuutiviani.

english: Then the people who were with Mary in the house consoling her saw her get up quickly and go out. They followed her, because they thought she was going to the tomb to weep there.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat tuvaaqatauruat Mary-mun iglumi quviasaaqługu, tautukamirruŋ makittuaq qilamiqsruqłuni animman, maliŋagaat, isumavlutiŋ iḷuvviviŋmuksaġasugalugu qiayaqtuqłuni taamani.

english: Now when Mary came to the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said to him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
inupiaq: Tavra Mary, tikiññami Jesus irvianun tautukługu, sitquŋaruq sivuġaanun, uqallakłuni ilaanun, Ataniiq, maaniinŋaguvich aniqatiga tuqunayaitchuq.

english: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the people who had come with her weeping, he was intensely moved in spirit and greatly distressed.
inupiaq: Jesus tautukamiuŋ qiaruaq, Jew-guruallu qaiqatiŋi qiarraqsimmataptauq, ilaa aniqsaapaŋaruq iḷunŋutchakłuni.

english: He asked, “Where have you laid him?” They replied, “Lord, come and see.”
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan apiġiŋagai, Sumun iḷiŋavisiuŋ? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Ataniiq, qaiḷutin tautugiaġuŋ.

english: Jesus wept.
inupiaq: Jesus qulviŋaruq.

english: Thus the people who had come to mourn said, “Look how much he loved him!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat uqallaŋarut, Tautuksiuŋ piviuttaġipaluŋniġaa.

english: But some of them said, “This is the man who caused the blind man to see! Couldn’t he have done something to keep Lazarus from dying?”
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi iḷaŋich uqallaŋarut, Uvvauma aŋmaiḷḷaruam ayauŋaruam irraŋnik tuqutchaiḷiyumiñaiñŋavauŋ taamna iñuk?

english: Jesus, intensely moved again, came to the tomb. (Now it was a cave, and a stone was placed across it.)
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aniqsaapatqiŋaruq, aasii tikiñŋaruq iḷuvviviŋmun qaiġusuŋmun, uyaġaŋmik umiqaqtuamun.

english: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of the deceased, replied, “Lord, by this time the body will have a bad smell, because he has been buried four days.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Piiqsiuŋ uyaġak. Martha, aniqataa tuquŋaruam uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Ataniiq, paŋmapaŋmun naimanaqsiyumiñaqsiruq qanuq sisamani uvluni tuquŋaaniktuq.

english: Jesus responded, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believe, you would see the glory of God?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Uqallautiŋaitpigiñ ukpiġumiñaġuvich tautukkumiñaġnivḷutin kamanautaanik God-im?

english: So they took away the stone. Jesus looked upward and said, “Father, I thank you that you have listened to me.
inupiaq: Tavra piiŋagaat uyaġak. Aasii Jesus qiviaqłuni qunmun uqallaŋaruq, Aapaaŋ, quyyavigigikpiñ tusaaŋakamŋa.

english: I knew that you always listen to me, but I said this for the sake of the crowd standing around here, that they may believe that you sent me.”
inupiaq: Iḷisimaruŋa tusaasuugiŋma ataramik, aglaan taapkua uqallausiġigitka pisigivlugich iñuich qikaqtuat uvani, ukpiliquvlugich iliŋnun tiliŋatilaamnik.

english: When he had said this, he shouted in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, Jesus ququulaŋagaa nipatuvluni, Lazarus anniiñ.

english: The one who had died came out, his feet and hands tied up with strips of cloth, and a cloth wrapped around his face. Jesus said to them, “Unwrap him and let him go.”
inupiaq: Tavra tuquŋaŋaruaq iñuk aniŋaruq, argaŋi isigaŋiḷu nimmaaġutiqaqłutiŋ iḷuvviuġutinik, suli kiiñaŋa nimmaaġutiqaqłuni ukił̣haamik. Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Nimiġutaiyaqsiuŋ aasii aullaqtillugu.

english: Then many of the people, who had come with Mary and had seen the things Jesus did, believed in him.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat Jew-guruani qaiqatauruat Mary-mun suli tautukłutiŋ Jesus piraanik, ukpiliŋarut ilaanun.

english: But some of them went to the Pharisees and reported to them what Jesus had done.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷaŋich aullaŋarut Pharisee-ñun aasii quliaqtuaġutivlugich sumik Jesus savaktilaaŋanik.

english: So the chief priests and the Pharisees called the council together and said, “What are we doing? For this man is performing many miraculous signs.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich Pharisees-lu katinŋagaich ataniġnaqusiraqtuat aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Qanuġniaqpisa? Qanuq taimña iñuk savaktuq iñugiaktuanik aliuġnaqtuanik ukpiġnaqtuanik iñuŋnun.

english: If we allow him to go on in this way, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away our sanctuary and our nation.”
inupiaq: Iḷatchiġuptigu tainna, iñupayaaq ukpiġniaqtuq ilaanun, suli Rome-miut qaiñiaqtut aasii suksraunġiġḷugik iluqaaktun aŋaiyyuvikpakpullu nunauniqpullu.

english: Then one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said, “You know nothing at all!
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋat, Caiaphas, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiġikkaŋat taavrumani ukiumi, uqallaŋaruq ilaiññun, Iḷisimaŋitchusi sumikunnii.

english: You do not realize that it is more to your advantage to have one man die for the people than for the whole nation to perish.”
inupiaq: Kaŋiqsiŋaitchusi anniqsuutauniaqtilaaŋanik uvaptiŋnun iñuk tuqqurrikpan iñuŋnik tamatkiġḷugu nunauniqput iñuktuummaan suksraunġiquŋiḷḷugu.

english: (Now he did not say this on his own, but because he was high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the Jewish nation,
inupiaq: Ilaan uqallausiġiŋaitkaa taamna inmisuġruiññaq, aglaan aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiġivlugu taavrumani ukiumi uqaŋaruq God-miñ tuqqurriruksraunivḷugu Jesus Jew-guruanik.

english: and not for the Jewish nation only, but to gather together into one the children of God who are scattered.)
inupiaq: Aasiivsauqami Jew-guruanun kisiŋiḷaaŋiññun, aglaan atausiŋŋuġukługich miqłiqtuŋi God-im siaminŋaruat sumiḷiqaa.

english: So from that day they planned together to kill him.
inupiaq: Tavra taavrumaŋŋaaglaan uvlumiñ sivunniuŋarut qanuġlugu tuqutchukługu Jesus.

english: Thus Jesus no longer went around publicly among the Judeans, but went away from there to the region near the wilderness, to a town called Ephraim, and stayed there with his disciples.
inupiaq: Jesus tavraŋŋaaglaan kukiḷuŋaiqsuq salapqiruakun akunġanni Jew-guruat, aglaan aullaŋaruq tavraŋŋa nunamun qanittuamun nunagluktuamun, nunaaqqimun atiqaqtuamun Ephraim-mik, aasii tavraniinŋaruq iḷitchitquraniḷu.

english: Now the Jewish feast of Passover was near, and many people went up to Jerusalem from the rural areas before the Passover to cleanse themselves ritually.
inupiaq: Tavra niqinaqivia Itqautim Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun Jew-guruani qalliŋaruq. Aasii iñugiaktuat nunamiñ Jerusalem-muŋarut sivuani niqinaqivium itqanaiyaġiaqłutiŋ, salummaksaġiaqłutiŋ inmiŋnik pitqurat pitqutaatigun.

english: Thus they were looking for Jesus, and saying to one another as they stood in the temple courts, “What do you think? That he won’t come to the feast?”
inupiaq: Ilaisa ivaŋagaat Jesus suli uqaqłutiŋ avanmun qikallaġmiŋ aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, Qanuq isumavisi? Niqinaqiyaqtuġniaŋiññasugivisiuŋ?

english: (Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who knew where Jesus was should report it, so that they could arrest him.)
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu Pharisees-lu piraksriiŋarut kialiqaa iḷisimakpagu sumiitilaaŋa Jesus, iḷitchuġipkaquvlutiŋ tigutaaġukługu.

english: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom he had raised from the dead.
inupiaq: Itchaksrat uvlut kisiŋŋuġmata Itqaġviŋmun Qulaurrusiqiviŋmik, Jesus qaiŋaruq Bethany-mun, Lazarus iñuuvianun, Jesus aŋipkaŋaraŋata tuqqunmiñ.

english: So they prepared a dinner for Jesus there. Martha was serving, and Lazarus was among those present at the table with him.
inupiaq: Nullautchiuġutiŋagaat Jesus tavrani. Martha savakłuni, suli Lazarus iḷauvluni taapkunuŋa niġiruani piqatigivlugu ilaa.

english: Then Mary took three quarters of a pound of expensive aromatic oil from pure nard and anointed the feet of Jesus. She then wiped his feet dry with her hair. (Now the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfumed oil.)
inupiaq: Mary tigusiŋaruq atautchisun uqumaisilaaqaqtuamik akisuruamik tivraġiksaunmik atiqaqtuamik Nard, aasii tivraġiksaŋagai isigaŋi Jesus, suli saluaqtiqługich nutchamiñik, aasii iglu naimanaqsiŋaruq tipaanik tivraġiksautim.

english: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples (the one who was going to betray him) said,
inupiaq: Tavra Judas Iscariot, iḷaŋat iḷitchitqurat, taamna aitchuutiginnikkumaaqtuaq Jesus-mik, uqallaŋaruq,

english: “Why wasn’t this oil sold for three hundred silver coins and the money given to the poor?”
inupiaq: Summan una tivraġiksaun tuniŋaitpa 300 taalamun aasii aitchuutigilugich iḷiappauruanun?

english: (Now Judas said this not because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief. As keeper of the money box, he used to steal what was put into it.)
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa, suksraġiŋitkaluaŋŋaisa iḷiappauruat aglaan ilaa tigligayuktauvluni, suli ilaan pigivlugu maniqaġviat tigusisuuŋaruq tavraŋŋa iksraniñ.

english: So Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept it for the day of my burial.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Iḷaksianagu. Ilaan pigiliuŋ pigikkani uvluanun iḷuvviuqtauniksrama.

english: For you will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me!”
inupiaq: Iḷiappauruat nayuqtigigisi ataramik, aglaan uvaŋa nayuqtiginiaŋitkivsiŋa ataramik.

english: Now a large crowd of Judeans learned that Jesus was there, and so they came not only because of him but also to see Lazarus whom he had raised from the dead.
inupiaq: Iñugiapiaġataqtuat iñusalaich Jew-guruat qaiŋarut iḷitchuġikamiŋ Jesus tavraniitilaaŋanik, pisigisuŋaġnagu Jesus kisian aglaallu tautugiaqługu Lazarus aŋipkaŋakkaŋa tuqqunmiñ.

english: So the chief priests planned to kill Lazarus too,
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich sivunniuŋammiut tuqutchukługu Lazarus,

english: for on account of him many of the Jewish people from Jerusalem were going away and believing in Jesus.
inupiaq: qanuq ilaa pisigivlugu iñugiaktuat Jew-guruat maliġuaŋaiŋagaich qaukłisiŋ, aasii ukpiqłutiŋ Jesus-mun.

english: The next day the large crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Uvlutqigman iñugiapiaġataqtuat niqinaqiyaqtuŋaruat tusaaŋarut Jesus Jerusalem-muaqsiñivḷugu.

english: So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him. They began to shout, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the king of Israel!”
inupiaq: Tavra tigusiŋarut qisiqsiutinik palm napaaqtuŋiññiñ, aasii aullaqłutiŋ paaqsaqługu nipaalavlutiŋ, Hosanna. Nanġaqtauli God. Nanġaqtauli qairuaq pisivlugu Ataniq. God-im piḷḷuataqtilliuŋ umialgat Israel.

english: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, just as it is written,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus paqinŋaruq kakaktim nuġġaŋanik aasii kakaksiġvigivlugu, aglaaguniŋatun Bible-ni,

english: “Do not be afraid, people of Zion; look, your king is coming, seated on a donkey’s colt!”
inupiaq: Iñusalaich itqatauŋaruat Jesus ququaġmagu Lazarus iḷuvviviŋmiñ, aŋipkaqługu tuqqunmiñ, quliaqtuaġiŋagaat taamna iñuŋnun.

english: (His disciples did not understand these things when they first happened, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him and that these things had happened to him.)
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu iñugiaktuat paaġiaŋagaat Jesus, tusaavlutiŋ ilaa savaktilaaŋanik taavrumiŋa aliuġnaqtuamik nalupqinaiyautauruamik kiutilaaŋanun.

english: So the crowd who had been with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead were continuing to testify about it.
inupiaq: Tavra Pharisees tavrani uqaŋarut avanmun, Iḷitchuġisitchi qanuġnaġumiñaiqsilaaŋanik. Tautuksiuŋ, iñupayaat iluqaġmiŋ malliutigaat.

english: Because they had heard that Jesus had performed this miraculous sign, the crowd went out to meet him.
inupiaq: Greek-nik iḷaqaŋarut aŋaiyyuyaqtuqtuanik nanġaiyaqtuqłutiglu God-mik niqinaqiviŋmi.

english: Thus the Pharisees said to one another, “You see that you can do nothing. Look, the world has run off after him!”
inupiaq: Tavra taapkua ullaŋagaat Philip, Bethsaida-ġmiu Galilee-miittuamiñ, aasii uqallautivlugu, Aŋuun, tautugukkikput Jesus.

english: Now some Greeks were among those who had gone up to worship at the feast.
inupiaq: Philip aullaqłuni uqallautiŋagaa Andrew. Tavra Andrew-vlu Philip-lu uqallautiŋagaak Jesus.

english: So these approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and requested, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus kiuŋagik, Ikarraq tikitchuq Iġñiŋan Iñuum kamanaqsipkaqtauviksraŋa.

english: Philip went and told Andrew, and they both went and told Jesus.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, palauvaksraq kataŋisuaqpan nunam iḷuanun aasii tuquliḷuni nauriḷaitchuq. Aglaan tuqulikpan, iñugiaksiḷuni nauniaqtuq.

english: Jesus replied, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa iñuullatuvaił̣aktuaq, tammaiñiaqtuq iñuggunmiñik. Aasii kiñaliqaa sullatuaġumiḷu atiruaq mattumani nunami, iñuuniaqtuq isuitchuamun.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, unless a kernel of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it produces much grain.
inupiaq: Iñuum savautiniaġumiŋa, maliġuagaksraġipiaġaaŋa, aasii sumiitkuma, tavrani kivgaġa inniaġmiuq. Kialiqaa savautikpaŋa, Aapam nanġaġniaġaa savaurriruaq uvamnik.

english: The one who loves his life destroys it, and the one who hates his life in this world guards it for eternal life.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak iłuiḷḷiuqpaktuŋa. Aasii qanuq uqallagniaqpik? Uqallagniaqpik, Aapaaŋ annautiŋŋa uumaŋŋa ikarraġmiñ? Naumi, taamna sivuniġivlugu tikitchuŋa uumuŋa ikarraġmun.

english: If anyone wants to serve me, he must follow me, and where I am, my servant will be too. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
inupiaq: Aapaaŋ, nanġausiaqaġiñ nalautchumaagaqsikkapkun. Tavra nipi tusaġnaŋaruq qiḷaŋmiñ uqallaktuaq, Nanġausiaqaaniŋaruŋa ilivich savaaġianikkapkun, suli nanġausiaqavsaaġniaqtuŋa ilivich nalautchumaagaqsikkapkun.

english: “Now my soul is greatly distressed. And what should I say? ‘Father, deliver me from this hour’? No, but for this very reason I have come to this hour.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat makitaruat tamaani tusaaŋagaat nipi aasii uqallakłutiŋ kallulanivḷugu. Allalli uqallaŋarut, Isaġulgum uqautiŋagaa.

english: Father, glorify your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Taamna nipi tusaġnaŋaruq ilivsi pisigivlusi, uvaŋaŋił̣aaq.

english: The crowd that stood there and heard the voice said that it had thundered. Others said that an angel had spoken to him.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak isivġiqsauniksraŋa mattuma nunam iñuata tikitchuq. Paŋmapak Tuunġaq atanniqsimariŋa mattuma nunam iñuŋisa akiiḷirauniaqtuq.

english: Jesus said, “This voice has not come for my benefit but for yours.
inupiaq: Aasii kiviktauguma aŋarraurakun uvaŋa qaisuliqsinniaġitka iñupayaat uvamnun.

english: Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be driven out.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa iḷitchuġipkaqsaqługu qanutchikun tuqqutikun ilaan tuquniaqtilaani.

english: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat kiuŋagaat, Tusaaŋarugut pitquraniñ Christ innivḷugu isuitchuamun. Qanuġlutin uqallakkumiñaqpich Iġñiŋa Iñuum kiviktauruksrauniḷugu? Kiuvauna Iġñiŋa Iñuum?

english: (Now he said this to indicate clearly what kind of death he was going to die.)
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uvaŋa qaummatauruaŋaa nayuutiuravsaallaŋniaqtuŋa ilivsiññun. Sivunmuktuġitchi qaummatiqaŋŋavsi, iḷaanni taaqsisiviaġaasi. Iñuk pisuaqtuaq taaqtuami naluruq suŋnamuktilaamiñik.
