english: Then the crowd responded, “We have heard from the law that the Christ will remain forever. How can you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
inupiaq: Qaummatiqaŋŋavsi ukpiġitchi qaummatauruamun miqłiqtuliutiyumausi God-mun qaummatiqaġlusi.

english: Jesus replied, “The light is with you for a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, so that the darkness may not overtake you. The one who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqallausiġianikamiuŋ taamna, aullaŋaruq aasii iriqłuni ilaiññiñ.

english: While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become sons of light.” When Jesus had said these things, he went away and hid himself from them.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaa piŋagaluaqtillugu qanutun iñugiaktigiruanik aliuġnaqtuanik nalupqinaiyautinik kiutilaamiñun takkuġmiŋni, iliŋich ukpiŋaitchut ilaanun.

english: Although Jesus had performed so many miraculous signs before them, they still refused to believe in him,
inupiaq: Tainnainŋaniqsuq uqaluk uqautigiŋakkaŋa uqaqtaata God-im Isaiah-m taŋŋiquvlugu,

english: so that the word of Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled. He said, “Lord, who has believed our message, and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
inupiaq: Tainnaitkaluaŋŋaan iñugiaktuat ataniġnaqutiqaqtuaniñ ukpiŋarut ilaanun, aglaan sivuuġagivlugich Pharisees, iliŋich iḷitchuġipkaŋaitchut taavrumiŋa, anitauniaġasugalutiŋ Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianniñ,

english: For this reason they could not believe, because again Isaiah said,
inupiaq: qanuq nakuaġiłhaaŋagaat nanġausiaqaġniq iñuŋniñ naumavlugu nanġausiaqaġniġmiñ God-miñ.

english: “He has blinded their eyes
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus nipatusivḷuni uqallaŋaruq, Iñuk ukpiqtuaq uvamnun ukpiqsiññaŋitchuq uvamnun aglaan tilirimnullu.

english: and hardened their heart,
inupiaq: Aasii iñuum tautuktuam uvamnik tautukkaa tilisiŋaruaq uvamnik.

english: so that they would not see with their eyes
inupiaq: Qaiŋaruŋa qaummatauvluŋa iñupayaanun, kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq uvamnun taaqtuamiitquŋił̣ł̣ugu.

english: and understand with their heart,
inupiaq: Kialiqaa tusaakpagich uqalutka aasii kamagiŋił̣ł̣ugich, uvaŋa isivġiŋitkiga, qanuq qaiŋaitchuŋa isivġiġiaġlugich iñuich, aglaan annautiyaqtuqługich.

english: and turn to me, and I would heal them.”
inupiaq: Iñuk ayyairuaq uvamnik suli akuqtuŋił̣ł̣ugich uqalutka isivġiqsiqaqtuq. Uqaluich uqautigikkaġma isivġiġñiaġaa aqulliġmi uvlumi.

english: Isaiah said these things because he saw Christ’s glory, and spoke about him.
inupiaq: Qanuq uqaŋaitchuŋa uvaŋaġruiññaq ataniġnaqutipkun, Aapam tilisiruam uvamnik ilaan piraksriŋagaaŋa sunik uqaqtuksrautilaamnik.

english: Nevertheless, even among the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they would not confess Jesus to be the Christ, so that they would not be put out of the synagogue.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷisimaruŋa taapkua uqaluich iñuggutiqaġnaqtut isuitchuamik. Tavraasii suna uqallausiġiraġa iḷisaurrutigiraġalu pigiga Aapam uqallausiatun uvamnun.

english: For they loved praise from men more than praise from God.
But Jesus shouted out, “The one who believes in me does not believe in me, but in the one who sent me,
and the one who sees me sees the one who sent me.
I have come as a light into the world, so that everyone who believes in me should not remain in darkness.
If anyone hears my words and does not obey them, I do not judge him. For I have not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
The one who rejects me and does not accept my words has a judge; the word I have spoken will judge him at the last day.
For I have not spoken from my own authority, but the Father himself who sent me has commanded me what I should say and what I should speak.
And I know that his commandment is eternal life. Thus the things I say, I say just as the Father has told me.”
Just before the Passover feast, Jesus knew that his time had come to depart from this world to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he now loved them to the very end.
inupiaq: Tavra sivuani niqinaqivian Itqautim Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun, Jesus iḷitchuġiŋaruq ikarraq tikisilaaŋanik aullaġviksrani mattumaŋŋa nunamiñ Aapamun. Aasii ilaan piviuttaġivlugich nanmiñiq piñi nunamiittuat piviuttaġiŋagai isuanun-aglaan.

english: The evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, that he should betray Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus-lu iḷitchitquraniḷu nullautchiŋarut. Tuunġaum isummiŋagaa Judas Simon Iscariot iġñiŋa aitchuutigitquvlugu Jesus.

english: Because Jesus knew that the Father had handed all things over to him, and that he had come from God and was going back to God,
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus iḷisimaŋaruq Aapamun qaisilaaŋanik iluqaan suaŋŋan inmiñun, suli iḷisimaŋammiuq qaiŋatilaamiñik God-miñ suli aullaġniaqtilaamiñik God-mun.

english: he got up from the meal, removed his outer clothes, took a towel and tied it around himself.
inupiaq: Jesus tavrani makinŋaruq niġġiviŋniñ, iḷivḷugich qalliich annuġaani, tavsiŋaruq imaiyaunmik.

english: He poured water into the washbasin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to dry them with the towel he had wrapped around himself.
inupiaq: Tavra kuvisiŋaruq imiġmik iqaqqiviŋmun, aasii iqaġirraqsivḷugich iḷitchitqurat isigaŋich, saluaqtiqługich imaiyaunmik tavsigikkamiñik.

english: Then he came to Simon Peter. Peter said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
inupiaq: Tikiñŋagaa Simon Peter, aasii Peter-m apiġiŋagaa, Ataniiq, iqaġiaqsivigich isigatka?

english: Jesus replied, “You do not understand what I am doing now, but you will understand after these things.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Sutilaaġa nalugaluaġiñ paŋmapak, aglaan aquvatigun kaŋiqsiñiaqtutin.

english: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus replied, “If I do not wash you, you have no share with me.”
inupiaq: Peter-m uqallautiŋagaa, Iqaġiyumiñaipiaġitin isigatka. Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iqaġiŋitkupkiñ, piqatauyumiñaitchutin uvamnun.

english: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, wash not only my feet, but also my hands and my head!”
inupiaq: Simon Peter-m uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, iqaġikkich isigałhiñaŋiḷaatka aglaan argatka niaquġalu.

english: Jesus replied, “The one who has bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean. And you disciples are clean, but not every one of you.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Iñuk ivvaqtuaniŋaruaq iqaġiraksraitchuq isigaŋiaglaan, qanuq salummaqtuq tamaġmi. Aasiuvva salumarusi, aglaan tamatkiŋitchusi.

english: (For Jesus knew the one who was going to betray him. For this reason he said, “Not every one of you is clean.”)
inupiaq: Qanuq Jesus iḷisimaŋaruq kimun aitchuutiginiaqtilaamiñik, taamna pisigivlugu ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Tamatkiġḷusi salummaŋitchusi.

english: So when Jesus had washed their feet and put his outer clothing back on, he took his place at the table again and said to them, “Do you understand what I have done for you?
inupiaq: Iqaġianikamigich isigaŋich, tiguanikługiḷḷu qalliich annuġaani, inimiñukami uqallautiŋagai, Iḷisimavisi sutilaamnik ilivsiññun?

english: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and do so correctly, for that is what I am.
inupiaq: Taisuugivsiŋa Iḷisaurrimik Ataniġmiglu, aasii nalauttusi qanuq tainnasiuruŋa.

english: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you too ought to wash one another’s feet.
inupiaq: Uvaŋaasii, ilivsi Ataniqsi Iḷisaurriksiḷu, iqaġiŋagupkich isigasi, ilivsivsauq iqaġiraksraġigaluaġmigisi isigasi avanmun.

english: For I have given you an example – you should do just as I have done for you.
inupiaq: Qanuq tuvraaksriŋagivsi, ilivsiḷi piruksraugaluaqtusi pikkaptun ilivsiññun.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, the slave is not greater than his master, nor is the one who is sent as a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, kivgaq una kamanałhaaŋitchuq ataniġmiñiñ, naaggaunnii taamna tilirauruaq kamanałhaaŋiñmiuq taavrumaŋŋa tilirimiñiñ.

english: If you understand these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
inupiaq: Tamatkua iḷisimaguvsigik, quviaginiaġisi piguvsigik.

english: “What I am saying does not refer to all of you. I know the ones I have chosen. But this is to fulfill the scripture, ‘The one who eats my bread has turned against me.’
inupiaq: Sivuniġiŋitkivsi iluqasi, iḷisimagitka piksraqtaatka. Taamna ittuq Bible uqaluŋich nalautitquvlugich. “Iñuk niġiŋaruaq punniġutimnik paaqłaŋasiruq uvamnun.”

english: I am telling you this now, before it happens, so that when it happens you may believe that I am he.
inupiaq: Uqallautigivsi taavrumiŋa paŋmapak taŋŋiqsaŋaiñŋaan, nalautpan ukpiliquvlusi Christ-gutilaamnik.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, whoever accepts the one I send accepts me, and whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.”
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñuk taamna akuqtuiruaq kimigliqaa tilikkamnik akuqtuiruq uvamnik, aasiivsauq taavruma akuqtuiruam uvamnik akuqtuġmigaa tiliriga.

english: When he had said these things, Jesus was greatly distressed in spirit, and testified, “I tell you the solemn truth, one of you will betray me.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tainna uqaanikami, iłuiḷḷiuqpaliŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iḷavsi aitchuutiginiaġaaŋa.

english: The disciples began to look at one another, worried and perplexed to know which of them he was talking about.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat qiñiġutiŋarut avanmun, nalupqisukłutiŋ kimik uqautiqaqtilaaŋanik.

english: One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved, was at the table to the right of Jesus in a place of honor.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋat iḷitchitquraŋisa, Jesus piviuttaġikkaŋa, ikusiksimaaŋaruq qaniłłuni Jesus-mun.

english: So Simon Peter gestured to this disciple to ask Jesus who it was he was referring to.
inupiaq: Tavra Simon Peter-m kiruaqtuŋagaa niaqqumiñik sivuniqaqługu, apiqquuŋ kimik uqautiqaqtilaaŋanik.

english: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved leaned back against Jesus’ chest and asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
inupiaq: Tavra tainna ikusiksimaallaġmi qaniłłuni Jesus-mun uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, kiuva?

english: Jesus replied, “It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread after I have dipped it in the dish.” Then he dipped the piece of bread in the dish and gave it to Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Taamnauruq aitchuġniakkaġa uumiŋa punniviñauramik misuqqaaġlugu. Tavra misuqqaaqługu punniviñauraq, qaiñŋagaa Judas-mun, iġñiŋanun Simon Iscariot.

english: And after Judas took the piece of bread, Satan entered into him. Jesus said to him, “What you are about to do, do quickly.”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qaisaniŋmagu punniviñauraq Judas-mun, Satan isiŋaruq ilaanun. Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Piyumakkan piuŋ qilamik.

english: (Now none of those present at the table understood why Jesus said this to Judas.
inupiaq: Tavra kiñaliqaa niġġiviŋñi kaŋiqsiŋitchuq summan Jesus taavrumiŋa uqallaktilaaŋanik Judas-mun.

english: Some thought that, because Judas had the money box, Jesus was telling him to buy whatever they needed for the feast, or to give something to the poor.)
inupiaq: Judas pigimmagu maniqaġviŋat, iḷaŋich isumaŋarut Jesus-mun uqallautinasugalugu, tauqsiġiaquvlugu pigiraksraġikkaġmiŋnik niqinaqikpata, naaggaqaa aitchuiyaqtuqunasugalugu iḷiappauruanun.

english: Judas took the piece of bread and went out immediately. (Now it was night.)
inupiaq: Tavra, aitchuusiaġianikamiuŋ punniviñauraq, tavrauvvaa Judas aniŋaruq. Unnuaguruq.

english: When Judas had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas anianiŋman, Jesus uqallaŋaruq, Paŋmapak Iġñiŋa Iñuum kamanaqsipkaqtauruq, aasii God kamanaqsipkaqtaummiuq ilaagun.

english: If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him right away.
inupiaq: Tavra God kamanaqsipkaqtaukpan ilaagun, God-iptauq kamanaqsipkaġniaġmigaa Iġñiŋa Iñuum, suli kamanaqsipkaġlugu tavrauvvaa.

english: Children, I am still with you for a little while. You will look for me, and just as I said to the Jewish religious leaders, ‘Where I am going you cannot come,’ now I tell you the same.
inupiaq: Miqłiqtuuraat, paŋmapak itqatigiurallakkivsi. Ivaġniaġivsiŋa. Aasii uqallausivsun Jew-guruanun paŋmapaktauq uqallautigivsi, qaiyumiñaitchusi aullaġviksrautimnun.

english: “I give you a new commandment – to love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another.
inupiaq: Aitchuġivsi nutauruamik pitquramik, ilivsi piviuttaqqutisitchi avanmun, uvaŋaptauq piviuttaqqutiqaqtuatun ilivsiññun, piviuttaqqutisitchi avanmun.

english: Everyone will know by this that you are my disciples – if you have love for one another.”
inupiaq: Piviuttaqqutiguvsi avanmun, iñupayaat iḷisimaniaqtut ilivsi iḷitchitquraġitilaavsiññik uvamnun.

english: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus replied, “Where I am going, you cannot follow me now, but you will follow later.”
inupiaq: Simon Peter-m apiġiŋagaa, Ataniiq sumuŋniaqpich? Jesus kiuŋagaa, Aullaġviksrautimnun malikkumiñaitkivsiŋa paŋmapak, aglaan maligutiniaqtusi aquvatigun.

english: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you!”
inupiaq: Peter-m apiġiŋagaa, Ataniiq summan malikkumiñaitpigiñ paŋmapak? Itqanaitchuŋa tuqqutisukłutin.

english: Jesus answered, “Will you lay down your life for me? I tell you the solemn truth, the rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times!
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Itqanaipiaqpich tuqqutisukłuŋa? Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigikpiñ, tiŋmiaq nipanniaŋitchuq iliŋnun piiḷaaġiŋaunnaŋa piŋasuni.

english: “Do not let your hearts be distressed. You believe in God; believe also in me.
inupiaq: Isumaaluutaittitchi. Ukpiqsimaaġitchi God-mun, ukpiqsimaaġitchiḷu uvamnun.

english: There are many dwelling places in my Father’s house. Otherwise, I would have told you, because I am going away to make ready a place for you.
inupiaq: Aapama igluqpaŋani iñugiaktut inillaat. Taamna tainnainŋitpan, uqallautiniaġaluaġivsi. Aullaaqsiruŋa itqanaiyaġiaġlugu iniksraqsi.

english: And if I go and make ready a place for you, I will come again and take you to be with me, so that where I am you may be too.
inupiaq: Aasii aullaġuma itqanaiyaġiaġlugu iniksraqsi, qaitqigñiaġmiuŋa aasii nayuqsiutilusi uvamnun, sumiitkuma tavranivsauq itquvlusi.

english: And you know the way where I am going.”
inupiaq: Aasii iḷisimagiksi apqutaa aullaġviksraunma.

english: Thomas said, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”
inupiaq: Thomas uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, nalurugut sumugniaqtilaaġnik, qanuġlugu iḷisimaniaqpisigu apqun?

english: Jesus replied, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa apqutauruŋa, iḷumun ittuaġlu, iñuggullu. Kiñaliqaa Aapamukkumiñaitchuq aglaan uvapkun kisian.

english: If you have known me, you will know my Father too. And from now on you do know him and have seen him.”
inupiaq: Iḷisimaŋaguvsiŋa, iḷisimayumiñaŋagaluaġmigiksi Aapaga. Tavraŋŋaaglaan iḷitchuġigiksi suli tautuaniŋagiksi.

english: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be content.”
inupiaq: Philip uqallautiŋagaa, Ataniiq, tautuktittigut Aapamik aasii katchuġniaqtugut.

english: Jesus replied, “Have I been with you for so long, and you have not known me, Philip? The person who has seen me has seen the Father! How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Itqatigiŋagaluaġikpiñ sivisuruamik, naluviŋa suli Philip? Iñuum tautuŋaruam uvamnik tautuŋammigaa Aapa. Qanuġlutin uqallakkumiñaqpich, tautuktittigut Aapamik?

english: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you, I do not speak on my own initiative, but the Father residing in me performs his miraculous deeds.
inupiaq: Ukpiŋitpich uvaŋa Aapamiitilaamnik suli Aapa uvamniitilaaŋanik? Uqaluich uqalugikkatka ilivsiññun uqautigilaitkitka uvaŋa ataniġnaqutipkun, aglaan Aapam iñuuruam uvamni pigai savaani.

english: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me, but if you do not believe me, believe because of the miraculous deeds themselves.
inupiaq: Ukpiġisiŋa uqallakama Aapamiitilaamnik suli Aapa uvamniitilaaŋanik, naaggaunnii ukpiġisiŋa pisigilugich savaatka.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, the person who believes in me will perform the miraculous deeds that I am doing, and will perform greater deeds than these, because I am going to the Father.
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, iñuk ukpiqtuaq uvamnun piñiaġmiuq savaanik pikkamnik, suli kamanałhaaqtuanik savaanik makkunaŋŋa ilaa piñiaqtuq, qanuq aullaaqsiruŋa Aapamun.

english: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
inupiaq: Sunapayaaq apiqsriaqsi atipkun, piñiaġiga, Aapa kamanaqsipkaqtautqulugu Iġñikun.

english: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it.
inupiaq: Apiġiguvsiŋa supayaamik atipkun, piñiaġiga.

english: “If you love me, you will obey my commandments.
inupiaq: Piviuttaġiguvsiŋa, kamagisigik pitquratka.

english: Then I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate to be with you forever –
inupiaq: Aasii aŋaiyyuviginiaġiga Aapa, ilaanun aitchuqulusi allamik Ikayuqtimik nayuqtiksravsiññik isuitchuamun.

english: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot accept, because it does not see him or know him. But you know him, because he resides with you and will be in you.
inupiaq: Taamna Ilitqusia iḷumun ittuam, nunam iñuŋisa akuqtuġumiñaisaŋat qanuq tautulaitkaat naaggaunnii nalugaat. Ilivsi iḷisimagiksi, qanuq iñuuqatauruq piqatigivlusi, suli iḷuvsiññiinniaqtuq.

english: “I will not abandon you as orphans, I will come to you.
inupiaq: Qimaŋniaŋitkivsi kisiŋŋuġruiññaġlusi, aglaan qaiñiaqtuŋa ilivsiññun.

english: In a little while the world will not see me any longer, but you will see me; because I live, you will live too.
inupiaq: Sivikitchuami nunam iñuŋisa tautuaġiŋaiġñiaġaanŋa, aglaan tautugniaġivsiŋa, qanuq iñuuŋaiḷaiññama ilivsivsauq iñuuniaġmiusi.

english: You will know at that time that I am in my Father and you are in me and I am in you.
inupiaq: Taamna uvluq tikitpan, iḷisimaniaqtusi uvaŋa Aapamniitilaamnik, suli ilivsi uvamni, aasiivsauq uvaŋa iḷuvsiññi.

english: The person who has my commandments and obeys them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will reveal myself to him.”
inupiaq: Iñuk iḷisimaruaq pitquramnik kamagivlugiḷḷu piviuttaġigaaŋa. Aapama piviuttaġiniaġaa piviuttaqsriruaq uvamnik, aasiivsauq piviuttaġiniaġmigiga suli iḷisimapkaġniaqtuŋa ilaanun.

english: “Lord,” Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “what has happened that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
inupiaq: Judas Iscariot-guŋitchuaq uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Ataniiq, qanuġlutin iḷisimapkaġniaqpich uvaptiŋnun, iḷisimapkaġaluaġnak nunam iñuŋiñun?

english: Jesus replied, “If anyone loves me, he will obey my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and take up residence with him.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Iñuum piviuttaġigumiŋa kamaginiaġai uqalutka, aasiiḷi Aapama piviuttaġiniaġaa, aasii uvaguk qaiñiaqtuguk ilaanun suli ilaa iñuuqatigilugu.

english: The person who does not love me does not obey my words. And the word you hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.
inupiaq: Iñuk piviuttaqsriŋitchuaq uvamnik kamaksriḷaitchuq uqalumnik, aasii uqaluich tusaakkasi uvaŋa uqalugiŋitkitka aglaan uqalugigai Aapam tilisiruam uvamnik.

english: “I have spoken these things while staying with you.
inupiaq: Tamatkuniŋa uqautiŋagivsi itqatigiŋŋavsisuli,

english: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything, and will cause you to remember everything I said to you.
inupiaq: aglaan imma Ikayuqti, Ilitqusiġiksuaq, Aapam tiliñiakkaŋa uvamnik pirritqulugu, iḷisautiniaġaasi supayaanik suli itqaqtinniaġaasi iluqaiññik uqalugiŋakkamnik ilivsiññun.

english: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you; I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be distressed or lacking in courage.
inupiaq: Qimaaqsikavsi tutqiqugivsi. Tutqigitchi uvaptun tutqiksuatun. Nunam iñuŋi tutqiutaitchut tutqiutipiamik tutqiutiqaqtirrutiptun ittuamik. Isumaaluutaittitchi iqsiñasiḷu.

english: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.
inupiaq: Tusaaŋagivsiŋa uqallautikavsi, aullaġniaġnivḷuŋa suli utiġniaġnivḷuŋa ilivsiññun. Piviuttaġipiaŋaguvsiŋa quviasugniaŋagaluaqtusi aullaġniaġnikama Aapamun, Aapakiataŋ kamanałhaaqtuq uvamniñ.

english: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it happens you may believe.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak kilianikkivsi taŋŋiŋaiñŋaan nalaulġiñaqpan ukpiliquvlusi.

english: I will not speak with you much longer, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋaaglaan uqaqatigipiaŋaiġñiaġivsi, qanuq Tuunġaq, atanauraŋat nunam iñuŋisa, qaigaqsiruq tigutaaqtitchukłuŋa. Suaŋŋataitkaluaqtuq payariyumiñaġluŋa.

english: but I am doing just what the Father commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. Get up, let us go from here.”
inupiaq: Tuqutinniaqtuŋa. Taamna piraksriutigiŋagaa Aapam uvamnun, iḷitchuġipkaqsaġlugich iñupayaat uvamnun piviuttaġitilaaŋa Aapa. Makittitchi, aullaqta uvaŋŋa.

english: “I am the true vine and my Father is the gardener.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa iḷumun napaaqtuayaapiatun ittuŋa, aasii Aapaga qaunaksritun ittuq napaaqtuayaamik.

english: He takes away every branch that does not bear fruit in me. He prunes every branch that bears fruit so that it will bear more fruit.
inupiaq: Qisiqsiutipayaaq uvamniittuaq siiġñiḷaiñman, ilaan piiġaa. Aasii qisiqsiutipayaaq siiġñisuuruaq nauyumiññaksaġuugaa siiġñivsaaquvlugu.

english: You are clean already because of the word that I have spoken to you.
inupiaq: Ilivsi salummaanikkaasi uqaluich uvaŋa uqautigikkaġma ilivsiññun.

english: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you unless you remain in me.
inupiaq: Atausiŋŋuqatigimaaqsiŋa, uvaŋaptauq atausiŋŋuqatigimaaġniaġmigivsi. Qisiqsiun siiġñiyumiñaitchuq inmisun pituummiŋitkumi napaaqtuayaamun, tainnatuttauq atausiŋŋuqatigimaaŋisuaġuvsiŋa piyumiñaitchusi piraksriutimnik.

english: “I am the vine; you are the branches. The one who remains in me – and I in him – bears much fruit, because apart from me you can accomplish nothing.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa napaaqtuayaatun ittuŋa, ilivsiḷi qisiqsiutitun ittusi. Tavraasii siiġñiqpaŋmatun piñiaqtusi atausiŋŋuqatigimaaġuvsiŋa, qanuq atausiŋŋuqatigiŋaisuaġuvsiŋa sumik piyumiñaitchusi.

english: If anyone does not remain in me, he is thrown out like a branch, and dries up; and such branches are gathered up and thrown into the fire, and are burned up.
inupiaq: Iñuk atausiŋŋuqatauŋaitchuaq uvamnun qisiqsiutitun igitauvluni palliġuqtuatun ittuq. Palliich qisiqsiutit katitchuugaich aasii igiłługich igniġmun aasii ikirauvlutiŋ.

english: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you want, and it will be done for you.
inupiaq: Ilivsi atausiŋŋuqatigimaaġuvsiŋa suli kamagituiññaġlugich uqalutka, apiqsrisitchi supayaamik pisukkavsiññik qaisauniaqtuq ilivsiññun.

english: My Father is honored by this, that you bear much fruit and show that you are my disciples.
inupiaq: Siiġñiqpakavsi satqummiġiksi Aapama kamanautaa. Tainna pikavsi, ukpiġnaqsigiksi iḷitchitqurautilaaqsi uvamnun.

english: “Just as the Father has loved me, I have also loved you; remain in my love.
inupiaq: Aapam piviuttaġimmaŋa piviuttaqsrisiatun piviuttaġimmigivsi. Iñuusiqaġitchiḷi piviuttaġipkaġumiñaqsiḷusi uvamnun.

english: If you obey my commandments, you will remain in my love, just as I have obeyed my Father’s commandments and remain in his love.
inupiaq: Ilivsi kamagiguvsigik pitquratka, piviuttaġipkaġniaqtusi uvamnun, uvaŋaptauq kamagimmatun Aapama pitquraŋi aasii piviuttaġipkaqłuŋa ilaanun.

english: I have told you these things so that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be complete.
inupiaq: Tamatkuniŋa uqautiŋagivsi, uvaŋa quviasuutiga iḷuvsiññiitquvlugu, suli quviasuurri naamatquvlugu.

english: My commandment is this – to love one another just as I have loved you.
inupiaq: Uvva uvaŋa pitquraġa, piviuttaqqutisitchi avanmun piviuttaqsriñiptun ilivsiññik.

english: No one has greater love than this – that one lays down his life for his friends.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa kamanałhaaqtuamik piviuttaqqutaitchuq uumaŋŋa, iñuum tuqqutigimmagich avilaitqatini.

english: You are my friends if you do what I command you.
inupiaq: Avilaitqatigigivsi kamaksriguvsi pitquramnik ilivsiññun.

english: I no longer call you slaves, because the slave does not understand what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because I have revealed to you everything I heard from my Father.
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋaaglaan taiŋaiġivsi kivganik, qanuq kivgaq naluruq suliqitilaaŋanik atanini, aglaan taigivsi avilaitqatinik, qanuq iluqaiññik iḷitchuġipkaŋagivsi tusaaŋakkamnik Aapamniñ.

english: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that remains, so that whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.
inupiaq: Ilivsi piksraqtaaġiŋaitkivsiŋa, aglaan uvaŋa piksraqtaaġiŋagivsi aasii nalunaiqł̣usi aullaqtuksrauvlusi quliaqtuaġutiyaqtuġlugich iñuich tusaayugaaġiksuanik ukpiġumiñaqsiḷugich. Iliŋich siiġñiaġimmatun piñiaġisi nuŋulaiḷaagummatun illugich. Tavraasii sunapayaaq apiqsriaġikkaqsi Aapamun atipkun, ilaan aitchuutigiyumiñaġniaġaa ilivsiññun.

english: This I command you – to love one another.
inupiaq: Uumiŋa pitqurriġivsi, piviuttaqqutisitchi avanmun.

english: “If the world hates you, be aware that it hated me first.
inupiaq: Nunam iñuŋisa uumigikpasi, itqaumaruksraurusi uumigiqqaaŋagaanŋa uumikłiqsaŋaunnatiŋ ilivsiññik.

english: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own. However, because you do not belong to the world, but I chose you out of the world, for this reason the world hates you.
inupiaq: Ilivsi atausiŋŋuqatigimaaġuvsigik nunam iñuŋi, nakuaġinayaġaasi nakuaqsrisimiktun ilaisa iḷamiŋnik. Aglaan nunam iñuŋisa uumigigaasi qanuq atausiŋŋuqatigimaaŋitkisi, uvaŋa piksraqtaaġiŋavlusi iliŋiññiñ pigisukłusi uvaŋa.

english: Remember what I told you, ‘A slave is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they obeyed my word, they will obey yours too.
inupiaq: Itqaumasigik uqaluich uqallautitka ilivsiññun, kivgaq kamanałhaaŋitchuq ataniġmiñiñ. Iliŋisa nagliksaaqtinŋakpanŋa, nagliksaaqtinniaġmigaasivsauq. Iliŋisa kamagiŋakpatigik uqalutka, kamaginiaġmigaitchauq uqalusi.

english: But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.
inupiaq: Aglaan tamarra tamatkua piñiaġaich iluqaisa ilivsiññun uvaŋa pigikkavsi, qanuq ilaisa naluvlugu taamna tilisiruaq uvamnik.

english: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin. But they no longer have any excuse for their sin.
inupiaq: Qaiŋaiḷḷuŋa uqautiŋaitkupkich pasirauyumiñaitkaluaqtut, aglaan paŋmapak pasiraurut piḷuunmikkun.

english: The one who hates me hates my Father too.
inupiaq: Iñuum uumikłiqsuam uvamnik uumigimmigaaptauq Aapaga.

english: If I had not performed among them the miraculous deeds that no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen the deeds and have hated both me and my Father.
inupiaq: Savaŋaitkuma savaanik akunġanni iñuum allam piŋaisaŋiñik, pasirauyumiñaitkaluaqtut. Aglaan paŋmapak tautuŋarut savaamnik suli uumigivlunuk uvaŋalu Aapagalu.

english: Now this happened to fulfill the word that is written in their law, ‘They hated me without reason.’
inupiaq: Taamna taŋŋiutausaġniqsuq uqaluŋmun aglausimaruamun ilaisa pitquraŋiññi, “Ilaisa uumigiŋagaanŋa patchisaiḷaakun.”

english: When the Advocate comes, whom I will send you from the Father – the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father – he will testify about me,
inupiaq: Aglaan Ikayuqti qaikpan, uvaŋa tiliñiakkaġa ilivsiññun Aapamiñ, taamna Ilitqusia iḷumun ittuam qairuaq Aapamiñ, ilaa iḷitchuġipkaiñiaqtuq uvapkun.

english: and you also will testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq ilivsi quliaqtuaġiniaġmigivsiŋa, qanuq nayuŋagivsiŋa isuaniñqaŋa.

english: “I have told you all these things so that you will not fall away.
inupiaq: Uqallausiġiŋagitka tamatkua iluqaisa ukpiġutaiquŋił̣ł̣usi.

english: They will put you out of the synagogue, yet a time is coming when the one who kills you will think he is offering service to God.
inupiaq: Iñuich aninniaġaasi Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviŋiññiñ. Iḷumutun, piviksraq tikitchumaaqtuq qakugu kiapayaaq tuqutkumisi isumaniaqtuq ilaa savaurriñasugaluni God-mik.

english: They will do these things because they have not known the Father or me.
inupiaq: Aasii taamna piñiaġaat ilivsiññun qanuq iḷitchuġiŋaił̣ł̣ugu Aapa, naaggaunnii uvaŋa.

english: But I have told you these things so that when their time comes, you will remember that I told you about them.
inupiaq: Aasiuvva tamatkua uqallausiġiŋagitka ilivsiññun, taimña piviksraq tikitpan, itqaquvlugich uqalutka ilivsiññun. Uqautiŋaitkivsi tamatkuniŋa isuaniñqaŋa, qanuq uvaŋa nayuqłusi.

english: “I did not tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.
inupiaq: Aasiuvva paŋmapak aullaaqsiruŋa tilirimnun, nallivsiunnii apiġiŋiñmigaaŋa sumuaqsimmagaaġma.

english: But now I am going to the one who sent me, and not one of you is asking me, ‘Where are you going?’
inupiaq: Pisigivlugu uqaluusiġa tamatkuniŋa ilivsiññun isumaalipiaġataqtusi.

english: Instead your hearts are filled with sadness because I have said these things to you.
inupiaq: Suŋiñmiuq, aasii uqallautigivsi iḷumun ittuamik, anniqsuutauniaqtuq ilivsiññun aullaġuma, qanuq aullaŋisuaġuma, Ikayuqtim ullaŋniaŋitkaasi. Aglaan aullaġuma, tiliñiaġiga ilivsiññun.

english: But I tell you the truth, it is to your advantage that I am going away. For if I do not go away, the Advocate will not come to you, but if I go, I will send him to you.
inupiaq: Aasii qaigumi, ilaan qanuqpisiiḷḷiñiaġai nunam iñuŋi piḷuutikun nalaunŋarualiqinikullu isivġiġvikullu.

english: And when he comes, he will prove the world wrong concerning sin and righteousness and judgment –
inupiaq: Qanuqpisiiḷḷiñiaġai piḷuutikun, qanuq ukpiŋitchut uvamnun.

english: concerning sin, because they do not believe in me;
inupiaq: Qanuqpisiiḷḷiñiaġai nalaunŋarualiqinikun, qanuq aullaqtuŋa Aapamun aasii ilivsi tautuaġiŋaiġñiaġivsiŋa.

english: concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will see me no longer;
inupiaq: Qanuqpisiiḷḷiñiaġai isivġiġvikun, qanuq Tuunġaq atanauraŋat mattuma nunam iñuŋisa isivġiqsauganiktuq.

english: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuanik suli uqautiksraqaġaluaqtuŋa ilivsiññun, kaŋiqsiyumiñaitkisi paŋmapak.

english: “I have many more things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.
inupiaq: Aglaan Ilitqusiata iḷumun ittuam qaigumi, kaŋiqsisaiññaqtinniaġaasi iluqaanik iḷumun ittuamik, qanuq ilaa uqaġniaŋitchuq ilaan ataniġnaqunmigun, aglaan sunapayaaq tusaarani uqautiginiaġaa. Aasii ilaa quliaqtuaġniaqtuq ilivsiññun sunik qaiyumaaqtuanik.

english: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth. For he will not speak on his own authority, but will speak whatever he hears, and will tell you what is to come.
inupiaq: Ilaan kamanaqsiḷiġniaġaaŋa, qanuq uqautiniaġiga uqalumnik aasii ilaan qaaŋiqsinniaġaiḷḷi ilivsiññun.

english: He will glorify me, because he will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.
inupiaq: Iluqaisa Aapam pigikkaŋi pigigitka. Taamna pisigivlugu uqallaŋaruŋa Ilitqusiġiksuaq uqautiniaġnivḷugu uqalumnik aasii qaaŋiqsinniaġai ilivsiññun.

english: Everything that the Father has is mine; that is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.
inupiaq: Tautuaġiŋaiyasigivsiŋa. Aasiisuli sivikitchuami tautugniaġivsiŋa.

english: In a little while you will see me no longer; again after a little while, you will see me.”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋich iḷitchitquraŋisa uqaurrutiŋarut avanmun, Sumik sivuniqaqługu uqallakpa, Tautuaġiŋaiyasiñivḷuni, aasiisuli, sivikitchuami tautugniaġivsiŋa? Suli sumik sivuniqaqługu uqallakpa uqallakami, Qanuq aullaqtuŋa Aapamun?

english: Then some of his disciples said to one another, “What is the meaning of what he is saying, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”
inupiaq: Iliŋich uqallaŋarut, Sumik sivuniqaqpauŋ uqallausiġikamiuŋ sivikitchuamiiġniñi? Nalugikput sumik uqautiqaqtilaaŋanik.

english: So they kept on repeating, “What is the meaning of what he says, ‘In a little while’? We do not understand what he is talking about.”
inupiaq: Jesus iḷisimaŋaruq apiġisuktilaamiñik iliŋiññun aasii uqallautiŋagai, Apiqsruqtuutivisi ilivsiññun sumik sivuniqaqtilaaŋanik uqallakama, tautuaġiŋaiyasiñivḷuŋa, aasiisuli, sivikitchuami tautugniaġnikama ilivsiññun?

english: Jesus could see that they wanted to ask him about these things, so he said to them, “Are you asking each other about this – that I said, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me’?
inupiaq: Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, qianiaqtusi suli kiŋuvġulusi, aglaalli nunam iñuŋi quviasugniaqtut. Isumaaqpagniaqtusi, aglaan isumaaŋaiġḷusi quviatchagniaqtusi.

english: I tell you the solemn truth, you will weep and wail, but the world will rejoice; you will be sad, but your sadness will turn into joy.
inupiaq: Aġnaq iġñisuliaqsikami sivuuġasuuruq, qanuq piviksraŋa tikitchuq. Aasii iġñianikami, itqaumaŋaiġayukkaa iłuiḷḷiuġun, quviasuutinikłuni miqłiqtuni animman.

english: When a woman gives birth, she has distress because her time has come, but when her child is born, she no longer remembers the suffering because of her joy that a human being has been born into the world.
inupiaq: Tainnatun isumaaġutiqaqtusi paŋmapak, aglaan taututqigñiaġivsi aasii quviatchaktitaupiaġniaqtusi, suli kiapayaaq ipiqtusuliqsitchumiñaitkaasi.

english: So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.
inupiaq: Taivrumani uvlumi apiqsruqtuġniaŋitkivsiŋa sutigun. Iḷumutupiaġataq uqallautigivsi, qiññuaġuvsi supayaamik Aapamiñ, aitchuutiginiaġaa ilivsiññun uvaŋa iḷitchitquraġikavsi.

english: At that time you will ask me nothing. I tell you the solemn truth, whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.
inupiaq: Paŋmapaŋmun aglaan apiqsriŋaitchusi sumik atipkun. Apiqsrisitchi, aasii aitchuusiaqaġniaqtusi quviasuutiksi naamatqulugu.

english: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive it, so that your joy may be complete.
inupiaq: Uqautigiŋagitka tamatkua ilivsiññun uuktuutitigun. Piviksraq tikitchumaaqtuq tavraŋŋaaglaan uqaŋaiġviksraġa ilivsiññun uuktuutiqaġluŋa, aglaan uqautilusi Aapakun kaŋiqsiñaqsiḷugu.

english: “I have told you these things in obscure figures of speech; a time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in obscure figures, but will tell you plainly about the Father.
inupiaq: Taimña piviksraq tikitpan apiqsriñiaqtusi aŋaiyyulusi Aapamun atipkun. Uvaŋaunnii apiqsrisiŋiḷḷuġivsi Aapamun, aitchuġumiñaġaasi,

english: At that time you will ask in my name, and I do not say that I will ask the Father on your behalf.
inupiaq: qanuq Aapam ilaan piviuttaġigaasi ilivsi piviuttaġiŋakavsiŋa, suli ukpiliŋakavsi uvaŋa qaiŋatilaamnik God-miñ.

english: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
inupiaq: Qaiŋaruŋa Aapamiñ aasii nunamukłuŋa. Qimaaqsiḷgitkiga nuna utiqsaqłuŋa Aapamun.

english: I came from the Father and entered into the world, but in turn, I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
inupiaq: Ilaan iḷitchitquraŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Aaŋ, paŋmapak uqaqtutin kaŋiqsiñaqsipiaqługu uuktuutiŋiḷaatigun.

english: His disciples said, “Look, now you are speaking plainly and not in obscure figures of speech!
inupiaq: Paŋmapak iḷitchuġirugut iḷisimatilaaġnik supayaanik. Nalupqisuŋaiqsugut apiqsruutiksraiqsugullu. Taamna pisigivlugu ukpiqtugut ilivich qaiŋatilaaġnik God-miñ.

english: Now we know that you know everything and do not need anyone to ask you anything. Because of this we believe that you have come from God.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Paŋmapak ukpiliqpisi?

english: Jesus replied, “Do you now believe?
inupiaq: Piviksraq qairuq, iḷumun tikisaniktuq, ilivsi siamitauniaqavsi, iñullaa aimaaġviŋmiñun, aasii kisiŋŋuġluŋa. Aglaan kisimġiuŋiñmiuŋa, qanuq Aapam nayuġaaŋa.

english: Look, a time is coming – and has come – when you will be scattered, each one to his own home, and I will be left alone. Yet I am not alone, because my Father is with me.
inupiaq: Uqautiŋagivsi tamatkuniŋa tutqiutiqaquvlusi atausiŋŋuqatigiŋakavsiŋa. Nunami iłuiḷḷiuġutiqpaqaġniaqtusi, aglaan qapiŋairrutiqaġluataġitchi, uvaŋa akiiḷipiaġataŋagitka nunam iñuŋi iłuiḷḷiuqtitchiruat ilivsiññik.

english: I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have trouble and suffering, but take courage – I have conquered the world.”
When Jesus had finished saying these things, he looked upward to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, so that your Son may glorify you –
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus uqautigianikamigich taapkua uqaluich, ilaa aaġluŋaruq qiḷaŋmun uqallakłuni. Aapaa, ikarraq tikitchuq. Kamanaqsipkaŋŋa uvaŋa Iġñiġiñ Iġñiqpiḷḷi kamanaqsiḷiġumagaatin,

english: just as you have given him authority over all humanity, so that he may give eternal life to everyone you have given him.
inupiaq: qanuq ilivich ataniġnaqusiŋagiŋma kamanałhaaġumiñaqsivḷuŋa iñupayaaniñ. Taamna pisigivlugu iñuupkaiyumiñaqtuŋa isuitchuamun iluqaiññik qaisaġnik uvamnun.

english: Now this is eternal life – that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you sent.
inupiaq: Aasiuvva isuitchuaq iñuggun, ilaisa iḷitchuġivlutin kisivisualuk iḷumun God-autilaaġnik, suli Jesus Christ ilivich tiliŋakkan.

english: I glorified you on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġipkaŋagiga kamanautin iñuŋnun naatchivḷuŋa piraksriutiŋnik uvamnun nunami.

english: And now, Father, glorify me at your side with the glory I had with you before the world was created.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak Aapaa, kamanaqsipkaŋŋa sivuġaġni taavrumiŋa kamanaunmik pigiŋakkamnik piqatigivlutin nuna savaaguŋaunnagu.

english: “I have revealed your name to the men you gave me out of the world. They belonged to you, and you gave them to me, and they have obeyed your word.
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġipkaŋagikpiñ iñuŋnun qaisaġnun uvamnun nunam iñuŋiñiñ. Ilivich pigiŋagitin, aasii qaiñŋagitin iliŋich uvamnun, aasii kamagiŋagaich uqaluktin.

english: Now they understand that everything you have given me comes from you,
inupiaq: Paŋmapak iḷitchuġirut supayaat qaisatin uvamnun iliŋniŋŋaqtautilaaŋannik.

english: because I have given them the words you have given me. They accepted them and really understand that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
inupiaq: Uqautiŋagitka uqaluksrirrutiŋnik uvamnun aasii iliŋisa ukpiġiŋagaich. Nalupqisuŋaiŋarut uvaŋa qaiŋatilaamnik iliŋniñ, ukpiliqł̣utiŋ tiliŋatilaamnik iliŋnun.

english: I am praying on behalf of them. I am not praying on behalf of the world, but on behalf of those you have given me, because they belong to you.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyutigitka. Aŋaiyyutiŋitkitka nunam iñuŋi aglaan aŋaiyyutigitka tamatkua qaisatin uvamnun, qanuq pigigitin.

english: Everything I have belongs to you, and everything you have belongs to me, and I have been glorified by them.
inupiaq: Iluqaisa pitka pigigitin suli ilivich pisin pigigitka, aasii uvaŋa kamanautiga iḷisimanaqsiruq ilaisigun.

english: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them safe in your name that you have given me, so that they may be one just as we are one.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak nunamiinŋaigaqsiruŋa, aglaan iliŋich nunamiittut, aasii ullaaqsigikpiñ. Piḷuutaitchuatiin Aapa, qaunagikkich ilivich suaŋŋatipkun iñuich qaisatin uvamnun, atautchisun itqulugich atausiŋŋuummatiptiktun.

english: When I was with them I kept them safe and watched over them in your name that you have given me. Not one of them was lost except the one destined for destruction, so that the scripture could be fulfilled.
inupiaq: Qaisatin uvamnun nayuŋŋaisa qaunagiŋagitka ilivich suaŋŋatipkun. Qaunagiŋagitka aasii atausiq unnii tammaŋaitchuq, aglaan taamna iñuk tammaġumaaqtuaq Bible uqaluŋich nalautquvlugich.

english: But now I am coming to you, and I am saying these things in the world, so they may experience my joy completed in themselves.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak qaiyasiruŋa iliŋnun, aasii tamatkua aŋaiyyutigigitka takkuanni ukua, iliŋich quviasuutiqpaqaquvlugich quviasuutiqpaqaqtilaaptun.

english: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them, because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
inupiaq: Uqautiŋagitka piraksriutiŋnik iñuŋnun, aasii nunam iñuŋisa uumigiŋagaich qanuq iliŋich iḷauŋitchut nunam iñuŋiñun, uvaptuttauq nunam iñuŋiñun iḷauŋitchuatun.

english: I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but that you keep them safe from the evil one.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuŋitchuŋa iliŋnun piiqulugich nunamiñ, aglaan qaunagitquvlugich Tuunġaġmiñ.

english: They do not belong to the world just as I do not belong to the world.
inupiaq: Iliŋich iḷauŋitchut nunam iñuŋiñun, uvaptuttauq nunam iñuŋiñun iḷauŋitchuatun.

english: Set them apart in the truth; your word is truth.
inupiaq: Ilaaguakkich iliŋnuksriḷugich iḷitchuġipkaġlugich iḷumun ittuanik ilivich uqaluŋnik.

english: Just as you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.
inupiaq: Ilivich tiliŋakamŋali iñupayaanun, tainnatun tiliŋammigitka iñupayaanun.

english: And I set myself apart on their behalf, so that they too may be truly set apart.
inupiaq: Aasii iliŋich pisigivlugich ilaaguaqtuŋa uvamnik iliŋnun tuqqutikun, iliŋitchauq ilaaguaqtautquvlugich iḷumutun iliŋnun.

english: “I am not praying only on their behalf, but also on behalf of those who believe in me through their testimony,
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyutiŋitkitka ukua iḷitchitquratka kisiisa, aglaallu taipkua ukpiġumaaqtuat uvamnun quliaqtuaŋannik tusaayugaaġiksuamik.

english: that they will all be one, just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you. I pray that they will be in us, so that the world will believe that you sent me.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyutigitka iluqaġmiŋ atautchisun itquvlugich. Aapaa, atautchisuttuq illich uvaptiŋni, ilivich uvamniinmatun uvaŋalu iliŋni. Atautchisuttuq illich nunam iñuŋi ukpiliqsitchumiñaqsiḷugich iliŋnun tiliŋatilaamnik.

english: The glory you gave to me I have given to them, that they may be one just as we are one –
inupiaq: Iḷisimanaqsiŋakavich iliŋnik uvamni, tainnatulli iḷisimanaqsiŋaruŋa uvamnik iliŋiññi, iliŋich atautchisun itquvlugich, uvaptiktun atausiuruatun.

english: I in them and you in me – that they may be completely one, so that the world will know that you sent me, and you have loved them just as you have loved me.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa ilaiññi suli ilivich uvamni, iliŋich atausiŋŋupiaġataġumaut, nunam iñuŋi iḷitchuġiyumiñaqsiyumaut iliŋnun tiliŋatilaamnik nunamun, suli piviuttaġivlugich ilivich piviuttaqsrisiktuttauq uvamnik.

english: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, so that they can see my glory that you gave me because you loved me before the creation of the world.
inupiaq: Aapaaŋ, kipiġniuqtuŋa taapkua aitchuutigiŋaratin uvamnun itqatigitquvluŋa sumiitkuma, tautuqulugu kamanaqsiḷiqtauniġa. Kamanautiqaqtinŋagiŋma piviuttaġiŋavluŋa nuna savaaguŋaiñŋaan.

english: Righteous Father, even if the world does not know you, I know you, and these men know that you sent me.
inupiaq: Nalaunŋaruatiin Aapa, nunam iñuŋisa iḷitchuġiŋaitkaatin, aglaan uvaŋa iḷisimaŋagikpiñ, suli ukua iḷitchitquratka iḷisimarut iliŋnun tiliŋatilaamnik.

english: I made known your name to them, and I will continue to make it known, so that the love you have loved me with may be in them, and I may be in them.”
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġipkaŋagikpiñ ilaiññun, suli iḷitchuġipkavsaaġniaġikpiñ, iliŋich puttuqsrisaiññaqtuaġumaut iliŋnun piviuttaġitilaamiŋnik piviuttaqsrisiktun uvamnik, uvaŋalu iḷumiŋniitilaamnik.

english: When he had said these things, Jesus went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley. There was an orchard there, and he and his disciples went into it.
inupiaq: Jesus aŋaiyyutigianikamigich taapkua uqaluich, ilaa aullaŋaruq iḷitchitquraniḷu ikaaqługu kuuġuuraq Kidron isiqłutiŋ napaaqtut nauviannun Gethsemane-mun.

english: (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, knew the place too, because Jesus had met there many times with his disciples.)
inupiaq: Judas-gum, aitchuutiginniktuam ilaanik, iḷisimaŋammiñiġaa taamna ini, qanuq Jesus akulaitchuami kasimaqatigisuugai iḷitchitqurani tavrani.

english: So Judas obtained a squad of soldiers and some officers of the chief priests and Pharisees. They came to the orchard with lanterns and torches and weapons.
inupiaq: Tavra Judas aullaŋaruq piqasiqł̣uni aŋuyaktinik, suli iḷaŋiññik munaqsrich tilikkaŋiññik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich Pharisee-ḷḷu. Tavruŋaŋarut naniġuaqtuqłutiŋ satkuliraqłutiglu.

english: Then Jesus, because he knew everything that was going to happen to him, came and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus, iḷisimavluni supayaamik piñiaqtuamik inmiñun, saarvaŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni ilaiññun, Kiña ivaqpisiuŋ?

english: They replied, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He told them, “I am he.” (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, was standing there with them.)
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Jesus Nazareth-miu. Tavra Jesus uqallautiŋagai, Ilaaguruŋa. Judas, aitchuutiginniktuaq ilaanik, makitaqatauŋaruq ilaiññun.

english: So when Jesus said to them, “I am he,” they retreated and fell to the ground.
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautimmatiŋ ilaagunivḷuni, taluqsratchakłutiŋ utiqqiaŋarut aasii ulġuvlutiŋ nunamun.

english: Then Jesus asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
inupiaq: Jesus apiġitqiŋagai, Kiña ivaqpisiuŋ? Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Jesus Nazareth-miu.

english: Jesus replied, “I told you that I am he. If you are looking for me, let these men go.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Uqallautiŋasugaavsi ilaagunivḷuŋa. Tavra ivaġuvsiŋa, ukua iḷitchitquratka aullaġlich.

english: He said this to fulfill the word he had spoken, “I have not lost a single one of those whom you gave me.”
inupiaq: Taamna taŋŋiutausalgiññiqsuq uqaluŋnun Jesus uqallausiġiŋaraŋiññun aŋaiyyukami, Taapkunaŋŋa aitchuutiŋniñ uvamnun tammaiŋitchuŋa atautchimik-unnii.

english: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, pulled it out and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his right ear. (Now the slave’s name was Malchus.)
inupiaq: Tavrani Simon Peter savikpaqaqłuni, amuŋagaa aasii anauvlugu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata kivgaŋa, aasii taliqpianik siutaiqł̣ugu. Kivgam atqa Malchus.

english: But Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath! Am I not to drink the cup that the Father has given me?”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa Peter, Iḷḷiuŋ savikpaiñ puuŋanun. Isumavich akuqtuġniaŋiññasugalugu uvamnun nagliksaaġutiqpak Aapama sivunniŋakkaŋa uvamnun?

english: Then the squad of soldiers with their commanding officer and the officers of the Jewish leaders arrested Jesus and tied him up.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋatalu Jew-guruat munaqsriŋisalu tiguŋagaat Jesus aasii qiḷiqsruivḷugu.

english: They brought him first to Annas, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
inupiaq: Aullautiqqaaŋagaat Annas-mun, qanuq aaparuaġimmagu Caiaphas-gum. Taamna Caiaphas aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat taavrumani ukiumi.

english: (Now it was Caiaphas who had advised the Jewish leaders that it was to their advantage that one man die for the people.)
inupiaq: Caiaphas-gum uqallautiŋagai Jew-guruat anniqsuutaupiaġniaġnivḷugu iñuk atausiq tuqukpan pisilugich iñupayaat.

english: Simon Peter and another disciple followed them as they brought Jesus to Annas. (Now the other disciple was acquainted with the high priest, and he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.)
inupiaq: Simon Peter-m allavlu iḷitchitquram maliŋagaak Jesus. Iḷitchitquraq taamna iḷisimaŋavlugu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata, isiġumiñaŋaruq piqatigivlugu Jesus siḷalliġuaŋanun inaata aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaum.

english: But Simon Peter was left standing outside by the door. So the other disciple who was acquainted with the high priest came out and spoke to the slave girl who watched the door, and brought Peter inside.
inupiaq: Peter qikaŋaruq siḷami paami. Tavra alla iḷitchitquraq, iḷisimakkaŋa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata, aniŋaruq aasii uqallautivlugu niviaqsiaq upkurriqiri, itqutiŋagaa Peter.

english: The girl who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You’re not one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” He replied, “I am not.”
inupiaq: Niviaqsiam upkurriqirim apiġiŋagaa Peter, Iḷagiŋitkaluaqpatin uuma iñuum iḷitchitquraŋisa? Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Iḷagiŋitkaanŋa.

english: (Now the slaves and the guards were standing around a charcoal fire they had made, warming themselves because it was cold. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.)
inupiaq: Tavra kivgat munaqsriḷḷu igniqsuŋarut qanuq qiiyanaqłuni, aasii qikaġniqsut pasiaqłutiŋ. Peter iḷagiŋagaat qikaqłuni pasiaqtuaq.

english: While this was happening, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata apiqsruqtuŋagaa Jesus iḷitchitquraŋigun iḷisaurrutiŋigullu.

english: Jesus replied, “I have spoken publicly to the world. I always taught in the synagogues and in the temple courts, where all the Jewish people assemble together. I have said nothing in secret.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uqaŋaruŋa iñuŋnun salapqiruakun, ataramik iḷisaurrisuuruŋa aŋaiyyuviŋiññiḷu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiḷu, iluqaġmiŋ Jew-guruat katirvikaaŋannun. Uqaŋaitchuŋa sumik nalunautchiḷuŋa.

english: Why do you ask me? Ask those who heard what I said. They know what I said.”
inupiaq: Summan apiqsruqpiŋa? Apiqsrukkich iñuich naalaġniritka qanuq uqaŋatilaamnik ilaiññun. Iḷisimarut uqautigiŋaramnik.

english: When Jesus had said this, one of the high priest’s officers who stood nearby struck him on the face and said, “Is that the way you answer the high priest?”
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġianiŋmagu, iḷaŋata munaqsrich qikaqtuam saniġaani patiŋagaa Jesus uqallakłuni, Tainna kiuraksraġiviuŋ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat?

english: Jesus replied, “If I have said something wrong, confirm what is wrong. But if I spoke correctly, why strike me?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Uqaŋaguma killukuaġluŋa, iḷitchuġipkaġuŋ iñuŋnun killukuaġutiga. Aasii nalaulluŋa uqaġuma, summan patikpiŋa?

english: Then Annas sent him, still tied up, to Caiaphas the high priest.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus qiḷiqsruiŋavlugu, Annas-gum aullaqtitkaa Caiaphas-mun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiannun taavrumani ukiumi.

english: Meanwhile Simon Peter was standing in the courtyard warming himself. They said to him, “You aren’t one of his disciples too, are you?” Peter denied it: “I am not!”
inupiaq: Tavra Simon Peter qikaŋaruq pasiaqłuni. Iñuich iḷaŋisa uqallautiŋagaat, Iḷagiŋitpatin iḷitchitquraŋisa taavruma iñuum? Ilaa piiḷaaŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Iḷauŋitchuŋa.

english: One of the high priest’s slaves, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the orchard with him?”
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata kivgaŋisa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata, nanmiñiŋata iñuum Peter-m siutaiŋakkaŋata, apiġiŋagaa, Tautuŋaitpigiñ Jesus piqatigivlugu Gethsemane-mi?

english: Then Peter denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
inupiaq: Peter piiḷaatqiŋaruq. Aasii tavrauvvaa tiŋmiaq nipanŋaruq.

english: Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas to the Roman governor’s residence. (Now it was very early morning.) They did not go into the governor’s residence so they would not be ceremonially defiled, but could eat the Passover meal.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich aullautiŋagaat Jesus igluqpaŋaniñ Caiaphas isivġiġviŋmun igluqpaŋaniittuamun kavanam. Uvlaatchaurauŋaruq. Jew-guruat isiŋitchut isivġiġviŋmun salumaiḷisuŋił̣ł̣utiŋ niġiḷḷasukłutiŋ Itqaunmi Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun.

english: So Pilate came outside to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate anniqiŋagai aasii uqallautivlugich, Sumik pasikkutiqaqpisi uumuuna iñukun?

english: They replied, “If this man were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you.”
inupiaq: Ilaisa kiuŋagaat, Una iñuk pitquranik navguirauŋitpan aitchuutiginayaitkikput iliŋnun.

english: Pilate told them, “Take him yourselves and pass judgment on him according to your own law!” The Jewish leaders replied, “We cannot legally put anyone to death.”
inupiaq: Pilate uqallautiŋagai, Pisiuŋ ilivsiññik aasii isivġiġḷugu ilivsi nanmiñiq pitquravsigun. Jew-guruat uqallautiŋagaat, Uvagut tuqutchipkaqtauyumiñaitchugut iñuŋmik pitquraŋisigun Rome-miut.

english: (This happened to fulfill the word Jesus had spoken when he indicated what kind of death he was going to die.)
inupiaq: Taamna taŋŋiutausaŋaniqsuq uqaluŋmun Jesus uqallautaanun qanutchikun tuqqutikun tuquniaqtilaamiñik.

english: So Pilate went back into the governor’s residence, summoned Jesus, and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
inupiaq: Pilate isitqiŋaruq isivġiġviŋmun aasii ququaqługu Jesus uqallautivlugu, Ilivich Umialigivatin Jew-guruat?

english: Jesus replied, “Are you saying this on your own initiative, or have others told you about me?”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Taamna uqallausiġiviuŋ iliktuġruiññaq, naagga allat uqallautivatin uvapkun?

english: Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own people and your chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”
inupiaq: Pilate kiuŋagaa, Jew-gunasugiviŋa? Jew-guqativich nanmiñiq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu qaiñŋagaatin uvamnun. Sumik piŋavich?

english: Jesus replied, “My kingdom is not from this world. If my kingdom were from this world, my servants would be fighting to keep me from being handed over to the Jewish authorities. But as it is, my kingdom is not from here.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Umialguŋitchuŋa mattumuŋa nunamun. Umialguguma mattumuŋa nunamun, kivgatka aŋuyakkayaqtut aitchuutautquŋiḷḷuŋa Jew-guruanun. Umialguŋitchuŋa nunam iñuŋiñun.

english: Then Pilate said, “So you are a king!” Jesus replied, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world – to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.”
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate uqallautiŋagaa, Uvva umialgurutin? Jesus kiuŋagaa, Ilivich uqallaktutin umialgunivḷuŋa. Taamna pisigivlugu aniŋaruŋa. Suli qaiŋaruŋa nunamun quliaqtuaġisukługu iḷumun ittuaq. Iñupayaam ivaqłiaruam iḷumun ittuamik naalaġnigaaŋa.

english: Pilate asked, “What is truth?”
inupiaq: Pilate apiġiŋagaa, Suuva iḷumun ittuaq?

english: When he had said this he went back outside to the Jewish leaders and announced, “I find no basis for an accusation against him.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiqqaaqługu, anitqiŋaruq Jew-guruanun, aasii uqallautivlugich, Iḷitchuġiruŋa patchisiksraisilaaŋanik.

english: But it is your custom that I release one prisoner for you at the Passover. So do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”
inupiaq: Aglaan ilivsi piḷġusiqaqtusi uvaŋa tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitchitquvluŋa iñuŋmik Itqaġviŋmi Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun. Tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitchitquvisiŋa Umialgannik Jew-guruat?

english: Then they shouted back, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” (Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.)
inupiaq: Iliŋich nipaallatqiŋarut, Ilaaniŋiḷaaq aglaan Barabbas-mik. Barabbas tigligayuktiqpauŋaruq.

english: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged severely.
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate tigupkaŋagaa Jesus aasii ipiġaqtuqtiłługu.

english: The soldiers braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they clothed him in a purple robe.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi aŋuyaktit niaquġusiuŋarut kakiḷḷaġnaqtuanik qisiqsiutinik, aasii iḷivḷugu niaquanun, suli annuġaaqługu suŋauraammaġiksuamik annuġaamik umialiktun.

english: They came up to him again and again and said, “Hail, king of the Jews!” And they struck him repeatedly in the face.
inupiaq: Ilaisa ullakługu ilaanun kipagivlugu nanġarraqsiŋagaat, Sivisuruamik iñuuli Umialgat Jews, pattakługulu argagmiŋnik.

english: Again Pilate went out and said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, I am bringing him out to you, so that you may know that I find no reason for an accusation against him.”
inupiaq: Pilate anitqiŋaruq aasii uqallautivlugich, Uvva, annisiniaġiga ilivsiññun iḷisimatquvlusi uvaŋa iḷitchuġiŋisilaamnik patchisiksramik ilaani.

english: So Jesus came outside, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Look, here is the man!”
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus aniŋaruq atuqłuni niaquġunmik kakiḷḷaġnaqtuanik suli suŋauraammaġiksuamik annuġaamik.

english: When the chief priests and their officers saw him, they shouted out, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said, “You take him and crucify him! Certainly I find no reason for an accusation against him!”
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu munaqsriḷḷu tautukamirruŋ, nipaallaŋarut, Kikiaktuutili, kikiaktuutili aŋarrauramun. Pilate uqallautiŋagai, Piḷugu ilivsiññik kikiaktuuttusiuŋ, qanuq uvaŋa iḷitchuġiruŋa patchisiksraisilaaŋanik.

english: The Jewish leaders replied, “We have a law, and according to our law he ought to die, because he claimed to be the Son of God!”
inupiaq: Jew-guruat kiuŋagaat, Pitquraqaqtugut aasii taavrumuuna pitqurakun tuquruksraugaluaqtuq, qanuq ilaa inmiñik iḷiuqtuq Iġñiġinivḷuni God-mun.

english: When Pilate heard what they said, he was more afraid than ever,
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate tusaakamigich taapkua uqaluich, iqsitchavsaaŋaruq.

english: and he went back into the governor’s residence and said to Jesus, “Where do you come from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
inupiaq: Isitqiŋaruq isivġiġviŋmun aasii apiġivlugu Jesus, Sumiñ qaivich? Jesus kiuŋaitkaa.

english: So Pilate said, “Do you refuse to speak to me? Don’t you know I have the authority to release you, and to crucify you?”
inupiaq: Pilate apiġiŋagaa, Uqautiniaŋitpiŋa? Iḷisimaŋitpich ataniġnaqutiqaqtilaamnik tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitchumiñaqłutin, suli kikiaktuutipkaġumiñaqłutin?

english: Jesus replied, “You would have no authority over me at all, unless it was given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of greater sin.”
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagaa, Ataniġnaqutiqaġumiñaitkaluaqtutin qanuġumiñaġluŋa aitchuusiaġiŋisuaġupku ilivich God-miñ. Tavra taamna iñuk aitchuutiginniktuaq uvamnik iliŋnun piḷuusiqiłhamaaqtuq.

english: From this point on, Pilate tried to release him. But the Jewish leaders shouted out, “If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar! Everyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar!”
inupiaq: Taapkua uqaluich pisigivlugich Pilate-gum tigutaaqtauŋaiqsinniaŋagaluaġaa Jesus, aglaan Jew-guruat nipaallaksiññaŋarut, tigutaaqtauŋaiqsitkupku una iñuk, Caesar-m avilaitqatigiŋitkaatin. Iñupayaaq iḷiuqtuaq inmiñik umialiguqtiqłuni akiḷḷiḷiqsuutiruq Caesar-mun umialguruamun Rome-mi.

english: When Pilate heard these words he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat in the place called “The Stone Pavement” (Gabbatha in Aramaic).
inupiaq: Tavra Pilate tusaakamigich taapkua uqaluich, ilaan annisiŋagaa Jesus aasii aquviłłuni isivġiġvium aquppiutaŋiñun inimun atiqaqtuamun Uyaġagmik natilik, aasii Hebrew-tun uqaġniġmi taggisaa Gabbatha.

english: (Now it was the day of preparation for the Passover, about noon.) Pilate said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, here is your king!”
inupiaq: Taamna uvluġiŋagaa Jew-guruat itqanaiyaġmata Itqaunmik Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun, aasii uvluq qitiqqaqpalliqł̣uni. Pilate uqallautiŋagai Jew-guruat, Uvva Umialiksi.

english: Then they shouted out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked, “Shall I crucify your king?” The high priests replied, “We have no king except Caesar!”
inupiaq: Iliŋich nipaallaŋarut, Tuqulli. Tuqulli. Kikiaktuutilugu aŋarrauramun. Pilate uqallautiŋagai, Kikiaktuutiniaqpigu Umialiksi? Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich uqallaŋarut, Umialgitchugut allamik, Caesar kisian.

english: Then Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan aitchuutigiŋagaa ilaiññun kikiaktuutitquvlugu aŋarrauramun.

english: So they took Jesus,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa tiguŋagaat Jesus, aasii anivḷuni iqsruŋagaa ilaan aŋarraurani, inimun taggisiqaqtuamun inaanik niaquġruam, taggisiqaqtuaq Hebrew-tun uqaġniġmi Golgotha.

english: and carrying his own cross he went out to the place called “The Place of the Skull” (called in Aramaic Golgotha).
inupiaq: Tavrani ilaisa kikiaktuutiŋagaat aŋarrauramun piqasiqł̣ugu malġugnik allaŋnik, Jesus qitqagnukługu.

english: There they crucified him along with two others, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.
inupiaq: Pilate suli aglaŋaruq aasii iḷivḷugu aŋarrauramun taiguaġnaqtuaq, Jesus Nazareth-miu, Umialgat Jew-guruat.

english: Pilate also had a notice written and fastened to the cross, which read: “Jesus the Nazarene, the king of the Jews.”
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat Jew-guruat taiguaŋagaat taamna aglak, qanuq ini Jesus kikiaktuurrauvia qaninŋaruq iniqpaŋmun, suli aglaaguvluni Hebrew-tun Latin-tullu Greek-tullu.

english: Thus many of the Jewish residents of Jerusalem read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the notice was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich tavrani uqallaŋarut Pilate-mun, Aglagnagu Umialgannik Jew-guruat, aglaan aglagiñ Una iñuk uqaqtuaq uvaŋa Umialguruŋa Jew-guruanun.

english: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The king of the Jews,’ but rather, ‘This man said, I am king of the Jews.’”
inupiaq: Pilate kiuŋagai, Aglaaġianikkaġa allaŋŋuġniaŋitchuq.

english: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit Jesus kikiaktuutianikamirruŋ aŋarrauramun, tiguŋagaich annuġaaŋi aasii autaaqługich sisamaigułługich, atautchimik piḷḷaayumiñaqsivḷugu aŋuyakti. Aglaan iḷagiŋaitkaat iḷulliat annuġaaŋisa kiluiḷaaq, qiḷaaq qulaaniñ anmun,

english: Now when the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and made four shares, one for each soldier, and the tunic remained. (Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom as a single piece.)
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ inmiŋnun, Aligaŋaiḷḷakput una, aglaan saaptautigilakput iḷitchuġisaġluta kimun piginiaqtilaaŋanik. Taamna taŋŋiutauniqsuq Bible uqaluannun inna,

english: So the soldiers said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but throw dice to see who will get it.” This took place to fulfill the scripture that says, “They divided my garments among them, and for my clothing they threw dice.” So the soldiers did these things.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna aŋuyaktit piŋagaat. Aasiivsauq makitaŋarut saniġaani aŋarrauraŋan Jesus, aakaŋa, aakaŋallu aniqataa, Mary-ḷu nuliaŋa Clopas, Mary-ḷu Magdalene.

english: Now standing beside Jesus’ cross were his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus tautukamiuŋ aakani iḷitchitquraġlu ilaan piviuttaġirani makitaruak qaniłłutiŋ, uqallautiŋagaa aakani, Aġnaaq, ikka iġñiġiñ.

english: So when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, look, here is your son!”
inupiaq: Aasii uqallaŋammiuq iḷitchitquramun, Ikka aakan. Tavraŋŋaaglaan iḷitchitquram nuutinŋagaa ilaan aimaaġviŋmiñun.

english: He then said to his disciple, “Look, here is your mother!” From that very time the disciple took her into his own home.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Jesus, iḷisimavluni supayaat paŋmapak naatilaaŋannik, uqallaŋaruq, Imiġuliqsuŋa. Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaa taŋŋiquvlugich Bible uqaluŋich.

english: After this Jesus, realizing that by this time everything was completed, said (in order to fulfill the scripture), “I am thirsty!”
inupiaq: Tavrani napaŋaruq qattaq siḷivinŋaruaq wine-mik, tavra iḷiŋagaat ivsaktaqtuaq ivsaktilluataqługu wine-mik aasii isaaġutivlugu qiruatchiamik qanġanun.

english: A jar full of sour wine was there, so they put a sponge soaked in sour wine on a branch of hyssop and lifted it to his mouth.
inupiaq: Jesus aitchuusiaġianikamiuŋ wine uqallaŋaruq, Naattuq. Aasii sikivlugu niaqquni aniġniġiŋaruq.

english: When he had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is completed!” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluġimmagu Itqanaiyaġvium Qulaurrusiqivikun niqinaqivium, Jew-guruat apiġiŋagaat Pilate niuŋich navguġukługich, suli aullautitquvlugich, timit aŋarrauraniititquŋił̣ł̣ugich Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋanni. Qanuq taamna Savaiññiq nuimaruaguruq allaniñ Savaiññiġniñ.

english: Then, because it was the day of preparation, so that the bodies should not stay on the crosses on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was an especially important one), the Jewish leaders asked Pilate to have the victims’ legs broken and the bodies taken down.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit qaiŋarut aasii navguqługik niuŋik sivullium, igḷuatalu kikiaktuurrauqatauruam Jesus-mun.

english: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the two men who had been crucified with Jesus, first the one and then the other.
inupiaq: Aasii tikiññamirruŋ Jesus iḷitchuġivlugu tuquaniktilaaŋanik, naviŋaitkaich niuŋik.

english: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷaŋata aŋuyaktit kapiŋagaa saniqsuagun panamik, aasii tavrauvvaa maqiŋaruk auglu imiġlu.

english: But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water flowed out immediately.
inupiaq: Iñuk taamna tautuŋaruaq taavrumiŋa quliaqtuaŋaruq ilivsi ukpiliquvlusi. Ilaan quliaqtuaŋa iḷumun ittuq, suli ilaa iḷisimaruq iḷumun ittuamik uqaqtilaamiñik.

english: And the person who saw it has testified (and his testimony is true, and he knows that he is telling the truth), so that you also may believe.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua piŋarut taŋŋiqsautquvlugich Bible uqaluŋich inna, “Atausiuraq-unnii sauniŋa naviktauniaŋitchuq.”

english: For these things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of his will be broken.”
inupiaq: Aasiisuli alla Bible uqaluat uqaġmiuq, “Ilaisa qiñiġniaġaat kapiŋaraqtiŋ.”

english: And again another scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Joseph Arimathea-ġmium ullakługu Pilate apiġiŋagaa pisukługu timaa Jesus. Taamna Joseph ukpiqtuaguruaq Jesus-mun aglaan nalunautchivḷuni sivuuġagivlugich Jew-guruat. Pilate-gum uqallautiŋagaa piyumiñaġnivḷugu timaa Jesus. Anivḷuni Joseph-gum aullautiyaqtuŋagaa Jesus timaa.

english: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus (but secretly, because he feared the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate if he could remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he went and took the body away.
inupiaq: Nicodemus-lu, Jesus-mukpaalluŋaruaq unnuami, qaiŋammiuq qaġġirrivḷuni akuvliġiiñik tivluktuaniglu tivraġiksuaniglu iḷuvviuġutinik tallimakipiatun uqumaisigiruanik.

english: Nicodemus, the man who had previously come to Jesus at night, accompanied Joseph, carrying a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about seventy-five pounds.
inupiaq: Iliŋikta piŋagaak timaa Jesus, aasii nimmaaqługu qattiġiksuanik ukił̣haanik tivraġiksausiqł̣ugu, piḷġusiatitun iḷuvviuqamiŋ Jew-guruat.

english: Then they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it, with the aromatic spices, in strips of linen cloth according to Jewish burial customs.
inupiaq: Tavra qaniŋani ilaan kikiaktuurrauviata nauvianni napaaqtut inŋaruq nutaaq iḷuvvivik iñuum qaŋaunnii iḷuvġuvigiŋaisaŋa.

english: Now at the place where Jesus was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb where no one had yet been buried.
inupiaq: Tavra pisigivlugu uvluq sivuani Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋata, pisigivlugulu iḷuvvivium qaninniŋa, iḷiŋagaat Jesus tavruŋa.

english: And so, because it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was nearby, they placed Jesus’ body there.
Now very early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat Itchaksriġmata Savaiññiŋat qaaŋiġman, Mary Magdalene iḷuvviviŋmuŋaruq uvlaaġuaqłuni taaŋŋaansuli, aasii tautuŋagaa uyaġagruaq piiŋaruaq iḷuvvivium paaŋaniñ.

english: So she went running to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus loved and told them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
inupiaq: Tavra aqpamik aullaŋaruq Simon Peter-mun allamullu iḷitchitquramun taavrumuŋa Jesus piviuttaġikkaŋanun, aasii uqallautivlugik, Aullautiniġaat Ataniq iḷuvviviŋmiñ, aasii nalugikput sumun iḷisilaaŋanik.

english: Then Peter and the other disciple set out to go to the tomb.
inupiaq: Peter tavrani aniŋaruq piqatigivlugu alla taamna iḷitchitquraq, aasii aullaqiŋaruk iḷuvviviŋmun.

english: The two were running together, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and reached the tomb first.
inupiaq: Iluqatik aqpanŋaruk, aglaan allam iḷitchitquram unitchaŋagaa Peter aasii tikitqaaqłuni iḷuvviviŋmun.

english: He bent down and saw the strips of linen cloth lying there, but he did not go in.
inupiaq: Aasii puuŋasivḷuni itchuaqami qiñiqsaqłuni, tautuŋagai qattiġiksuat ukił̣haat tamaani, aglaan isiŋitchuq.

english: Then Simon Peter, who had been following him, arrived and went right into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen cloth lying there,
inupiaq: Tavra Simon Peter tikiñŋaruq aasii isiqłuni iḷuanun iḷuvvivium. Aasii tautuŋagai qattiġiksuat ukił̣haat tamaaniittuat,

english: and the face cloth, which had been around Jesus’ head, not lying with the strips of linen cloth but rolled up in a place by itself.
inupiaq: ukił̣haaġlu niaquaniinŋaruaq itqatauŋiññiqsuq qattiġiksuanun ukił̣haanun, aglaan imulaaŋavluni inniqsuq inmigun.

english: Then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, came in, and he saw and believed.
inupiaq: Tavra alla iḷitchitquraq, tikitqaaŋaruaq iḷuvviviŋmun, isiŋammiuq aasii tautukługich ukpiliŋaruq.

english: (For they did not yet understand the scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.)
inupiaq: Tamauŋanun aglaan kaŋiqsiŋaitkaich Bible uqaluŋich, ilaan aŋiruksrauniŋagun tuqqunmiñ.

english: So the disciples went back to their homes.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurak utiŋaruk aimaaġviŋmiŋnun.

english: But Mary stood outside the tomb weeping. As she wept, she bent down and looked into the tomb.
inupiaq: Tavrali Mary makitaŋaruq qiavluni siḷataani iḷuvvivium, qianiallaġmi puuŋasivḷuni itchuaŋaruq iḷuvvivium iḷuanun,

english: And she saw two angels in white sitting where Jesus’ body had been lying, one at the head and one at the feet.
inupiaq: aasii tautuŋaruq malġugnik isaġullaŋnik qatiqtuanik annuġaaqaqtuaŋnik, aquppiruaŋnik timaata Jesus nallavigiŋaraani, igḷua niaquani aasii igḷua isigaŋiñi.

english: They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” Mary replied, “They have taken my Lord away, and I do not know where they have put him!”
inupiaq: Iliŋikta apiġiŋagaak, Aġnaaq, summan qiavich? Ilaan kiuŋagik, Atakkiataŋimma aullautiŋaniġaat Ataniġa, aasii nalugiga sumun iliŋiññun iḷisilaaŋanik.

english: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.
inupiaq: Tainna uqallaanikami, kiŋiaŋaruq aasii tautuŋagaa Jesus makitaruaq, aglaan iḷisaġiŋitkaa Jesus-gutilaaŋanik.

english: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” Because she thought he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him.”
inupiaq: Jesus apiġiŋagaa, Aġnaaq, summan qiavich? Kiña ivaqpiuŋ? Isummatigivlugu nunaliqiraunasugalugu, Mary uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Iñuuk, sumun aullautiŋagupku uqallautiŋŋa sumun iḷiŋatilaaŋanik, aullautiyumagiga.

english: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him in Aramaic, “Rabboni” (which means Teacher).
inupiaq: Jesus tuqłuŋagaa atqanik, Mary. Mary qiviaŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni ilaanun Hebrew-tun, Rabboni (sivuniqaqtuaq Iḷisaurrii).

english: Jesus replied, “Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. Go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Tiggunaŋa qanuq mayuaniŋaitchuŋasuli Aapamun. Aglaan aullaġiñ aniqatiimnun aasii uqallautilugich, mayuġumaagaqsiruŋa Aapamnun Aapavsiññullu, suli God-imnun God-ivsiññullu.

english: Mary Magdalene came and informed the disciples, “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.
inupiaq: Mary Magdalene aullaŋaruq aasii uqallautiŋagai iḷitchitquraŋi, Tautuŋagiga Ataniq. Suli quliaqtuaġutiŋagai Jesus uqaluŋiñik.

english: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the disciples had gathered together and locked the doors of the place because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
inupiaq: Unnugiaġniŋani taavruma uvlum, tugliani uvlum Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋata, upkuat umiktuŋapkaqługich iḷitchitqurat irvianni, iqsivḷutiŋ Jew-guruanik, Jesus qaiŋaruq aasii makiłłuni akunġannun uqallautivlugich, Tutqiutiqaġitchi.

english: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, ilaan maniŋagai ilaiññun argagni saniqqaniḷu. Tavra iḷitchitqurat quviatchaŋarut tautukamirruŋ Ataniq.

english: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. Just as the Father has sent me, I also send you.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautitqiŋagai, Tutqiutiqaġitchi. Aapavli tiliŋammaŋa, tainnatulli tiligivsi.

english: And after he said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Taamnaasii uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, aniqsaaġvigiŋagai uqallautivlugich, Ilitqusiġiksuaq aitchuusiaġisiuŋ.

english: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven; if you retain anyone’s sins, they are retained.”
inupiaq: Uqallautiguvsigik iñuich God-mun suliqutigiŋaiġñiḷugich itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich piḷuutiŋich ukpiliqpata, suliqutigiŋaiqsaurut. Aasiisuli uqallautimmiguvsigik God-mun suliqutigiŋaiŋiññiḷugich piḷuutiŋich ukpiliŋitpata, suliqutigiŋaiqsauŋitchut.

english: Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
inupiaq: Tavra Thomas, iḷaŋat qulit malġuk, taggisiqaqtuaq igḷuanik Malġim, piiñŋaruq iḷamiñi Jesus qaimman.

english: The other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he replied, “Unless I see the wounds from the nails in his hands, and put my finger into the wounds from the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe it!”
inupiaq: Tavraasii allat iḷitchitqurat uqallautiŋagaat, Tautuŋagikput Ataniq. Thomas uqallautigiññaŋagai, Tautuŋisuaġupkich argaŋiñi ikiŋich kikiagich, suli argatka iḷiḷugich ikiŋiññun kikiagich, iḷiḷugiḷḷu argatka saniġaanun, ukpiġumiñaipiaqtuŋa.

english: Eight days later the disciples were again together in the house, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
inupiaq: Tallimat piŋasut uvlut pianiŋmata, iḷitchitquraŋi iglumiinŋalgitchut, aasii Thomas itqatauŋaruq. Upkuat umiktuutiqaŋarut, aasii Jesus qaiŋaruq qikaqłuni akunġannun. Uqallaŋaruq, Tutqiutiqaġitchi.

english: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and examine my hands. Extend your hand and put it into my side. Do not continue in your unbelief, but believe.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii ilaan uqallautiŋagaa Thomas, Iḷḷiuŋ argaiñ uvuŋa suli tautukkich argatka, isaaġutilugiḷḷu argaktin aasii iḷiḷugich saniqsumnun. Arguasuŋaiġiñ aglaan ukpiqsimaaġiñ.

english: Thomas replied to him, “My Lord and my God!”
inupiaq: Thomas kiuŋagaa Jesus, Ataniiŋ, God-iiŋ.

english: Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are the people who have not seen and yet have believed.”
inupiaq: Jesus uqallautiŋagaa, Ukpiliqsutin tautuanikamŋa kisianik. Quviasuglich iñuich tautuŋaitkaluaqłuŋa ukpiliqsuat.

english: Now Jesus performed many other miraculous signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
inupiaq: Tavra Jesus takkuanni iḷitchitqurat piŋagaluaqtuq iñugiaktuanik allanik aliuġnaqtuanik nalupqinaiyautinik kiutilaamiñik aglausimaŋitchuanik ukunani makpiġaani.

english: But these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
inupiaq: Aglaan makua aglaagurut ilivsi ukpiquvlusi taamna Jesus Christ-gutilaaŋanik, Iġñiŋa God-im, aasii ukpiliġḷusi iñuggutinnaquvlusi ilaan suaŋŋataagun.

english: I wrote the former account, Theophilus, about all that Jesus began to do and teach
inupiaq: Nakuaġiramnun Theophilus-mun. Sivulliġñi makpiġaani uqausiġiŋagitka iluqaisa Jesus savaaġikkaŋi iḷisaurrutiŋiḷu,

english: until the day he was taken up to heaven, after he had given orders by the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
inupiaq: uvlumun-aglaan mayuurrauvianun qiḷaŋmun. Mayuurrauŋaiñŋaan Ilitqusiġiksuam suaŋŋasiŋagaa piraksriiyumiñaqsivḷugu iñuŋnun piksraqtaaġiŋaraŋiñun tilisukługich.

english: To the same apostles also, after his suffering, he presented himself alive with many convincing proofs. He was seen by them over a forty-day period and spoke about matters concerning the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: Malġukipiani uvluni tuqutauqqaaqłuni tautuktitqataŋaruq inmiñik ilaiññun iñugiaktuani, nalupqinaiqł̣ugu iñuutilaani. Ilaisa tautukkayuŋagaat, uqaqatigivlugiḷḷu ilaata God-im atanniqsimmataanik iñuŋnun.

english: While he was with them, he declared, “Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait there for what my Father promised, which you heard about from me.
inupiaq: Katinmata atautchimun Jesus piraksriŋagai uumiŋa, Jerusalem-miñ aullaġnasi, aglaan utaqqiyumagiksi aitchuutiksraun Aapama unniqsuqłiisaa, uqautigiŋakkaġa ilivsiññun.

english: For John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
inupiaq: Qanuq John paptaiġutiqaŋaruq imiġmik, aglaan uvva iñukitchuat uvlut pianikpata, Ilitqusiġiksuaq iḷuvsiññun iḷiñiaġiga.

english: So when they had gathered together, they began to ask him, “Lord, is this the time when you are restoring the kingdom to Israel?”
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat katinnamiŋ piqatigivlugu Jesus apiġiŋagaat, Ataniiq, paŋmapak isagutipkaġniaqpiuŋ Israel-guruat umialiqaġumiñaqsiḷugich inmiŋni taimanisun?

english: He told them, “You are not permitted to know the times or periods that the Father has set by his own authority.
inupiaq: Jesus kiuŋagai, Ilivsi iḷisimaraksrautigiŋitkisi uvlullu piviksrallu Aapam inillaŋaraŋi ilaan ataniġnaqunmigun.

english: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the farthest parts of the earth.”
inupiaq: Aglaan Ilitqusiġiksuam qaigumi ilivsiññun suaŋŋasiġñiaġaasi quliaqtuaġumiñaqsiḷusi tusaayugaaġiksuanik uvapkun Jerusalem-mi, iluqaaniḷu Judea-mi, Samaria-miḷu, uŋasigñiqsraŋiññullu nunam.

english: After he had said this, while they were watching, he was lifted up and a cloud hid him from their sight.
