english: But Ananias replied, “Lord, I have heard from many people about this man, how much harm he has done to your saints in Jerusalem,
inupiaq: Tavra Ananias-gum kiuŋagaa, Ataniiq, tusaaŋaruŋa iñugiaktuaniñ iñuŋniñ taavrumuuna iñukun, qanutun pigiisigiruamik savaaġiŋakkaŋanik ukpiqtuanun Jerusalem-mi.

english: and here he has authority from the chief priests to imprison all who call on your name!”
inupiaq: Aasii qaiŋaruq Damascus-mun ataniġnaqusiraqłuni aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋniñ qiḷiqsruiyumiñaġukługich iluqaisa ukpiqtuat iliŋnun.

english: But the Lord said to him, “Go, because this man is my chosen instrument to carry my name before Gentiles and kings and the people of Israel.
inupiaq: Tavra Ataniq uqallaŋaruq ilaanun, Aullaġiñ, qanuq uvaŋa piksraqtaaġiŋagiga savautitquvluŋa, iḷitchuġipkaquvluŋa Jew-guŋitchuanun, umialiŋnullu, Israel-guruanullu.

english: For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.”
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷisautiniaġiga qanutupayauraq nagliksaaqtuksrautilaaŋa pisigiluŋa.

english: So Ananias departed and entered the house, placed his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you came here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
inupiaq: Tavra Ananias aullaŋaruq, aasii isiqłuni iglumun. Aasii iḷiŋagai argaŋni Saul-mun uqallakłuni, Aniqaan Saul, Atanġum Jesus niptaŋaruam iliŋnun apqunmi qaġġiviŋñi, tiliŋagaaŋa qiñillasitqiquvlutin, suli paŋmapaŋmiñ aglaan Ilitqusiġiksuamun aŋalatquvlutin.

english: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized,
inupiaq: Aasii tavrauvvaa sutkiaq kavitchisun ittuat kataŋarut Saul-gum irraŋniñ, aasii qiñillasitqiŋaruq. Tavra makinŋaruq aasii paptaiqsauvluni,

english: and after taking some food, his strength returned.
inupiaq: suli niġiŋaruq aasii sayanitqikł̣uni. Tavra iñugiaktuani uvluni piqatigiŋagai ukpiqtuat Damascus-mi.

english: For several days he was with the disciples in Damascus,
inupiaq: Tavra Saul aŋaiyyuliaqsautigillaan piŋaruq Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviŋiññun. Aasii alġaqsruutigirraqsiŋagaa Jesus, Iġñiġinivḷugu God-mun.

english: and immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “This man is the Son of God.”
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ tusaaruat ilaanik niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut, aasii uqaqłutiŋ, Taimñauŋitpauna iñuk Jerusalem-mi tuquġairuaq ukpiqtuanik Jesus-mun? Aasii qaiŋaruq mauŋa sivuniġivlugu tigutaaġlugich ukpiqtuat utqutisukługich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun.

english: All who heard him were amazed and were saying, “Is this not the man who in Jerusalem was ravaging those who call on this name, and who had come here to bring them as prisoners to the chief priests?”
inupiaq: Tavra Saul alġaqsruiŋaruq suaŋasisaiññaqługu alġaqsruutini. Aasii ilaan ukpiġnaqsilġutiŋi Jesus Christ-guniŋagun suaŋavaił̣ł̣utiŋ Jew-guruat Damascus-miittuat kiumalaiñŋagaat.

english: But Saul became more and more capable, and was causing consternation among the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Christ.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat uvlut qaaŋianiŋmata, Jew-guruat katinŋarut sivunniuqłutiŋ tuqutchukługu Saul.

english: Now after some days had passed, the Jews plotted together to kill him,
inupiaq: Tavra sivunniuġutaat iḷitchuġiŋagaa Saul-gum. Aasii taapkua iñuaġuktuat qaunagiŋagaich paaqpaich uvlumi unnuamiḷu, tuqutchukługu Saul.

english: but Saul learned of their plot against him. They were also watching the city gates day and night so that they could kill him.
inupiaq: Tavra unnuat iḷaŋanni, ukpiliqsuat Saul alġaqsruimman, niŋinŋagaat Saul siḷataatigun katchich niŋirrusiqł̣ugu aguummakpaŋmik.

english: But his disciples took him at night and let him down through an opening in the wall by lowering him in a basket.
inupiaq: Tavra Saul aullaŋaruq Jerusalem-mun, aasii iḷḷatisaŋagaluaqtuq ukpiqtuanun. Iliŋisa arguagiŋagaat ukpiqtuaġuqtilaaŋa, suli iluqaġmiŋ iqsigiŋagaat.

english: When he arrived in Jerusalem, he attempted to associate with the disciples, and they were all afraid of him, because they did not believe that he was a disciple.
inupiaq: Tavra Barnabas qaivḷuni ikayuŋagaa Saul, aasii tiliraunikun iḷitchitquranuutivlugu. Ilaan quliaqtuaġutiŋagai Saul-mun tautuŋatilaaŋanik Ataniq apqunmi, qanuġlu Atanġum uqaŋatilaaŋanik Saul-mun. Barnabas quliaqtuaġutiŋammigai qanutun qikkisaił̣ł̣uni Saul alġaqsruiŋatilaaŋanik alġaqsruutigivlugu Jesus Damascus-miuni.

english: But Barnabas took Saul, brought him to the apostles, and related to them how he had seen the Lord on the road, that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had spoken out boldly in the name of Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra Saul nayuŋagai, aasii kukiḷukłuni iluqaani Jerusalem-mi,

english: So he was staying with them, associating openly with them in Jerusalem, speaking out boldly in the name of the Lord.
inupiaq: alġaqsruutigivlugu Ataniq qikkisaił̣ł̣uni. Suli uqaaqatigivlugich Greek-gich uqausiqaqtuat Jew-guruatun, ilaisaliasii tuqurviksraqsiuŋagaat.

english: He was speaking and debating with the Greek-speaking Jews, but they were trying to kill him.
inupiaq: Tavra aniqatit iḷitchuġikamiŋ taavrumiŋa, aullautiŋagaat Saul Caesarea-mun, aasii tavraŋŋa aullaqtiłługu Tarsus-mun.

english: When the brothers found out about this, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqiruat iluqaani Judea-mi Galilee-miḷu Samaria-miḷu tutqiksiŋarut, suli aŋaiyyuliqiruat suaŋasisaiññaŋarut iñugiaksisaiññaqłutiglu iñuuvlutiŋ qiksigivlugu Ataniq, quviasaaġutaaniḷu Ilitqusiġiksuam.

english: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria experienced peace and thus was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and in the encouragement of the Holy Spirit, the church increased in numbers.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter iglauŋaruq sumulliqaa, aasii iḷaanni ullaŋagai God-im iñuŋi iñuuruat Lydda-mi nunaaqqimi.

english: Now as Peter was traveling around from place to place, he also came down to the saints who lived in Lydda.
inupiaq: Tavrani kasuŋagaa iñuk atiqaqtuaq Aeneas-mik, makitilaiñŋaniqsuaq tallimat piŋasuni ukiuni avatiŋi tuquŋavlutiŋ.

english: He found there a man named Aeneas who had been confined to a mattress for eight years because he was paralyzed.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m uqallautiŋagaa, Aeneas, Jesus Christ iłuaqsigaatin. Makittin iłuaqsakkich tuŋiutitin. Tavra tavrauvvaa makinŋaruq.

english: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus the Christ heals you. Get up and make your own bed!” And immediately he got up.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iñuuruat Lydda-mi Sharon-miḷu tautuŋagaat, aasii iliŋich ukpiliŋarut Ataniġmun.

english: All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
inupiaq: Tavra Joppa-miinŋaruq ukpiqtuaq aġnaq atiqaqtuaq Tabitha-mik. Atqa Greek-tun Dorcas sivuniqaqtuaq tuttumik. Iluqaan piviksrani atuŋaniġaa nakuurualiqivluni ikayuqługiḷḷu iḷiappauruat.

english: Now in Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which in translation means Dorcas). She was continually doing good deeds and acts of charity.
inupiaq: Taipkunani uvluni naŋiliŋaruq aasii tuquvluni, tavraasii timaa ivvaanikamirruŋ iḷiŋagaat qiḷaguamun.

english: At that time she became sick and died. When they had washed her body, they placed it in an upstairs room.
inupiaq: Tavra Joppa qaninman Lydda-mun, ukpiqtuat Joppa-mi tusaaŋarut Peter Lydda-miitilaaŋanik. Tavra tilisiŋarut malġugnik iññuŋnik Peter-mun uqaluksriqł̣ugik inna, Qilamik ullaktigut.

english: Because Lydda was near Joppa, when the disciples heard that Peter was there, they sent two men to him and urged him, “Come to us without delay.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter itqanaiyaŋaruq, aasii aullaqatigivlugik. Tavra tikiñman qiḷaguamuutiŋagaat. Iluqaġmiŋ uiḷgaŋaruat makitaŋarut saniġaani qiavlutiŋ, suli maniuqługich quppiġaat annuġaallu Dorcas piḷiaŋi iñuuŋŋaġmi.

english: So Peter got up and went with them, and when he arrived they brought him to the upper room. All the widows stood beside him, crying and showing him the tunics and other clothing Dorcas used to make while she was with them.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m aninŋagai iluqaisa, aasii sitquqłuni aŋaiyyuŋaruq. Tavraasii qiviaqługu timaa uqallaŋaruq, Tabitha, makittin. Tavra uiñŋaruq, aasii Peter tautukamiuŋ aquvinŋaruq.

english: But Peter sent them all outside, knelt down, and prayed. Turning to the body, he said, “Tabitha, get up.” Then she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m isaaqłuni ikayuŋagaa makinman. Tavraniasii ququaqługich ukpiqtuallu uiḷgaŋaruallu, ilaan qaiñŋagaa iñuuvlugu.

english: He gave her his hand and helped her get up. Then he called the saints and widows and presented her alive.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna iḷitchuġirauŋaruq iluqaani Joppa-mi, suli iñugiaktuat iñuich ukpiliŋarut Ataniġmun.

english: This became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uvliuŋaruq Joppa-mi, tukkuġivlugu Simon qitummairi ammiñik.

english: So Peter stayed many days in Joppa with a man named Simon, a tanner.
Now there was a man in Caesarea named Cornelius, a centurion of what was known as the Italian Cohort.
inupiaq: Caesarea-mi iñuqaŋaruq atiqaqtuamik Cornelius-mik, atanaurauniqsuaq Rome-miut aŋuyaktiŋiññun, taggisiqaqtuanun Italian-nik aŋuyaktauqatigiiñik.

english: He was a devout, God-fearing man, as was all his household; he did many acts of charity for the people and prayed to God regularly.
inupiaq: Taamna Cornelius god-iliqiruaguruaq, suli ilaalu qitunġaniḷu qiksigivlugu God. Ilaa ikayuiŋaruq atqunaq Jew-guruat iḷiappaŋiññik, suli ataramik aŋaiyyuvluni God-mun.

english: About three o’clock one afternoon he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God who came in and said to him, “Cornelius.”
inupiaq: Piŋasunukpalliġman qiñiqtuuraaŋaruq tautupiaġataqłuni isaġulganik God-im isiqtuamik, aasii ququaqługu, Cornelius.

english: Staring at him and becoming greatly afraid, Cornelius replied, “What is it, Lord?” The angel said to him, “Your prayers and your acts of charity have gone up as a memorial before God.
inupiaq: Tavra takunnaakkiutiŋagaa isaġulik iqsiḷḷaġmi, aasii uqallakłuni, Suna Ataniiq. Isaġulgum kiuŋagaa, God-im akuqtuŋagai aŋaiyyutitin, savaatillu nagliktuiñikun, suli itqaŋagaatin.

english: Now send men to Joppa and summon a man named Simon, who is called Peter.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak tilisiiñ iñuŋnik Joppa-mun, aasii qaġġisipkaġlugu Simon atiqaqtuaq Peter-mik.

english: This man is staying as a guest with a man named Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
inupiaq: Ilaa amma tukkumaruq Simon-mi qitummairimi ammiñik, igluqaqtuaq taġium siñaani.

english: When the angel who had spoken to him departed, Cornelius called two of his personal servants and a devout soldier from among those who served him,
inupiaq: Isaġulik uqaurriñi aullaaniŋman, Cornelius ququaŋagik malġuk kivgami iḷaŋich, god-iliqiruaguruaġlu aŋuyakti akunġanniñ tamatkua savaurriruat inmiñik,

english: and when he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
inupiaq: aasii quliaqtuaġutianikamigich supayaamik, ilaan tiliŋagai Joppa-mun.

english: About noon the next day, while they were on their way and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman qitiqqaqpalliġman, iglaupkaqtillugich qallivḷutiŋ Joppa-mun, Peter mayuŋaruq iglum qaaŋanun aŋaiyyuyaqtuqłuni.

english: He became hungry and wanted to eat, but while they were preparing the meal, a trance came over him.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter kaaliqł̣uni niġisuliŋaruq. Tavra niqłiuġataviksillugich ilaa qiñiqtuuraaŋaruq.

english: He saw heaven opened and an object something like a large sheet descending, being let down to earth by its four corners.
inupiaq: Aasii tautukługu qiḷak aŋmaqtuaq, sunalu niŋiruaq qiññaqaqłuni ukił̣haaqpaktun, niŋitaŋat sisamatigun kaŋiġalluŋisigun nunamun.

english: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth and wild birds.
inupiaq: Iḷuani imaġiniġai qanusipayaat nunam niġrutiŋi paamġuqtuallu tiŋmiallu.

english: Then a voice said to him, “Get up, Peter; slaughter and eat!”
inupiaq: Tavra nipim nivliutiŋagaa, Peter makittin. Tuqutchiḷutin niġġiiñ.

english: But Peter said, “Certainly not, Lord, for I have never eaten anything defiled and ritually unclean!”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Naagga Ataniiq. Niġiŋaitchuŋa qaŋaunnii supayaamik God-im salumaiññiraŋanik pitqurani.

english: The voice spoke to him again, a second time, “What God has made clean, you must not consider ritually unclean!”
inupiaq: Tavra nipim nivliutitqiŋagaa igḷuani, Sut God-im salummaanikkaŋi, isummatiginagich salumaitchuagulugich.

english: This happened three times, and immediately the object was taken up into heaven.
inupiaq: Taamna niŋiraġaŋaruq piŋasuiqsuaqłuni, aasii taamna mayuurrauŋaruq tavrauvvaa qiḷaŋmun.

english: Now while Peter was puzzling over what the vision he had seen could signify, the men sent by Cornelius had learned where Simon’s house was and approached the gate.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter isumalġataviksillugu sumik sivuniqaġniaqtilaaŋanik qiñiqtuuraani, taapkuali iñuich tilirautiŋi Cornelius, apiqsruqtuiqqaaqłutiŋ Simon iglua sumiitilaaŋanik, makitaŋarut sivuġaani paaqpaum.

english: They called out to ask if Simon, known as Peter, was staying there as a guest.
inupiaq: Quqquaŋarut tatqamuŋa apiqsrivḷutiŋ Simon taggisiqaqtuaq Peter-mik tukkumammagaan tavrani.

english: While Peter was still thinking seriously about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Look! Three men are looking for you.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter isumalaaġutiqaqtillugu qiñiqtuuraamik, Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallautiŋagaa, Iñuich qaŋma piŋasut ivaġaatin.

english: But get up, go down, and accompany them without hesitation, because I have sent them.”
inupiaq: Makillutin atqaġiñ, tuvaaqasikkich piñatchiasuŋaġnak, qanuq uvaŋa tiliŋagitka.

english: So Peter went down to the men and said, “Here I am, the person you’re looking for. Why have you come?”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter atqaŋaruq, aasii uqallautivlugich, Uvaŋauruŋa ivakkaqsi. Suvlusi qaivisi?

english: They said, “Cornelius the centurion, a righteous and God-fearing man, well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation, was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to hear a message from you.”
inupiaq: Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Cornelius aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata tiliŋagaatigut. Ilaa iñulluatauruq aŋaiyyusuuvluni God-mun, suli qutchiksuakun isummatigisuuvlugu Jew-guruat. Iḷaŋata God-im isaġuliŋisa uqallautiŋagaa aiyugaaquvlutin igluanun, tusaatquvlugu uqautiŋnik.

english: So Peter invited them in and entertained them as guests.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m isiquŋagai tuyuġmiaġisukługich. Uvlutqiŋman makinŋaruq, aasii aullaqatigivlugich, suli iḷaŋisa aniqatit Joppa-miñ tuvaaqasiŋagaat.

english: On the next day he got up and set out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
inupiaq: Uvlutqiḷgiñman tikiñŋarut Caesarea-mun. Cornelius iglaaksrani niġiugivlugich katitinŋagai atautchimun ilaan nanmiñiq iḷani, avilaitqatimmaġikkaniḷu.

english: The following day he entered Caesarea. Now Cornelius was waiting anxiously for them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter isiaqsimman Cornelius-gum paaŋagaa, aasii purvigiŋagaa qiksiqsrautikun.

english: So when Peter came in, Cornelius met him, fell at his feet, and worshiped him.
inupiaq: Tavrali Peter-m makitinŋagaa uqallakłuni, Makittin. Uvaŋaptauq iñuk iliktun.

english: But Peter helped him up, saying, “Stand up. I too am a mere mortal.”
inupiaq: Tavra uqaqatigillaan isiŋaruk, aasii tautuŋagai iñugiaktuat iñuich kasimaruat.

english: Peter continued talking with him as he went in, and he found many people gathered together.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Peter-m uqallautiŋagai, Ilivsivsauq iḷisimalluataqtusi qanuq nalaunŋaisilaaŋanik pitquratigun Jew-guruaq piqasiqsuutikpan naagga isiqattaaqpan Jew-guŋitchuamun, aglaan uvva God-im iḷisautiŋagaaŋa isummatigitquŋił̣ł̣ugu iñupayaaq salumaiḷḷugu suuvigruaŋiññiḷugulu.

english: He said to them, “You know that it is unlawful for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile, yet God has shown me that I should call no person defiled or ritually unclean.
inupiaq: Tavra qanniġñiqamŋa, qaiŋaruŋa qapiŋŋataił̣ł̣uŋa, aasii apiġigikpiñ paŋmapak, suna pisigivlugu qanniqpiŋa?

english: Therefore when you sent for me, I came without any objection. Now may I ask why you sent for me?”
inupiaq: Tavra Cornelius uqallaŋaruq, Piŋasut uvlut pianiktut, ikarraq tainnaiḷivalliġman aŋaiyyuruaŋaa iglumni. Tavrauvvaa iñuk makinŋaruq sivuqqamnun qaummaġiksuanik annuġaalik,

english: Cornelius replied, “Four days ago at this very hour, at three o’clock in the afternoon, I was praying in my house, and suddenly a man in shining clothing stood before me
inupiaq: uqallakłuni, Cornelius, aŋaiyyutin God-im tusaaŋagaa, suli itqaqługich savaatin nagliktuutit.

english: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your acts of charity have been remembered before God.
inupiaq: Tilisiiñ iñuŋmik Joppa-mun, aasii apiqsriaġilugu Simon taggisiqaqtuaq Peter-mik. Tukkumaruq amma taġium siñaaniittuami igluani Simon qitummairim ammiñik.

english: Therefore send to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter. This man is staying as a guest in the house of Simon the tanner, by the sea.’
inupiaq: Tavra aipkaŋagikpiñ tavrauvvaa, aasii nagliktauvlutin qairutin. Paŋmapak uvva iluqata uvaniittugut takkuani God-im, naalagukłuta iluqaiññik uqaluksriusiaġnik Ataniġmiñ.

english: Therefore I sent for you at once, and you were kind enough to come. So now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to say to us.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqarraqsiŋaruq, Paŋmapak puttuqsriruŋa God iḷumutun ativlugich iñupayaat aŋalatkai.

english: Then Peter started speaking: “I now truly understand that God does not show favoritism in dealing with people,
inupiaq: Nunauruapayaani kiñaliqaa qiksiksrautiqaqtuaq ilaanik, suli nalaunŋarualiqivluni, God-im akuqtullagaa.

english: but in every nation the person who fears him and does what is right is welcomed before him.
inupiaq: Nalupqisuŋitchuŋa tusaaŋatilaavsiññik tusaayugaaġiksuanik sivuniqaqtuanik Israel-guruanun, ilaan piksraqtaaġivluta alġaqsruutigitquvlugu tutqiutiqaġumiñaqtilaaŋat God-mun Jesus Christ-guruakun, Atanġuruakun iñupayaanun.

english: You know the message he sent to the people of Israel, proclaiming the good news of peace through Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all) –
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi taamna tusaayugaaġiksuaq siaminŋaruq iluqaani Judea-mi, isagutivluni Galilee-miñ John Paptaiqsi alġaqsruiganiŋman.

english: you know what happened throughout Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John announced:
inupiaq: Iḷisimammiusi Jesus Nazareth-miukun, God-im suaŋŋasikkaŋagun kuvivḷugu Ilitqusiġiksuani ilaanun. Iḷisimammiusi Jesus kukiḷuŋanivḷugu nakuurualiqivluni, iłuaqsivḷugiḷḷu iluqaisa iłuiḷḷiuqtitaŋi Tuunġaum, God-im itqatigivlugu.

english: with respect to Jesus from Nazareth, that God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with him.
inupiaq: Aasii uvagut iḷisimavluta quliaqtuaġigivut iluqaisa Jesus savaaŋi nunaŋanni Jew-guruat Jerusalem-miḷu. Ilaisa tuqunŋagaat kikiaktuutivlugu aŋarrauramun.

english: We are witnesses of all the things he did both in Judea and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a tree,
inupiaq: Aasii God-im aŋipkaŋagaa tuqqunmiñ piŋayuaŋni uvluk, aasii tautuktiłługu uvaptiŋnun.

english: but God raised him up on the third day and caused him to be seen,
inupiaq: Iñupayaanun tautuktinŋiñmigaa, aglaan uvagut tautuŋagikput God-im piksraqtaaġiŋaraŋatigut quliaqtuaġitquvlugu. Uvagut niġiqatigiŋagikput imiqatigivlugulu God-im aŋipkaaniŋmagu tuqqunmiñ.

english: not by all the people, but by us, the witnesses God had already chosen, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan piraksriŋagaatigut alġaqsruitquvluta tusaayugaaġiksuanik iñuŋnun, suli uqalugaaġitquvlugu ilaagutilaaŋanik piksraqtaaŋa God-im isivġiquvlugich iñuuruallu tuquŋaruallu.

english: He commanded us to preach to the people and to warn them that he is the one appointed by God as judge of the living and the dead.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ uqaqtiŋisa God-im uqautigiŋagaat Jesus, uqaqłutiŋ, Iñupayaagguuq ukpiqtuaq ilaanun piḷuutiŋi suliqutigiŋaiqsauniaqtut itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich Jesus pisigilugu.

english: About him all the prophets testify, that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
inupiaq: Peter taavrumiŋa uqaqtillugu suli, Ilitqusiġiksuaq atqaŋaruq iluqaiññun naalaġniruanun uqaluŋmik.

english: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the message.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat ukpiqtuat, Peter-m qaiqatiŋi Joppa-miñ, niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut God-im kuvimmagu aitchuutini Ilitqusiġiksuaq Jew-guŋitchuanununnii.

english: The circumcised believers who had accompanied Peter were greatly astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles,
inupiaq: Qanuq tusaaŋagaich uqaġmata nalukkamiŋnik allakanik uqautchiñik, nanġaqługu God.

english: for they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God. Then Peter said,
inupiaq: Tavra Peter uqallaŋaruq, Ukua iñuich aŋalatkai Ilitqusiġiksuam uvaptiktuttauq. Kia iñuum paptaiqsaiḷiraġniaqpagich imiġmik?

english: “No one can withhold the water for these people to be baptized, who have received the Holy Spirit just as we did, can he?”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter piraksriiŋaruq paptaiqsautquvlugich atqagun Jesus Christ. Tavrani apiġiŋagaat uvliuqtuallaquvlugu piqatigilutiŋ.

english: So he gave orders to have them baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for several days.
Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles too had accepted the word of God.
inupiaq: Tavra tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat, aniqatiillu iluqaani Judea-miittuat, tusaaŋarut Jew-guŋitchuattauq ukpiliġñivḷugich uqaluanik God-im.

english: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers took issue with him,
inupiaq: Tavra Peter Jerusalem-muŋman, pisaaŋaŋagaat Jew-guruat isumaqaqtuat Jew-guŋitchuat ukpiqtuat nalunaiñŋutchigaksrauvlugich timimikkun,

english: saying, “You went to uncircumcised men and shared a meal with them.”
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, Summan tuyuġmiaġuŋavich Jew-guŋitchuat aimaaġvianni niġiqatigivlugiḷḷu?

english: But Peter began and explained it to them point by point, saying,
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m quliaqtuaġutiŋagai supayauranik piruanik isuaniñqaŋa.

english: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision, an object something like a large sheet descending, being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came to me.
inupiaq: Iniqpaŋmi Joppa-mi aŋaiyyuuŋaruŋa, aasii qiñiqtuuraaqłuŋa. Atqaqtuamik ukił̣haaqpaktun niŋitauŋaruq qiḷaŋmiñ sisamatigun kaŋiġalluŋisigun, aasii nutqaqłuni saniqqamnun.

english: As I stared I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and wild birds.
inupiaq: Takunnaakkiutikapku tautuŋaruŋa niġrutinik niġrułłuŋniglu paamġuqtuaniglu tiŋmianiglu.

english: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter; slaughter and eat!’
inupiaq: Aasii tusaaŋaruŋa nipimik uqallaktuamik uvamnun, Peter makittin. Tuqutchiḷutin niġġiiñ.

english: But I said, ‘Certainly not, Lord, for nothing defiled or ritually unclean has ever entered my mouth!’
inupiaq: Tavra kiuŋagiga, Naagga Ataniiq, qanuq suuramikunnii salumaitchuamik niqimik pitqurat niġitquŋisaŋannik uqummirriŋaitchuŋa.

english: But the voice replied a second time from heaven, ‘What God has made clean, you must not consider ritually unclean!’
inupiaq: Tavra nipi uqallatqiŋaruq qiḷaŋmiñ, Suna God-im salummaanikkaŋa, isummatiginagu salumaitchuagulugu.

english: This happened three times, and then everything was pulled up to heaven again.
inupiaq: Taamna piŋaruq piŋasuiqsuaqłuni, aasii nuqitautqikł̣uni qiḷaŋmun.

english: At that very moment, three men sent to me from Caesarea approached the house where we were staying.
inupiaq: Tavrauvvaa aŋutit piŋasut tikiñŋarut iglumun irvimñun, tilirauruat uvamnun Caesarea-miñ.

english: The Spirit told me to accompany them without hesitation. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s house.
inupiaq: Tavra Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallautiŋagaaŋa aullaqatigitquvlugich taqiŋaŋaiġḷuŋa. Ukua uvva itchaksrat aniqatiit aullaqasiŋagaanŋa Caesarea-mun, aasii iluqata isiqłuta igluanun Cornelius.

english: He informed us how he had seen an angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter,
inupiaq: Aasii Cornelius quliaqtuaġutiŋagaatigut tautuŋnivḷuni isaġuliŋmik makitaruamik iglumiñi suli uqallautivlugu, Tilisiḷutin Joppa-mun qaitquuŋ Simon taiguutiqaqtuaq Peter-mik.

english: who will speak a message to you by which you and your entire household will be saved.’
inupiaq: Ilaan quliaqtuaġutiniaġaatin uqaluŋmik annautigiyumiñakkaġnik, iliviḷḷu igluqatitillu.

english: Then as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them just as he did on us at the beginning.
inupiaq: Uqaqsaġataaqsimmiuŋalu Ilitqusiġiksuam atqaġvigiŋagai uvaptiktupiaġataq isagutisaami.

english: And I remembered the word of the Lord, as he used to say, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
inupiaq: Aasii itqaŋagitka uqaluŋi Atanġum uqallaŋaruaq, John paptaiġutiqaŋaruq imiġmik, aglaan Ilitqusiġiksuaq iḷirauniaqtuq iḷuvsiññun.

english: Therefore if God gave them the same gift as he also gave us after believing in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to hinder God?”
inupiaq: Tavraasii nalupqinaitchuq God-im aitchuŋammigai Jew-guŋitchuat Ilitqusiġiksuamik aitchuunmisun uvaptiŋnun ukpiqtuaġuqapta Ataniġmun Jesus Christ-mun, Suuvik uvaŋa piñaiḷutaġumiñaġlugu God?

english: When they heard this, they ceased their objections and praised God, saying, “So then, God has granted the repentance that leads to life even to the Gentiles.”
inupiaq: Taamna tusaakamirruŋ pisaaŋaŋaiŋagaat, aasii nanġaqługu God uqaqłutiŋ, Tavraptauq Jew-guŋitchuat God-im isumalitqigviksraqaqtinŋagai iñuutquvlugich isuitchuamun.

english: Now those who had been scattered because of the persecution that took place over Stephen went as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the message to no one but Jews.
inupiaq: Tavra ukpiqtuat siamitauŋarut pisigivlugu nagliksaaqtitauniq isagutiruaq Stephen-qaŋa tuqutaumman. Iḷaŋich aullaŋarut ayuuqtigivlutiŋ Phoenicia-mun Cyprus-mullu Antioch-mullu, quliaqtuaġivlugich tusaayugaaġiksuat Jew-nun kisiiññun.

english: But there were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene among them who came to Antioch and began to speak to the Greeks too, proclaiming the good news of the Lord Jesus.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq iḷaŋich ukpiqtuat aŋutit Cyprus-miñ Cyrene-miḷḷu Antioch-muŋarut, aasii quliaqtuaġutivlugich Jew-guŋitchuat, alġaqsruutigivlugich tusaayugaaġiksuat Atanikun Jesus-kun.

english: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.
inupiaq: Suli Atanġum suaŋŋataata ikayuŋagai, suli iñugiapiaġataqtuat ukpiliŋarut Ataniġmun.

english: A report about them came to the attention of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
inupiaq: Tusaayugaat taavrumuuna tusaaŋagaich aŋaiyyuliqiruat Jerusalem-mi, aasii tiliŋagaat Barnabas Antioch-mun.

english: When he came and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with devoted hearts,
inupiaq: Tikiññami iḷitchuġikami God-im quviasaaġniġmagich iñuich, ilaa quyatchaŋaruq, suli qapiŋaisaaŋagai iluqaisa ukpiġnaqtuagutquvlugich iḷumullu illutiŋ Ataniġmun iḷumiŋniñ.

english: because he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and a significant number of people were brought to the Lord.
inupiaq: Qanuq Barnabas iñulluatauŋaruq, aŋalatiłłuni Ilitqusiġiksuamun, ukpiqtuagupiaqłuniḷu. Suli iñugiaktuat iñuich ukpiliqsitauŋarut Ataniġmun.

english: Then Barnabas departed for Tarsus to look for Saul,
inupiaq: Tavraasii Barnabas aullaŋaruq Tarsus-mun ivaġiaqługu Saul.

english: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught a significant number of people. Now it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.
inupiaq: Aasii paqitanikamiuŋ, ilaan qaġġisiŋagaa Antioch-mun. Tavra ukiuq naalġataqługu iliŋikta piqatigiŋagaich aŋaiyyuliqiruat, iḷisautivlugiḷḷu iñusalaich. Aasii Antioch-mi ukpiqtuat tairauqqaaŋarut Christ-miunik.

english: At that time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkunani uvluni iḷaŋich uqaqtiŋisa God-im ullautiŋarut Jerusalem-miñ Antioch-mun.

english: One of them, named Agabus, got up and predicted by the Spirit that a severe famine was about to come over the whole inhabited world. (This took place during the reign of Claudius.)
inupiaq: Aasii iḷaŋat atiqaqtuaq Agabus-mik makiłłuni aŋalałługu Ilitqusiġiksuam uqaŋaruq piyumaaqtuamik kamanaqtuaq kaaksiunaq piñiaġnivḷugu nunami iluqaani. Taamna nalaunŋaruq Claudius umialgumman Rome-mi.

english: So the disciples, each in accordance with his financial ability, decided to send relief to the brothers living in Judea.
inupiaq: Tavra ukpiqtuat sivunniiŋarut iñupayaaq aitchuiyumiñaqtilaamisun tuyuquvlugu ikayuutiksranik aniqatiinun iñuuruanun Judea-mi.

english: They did so, sending their financial aid to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.
inupiaq: Aasii tainna piŋarut, tuyuġivlugich maniich aŋaiyyuliqiruat umialiŋnaŋiññun Barnabas-kullu Saul-kullu.

english: About that time King Herod laid hands on some from the church to harm them.
inupiaq: Tavraptauq tainnaiḷivalliġman umialgum Herod nagliksaaqtirraqsiŋagai iḷaŋich aŋaiyyuliqiruat.

english: He had James, the brother of John, executed with a sword.
inupiaq: Ilaan tuqutinŋagaa savikpaŋmik James aniqataa John.

english: When he saw that this pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter too. (This took place during the feast of Unleavened Bread.)
inupiaq: Aasii iḷitchuġikami iviġagniqamigich Jews nagliksaaqtitchivsaaŋaruq, aasii Peter tigutaaqtiłługu. Taamna piŋaruq uvluŋiñi itqautim Qulaurrusiqiviŋmun.

english: When he had seized him, he put him in prison, handing him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him. Herod planned to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.
inupiaq: Tiguanikamirruŋ Peter iḷiŋagaat tigutaaġviŋmun, aasii aitchuutigivlugu qaunagitquvlugu akimiaq atautchimun aŋuyaktinun. Herod sivunniŋaruq isivġiġukługu Peter takkuanni Jew-guruat Qulaurrusiqianikpata.

english: So Peter was kept in prison, but those in the church were earnestly praying to God for him.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter tigutaaġviŋmiinŋaruq, aglaattauq aŋaiyyuliqiruat aŋaiyyutiŋammigaat God-mun qapiŋaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: On that very night before Herod was going to bring him out for trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, while guards in front of the door were keeping watch over the prison.
inupiaq: Taavrumani unnuami Herod annisiyumaalliġmagu Peter uvluqpan iñuŋnun, Peter siñiŋaruq akunġaŋni malġuk aŋuyaktik, pituqaqłuni malġuiñik kalimñanik, aasii munaqsrich munaqsriŋarut tigutaaġvium paaqpaŋani.

english: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared, and a light shone in the prison cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, “Get up quickly!” And the chains fell off Peter’s wrists.
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋatchiaq isaġulga Atanġum makinŋaruq tavruŋa, suli qaummaq qaummaġiksiŋaruq tigutaaġviŋmi, aasii isaġulgum saqiñŋagaa Peter tuiqqaŋagun, aasii itiqsaqługu, uqallakłuni, Makittin qilamik. Suli tavrauvvaa kalimñat kataŋarut tayaġniŋiñiñ.

english: The angel said to him, “Fasten your belt and put on your sandals.” Peter did so. Then the angel said to him, “Put on your cloak and follow me.”
inupiaq: Tavra isaġulgum uqallautiŋagaa, Tavsiaġiksaaġiñ aluġusiġḷutillu. Aasii tainna Peter piŋaruq. Isaġulik uqallavsaaŋaruq, Uligaaġiñ, aasii maligluŋa.

english: Peter went out and followed him; he did not realize that what was happening through the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter-m maliŋagaa tigutaaġviŋmiñ, aglaan iḷisimaŋaitchuq taamna savaaġikkaŋa isaġulgum iḷumun itilaaŋanik, aglaan isumaŋaruq siññaktuġasugaluni.

english: After they had passed the first and second guards, they came to the iron gate leading into the city. It opened for them by itself, and they went outside and walked down one narrow street, when at once the angel left him.
inupiaq: Tavra qaaŋianikamisigik sivulliigḷu tugliŋiḷḷu munaqsrich, tikiñŋaruk savił̣hamun upkuaqpaŋmun, anisaġiamun iniqpaŋmun. Taamna upkuaqpak aŋmaŋaruq inmisun, aasii aniŋaruk. Tavraasii pisuaŋaruk apqutitigun, aasii tavraŋŋatchiaq isaġulgum qimaŋagaa Peter.

english: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from everything the Jewish people were expecting to happen.”
inupiaq: Tavra Peter qaurimmaġiksiŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Paŋmapak nalupqisuŋaiqsuŋa Atanġum tiliŋagaa isaġulini, aasii annautivluŋa Herod-gum suaŋŋataaniñ, suli iluqaiññiñ Jew-guruat niġiukkutaanniñ uvapkun.

english: When Peter realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John Mark, where many people had gathered together and were praying.
inupiaq: Isumalaallakkaluaqami aullaŋaruq igluanun Mary-m, aakaŋata John Mark. Tavrani iñugiaktuat kasimaŋarut atautchimi aŋaiyyuvlutiŋ.

english: When he knocked at the door of the outer gate, a slave girl named Rhoda answered.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter tigluktuġman siḷataani upkuam, niviaqsiaq atiqaqtuaq Rhoda-mik kiuriyyaŋaruq.

english: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed she did not open the gate, but ran back in and told them that Peter was standing at the gate.
inupiaq: Iḷisaġikamiuŋ Peter-m nipaa, quviatchakpaił̣ł̣uni upkuiġutigaluaġnagu aqpamik isiŋaruq, aasii uqallautivlugich Peter makitanivḷugu paam siḷataani.

english: But they said to her, “You’ve lost your mind!” But she kept insisting that it was Peter, and they kept saying, “It is his angel!”
inupiaq: Ilaisa uqallautiŋagaat, Kinnaġuqtutin. Aasii ilaa qapiŋaiñŋaruq iḷumun innivḷugu. Ilaisa kiulgitkaat, Isaġulik qaŋma qaunaksriŋa piuq.

english: Now Peter continued knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were greatly astonished.
inupiaq: Tavra Peter tigluktuqtuiññaŋaruq. Kiisaimmaa upkuiġutivaat, aasii tautukkamirruŋ niġiiḷḷaqtauŋarut.

english: He motioned to them with his hand to be quiet and then related how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said, “Tell James and the brothers these things,” and then he left and went to another place.
inupiaq: Tavra urriqavluni argaŋmiñik nipaiquŋagai, aasii quliaqtuaġutiŋagai qanuq Ataniġmun annisisilaamiñik tigutaaġviŋmiñ. Tavra uqallaŋaruq, Quliaqtuaġiyumagiksi taamna James-mun, aniqatiinullu. Tavraniasii ilaa aullaŋaruq allamun inimun.

english: At daybreak there was great consternation among the soldiers over what had become of Peter.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluġmagu piallapiaġataŋarut aŋuyaktit qanuqtilaaŋagun Peter-m.

english: When Herod had searched for him and did not find him, he questioned the guards and commanded that they be led away to execution. Then Herod went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod piraksriiŋaruq ivaqłiatquvlugich Peter-mik, aglaan paqilaiñŋagaat. Tavra ilaan apiqsruqtuqtitqaaqługich munaqsrich, piraksriiŋaruq tuqutquvlugich. Taamna pianiŋman Herod aullaŋaruq Judea-miñ, aasii Caesarea-miitkaqsivḷuni.

english: Now Herod was having an angry quarrel with the people of Tyre and Sidon. So they joined together and presented themselves before him. And after convincing Blastus, the king’s personal assistant, to help them, they asked for peace, because their country’s food supply was provided by the king’s country.
inupiaq: Tavra Herod qinnautipiaġataŋagai iñuich Tyre-miḷu Sidon-miḷu ittuat. Aasii ilaisa ullaŋagaat Herod piqatigiikł̣utiŋ. Iḷaaluksraqtaaġiqqaaqługu Blastus, Umialgum igluqpaŋata qaunaksriŋa, ullaŋagaat Herod apiqsrisukłutiŋ aŋuyautairrunmik, qanuq ilaisa nunaŋat niqiksraqtuġviqaqłuni umialgum nunaŋaniñ.

english: On a day determined in advance, Herod put on his royal robes, sat down on the judgment seat, and made a speech to them.
inupiaq: Nalunaiqsauŋaruami uvlumi Herod atiŋagai umialguniġmigun annuġaani, aquvinŋaruq umialgum aquppiutaŋiññun, aasii uqaqłuni ilaiññun.

english: But the crowd began to shout, “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich nipaallaŋarut, Nipaa God-im. Iñugruiññaq uqaŋitchuq.

english: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck Herod down because he did not give the glory to God, and he was eaten by worms and died.
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋatchiaq isaġulgata Atanġum tuqupkaŋagaa Herod, qanuq kamanaqsiḷiŋaitkaa God. Tavra ilaa qupilġunikłuni iḷumiñi tuquŋaruq.

english: But the word of God kept on increasing and multiplying.
inupiaq: Aglaan God-im uqalua nauŋaruq, siamiłłuniḷu.

english: So Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem when they had completed their mission, bringing along with them John Mark.
inupiaq: Tavra Barnabas-lu Saul-lu naatchikamiŋ piraksraunmiŋnik, utiŋaruk Jerusalem-miñ, piqatigivlugu John Mark.

english: Now there were these prophets and teachers in the church at Antioch: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius the Cyrenian, Manaen (a close friend of Herod the tetrarch from childhood) and Saul.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqiruani Antioch-mi, iḷaŋich uqaqtiŋi God-im inŋarut, iḷisaurriḷḷu, Barnabas-lu Simeon-lu taiguutiqaqtuaq Taaqsipaŋmik, Lucius-lu Cyrene-miu, Manaen-lu iñuguqatiqaŋaruaq Herod-mik kavanauruamik, Saul-lu.

english: While they were serving the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyupkaqtillugich Ataniġmun niġiḷaił̣ł̣utiŋ, Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallautiŋagai, Ilaaguaqsisiŋa Barnabas-miglu Saul-miglu savaaksramun ququaqtauviaŋnun uvamniñ.

english: Then, after they had fasted and prayed and placed their hands on them, they sent them off.
inupiaq: Tavra niġiḷaitqaaqłutiŋ aŋaiyyuanikamiglu, iḷiŋagaich argatiŋ iliŋiŋnun aasii aullaqtiłługik.

english: So Barnabas and Saul, sent out by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
inupiaq: Tavra Barnabas-lu Saul-lu tilimmatik Ilitqusiġiksuam aullaŋaruk Seleucia-mun, aasii tavraŋŋa tiŋilġaqsiqł̣utiŋ qikiqtamun Cyprus-mun.

english: When they arrived in Salamis, they began to proclaim the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. (Now they also had John as their assistant.)
inupiaq: Tikiññamik Salamis-mun, alġaqsruutigiŋagaat God-im uqalua aŋaiyyuviŋiññi Jew-guruat. Suli John Mark-mik ikayuqtiqaŋaruk.

english: When they had crossed over the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a magician, a Jewish false prophet named Bar-Jesus,
inupiaq: Ikaaŋagaat iluqaan qikiqtaq Paphos-munaglaan. Tavrani kasuŋagaat aŋatkuqatiqaqtuaq Bar-Jesus-mik, Jew-guvluni uqaqtauniruaq God-mun.

english: who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. The proconsul summoned Barnabas and Saul and wanted to hear the word of God.
inupiaq: Ilaa avilaitqatauŋaruq kavanauruamun qikiqtami Sergius Paulus-mun, puqiksuaguruamun. Kavanauruaq aiyugaaqłiŋaruq Barnabas-mik Saul-miglu tusaasukłuni uqaluanik God-im.

english: But the magician Elymas (for that is the way his name is translated) opposed them, trying to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋatkum Elymas, Greek-tun taigutaa, akiḷḷiḷiqsuŋagik, ukpiqtaiḷivḷugu kavanauruaq.

english: But Saul (also known as Paul), filled with the Holy Spirit, stared straight at him
inupiaq: Tavra Saul-gum, taggisiqaġmiruaptauq Paul-mik, Ilitqusiġiksuam aŋalałługu takunnaakkiutiŋagaa aŋatkuq,

english: and said, “You who are full of all deceit and all wrongdoing, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness – will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord?
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivlugu, Ilivich iġñiŋa Tuunġaum, uumikłiqsuatiin iluqaanik nakuuruamik, ataramik sagluqivlugich iñuich ilivich pisaasuġmiaġutiŋnik, suli ataramik sagluġuqtinniatakługich Atanġum iḷumun ittuat uqaluŋi.

english: Now look, the hand of the Lord is against you, and you will be blind, unable to see the sun for a time!” Immediately mistiness and darkness came over him, and he went around seeking people to lead him by the hand.
inupiaq: Aasii uvva paŋmapak Atanġum tatavsaġniaġaatin, ayauniaqtutin, suli tautulaisaallagniaġiñ qaummaq. Tavraŋŋatchiaq niptaniġluksisiŋagaa, suli taaqsisiŋagaa, aasii saptalaaqsiŋaruq ivaqłiavluni tasiuqtiksramiñik.

english: Then when the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, because he was greatly astounded at the teaching about the Lord.
inupiaq: Tavrani kavanauruaq ukpiliŋaruq, tautukamiuŋ taamna piruaq, qanuq kamanniupiaġataŋaruq iḷisaurrutinik Atanikun.

english: Then Paul and his companions put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia, but John left them and returned to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul piqatiniḷu tiŋinnaaŋarut Paphos-miñ, aasii tikił̣ł̣utiŋ Perga-mun Pamphylia-miittuamun. Tavrani John Mark-gum qimaŋagik aasii utiqłuni Jerusalem-mun.

english: Moving on from Perga, they arrived at Pisidian Antioch, and on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.
inupiaq: Tavra igliġiññaŋarut Perga-miñ, aasii tikił̣ł̣utiŋ Antioch-mun Pisidia-miittuamun. Aasii Jew-guruat Savairvianni, aŋaiyyuliaqamiŋ Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianni, aquptaaŋaruk.

english: After the reading from the law and the prophets, the leaders of the synagogue sent them a message, saying, “Brothers, if you have any message of exhortation for the people, speak it.”
inupiaq: Taiguaganiŋmata aglaaŋiñiñ Moses, uqaqtiŋisalu God-im, umialiŋnaŋi aŋaiyyuvium uqallaurriŋarut, Aniqatiit, uqaluksraqaġuvsi siḷġiqsuutinik iñuŋnun, uqaġitchi.

english: So Paul stood up, gestured with his hand and said,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul makinŋaruq, aasii urriqavluni argaŋmiñik uqarraqsiŋaruq, Israel-guqatiimaaŋ, iluqasiḷu Jew-guŋitchuasii, uvani qiksiksrautiqaqtuasii God-mun, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: “Men of Israel, and you Gentiles who fear God, listen:
inupiaq: God-iŋata ukua iñuich Israel-guruat piksraqtaaġiŋagai maŋŋuuvut, aasii kamanaqsipkaqługich iñuummata tuyuġmiaguvlutiŋ Egypt-mi. God-im annisiŋagai Egypt-miñ kamanaqtuakun suaŋŋanmigun.

english: The God of this people Israel chose our ancestors and made the people great during their stay as foreigners in the country of Egypt, and with uplifted arm he led them out of it.
inupiaq: Aasii malġukipiani ukiuni iglaummata nunagluktuami, ilaan igḷutuŋagai.

english: For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan suksraunġianikamigich tallimat malġuk nunauruat Canaan-mi, ilaan aitchuutigiŋagaa nunaŋat iñuŋmiñun.

english: After he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave his people their land as an inheritance.
inupiaq: Isagutivlugu tavraŋŋa 450-mik ukiivḷutiŋ iñuuniŋanun aglaan Samuel uqaqtaa God-im, God nalunaiqsiraġaŋaruq isivġiqsinik atanniqsimaraġaquvlugich Israel.

english: All this took about four hundred fifty years. After this he gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iliŋich apiqsriŋarut umialiqaġukłutiŋ, aasii God-im aitchuŋagai Saul-mik iġñiŋanik Kish, maŋŋuqaqtuamik Benjamin-miñ, umialigitquvlugu malġukipiani ukiuni.

english: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.
inupiaq: God-im piiganikamiuŋ Saul, David umialliutiŋagaa iliŋiññun. Innauvva God-im uqallausiġiŋagaa ilaa, Iḷitchuġigiga David iġñiŋa Jesse-m iviġaumanaqtuaguvlugu uvamnun, piyumiñaqłuni iluqaiññik pitqutimnik ilaanun.

english: After removing him, God raised up David their king. He testified about him: ‘I have found David the son of Jesse to be a man after my heart, who will accomplish everything I want him to do.’
inupiaq: Iḷaŋat David kiŋuniŋisa, Jesus, God-im unniqsuqłiisigiŋagaa annaurrigitquvlugu Israel-guruanun.

english: From the descendants of this man God brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus, just as he promised.
inupiaq: Qaiŋaiñŋaan Jesus, John alġaqsruiŋaruq iñupayaanun Israel-nun isumalitqiksuksraunivḷugich, aasii paptaiqsaulutiŋ.

english: Before Jesus arrived, John had proclaimed a baptism for repentance to all the people of Israel.
inupiaq: Aasii John naatchiyasikami savaamiñik, ilaa uqallaŋaruq iñuŋnun, Kiunasugaluŋa isummatigivisiŋa? Taamnauŋitchuŋa niġiugikkaqsi. Aglaan iñuk imma qairuq aqupkun, aluġutik-unnii isigaŋisa nalliummatiŋitchuŋa siŋiiġumiñaġlugik.

english: But while John was completing his mission, he said repeatedly, ‘What do you think I am? I am not he. But look, one is coming after me. I am not worthy to untie the sandals on his feet!’
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, kiŋunġuruasii Abraham-mun, iluqasiḷu Jew-guŋitchuat qiksiksraqtuat God-mik, uvaptiŋnun tilirauŋaruq tusaayugaaġiksuaq annautauyumiñaqtuaq.

english: Brothers, descendants of Abraham’s family, and those Gentiles among you who fear God, the message of this salvation has been sent to us.
inupiaq: Taipkua iñuuruat Jerusalem-mi umialiŋnaŋisalu, akuqtuŋił̣ł̣ugu annaurrigitilaaŋanik, kaŋiqsiŋił̣ł̣ugiḷḷu uqaluŋich uqaqtiŋisa God-im, taiguaġuukkaŋich Savaiññipayaaŋiññi, nalautinŋagaich God-im uqaqtiŋisa uqaluŋich suksraunġiqł̣ugu Jesus.

english: For the people who live in Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize him, and they fulfilled the sayings of the prophets that are read every Sabbath by condemning him.
inupiaq: Patchisiksraitkaluaŋŋaġmiŋ sumik-unni ilaanun tuqurrutauyumiñaqtuamik, apiġiŋagaat Pilate tuqutitquvlugu.

english: Though they found no basis for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
inupiaq: Tavraasii nalautitanikamisigik iluqaisa Bible uqaluŋich ilaagun, atqaŋagaat aŋarrauramiñ, aasii iḷuviqługu iḷuvviviŋmun.

english: When they had accomplished everything that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb.
inupiaq: Tavra God-im aŋipkaŋagaa tuqqunmiñ.

english: But God raised him from the dead,
inupiaq: Aasii uvluni iñugiaktuani taamna Jesus tautuktitqataŋaruq tamatkunuŋa qaiqatauŋaruanun inmiñun Galilee-miñ Jerusalem-mun. Aasii tamatkua iñuich tautuktuat ilaanik quliaqtuaŋarut Israel-guruanun.

english: and for many days he appeared to those who had accompanied him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These are now his witnesses to the people.
inupiaq: Aasii tusaayugaaġiksuanik qaġġirrigivsi tamatkua God-im unniqsuqłiisigiŋakkaŋich maŋŋuuptiŋnun piñiaġnivḷugich,

english: And we proclaim to you the good news about the promise to our ancestors,
inupiaq: pianiŋagai uvaptiŋnun kiŋunġuruanun, aŋipkaqługu Jesus. Aglausimaruq second Psalm-mi inna, “Ilivich Iġñiġigikpiñ. Uvlupak Aapagiliutigiŋma.”

english: that this promise God has fulfilled to us, their children, by raising Jesus, as also it is written in the second psalm, ‘You are my Son; today I have fathered you.’
inupiaq: Qanuq God unniqsuqłiiŋaruq aŋipkaġniaġnivḷugu tuqutqikkumiñaiġḷugu. Una uqaluuruq Bible-ni inna, “Pisiniaġikpiñ aliuġnaqtuamik unniqsuqłiisigiŋaramnik David-mun.”

english: But regarding the fact that he has raised Jesus from the dead, never again to be in a state of decay, God has spoken in this way: ‘I will give you the holy and trustworthy promises made to David.’
inupiaq: Allamisuli Psalm-mi God-im kaŋiqsiñaqsiḷaavsaaŋagaa uqallakłuni, “God-im aupkaġniaŋitkaa Ilaan Piḷuutaitchuani.”

english: Therefore he also says in another psalm, ‘You will not permit your Holy One to experience decay.’
inupiaq: Qanuq David tuquŋaruq, savaaġianikamiuŋ piraksriutaa God-im ilaan iñuuqanmiñi, aasii iḷuviqatauvluni maŋŋuumiñun, aasii timaa auvluni.

english: For David, after he had served God’s purpose in his own generation, died, was buried with his ancestors, and experienced decay,
inupiaq: Aglaan taamna iñuk Jesus God-im aŋipkaŋaraa tuqqunmiñ, auŋaitchuq timaa.

english: but the one whom God raised up did not experience decay.
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, iluqasi iḷisimaruksraupiaqtusi, taavrumuuna Jesus-kun God-im suliqutigiŋaiġumiñaġai piḷuutisi itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich.

english: Therefore let it be known to you, brothers, that through this one forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
inupiaq: Aasii kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq ilaanun annaktitauruq piḷuutipayauramiñ, aasii nalaunŋarualirauvluni. Tainna iñuk iḷiyumiñaitchuq kamagilugich pitqurat aitchuutauŋaruat Moses-kun.

english: and by this one everyone who believes is justified from everything from which the law of Moses could not justify you.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchiasiiñ, iḷaanni uqaluŋich uqaqtiŋisa God-im nalautpiaqtut ilivsiññun, uqaqtut inna,

english: Watch out, then, that what is spoken about by the prophets does not happen to you:
inupiaq: Savaitqiŋmata iluqakavsaŋmiŋ iniqpaum iñuŋi qaiŋarut naalagiaqłutiŋ uqaluanik God-im.

english: ‘Look, you scoffers; be amazed and perish!
inupiaq: Tavrali Jew-guruat tautukamisigik iñusalaich, killuqsraliŋarut, aasii qapiqtaqługich sut uqautigikkaŋi Paul-gum, suli uqamaqłuutivlugu.

english: For I am doing a work in your days,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Barnabas-lu uqaŋaruk iqsiŋaiqł̣utik, uqaqłutik, God-im uqalua uqautigiraksraupiaqtuq ilivsi sivulliġilusi Jews. Aasii ayyakavsiuŋ, sivunniqsusi ilivsiññik iñuusuŋił̣ł̣usi isuitchuamun. Iḷisimatitchi. Aullaġniaqtuguk Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: a work you would never believe, even if someone tells you.’”
inupiaq: Qanuq Atanġum piraksriŋagaatigut Bible-ni, uqaqłuni,

english: As Paul and Barnabas were going out, the people were urging them to speak about these things on the next Sabbath.
inupiaq: Tavra uqalua Atanġum siaminŋaruq iluqaiññun nunaaqqiñun tamaaniittuanun.

english: When the meeting of the synagogue had broken up, many of the Jews and God-fearing proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who were speaking with them and were persuading them to continue in the grace of God.
inupiaq: Tavrali Jew-guruat maqulluksaiŋarut Jew-guŋitchuanik aġnanik qaukłiuruaniglu aŋutinik iniqpaŋmi ukpiqtuanik God-mun. Ilaisa nagliksaaqtinniarraqsiŋagaich Paul-lu Barnabas-lu, aasii uŋułługik nunaaqqimiŋniñ.

english: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city assembled together to hear the word of the Lord.
inupiaq: Tavra piiyaŋagaak nunam avyua isigagmiŋniñ kiliktuutausaqługu ilaiññun ayyaiñiŋatigun, aasii aullaqłutiŋ Iconium-mun.

english: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, and they began to contradict what Paul was saying by reviling him.
inupiaq: Tavra ukpiqtuat Antioch-mi quviasupiaġataŋarut aŋalatiłłutiglu Ilitqusiġiksuamun.

english: Both Paul and Barnabas replied courageously, “It was necessary to speak the word of God to you first. Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we are turning to the Gentiles.
For this is what the Lord has commanded us: ‘I have appointed you to be a light for the Gentiles, to bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”
When the Gentiles heard this, they began to rejoice and praise the word of the Lord, and all who had been appointed for eternal life believed.
So the word of the Lord was spreading through the entire region.
But the Jews incited the God-fearing women of high social standing and the prominent men of the city, stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their region.
So after they shook the dust off their feet in protest against them, they went to Iconium.
And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
The same thing happened in Iconium when Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a large group of both Jews and Greeks believed.
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli piŋammiuq Iconium-mi. Paul-lu Barnabas-lu Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviannun aŋaiyyuliaŋaruk, aasii uqaurrivḷutik iñuŋnik ukpillasivḷugich iñugiapiaġataqtuat Jew-guruallu Jew-guŋitchuallu.

english: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
inupiaq: Aglaan ukpiŋitchuat Jew-guruat piallaktinŋagaich Jew-guŋitchuat, suli isumanŋutchautiqallasivḷugich aniqatiinun.

english: So they stayed there for a considerable time, speaking out courageously for the Lord, who testified to the message of his grace, granting miraculous signs and wonders to be performed through their hands.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋik nayuutiŋaruk sivisuruamik. Alġaqsruutigiŋagaak Ataniq iqsisaił̣ł̣utiŋ, ukpiġnaqsiḷiġiruaq uqaluŋmiŋnik annautikun, iḷumun itilaaŋanik suaŋŋasiqługik aliuġnaqtuanik piyumiñaqsivḷugik.

english: But the population of the city was divided; some sided with the Jews, and some with the apostles.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuŋi iniqpaum malġuigunŋarut, iḷaŋich iḷaalliutivlutiŋ Jew-guruanun, aasiiḷi iḷaŋich tiliraunikun iḷitchitquranun.

english: When both the Gentiles and the Jews (together with their rulers) made an attempt to mistreat them and stone them,
inupiaq: Tavra qanuqsaġummanmik aŋalatchisaġmata iluqatiŋ Jew-guŋitchuallu Jew-guruallu, piqatigivlugich umialiŋnatiŋ, sivunniŋarut piaqłuqtaġukługich tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat uyaġaŋniglu miḷḷuuġlugich.

english: Paul and Barnabas learned about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding region.
inupiaq: Tilirauruak iḷitchuġiŋagaak taamna, aasii pigruqłutik Lystra-mun Derbe-mullu, iniqpaaŋnun Lycaonia-miittuaŋnun, avataaŋnullu nunaaqqiñun.

english: There they continued to proclaim the good news.
inupiaq: Aasii tamatkunani nunaaqqiñi alġaqsruutigivlugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq.

english: In Lystra sat a man who could not use his feet, lame from birth, who had never walked.
inupiaq: Tavra Lystra-mi iñuqaġniqsuq pisualaitchuamik, pisualaiñŋaniqsuq anikamiqaŋa.

english: This man was listening to Paul as he was speaking. When Paul stared intently at him and saw he had faith to be healed,
inupiaq: Ilaa naalaġniŋaruq Paul-mun uqaqtuamun. Aasiivsauq Paul-gum qiñipiaġataqługu, iḷitchuġivlugu ukpiġutiqaqtilaaŋa iłuaqsirauyumiñaqłuni,

english: he said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And the man leaped up and began walking.
inupiaq: uqallautiŋagaa nipatusivḷuni, Makittin Ilaa maksriŋaruq aasii pisuarraqsivḷuni.

english: So when the crowds saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in human form!”
inupiaq: Tavrali iñusalaich tautukamirruŋ Paul-gum savaaŋa, nipiriŋ aninŋagaat uqaqłutiŋ Lycaonia-ġmiutun, Atqaqigaatigut god-ipta iḷivḷutiŋ iñuktun.

english: They began to call Barnabas Zeus and Paul Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.
inupiaq: Barnabas atchiŋagaat Zeus-mik, aasiiḷi Paul atchiqł̣ugu Hermes-mik pisigivlugu uqałhamaaġniŋa.

english: The priest of the temple of Zeus, located just outside the city, brought bulls and garlands to the city gates; he and the crowds wanted to offer sacrifices to them.
inupiaq: Tavra god Zeus-gum aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋa, aŋaiyyuviat sivuġaani iniqpaum iłłuni, qaġġirriŋaruq immuliviich aŋusalluŋiññik nautchianiglu paaqpaŋiñun, aasii ilaa iñuiḷḷu aitchuisuaqsivḷutiŋ ikipkautinik tiliraunikun iḷitchitquraŋnun.

english: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about it, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, shouting,
inupiaq: Tavrali Barnabas-lu Paul-lu tusaakamitku taamna aliktuŋagaich annuġaatiŋ, aasii upaktuutivlutiŋ akunġannun iñusalaich nipimikkun,

english: “Men, why are you doing these things? We too are men, with human natures just like you! We are proclaiming the good news to you, so that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and everything that is in them.
inupiaq: Aŋutiit, summan tainna pivisi? Uvaguktauq uvva aŋutik iñugruiññaak irrusiqaqtuak ilivsisuttauq. Aasii maaniittugut alġaqsruutigisukługu tusaayugaaġiksuaq, mumiquvlusi tamatkunaŋŋa taŋiġitchuaniñ suniñ, iñuuruamun God-mun savaŋaruamun qiḷaŋmiglu nunamiglu taġiumiglu imaġikkaŋiñiglu.

english: In past generations he allowed all the nations to go their own ways,
inupiaq: Qaaŋianiŋaruani kiŋuniġiiñi God-im iḷatchiŋagai iñupayaurat iñuupkaqługich ilaisa sivuniġmikkun.

english: yet he did not leave himself without a witness by doing good, by giving you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying you with food and your hearts with joy.”
inupiaq: Aglaattauq inmiñik iḷisimanaqsisuummiuq nakuuruatigun savaamigun, aitchuqłusi sialuŋmik qiḷaŋmiñ niqiksraniglu nauruanik piviksrakun, niqaiḷḷisaaŋiḷḷusi quviasuquvlusi.

english: Even by saying these things, they scarcely persuaded the crowds not to offer sacrifice to them.
inupiaq: Tamatkuniŋa uqaluŋnik Barnabas-lu Paul-lu qapiqtipqauraŋagaich iñuich aitchuiñiksraŋanniñ ikipkautinik inmiŋnun.

english: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and after winning the crowds over, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, presuming him to be dead.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat qaiŋarut Antioch-miñ Pysidia-miittuamiñ Iconia-miḷḷu, aasii maliksuktitchivḷutiŋ iñuŋnik, uyaġaŋnik miḷuqtuŋagaat Paul, aasii kaliksraqługu annisivlugu iniqpaŋmiñ, isumavlutiŋ tuqunivḷugu.

english: But after the disciples had surrounded him, he got up and went back into the city. On the next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchitqurat iḷḷuaġutimmanni, Paul makinŋaruq, aasii utiqłutiŋ iniqpaŋmun, aasii uvlaakumman ilaalu Barnabas-lu aullaŋaruk Derbe-mun.

english: After they had proclaimed the good news in that city and made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, to Iconium, and to Antioch.
inupiaq: Paul-lu Barnabas-lu alġaqsruiŋaruk tusaayugaaġiksuanik Derbe-mi, aasii iñugiaktuat ukpiliŋarut. Tavra utiŋaruk Lystra-mun Iconia-mullu Antioch-mullu Pysidia-miittuamun,

english: They strengthened the souls of the disciples and encouraged them to continue in the faith, saying, “We must enter the kingdom of God through many persecutions.”
inupiaq: iliŋikta suaŋasiḷaaŋagaich ukpiqtuat ukpiġutiŋich, qapiŋaisaaqługich kiikaa ukpiqsimaaquvlugich God-mun, uqautivlugich inna, Uvagut nalautchiruksraupiaqtugut iñugiaktuanik iłuiḷḷiuġutinik isiġumiñaqsisugluta God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: When they had appointed elders for them in the various churches, with prayer and fasting they entrusted them to the protection of the Lord in whom they had believed.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqiruallaani umialiŋnaksrallaaŋagaich, suli aŋaiyyuuqqaaqłutiŋ niġiḷaił̣ł̣utiŋ, qiññuaġutiŋagaich Ataniġmun ukpiġivigiŋakkaŋannun qaunagitquvlugich.

english: Then they passed through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Barnabas-lu iglauvlutik nunaaqqisigun Pysidia-mi tikiñŋaruk Pamphylia-mun.

english: and when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
inupiaq: Tavra alġaqsruutigianikamitku tusaayugaaġiksuaq Perga-mi, aullaŋaruk Attalia-mun.

english: From there they sailed back to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work they had now completed.
inupiaq: Aasii tavraŋŋa tiŋinnaaqłutiŋ utiŋarut Antioch-mun aullaġataġviŋmiŋnun. Tavraŋŋa aullaŋaruak ukpiqtuat aŋaiyyutianiŋmatik God-mun qaunagitquvlugik. Tavrani naatchiŋaruk iglaukkaġmiŋnik.

english: When they arrived and gathered the church together, they reported all the things God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith for the Gentiles.
inupiaq: Aasii tikiññamik Antioch-mun, katinŋagaich aŋaiyyuliqiruat atautchimun, aasii quliaqtuaġutivlugich iluqaiññik God-im ikayuqługik piramikkun, qanuġlu God-mun ukpiġumiñaqsipkaqtilaaŋannik Jew-guŋitchuat.

english: So they spent considerable time with the disciples.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋik nayuutiksraaġiŋaruk piqatigivlugich ukpiqtuat.

english: Now some men came down from Judea and began to teach the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich iḷaŋich qaiŋarut Judea-miñ Antioch-mun, aasii iḷisautirraqsivḷugich aniqatit uqaqłutiŋ, Nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋisuaġuvsi timivsigun nalaullugich pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun annaurrauyumiñaitchusi.

english: When Paul and Barnabas had a major argument and debate with them, the church appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others from among them to go up to meet with the apostles and elders in Jerusalem about this point of disagreement.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Barnabas-lu siimmaqatigivlugich qapiqtaiḷiqatigiŋagaich taavrumuuna. Tavraasii sivunniŋarut Paul-lu Barnabas-lu iḷaŋiḷḷu allat Antioch-miittuat aullaqtuksrivḷugich Jerusalem-mun, tiliraunikun iḷitchitquranun umialiŋnanullu taavrumuuna iḷitchuġiyaqtuġlutiŋ.

english: So they were sent on their way by the church, and as they passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, they were relating at length the conversion of the Gentiles and bringing great joy to all the brothers.
inupiaq: Tavra tilimmatiŋ aŋaiyyuliqiruaŋisa, iglauŋarut Phoenicia-kun Samaria-kullu, quliaqtuaġutivlugich Jew-guŋitchuat ukpiliqsilaaŋannik God-mun, aasii taavruma tusaakkaŋata quviatchaŋagai iluqaisa aniqatit.

english: When they arrived in Jerusalem, they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all the things God had done with them.
inupiaq: Tikiñmata Jerusalem-mun, paġlaŋagaich aŋaiyyuliqiruat tiliraunikullu iḷitchitqurat umialiŋnallu, aasii quliaqtuaŋaruk iluqaiññik God-im ikayuqługik piramiŋnik.

english: But some from the religious party of the Pharisees who had believed stood up and said, “It is necessary to circumcise the Gentiles and to order them to observe the law of Moses.”
inupiaq: Aglaattauq iḷaŋich ukpiqtuat iḷauruat Pharisee-ñun makinŋarut, aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Jew-guŋitchuat ukpiliqsuat nalunaiñŋutchiqsitaksraupiaqtut timimikkun, suli kamagitqulugich pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun.

english: Both the apostles and the elders met together to deliberate about this matter.
inupiaq: Tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat umialiŋnallu katinŋarut atautchimun isummatigisukługu taamna.

english: After there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that some time ago God chose me to preach to the Gentiles so they would hear the message of the gospel and believe.
inupiaq: Tavra uqavaaganisugruŋmata, Peter makinŋaruq, aasii uqallautivlugich, Aniqatiit, iḷisimarusi iŋiḷġaan God-im piksraqtaaġiŋagaaŋa akunnavsiññiñ, alġaqsruitquvluŋa tusaayugaaġiksuanik Jew-guŋitchuanun, tusaalutiŋ ukpiliquvlugich.

english: And God, who knows the heart, has testified to them by giving them the Holy Spirit just as he did to us,
inupiaq: Aasii God iḷisimaruaq iñuich isumaŋiññik, iḷisimanaqsiŋagaa iviġaumatilaani aitchuutigivlugu Ilitqusiġiksuaq Jew-guŋitchuanun, uvaptiŋnuttauq piḷġusiġmisun.

english: and he made no distinction between them and us, cleansing their hearts by faith.
inupiaq: Suli ilaa allakaaġiiksualiŋaitchuq uvaptiŋniglu iliŋiññiglu, ilaan suliqutigiŋaiqł̣ugich itqaumayumiñaiqł̣ugich piḷuutiŋich ukpiliġmata.

english: So now why are you putting God to the test by placing on the neck of the disciples a yoke that neither our ancestors nor we have been able to bear?
inupiaq: Paŋmapak aasii summan uuktuġniaqpisiuŋ God, Jew-guŋitchuat kamaksripkaġniaġlugich pitquranik nallivsaunnii maŋŋuuptali uvagullu kamagilluatapialaisaptiŋnik?

english: On the contrary, we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, in the same way as they are.”
inupiaq: Aglaan ukpiqtugut uvagut annaurrauniaqtilaaptiŋnik nagliktuutiqpaŋagun Atanġum Jesus, tainnatuttauq iliŋich annaurraummiut.

english: The whole group kept quiet and listened to Barnabas and Paul while they explained all the miraculous signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ kasimaruat nipaiñŋarut, naalaktuaqługik Barnabas-lu Paul-lu quliaqtuaqtillugik qanutchisigun aliuġnaqtuatigun ukpiġnaqsiḷiġutitigun God-im savaaŋigun ilimikkun akunġanni Jew-guŋitchuat.

english: After they stopped speaking, James replied, “Brothers, listen to me.
inupiaq: Tavra uqaaniŋmata, James uqallaŋaruq, Aniqatiit, naalaġnisiŋa.

english: Simeon has explained how God first concerned himself to select from among the Gentiles a people for his name.
inupiaq: Simon quliaqtuaŋaruq qanuq God-mun ukpiqtitqaaġnivḷugich Jew-guŋitchuat, ilaaguaqsisaqłuni akunġanniñ iñuksramiñik.

english: The words of the prophets agree with this, as it is written,
inupiaq: Aasii taamna uqaluŋisa uqaqtiŋisa God-im atiqatigiŋagaat, aglausimarut Bible-ni uqaluŋi inna,

english: ‘After this I will return,
inupiaq: Tavra tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat umialiŋnallu iluqaġmiglu aŋaiyyuliqiruat sivunniŋarut piksraġukłutiŋ iñuŋnik iḷamiŋnik, aasii tiliḷugich Antioch-mun piqatigilugik Paul-lu Barnabas-lu. Tavra piksraqtaaġiŋagaich Judas-lu taggisiqaqtuaq Barsabbas-mik, Silas-lu, iññuk isumakkusiaqaġluataqtuak aniqatiniñ.

english: and I will rebuild the fallen tent of David;
inupiaq: Ukuniŋa tuyuutinik tuyuŋarut. Aniqatisi, iluqatiŋ tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat, umialiŋnallu, tuyuqtut paġlanmiŋnik iluqaiññun aniqatinun Jew-guŋitchuanun, iñuuruanun Antioch-mi Syria-miḷu Cylicia-miḷu.

english: I will rebuild its ruins and restore it,
inupiaq: Tusaaŋarugut iñuich iḷaŋiññun, uvaptiŋniñ aullaqtuanun, nalupqitchaktinnivḷusi uqaluanun, uvaptiŋnun qaitchiŋaitkaluaqtillutiŋ tainna pitqutinik.

english: so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord,
inupiaq: Aasiuvva kasimaŋarugut atautchimi, aasii iluqata atisivḷuta piksraŋarugut aŋutinik, aasii aullaqtillugich ilivsiññun, piqatigilugik piviuttaġikkavut Barnabas-lu Paul-lu,

english: namely, all the Gentiles I have called to be my own,’ says the Lord, who makes these things
inupiaq: iññuk anayanniuqtitchiŋaruak iñuggunmiŋnik savautivlugu Ataniqput Jesus Christ.

english: known from long ago.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tiliŋagivut Judas-lu Silas-lu, inmiŋnik uqautiniaġmigaasi tainnatuttauq tuyuutiptiktun.

english: “Therefore I conclude that we should not cause extra difficulty for those among the Gentiles who are turning to God,
inupiaq: Qanuq Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallautiŋagaatigut, uvaguttauq aasii iviġaumagivlugu aitchuġuŋił̣ł̣usi pitquravsaanik siġḷiġnaqtuanik kamaginiaqtuni, ukuniŋałhiñaq piraksriġivsi,

english: but that we should write them a letter telling them to abstain from things defiled by idols and from sexual immorality and from what has been strangled and from blood.
inupiaq: ilivsi niġiñasi niqinik ilaaguaqtauruanik iñuuraqpaŋnun, auktuġnasiḷu, suli niġiñasi niġrutinik auŋich makinŋaitchuanik, allatuġnasiḷu. Ilivsiññik qaunagiguvsi taapkunaŋŋa piḷḷuataġniaqtusi. Kutpaiġivsi.

english: For Moses has had those who proclaim him in every town from ancient times, because he is read aloud in the synagogues every Sabbath.”
inupiaq: Tavra aullaqtitaukamiŋ Antioch-muŋarut, aasii katitanikamisigik ukpiqtuat atautchimun, qaiñŋagaich tuyuutit.

english: Then the apostles and elders, with the whole church, decided to send men chosen from among them, Judas called Barsabbas and Silas, leaders among the brothers, to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas.
inupiaq: Aasii taiguaganiŋmatigik, quviasuŋarut qapiŋaisaaġusiamikkun.

english: They sent this letter with them:
inupiaq: Tavra Judas-lu Silas-lu, iliŋiktauq uqaqtauvlutiŋ God-mun, uqautiŋagaich aniqatit sivisuruamik qapiŋaisaaqługich, suaŋasiḷaaqługiḷḷu ukpiġutaatigun.

english: From the apostles and elders, your brothers, to the Gentile brothers and sisters in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia, greetings!
inupiaq: Tavra tavraniisugruaniŋmaŋnik, aullaqtinŋagaich tutqiunmi aniqatit taamapkunuŋa tiliriŋiññun.

english: Since we have heard that some have gone out from among us with no orders from us and have confused you, upsetting your minds by what they said,
inupiaq: Aglaan Silas sivunniŋaruq tavraniitchukłuni.

english: we have unanimously decided to choose men to send to you along with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Barnabas-lu Antioch-miinŋaruk, iḷisaurrivḷutik piqatigivlugich allat iñugiaktuat alġaqsruutigiŋagaat Atanġum uqalua.

english: who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
inupiaq: Uvliuganikamiŋ, Paul uqallaŋaruq Barnabas-mun, Utaqqiḷavuk takulugich aniqatiit iniqpapayaani alġaqsruivigiŋakkaptiŋni uqaluanik Atanġum, aasii iḷitchuġilugich qanuqtilaaŋannik.

english: Therefore we are sending Judas and Silas who will tell you these things themselves in person.
inupiaq: Tavra Barnabas piqatigisuaqsiŋagaa John Mark maliquvlutik.

english: For it seemed best to the Holy Spirit and to us not to place any greater burden on you than these necessary rules:
inupiaq: Paul isumaniqsuġli iłuałhaaġasugalugu maliŋitpatik, utiqsaŋamman inmiŋniñ Pamphylia-mi naatkaluaqtinnagu alġaqsruiñiqtiŋ.

english: that you abstain from meat that has been sacrificed to idols and from blood and from what has been strangled and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from doing these things, you will do well. Farewell.
inupiaq: Tavra qapiqtaiḷirrapiaŋaruk avanmun isummatillaamiŋnik piqatigiiŋaiqsaallaġmiŋ, Barnabas-li piqasiutiŋagaa Mark, aasii tiŋinnaaqłutiŋ Cyprus-mun.

english: So when they were dismissed, they went down to Antioch, and after gathering the entire group together, they delivered the letter.
inupiaq: Paul-li piksraqtaaġiŋagaa Silas aasii aullaqłutiŋ, aŋaiyyutiqqaaqtillutiŋ aniqatinun, God-mun qaunagitquvlugik.

english: When they read it aloud, the people rejoiced at its encouragement.
inupiaq: Aasii iliŋik iglauŋaruk Syria-kun Cilicia-kullu, aasii Paul suaŋasiḷiŋagai aŋaiyyuliqiruat ukpiġutiŋich.

english: Both Judas and Silas, who were prophets themselves, encouraged and strengthened the brothers with a long speech.
After they had spent some time there, they were sent off in peace by the brothers to those who had sent them.
But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, teaching and proclaiming (along with many others) the word of the Lord.
After some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let’s return and visit the brothers in every town where we proclaimed the word of the Lord to see how they are doing.”
Barnabas wanted to bring John called Mark along with them too,
but Paul insisted that they should not take along this one who had left them in Pamphylia and had not accompanied them in the work.
They had a sharp disagreement, so that they parted company. Barnabas took along Mark and sailed away to Cyprus,
but Paul chose Silas and set out, commended to the grace of the Lord by the brothers and sisters.
He passed through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
He also came to Derbe and to Lystra. A disciple named Timothy was there, the son of a Jewish woman who was a believer, but whose father was a Greek.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-kut tikiñŋarut Derbe-mun Lystra-mullu. Ukpiqtuaq tavraniinŋaruq atiqaqtuaq Timothy-mik, iġñiŋa Jew-guruam aġnam ukpiqtuaguruam, aglaan aapaŋa Greek-guvluni.

english: The brothers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him.
inupiaq: Ilaa uqautigilluataŋagaat iluqatiŋ aniqatit Lystra-mi Aichonia-miittuallu.

english: Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him, and he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places, for they all knew that his father was Greek.
inupiaq: Paul-gum Timothy maliquŋagaa inmigun. Tavra Paul-gum nalunaiñŋutchiŋagaa timaagun Timothy Jew-guqtirrunmik. Taamna piŋagaa pisigivlugich iluqaisa Jew-guruat iñuuruat tamaani iḷisimaruat Timothy-m aapaŋa Jew-guŋisilaaŋanik.

english: As they went through the towns, they passed on the decrees that had been decided on by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the Gentile believers to obey.
inupiaq: Tavra iglaullaġmiŋ iniqpaktigun, aitchuutigiraġaŋagaich sivunniutit ukpiqtuanun inillakkaŋich tiliraunikun iḷitchitqurat umialiŋnallu Jerusalem-miittuat, uqautivlugich kamagitquvlugich tamatkua piraksriutit.

english: So the churches were being strengthened in the faith and were increasing in number every day.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqiruat suaŋasiḷaaqtauŋarut ukpiġunmiŋni, suli iñugiaksisaiññaŋarut uvlutuaġman.

english: They went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the message in the province of Asia.
inupiaq: Tavra kukiḷuŋarut nunaŋigun Phrygia-m Galatia-vlu. Ilitqusiġiksuam alġaqsruitquŋaitkai tusaayugaaġiksuamik nunaaqqiŋiñi Asia-m.

english: When they came to Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them to do this,
inupiaq: Tavra akiŋiqamirruŋ nuna Mysia, iglausaġaluaŋarut nunaaqqiŋiñun Bithynia-m, aasii Jesus Ilitqusiġiksuaŋata pipkaŋaitkai.

english: so they passed through Mysia and went down to Troas.
inupiaq: Tavraasii qaaŋiqł̣ugu Mysia, Troas-muŋarut.

english: A vision appeared to Paul during the night: A Macedonian man was standing there urging him, “Come over to Macedonia and help us!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul qiñiqtuuraaŋaruq unnuami, tautukługu Macedonia-ġmiu makitavluni qaitquuqłiqsuaq inmiñik, uqaqłuni, Qaiḷutin Macedonia-mun ikayuġiaqtigut.

english: After Paul saw the vision, we attempted immediately to go over to Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to proclaim the good news to them.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul qiñiqtuuraaganipqaġman, tavrauvvaa itqanaiyaŋarugut aullaġukłuta Macedonia-mun, sivunniqł̣ugu God-mun ququaġnivḷuta alġaqsruitquvluta tusaayugaaġiksuamik iñuŋnun taamani.

english: We put out to sea from Troas and sailed a straight course to Samothrace, the next day to Neapolis,
inupiaq: Umiaqpagaqłuta aullaŋarugut Troas-miñ, aasii tiŋinnaaqłuta nalimun ikaaqłuta Samothrace-mun, aasii uvlutqiŋman Neapolis-mun.

english: and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of that district of Macedonia, a Roman colony. We stayed in this city for some days.
inupiaq: Aasii tavraŋŋa aullaqłuta nunanmun Philippi-mun, naumaniqsrauruamun iniqpaŋiñi Macedonia-m, Rome-miunik iñuqaqtuaq. Taavrumani iniqpaŋmi uvliuŋarugut.

english: On the Sabbath day we went outside the city gate to the side of the river, where we thought there would be a place of prayer, and we sat down and began to speak to the women who had assembled there.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat Savaiññiŋanni, siḷataanuŋarugut iniqpaum kuugum siñaanun, isumavluta Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuliaġuunasugalugich tavruŋa. Aasii aquptaaqłuta uqaqatigiŋagivut aġnat katittuat tavruŋa.

english: A woman named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira, a God-fearing woman, listened to us. The Lord opened her heart to respond to what Paul was saying.
inupiaq: Iñuich iḷaŋat tusaarikput aġnaq atiqaŋaruq Lydia-mik, iniqpaŋaniñ Thyatira-m, tuniuqqairi suŋauraammaġiksuanik ukił̣haanik, aŋaiyyurauruaq God-mun. Atanġum puttuqsripkaŋagaa akuqtuġumiñaqsivḷugich uqaluŋi Paul.

english: After she and her household were baptized, she urged us, “If you consider me to be a believer in the Lord, come and stay in my house.” And she persuaded us.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaalu igluqatiniḷu paptaiqsauŋarut. Tavrani ilaan aiyugaaŋagaatigut uqaqłuni, Isummatigiguvsiŋa iḷumun ukpiqtuaġuġniḷuŋa Ataniġmun, qaisitchi iglumnun aasii tukkulusi. Tavra kamagiŋagikput.

english: Now as we were going to the place of prayer, a slave girl met us who had a spirit that enabled her to foretell the future by supernatural means. She brought her owners a great profit by fortune-telling.
inupiaq: Iḷaanni aullalgiññapta aŋaiyyuliaġvikaamun paaŋagaatigut kivgam niviaqsiam ilitqusiqł̣uqaġniqsuam nalautchaġuuvluni sunik piyumaaqtuanik. Ilaan pigirini maniññakpautisuunikkaŋi nalautchuġaqłuni.

english: She followed behind Paul and us and kept crying out, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation.”
inupiaq: Ilaan maliġuaŋagaa Paul uvagullu nipałłuni, Uvvaukua aŋutit kivgaŋi kamanaġniqsrauruam God-im uqautigaasi qanuġlusi annallasiñiaqtilaavsiññik.

english: She continued to do this for many days. But Paul became greatly annoyed, and turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!” And it came out of her at once.
inupiaq: Tainna nipanŋaruq uvluni iñugiaktuani. Tavra Paul-gum aġiuvlugu kiŋiaqługu uqallautiŋagaa ilitqusiqł̣uk, Ataniġnaqutaagun Jesus Christ piraksriġikpiñ anitquvlutin ilaaniñ. Tavrauvvaa ilitqusiqł̣uk aniŋaruq ilaaniñ.

english: But when her owners saw their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the authorities.
inupiaq: Tavra pigiriŋisa iḷitchuġikamiŋ maniññagniutigikkaqtiŋ piiġñiġman, tigguġluŋagaich Paul-lu Silas-lu, aasii kaliksraqługik kasimmaviŋmuutiŋagaich sivuġaannun atanaurat.

english: When they had brought them before the magistrates, they said, “These men are throwing our city into confusion. They are Jews
inupiaq: Tavra qaġġisiŋagaich sivuġaannun Rome-miut atanauraŋisa, aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Ukua uvva aŋutit Jew-guruat aŋalayyakkaich iñuich iniqpaptiŋni.

english: and are advocating customs that are not lawful for us to accept or practice, since we are Romans.”
inupiaq: Iliŋich iḷisaurrirut paaqsaaŋaruanik pitquraptiŋnun. Uvagut Rome-miuguruaguut kamagiyumiñaitkivut tamatkua piḷġutchich iḷisaurrutiŋich.

english: The crowd joined the attack against them, and the magistrates tore the clothes off Paul and Silas and ordered them to be beaten with rods.
inupiaq: Iñusalaich tapiġiiksinŋarut piyuaqłiqł̣utiŋ iliŋiŋnik, suli atanaurauruat aliktuŋagaich annuġaaŋik Paul-lu Silas-lu, aasii piraksriivḷutiŋ anaumiquvlugik.

english: After they had beaten them severely, they threw them into prison and commanded the jailer to guard them securely.
inupiaq: Tavra anaumianisugruanikamisigik, tigutaaġviŋmuŋagaich piraksriqł̣ugu tigutaaqtanik munaqsri qaunagipiaġataquvlugik.

english: Receiving such orders, he threw them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.
inupiaq: Kamagivlugu taamna piraksriusiani, munaqsrim iḷulliġmun tigutaaġviŋmun isiŋagik, aasii payaŋaiyaqługik siŋiġñiŋikkun qiruŋnun tigutaaġutinun.

english: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the rest of the prisoners were listening to them.
inupiaq: Tavra unnuaq qitiqqaqpalliġman Paul-lu Silas-lu aŋaiyyuŋaruk, suli nanġautinik atuqłutik God-mun, aasii tigutaaqtat naalaktuaŋagaich.

english: Suddenly a great earthquake occurred, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. Immediately all the doors flew open, and the bonds of all the prisoners came loose.
inupiaq: Tavra tavraŋŋatchiaq nuna aulaqpaŋaruq, maŋŋuŋiunnii tigutaaġvium aulayyaktaallaisa. Tavraŋŋatchiaq iluqaġmiŋ upkuat upkuiŋarut, suli iñupayaam tigutaaqsimmatiŋi kalimñat kataŋarut tigutaaqtaniñ.

english: When the jailer woke up and saw the doors of the prison standing open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, because he assumed the prisoners had escaped.
inupiaq: Tavrali tigutaaqtanik munaqsri itiqami, tautukamigich tigutaaġvium upkuaŋi aŋmaruat, isumaliŋaruq iluqaisa tigutaaqtat pigruġasugalugich, tavraasii amuŋagaa savikpani tuqutchaqsaqłuni inmiñik.

english: But Paul called out loudly, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul nivliŋaruq nipatutilaamisun, Anniaġnak iliŋnik, qanuq uvaniittugut iluqata.

english: Calling for lights, the jailer rushed in and fell down trembling at the feet of Paul and Silas.
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaqtanik munaqsri qaummatiksramik qiññuaŋaruq, suli isiniqłakłuni uullaġruaqtun iqsim punŋaruq sivuġaaŋnun Paul-lu Silas-lu.

english: Then he brought them outside and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
inupiaq: Tavra annisivlugik apiġiŋagik, Aŋutiik, sumik piruksrauvik annaurrausugluŋa?

english: They replied, “Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved, you and your household.”
inupiaq: Iliŋik uqallaŋaruk, Ukpiġiñ Ataniġmun Jesus-mun aasii annaurrauniaqtutin, iliviḷḷu igluqatitillu.

english: Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him, along with all those who were in his house.
