inupiaq: Tavra iliŋikta quliaqtuaġiŋagaak uqalua Atanġum ilaanun, iluqaiññullu igluaniittuanun.

english: At that hour of the night he took them and washed their wounds; then he and all his family were baptized right away.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan piŋagik taavrumani unnuam ikarraŋani, aasii iqaġivlugich kiḷḷiaġniŋik, suli ilaa qitunġaniḷu paptaiqsauŋarut tavrauvvaa.

english: The jailer brought them into his house and set food before them, and he rejoiced greatly that he had come to believe in God, together with his entire household.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan Paul-lu Silas-lu iglumiñuutiŋagik, aasii niqłiqsuqługik. Tavra ilaa igluqatiniḷu quviasupiaġataŋarut pisigivlugu ukpiliġñiqtiŋ God-mun.

english: At daybreak the magistrates sent their police officers, saying, “Release those men.”
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaami Rome-miut atanauraŋisa tiliŋagaich piliisimat uqaqłutiŋ, Taamapkuak aŋutik aullaqtitchigik.

english: The jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent orders to release you. So come out now and go in peace.”
inupiaq: Tavra tigutaaqtanik munaqsrim uqallautiŋagaa Paul, Atanaurat tilisiŋarut aullaqtitquvlutik, iliviḷḷu Silas-lu tigutaaqtauŋaiġḷutik. Aullaġumiñaqtutik tuaksruiḷaakun.

english: But Paul said to the police officers, “They had us beaten in public without a proper trial – even though we are Roman citizens – and they threw us in prison. And now they want to send us away secretly? Absolutely not! They themselves must come and escort us out!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-gum uqallautiŋagai piliisimat atanauraŋich, Anaumiŋasugaaptiguk iñuich takkuanni, isivġiqsauŋaiḷaak patchisiqaqtilaaġlunuk, iññuk Rome-miunun iḷauruaguuk, suli isiqtaġivlunuk tigutaaġviŋmun. Paŋmapak aasiiñ aullaqtinniaqpatiguk nalunautchiḷutiŋ? Naumi, qaiḷutiŋ ilimiŋnik annisiyaqtuġlisiguk.

english: The police officers reported these words to the magistrates. They were frightened when they heard Paul and Silas were Roman citizens
inupiaq: Piliisimat quliaqtuaġiŋagaich taapkua uqaluich atanauranun, aasii tusaakamasigik Paul-lu Silas-lu Rome-miunun iḷautilaaŋaŋnik iqsiḷiŋarut.

english: and came and apologized to them. After they brought them out, they asked them repeatedly to leave the city.
inupiaq: Tavra qaivḷutiŋ nunuuraġvigiŋagaik. Aasii annisivlugik apiġiŋagaich aullaquvlugik iniqpaŋmiñ.

english: When they came out of the prison, they entered Lydia’s house, and when they saw the brothers, they encouraged them and then departed.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Silas-lu aniŋaruk tigutaaġviŋmiñ, aasii isiqłutik Lydia-m igluanun. Tavrani kasuŋagaich aniqatit, aasii uqautiqqaaqługich qapiŋaisaaġutinik, aullaŋaruk.

english: After they traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-lu Silas-lu iglauŋaruk nalaułługik Amphipolis-lu Apollonia-lu, aasii tikił̣ł̣utik Thessalonica-mun, aŋaiyyuviqaġniqsuanun Jew-nun.

english: Paul went to the Jews in the synagogue, as he customarily did, and on three Sabbath days he addressed them from the scriptures,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuviŋmun piḷġusikaamisun. Suli piŋasuni Savaiññiġni ilaan uqaaqatigiŋagai iñuich Bible uqaluŋiññiñ,

english: explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer and to rise from the dead, saying, “This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Christ.”
inupiaq: sivunniuġutivlugich, iḷumun itilaaġutivlugiḷḷu, Christ nagliksaaqtuksraupiaġnivḷugu suli aŋiluni tuqqunmiñ, uqaqłuniḷu, Taamna Jesus quliaqtuaġikkaġa ilivsiññun Christ-guruq.

english: Some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, along with a large group of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few prominent women.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋich maliksuktitauŋarut, aasii iḷḷativlutiŋ Paul-mullu Silas-mullu, iñugiaktuallu Greek-gich ukpiliŋaruat God-mun, suli iñugiaktuat naumaruat aġnat iḷḷatiŋammiut.

english: But the Jews became jealous, and gathering together some worthless men from the rabble in the marketplace, they formed a mob and set the city in an uproar. They attacked Jason’s house, trying to find Paul and Silas to bring them out to the assembly.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat killuqsraliŋarut, aasii iñuksraqłutiŋ anniqsuutauŋitchuanik iḷatchiqsiñik iñugiaksiŋagaich. Tavra iniqpaum iñuŋi tuavaallaktinŋagaich aasii piyuksraġiŋagaat iglua Jason, Paul-lu Silas-lu paqinniatakługik iñuŋnuutisukługik.

english: When they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some of the brothers before the city officials, screaming, “These people who have stirred up trouble throughout the world have come here too,
inupiaq: Tavra paqinŋiññamisigik, kaliksraŋagaat Jason aniqatillu iḷaŋich sivuġaannun iniqpaum atanauraŋisa, pasivḷugik Paul-lu Silas-lu uqaqłutiŋ, Taipkuak iññuk tuavaalatchiññiktuk iñuŋnik sumiḷḷiqaa, aasiuvva iniqpaptiŋnuŋmiuk.

english: and Jason has welcomed them as guests! They are all acting against Caesar’s decrees, saying there is another king named Jesus!”
inupiaq: Aasii Jason tukkuliŋagik iglumiñun. Iluqaġmiŋ piḷġusiqaqtut paaqłakługich pitquraŋi Caesar-m, Rome-miut umialgata, uqaqłutiŋ umialiqaġnivḷugu allamik, atiqaqtuamik Jesus-mik.

english: They caused confusion among the crowd and the city officials who heard these things.
inupiaq: Tamatkuniŋa uqaqłutiŋ iñusalaiḷḷu atanauraŋiḷḷu iniqpaum tuavaallaktinŋagaich.

english: After the city officials had received bail from Jason and the others, they released them.
inupiaq: Tavra atanaurat akiḷiipkaŋagaich Jason-lu allallu maniŋñik annisiqsiłługich, aasii aullaqtinŋagaich.

english: The brothers sent Paul and Silas off to Berea at once, during the night. When they arrived, they went to the Jewish synagogue.
inupiaq: Unnupqauraġman, aniqatit tavrauvvaa aullaqtinŋagaich Paul-lu Silas-lu Berea-mun, aasii tikiññamik aŋaiyyuliaŋaruk Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviannun.

english: These Jews were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica, for they eagerly received the message, examining the scriptures carefully every day to see if these things were so.
inupiaq: Iñuich tavrani uqautisuġnapayaaŋarut iñuŋniñ Thessalonica-miittuaniñ, qanuq ilaisa naalaġniŋagaat uqaluk kipiġniuqłutiŋ. Aasii uvlutuaġman iḷisaŋagaich Bible uqaluŋich iḷitchuġiniaqłutiŋ Paul-gum uqaluŋi iḷumun itilaapiaŋannik.

english: Therefore many of them believed, along with quite a few prominent Greek women and men.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat tavrani ukpiliŋarut, suli iñugiaktuat Greek-guruat aġnat naumaruat, allallu iñugiaktuat Greek-guruat aŋutit, ukpiliŋammiut.

english: But when the Jews from Thessalonica heard that Paul had also proclaimed the word of God in Berea, they came there too, inciting and disturbing the crowds.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruat Thessalonica-mi tusaakamiŋ Paul alġaqsruiñivḷugu uqaluanik God-im Berea-mi tavruŋaŋarut, aasii tuavaalatchiññikłutiŋ iñuŋnik tavrani.

english: Then the brothers sent Paul away to the coast at once, but Silas and Timothy remained in Berea.
inupiaq: Tavra aniqatit tavrauvvaa aullaqtinŋagaat Paul iglauyaaksraŋanun taġiukun, aglaan Silas-lu Timothy-lu qimaktinŋaruk Berea-mun.

english: Those who accompanied Paul escorted him as far as Athens, and after receiving an order for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they left.
inupiaq: Taapkua aullaqtitchiruat Paul-mik qaniŋagaat Athens-munaglaan, aasii utiqłutiŋ Berea-mun. Paul-miñ piraksriusiaqaŋaruk Silas-lu Timothy-lu qaiñasuaquvlugik inmiñun.

english: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was greatly upset because he saw the city was full of idols.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul utaqqiḷḷaagnik Silas-lu Timothy-lu Athens-mi, tautukłuni iñugiaktuanik iñuuraqpaŋnik isumaalutchaŋaruq atqunaqłuni.

english: So he was addressing the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles in the synagogue, and in the marketplace every day those who happened to be there.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqaaqatigiŋagai Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianni, Jew-guruallu Jew-guŋitchuallu ukpiliŋaruat God-mun, suli uvlutuaġman kasimmaviŋñi uqaqatigivlugich iñuich nalaurrutiruat.

english: Also some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him, and some were asking, “What does this foolish babbler want to say?” Others said, “He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods.” (They said this because he was proclaiming the good news about Jesus and the resurrection.)
inupiaq: Iñuitchauq iḷaŋich Epicurean-guruat Stoic-guruallu iḷisaurrit qapiqtaŋagaat Paul. Aasii iḷaŋich uqallaŋarut, Sumik una uqavalari uqaġniḷuksaava? Allalli uqaŋarut, Ilaa qiññaqaqtuq alġaqsruirisun allayuqqanik god-tinik. Tainna uqaŋarut pisigivlugu Paul alġaqsruimman Jesus-mik aŋŋiñmiglu.

english: So they took Paul and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new teaching is that you are proclaiming?
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa Paul tiguŋagaat aasii qaġġisivlugu sivuġaannun kasimaruat Areopagus-mi uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷisimasukkaluaqtugut taavrumuuna nutauruakun iḷisaurrutigikkapkun.

english: For you are bringing some surprising things to our ears, so we want to know what they mean.”
inupiaq: Qanuq uvva tusaakkapta iḷaŋich allayuaġigivut, aasii iḷitchuġisukkaluaqtugut sumik tamatkua sivuniqaqtilaaŋannik.

english: (All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there used to spend their time in nothing else than telling or listening to something new.)
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ Athens-miut, imaŋŋaqtallu iñuuruat tavrani, atuġaġniġaat piviksraqtiŋ suuŋiḷanun, quliaqtuaqsiññaqłutiŋ naagga tusaaniaqłutiŋ sunik nutauruanik.

english: So Paul stood before the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I see that you are very religious in all respects.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul, makiłłuni sivuġaannun kasimaruat Areopagus-mi uqallaŋaruq, Iñuich Athen-miut, puttuqsriruŋa ilivsi qanusipayaakun piraġausikun ukpiqtauniqsusi.

english: For as I went around and observed closely your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: ‘To an unknown god.’ Therefore what you worship without knowing it, this I proclaim to you.
inupiaq: Qanuq pisuaqtuallaġma qiñiqtuaqługich init iñuuraqpaŋnun aŋaiyyuvigikkasi, paqinŋammiuŋa ikipkaiviŋmik ukuniŋa aglaqaqtuamik, Nalukkaptiŋnun god-mun. Taamnaasii aŋaiyyuvigikkaqsi nalullaan quliaqtuaġiniaġiga paŋmapak ilivsiññun.

english: The God who made the world and everything in it, who is Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by human hands,
inupiaq: God savaŋaruaq nunamik suli supayaanik imaġikkaŋiñik, Atanġuruq qiḷaŋmullu nunamullu, iñuuviqapiaġniaqtuksrauŋitchuq ininik iñuich savaaŋiññik.

english: nor is he served by human hands, as if he needed anything, because he himself gives life and breath and everything to everyone.
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii ilaa piqaqtuksraupiaġniaŋitchuq iñuich piḷiuġumiñakkaŋiññik ilaa savautilugu, qanuq ilaan inmiñik aitchuutigigai iñuggullu aniġniġlu supayaallu iñupayaanun.

english: From one man he made every nation of the human race to inhabit the entire earth, determining their set times and the fixed limits of the places where they would live,
inupiaq: Suli ilaan savaŋagai atautchimiñ iñuŋmiñ, iñupayaurat nunami iñuutquvlugich iluqaani nunami. Ilaan sivunniutiŋagai sivuani iñuullaaniksraŋich suli killiksraŋich iñuuniaġviḷḷaaŋisa.

english: so that they would search for God and perhaps grope around for him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us.
inupiaq: Tainna God piŋaruq iñuŋnun ivaquyumagaluaqłuni, iḷaanni paqinnasugaluni ivaqtuiññaqpanni, God qanitkaluaqtuq iluqaptiŋnun.

english: For in him we live and move about and exist, as even some of your own poets have said, ‘For we too are his offspring.’
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaa kaŋiutauruq iñuusipayauraptiŋnun. Iḷaŋitchauq taigualirivsi uqallaŋammiut,

english: So since we are God’s offspring, we should not think the deity is like gold or silver or stone, an image made by human skill and imagination.
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamirruŋ Paul uqaġman aŋŋisikun tuqqunmiñ, iḷaŋisa kipagiŋagaat. Aglaalli allat uqallakłutiŋ, Naalaktuavsaaġukkiptigiñ taavrumiŋa iḷaannigu.

english: Therefore, although God has overlooked such times of ignorance, he now commands all people everywhere to repent,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul aniŋaruq kasimaruaniñ.

english: because he has set a day on which he is going to judge the world in righteousness, by a man whom he designated, having provided proof to everyone by raising him from the dead.”
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq iñuich iḷaŋich iḷḷatiŋarut ilaanun ukpiliqł̣utiŋ, iḷagiŋagaat Dionysius iḷauruaq Ariopagus-nun, aġnaġlu atiqaqtuaq Damaris-mik, allallu iñuich.

english: Now when they heard about the resurrection from the dead, some began to scoff, but others said, “We will hear you again about this.”
So Paul left the Areopagus.
But some people joined him and believed. Among them were Dionysius, who was a member of the Areopagus, a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
After this Paul departed from Athens and went to Corinth.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Paul aullaŋaruq Athens-miñ aasii Corinth-mukłuni.

english: There he found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to depart from Rome. Paul approached them,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan kasuŋagaa Jew-guruaq atiqaqtuaq Aquila-mik, aniŋaruaq Pontus-mi, qaiqqammiqsuaq Italy-miñ piqatigivlugu nuliani Priscilla, qanuq umialik Claudius pitqurriiŋaruq Jew-payaurat aullaquvlugich Rome-miñ. Tavra Paul-gum tautugiaŋagik.

english: and because he worked at the same trade, he stayed with them and worked with them (for they were tentmakers by trade).
inupiaq: Aasii atiruamik savaaqaġniqamiŋ tuppiuqtauvlutiŋ, ilaan nayuŋagik.

english: He addressed both Jews and Greeks in the synagogue every Sabbath, attempting to persuade them.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul uqaaġaqtuq Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianni Savaiññipayaani, ukpiliqsinniaqługich Jew-guruallu Greek-giḷḷu.

english: Now when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul became wholly absorbed with proclaiming the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
inupiaq: Tavra Silas-lu Timothy-lu tikiñŋaruk Macedonia-miñ, Paul aptatiqaŋaruq alġaqsruiñiġmik, uqaluktuaġivlugu Jew-guruanun Jesus Christ-gunivḷugu.

english: When they opposed him and reviled him, he protested by shaking out his clothes and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am guiltless! From now on I will go to the Gentiles!”
inupiaq: Tavraasii akiḷḷiḷiqsuġmanni uqamaqłuutivluniḷu, ilaan ivsuktuŋagai annuġaani aasii uqallautivlugich, Annaurrauŋitkuvsi ilivsiññik pasiruksraurusi. Uvaŋa patchisauŋitchuŋa. Paŋmapaŋmiñ alġaqsruiñiaqtuŋa Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: Then Paul left the synagogue and went to the house of a person named Titius Justus, a Gentile who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul qimaŋagai aasii aullaqłuni igluanun Jew-guŋitchuam atiqaqtuam Titus Justus-mik, aŋaiyyusuuruaq God-mun. Ilaan iglua siḷalliuŋaruq Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviannun.

english: Crispus, the president of the synagogue, believed in the Lord together with his entire household, and many of the Corinthians who heard about it believed and were baptized.
inupiaq: Crispus umialiŋnauruaq aŋaiyyuviŋmi ukpiliŋaruq Ataniġmun, piqatigivlugich igluqatipayaani. Suli iñugiaktuat allat iñuich Corinth-miittuat tusaavlugu uqaluk, ukpiliŋarut suli paptaiqsauvlutiŋ.

english: The Lord said to Paul by a vision in the night, “Do not be afraid, but speak and do not be silent,
inupiaq: Unnuat iḷaŋanni, Paul qiñiqtuuraaŋaruq. Tavrani Atanġum uqallautiŋagaa, Iqsiñak, aglaan alġaqsruivsaaġiñ, nikatchaŋnak,

english: because I am with you, and no one will assault you to harm you, because I have many people in this city.”
inupiaq: qanuq itqatigigikpiñ, iñuum kialiqaa anniaqsaayumiñaitkaatin, qanuq ittut iñugiaktuat iñutka uumani iniqpaŋmi.

english: So he stayed there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul tavraniinŋaruq ukiuq iḷavlugu avvaġmik, iḷisautivlugich iñuich God-im uqaluanik.

english: Now while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews attacked Paul together and brought him before the judgment seat,
inupiaq: Tavra Gallio kavanaupkaqtillugu Greece-mi, Jew-guruat katinŋarut, aasii tigguġlukługu Paul qaġġisiŋagaat uqaqsitaaġviŋmun,

english: saying, “This man is persuading people to worship God in a way contrary to the law!”
inupiaq: uqaqłutiŋ, Iñuk una maliksuktitchiñiaqsaaruq iñuŋnik aŋaiyyutquvlugich God-mun, paaqłaglugich pitqurat.

english: But just as Paul was about to speak, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it were a matter of some crime or serious piece of villainy, I would have been justified in accepting the complaint of you Jews,
inupiaq: Tavra Paul uqallaksaaqsimmiuġlu, Gallio-m uqallautiŋagai Jew-guruat, Iñuk taamna piŋakpan sumik pigiitchuamik pitqurallu kamagiŋiḷḷugich, uvaŋa manimmiyumiñaġaluaġivsi Jew-guruasii.

english: but since it concerns points of disagreement about words and names and your own law, settle it yourselves. I will not be a judge of these things!”
inupiaq: Aglaan pasiñiqavsiuŋ uqaluktigullu iñuiḷḷu atiŋisigun ilivsiḷu pitquravsigun, ilivsiññik iłuaqsruġumiñaġiksi. Tamatkunuuna isivġiqsauniaŋitchuŋa.

english: Then he had them forced away from the judgment seat.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan aninŋagai uqaqsitaaġviŋmiñ.

english: So they all seized Sosthenes, the president of the synagogue, and began to beat him in front of the judgment seat. Yet none of these things were of any concern to Gallio.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ tigguġluŋagaat Sosthenes, umialiŋnaŋa Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviata, aasii anaumiaqsivḷugu sivuġaani uqaqsitaaġvium. Taamna suliqutigiŋiñmigaa Gallio-m suuramikunnii.

english: Paul, after staying many more days in Corinth, said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila. He had his hair cut off at Cenchrea because he had made a vow.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun Paul iñugiaktuanik uvliuqqaaqłuni Corinth-mi, qimaŋagai aniqatit tiŋilġaivḷuni Cyria-mun, piqatigivlugik Priscilla-lu Aquila-lu. Cenchreae-miinŋaġmi, niaquni mitquiŋagaa piḷġusiatitun Jew-guruat unniqsuqłiivḷuni God-mun.

english: When they reached Ephesus, Paul left Priscilla and Aquila behind there, but he himself went into the synagogue and addressed the Jews.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiñŋarut Ephesus-mun, aasii Paul-gum qimaŋagik Priscilla-lu Aquila-lu tavruŋa. Ilaa aŋaiyyuliaŋaruq Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviannun, aasii tavrani uqavaaqatigiŋagai Jew-guruat.

english: When they asked him to stay longer, he would not consent,
inupiaq: Iliŋisa apiġimmanni nayuqtuallaquvlutiŋ sivisuuraqtuami, ilaa pisuŋiñŋaruq.

english: but said farewell to them and added, “I will come back to you again if God wills.” Then he set sail from Ephesus,
inupiaq: Aglaan qimaksaqamigich uqallautiŋagai, Pisuutigikpagu God-im, utaqqiñiaġmigivsi. Tavra tiŋinnaaqsaŋaruq Ephesus-miñ.

english: and when he arrived at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church at Jerusalem and then went down to Antioch.
inupiaq: Tavra tikiññami Caesarea-mun, aullaŋaruq Jerusalem-mun, aasii paġlaŋagai aŋaiyyuliqiruat, aasii aullalgił̣ł̣uni Antioch-mun.

english: After he spent some time there, Paul left and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
inupiaq: Tavraniittuallaqqaaqłuni aullaŋaruq aasii kukiḷukłuni nunaaqqiñun Galatia-mi Phrygia-miḷu, suaŋasiḷiqługich ukpiġutiŋich ukpiqtuat.

english: Now a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, arrived in Ephesus. He was an eloquent speaker, well-versed in the scriptures.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruaq atiqaqtuaq Apollos-mik, iñuguŋaruaq Alexandria-mi, tikiñŋaruq Ephesus-mun. Ilaa uqaqtuayuruaq iḷisimmaġikł̣uni Bible uqaluŋiññik.

english: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord, and with great enthusiasm he spoke and taught accurately the facts about Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.
inupiaq: Iḷisausiaqaŋaniqsuq Atanikun, aasii qapiŋaił̣ł̣uni uqaŋaruq iḷisaurrivḷuniḷu nalaupiaqługich sut sivuniqaqtuat Jesus-mik. Aglaan iḷisimatualuŋniqsuq paptaiġutaanik John.

english: He began to speak out fearlessly in the synagogue, but when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside and explained the way of God to him more accurately.
inupiaq: Ilaa uqarraqsiŋaruq taluqsrautaił̣ł̣uni Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvianni. Tavra Priscilla-vlu Aquila-vlu naalaktuaqqaaqługu aggisiŋagaak, aasii iḷisautimmaġiksaagaqsivḷugu God-im annaurriḷḷatilaaŋanik iñuŋnik.

english: When Apollos wanted to cross over to Achaia, the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him. When he arrived, he assisted greatly those who had believed by grace,
inupiaq: Tavra Apollos sivunniġman aullaġukłuni Greece-mun aniqatit Ephesus-mi ikayuŋagaat, tuyuqłutiŋ aniqatimiŋnun Greece-miittuanun paġlatquvlugu tikitpan. Tikiññami, Apollos ikayuŋagai tamatkua ukpiliŋaruat God-im nagliktuutiqpaŋagun.

english: for he refuted the Jews vigorously in public debate, demonstrating from the scriptures that the Christ was Jesus.
inupiaq: Qanuq ilaan qapiġnaił̣ł̣uni, suaŋavlutiŋ uqaluŋi, Jew-guruat qapiqtaŋagai kasimaruani qapiqtautikamiŋ nalupqinaiyaqługu Bible uqaluŋiññiñ Jesus Christ-guniŋa.

english: While Apollos was in Corinth, Paul went through the inland regions and came to Ephesus. He found some disciples there
inupiaq: Tavra Apollos Corinth-miitillugu, Paul iglauŋaruq nunatigun aasii tikił̣ł̣uni Ephesus-mun. Tavrani kasuŋagai iḷaŋich ukpiqtuat.

english: and said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” They replied, “No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan apiġiŋagai, Aitchuusiaġiŋavisiuŋ Ilitqusiġiksuaq ukpiliqavsi? Aasii kiuŋagaat, Naagga, qaŋaunnii tusaaŋaitchugut Ilitqusiġiksuaqaqtilaamik.

english: So Paul said, “Into what then were you baptized?” “Into John’s baptism,” they replied.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul apiġivsaaŋagai, Qanuqłusi paptaiqsauŋavisi? Iliŋisa kiuŋagaat, Paptaiqsauŋarugut John piraksriutaagun.

english: Paul said, “John baptized with a baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him, that is, in Jesus.”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul uqallaŋaruq, John paptaiŋagai iñuich isumalitqiŋmata, uqautivlugich iñuich Israel-guruat ukpiliquvlugich iñuŋmun qaiyumaaqtuamun aqumigun, taavrumuŋa Jesus-mun.

english: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus,
inupiaq: Taamna tusaakamirruŋ, paptaiqsauŋarut atqagun Atanġum Jesus.

english: and when Paul placed his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they began to speak in tongues and to prophesy.
inupiaq: Taavruma aquagun, Paul iḷimmagich argaŋni ilaiññun, Ilitqusiġiksuam aŋalarraqsiŋagai, aasii iliŋich uqaŋarut allakanik uqautchiñik nalukkamiŋnik, suli uqaqłutiŋ kaŋiqsiñaqsivḷugich God-im uqaluksriutiŋi.

english: (Now there were about twelve men in all.)
inupiaq: Iñugiaktilaaġivalliŋagaat qulit malġuk aŋutit.

english: So Paul entered the synagogue and spoke out fearlessly for three months, addressing and convincing them about the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul aŋaiyyuliaqtaŋaruq Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuviannun, aasii piŋasuni tatqiñi uqaqłuni taluqsraŋił̣ł̣uni, uqaaqatigivlugich ukpiqtinniaqługich God-im atanniqsimmataagun iñuŋnun.

english: But when some were stubborn and refused to believe, reviling the Way before the congregation, he left them and took the disciples with him, addressing them every day in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷaŋich uqayunaiñŋarut ukpiġuŋiñŋarullu, suli uqautigimaqłukługulu Ataniq takkuanni iñuich kasimaruat. Tavra Paul qimaŋagai, aasii piqasiutivlugich ukpiqtuat, aasii uvlutuaġman uqautivlugich igluqpaŋmi iḷisaurriviani Tyrannus-gum.

english: This went on for two years, so that all who lived in the province of Asia, both Jews and Greeks, heard the word of the Lord.
inupiaq: Paul tainna piŋaruq ukiuŋni malġuŋni, iñupayaurat iñuuruat nunaaqqiŋiññi Asia-m Jew-gugaluaqtuat Jew-guŋitkaluaqtuallu tusaaŋarut uqaluŋiñik Atanġum.

english: God was performing extraordinary miracles by Paul’s hands,
inupiaq: Tavra God-im savaktinŋagaa Paul naumaruanik aliuġnaqtuanik.

english: so that when even handkerchiefs or aprons that had touched his body were brought to the sick, their diseases left them and the evil spirits went out of them.
inupiaq: Kakkiiyautikkaluat unnii saaġuallu atuŋakkaŋi Paul naŋittuanuutiraġaŋagaich, aasii naŋirrutiŋich piiġaqtut, ilitqusiqł̣uiḷḷu anivḷutiŋ iliŋiññiñ.

english: But some itinerant Jewish exorcists tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who were possessed by evil spirits, saying, “I sternly warn you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”
inupiaq: Tavra kukiḷuktuat iḷaŋich Jew-guruat ilitqusiqł̣uiyairuat atuqsaaŋagaat atqa Atanġum Jesus tamatkunuŋa ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuanun. Uqallautiŋagaich ilitqusiqł̣ugich inna, Piraksriġivsi anitquvlusi atqagun Jesus, Paul alġaqsruutigikkaŋata.

english: (Now seven sons of a man named Sceva, a Jewish high priest, were doing this.)
inupiaq: Tainna piŋaniqsut tallimat malġuk iġñiŋi Jew-guruam aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata atiqaqtuam Sceva.

english: But the evil spirit replied to them, “I know about Jesus and I am acquainted with Paul, but who are you?”
inupiaq: Tavra ilitqusiqł̣uum kiuŋagai, Jesus iḷisimagiga, Paul iḷisimammigiga, aglaan ilivsi kitkuuvisi?

english: Then the man who was possessed by the evil spirit jumped on them and beat them all into submission. He prevailed against them so that they fled from that house naked and wounded.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuum ilitqusiqł̣uqaqtuam piyuarraqsiŋagai piaqługivlugich, aasii payarivḷugich. Tavra iluqaġmiŋ pigruŋarut iglumiñ annuġaiḷat kiḷḷiaqtat.

english: This became known to all who lived in Ephesus, both Jews and Greeks; fear came over them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was praised.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna tusaaŋagaat iluqaġmiŋ Jew-guruat Jew-guŋitchuallu iñuuruat Ephesus-mi aasii iqsitchaŋarut iluqaġmiŋ, aasiiḷi atqa Atanġum Jesus kamanaqtuaġiŋagaat iñuich.

english: Many of those who had believed came forward, confessing and making their deeds known.
inupiaq: Iñugiaktuat ukpiqtuaġuqtuat qaiŋarut, aasii quliaqługich takkuanni iñuich sut savaaġisuuratiŋ,

english: Large numbers of those who had practiced magic collected their books and burned them up in the presence of everyone. When the value of the books was added up, it was found to total fifty thousand silver coins.
inupiaq: iḷaŋisa savaaqaġuuŋaruat aŋatkiqiniġmik qaġġisiŋagaich makpiġaatiŋ atautchimun, aasii ikipkaqługich takkuanni iñupayaat. Aasii akisutilaaġmatigik makpiġaat iḷitchuġiŋagaich katiłługich akisutilaaŋat 50,000 taalatun.

english: In this way the word of the Lord continued to grow in power and to prevail.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuvsaat ukpiġiliŋagaat uqalua Atanġum. Suli iluqaġmiŋ iñuich iḷitchuġiŋagaat suaŋŋatiqaqtilaaŋanik God-im uqalua.

english: Now after all these things had taken place, Paul resolved to go to Jerusalem, passing through Macedonia and Achaia. He said, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua piruat aquatigun, Paul aŋalałługu Ilitqusiġiksuam sivunniqsinŋagaa iglausukłuni nunaaqqiŋisigun Macedonia-m Greece-guvlu, aasii Jerusalem-mugluni. Ilaa uqallaŋaruq, Jerusalem-muqqaaġluŋa, tautugaksraġipiaġmigiga Rome.

english: So after sending two of his assistants, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, he himself stayed on for a while in the province of Asia.
inupiaq: Tavra tiliŋagik Timothy-lu Erastus-lu ikayuqtiŋni Macedonia-mun, ilaali ittuallavsaaġukłuni nunaaqqiŋiñi Asia-m.

english: At that time a great disturbance took place concerning the Way.
inupiaq: Tasamma tainnaiḷimman iñuich tuavaallapiaġataŋarut Ephesus-mi, akiḷḷiḷiqsuqługu alġaqsruun Atanikun.

english: For a man named Demetrius, a silversmith who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought a great deal of business to the craftsmen.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk atilik Demetrius-mik, maniŋñik qatiqtuanik savviqiri aŋaiyyuviŋŋualiuġuuruaq tuvraqługu aŋaiyyuvikpak savaaguruaq aġnamun god-iŋŋuamun Artemis-mik atiqaqtuamun. Savaaŋata maniññaktiqpagaġniġai savaktit.

english: He gathered these together, along with the workmen in similar trades, and said, “Men, you know that our prosperity comes from this business.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan katitinŋagai atautchimun iluqaisa savaaqaqtuat ilimiktuttauq, aasii uqallautiŋagai, Aŋutiit, iḷisimarusi taavruma savaapta maniññaktilluataġuugaatigut.

english: And you see and hear that this Paul has persuaded and turned away a large crowd, not only in Ephesus but in practically all of the province of Asia, by saying that gods made by hands are not gods at all.
inupiaq: Aasii qiñiqtusi tusaarusiḷu taamna Paul suliqitilaaŋanik. Ilaa uqaqtuq god-iŋŋuat iñuich savaaŋich god-tauŋiññivḷugich, aasii maliksuktiłługich iñuich iñugiaktuat uvani Ephesus-mi, iluqakavsaŋiññiḷu nunaaqqiŋisa Asia-m.

english: There is danger not only that this business of ours will come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be regarded as nothing, and she whom all the province of Asia and the world worship will suffer the loss of her greatness.”
inupiaq: Aasiuvva anayanaqtuq savaaqput, una kisimi suksraaqtauniaŋitchuq, aglaallu aŋaiyyuvikpaŋa kamanaqtuam aġnam god-iŋŋuam Artemis-gum suuŋaiġñiaġmiuq, aasii kamanautaa suksraunġiqsauluni iñupayaat aŋaiyyuvigisuukkaŋat Asia-mi iluqaaniḷu nunami.

english: When they heard this they became enraged and began to shout, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
inupiaq: Taamna iñusalaich tusaakamirruŋ qinnaliqpaŋarut, suli nipaalarraqsiŋarut, Kamanaqtuq Artemis god-iŋat Ephesus-miut.

english: The city was filled with the uproar, and the crowd rushed to the theater together, dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus, the Macedonians who were Paul’s traveling companions.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuŋi iniqpaum tuavaallapiaġataŋarut. Suli pialaruat tigguġluŋagaich Gaius-lu Aristarchus-lu Macedonia-ġmiuk, Paul iglauqatiŋik, aasii aullautivlugik kasimaviŋmun.

english: But when Paul wanted to enter the public assembly, the disciples would not let him.
inupiaq: Paul ullautiyumaŋagaluaqtuq kasimaruanun, ukpiqtuat pitchaiḷiŋagaat.

english: Even some of the provincial authorities who were his friends sent a message to him, urging him not to venture into the theater.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋisaptauq atanaurauruat ilaan avilaitqatiŋi tilisiŋammiut uqaluŋmik ilaanun ullautisaatquŋił̣ł̣ugu iñuich kasimmaviannun.

english: So then some were shouting one thing, some another, for the assembly was in confusion, and most of them did not know why they had met together.
inupiaq: Tavrali kasimaruat iluqaġmiŋ tuavaallaŋarut. Iḷaŋich nipaalaŋarut inmikkun, iḷaŋiḷḷi allamik, qanuq kasimaruat alapinŋarut, suli iñugiagniqsrat naluŋarut summan katitilaamiŋnik.

english: Some of the crowd concluded it was about Alexander because the Jews had pushed him to the front. Alexander, gesturing with his hand, was wanting to make a defense before the public assembly.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk atiqaqtuaq Alexander-mik Jew-guruat saavititaŋat sivuġaannun kasimaruat urriqaŋaruq argaŋmiñik nipaiquvlugich, aasii uqaġnirraqsivḷuni iñuŋnun iliŋich patchisauŋiññivḷutiŋ.

english: But when they recognized that he was a Jew, they all shouted in unison, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!” for about two hours.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisaġikamirruŋ Jew-gutilaaŋa, atausiŋŋuqługu nipiriŋ nipaalaŋarut malġuŋni ikarraaŋni, Kamanaqtuq Artemis god-iŋat Ephesus-miut.

english: After the city secretary quieted the crowd, he said, “Men of Ephesus, what person is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is the keeper of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image that fell from heaven?
inupiaq: Kiisaimmaa iniqpaŋmi aglaktim nipaiqsinnamigich iñusalaich uqallaŋaruq, Iñuŋi Ephesus, iñupayaat iḷisimarut iniqpaŋat Ephesus-miut qaunaksriruagutilaaŋanik aŋaiyyuvikpaŋanik kamanaqtuam Artemis, taavrumalu iñuuraqpaum kataŋaruam siḷamiñ.

english: So because these facts are indisputable, you must keep quiet and not do anything reckless.
inupiaq: Iḷisimalusiasii tamatkua kialiqaa piiḷaaġiyumiñaiñmagich nipaalaruksrauŋitkaluaqtusi, suli piaqłuktaŋaiġḷusi.

english: For you have brought these men here who are neither temple robbers nor blasphemers of our goddess.
inupiaq: Qaġġisiŋagisi ukuak iññuk uvuŋa tigligaiŋaitkaluaqtillugik aŋaiyyuvikpavsiññik, naagga uqamaqłuktautiqaŋaitkaluaqtillugik god-iptigun.

english: If then Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a complaint against someone, the courts are open and there are proconsuls; let them bring charges against one another there.
inupiaq: Tavra Demetrius-lu savaktiniḷu pasikkutiksraqaġumiŋ iññukkun, uqaqsitaaġviich aŋmarut uqaqsitaaġvikaallu uvlut, isivġiqsillu ittut, tavrani uqautikkutiyumiñaqtut avanmun.

english: But if you want anything in addition, it will have to be settled in a legal assembly.
inupiaq: Suli allanik iłuaqsrugaksranik piqavsaaġuvsi, iłuaqsruqtauyumiñaqtut pitquratigun kasimakpata.

english: For we are in danger of being charged with rioting today, since there is no cause we can give to explain this disorderly gathering.”
inupiaq: Qanuq anayasaaqtugut uqautikkusiaksramik tuavaalanikun uvlupak, patchisiksraiñŋapta nalauttualiḷuta uumuuna tuavaalanikun.

english: After he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.
inupiaq: Tavraasii taamna uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, aġiupkaŋagai kasimaruat.

english: After the disturbance had ended, Paul sent for the disciples, and after encouraging them and saying farewell, he left to go to Macedonia.
inupiaq: Tuavaalaŋaiġmata, Paul katitquŋagai ukpiqtuat aasii qapiŋaisaaqqaaqługich, qimaŋagai Macedonia-muksaqłuni.

english: After he had gone through those regions and spoken many words of encouragement to the believers there, he came to Greece,
inupiaq: Iglauganikami tamatkunuuna nunaaqqisigun, qapiŋaisaaqługich ukpiqtuat, tikiñŋaruq Greece-mun.

english: where he stayed for three months. Because the Jews had made a plot against him as he was intending to sail for Syria, he decided to return through Macedonia.
inupiaq: Tavraniinŋaruq tatqiñi piŋasuni, aasii iḷitchuġikami Jew-guruat sivunniuġniġmata inmigun piyumigivluni, itqanaiyaŋaruq aullaġukłuni Syria-mun. Tavra sivunniŋaruq utiqsaġukłuni Macedonia-kun.

english: Paul was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, and Timothy, as well as Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia.
inupiaq: Sopater iġñiŋa Pyrrhus Berea-mium aullaqasiŋagaa, aasiiḷi Thessalonica-ġmiuniñ Aristarchus-guvlu Secundus-lu Gaius-lu Derbe-mium, Timothy-vlu Tychicus-lu Trophimus-lu nunaaqqiŋiñiñ Asia-m tuvaaqasiŋagaat.

english: These had gone on ahead and were waiting for us in Troas.
inupiaq: Taapkua iñuich ayuŋarut sivuptiŋni, aasii utaqqivḷuta Troas-mi.

english: We sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and within five days we came to the others in Troas, where we stayed for seven days.
inupiaq: Uvagulli tiŋinnaaŋarugut Philippi-miñ Niqinaqianiŋmata Puvlaksiŋaitchuamik Punniġmik, aasii tallimat uvlut pianiŋmata kasuŋagivut Troas-mi. Tavrani tallimat malġuŋni uvliŋarugut.

english: On the first day of the week, when we met to break bread, Paul began to speak to the people, and because he intended to leave the next day, he extended his message until midnight.
inupiaq: Tavra Savaitchuani katinŋarugut atautchimun nullautchiġviḷiqiniaqłuta. Paul uqautiŋagai iñuich unnuaq qitiqqaġataqtillugu aullaġniaqłuni uvlaakukpan.

english: (Now there were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting.)
inupiaq: Qulliich iñugiaŋarut qiḷaguami kasimavivsiŋñi.

english: A young man named Eutychus, who was sitting in the window, was sinking into a deep sleep while Paul continued to speak for a long time. Fast asleep, he fell down from the third story and was picked up dead.
inupiaq: Aasii nukatpiaq atiqaqtuaq Eutychus aquppiŋaruq igalaurami. Paul uqaŋaiḷḷaiqsillugu Eutychus uiñġaliqsaiññaŋaruq, kiisaimmaa siquvuq, aasii katakłuni piŋayuaŋniñ qiḷaguak nunamun. Tigummarruŋ tuquŋaniqsuq.

english: But Paul went down, threw himself on the young man, put his arms around him, and said, “Do not be distressed, for he is still alive!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul atqaŋaruq aasii pułłuni qulaŋiqł̣ugu, iqinnamiuŋ uqallaŋaruq Uŋiariñasi. Iñuuruq suli.

english: Then Paul went back upstairs, and after he had broken bread and eaten, he talked with them a long time, until dawn. Then he left.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul mayuanikami, niġianikamirruŋ nullautchiġvik, uqautivsaaŋagai uvluġataqtillugu, aasii aullaqłuni.

english: They took the boy home alive and were greatly comforted.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuich aggisiŋagaat nutaġaaluk iñuuvlugu, suli quviasaaqtauqpaŋarut.

english: We went on ahead to the ship and put out to sea for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there, for he had arranged it this way. He himself was intending to go there by land.
inupiaq: Aasii ayuvluta umiaqpaŋmun tiŋilġaqsiqsaŋarugut Assos-mun, sivuniqaqłuta ikisukługu Paul tavrani. Tainna sivunniuŋamman ilaa nunakuaġumavluni.

english: When he met us in Assos, we took him aboard and went to Mitylene.
inupiaq: Tavra kasuġmatigut Assos-mi, ikuŋagikput umiaqpaŋmun aasii Mitylene-mukłuta.

english: We set sail from there, and on the following day we arrived off Chios. The next day we approached Samos, and the day after that we arrived at Miletus.
inupiaq: Tavraŋŋa tiŋinnaaŋarugut uvlaakumman akiŋiqł̣ugu Chios. Aasii uvlutqiŋman tikił̣ł̣uta Samos-mun, aasii uvlaakutqiŋman tikił̣ł̣uta Miletus-mun.

english: For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so as not to spend time in the province of Asia, for he was hurrying to arrive in Jerusalem, if possible, by the day of Pentecost.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul sivunniŋaruq qaaŋiqsaaġukługu Ephesus, iñaviqqutchiġuŋił̣ł̣uni nunaaqqiŋisiguaġumi Asia-m. Ilaa tikiññasuaġuŋaruq Jerusalem-mun piñaġumiñaqpan Pentecost-liqikpata itchukłuni.

english: From Miletus he sent a message to Ephesus, telling the elders of the church to come to him.
inupiaq: Paul aullaqtitchiŋaruq uqaluŋmik Miletus-miinŋaġmi Ephesus-mun apiġivlugich umialiŋnaŋich aŋaiyyuliqiruat paaquvluni.

english: When they arrived, he said to them, “You yourselves know how I lived the whole time I was with you, from the first day I set foot in the province of Asia,
inupiaq: Aasii tikiñmanni uqallautiŋagai, Iḷisimarusi qanuq iñuuŋatilaamnik akunnavsiññi sivulliġmiñqaŋa uvlumiñ tikiññama nunaaqqiŋiñun Asia-m.

english: serving the Lord with all humility and with tears, and with the trials that happened to me because of the plots of the Jews.
inupiaq: Savautiŋagiga Ataniq kamasaaŋaiqł̣uŋa qulviuqłuŋalu siġḷiġniuġutit pisigivlugich tikitqataqtuat uvamnun sivunniuġutiŋich piyumigivluŋa Jew-guruat.

english: You know that I did not hold back from proclaiming to you anything that would be helpful, and from teaching you publicly and from house to house,
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi aŋŋikkutiŋaitkivsi supayaamik ikayuutauyumiñaqtuamik ilivsiññun alġaqsruikama iḷisautivlusiḷu kasimakavsi, igluvsiññiḷu.

english: testifying to both Jews and Greeks about repentance toward God and faith in our Lord Jesus.
inupiaq: Jew-guruallu Jew-guŋitchuallu ativlugich kiliktuŋagitka isumalitqiquvlugich piḷuunmiŋniñ God-mun, suli ukpiquvlugich Ataniptiŋnun Jesus-mun.

english: And now, compelled by the Spirit, I am going to Jerusalem without knowing what will happen to me there,
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak Ilitqusiġiksuam piyummiqł̣uŋa aullaaqsiruŋa Jerusalem-mun, nalugaluaŋŋaan suna piruksraq uvamnun taamani.

english: except that the Holy Spirit warns me in town after town that imprisonment and persecutions are waiting for me.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷisimatualuktuŋa Ilitqusiġiksuam iḷitchuġipkaŋagaaŋa iniqpapayaani tigutaaqtauniaġnivḷuŋa nagliksaaqtitauniaġnivḷuŋalu.

english: But I do not consider my life worth anything to myself, so that I may finish my task and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the good news of God’s grace.
inupiaq: Aasii tamatkua sivuuġagiŋitkitka. Sugiŋitkigalu tuqutkaluaqpanŋa. Naatchisuktuŋa tiliraunimnik alġaqsruiñimniglu Atanġum Jesus piraksriŋammaŋa quliaqtuaġutitquvlugich iñuich tusaayugaaġiksuanik, God-mun annautiyumiñaġnivḷugich nagliktuutiqpaŋmigun.

english: “And now I know that none of you among whom I went around proclaiming the kingdom will see me again.
inupiaq: Aasii kukiḷuŋaruŋa akunnavsiññi alġaqsruutigivlugu God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun. Paŋmapak uvva iḷisimaruŋa iluqasi taututqigñiaŋitkivsiŋa.

english: Therefore I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of you all.
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautipiaġivsi uvlupak patchisauyumiñaiññiḷuŋa nalliqsi annaurrauyumiñaiññiqpan.

english: For I did not hold back from announcing to you the whole purpose of God.
inupiaq: Qanuq aŋŋikkutiŋaitkivsi sumik uqautigiraksramnik iluqaanik God-im iḷisimatqukkaŋanik ilivsiññun.

english: Watch out for yourselves and for all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the church of God that he obtained with the blood of his own Son.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi ilivsiññun iluqaisalu ukpiqtuat, Ilitqusiġiksuam qaunagitquŋakkaŋi ilivsiññun. Qaunagisigik aŋaiyyuliqiruat God-mun, ilaan pigiliutiŋakkaŋi tuqqutaagun ilaan iġñiġmi.

english: I know that after I am gone fierce wolves will come in among you, not sparing the flock.
inupiaq: Iḷisimaruŋa aullaanikkuma, iḷisaurriruat iḷumun inŋitchuanik iqsiñaqtuatun amaqqutun akunnaaġutiniaqtut ilivsiññun, aasii ukpiġutaiqsinniaġniaġaich ukpiqtuat.

english: Even from among your own group men will arise, teaching perversions of the truth to draw the disciples away after them.
inupiaq: Suli ilivsi nanmiñiq akunnavsiññiñ satqummiġñiaqtut iñuich uqaurriruat saglunik ukpiqtuaguruanun maliksuktitchiñiaqłutiŋ inmiŋnun.

english: Therefore be alert, remembering that night and day for three years I did not stop warning each one of you with tears.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu nipuŋaitchitchi, itqaumalusi ukiuni piŋasuni nutqaŋaitchuŋa unnuakkaluami naagga uvlumi kiliktuqługu iñupayaaq tamatkunuuna qulviuġaluaŋŋaġma.

english: And now I entrust you to God and to the message of his grace. This message is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak aŋaiyyutigivsi God-mun qaunagitquvlusi, suli aŋaiyyutivlusi nagliktuutikun uqaluŋiñun suaŋasiḷaaquvlugu ukpiġutiksi iḷaŋiutiyumiñaqsiḷusi quviasaaġusianik ilaan aitchuutigisuukkaŋiñik ilaaguaqtamiñun.

english: I have desired no one’s silver or gold or clothing.
inupiaq: Kaviuġiŋaitkiga kialiqaa mania qatiqtuaq naagga kaviqsuaq, naagga annuġaaŋi.

english: You yourselves know that these hands of mine provided for my needs and the needs of those who were with me.
inupiaq: Ilivsi iḷisimarusi ukuniŋa argamnik savautiqaġuuruŋa piqallasivḷuta iḷatkalu pigiraksraġikkaptiŋnik.

english: By all these things, I have shown you that by working in this way we must help the weak, and remember the words of the Lord Jesus that he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
inupiaq: Tamatkunani iluqaiññi iḷisautiŋagivsi tainna iñuk savagluni ikayuiruksrautilaaŋanik piḷguitchuanik, itqaumalugich uqaluŋi Atanġum Jesus uqallaŋamman, Quvianałhaaqtuq aitchuiruni aitchuusiaqaġniġmiñ.

english: When he had said these things, he knelt down with them all and prayed.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul tamatkuniŋa uqaanikami, sitquqatigiŋagai iluqaisa umialiŋnat, aasii aŋaiyyuvlutiŋ.

english: They all began to weep loudly, and hugged Paul and kissed him,
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ qiaqpaŋarut, suli iqimmaaqługu Paul kunikł̣ugulu kutpaiŋagaat,

english: especially saddened by what he had said, that they were not going to see him again. Then they accompanied him to the ship.
inupiaq: isumaaġutigiłhaaqługich uqaluich uqallausiġiŋakkaŋi taututqigñiaŋiññivḷuni. Tavra umiaqpaŋmuqatigiŋagaat.

english: After we tore ourselves away from them, we put out to sea, and sailing a straight course, we came to Cos, on the next day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.
inupiaq: Tavra avinnapta iliŋiññiñ tiŋilġaqsiqł̣uta sivunmun ikaaŋarugut Cos-mun, aasii uvlutqiŋman tikił̣ł̣uta Rhodes-mun, aasii taavaŋŋa aullalgiññapta tikił̣ł̣uta Patara-mun.

english: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, went aboard, and put out to sea.
inupiaq: Taavrumani inimi iḷitchuġiŋarugut umiaqpaŋmik ikaaġniaqtuamik Phoenicia-mun. Tavraasii ikiŋarugut aullaqsaqłuta.

english: After we sighted Cyprus and left it behind on our port side, we sailed on to Syria and put in at Tyre, because the ship was to unload its cargo there.
inupiaq: Qiñiġnaqsikaptigu qikiqtaq Cyprus, uŋalaŋata tuŋaagun igliŋarugut Syria-mun. Tulaŋarugut Tyre-mi, umiaqpak niuriñiaqłuni usiamiñik.

english: After we located the disciples, we stayed there seven days. They repeatedly told Paul through the Spirit not to set foot in Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Aasii paqiłługich iḷaŋich ukpiqtuat tavraniittuat, nayuŋagivut tallimat malġuŋni uvluni. Ilitqusiġiksuam uqallaguliqsinŋagai ukpiqtuat Paul Jerusalem-muquŋił̣ł̣ugu.

english: When our time was over, we left and went on our way. All of them, with their wives and children, accompanied us outside of the city. After kneeling down on the beach and praying,
inupiaq: Tavra uvliuġniksravut tavrani naanmata, aullaŋarugut iglausaqłuta. Iluqaġmiŋ ukpiqtuat piqatigivlugich nuliatiglu miqłiqtutiglu, qaniŋagaatigut siḷataanun iniqpaum. Tavrani sitquqłuta taġium siñaanun aŋaiyyuŋarugut suli kutpaiġutisuiqsaaqłuta avanmun.

english: we said farewell to one another. Then we went aboard the ship, and they returned to their own homes.
inupiaq: Tavrali uvagut ikiŋarugut umiaqpaŋmun, aasiiḷi iliŋich aisaqłutiŋ.

english: We continued the voyage from Tyre and arrived at Ptolemais, and when we had greeted the brothers, we stayed with them for one day.
inupiaq: Aullaqapta tiŋinnaaqłuta Tyre-miñ, tikiñŋarugut Ptolemais-mun. Tavrani paġlaŋagivut aniqatit nayuqługich uvlivḷuta atautchimik.

english: On the next day we left and came to Caesarea, and entered the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman aullaŋarugut aasii tikił̣ł̣uta Caesarea-mun. Tavrani isiŋarugut igluanun Philip isumalitqiksitchiñiaqtim, aasii tukkuġivlugu. Ilaa iḷagiŋagaat tallimat malġuk aŋutit tiikaksraqtaaguŋaruat Jerusalem-mi.

english: (He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied.)
inupiaq: Aasii Philip sisamanik paniqaġniqsuaq uiñiŋaitchuanik, uqaqtauruanik God-mun.

english: While we remained there for a number of days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
inupiaq: Uvliuqtilluta uqaqtauruaq God-mun atiqaqtuaq Agabus-mik tikiñŋaruq Judea-miñ.

english: He came to us, took Paul’s belt, tied his own hands and feet with it, and said, “The Holy Spirit says this: ‘This is the way the Jews in Jerusalem will tie up the man whose belt this is, and will hand him over to the Gentiles.’”
inupiaq: Ullakamisigut ilaan tiguŋagaa Paul tavsia aasii qiḷiqsruqługich ilaan isigaŋni argaŋniḷu, uqaqłuni, Inna uqaqtuq Ilitqusiġiksuaq, Tainnatun Jew-guruat Jerusalem-mi qiḷiqsruiñiaġaat iñuk tavsiqaqtuaq mattumiŋa aasii aitchuutigilugu Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: When we heard this, both we and the local people begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Taamna tusaakaptigu, uvagullu iñuiḷḷu araŋagaluaġikput Paul Jerusalem-muquŋił̣ł̣ugu.

english: Then Paul replied, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be tied up, but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
inupiaq: Paul kiuŋagaatigut, Suvisiuvva qiavisi isumaalluksaaqpisiŋa? Qanuq uvva itqanaitchuŋa tigutaaqtauyumiñaqłuŋa Jerusalem-mi tuqutaullatuaġumalu pisigilugu Ataniq Jesus.

english: Because he could not be persuaded, we said no more except, “The Lord’s will be done.”
inupiaq: Tavra payariyumiñaiññiqaptigu Paul, aġiuŋarugut aasii uqallakłuta, Pisuutaa Atanġum nalaulli.

english: After these days we got ready and started up to Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Taapkua uvlut aquatigun itqanaiyarraqsiŋarugut aasii Jerusalem-muksaqłuta.

english: Some of the disciples from Caesarea came along with us too, and brought us to the house of Mnason of Cyprus, a disciple from the earliest times, with whom we were to stay.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷaŋisa ukpiqtuat qaiŋaruat Caesarea-miñ maliŋagaatigut, aasii aggisivluta tukkuksraptiŋnun igluanun Mnason Cyprus-mium, ukpiqtuaġuŋaruaq sivulliqsigun ukpiqtuatigun.

english: When we arrived in Jerusalem, the brothers welcomed us gladly.
inupiaq: Tikiññapta Jerusalem-mun, aniqatit paġlapiaġataŋagaatigut.

english: The next day Paul went in with us to see James, and all the elders were there.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman Paul piqasiŋagaatigut tautugiaqługu James, aasii umialiŋnat iluqaġmiŋ tavraniinŋarut.

english: When Paul had greeted them, he began to explain in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.
inupiaq: Paul paġlaqqaaqługich quliaqtuaġutiŋagai iluqapayauraŋiññik savaamigun God-im piŋaraŋiñik akunġanni Jew-guŋitchuat.

english: When they heard this, they praised God. Then they said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are who have believed, and they are all ardent observers of the law.
inupiaq: Naalaktuaganikamirruŋ Paul, iluqaġmiŋ God nanġaŋagaat. Aasii Paul uqallautiŋagaat, Aniqaan, iḷisimarutin iñugiapiaġataqtut Jew-guruat ukpiliŋaruat, iliŋisa siġmaaġutigigaich pitqurat.

english: They have been informed about you – that you teach all the Jews now living among the Gentiles to abandon Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs.
inupiaq: Aasii iliŋich kiliktuusiaqaŋarut ilipkun iḷisaurriñivḷutin iluqaiññik Jew-guruanik akunġanni iñuuruanik Jew-guŋitchuat nunaŋiññi suksraaquvlugich pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun, uqautinivḷugich nalunaiñŋutchiquŋił̣ł̣ugich miqłiqtuŋich timiŋisigun, kamagiŋaiġḷugiḷḷu Jew-guruat piḷġusiŋich.

english: What then should we do? They will no doubt hear that you have come.
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik tusaaniaqtut qaisiḷaaġnik. Aasii qanuġniaqpisa?

english: So do what we tell you: We have four men who have taken a vow;
inupiaq: Piiñ uqaluptigun iliŋnun. Sisamat imma maani aŋutit unniqsuqłiiŋaruat God-mun.

english: take them and purify yourself along with them and pay their expenses, so that they may have their heads shaved. Then everyone will know there is nothing in what they have been told about you, but that you yourself live in conformity with the law.
inupiaq: Piqasiuttuiñ taipkunuŋa aŋutinun, salummaqsaġlutin Jew-guruat piḷġusiatiktun pitquramikkun aasii akiḷiutilugich, niaqqutiŋ saliyumiñaqsiyumagaich. Tainnaġuvsi, iluqaġmiŋ iñuich iḷitchuġiniaqtut taŋiġisilaaŋanik kiliktuusiaqtiŋ ilipkun, aglaan ilivitchauq iñuuniñiaġaatin kamagivlugich pitqurat qaisauruat Moses-kun.

english: But regarding the Gentiles who have believed, we have written a letter, having decided that they should avoid meat that has been sacrificed to idols and blood and what has been strangled and sexual immorality.”
inupiaq: Aglaan apiġiŋitkivut Jew-guŋitchuat ukpiqtuaġuŋaruat kamagitquvlugich Jew-guruat piḷġusiŋich. Qanuq tuyuaniŋagivut niġitquŋił̣ł̣ugich niqinik ilaaguaqtauruanik iñuuraqpaŋnun, auktuquŋił̣ł̣ugiḷḷu, niġitquŋił̣ł̣ugiḷḷu niġrutinik auŋich maqinŋaitchuanik, allatuquŋił̣ł̣ugiḷḷu.

english: Then Paul took the men the next day, and after he had purified himself along with them, he went to the temple and gave notice of the completion of the days of purification, when the sacrifice would be offered for each of them.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul piŋagai taipkua aŋutit, aasii uvlaakumman salummaksaqłuni pitquratigun piqatigivlugich. Aasii ilaa isiŋaruq aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun uqallautiyaqtuqługu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpak qakuguaglaan salummaqsaġniqtiŋ naanniaqtilaaŋanik, aasii naatpan, atausiullaalutiŋ iluqatiŋ aitchuisaġlutiŋ ikipkautinik.

english: When the seven days were almost over, the Jews from the province of Asia who had seen him in the temple area stirred up the whole crowd and seized him,
inupiaq: Tallimat malġuk uvlut naatkaqsimmiullu, iḷaŋich Jews qaiŋaruat nunaaqqiŋiñiñ Asia-m, tautuŋagaat Paul aŋaiyyuvikpaum iḷuani. Tavra ilaisa tuavaallaktinŋagaich iñusalaich, aasii tigguġlukługu Paul,

english: shouting, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people, our law, and this sanctuary! Furthermore he has brought Greeks into the inner courts of the temple and made this holy place ritually unclean!”
inupiaq: nipaalavlutiŋ, Israel-guruasii, ikayuġitchi. Uvva una iñuk iḷisaurriruaq iñuŋnik sumiḷiqaa paaqłakługich Israel-guruat, pitqurallu qaisauruat Moses-kun unalu aŋaiyyuvikpak. Aasiuvva paŋmapak qaġġirrimmiuq iḷaŋiññik Jew-guŋitchuat itqutivlugich aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun, aasii salumaiḷivḷugu una ini ilaaguaqtauŋaruaq God-mun.

english: (For they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him previously, and they assumed Paul had brought him into the inner temple courts.)
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġiŋagaat tautuŋavlugu Trophimus Ephesus-miu piqatigimmagu Paul-gum iniqpaŋmi, iḷimasukłutiŋ Paul-mun itqutiŋanasugalugu aŋaiyyuvikpaum iḷuanun.

english: The whole city was stirred up, and the people rushed together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple courts, and immediately the doors were shut.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ iniqpaum iñuŋi tuavaallaŋarut, aasii iñuich aqpałłutiŋ atautchikun tigguġluŋagaat Paul aasii kaliksraqługu annisiŋagaat aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ. Tavrauvvaa aŋaiyyuvikpaum upkuaŋi umiktuŋagaich.

english: While they were trying to kill him, a report was sent up to the commanding officer of the cohort that all Jerusalem was in confusion.
inupiaq: Tavra tuavaalaruat tuqunniaqsaaqsimmigaallu Paul, iḷitchuġipkaŋagaat atanauraŋat Rome-miut aŋuyaktiŋisa, iluqaġmiŋ Jerusalem iñuŋi tuavaallaŋnivḷugich.

english: He immediately took soldiers and centurions and ran down to the crowd. When they saw the commanding officer and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
inupiaq: Tavrauvvaa ilaan aullautiŋagai aŋuyaktit atanauraŋiḷḷu aasii upaktuqługich tuqługich iñusalaich. Tavra pialaruat iñuich, tautukamirruŋ atanauraŋat aŋuyaktit aŋuyaktiŋiḷu, Paul anaumiŋaiŋagaat.

english: Then the commanding officer came up and arrested him and ordered him to be tied up with two chains; he then asked who he was and what he had done.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata ullakługu Paul, tigutaaŋagaa piraksriivḷuni qiḷiqsruitquvlugu malġuiñik kalimñanik. Tavra ilaan apiġiŋagai iñusalaich, Kiñauvvauna iñuk? Suniglu piŋava?

english: But some in the crowd shouted one thing, and others something else, and when the commanding officer was unable to find out the truth because of the disturbance, he ordered Paul to be brought into the barracks.
inupiaq: Iñuich iḷaŋich kasimaruaniñ saqłaŋarut qanuġliqaa. Tuavaalavaił̣ł̣utiŋ atanauraŋat aŋuyaktit iḷitchuġillaiġutiŋaruq suna pipiaqtilaaŋanik. Tavraasii piraksriŋagai iñuŋni, tigulugu Paul aŋuyaktit igluannuutitquvlugu.

english: When he came to the steps, Paul had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the mob,
inupiaq: Tikiññamiŋ igluqpaum tutipqiŋiñun, aŋuyaktit kivikataŋagaat unnii Paul iñuich piaqłuktaliqpaił̣ł̣utiŋ.

english: for a crowd of people followed them, screaming, “Away with him!”
inupiaq: Qanuq piaqłuktaliqsuat iñuich maliqataqługu saqłaŋarut, Tuqutauli.

english: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he said to the commanding officer, “May I say something to you?” The officer replied, “Do you know Greek?
inupiaq: Tavra Paul itqutisaġmanni aŋuyaktit igluŋiññun, uqallautiŋagaa aŋuyaktit atanauraŋat, Uqallautillakkumiñaqpigiñ. Ilaan apiġiŋagaa, Uqayuvich Greek-tun?

english: Then you’re not that Egyptian who started a rebellion and led the four thousand men of the ‘Assassins’ into the wilderness some time ago?”
inupiaq: Egypt-miuguŋitpich taimña qaŋaqqammiuraq piallaktitchiruaq akiḷḷiḷiqsuunmik, aullativlugich nunagluktuamun 4,000 iññuqłuich satkuliraqługich?

english: Paul answered, “I am a Jew from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of an important city. Please allow me to speak to the people.”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul kiuŋagaa, Uvaŋa Jew-guruŋa aniŋaruŋa Tarsus-mi Cilicia-miittuami, iḷauvluŋa nuimaruamun iniqpaŋmun. Uqallakkumiñaqpik iñuŋnun?

english: When the commanding officer had given him permission, Paul stood on the steps and gestured to the people with his hand. When they had become silent, he addressed them in Aramaic,
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata uqallakkumiñaqsiŋagaa. Tavra Paul makinŋaruq tunmiqqanun, aasii urriqavluni argaŋmiñik iñuŋnun. Iñuich nipaiġmata Paul uqallautiŋagai Hebrew-tun.

english: “Brothers and fathers, listen to my defense that I now make to you.”
inupiaq: Aniqatiit aapauruallu, naalaġnisiŋa patchisaiññiaġnipkun sivuqqavsiññi.

english: (When they heard that he was addressing them in Aramaic, they became even quieter.) Then Paul said,
inupiaq: Tavra tusaakamirruŋ uqallautimmatiŋ Hebrew-tun uqaqłuni, nipaimmaġiksaaŋarut. Aasii Paul uqallaŋaruq.

english: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but brought up in this city, educated with strictness under Gamaliel according to the law of our ancestors, and was zealous for God just as all of you are today.
inupiaq: Uvaŋa Jew-guruŋa, aniŋaruŋa Tarsus-mi Cilicia-miittuami, aglaan iñuguqłuŋa uvani Jerusalem-mi, iḷisaurriqaqłuŋa Gamaliel-mik. Iḷisaurrusiaqaqłuŋa tuvraipiaġatallaŋnikun pitquraŋiññik maŋŋuupta, suli kipiġniupiaġataqłuŋaptauq ilivsisun iviġagukługu God.

english: I persecuted this Way even to the point of death, tying up both men and women and putting them in prison,
inupiaq: Sivuani nagliksaaqtitchuuŋagitka iñuich tuqunniallavlugich ukpiqtuat Jesus-mun, tigutaaqługich aŋutillu aġnallu tigutaaġviŋmun.

english: as both the high priest and the whole council of elders can testify about me. From them I also received letters to the brothers in Damascus, and I was on my way to make arrests there and bring the prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat iluqaġmiglu uqaqsitaaqtitchirit arguanaiġumiñaġaat iḷumun uqaqtilaaġa. Iliŋiññiñ aitchuusiaqaŋaruŋa tuyuutinik aniqatinun Jew-guruanun Damascus-miittuanun. Aasii iglauŋaruŋa tigutaaġiaqługich Jesus-mun ukpiqtuat, qiḷiqsruiḷugich Jerusalem-muutisukługich tatavsaqtautqulugich.

english: As I was en route and near Damascus, about noon a very bright light from heaven suddenly flashed around me.
inupiaq: Iglaullaġma qallimmiuŋalu Damascus-mun, uvluq qitiqqaqpalliġmiuġlu qaumaniqpak qiḷaŋmiñ tavraŋŋatchiaq qaummaġiksinŋaruq avatimnun.

english: Then I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’
inupiaq: Tavra ulġuŋaruŋa nunamun aasii tusaavluŋa nipimik uqallaktuamik uvamnun, Saul, Saul, summan nagliksaaqtitpiŋa?

english: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus the Nazarene, whom you are persecuting.’
inupiaq: Aasii kiuŋagiga, Kiuvich ququularuatiin uvamnik? Ilaalli kiuŋagaaŋa, Jesus-guruŋa Nazareth-miu nagliksaaqtitaġma.

english: Those who were with me saw the light, but did not understand the voice of the one who was speaking to me.
inupiaq: Tamatkuali tuvaaqatigikkaġma tautuŋagaluaġaat qaummaq aglaan tusaaŋaitkaat nipaa uqaqtuam uvamnun.

english: So I asked, ‘What should I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Get up and go to Damascus; there you will be told about everything that you have been designated to do.’
inupiaq: Tavra apiġiŋagiga, Suniaqpik uvaŋa Ataniiq? Tavra Atanġum uqallautiŋagaaŋa, Makillutin, Damascus-mugiñ. Taamani uqallautiniaġaatin supayaanik God-im piraksriutiŋiñik iliŋnun.

english: Since I could not see because of the brilliance of that light, I came to Damascus led by the hand of those who were with me.
inupiaq: Tavra tautuksiḷḷaiġñiqama qaummaġikpaił̣ł̣uni taimña qaumaniq, tasirriutiŋagaanŋa iglauqatiŋma aullativluŋa Damascus-mun.

english: A man named Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well spoken of by all the Jews who live there,
inupiaq: Tavraniinŋaruq iñuk atiqaqtuaq Ananias, god-tiliqiruaq kamagivlugich pitquravut isumakkusiaqaġluataqłuniḷu iluqaiññiñ Jew-guruaniñ iñuuruaniñ Damascus-mi.

english: came to me and stood beside me and said to me, ‘Brother Saul, regain your sight!’ And at that very moment I looked up and saw him.
inupiaq: Ullautiŋaruq uvamnun, aasii makiłłuni saniqqamnun uqallautiŋagaaŋa, Aniqaan Saul, tautullasiiñ. Tavra tavrauvvaa tautullasiŋaruŋa aasii qiviaqługu.

english: Then he said, ‘The God of our ancestors has already chosen you to know his will, to see the Righteous One, and to hear a command from his mouth,
inupiaq: Tavra ilaan uqallautiŋagaaŋa, God-iŋata maŋŋuupta piksraqtaaġiŋagaatin iḷitchuġitquvlutin pisuunmiñik, tautuquvlugu piḷuutaitchuaq Kivgani, suli tusaatquvlugu ilaan nipaa.

english: because you will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard.
inupiaq: Aasii taamna tautuŋakkan tusaaŋakkallu uqautimmatin, quliaqtuaġiniaġiñ iñupayaanun.

english: And now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized, and have your sins washed away, calling on his name.’
inupiaq: Aasiuvva paŋmapak summan utaqqivich? Makillutin paptaiqsaugiñ, aasii piḷuutitin piiqsillugich, aŋaiyyutikun ikayuqtaiḷiqilutin ilaanun.

english: When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple, I fell into a trance
inupiaq: Utianikama Jerusalem-mun aŋaiyyuniallaġma aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, qiñiqtuuraaŋaruŋa,

english: and saw the Lord saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not accept your testimony about me.’
inupiaq: aasii tautukługu Ataniq uqallaktuaq uvamnun, Qilamiqsruġlutin aullaġasuaġiñ Jerusalem-miñ, qanuq iñuich uvani ukpiġiniaŋitkaat quliaqtuan uvapkun.

english: I replied, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat those in the various synagogues who believed in you.
inupiaq: Aasii kiuŋagiga, Ataniiq, iliŋich iḷisimalluataqtut aŋaiyyuvipayaani tigutaaqsisuutilaamnik anaumikł̣ugiḷḷu tamatkua ukpiqtuat iliŋnun.

english: And when the blood of your witness Stephen was shed, I myself was standing nearby, approving, and guarding the cloaks of those who were killing him.’
inupiaq: Suli Stephen alġaqsruirin tuqutaumman makitaŋammiuŋa tavrani, iviġaumagivlugu tuqutauniŋa, qaunagivlugiḷḷu annuġaaŋich taapkua iñuaqtuat ilaanik.

english: Then he said to me, ‘Go, because I will send you far away to the Gentiles.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum uqallautiŋagaaŋa, Aullaġiñ, qanuq tiliñiaġikpiñ uŋasiksuamun Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: The crowd was listening to him until he said this. Then they raised their voices and shouted, “Away with this man from the earth! For he should not be allowed to live!”
inupiaq: Taavrumuŋaaglaan uqallautaanun, iñusalaich Paul naalaġniŋagaat. Tavraasii niparraqsiŋarut nipatutilaamiktun, uqaqłutiŋ, Tuqulliuna innasiq iñuk. Qanuq iñuuruksrauŋitchuq.

english: While they were screaming and throwing off their cloaks and tossing dust in the air,
inupiaq: Tavra nipaalapkaqługich annuġaamiŋniglu takuyaġaqtillugich miḷḷuutigivlugulu nunam avyua siḷamun,

english: the commanding officer ordered Paul to be brought back into the barracks. He told them to interrogate Paul by beating him with a lash so that he could find out the reason the crowd was shouting at Paul in this way.
inupiaq: Rome-miut aŋuyaktiŋisa atanauraŋata piraksriŋagai iñuŋni itqutitquvlugu Paul aŋuyaktit igluŋiññun, suli uqallautivlugich ipiġaqtuġlugu iḷitchuġisaquvlugich sumik Jew-guruat saqłautiqaqtilaaŋannik ilaagun.

english: When they had stretched him out for the lash, Paul said to the centurion standing nearby, “Is it legal for you to lash a man who is a Roman citizen without a proper trial?”
inupiaq: Tavra qiḷiqsruiganiŋmanni akłunaanik ipiġaqtuġukługu, Paul-gum uqallautiŋagaa aŋuyaktit atanauraŋat makitaruaq tavrani, Pitqurani nalaunŋava ipiġaqtuġuvsiuŋ iñuk Rome-miunun iḷauruaq, isivġiqsauŋaiñŋaan?

english: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commanding officer and reported it, saying, “What are you about to do? For this man is a Roman citizen.”
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata taamna tusaakamiuŋ, ullautiŋaruq qaukłiannun aŋuyaktit aasii uqallautivlugu, Susaġumaagaqsivich? Taamna iñuk Rome-miunun iḷauruq.

english: So the commanding officer came and asked Paul, “Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?” He replied, “Yes.”
inupiaq: Qaukłiata ullakługu Paul apiġiŋagaa, Uqallautiŋŋa, Rome-miunun iḷauvich? Paul kiuŋagaa, Aaŋ.

english: The commanding officer answered, “I acquired this citizenship with a large sum of money.” “But I was even born a citizen,” Paul replied.
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit qaukłiat uqallaŋaruq, Tauqsiŋagiga taamna iḷaliutinik manisalaŋnik. Paul uqallaŋaruq, Aglaan uvaŋa aniŋaruŋa nutim iḷauvluŋa.

english: Then those who were about to interrogate him stayed away from him, and the commanding officer was frightened when he realized that Paul was a Roman citizen and that he had had him tied up.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua apiqsruqtuiyumaruat Paul-mik niguutiŋarut ilaaniñ tavrauvvaa, taamnalu aŋuyaktit qaukłiat iqsitchaŋammiuq iḷitchuġivluni Paul Rome-miunun iḷautilaaŋanik ilaallu qiḷiqsruiñiqamiuŋ.

english: The next day, because the commanding officer wanted to know the true reason Paul was being accused by the Jews, he released him and ordered the chief priests and the whole council to assemble. He then brought Paul down and had him stand before them.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaakumman aŋuyaktit qaukłiat kipiġniuqłuni iḷisimasukługu nalupqinaiġḷugu sumik Jew-guruanun pasisilaaŋanik Paul. Qiḷiġutaiŋagaa Paul, aasii piraksriqł̣ugich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iluqaisalu uqaqsitaaqtitchirit katitquvlugich. Tavra ilaan qaġġisiŋagaa Paul ilaiññun aasii inillakługu sivuġaannun.

english: Paul looked directly at the council and said, “Brothers, I have lived my life with a clear conscience before God to this day.”
inupiaq: Tavra takunnaqługich uqaqsitaaqtitchirit Paul uqallaŋaruq, Aniqatiit, uvlupaŋmun-aglaan isumamni piitchuŋa naġġutchaunmik iluqaagun iñuuniaġnipkun sivuġaani God-im.

english: At that the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiata Ananias-gum piraksriŋagai tamatkua makitaruat saniġaani patiquvlugu Paul qanġagun.

english: Then Paul said to him, “God is going to strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit there judging me according to the law, and in violation of the law you order me to be struck?”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-gum uqallautiŋagaa, Isivġiqsauŋŋuaqtuatiin, God-im nalupqinaitchuq tatavsaġniaġaatin. Aquppirutin isivġiġukłuŋa pitquratigun, aasiiñ ilivich kipuqłakługich pitqurat piraksriirutin patiquvluŋa.

english: Those standing near him said, “Do you dare insult God’s high priest?”
inupiaq: Tamatkua makitaruat saniġaani uqallaŋarut Paul-mun, Uqamaqłuutigiñ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat, God-im kivgaŋa.

english: Paul replied, “I did not realize, brothers, that he was the high priest, for it is written, ‘You must not speak evil about a ruler of your people.’”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul kiuŋagai, Aniqatiit, naluruŋa aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun qaukłiġitilaaŋanik. Qanuq aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, “Uqautiginiaŋitkiñ pigiiḷiḷugu atanauraŋat iñukpich.”

english: Then when Paul noticed that part of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees, he shouted out in the council, “Brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. I am on trial concerning the hope of the resurrection of the dead!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul iḷitchuġikami kasimaruat alġaiŋich Sadducee-guniġmata, aasii alġaiŋich Pharisee-guvlutiŋ, uqallaŋaruq nipatusivḷuni uqaqsitaaqtitchiriñun, Aniqatiit, uvaŋa Pharisee-guruŋa, iġñiŋa Pharisee-m. Isivġiġaanŋa uvani pisigivlugu niġiugikapkich tuquŋaruat aŋiñiaġnivḷugich.

english: When he said this, an argument began between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna uqallausiġipqauraġmagu, Pharisee-ḷḷu Sadducee-ḷḷu qanaarraqsiŋarut, aasii kasimaruat atiŋaiŋarut.

english: (For the Sadducees say there is no resurrection, or angel, or spirit, but the Pharisees acknowledge them all.)
inupiaq: Qanuq Sadducees uqaġuurut iñuich aŋiniaŋiññivḷugich tuqqunmiñ, isaġulgiññivḷugulu ilitqusiiññivḷugulu, aglaalli Pharisees iluqaisa ukpiġivlugich innivḷugich.

english: There was a great commotion, and some experts in the law from the party of the Pharisees stood up and protested strongly, “We find nothing wrong with this man. What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?”
inupiaq: Tavra kasimaruat nipatusisaiññaŋarut, aasii iḷaŋich iḷisaurrit pitquranik iḷauruat Pharisee-ñun makinŋarut, aasii qapiqtaiḷiqpakłutiŋ uqaqłutiŋ, Iḷitchuġiŋitchugut suuramik-unnii piḷuktuamik uumani iñuŋmi. Iḷaanniḷuunnii ilitqutchim naagga isaġulgum uqautipiaŋagaa.

english: When the argument became so great the commanding officer feared that they would tear Paul to pieces, he ordered the detachment to go down, take him away from them by force, and bring him into the barracks.
inupiaq: Tavra uqavaaqtuat suammaŋmata, qaukłiat aŋuyaktit anayatchaŋaruq Paul siquvrataġinasugalugu iliŋiññun. Tavraasii piraksriŋagai aŋuyaktini atqaquvlugich kasimaruanun aullautitquvlugu Paul, aasii itqutilugu aŋuyaktit igluŋiññun.

english: The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said, “Have courage, for just as you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.”
inupiaq: Taavrumani unnuami Ataniq makinŋaruq saniġaanun Paul aasii uqallautivlugu, Qapiŋanak. Quliaqtuaġimmatuttauq Jerusalem-mi, quliaqtuaġiraksraġiniaġmigiŋma Rome-mi.

english: When morning came, the Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink anything until they had killed Paul.
inupiaq: Uvlaaġmagu Jew-guruat kasimavlutiŋ sivunniuŋarut unniqsuqłiipiaġataqłutiŋ niġiyumiñaiññivḷutiŋ imiġuraġumiñaiññivḷutiglu tuqutqaaŋaunnagu Paul.

english: There were more than forty of them who formed this conspiracy.
inupiaq: Sippaqaŋaruq malġukipiaq iñuich sivunniuqatigiiksuat taavrumiŋa.

english: They went to the chief priests and the elders and said, “We have bound ourselves with a solemn oath not to partake of anything until we have killed Paul.
inupiaq: Tavra iliŋich ullautiŋarut aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun umialiŋnanullu, aasii uqallakłutiŋ, Pisaġisapiaġataqługu unniqsuqłiipiaġataŋarugut uvaptiŋnik niġiyumiñaiqł̣uta suuramik-unnii tuqunŋaunnagu Paul.

english: So now you and the council request the commanding officer to bring him down to you, as if you were going to determine his case by conducting a more thorough inquiry. We are ready to kill him before he comes near this place.”
inupiaq: Ilivsiasii piqasiġḷusi uqaqsitaaqtitchiriñik, kilikkumagiksi Rome-miut aŋuyaktiŋisa qaukłiat qaġġisitqulugu Paul ilivsiññun, sivunnimmaġiksaaġugniḷugu pimaqłuutaa. Uvagut itqanaiññiaqtugut tuqutchuglugu tavruŋa tikiñŋaiñŋaan.

english: But when the son of Paul’s sister heard about the ambush, he came and entered the barracks and told Paul.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-gum uyuġua tusaaŋaruq sivunniuġutaannik, aasii isiqłuni aŋuyaktit igluannun kiliŋagaa Paul.

english: Paul called one of the centurions and said, “Take this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to report to him.”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul ququaŋagaa iḷaŋat aŋuyaktit atanauraŋisa aasii uqallautivlugu, Una nukatpiaq aŋuyaktit qaukłiannuuttuuŋ. Samma uqallautiksraqaqtuq ilaanun.

english: So the centurion took him and brought him to the commanding officer and said, “The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you.”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata qaġġisiŋagaa qaukłiannun aŋuyaktit aasii uqallakłuni, Paul-gum tigutaaqtam ququakkaŋanii aasii apiġivluŋa qaġġisitquvlugu una nukatpiaq iliŋnun. Samma uqallautiksraqaqtuq sumik iliŋnun.

english: The commanding officer took him by the hand, withdrew privately, and asked, “What is it that you want to report to me?”
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit qaukłiata tasirriutivlugu asivaqtaaġutiŋagaa, aasii apiġivlugu iñuił̣aami, Sumik uqallautisuktaġma?

english: He replied, “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as if they were going to inquire more thoroughly about him.
inupiaq: Tavra nukatpiam uqallautiŋagaa, Jew-guruat sivunniŋarut apiġisukłutin qaġġisitqulugu Paul uqaqsitaaqtitchiriñun uvlaakun, apiqsruqtuġumaŋŋuaġlugu pasiummaġiksaaġlugu.

english: So do not let them persuade you to do this, because more than forty of them are lying in ambush for him. They have bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink anything until they have killed him, and now they are ready, waiting for you to agree to their request.”
inupiaq: Aglaan aŋiġnagich, qanuq malġukipiaq iñuich sippalik iriqsimaniaqtut utaqqiḷugu Paul. Taapkua unniqsuqłiipiaġataŋarut niġiyumiñaiññivḷutiŋ imiġumiñaiññivḷutiglu tuqutqaaŋaunnagu Paul, aasii paŋmapak itqanaitchut taamna pisukługu, utaqqirullu sivunniutiksraġnik.

english: Then the commanding officer sent the young man away, directing him, “Tell no one that you have reported these things to me.”
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit qaukłiata anipkaŋagaa nukatpiaq piraksriqł̣ugu, Uqallautinagu kiñapayaaq kiliŋniḷuŋa taavrumiŋa.

english: Then he summoned two of the centurions and said, “Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea along with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen by nine o’clock tonight,
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit qaukłiata qaitquŋagik malġuk aŋuyaktit atanauraŋik, aasii uqallautivlugik, Itqanaiyaġitchik 200-mik aŋuyaktinik aullaqtuksranik Caesarea-mun, piqasiġḷugich 70 tuttuqpaŋni kakaksiqsuanik, 200-niglu panaliraqtuanik, aasii itqanaitchumausi aullaġumiñaqsiḷusi nainukłaaqpan unnuapak.

english: and provide mounts for Paul to ride so that he may be brought safely to Felix the governor.”
inupiaq: Suli kakaksiġviqaqtitchumagiksi Paul, aasii tikiutilugu sugaluaġnagu Felix-mun kavanauruamun.

english: He wrote a letter that went like this:
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit qaukłiat tuyuksriuŋaruq inna ittuanik.

english: So the soldiers, in accordance with their orders, took Paul and brought him to Antipatris during the night.
inupiaq: Claudias Lysias, Kamanaqtuamun kavanamun Felix-mun, paġlan.

english: The next day they let the horsemen go on with him, and they returned to the barracks.
inupiaq: Unauvva iñuk Jew-guruat tigguġluŋakkaŋat tuqutchaqługu. Ullaŋagitka aŋuyaktiliraqłuŋa aasii annautivlugu, iḷitchuġivlugu Rome-miunun iḷautilaaŋa.

english: When the horsemen came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.
inupiaq: Aasii kipiġniuġutigivlugu iḷitchuġisukługu pasikkutaat uqautikkusiaŋa, qaġġisiŋagiga uqaqsitaaġviannun.

english: When the governor had read the letter, he asked what province he was from. When he learned that he was from Cilicia,
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġiŋaruŋa sumik piŋaisilaaŋanik tuqqutauyumiñaqtuamik naaggaunnii tigutaaġutauyumiñaqtuamik. Pasiŋagaat apiqqutitigun pitquramiŋniittuatigun.

english: he said, “I will give you a hearing when your accusers arrive too.” Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod’s palace.
inupiaq: Tavra kiliŋmanŋa Jew-guruanun sivunniuġutinivḷugu piyumigivlugu, aullaqtitchuliŋagiga iliŋnun tavrauvvaa. Uqallautiŋagitka pasiriŋi uqautigitquvlugu Paul sivuġaġni.

english: After five days the high priest Ananias came down with some elders and an attorney named Tertullus, and they brought formal charges against Paul to the governor.
inupiaq: Tavra tallimat uvlut pianiŋmata aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat Ananias tikiñŋaruq Caesarea-mun, umialiŋnallu iḷaŋich, pitquraliqirilu atiqaqtuaq Tertullus-mik. Iliŋisa uqautigiŋagaat kavanamun pasikkurriŋ Paul-mun.

english: When Paul had been summoned, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “We have experienced a lengthy time of peace through your rule, and reforms are being made in this nation through your foresight.
inupiaq: Tavra Tertullus qaitquraukami, uqautigirraqsiŋagaa Paul uqaqłuni, Kamanaqtuatiin Felix, isumatuvlutin aullarriñiqpich sivisuruamik aŋuyautairrutiqaqtinŋagaatigut, iñugiaktuatigullu iłuaqsruutitigun savautiŋagiptigut anniqsuutauruanik nunauniptiŋnun.

english: Most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this everywhere and in every way with all gratitude.
inupiaq: Taamna quyyatigigikput sumiḷiqaa ataramik, aasii quyanaapiaġataġiptigiñ.

english: But so that I may not delay you any further, I beg you to hear us briefly with your customary graciousness.
inupiaq: Piviksran atuqpaitchuŋitkiga aasii apiġipiaġikpiñ, qiñuiḷḷutin naalaġniḷḷaquvlutin uqaluksraptiŋnik.

english: For we have found this man to be a troublemaker, one who stirs up riots among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.
inupiaq: Una iñuk iḷitchuġigikput iññuqłuuvlugu, ilaan aullaqisuugai tuavaallatit Jew-guruani nunami iluqaani, aullarrauvluniḷu Nazarene-guruanun.

english: He even tried to desecrate the temple, so we arrested him.
inupiaq: Ilaan suli Jew-guŋitchuat itqutiniataŋagai aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmun, salumaiḷḷisauyumiñaqtuat. Aasii tigutaaŋagikput, isivġiġuqługu pitquraptigun.

english: When you examine him yourself, you will be able to learn from him about all these things we are accusing him of doing.”
inupiaq: Aasii qaukłiata aŋuyaktit Lysias-gum upaktuŋagaatigut, aasii piaqłuktaqłuta aullautiŋagaa uvaptiŋniñ.

english: The Jews also joined in the verbal attack, claiming that these things were true.
inupiaq: Aasii Lysias piraksriŋaruq Paul pasiriŋi iliŋnun uqaġiaquvlugich. Qanuqitilaaġlugu iliŋnik iḷitchuġiyumiñaġniaqtutin ilaaniñ supayaatigun pasikkutiptiŋnik ilaanun.

english: When the governor gestured for him to speak, Paul replied, “Because I know that you have been a judge over this nation for many years, I confidently make my defense.
inupiaq: Tavra Jew-guruattauq iḷaŋammigaat pasikkutaat uqaqłutiŋ iḷumun innipiaġataqługich pasikkutiŋich.

english: As you can verify for yourself, not more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
inupiaq: Tavrali kavanam urriqavigimmani Paul uqaquvluni, Paul uqallaŋaruq, Iḷisimaruŋa atanġuŋarutin ukunuŋa nunauruanun ukiuni iñugiaktuani. Quviasupiaġataqtuŋa uqautigigupku patchisaisilaaġa sivuġaġni.

english: They did not find me arguing with anyone or stirring up a crowd in the temple courts or in the synagogues or throughout the city,
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġiniaqtutin iliŋnik qulit malġuk uvlut sipinŋaitchut aŋaiyyuyaqtuaqama Jerusalem-mi.

english: nor can they prove to you the things they are accusing me of doing.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat iḷitchuġiŋaitkaluaġaanŋa qapiqtaiḷiqatiqaqtilluŋa iñuŋmik aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, naaggaunnii iḷitchuġiŋaitkaanŋa piallaktitchiñiaġluŋa iñuŋnik aŋaiyyuviŋiññi, naaggaunnii Jerusalem-mi.

english: But I confess this to you, that I worship the God of our ancestors according to the Way (which they call a sect), believing everything that is according to the law and that is written in the prophets.
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii ukpiġnaqsiḷiġumiñaitkaat iliŋnun paŋmapak pasikkutigikkaqtiŋ uvamnun.

english: I have a hope in God (a hope that these men themselves accept too) that there is going to be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous.
inupiaq: Uvvaaglaan una piiḷaaġiyumiñaitkiga iliŋnun. Ukpiġigiga God-iŋat maŋŋuupta, tuvraqługu nutauruakun ukpiġniq iḷumun ittuaġiŋisaŋat ukua iñuich. Ukpiġimmigitka suli iluqaisa aglausimaruat pitqurani qaisauruani Moses-kun, makpiġaaŋiññiḷu Uqaqtiŋisa God-im.

english: This is the reason I do my best to always have a clear conscience toward God and toward people.
inupiaq: Niġiugimmigiga ukunatuttauq iñuktun God-mun iñupayaat aŋipkaġniaġnivḷugich tuqqunmiñ, nakuuruallu nakuuŋitchuallu.

english: After several years I came to bring to my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings,
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuuniḷuktuŋa pisuqtilaaptun patchisaiññiaqłuŋa God-mun iñuŋnullu.

english: which I was doing when they found me in the temple, ritually purified, without a crowd or a disturbance.
inupiaq: Piitqaaqłuŋa ukiuni iñugiaktuani Jerusalem-miñ, utiŋaruŋa saagaqługich maniich aitchuutit uvagut iñuptiŋnun, aitchuiyaqtuqłuŋalu ikipkautinik.
