english: But there are some Jews from the province of Asia who should be here before you and bring charges, if they have anything against me.
inupiaq: Taamna savaaġipkaqtillugu, paqinŋagaanŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi, naatchianikłuŋa salummaqtauganikłuŋa pitqurat uqaluatigun. Iñuŋnik iñugiaktuanik piqatiqaŋaitchuŋa pialaŋaitchugullu.

english: Or these men here should tell what crime they found me guilty of when I stood before the council,
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷaŋich Jew-guruat qairuat nunaaqqiŋiñiñ Asia-m tavraniinŋarut. Taipkua iliŋich qairuksraugaluaqtut sivuġaġnun aasii sunik pasikkutiksraqaġumiŋ uvapkun uqautilutin.

english: other than this one thing I shouted out while I stood before them: ‘I am on trial before you today concerning the resurrection of the dead.’”
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii ukua iñuich uqaġlich sunik killukuaġutinik iḷitchuġikkamiŋnik uvapkun makitakama uqaqsitaaġviŋmi.

english: Then Felix, who understood the facts concerning the Way more accurately, adjourned their hearing, saying, “When Lysias the commanding officer comes down, I will decide your case.”
inupiaq: Aglaan uvvauna atausiq pisigivlugu nivliutigiŋagiga nipatusivḷuŋa makitakama sivuġaanni. Isivġiġivsiŋa uvlupak pisigivlugu ukpiġniġa tuquŋaruat aŋipkaġniaġnivḷugich.

english: He ordered the centurion to guard Paul, but to let him have some freedom, and not to prevent any of his friends from meeting his needs.
inupiaq: Tavra Felix iḷisimmaġikł̣uni ukpiqtuaguruat piḷġusiŋiññik, aġiupkaŋagai kasimaruat uqallakłuni, Lysias qaukłiat aŋuyaktit qaikpan sivunniġñiaġiga uqavaaġutiksi.

english: Some days later, when Felix arrived with his wife Drusilla, who was Jewish, he sent for Paul and heard him speak about faith in Christ Jesus.
inupiaq: Tavra piraksriiŋaruq atanauraŋiññik aŋuyaktit Paul qaunaksriqaquvlugu aglaan tigutaaqsimavaiñŋaiġḷugu, avilaitqatiŋiññullu ullallaayumiñaqsiḷugu ikayuġiaqsaqparruŋ.

english: While Paul was discussing righteousness, self-control, and the coming judgment, Felix became frightened and said, “Go away for now, and when I have an opportunity, I will send for you.”
inupiaq: Uvlut qavsich pianiŋmata Felix qaiŋaruq nulianiḷu Drusilla, Jew-guruaq aġnaq. Ilaan qaitquŋagaa Paul aasii naalaaqsivḷugu uqautiqaġman qanuġlutiŋ iñuich ukpiliġumiñaqtilaaŋannik Christ Jesus-mun.

english: At the same time he was also hoping that Paul would give him money, and for this reason he sent for Paul as often as possible and talked with him.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul uqaaġataviksillugu iñuich nalaunŋaruakun iñuuruksrautilaaŋannik, qaaŋiulaaŋairrutikullu iñuuniaġniġmik, tikitchumaaqtuakullu isivġiġviksrautikun, Felix sivuuġatchaŋaruq aasii uqallakłuni, Piiḷḷagiñ uvaŋŋa. Piviksranikkuma qaitquvsaaġniaġikpiŋ.

english: After two years had passed, Porcius Festus succeeded Felix, and because he wanted to do the Jews a favor, Felix left Paul in prison.
inupiaq: Tavranivsauq Felix maniḷitquyumaŋagaluaqtuq Paul-mun. Tavra taamna pisigivlugu qaitquraġigaa akulaitchuamik suli uqaluqatigivlugu.

english: Now three days after Festus arrived in the province, he went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.
inupiaq: Tavra Festus piŋasunik uvlianikami nunamiñi, aullaŋaruq Caesarea-miñ Jerusalem-mun.

english: So the chief priests and the most prominent men of the Jews brought formal charges against Paul to him.
inupiaq: Tavrani aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu Jew-guruallu aullarriŋisa uqautigirraqsiŋagaich pasikkutitiŋ Paul-kun.

english: Requesting him to do them a favor against Paul, they urged Festus to summon him to Jerusalem, planning an ambush to kill him along the way.
inupiaq: Apiġiŋagaat Festus iviġallaglutiŋ Paul Jerusalem-muktitquvlugu, sivunniuŋavlutiŋ tuqutchukługu apqunmi.

english: Then Festus replied that Paul was being kept at Caesarea, and he himself intended to go there shortly.
inupiaq: Festus kiuŋagai, Paul tigutaaqtauniaqtuq suli Caesarea-mi, ilaalu sivuniqaġnivḷuni taamuŋa utiġnasuaġniaġnivḷuni.

english: “So,” he said, “let your leaders go down there with me, and if this man has done anything wrong, they may bring charges against him.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii uqallautiŋagai, Iñuich aullarrisi Caesarea-muglich maligluŋa, aasii pasiḷugu Paul taamani sumik pigiitchuanik piŋakpan.

english: After Festus had stayed not more than eight or ten days among them, he went down to Caesarea, and the next day he sat on the judgment seat and ordered Paul to be brought.
inupiaq: Tavra Festus uvliuvsaaŋaruq tallimat piŋasuniḷuunnii naagga qulini uvluni piqatigivlugich, aasii utiqłuni Caesarea-mun. Aasii uvlaakumman, isivġiirraqsiŋaruq aasii piraksriivḷuni Paul qaġġisitquvlugu.

english: When he arrived, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing many serious charges that they were not able to prove.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul qaimman, Jew-guruat Jerusalem-miŋŋaqtuat makitaŋarut avataani, pasiñiapiaġataqługu iñugiaktuatigun sutigun ukpiġnaqsiyumiñaiḷḷaisa pasikkutitiŋ.

english: Paul said in his defense, “I have committed no offense against the Jewish law or against the temple or against Caesar.”
inupiaq: Paul uqallaŋaruq patchisaiññiaġunmiñi, Suuramikunnii pimaqłuŋaitchuŋa kipuqłaglugich Jew-guruat pitquraŋich aŋaiyyuvikpauvlu, naaggaunnii Rome-miut umialgata.

english: But Festus, wanting to do the Jews a favor, asked Paul, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and be tried before me there on these charges?”
inupiaq: Tavra Festus, iviġallakkumavlugich Jew-guruat, apiġiŋagaa Paul, Utiġukpich Jerusalem-mun, aasii taamani qanuqitilaaqtaulutin sivuqqamni pasikkutiŋisigun iliŋnun?

english: Paul replied, “I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat, where I should be tried. I have done nothing wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.
inupiaq: Tavra Paul-gum kiuŋagaa, Makitaruŋa isivġiqsauruksrauvluŋa sivuġaani Rome umialgata piriŋisa. Pigiitchuamik sumik piŋaitchuŋa Jew-guruanun, ilivitchauq iḷisimalluataġmiutin.

english: If then I am in the wrong and have done anything that deserves death, I am not trying to escape dying, but if not one of their charges against me is true, no one can hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar!”
inupiaq: Tavraasii uvaŋa kipuqłaŋagupkich pitqurat sumiglu piŋaguma tuqurrutauyumiñaqtuamik, apiqsriŋitchuŋa naŋaġuglugu. Aglaan taŋiġitpan pasikkutaat uvamnun, kialiqaa aitchuutigiyumiñaitkaaŋa iliŋiññun. Isivġiqsauyyaġuktuŋa Rome-miut umialgannun.

english: Then, after conferring with his council, Festus replied, “You have appealed to Caesar; to Caesar you will go!”
inupiaq: Tavra Festus uqaaqatigiqqaaqługich ikayuqtini isivġiikami, kiuŋagaa, Rome-miut umialganun isivġiqsauyyaġukavich ilaanun aullaġniaqtutin.

english: After several days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus.
inupiaq: Tavra qavsiñik uvlianiŋmata, umialik Agrippa Bernice-lu tikiñŋaruk Caesarea-mun tautugiaqługu Festus.

english: While they were staying there many days, Festus explained Paul’s case to the king to get his opinion, saying, “There is a man left here as a prisoner by Felix.
inupiaq: Tavra uvliuġaniŋmaŋnik, Festus quliaqtuaġiŋagaa Paul pasikkusiaŋa umialiŋmun, uqaqłuni, Iñuk amma tigutaaqtauvlugu qimaŋakkaŋa Felix-gum.

english: When I was in Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me about him, asking for a sentence of condemnation against him.
inupiaq: Jerusalem-mukama, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaiḷḷu umialiŋnallu Jew-guruani uqautigiŋagaat pasivḷugu tuqutaullasiñiaqługu apiġivluŋa.

english: I answered them that it was not the custom of the Romans to hand over anyone before the accused had met his accusers face to face and had been given an opportunity to make a defense against the accusation.
inupiaq: Aglaalli kiuŋagitka piḷġusiġiŋiññivḷugu Rome-miunun iñuk pasirauruaq tatavsaġumiñaġlugu kasuutiŋaiñŋaan tavruŋa pasiriŋiñun, aasii uqaġviksraqaqtitauluni patchisaisilaamiñik taavrumuuna pasikkusiamigun.

english: So after they came back here with me, I did not postpone the case, but the next day I sat on the judgment seat and ordered the man to be brought.
inupiaq: Tavra iluqaġmiŋ qaimmata uvuŋa, piñatchiaŋaitchuŋa, uvlaakugiññaġman isivġiirraqsiŋaruŋa, aasii piraksriivḷuŋa Paul itqutitquvlugu.

english: When his accusers stood up, they did not charge him with any of the evil deeds I had suspected.
inupiaq: Ilaan akiḷḷiŋi makinnamiŋ pasikkutiksraitkaqsiŋarut sumik pigiitchuamik ilaagun niġiugusivsun.

english: Rather they had several points of disagreement with him about their own religion and about a man named Jesus who was dead, whom Paul claimed to be alive.
inupiaq: Aglaan uqavaaqatigiŋaniġaat Paul ukpiġikkaġmikkun iñukullu tuquŋaruakun atiqaqtuakun Jesus-mik, Paul-gum iñuupiaġataġnikkaŋagun.

english: Because I was at a loss how I could investigate these matters, I asked if he were willing to go to Jerusalem and be tried there on these charges.
inupiaq: Sivunniqsausiiñŋaruŋa qanuġluŋa iḷitchuġimmaġiksiyumiñaqtilaamnik tamatkunuuna pasikkutitigun, aasii apiġiŋagaluaġiga Paul Jerusalem-mugugmagaan taamani isivġiqsautquvlugu tamatkunuuna pasikkusiaŋigun.

english: But when Paul appealed to be kept in custody for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor, I ordered him to be kept under guard until I could send him to Caesar.”
inupiaq: Aglaan Paul apiqsrimman Caesar-mun umialganun Rome isivġiquvluni, uvaŋa uqallaŋaruŋa tigutaaqsimatquvlugu aullaqtitchumiñaqsiaġilugu Caesar-mun.

english: Agrippa said to Festus, “I would also like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he replied, “you will hear him.”
inupiaq: Tavra Agrippa uqallaŋaruq Festus-mun, Tusaasukkaluaġiga iñuk uvamnik. Festus-gum kiuŋagaa, Uvlaakun naalaktuaġisigiñ.

english: So the next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience hall, along with the senior military officers and the prominent men of the city. When Festus gave the order, Paul was brought in.
inupiaq: Tavra uvlaakumman Agrippa-lu Bernice-lu qaiŋaruk kamanaqsisapiaqłutiŋ qiññamiŋni. Isiqtuk kasimaruanun iñuŋnun piqatiqaqłutiŋ aŋuyaktit qaukłiŋiññik naumaruaniglu iñuŋiñik iniqpaum. Festus piraksriutaagun Paul itqutiŋagaat.

english: Then Festus said, “King Agrippa, and all you who are present here with us, you see this man about whom the entire Jewish populace petitioned me both in Jerusalem and here, shouting loudly that he ought not to live any longer.
inupiaq: Tavra Festus uqallaŋaruq, Umialiik Agrippa iluqapayauravsiḷu uvaniittuasii piqatigivluta, tautukkiksi uvva iñuk iluqaġmiŋ Jew-guruat maaniḷu Jerusalem-miḷu uqautigiŋakkaŋat uvamnun pasivḷugu. Saqłaŋarut iñuuruksrauŋaiġñivḷugu.

english: But I found that he had done nothing that deserved death, and when he appealed to His Majesty the Emperor, I decided to send him.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷitchuġiŋaitchuŋa sumik ilaan savaaŋanik tuqqutauyumiñaqtuamik. Aasii isivġiqumman Caesar-mun umialiŋmun, sivunniutiŋagiga taamuŋaqtitchukługu.

english: But I have nothing definite to write to my lord about him. Therefore I have brought him before you all, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that after this preliminary hearing I may have something to write.
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva sumik nalupqinaitchuamik pasikkunmik Paul-kun tuyuutiksraitchuŋa umialimñun. Taamna pisigivlugu qaġġisiŋagiga sivuqqavsiññun, iliŋnułhaaq ami Umialiik Agrippa, qanuqitilaaganikkuptigu tuyuutiksranikkasugaluŋa.

english: For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner without clearly indicating the charges against him.”
inupiaq: Qanuq qiññaqaqtuq uvamnun iruġnaġmatun aullaqtitchiñiq tigutaaqtamik Rome-mun nalupqinaisuŋaġnagu pasikkutauruaq ilaanun.

english: So Agrippa said to Paul, “You have permission to speak for yourself.” Then Paul held out his hand and began his defense:
inupiaq: Agrippa-m uqallautiŋagaa Paul, Uqaġumiñaqsipkaqtaurutin uqautigilutin iliŋnik. Tavra Paul isaaqługich argagni uqarraqsiŋaruq patchisaiññiġmigun inna.

english: “Regarding all the things I have been accused of by the Jews, King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate that I am about to make my defense before you today,
inupiaq: Umialiik Agrippa, Isummatigiruŋa uvamnik piḷḷuataġasugaluŋa sivuġaŋiutiyumiñaġniqama iliŋnun uvlupak, uqautigiyumiñaqługu patchisaisilaaġa iluqaisigun Jew-guruat pasikkutiŋisigun uvamnun.

english: because you are especially familiar with all the customs and controversial issues of the Jews. Therefore I ask you to listen to me patiently.
inupiaq: Qanukkiataŋ iḷisimmaaġiksutin iluqaiññik Jew-guruat piḷġusiŋiññik uqaġlaqutigisuukkaŋiññiglu. Taamna pisigivlugu apiġigikpiñ naalaġnitquvlutin uvamnik qiñuiġḷutin.

english: Now all the Jews know the way I lived from my youth, spending my life from the beginning among my own people and in Jerusalem.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ Jew-guruat iḷisimagaat qanuq iñuuniaġusiġa nutaġaunnamniñqaŋa. Iḷisimarut isuaniñqaŋa iñuuŋatilaamnik uvaŋa nanmiñiq nunamni Jerusalem-miḷu.

english: They know, because they have known me from time past, if they are willing to testify, that according to the strictest party of our religion, I lived as a Pharisee.
inupiaq: Uqaġutuaġumiŋ nalaullugu iḷisimakkaqtiŋ, iḷisimaŋammiut isuaniñqaŋa iḷautilaamnik kipuqłayunaitchuanun Pharisee-ñun piḷġusivsiŋñi.

english: And now I stand here on trial because of my hope in the promise made by God to our ancestors,
inupiaq: Aasiuvva paŋmapak makitaruŋa uvani qanuqitilaaqtauvluŋa pisigivlugu aŋŋiñ niġiuqsruutaa God-im maŋŋuuptiŋnun.

english: a promise that our twelve tribes hope to attain as they earnestly serve God night and day. Concerning this hope the Jews are accusing me, Your Majesty!
inupiaq: Taavrumiŋa qulit malġuk maŋŋuuvut niġiuktuat kipiġniuqłutiŋ tikiutisukłutiŋ, aŋaiyyuuqłutiŋ God-mun unnuamiḷu uvlumiḷu. Taavrumuunaasiuvva Umialiik, Jew-guruat pasigaanŋa.

english: Why do you people think it is unbelievable that God raises the dead?
inupiaq: Suvlusiasiuvva ilivsi siġḷiġnaġivisiuŋ ukpiġniksraq God-mun aŋipkaġumiñaqtilaaŋat tuquŋaruat?

english: Of course, I myself was convinced that it was necessary to do many things hostile to the name of Jesus the Nazarene.
inupiaq: Uvamniḷiuvva isumapiaġataŋagaluaqtuaŋaa taimani qanusiġairuksraunasugaluŋa ukpiqtuanik Jesus-mun Nazareth-miumun.

english: And that is what I did in Jerusalem: Not only did I lock up many of the saints in prisons by the authority I received from the chief priests, but I also cast my vote against them when they were sentenced to death.
inupiaq: Tainnaasii piŋaruŋa Jerusalem-mi. Aitchuusiaqaqłuŋa ataniġnaqunmik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋniñ, God-im iñuŋi iñugiaktuat tigutaaŋagitka, suli tuqutauruksraġuġmata iḷaalliqsuutimmiraqtuŋa piyuaqłiqsuanun.

english: I punished them often in all the synagogues and tried to force them to blaspheme. Because I was so furiously enraged at them, I went to persecute them even in foreign cities.
inupiaq: Tatavsaġayuŋagitkalu iñugiaktuani Jew-guruat aŋaiyyuvipayauraŋiññi, piiḷaaġipkaġniaqługu ukpiġutaat, suli suammautivaił̣ł̣ugich aullaġaqtuŋa uŋasiksuanun iniqpaŋnun nagliksaaqtitchukługich.

english: “While doing this very thing, as I was going to Damascus with authority and complete power from the chief priests,
inupiaq: Tainna piyaqtuqłuŋa, Damascus-mun aullaŋaruŋa ataniġnaqusiraqłuŋa piraksriusiaqaqłuŋalu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋniñ.

english: about noon along the road, Your Majesty, I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, shining everywhere around me and those traveling with me.
inupiaq: Umialiik, uvluq qitiqqaġman tautuŋagiga iglaullapta qaumaniq qiḷaŋmiñ, qaummaġił̣haaġniqsuaq siqiñiġmiñ, qaummatittuaq avatimnun taapkunuŋalu iglauqatimnun.

english: When we had all fallen to the ground, I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? You are hurting yourself by kicking against the goads.’
inupiaq: Tavra iluqata ulġuanikapta nunamun, tusaaŋaruŋa nipimik uqaqtuamik uvamnun Jew-guruat uqausiatigun, Saul, Saul, summan nagliksaaqtitpiŋa? Nagliksautiksriuqsiññaqtutin iliŋnun akiḷḷiḷiqsuqamŋa qimuktitun tukkaqtuatun qimuguksaaġunmun.

english: So I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ And the Lord replied, ‘I am Jesus whom you are persecuting.
inupiaq: Tavra uqallaŋaruŋa, Kiuvich ququularuatiin uvamnik? Aasii Ataniq uqallaŋaruq, Jesus-guruŋa nagliksaaqtitan.

english: But get up and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this reason, to designate you in advance as a servant and witness to the things you have seen and to the things in which I will appear to you.
inupiaq: Aasii makittin, niptaġvigiŋagikpiñ kivgaksraqtaaġisukłutin; quliaqtuaġutiniaġitin iñuich tautuŋaniḷuŋa uvlupak, suli quliaqtuaġutilugich sunik iḷitchuġipkaġumaakkamnik iliŋnun.

english: I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles, to whom I am sending you
inupiaq: Qaunaginiaġikpiñ pisaġitquŋiḷḷutin Israel-guruanun, Jew-guŋitchuanullu, iliŋiññun tiliñiaġikpiñ.

english: to open their eyes so that they turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a share among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
inupiaq: Tavra iḷisautiniaġitin tusaayugaaġiksuanik mumikkumiñaqsiḷugich taaqtuamiñ qaummaġiksuamun, aŋalatinŋaiġḷutiŋ Satan-mun aglaan God-mun, ukpiliġḷutiŋ piḷuutitiŋ suliqutigiŋaiqsautqulugich, suli iḷaliutiyumiñaqsiḷutiŋ God-im iñuksraqtaaŋiñun.

english: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,
inupiaq: Tavra Umialiik Agrippa, kamagiŋagiga qiḷaŋmiŋŋaqtauruaq qiñiqtuuraaġa.

english: but I declared to those in Damascus first, and then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, performing deeds consistent with repentance.
inupiaq: Aasii isagutiŋaruŋa Damascus-miñ Jerusalem-miḷḷu suli nunaaqqiñiñ iluqaani Judea-miittuani, akunġanniḷu Jew-guŋitchuat alġaqsruiŋaruŋa isumalitqiksuksraunivḷugich iñuich aasii mumigḷutiŋ God-mun, suli iñuuniaqtuksraunivḷugich iḷisimanaqsiḷugu allaŋŋuqtautilaaqtiŋ.

english: For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple courts and were trying to kill me.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu Jew-guruat tigguġluŋagaanŋa aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmi aasii tuqunnialaaqsivḷuŋa.

english: I have experienced help from God to this day, and so I stand testifying to both small and great, saying nothing except what the prophets and Moses said was going to happen:
inupiaq: Uvlupaŋmun-aglaan God-im ikayuŋagaaŋa, aasiuvva makitaruŋa uvani quliaqtuaġivlugu iḷisimakkaġa iḷumun ittuaq, iñupayaanun kamanaitchuallu kamanaqtuallu ativlugich. Uqautigikkaġa tainnatupiaġataq ittuq uqaqtiŋisa God-im Moses-lu uqautigikkaŋatitun piyumaaġnivḷugu,

english: that the Christ was to suffer and be the first to rise from the dead, to proclaim light both to our people and to the Gentiles.”
inupiaq: taamna Christ-guruaq nagliksaaqtuksraunivḷugu, suli sivulliuluni aŋiruaniñ tuqqunmiñ, iḷitchuġipkaġlugulu annaun iluqaiññun Jew-guruanun Jew-guŋitchuanullu.

english: As Paul was saying these things in his defense, Festus exclaimed loudly, “You have lost your mind, Paul! Your great learning is driving you insane!”
inupiaq: Tavra Paul uqaġniaqtillugu patchisairrunmigun, Festus-gum nipatusivḷuni uqallautiŋagaa, Paul kinnaġuqtutin uvva, iḷitchivaiñŋavlutin kinnaġuutigiaqsigiñ.

english: But Paul replied, “I have not lost my mind, most excellent Festus, but am speaking true and rational words.
inupiaq: Paul-gum kiuŋagaa, Kinnaġuŋitchuŋa, kamanaqtuatiin Festus, uvvaaglaan uqautiqaqtuŋa isumalaaġutiksraupiaqtuamik iḷumun ittuamiglu.

english: For the king knows about these things, and I am speaking freely to him, because I cannot believe that any of these things has escaped his notice, for this was not done in a corner.
inupiaq: Umialiik Agrippa, uqautiyumiñaġikpiñ taluqsrautaiḷḷuŋa qanuq iḷisimagitin tamatkua iluqaisa. Nalupqisuŋitchuŋa iḷisimammiutin iluqaiññik, qanuq taamna piŋaitchuq nalunautchiaġilugu.

english: Do you believe the prophets, King Agrippa? I know that you believe.”
inupiaq: Umialiik Agrippa, ukpiġivigich God-im uqaqtiŋi? Iḷisimaruŋa ukpiġigitin.

english: Agrippa said to Paul, “In such a short time are you persuading me to become a Christian?”
inupiaq: Tavra Agrippa uqallaŋaruq Paul-mun, Akkupauraq Christ-miuġuqtitchukłuŋa isumavich?

english: Paul replied, “I pray to God that whether in a short or a long time not only you but also all those who are listening to me today could become such as I am, except for these chains.”
inupiaq: Tavrali Paul-gum kiuŋagaa, Sivikitkaluaqpan naagga sivisunaaġaluaqpan, aŋaiyyutigigaluaġiga God-mun iliviḷḷu iluqaġmiglu naalaġniruat uvamnik uvlupak ukpiliqugaluaqługich uvaptun, tigutaaqtauŋisiññaġlusi uvaptun.

english: So the king got up, and with him the governor and Bernice and those sitting with them,
inupiaq: Tavrani umialik kavanauruaġlu Bernice-lu iluqaġmiglu allat iñuich makinŋarut,

english: and as they were leaving they said to one another, “This man is not doing anything deserving death or imprisonment.”
inupiaq: aasii anianikamiŋ uqaurrutiŋarut avanmun, Iñuk iŋña piŋitchuq sumik tuqurrutauyumiñaqtuamik naaggaunnii tigutaaqsimmatiksramik.

english: Agrippa said to Festus, “This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar.”
inupiaq: Tavra Agrippa uqallaŋaruq Festus-mun, Taamamna iñuk tigutaaqtauŋaiqsiññaġayaqtuq apiqsriŋaitpan Caesar-mugugluni.

english: When it was decided we would sail to Italy, they handed over Paul and some other prisoners to a centurion of the Augustan Cohort named Julius.
inupiaq: Tavra sivunniutaumman umiaqpagaqtuksraġuqłuta Italy-mun aitchuutigiŋagaat Paul iḷaŋiḷḷu allat tigutaaqtat Julius-mun, atanauraŋannun Rome-miut aŋuyaktiŋisa atiqaqtuat Augustan-gum aŋuyaktiŋiñik.

english: We went on board a ship from Adramyttium that was about to sail to various ports along the coast of the province of Asia and put out to sea, accompanied by Aristarchus, a Macedonian from Thessalonica.
inupiaq: Ikuŋarugut umiaqpaŋmun Adramyttium-miŋŋaqtuamiñ aullaqsiññaaġuġman nutqaaġaġviŋiññun nunaaqqiŋiñi Asia-m, aasii tiŋinnaarraqsivḷuta. Aristarchus, Macedonia-ġmium Thessalonica-miñ, piqasiŋagaatigut.

english: The next day we put in at Sidon, and Julius, treating Paul kindly, allowed him to go to his friends so they could provide him with what he needed.
inupiaq: Uvlaakumman tikiñŋarugut Sidon-mun. Julius-gum aŋalalluataŋagaa Paul piaqłuktautaitchuakun, suli aullaqtinŋagaa tautugiaquvlugich avilaitqatiŋi aitchuquvlugu sunik pigiraksraġikkaŋiñik.

english: From there we put out to sea and sailed under the lee of Cyprus because the winds were against us.
inupiaq: Aullaŋarugut tavraŋŋa, aasii anuġi arguġiannaqłuni tiŋilġaiŋarugut qamanġagun qikiqtam Cyprus.

english: After we had sailed across the open sea off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we put in at Myra in Lycia.
inupiaq: Tavraasii tiŋilġaiganikapta ikaaqługu taġiuq akianiittuaq Cilicia-m Pamphylia-vlu, tikiñŋarugut Myra-mun Lycia-miittuamun.

english: There the centurion found a ship from Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us aboard it.
inupiaq: Tavrani aŋuyaktit atanauraŋat iḷitchuġiŋaruq umiaqpaŋmik qairuamik Alexandria-miñ aullaqsaġumaruamik Italy-mun, aasii ikipkaqłuta taavrumuŋa umiaqpaŋmun.

english: We sailed slowly for many days and arrived with difficulty off Cnidus. Because the wind prevented us from going any farther, we sailed under the lee of Crete off Salmone.
inupiaq: Tiŋilġaqsiŋarugut sukaiḷaamik anuqłiqpaił̣ł̣uni uvluni iñugiaktuani, arguġianniuqłuta tikiḷġiñaŋarugut akianun nunaaqqim Cnidus. Aasii anuġim sivunmuktuqtitchumiñaiñmatigut nalimun, tiŋilġaiŋarugut qamanġagun qikiqtam Crete, uivvaqługu nuvuġaq Salmone.

english: With difficulty we sailed along the coast of Crete and came to a place called Fair Havens that was near the town of Lasea.
inupiaq: Siñiqsraqtuaqługu nunam siñaa siġġaġnaġaluaŋŋaan, tikiñŋarugut inimun atiqaqtuamun Qamannirviŋmik, qaniŋani iniqpak inmiruaq Lasea.

english: Since considerable time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous because the fast was already over, Paul advised them,
inupiaq: Taavrumani nunaaqqimi uvliuŋarugut iñugiaktuanik, navianaqsiḷġataqtillugu iglauniksraq ukiaqłuni Jew-guruat uvluq niġiḷairviat qaaŋianiŋavluni. Tavra Paul uqallautiŋagaluaġai inna,

english: “Men, I can see the voyage is going to end in disaster and great loss not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”
inupiaq: Aŋutiit, iḷitchuġiruŋa aullaġupta uvaŋŋa navianaġniaqtuq iglauniqput, maqutauniaqtut usiavullu umiaqpaglu, iḷaanniḷu suksraunniksraqput.

english: But the centurion was more convinced by the captain and the ship’s owner than by what Paul said.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata kamagiłhaaŋagik umiaqpaum umialgatalu iñuatalu uqaluŋik, kamagigaluaġnagu Paul uqalua.

english: Because the harbor was not suitable to spend the winter in, the majority decided to put out to sea from there. They hoped that somehow they could reach Phoenix, a harbor of Crete facing southwest and northwest, and spend the winter there.
inupiaq: Tavra qamannisimavik umiaqpaŋmun nayukkaŋat ukiiviksraġiiñŋaruq, iñugiagniqsrat ayaksaaġuŋarut taġiumun tavraŋŋa, tikiḷaiñmagaaqsaġukługu Phoenix piyumiñaġumiŋ. Taamna qamannisimavik Crete-miittuaq sanmiruaq uŋallavlu kanagnavlu tuŋaaŋnun, aasii tavrani ukiiḷutiŋ.

english: When a gentle south wind sprang up, they thought they could carry out their purpose, so they weighed anchor and sailed close along the coast of Crete.
inupiaq: Tavra uŋallaaġuġman isumavlutiŋ sivunniurriŋ nalaunniaġasugalugu, kisaq nuqinŋagaat aasii tiŋilġaigaqsivḷutiŋ siñiqsraqługu Crete, siñiqsraurapiaġataqługu nunam siñaa.

english: Not long after this, a hurricane-force wind called the northeaster blew down from the island.
inupiaq: Tavra akuniḷitchiaŋitchuq anuġiqpak nigiqłuk, anuqqałłaŋaruq qikiqtam tuŋaaniñ.

english: When the ship was caught in it and could not head into the wind, we gave way to it and were driven along.
inupiaq: Tavra umiaqpak anuġiqpaum nalaunmagu arguġumiñaiñŋarugut sanmiḷugu anuġi, iḷatchiŋarugut tiksiqł̣uta.

english: As we ran under the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were able with difficulty to get the ship’s boat under control.
inupiaq: Aasii iglauŋarugut qamanġagun qikiqtauram atiqaqtuam Cauda-mik. Tavra siġġaqivluta anayanaiyaŋagikput umiaqpaum umiuraŋa.

english: After the crew had hoisted it aboard, they used supports to undergird the ship. Fearing they would run aground on the Syrtis, they lowered the sea anchor, thus letting themselves be driven along.
inupiaq: Ikuaniŋmarruŋ umiuraq, anniqsuġniḷuksaaqsiŋagaat payaŋaiyaqsaavlugu akłunaanik umiaqpak. Tavraasii anayasuliqł̣utiŋ ikkalġiññasugalutiŋ mauyaqiññamun siñaani Libya-m, tiŋilġautaiyaŋarut aasii tiksiaqsivḷuta.

english: The next day, because we were violently battered by the storm, they began throwing the cargo overboard,
inupiaq: Tavra anuġi suamaruaq anuqłiqsillugusuli, uvlutqiŋman siqqairraqsiŋarut umiaqpaum usiaŋiñik.

english: and on the third day they threw the ship’s gear overboard with their own hands.
inupiaq: Uvluk piŋayuagniasii siqqarraqsiŋagaich saatqutiŋi umiaqpaum.

english: When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and a violent storm continued to batter us, we finally abandoned all hope of being saved.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluni iñugiaktuani tautulaiñŋagivut siqiñiġlu uvluġiallu, anuġi anuqłipiaġataqłuni. Kiisaimmaa iñuuyumiñaiġasukkiutivugut.

english: Since many of them had no desire to eat, Paul stood up among them and said, “Men, you should have listened to me and not put out to sea from Crete, thus avoiding this damage and loss.
inupiaq: Tavra aŋutit sivisuruamik niġiḷaitkaluaġmata, Paul makinŋaruq sivuġaannun, aasii uqallautivlugich, Aŋutiit, kamagiyumiñaŋagaluaġivsiŋa aullaqusaaŋiññavsi Crete-miñ aasii siqqaiŋiḷḷuta iluqaiññik usiaptiŋnik.

english: And now I advise you to keep up your courage, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only the ship will be lost.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak ipiqtusuŋaiqugivsi, qanuq iḷaŋiġñiaŋitchusi atausiuramik-unnii, aglaan umiaqpaiyaġniaqtugut.

english: For last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve came to me
inupiaq: Qanuq unnuapak makitaŋaruq saniqqamni isaġulga God-im ukpiġikkaġma, aŋaiyyuvigisuukkaġmalu,

english: and said, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul! You must stand before Caesar, and God has graciously granted you the safety of all who are sailing with you.’
inupiaq: aasii uqallautivluŋa, Iqsiñak Paul, qanuq tikitchuksraurutin Rome-mun, aasii Caesar-m isivġiġḷutin. Aasii pisigivlutin, God-im iñuuliñiaġai iluqaisa umiaqpagaqatitin.

english: Therefore keep up your courage, men, for I have faith in God that it will be just as I have been told.
inupiaq: Ipiqtusuŋaiġitchiasii, aŋutiit, qanuq ukpiġutiqaqtuŋa God-mun nalaupiaġataġniaqtilaaŋa kilgusiaġa.

english: But we must run aground on some island.”
inupiaq: Aglaan tipiniaġaatigut qikiqtamun.

english: When the fourteenth night had come, while we were being driven across the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors suspected they were approaching some land.
inupiaq: Akimiaġuutaiḷaŋŋuġmata unnuat tiksiġñivut anuqłiuqłuta taġiumi Mediterranean-mi, unnuaq qitiqqaqpalliġman sivuqłich iḷimatchaŋarut qalliñasugalutiŋ nunamun.

english: They took soundings and found the water was twenty fathoms deep; when they had sailed a little farther they took soundings again and found it was fifteen fathoms deep.
inupiaq: Tavra kiviuqsraŋarut aasii iḷitchuġivlutiŋ iñuiññaqtun isaŋniqtun ititilaaŋanik, ayuuqtaallaqqaaqłutiŋ kiviuqsravsaaŋarut aasii akimiaq isaŋniqtun ititilaanikłuni.

english: Because they were afraid that we would run aground on the rocky coast, they threw out four anchors from the stern and wished for day to appear.
inupiaq: Tavra anayatchakłutiŋ umiaqpakput apuġasugalugu uyaġagruanun, niŋinŋagaich sisamat kitchat aquagun, aasii uvluqsiigaqsivḷutiŋ.

english: Then when the sailors tried to escape from the ship and were lowering the ship’s boat into the sea, pretending that they were going to put out anchors from the bow,
inupiaq: Tavra sivuqłich pigruġumavlutiŋ umiaqpaŋmiñ, niŋinŋagaat umiuraq immamun, kisaġniaŋŋuaqsaqłutiŋ umiaqpaum sivuagun.

english: Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers, “Unless these men stay with the ship, you cannot be saved.”
inupiaq: Paul uqallautiŋagai aŋuyaktit atanauraŋat aŋuyaktillu, Ukua aŋutit umiaqpaŋmiinŋisuaqpata iñuulirauyumiñaitchusi.

english: Then the soldiers cut the ropes of the ship’s boat and let it drift away.
inupiaq: Tavrani aŋuyaktit kivluŋagaich akłunaaŋi umiuram aasii saġvaqtiłługu.

english: As day was about to dawn, Paul urged them all to take some food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day you have been in suspense and have gone without food; you have eaten nothing.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluq qausaaqsivalliġman, Paul niġiḷḷaqupiaŋagai umiaqpagaqtit uqallakłuni, Uvlupak akimiaġuutaiḷaŋŋuqtut uvlut, aasii iluqasi tainnatun sivisutigiruamik niġiuraŋaitchusi.

english: Therefore I urge you to take some food, for this is important for your survival. For not one of you will lose a hair from his head.”
inupiaq: Tavra niġiḷḷaqupiaġivsi, sayaniktaaġumausi iñuullasisaġlusi. Atausiuraq-unnii nusaqsi niaquvsiññi tammaġniaŋitchuq.

english: After he said this, Paul took bread and gave thanks to God in front of them all, broke it, and began to eat.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallausiġianikamiuŋ, Paul-gum tiguŋagaa punniq, aasii quyyavigiqqaaqługu God takkuanni, avikługu niġirraqsiŋaruq.

english: So all of them were encouraged and took food themselves.
inupiaq: Tavrani iluqaġmiŋ qapiŋaisaaqtauŋarut aasii niġivḷutiktauq iliŋich.

english: (We were in all two hundred seventy-six persons on the ship.)
inupiaq: Iluqata katiłłuta iñugiaktilaaqput 276 umiaqpaum iñuŋi.

english: When they had eaten enough to be satisfied, they lightened the ship by throwing the wheat into the sea.
inupiaq: Tavra niġisuiġataqamiŋ, uqigḷiḷiŋagaat umiaqpak igiłługich palauvaksrat taġiumun.

english: When day came, they did not recognize the land, but they noticed a bay with a beach, where they decided to run the ship aground if they could.
inupiaq: Tavra uvluġman, umiaqpagaqtit iḷisaġiŋaitkaat nuna, aglaan nalunaigiŋagaat puviaq naqittuamik siñilik, sivunniutiŋagaat piñaġumiñaqpan umiaqpaŋmik apuġaksaaġvigisaġukługu.

english: So they slipped the anchors and left them in the sea, at the same time loosening the linkage that bound the steering oars together. Then they hoisted the foresail to the wind and steered toward the beach.
inupiaq: Tavra ilaisa kivluŋagaich kitchat akłunaaŋich qimakługich kitchat immamun. Aasiisuli tavrani aŋivraaqługich akłunaat qiḷiġutigikkaŋi aquutim. Aasii nuqiłługu sivulliq tiŋilġautaq apuġaksaaqsaŋarut nunamun.

english: But they encountered a patch of crosscurrents and ran the ship aground; the bow stuck fast and could not be moved, but the stern was being broken up by the force of the waves.
inupiaq: Tavra nalaułługu ikkalġuq ikkalġisinŋagaat umiaqpak, sivua kaliviłłuni aulayyallaiŋaruq, aasii aqua siquminŋagaa ulivrigaqtuam taġium.

english: Now the soldiers’ plan was to kill the prisoners so that none of them would escape by swimming away.
inupiaq: Aŋuyaktit sivunniŋarut tuquġaġukługich tigutaaqtapayaurat, iḷaanni nalliŋich puumillutiŋ annakkasugalugich.

english: But the centurion, wanting to save Paul’s life, prevented them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land,
inupiaq: Tavra aŋuyaktit atanauraŋata annautiyumavlugu Paul, taŋŋiqsinŋaitkaa sivunniutaat. Ilaan piraksriŋagai iñupayaat puuvrallaruat nautkiaquvlugich umiaqpaŋmiñ aasii tulaksaquvlugich.

english: and the rest were to follow, some on planks and some on pieces of the ship. And in this way all were brought safely to land.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi iḷakutat ikiaqtatigun naagga umiaqpaviñiqtigun tulaquvlugich. Tavra iluqata annaŋarugut nunamun.

english: From Paul, a slave of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle, set apart for the gospel of God.
inupiaq: Ukua tuyuutit qairut ilivsiññun Paul-miñ, kivgaŋaniñ Jesus Christ, piksraqtaaġiŋaraŋa tiliraġisukługu alġaqsruitquvlugu God-im tusaayugaaġiksuaŋiñik.

english: This gospel he promised beforehand through his prophets in the holy scriptures,
inupiaq: Taapkua tusaayugaaġiksuat iŋiḷġaan unniqsuqłiisigiŋakkaŋich God-im uqaqtiŋisa Bible-ni.

english: concerning his Son who was a descendant of David with reference to the flesh,
inupiaq: Taapkua tusaayugaaġiksuat quliaqtuaqaqtut God-im Iġñiŋanik aniŋaruamik David kiŋuniŋiññiñ,

english: who was appointed the Son-of-God-in-power according to the Holy Spirit by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord.
inupiaq: suli pisigivlugu piḷuutaitchuaq Ilitqusia nalupqinaiqsauŋapiaqtuq God-mun Iġñiġinivḷugu aliuġnaġniŋagun aŋŋisim tuqqunmiñ.

english: Through him we have received grace and our apostleship to bring about the obedience of faith among all the Gentiles on behalf of his name.
inupiaq: Ataniqput Jesus Christ naglikkutiqpaqaŋaruq uvamnun tilivḷuŋa quliaqtuaġutitquvlugich iñupayaat annautiyumiñaġniḷugich ilaanun ukpiġikpanni kamagikpanniḷu.

english: You also are among them, called to belong to Jesus Christ.
inupiaq: Ilivsivsauq ququaqtaummiusi pigitquvlusi Jesus Christ-mun.

english: To all those loved by God in Rome, called to be saints: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ!
inupiaq: Paġlagivsi iluqasi Rome-miittuasii, God-im piviuttaġiraŋasi, ququaqtauŋaruasii ilaaguaqtautquvlusi ilaanun. Nagliktuusiaqpaqaġitchisuq tutqiunmiglu God-miñ Aapaptiŋniñ, Ataniptiŋniḷḷu Jesus Christ-miñ.

english: First of all, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, because your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.
inupiaq: Quyyavigiqqaaġiga God-iga Jesus Christ-kun iluqavsigun, ukpiġurri quliaqtuaġimmarruŋ nunapayaani.

english: For God, whom I serve in my spirit by preaching the gospel of his Son, is my witness that I continually remember you
inupiaq: God, savautikkaġa pisuqtilaaptun tusaayugaaġiksuaŋagun Iġñiŋan, iḷisimaruq ataramik itqaumatilaamnik ilivsiññik aŋaiyyutimni.

english: and I always ask in my prayers, if perhaps now at last I may succeed in visiting you according to the will of God.
inupiaq: Suli ataramik apiqsriruŋa qanuġluŋa ullagukłusi God-im pisuutigikpagu.

english: For I long to see you, so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to strengthen you,
inupiaq: Tautugumapiaġivsi ikayuġukłusi ukpiġutiksi suaŋasiḷaaġukługu.

english: that is, that we may be mutually comforted by one another’s faith, both yours and mine.
inupiaq: Taamna sivuniqaqtuq, uvagut avanmun qapiŋaisaaġutiluta ukpiġutiptigun.

english: I do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, that I often intended to come to you (and was prevented until now), so that I may have some fruit even among you, just as I already have among the rest of the Gentiles.
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, iḷisimatqugivsi ataramik qaiyumagaluaġaqtuŋa ilivsiññun alġaqsruisukłuŋa, tautullasiḷuŋa ukpiqtuanik suaŋasiḷaaqtuanik, piḷuusiqirauruaniglu annaurrauruanik, piŋaruatuttauq allani nunani. Aglaan piñaiḷutaksraq itchuuruq tamauŋanun aglaan.

english: I am a debtor both to the Greeks and to the barbarians, both to the wise and to the foolish.
inupiaq: Alġaqsruiruksraupiaqtuŋa iñupayaanun aglagnik iḷisimaruanun naluruanullu isumaturuanullu isumalluaġiitchuanullu,

english: Thus I am eager also to preach the gospel to you who are in Rome.
inupiaq: ilivsiññullu Rome-miittuanun alġaqsruiyumapiaqtuŋa tusaayugaaġiksuanik.

english: For I am not ashamed of the gospel, for it is God’s power for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first and also to the Greek.
inupiaq: Kanŋugiŋitkiga tusaayugaaġiksuaq qanuq taavrumuuna God-im annautillagaa kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq tusaayugaaġiksuamik, qaiqqaaŋaruaq Jew-guruanun, aasii aquvatigun Jew-guŋitchuanun.

english: For the righteousness of God is revealed in the gospel from faith to faith, just as it is written, “The righteous by faith will live.”
inupiaq: Taavrumuuna tusaayugaaġiksuakun God-im nalaunŋatqutaa salapqiŋaruq iñupayaami ukpiqtuami tusaayugaaġiksuamik, aglausimaruatun inna, “Iñuk nalaunŋasirauruaq ukpiġunmigun iñuuniaqtuq isuitchuamun.”

english: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of people who suppress the truth by their unrighteousness,
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im qinnautaa salapqiqsuq qiḷaŋmiñ iñupayaanun god-aiḷaqtuanun piḷuktuanullu, tamatkunuŋa piñaiḷutchiqsuiruanun iḷumun ittuamik.

english: because what can be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it plain to them.
inupiaq: Sut iḷitchuqqutiksrat God-iqaqtilaamik nalunaitkaluaqtut iliŋiññun qanuq God-im iḷitchuġipkaŋagai iliŋiññun.

english: For since the creation of the world his invisible attributes – his eternal power and divine nature – have been clearly seen, because they are understood through what has been made. So people are without excuse.
inupiaq: Taimaŋŋaqaŋa God-im savaŋmagich supayaat, iñuich qiñiŋagaich sut God-im savaaŋi, suli iḷisimavlugu iñuutilaaŋa suaŋŋatiqaqłuni kamanaqtuamik isuitchuamun. Tavraasii patchisiksraitchut,

english: For although they knew God, they did not glorify him as God or give him thanks, but they became futile in their thoughts and their senseless hearts were darkened.
inupiaq: qanuq iḷisimagaluaqługu God, ukpiġilipiaġataŋaitkaat God-auniḷugu aasii nanġaġlugu quyyavigilugulu, aglaan isumalluaġiiḷiŋarut kamasuutaiqł̣utiglu.

english: Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools
inupiaq: Uqavigaaqłutiŋ isumatunivḷutiŋ isumalluaġiiḷiŋarut,

english: and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for an image resembling mortal human beings or birds or four-footed animals or reptiles.
inupiaq: suli aŋaiyyuniq tuqulaitchuamun God-mun simmausiqł̣ugu aŋaiyyuvigivlugich iñuuraqpaliat tuqullaruatun iñuktun, tiŋmiatullu niġrutitullu nimiġiatullu.

english: Therefore God gave them over in the desires of their hearts to impurity, to dishonor their bodies among themselves.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu, God-im ilaisituuqtinŋagai pisuutaatigun. Iliŋich piḷuksiŋarut kamagivlugich pigiitchuat kipiġniuġutitiŋ aasii atuqługich timitiŋ kanŋunaqtuakun avanmun.

english: They exchanged the truth of God for a lie and worshiped and served the creation rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever! Amen.
inupiaq: Tainnatchich iñuich ukpiġiŋagaat saglun, ukpiġigaluaġnagu iḷumun ittuaq God-ikun. Tavra aŋaiyyuvigiŋagaich sut God-im savaaŋi, aasii kamagisuŋił̣ł̣ugu God savaŋaruaq supayaanik, nanġagaksrauruaq isuitchuamun, Amen.

english: For this reason God gave them over to dishonorable passions. For their women exchanged the natural sexual relations for unnatural ones,
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu God-im ilaisituuqtinŋagai pigiitchuanun kipiġniuġutiŋiññun. Aġnaŋisa simmausiqł̣ugu nutim piḷġusiuruaq atugaġivlugich timitiŋ aġnauqanmiŋnun.

english: and likewise the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed in their passions for one another. Men committed shameless acts with men and received in themselves the due penalty for their error.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq aŋutit simmausiqł̣ugu nutim piḷġusiq aġnamun kipiġniupiaġatautigivlugich atugaġisukługich aŋutit timitiŋ kanŋunaqtuakun allanun aŋutinun. Aasii nalliummatiruamik paaqłiusiaqaqłutiŋ pigiitchuatigun piḷġusiġikkaġmikkun.

english: And just as they did not see fit to acknowledge God, God gave them over to a depraved mind, to do what should not be done.
inupiaq: Qanuq isummatigimmarruŋ kamagiraksraiññivḷugu God, ilaan ilaisituuqtinŋagai pigiitchuanun kipiġniuġutiŋiññun, piḷuusiqutinullu piḷġutchiñun.

english: They are filled with every kind of unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, malice. They are rife with envy, murder, strife, deceit, hostility. They are gossips,
inupiaq: Iḷumiutaġiŋagaich qanusipayaat piḷuutit, allatuutillu kaviuqqutillu uumisuutiqpaiḷḷu. Suli iḷumiutaġivlugich killuqsrautit iñuaġutillu uqavaaġutillu pisaasuġmiaġutillu, pigiitchuamik irrusiqaġniġiḷḷu allanun, uqautikłiġñiġiḷḷu,

english: slanderers, haters of God, insolent, arrogant, boastful, contrivers of all sorts of evil, disobedient to parents,
inupiaq: saglutiginnigniġiḷḷu, uumikłiqsuallu God-mik, qapiġnautikun uumisaaqłiqsillu, arguaŋŋatillu uqavigaaġutillu. Isummatiqaqtuallu nutauruakun piḷuusiqutiksranik kamasuutairrutiniglu aŋayuqaanun,

english: senseless, covenant-breakers, heartless, ruthless.
inupiaq: isumalluaġiirrutillu, taŋŋiiḷaiññiġiḷḷu unniqsuqłiisinun, aŋayuqaaġiiñi piviuttaqqutairrullu, nagliktairrutillu.

english: Although they fully know God’s righteous decree that those who practice such things deserve to die, they not only do them but also approve of those who practice them.
inupiaq: Tamatkua tainnatchiñik piraġausiqaqtuat iḷisimalluataġaluaqtut God-mun uqallautiŋatilaaqtiŋ tuquruksraunivḷugich. Aasii piḷuusiqiugaŋarut tainnatchisigun kiaqsruqługiḷḷu allat tainnali pitquvlugich.

english: Therefore you are without excuse, whoever you are, when you judge someone else. For on whatever grounds you judge another, you condemn yourself, because you who judge practice the same things.
inupiaq: Tavrali ilivich, kiugaluaġuvich, tainnatuttauq piḷuksiŋarutin taipkunatun iñuktun, aasii pasiraksraummiutin. Isivġiqapkich taipkua iñuich piḷuusiqirualivḷugich, iliŋnun isivġiġmiutin, qanuq piḷuksimmiutin tainnatun.

english: Now we know that God’s judgment is in accordance with truth against those who practice such things.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarugut God isivġiisuuruq nalaunŋaruakun tamatkuniŋa piḷuksiruanik.

english: And do you think, whoever you are, when you judge those who practice such things and yet do them yourself, that you will escape God’s judgment?
inupiaq: Isumanak God-mun isivġiġñiaġasugalugich allat kisiisa, piḷuksiruat tamatkunuuna, aasii isivġiŋiḷḷutin tamatkuniŋaptauq piḷuksisiqaqavich.

english: Or do you have contempt for the wealth of his kindness, forbearance, and patience, and yet do not know that God’s kindness leads you to repentance?
inupiaq: Isumaruksrauŋitchutin God suaŋaiññasugalugu qanutun manimmiḷgutigimmatin tatavsalaisaaqłutin. God-im qiñuirrutigaatin piaqłuktaŋitkaatillu isumalitqiquvlutin.

english: But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart, you are storing up wrath for yourselves in the day of wrath, when God’s righteous judgment is revealed!
inupiaq: Aglaan sivunmuuguvich suli uqaqsiġiirrutiŋni isumalitqiguŋiḷḷutin God-mun qinnaliqsaiññautipkaqtutin. Ilaan qinnautaa salapqiġumaaqtuq uvlumi ilaan nalaunŋaruakun isivġiqpagich iñupayaat.

english: He will reward each one according to his works:
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im paaqłiġñiaġaa iñupayaaq qanuq iñuuŋaniŋagun.

english: eternal life to those who by perseverance in good works seek glory and honor and immortality,
inupiaq: Tamatkua qiñuiqł̣utiŋ nalautchiruat God-im pisuutaanik, ilaan aitchuġniaġai iñuggunmik isuitchuamik, tamatkua niġiuktuat kamanaqsipkaqtauniksramik God-miñ.

english: but wrath and anger to those who live in selfish ambition and do not obey the truth but follow unrighteousness.
inupiaq: Aglaan God-im qinnautipiaġataġniaġai iñuuruat isummaatuuqłutiŋ piḷuusiqirauvlutiŋ, iñuusuŋaġnatiŋ God-im iñuutqutiŋigun.

english: There will be affliction and distress on everyone who does evil, on the Jew first and also the Greek,
inupiaq: Isumaaġutiqpaqaġniaqtut nagliksaaġlutiglu iñupayaat piḷuusiqiugaqtuat, Jew-guruallu Jew-guŋitchuallu atunim.

english: but glory and honor and peace for everyone who does good, for the Jew first and also the Greek.
inupiaq: Aglaalli iñupayaat kamaksriruat God-mik, Jew-gugaluaqpata Jew-guŋitkaluaqpatalu, aitchuġniaġai tutqiunmik kamanaqsipkaunmiglu qiḷaŋmi.

english: For there is no partiality with God.
inupiaq: Qanuq God atiruq iñupayaanun.

english: For all who have sinned apart from the law will also perish apart from the law, and all who have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.
inupiaq: Iñuich iluqaġmiŋ piḷuksiŋarut naluvlugich God-im pitquraŋi Moses-mun qaisaŋi, suksrauniaqtut. Aglaan God-im isivġiġñiaŋitkai taapkua pitqurat uqaluatigun. Aasiiḷi iluqaġmiŋ piḷuksiruat iḷisimallaisa God-im pitquraŋi, isivġiqsauniaqtut pitqurat uqaluatigun.

english: For it is not those who hear the law who are righteous before God, but those who do the law will be declared righteous.
inupiaq: Tamatkua kamaksriruat God-im pitquraŋiñik nalaunŋanirauniaqtut, aglaan tusaaruat kamagigaluaġnagich pitqurat God-im nalaunŋarualiñiaŋitkai.

english: For whenever the Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature the things required by the law, these who do not have the law are a law to themselves.
inupiaq: Jew-guŋitchuat naluruat God-im pitquraŋiñik nalaunniġmatigik taapkua pitqurat iñuuniaqłutiŋ isumamiŋni nalaunŋanasugikkaġmikkun, inmiŋnun pitquraliuġmatun piut,

english: They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts, as their conscience bears witness and their conflicting thoughts accuse or else defend them,
inupiaq: aglaan salapqiŋagaat puttuqsrisilaaqtiŋ God-im pitquraŋiñik, iḷitchuġipkairuanik nalautilaaŋanik naagga pigiitchualiqitilaaŋannik, suli isumaalutchaktiłługich, naagga patchisaiññialavlutiŋ.

english: on the day when God will judge the secrets of human hearts, according to my gospel through Christ Jesus.
inupiaq: Iñupayaat isivġiqsauniaqtut taivrumani uvlumi, God-im tilikpagu Christ Jesus isivġiqulugich iluqaisa nalunautchiaŋich iñuich. Tavra taapkua iḷagigaich tusaayugaaġiksuam alġaqsruutigikkaġama.

english: But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast of your relationship to God
inupiaq: Tavra ilivsi, Jew-guniraġaaqtuasii, naamarualirusi piqaqavsi God-im pitquraŋiñik qaisaŋiñik Moses-mun. Uqavigaaqtusi God God-iginivḷugu.

english: and know his will and approve the superior things because you receive instruction from the law,
inupiaq: Iḷisimaniqsusi qanuq God-mun iñuutqutilaavsiññik, God-ivlu nakuułhaaqtuanik iñuutqutiŋiñik iḷisausiaqaŋavlusi ilaan pitquraŋiñik.

english: and if you are convinced that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness,
inupiaq: Nalupqisuŋipiaqtusi iḷisimanivḷusi God-im pitquraŋiñik, iḷisautiyumiñaqługich kaŋiqsisaitchuat pitquranun, aasii iḷisautilugich kaŋiqsipkaġlugich.

english: an educator of the senseless, a teacher of little children, because you have in the law the essential features of knowledge and of the truth –
inupiaq: Iḷisautiyumiñaġniġisi naluruat God-im pitquraŋiñik, tamatkualu miqłiqtutun ittuat kaŋiqsisimiŋni pitquraŋiñik God-im. Tavra piginiqavsigik God-im pitquraŋi kaŋiqsiŋapiaġniqsusi qanuq God-mun iñuutqupiaġataqtilaaŋannik iñuich.

english: therefore you who teach someone else, do you not teach yourself? You who preach against stealing, do you steal?
inupiaq: Iḷisaurriyumiñaqsiŋaniġuvsi allanik iñuŋnik, summan iḷisautisuŋitpisi ilivsiññun? Uqallaurrisuuruasii iñuŋnik, Tiglignak. Ilivsi tigliguuvisi?

english: You who tell others not to commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
inupiaq: Uqallaurrisuuruasii iñuŋnik, Allatuġnak, allatuġuuvisi? Uqaqtuasii piḷuutaunivḷugu aŋaiyyuruni iñuuraqpaŋnun, aŋaiyyuvianniñ iñuuraqpaich tigliguuvisi?

english: You who boast in the law dishonor God by transgressing the law!
inupiaq: Uqavigaaqtusi iḷisimanivḷugich God-im pitquraŋi qaisaŋi Moses-mun naaggauvva kanŋunaqsiḷiġaġigiksi God, kamagiŋiññavsigik pitquraŋi.

english: For just as it is written, “the name of God is being blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”
inupiaq: “Taamna pisigivlugu nunam iñuŋisa uqamaqłuutigigaat God.” Tainna aglausimaruq Bible-ni.

english: For circumcision has its value if you practice the law, but if you break the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.
inupiaq: Nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaguvsi God-im iñuksraqtaaŋiñun iḷaliutilusi Jew-guruasii, aasii kamagivlugich God-im pitquraŋi, anniqsuusiaqaqtusi. Aglaan kamagiŋitkuvsigik God-im pitquraŋi, nalunaiñŋutchiusiaqsi iḷautilaavsiññik God-im iñuksraqtaaŋiñun anniqsuutauŋitchuq, Jew-guŋitchuatun iḷimmiusi.

english: Therefore if the uncircumcised man obeys the righteous requirements of the law, will not his uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision?
inupiaq: Allaaguttauq, Jew-guŋitchuaġli iñuuniqpan God-im pitquraŋi kamagilugich, ilaa kisiuqatauniaqtuq God-im iñuksraqtaaŋiñun, nalunaiñŋutaitkaluaŋŋaġmi Jew-guruat nalunaiñŋutaŋannik.

english: And will not the physically uncircumcised man who keeps the law judge you who, despite the written code and circumcision, transgress the law?
inupiaq: Aasii taapkua Jew-guŋitchuat, nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaitchuat, kamagimmatigik God-im pitquraŋi pasiñiaġaasi piḷuusiqiniḷusi nalunaiñŋutaqaqtuasii, qanuq kamagiŋiññavsigik God-im pitquraŋi aglausimaruat.

english: For a person is not a Jew who is one outwardly, nor is circumcision something that is outward in the flesh,
inupiaq: Pisigigiññaġlugu taiguutiqaġniqsi Jew-mik Jew-gupiaġataŋitchusi. Iḷagiŋitkaasi God-im iñuksraqtaaŋisa pisigigiññaġlugu God-im nalunaiñŋutchiutaa ilivsiññun.

english: but someone is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is of the heart by the Spirit and not by the written code. This person’s praise is not from people but from God.
inupiaq: Jew-gupiaqpaalluktuq iñuk kamaksriḷḷaturuaq God-mik ataramik. Jew-gupiaqpaalluktuq iñuk God-im iñuksraqtaaġikkaŋa, qanuq iñuuruq nalaunŋaruakun sivuġaani God-im. Ilaa iñuusuktuq kamagilugu God uummanmiñiñ aglałhiñaŋiḷaatigun pitqurani, aasii nanġausiaqaġluni God-miñ iñuŋił̣aaniñ.

english: Therefore what advantage does the Jew have, or what is the value of circumcision?
inupiaq: Tamatkua tainna itpata, sumik anniqsuusiaqaqpa Jew-guniq? Sumik anniqsuusiaqaqpa piqaġniq God-im nalunaiñŋutchiutaanik?

english: Actually, there are many advantages. First of all, the Jews were entrusted with the oracles of God.
inupiaq: Atqunaq anniqsuusiaqaġnaqtuq Jew-guniq. Sivulliġmi, God-im aitchuŋagai Jew-guruat aglausimaruanik pitquranik Moses-kun.

english: What then? If some did not believe, does their unbelief nullify the faithfulness of God?
inupiaq: Jew-guruat iḷaŋich ukpiġutaitkaluaqpata kamagilaiḷḷugich God-im pitquraŋi, ukpiġutairrutaata God taŋŋiipkaġumiñaitparruŋ unniqsuqłiisiŋiñik tamatkunuŋa ukpiqtuanun?

english: Absolutely not! Let God be proven true, and every human being shown up as a liar, just as it is written: “so that you will be justified in your words and will prevail when you are judged.”
inupiaq: Naaggapiaġataq. Iñupayaaq saglusuugaluaġniqpan, God sagluyumiñaitchuq. Bible-ni aglausimaruq God-ikun inna,

english: But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God, what shall we say? The God who inflicts wrath is not unrighteous, is he? (I am speaking in human terms.)
inupiaq: Iñuich iḷaŋich killukun uqaġuurut inna, Uvagurguuq piḷuksigupta, tautuktinniaġivut iñuich God-im nalaunŋataanik, tavraasii uqallakłutiŋ nakuuniḷugu piḷuksiruni. Tavrasuligguuq God killukuaġniqsuq tatavsaqamisigut.

english: Absolutely not! For otherwise how could God judge the world?
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua uqaqtuat tainna killukuaqtut qanuq nalupqinaitchuq iḷisimarugut God-im isivġiġñiaġai nunam iñuŋi piḷuktuat.

english: For if by my lie the truth of God enhances his glory, why am I still actually being judged as a sinner?
inupiaq: Uvaŋaptauq killukuaġmiuŋa uqaqama inna. Sagluniġma iñuich qiñiqtillakpagich God-im iḷumun irrutaanik aasii nanġaġlugu, pasiyumiñaitkaaŋa piḷuusiqirauniḷuŋa.

english: And why not say, “Let us do evil so that good may come of it”? – as some who slander us allege that we say. (Their condemnation is deserved!)
inupiaq: Taamna iḷumun inniqpan, piḷuusiqiugaqta iñuŋnun nanġavsaaqulugu God. Iḷisaurriŋitchuŋa tainnatchiñik saglunik. Aglaan iñuich iḷaŋisa uqautigiŋagaanŋa tainnatchiñik iḷisaurriñivḷuŋa. Taapkua iñuich God-im isivġiġñiaġai nalaunŋaruakun.

english: What then? Are we better off? Certainly not, for we have already charged that Jews and Greeks alike are all under sin,
inupiaq: Taapkua uqautigianikaptigik uqallakkumiñaqpisa Jew-guruat nalaunŋałhaaġniḷugich allaniñ iñuŋniñ? Naaggapiaġataq. Iḷitchuġipkaaniŋagivsi iñupayaurat Jew-gugaluaġumiŋ Jew-guŋitkaluaġumiŋ, aŋalatiqaqtut piḷuunmik.

english: just as it is written:
inupiaq: Bible-ni aglausimarut uqaluich inna,

english: “There is no one righteous, not even one,
inupiaq: Paŋmapak iḷitchuġirugut pitquraŋi God-im qaisaŋi Moses-kun aŋalatchirut iñuŋnik aitchuusiaqaqtuanik pitquranik. Tavraasii, kiñaliqaa patchisiksraqaġumiñaitchuq kamaksriŋiññiġmigun pitquranik, suli nunam iñupayaaŋa pasikkusiaqaġniaqtuq God-miñ.

english: there is no one who understands,
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa nalaunŋarualiyumiñaitchuq inmiñik sivuġaani God-im, kamagiugaġniḷugich pitquraŋi God-im ataramik, qanuq pitqurat iḷisautigiññaġaatigut qanutun piḷuktilaaptiŋnik.

english: there is no one who seeks God.
inupiaq: Aasii paŋmapak God-im salapqiŋagaa qanuq iñuk nalaunŋasiyumiñaqtilaaŋanik sivuqqamiñi, pitqurat piqutigiŋaiġḷugich. Uqaqtiŋisa God-im Bible-ni iŋiḷġaan uqautigiŋagaat taamna nalaunŋasiñiq sivuġaani God-im.

english: All have turned away,
inupiaq: Taamna nalaunŋasipkaun qairuq ukpiġutikun. Iñupayaaq ukpiqtuaq Jesus Christ-mun nalaunŋasipkaqtauniaqtuq sivuġaani God-im. Iñuich iluqaġmiŋ atirut,

english: together they have become worthless;
inupiaq: qanuq iñupayaat piḷuksiŋarut aasii God-im nanġaġumiñaitkaa kiñaliqaa nalaunŋaniḷugu.

english: there is no one who shows kindness, not even one.”
inupiaq: Tavraasii, nagliktuutiqpaqaqłuni, God-im nalaunŋasipkaŋagai iñupayaat akiiḷaamik. Ilaan tiliŋagaa Christ Jesus akiḷiquvlugich piḷuutipayaurat tuqulugu aŋarraurami.

english: “Their throats are open graves,
inupiaq: God-im tiliŋagaa Jesus tuqutquvlugu aasii maqipkaġlugu auŋa akiḷiqsaġlugich piḷuutiŋich iluqaġmiŋ ukpiqtuat inmiñun. Taamna piŋagaa salapqiġukługu nalaunŋatini suliqutigiŋaiqsiñiġmigun piḷuutinik, piḷuusiqiaŋiññik-unnii iñuich Christ tuquŋaiñŋaan. God-im tatavsaŋaitkai tavrauvvaa manimmiḷgutiqaqłuni.

english: they deceive with their tongues,
inupiaq: Tavra paŋmapak God-im salapqiġaa nalaunŋatilaani suli nalaunŋasipkallatilaaŋanik kiñaliqaa ukpiqtuaq Jesus-mun.

english: the poison of asps is under their lips.”
inupiaq: Tainnainniġman, uqavigaaġutiksraipiaqtugut qanuq nalaunŋasiyumiñaitchugut kamagilugich God-im pitquraŋi. Nalaunŋasipkaqtaurugut ukpiġutiptigun,

english: “Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”
inupiaq: qanuq iḷisimarugut iñuk nalaunŋasipkaqtautilaaŋanik ukpiġutaagun Christ Jesus-mun. Iñuk nalaunŋasipkaqtaulaitchuq kamaginiḷugich pitqurat.

english: “Their feet are swift to shed blood,
inupiaq: God Jew-guruat kisimik God-igiŋitkaat. God-igimmigaat Jew-guŋitchuat.

english: ruin and misery are in their paths,
inupiaq: Atausiuniġman God, ilaan nalaunŋasipkaġniaġai iñupayaat pisigilugu ukpiġutaat, Jew-guruallu Jew-guŋitchuallu.

english: and the way of peace they have not known.”
inupiaq: Nalaunŋasipkaqtaullaniqapta ukpiġutiptigun, sivuniqaŋipiaġataqtuq kamagiraksraiġñiḷugich God-im pitquraŋi qaisaŋi Moses-kun. Aglaan paŋmapak ukpiliqapta Jesus-mun, kamagiyumiñaġivut pitqurat.

english: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world may be held accountable to God.
For no one is declared righteous before him by the works of the law, for through the law comes the knowledge of sin.
But now apart from the law the righteousness of God (which is attested by the law and the prophets) has been disclosed –
namely, the righteousness of God through the faithfulness of Jesus Christ for all who believe. For there is no distinction,
for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.
But they are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.

God publicly displayed him at his death as the mercy seat accessible through faith. This was to demonstrate his righteousness, because God in his forbearance had passed over the sins previously committed.
This was also to demonstrate his righteousness in the present time, so that he would be just and the justifier of the one who lives because of Jesus’ faithfulness.
Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded! By what principle? Of works? No, but by the principle of faith!
For we consider that a person is declared righteous by faith apart from the works of the law.
Or is God the God of the Jews only? Is he not the God of the Gentiles too? Yes, of the Gentiles too!
Since God is one, he will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith.
Do we then nullify the law through faith? Absolutely not! Instead we uphold the law.
What then shall we say that Abraham, our ancestor according to the flesh, has discovered regarding this matter?
inupiaq: Abraham, maŋŋuuruaq Jew-payauranun, uuktuutigilakput iñuŋmun ukpiġunmigun nalaunŋasipkaqtauruamun sivuġaani God-im.

english: For if Abraham was declared righteous by the works of the law, he has something to boast about – but not before God.
inupiaq: Abraham piḷġusiḷḷuataŋisa nalaunŋasipkallakparruŋ sivuġaani God-im, uqavigaaġutiksraqaġayaqtuq. Aglaan uqavigaaġutiksraitchuq piḷġusiġiksuanik sivuġaani God-im,

english: For what does the scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”
inupiaq: qanuq Bible uqaqtut, “Abraham ukpiġiŋagaa God, aasii taavruma nalaunŋasiŋagaa sivuġaani God-im.”

english: Now to the one who works, his pay is not credited due to grace but due to obligation.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuk nalaunŋasipkaqtaullakpan pisigilugich piḷġusiḷḷuataŋi akiññaktaaġiniġaa nalaunŋasisiñi, iñuktun savakłuni akiññaktuatun. Aitchuusiaġiŋitkaa, aglaan akiḷiusiaġigaa.

english: But to the one who does not work, but believes in the one who declares the ungodly righteous, his faith is credited as righteousness.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi iñuk nalaunŋasiñiataŋitchuaq piḷġusiḷḷuatamigun aglaan ukpiqtuaq God-mun, nalaunŋarualigaa God-im ukpiġutaa pisigivlugu. God-im nalaunŋasiḷḷagai piḷuusiqirit ukpiliġmata.

english: So even David himself speaks regarding the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:
inupiaq: Taamna uvva David uqautigiŋagaa Bible-ni uqallakami, iñuk quviasuguuruq God-im nalaunŋasipkaġmani piqutigiŋaiqł̣ugich piḷġusiḷḷuataŋi. David uqallaŋaruq inna,

english: “Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven, and whose sins are covered;
inupiaq: Taapkua David uqaluŋi quviasaaġusiat inŋitchut kisiŋiññun tamatkunuŋa nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaruanun God-mun piksraqtaaguniŋatigun, aglaallu Jew-guŋitchuanun. Qanuq Bible uqaqtut Abraham nalaunŋasipkaqtaunivḷugu pisigivlugu ukpiġutaa.

english: blessed is the one  against whom the Lord will never count sin.”
inupiaq: Abraham nalaunŋasiŋagaa God-im nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaiñŋaan timimiñi.

english: Is this blessedness then for the circumcision or also for the uncircumcision? For we say, “faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness.”
inupiaq: Abraham nalunaiñŋutaŋa iḷitchuqqutauŋaruq ilaa God-mun nalaunŋasipkaqtauganiŋatilaaŋanik pisigivlugu ukpiġutaa. God sivunniŋaruq tainna, malġuk sivuniġivlugik. Sivulliġmi, Abraham aapatun ittuq iluqaiññun Jew-guŋitchuanun, tuvrautiruanun tuvraaksriutaanun, ukpiġunmikkun nalaunŋasipkaqtauruanun God-im sivuġaani.

english: How then was it credited to him? Was he circumcised at the time, or not? No, he was not circumcised but uncircumcised!
inupiaq: Igḷuani, ilaa aapauruq iluqaiññun Jew-guruanun kisian pisigisuŋaġnagu nalunaiñŋutaŋat God-mun iñuginiḷugich, aglaan ukpiqtuanun God-mun, Abraham-tun ukpiġutiqaqtuatun God-mun nalunaiñŋutchiŋaiñŋaġmi.

english: And he received the sign of circumcision as a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised, so that he would become the father of all those who believe but have never been circumcised, that they too could have righteousness credited to them.
inupiaq: God-im unniqsuqłiiŋagaa Abraham kiŋuniŋiḷu kiŋuvaannagniaġnivḷugich nunamik. Taamna unniqsuqłiiñ unniqsuqłiisauŋaitchuq God-im qaiñmagich aglausimaruat pitqurani Moses-kun, aglaan unniqsuqłiisauŋaruq Abraham-mun God-im nalaunŋasipkaġmagu ukpiġutaa pisigivlugu.

english: And he is also the father of the circumcised, who are not only circumcised, but who also walk in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham possessed when he was still uncircumcised.
inupiaq: Tavra kisimiŋ piqaqtuat God-im pitquraŋiññik kiŋuvaannakkumaaqpata nunamik, ukpiġun anniqsuutauŋitchuq, unniqsuqłiiñ anniqsuutauŋiñmiuq.

english: For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants that he would inherit the world was not fulfilled through the law, but through the righteousness that comes by faith.
inupiaq: Qanuq uqallautianiŋagivsi, God-im pitquraŋisa tatavsaqtitchuugaich iñuich qanuq kamagilaitkaich. Iñuich pitquraiññamiŋ kamagiŋisaksraitchut pitquranik.

english: For if they become heirs by the law, faith is empty and the promise is nullified.
inupiaq: Tavra iḷitchirugut iñuich ukpiġutiqaqtuksraupiaqtut aitchuusiaġiniaġumirruŋ God-im unniqsuqłiisaa. Aasii iñuich ukpiliqamiŋ, Abraham-mun kiŋuniḷiutisuurut, aasiiḷi God nagliktuutiqpaŋmigun nalupqinaiġuugaa unniqsuqłiisini iliŋiññun, tamatkunuŋa pitquramiñik piqaqtuanun, tamatkunuŋalu ukpiġutiqaqtuanun Abraham-tun. Tavraasii Abraham aapagigikput iluqata,

english: For the law brings wrath, because where there is no law there is no transgression either.
inupiaq: aglausimaniŋatun Bible-ni, God uqallaŋaruq, “Uvaŋa aapaliutiŋagikpiñ iñugiaktuanun nunauruanun.” Tavraasii God-im akuqtuŋagaa Abraham aapaliutivlugu iluqaptiŋnun, qanuq ilaan ukpiġiŋagaa God iñuupkaiḷḷaruaq tuquŋaruanik, suli uqautiqallaruaq sivunniuġunmiñik taŋŋiŋaitchuanik taŋŋianiŋaruatun iḷivḷugich.

english: For this reason it is by faith so that it may be by grace, with the result that the promise may be certain to all the descendants – not only to those who are under the law, but also to those who have the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all
inupiaq: Abraham, niġiunaiġaluaqtillugu timimiñi, niġiuŋaruq suli aapaġuġniaġnivḷuni iñugiaktuanun nunauruanun, uqallausiaqaŋavluni, “Iñugiaktuanik kiŋuniqaġniaqtutin.”

english: (as it is written, “I have made you the father of many nations”). He is our father in the presence of God whom he believed – the God who makes the dead alive and summons the things that do not yet exist as though they already do.
inupiaq: Nalupqitchauraŋitchuq ukpiġunmiñi isummatigikami utuqqalivḷuni miqłiqsiñiksramigun tallimakipiatun ukiunikami. Nalupqitchauraŋiñmiuq isummatigikamiuŋ Sarah miqłiqsiḷaitchuaq.

english: Against hope Abraham believed in hope with the result that he became the father of many nations according to the pronouncement, “so will your descendants be.”
inupiaq: Arguagiŋaitkaa God-mun taŋŋiġñiaqtilaaŋa unniqsuqłiisaa, aglaan nanġaqługu God ukpiliqsaiññaŋaruq.

english: Without being weak in faith, he considered his own body as dead (because he was about one hundred years old) and the deadness of Sarah’s womb.
inupiaq: Abraham ukpipiallaŋaruq God-mun taŋŋiġumiñaqtilaaŋanik unniqsuqłiisaa.

english: He did not waver in unbelief about the promise of God but was strengthened in faith, giving glory to God.
inupiaq: Abraham ukpiġutaa pisigivlugu God-im nalaunŋasipkaŋagaa sivuqqamiñi.

english: He was fully convinced that what God promised he was also able to do.
inupiaq: Taapkua uqaluich Bible-niittuat quliaqtuaqaqtuat Abraham nalaunŋasipkaqtaunivḷugu ukpiġutaa pisigivlugu, anniqsuġmigaatigut uvagut.

english: So indeed it was credited to Abraham as righteousness.
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiġupta God-mun aŋipkaiŋaruamun Jesus-mik Ataniptiŋnik tuqqunmiñ, God-iptauq nalaunŋasipkaġniaġmigaatigut sivuqqamiñi.

english: But the statement it was credited to him was not written only for Abraham’s sake,
inupiaq: God-im nalaunŋarualiyumiñaġaatigut, qanuq Jesus tuqqutiŋagaatigut aŋivḷuniḷu tuqqunmiñ, akiḷiqł̣ugich piḷuutivut nalaunŋasivḷutalu sivuġaani God-im.

english: but also for our sake, to whom it will be credited, those who believe in the one who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead.
He was given over because of our transgressions and was raised for the sake of our justification.
Therefore, since we have been declared righteous by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
inupiaq: Paŋmapak aŋuyautaiqsugut God-mun qanuq ukpiqtugut Atanipta Jesus Christ nalaunŋasipkaŋagaatigut sivuġaani God.

english: through whom we have also obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand, and we rejoice in the hope of God’s glory.
inupiaq: Pisigivlugu Jesus, God nagliktuutiqpaqaqsimaaqtuq uvaptiŋnun, aasii quviasuktugut niġiugivlugu iḷaŋiutiniksraqput God-im kamanautaanun.

english: Not only this, but we also rejoice in sufferings, knowing that suffering produces endurance,
inupiaq: Aasiisuli quviasugmiugut nagliksaaqaptaunnii, iḷisimavluta nagliksaaġunmun qiñuiqsaiññaqtitchumiñaqtilaaptiŋnik,

english: and endurance, character, and character, hope.
inupiaq: aasii qiñuirrutiqaqtuiññaġupta nagliksaaqapta, iḷumun ititkikput ukpiqtuagutilaaqput. Niġiuktugut suli iḷaŋiutiniaqtilaaptiŋnik God-im kamanautaanik.

english: And hope does not disappoint, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us.
inupiaq: Niġiukkurvut asiḷiqqutauŋitchuq. Ilitqusiġiksuam iḷuptiŋniittuam nalupqinaiŋagaa uvaptiŋnun iḷisimapkairuam uvaptiŋnik qanutun God-mun piviuttaġipiaġataqtilaaptiŋnik.

english: For while we were still helpless, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.
inupiaq: Uvaptiŋnik ikayuġumiñaipiaqtilluta, piviksraq nalautinman, Christ tuqqutiŋagai piḷuusiqiripayaurat.

english: (For rarely will anyone die for a righteous person, though for a good person perhaps someone might possibly dare to die.)
inupiaq: Qanutun iñuk nakuutigigaluaqtillugu nallivsaunnii tuqqutisuŋniaŋitkaa. Iḷaannivsauq iñuum imma tuqqutiyumiñaġugnaġmigaa iñulluataq.

english: But God demonstrates his own love for us, in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
inupiaq: Naaggauvva piḷuusiqiraugaluaqtilluta, Christ tuqqutiŋagaatigut, aasii taavrumuuna God-im salapqiġaa piviuttaqqutini uvaptiŋnun.

english: Much more then, because we have now been declared righteous by his blood, we will be saved through him from God’s wrath.
inupiaq: Tavra nalaunŋasipkaqtaukapta paŋmapak Christ auŋagun, nalupqisuŋipiaqtugut Christ-mun annautiniaqtilaaptiŋnik God-im qinnautaaniñ.

english: For if while we were enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, how much more, since we have been reconciled, will we be saved by his life?
inupiaq: Christ iḷauraaliuŋagaatigut God-mun tuqqutivluta, uumikłiġaluaqtilluta ilaanik. Tavraasii paŋmapak God-im iḷauraaġiliutimmatigut, Christ nalupqinaitchuamik annautiniaġaatigut, qanuq ilaa iñuuruq.

english: Not only this, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received this reconciliation.
inupiaq: Taamnatualuuŋiñmiuq, quviakkiutigikput God Ataniptigun Jesus Christ-kun, iḷauraaliuqtuakun uvaptiŋnik God-mun.

english: So then, just as sin entered the world through one man and death through sin, and so death spread to all people because all sinned –
inupiaq: Una pisigivlugu iñupayaat piḷuksiŋarut aasii tuquvlutiŋ. Adam iñuqqaaq piḷuksiŋaruq aasii aquvatigun tuquŋaruq. Adam kiŋuniġivlugich iñupayaat, iluqaġmiŋ piḷuksiŋarut aasii tuquruksraġuqłutiŋ.

english: for before the law was given, sin was in the world, but there is no accounting for sin when there is no law.
inupiaq: Iñupayaat iñuuŋaruat Moses aitchuusiaqaŋaiñŋaan God-miñ pitquranik piḷuusiqirauŋarut, aglaan pasirauŋaitchut piḷuunmikkun qanuq piqaŋił̣ł̣utiŋ God-im pitquraŋiñik.

english: Yet death reigned from Adam until Moses even over those who did not sin in the same way that Adam (who is a type of the coming one) transgressed.
inupiaq: Tavra iñupayaat Adam-miñqaŋa Moses-munaglaan tuquŋarut Adam tuvraqługu kipuqłaktaŋitkaluaŋŋaisa God-im pitquraŋi. Tuqummiut qanuq piḷuusiqirauvlutiktauq. Adam tuqqunmik pipkaimman, Christ-li aquvatigun qairuaq iñuggutiqaqtitchiruq.

english: But the gracious gift is not like the transgression. For if the many died through the transgression of the one man, how much more did the grace of God and the gift by the grace of the one man Jesus Christ multiply to the many!
inupiaq: God-im nagliktuutigivlugu aitchuutaa akiḷḷiuruq Adam kamaksriŋiññiŋanun. Iñuich tuquŋarut qanuq Adam piḷuksiŋaruq. Taavrumaŋŋa pił̣haaqtuq, iñuich nalaunŋasipkaqtauyumiñaqtut akiiḷaamik Jesus Christ-kun, qanuq God nagliktuutiqpaqaŋaruq iliŋiññun.

english: And the gift is not like the one who sinned. For judgment, resulting from the one transgression, led to condemnation, but the gracious gift from the many failures led to justification.
inupiaq: Tavra akiiḷaaq aitchuun Christ-kuaqtuaq akiḷḷiuruq Adam piḷuutikun iñiqtaŋanun. Qanuq Adam piḷuutaa pipkaiŋaruq isivġiunmik suksraunġiunmiglu, aglaan akiiḷaaq aitchuun, iñugiaktuat piḷuksianiŋmata, nalaunŋasipkairuq iñuŋnik God-im sivuġaani.

english: For if, by the transgression of the one man, death reigned through the one, how much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ!
inupiaq: Pisigivlugu Adam piḷuksimman, tuqqun umialiktun atanniqsimanniŋaruq iñupayaanik. Taavrumaŋŋa pił̣haaqtuq, iñuich akuqtuiruat nalaunŋasipkaunmik God-im nagliktuutigivlugu aitchuutaanik, iñuullaniaqtut umialiktun, atanniqsimalugu piḷuun ikayuutaagun Jesus Christ.

english: Consequently, just as condemnation for all people came through one transgression, so too through the one righteous act came righteousness leading to life for all people.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuum atautchim piḷuksisaata qaġġisimmagu suksraunġiun iñupayaanun, tainnalivsauq iñuum atautchim kamaksriñiŋata God-mik, qaġġisigaik suliqutigiŋaiqsauniġlu piiguġumiñaqsivḷugich piḷuutit iñuggullu iñupayaanun.

english: For just as through the disobedience of the one man many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of one man many will be made righteous.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuum atautchim kamasuŋirrutaagun iñuich piḷuusiqiriġuġmata, tainnaptauq iñuum atautchim kamaksriñiŋagun, iñuich nalaunŋasipkaqtauyumiñaqtut.

english: Now the law came in so that the transgression may increase, but where sin increased, grace multiplied all the more,
inupiaq: God-im aitchuutigimmagich pitqurani Moses-kun, iñuich iḷitchuġivsaaŋarut piḷuun kamaksriŋirrutautilaaŋanik God-im pitquraŋiñik. Tavra kamasuŋirrun aglimman, tainnatuttauq God-im nagliktuutiqpaŋa aglił̣haaŋaruq.

english: so that just as sin reigned in death, so also grace will reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
inupiaq: Tavra piḷuun atanniqsimanniŋman iñuŋnik tuqqutauvluni, God-ivli nagliktuutiqpaŋa atanniqsimanniktuq iñuŋnik iñuupkallavlugich isuitchuamun qanuq Atanipta Jesus Christ nalaunŋasipkaŋagai.

english: What shall we say then? Are we to remain in sin so that grace may increase?
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainman, piḷuusiqiugaqtuksrauŋitchugut uuktuġniaqsiññaġlugu qanutun God nagliktuutiqpaqaqtilaaŋa.

english: Absolutely not! How can we who died to sin still live in it?
inupiaq: Piḷuusiqiruksrauŋipiaġataqtugut. Ukpiliqapta Christ Jesus-mun, iñuutchivut piḷuksisuguuruat tuqummatun piut. Taamna pisigilugu piḷuusiqiugaqtuksrauŋitchugut.

english: Or do you not know that as many as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi iluqata paptaiqsaukapta, Atausiŋŋuqatauŋarugut Christ Jesus-mun. Aasii ilaa tuqumman, uvagut piḷuksisuguuruat iñuutchivut tuqummiut.

english: Therefore we have been buried with him through baptism into death, in order that just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we too may live a new life.
inupiaq: Tavra paptaiqsaukapta, piḷuktuat iñuutchivut iḷuviqataummatun piŋarut ilaa tuqumman. Aasii Christ-tun aŋipkaqtauruatun tuqqunmiñ suaŋŋataagun Aapam, uvaguttauq aitchuusiaqaŋammiugut nutauruamik iñuggunmik, aasii iñuuruksraurugut taavrumuuna nutauruakun iñuutchikun.

english: For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death, we will certainly also be united in the likeness of his resurrection.
inupiaq: Tavra atausiŋŋuqatigiŋaguptigu tuqqutaani, nalupqinaitchuq atausiŋŋuqatiginiaġmigikput aŋŋisaani.

english: We know that our old man was crucified with him so that the body of sin would no longer dominate us, so that we would no longer be enslaved to sin.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarugut ilaa kikiaktuurraumman uvagut piḷuksisuguuruat iñuutchivut kikiaktuurrauqatauŋarut ilaanun, piḷuunmun aŋalanŋaiquvluta, kivgauŋaiquvluta piḷuunmun.

english: (For someone who has died has been freed from sin.)
inupiaq: Iñuk tuqukami, aŋalatinŋaiġuuruq piḷuunmun.

english: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.
inupiaq: Piqatauŋaniqapta Christ tuqqutaani, ukpiqtugut piqatauniaqtilaaptiŋnik iñuusianun Christ.

english: We know that since Christ has been raised from the dead, he is never going to die again; death no longer has mastery over him.
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷisimarugut Christ aŋipkaqtauganikami tuqqunmiñ, tuqutqikkumiñaipiaqtuq, tuqqutim atanniqsimatqikkumiñaitkaa.

english: For the death he died, he died to sin once for all, but the life he lives, he lives to God.
inupiaq: Christ tuqukami, tuquŋaruq atausiaqłuni, akiḷiġukługich piḷuutivut. Paŋmapak iñuuruq, iñuutuiññaqłuni God-mun.

english: So you too consider yourselves dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus.
inupiaq: Ilivsiḷiasii isummatigiruksraurusi ilivsiññik tuquŋaruatun iḷiḷusi piḷuunmun, aŋalatinŋaiġḷusi piḷuunmun, aasii iñuulusi God-mun, qanuq atausiŋŋuqatigiŋagiksi Christ Jesus.

english: Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its desires,
inupiaq: Piḷuunmun aŋalatinnasi. Kamaginagich pigiitchuat pisuguutisi.

english: and do not present your members to sin as instruments to be used for unrighteousness, but present yourselves to God as those who are alive from the dead and your members to God as instruments to be used for righteousness.
inupiaq: Atuġnagu sulliñipayauraŋa timivsi piḷuusiqutigisuglugu. Aglaan God-im aŋalallisi qanuq tavraŋŋaaglaan aŋalatinŋaiŋarusi piḷuunmun iñuusarraqsikavsi God-mun. Aŋalatitchiuŋ sulliñipayauraŋa timivsi God-mun, nalaunŋarualiqiyumausi.

english: For sin will have no mastery over you, because you are not under law but under grace.
inupiaq: Piḷuutim aŋalataġiŋaiġñiaġaasi, qanuq iñuuŋaiŋarusi kamaginiataglugich pitqurat, aglaan iñuurusi God-im nagliktuutiqpaŋagun.

english: What then? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Absolutely not!
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainniġman, piḷuksiñata pisigilugu iñuuniqput God-im nagliktuutiqpaŋagun, kamaksriñiatagniġmiñ pitquranik qaisauruanik Moses-kun. Piḷuksiruksrauŋipiaġataqtugut.

english: Do you not know that if you present yourselves as obedient slaves, you are slaves of the one you obey, either of sin resulting in death, or obedience resulting in righteousness?
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi nalliqsi kivgaliutiniġumi kimulliqaa, kamagiraksraġigaa kivgatun. Tainnatulli ilivsi piḷuunmun aŋalatitkuvsi kivgaummatun piḷuunmun inniaġmiusi, tasammaasii tatavsaqtaulġiñaġlusi isuitchuamun. Aglaan aŋalatitkuvsi kamagisuglugu God, nalaunŋaruaguniaqtusi ilaan sivuġaani.

english: But thanks be to God that though you were slaves to sin, you obeyed from the heart that pattern of teaching you were entrusted to,
inupiaq: Tavra God quyyavigirauli, qanuq paŋmapak kamaksripialiqsusi uummativsiññiñ taavrumiŋa iḷisaurrutaanik God-im iḷisausiavsiññik, kivgausuuŋagaluaqtuasii piḷuunmun.

english: and having been freed from sin, you became enslaved to righteousness.
inupiaq: Annaktitauganikłusi piḷuunmiñ, kivgaġuqtusi iłuatun iñuuniaġniġmun sivuġaani God-im.

english: (I am speaking in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh.) For just as you once presented your members as slaves to impurity and lawlessness leading to more lawlessness, so now present your members as slaves to righteousness leading to sanctification.
inupiaq: Uqautisaaqsigivsi uuktuusiġḷuŋa kivgauniġmik, kaŋiqsimmaġiksitquvlusi. Taimani aitchuutigisuuŋagaluakkasi timivsi sulliñipayauraŋich piḷuusiqiniġmun suli kamasuutaiqsaiññaġniġmun, tavrali paŋmapak aitchuutigisigik timivsi sulliñipayaaŋi nalaunŋaruakun iñuuniaġniġmun ilaaguaqtauyumausi God-mun.

english: For when you were slaves of sin, you were free with regard to righteousness.
inupiaq: Kivgausuuŋŋavsi piḷuunmun, aŋalataġipkaŋaitchusi iñuuniaġniġmun nalaunŋaruamun sivuġaani God-im.

english: So what benefit did you then reap from those things that you are now ashamed of? For the end of those things is death.
inupiaq: Tainnatchim iñuutchim paŋmapak kanŋugilikkavsi anniqsuŋaitkaasi aglaan tatavsaqtaupkaġumiñaġaasi isuitchuamun.

english: But now, freed from sin and enslaved to God, you have your benefit leading to sanctification, and the end is eternal life.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak-aasii atanġiqsitaurusi piḷuunmiñ kivgaliutivlusi God-mun, anniqsuusiaqaġniaqtusi ilaaguaqtauniġmik iñuggunmiglu isuitchuamik iñuutqulusi God-mun.

english: For the payoff of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa piḷuusiqirauruaq akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtuq tatavsaqtauluni isuitchuamun, aglaan God-im akiiḷaaq aitchuutigigaa iñuggun isuitchuaq tamatkunuŋa atausiŋŋuqatauruanun Christ Jesus-mun.

english: Or do you not know, brothers and sisters (for I am speaking to those who know the law), that the law is lord over a person as long as he lives?
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, uqautigivsi iḷisimaruasii God-im pitquraŋiñik qaisaŋiñik Moses-kun, iḷisimarusi pitquranun iñuk aŋalatitchuuruq iñuuniġmiñi kisianik.

english: For a married woman is bound by law to her husband as long as he lives, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law of the marriage.
