english: And we speak about these things, not with words taught us by human wisdom, but with those taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual things to spiritual people.
inupiaq: Qanuq,

english: The unbeliever does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him. And he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.
The one who is spiritual discerns all things, yet he himself is understood by no one.
For who has known the mind of the Lord, so as to advise him? But we have the mind of Christ.
So, brothers and sisters, I could not speak to you as spiritual people, but instead as people of the flesh, as infants in Christ.
inupiaq: Aglaan taimani nayuqavsi, aniqatiit, iḷisautiyumiñaiñŋagivsi iñuktun iḷiḷusi puttuqsriruatun Ilitqusiġiksuakun, qanuq ukpiqsaqpaallukłusi. Inŋavlusi ukpiŋaitchuatun kaŋiqsiñmi, suli miqłiqtuuratun iłłusi ukpiġutivsiññi.

english: I fed you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready. In fact, you are still not ready,
inupiaq: Iḷisaurrutitka ilivsiññun siġḷiġnaiñŋarut. Miqłiqtuuraq immułhiñamik imiqtuksraummatun niqipiaqtullasiŋaił̣ł̣uni, tainnatun itqanaiñŋaiñmiusi iḷisaurrutiksranun agliraksraiŋaruat ukpiqtuat kaŋiqsiḷḷakkaŋiññun. Paŋmapak-unnii itqanaiñŋitchusi.

english: for you are still influenced by the flesh. For since there is still jealousy and dissension among you, are you not influenced by the flesh and behaving like unregenerate people?
inupiaq: Qanuq uvva paŋmapak-unnii iñuuruagurusi ukpiŋaitchuatun. Killuqqutivlusi avanmun, qanaaġutivlusiḷu, ukpiŋaitchuatun ittusi, aullasiqaqtusi iñugruiññatun.

english: For whenever someone says, “I am with Paul,” or “I am with Apollos,” are you not merely human?
inupiaq: Qanuq ilivsiññik aŋalattusi iñugruiññatun iḷasi uqaġmata Paul-muktuqtuŋa, allalli uqaqłutiŋ, uvaŋa Apollos-muktuqtuŋa.

english: What is Apollos, really? Or what is Paul? Servants through whom you came to believe, and each of us in the ministry the Lord gave us.
inupiaq: Suliqutauva Apollos? Suliqutauva Paul? Kivgałhiñak uvaguk ukpiġikkaptiguk, Atanġum ukpiliqsinmasi Apollos-kullu uvapkullu God-im piraksriutillaaŋatun uvaptiŋnun.

english: I planted, Apollos watered, but God caused it to grow.
inupiaq: Alġaqsruiñiqpuk akunnavsiññi uuktuutiqaġumiñaqtuq nautchirriqirim savaaŋanik. Uvaŋa urriqatigiluŋa nautchirriiruatun nautchiaksranik, aasiiḷi Apollos imiġmik aiḷaqtiġimmatun nautchirriutauruanik, aasiiḷi God-im naupkaqługich.

english: So neither the one who plants counts for anything, nor the one who waters, but God who causes the growth.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iñuk nautchirriiruaq iñuglu aiḷaqtiġiruaq suvigruaguŋitchuk, aglaan God kisimi naumaruq qanuq naupkaiḷḷaruq.

english: The one who plants and the one who waters work as one, but each will receive his reward according to his work.
inupiaq: Nautchirriiruaġlu aiḷaqtiġiruaġlu atiruk, aasii inmikkullaa akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtuk savaallaamikkun.

english: We are coworkers belonging to God. You are God’s field, God’s building.
inupiaq: Qanuq uvaguk savaqatigiiksuguk God pisivlugu, aasii ilivsiḷi God-im nautchiaqaġvigimmatun. Aasiisuli igluqpaktun inmiusi God-im nappakkaŋatun.

english: According to the grace of God given to me, like a skilled master-builder I laid a foundation, but someone else builds on it. And each one must be careful how he builds.
inupiaq: Sanatuvluni qaukłiuruatun igluqpiritun, inillaŋagiga maŋŋuksraq, taŋŋiqł̣ugu savaaksrirrutaa God-im uvamnun. Taavruma maŋŋuliutiruam qaaŋanun allali iñuk nappairuq. Iñullaa qaunakłaaġli qanuq nappaisilaamiñik taavrumuŋa maŋŋuliutauŋaruamun.

english: For no one can lay any foundation other than what is being laid, which is Jesus Christ.
inupiaq: Allamik maŋŋuksramik iñuk iḷisiyumiñaitchuq taamna anaglugu iḷirauŋaruaq, sivuniqaqtuaq Jesus Christ-mik.

english: If anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or straw,
inupiaq: Iñuich aglaan nappaiyumiñaġmiut maŋŋuliutauŋaruamun akisuruanik sunik maqulaitchuanik naaggaqaa akiisuuranik sunik maquyaruanik.

english: each builder’s work will be plainly seen, for the Day will make it clear, because it will be revealed by fire. And the fire will test what kind of work each has done.
inupiaq: Iñullaam savaaŋa satqummiġñiaqtuq isivġiġvium uvluani. Qanuq taavrumani uvlumi iñullaam savaaŋa qanuġumiñaġniaġaa igniġum, aasii igniġum uuktuġniaġaa qanusiutilaaŋanik iñullaam savaaŋa.

english: If what someone has built survives, he will receive a reward.
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa savaaŋa nappaŋakkaŋa maŋŋuliutauŋaruamun, igniġum ikiŋitpagu ilaa akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtuq.

english: If someone’s work is burned up, he will suffer loss. He himself will be saved, but only as through fire.
inupiaq: Iñuum kialiqaa savaaŋa ikiraukpan, ilaa akiḷiusiaqaġniaŋitchuq, ilaa annaurraupqaatchiaġmiḷuni igniġmiñ annaurraukami.

english: Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit lives in you?
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik puttuqsrimarusi God-im iñuutilaaŋanik iḷuvsiññi. Ilivsi ittusi ilaan aŋaiyyuviatun, suli God-im Ilitqusiġiksuaŋa iñuuvluni iḷuvsiññi.

english: If someone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy him. For God’s temple is holy, which is what you are.
inupiaq: Kialiqaa maqutpagu taamna God-im aŋaiyyuvia, God-iptauq suksraunġiġñiaġmigaa ilaa. Qanuq God-im aŋaiyyuvia ilaaguaqtauruq ilaanun, aasii ilivsi ilaan aŋaiyyuvigigaasi.

english: Guard against self-deception, each of you. If someone among you thinks he is wise in this age, let him become foolish so that he can become wise.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa sagluqinani inmiñik. Iñuk akunnavsiññi isumagumi isumatunasugaluni, iñugruiññaich isummasiatitun isummatigikamirruŋ isumattun, ilaa isumalluaġiiġḷi isumattutinikkumauq God-im isumattutaanik.

english: For the wisdom of this age is foolishness with God. As it is written, “He catches the wise in their craftiness.”
inupiaq: Qanuq isumattutaat ukpiŋaitchuat asiḷiqqutauruq God-mi. Taamna sivuniġivlugu aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, “God-im isumatusaaruat pisaupkaġaġigai ilaisa pisaasuqsaaniaġutaannun.”

english: And again, “The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile.”
inupiaq: Aasiisuli aglausimavsaaqłuni, “Atanġum iḷisimagai isumaŋich isumaturuat asiḷiqqutautilaaŋat.”

english: So then, no more boasting about mere mortals! For everything belongs to you,
inupiaq: Tamatkua tainnainniġmata, kiñaliqaa uqavigaaġutiqaŋaiḷḷi iñuich nalliŋiññuktuġniḷuni atautchimunmuktaqtuat, qanuq supayaat pigigisi ikayuqsaqłusi,

english: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future. Everything belongs to you,
inupiaq: Paul-lu Apollos-lu Cephas-lu God-im nunaŋalu iñuggullu tuqqullu paŋmapak iñuuniqsiḷu, iñuggutigiyumaakkaqsiḷu, iluqaisa pigigisi,

english: and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God.
inupiaq: aasiisuli Christ pigigaasi, aasiiḷivsauq Christ God-im pigimmigaa.

english: One should think about us this way – as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
inupiaq: Uvagut iḷisaurrit isummatigiraksraurugut Christ-mun kivgaġiniḷuta, aitchuusiaqaqłuta savaaksrapiaġatamik iḷisaurriruaguluta God-im iḷumun ittuaŋanik kaŋiqsiñaiñŋaruamik sivuani.

english: Now what is sought in stewards is that one be found faithful.
inupiaq: Tavraasii kivgat niġiugiraurut ataramik ukpiġnaqtuksraupiaqługich.

english: So for me, it is a minor matter that I am judged by you or by any human court. In fact, I do not even judge myself.
inupiaq: Kivgalluatauŋavik uvaŋa? Qanupayaaq ilivsi allallu iñuich isummatigigaluaqpanŋa uŋiarrisaġiŋitkiga. Uvamnun unnii pimaqłuktualiŋitchuŋa.

english: For I am not aware of anything against myself, but I am not acquitted because of this. The one who judges me is the Lord.
inupiaq: Isummatigiŋitchuŋa pasiñaġumiñaġluŋa kivgaumaqłuŋniḷuŋa, aglaan taamna sivuniqaŋitchuq pasiñaġumiñaiññiḷuŋa. Ataniq isivġiiruq uvamnik.

english: So then, do not judge anything before the time. Wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light the hidden things of darkness and reveal the motives of hearts. Then each will receive recognition from God.
inupiaq: Uqaġnasi iñuich pasiraksraġuġniḷugich isivġiġvium sivuani, Atanġum qaiviksraŋata sivuani. Atanġum qaigumi, ilaan salapqiġñiaġai iluqaisa iriqsimaruat, suli salapqiġḷugich iñuich nalunaqtuakun sivunniuġutiŋich. Tavraniasii iñupayaaq nalaunŋaruakun God-im akiḷiġñiaġaa.

english: I have applied these things to myself and Apollos because of you, brothers and sisters, so that through us you may learn “not to go beyond what is written,” so that none of you will be puffed up in favor of the one against the other.
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, uvamniglu Apollos-miglu urriqasiŋaruŋa anniqsuqsaqłusi, iḷitchitquvlusi qanuq iñuusiksravsiññik uvaptiktun tuvraġlugich Bible, nallipayaaqsi kamasaaquŋił̣ł̣ugu, iviġaumaġiłhaaquŋił̣ł̣ugu iñuk atausiq allamiñ iñuŋmiñ.

english: For who concedes you any superiority? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you received it, why do you boast as though you did not?
inupiaq: Anniqsuusiat pigikkasi iluqaġmiŋ God-miŋŋaqtaurut. Aasii aitchuusiaġiniqavsigik, summan uqavigaaqpisi aitchuusiaġiŋitchuatun iḷivḷugich?

english: Already you are satisfied! Already you are rich! You have become kings without us! I wish you had become kings so that we could reign with you!
inupiaq: Ilivsi Corinthians isummatigisaaniktusi ilivsiññun pigiliutianignivḷugich iluqaisa pigisuktasi. Isummatigisaaniktusi ilivsiññun piiḷḷiuŋiññivḷusi quviasaaġusianik qiḷaŋmiñ. Isummatigirusi ilivsiññik umialiktun iḷivḷusi, kamanałhaaġnivḷusi uvaptiŋniñ, aasii pigiraksraġiŋił̣ł̣ugich uvagut iḷisaurrutivut. Umialliqsimanniquyumagaluaġmigivsi umialiktitun, piqatauyumiñaqsiḷuta atanniqsimannignivsiññi.

english: For, I think, God has exhibited us apostles last of all, as men condemned to die, because we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to people.
inupiaq: Iḷaanni isumasuuruŋa God-mun aqulliqpiaġuutipkaġasugaluta takłauriruani iñuŋni, uvagut tililauruaguut, tigutaaqtatun tuqutauyasiruatun, qiñiqsitaaliutivluta isuannun akimavlutiŋ aŋiḷġaqtuat takłaurivḷutiŋ, takunnaqtitchukłuta iñuŋnullu isaġuliŋnullu atunim.

english: We are fools for Christ, but you are wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are distinguished, we are dishonored!
inupiaq: Isumakkusiaqaqtugut isumalluaġiitchualivḷuta Christ pisigivlugu, aglaalli ilivsiññun isummatigirusi isumaturualivḷusi ukpiqtuasii. Aasiisuli uvagut suaŋaiññiraurugut ilivsiḷi isummatigipkaqtillusi suaŋarualivḷusi. Kamanaqtualiraummiusi aglaalli uvagut suuŋitchualirauvluta.

english: To the present hour we are hungry and thirsty, poorly clothed, brutally treated, and without a roof over our heads.
inupiaq: Paŋmapaŋmun aglaan ikarraġmun kaaksiurugut imiġuksiuvlutalu, annuġaagiḷḷiuġmiugut, pimaqłuktaqtauvluta, aimaaġviiñmiugut.

english: We do hard work, toiling with our own hands. When we are verbally abused, we respond with a blessing, when persecuted, we endure,
inupiaq: Siġġaqinialgiñmiugut savautigivlugich argavut. Uqamaqłuurraukapta, quviasaaqłiirugut, nagliksaaqtitaukapta igḷutuutirugut.

english: when people lie about us, we answer in a friendly manner. We are the world’s dirt and scum, even now.
inupiaq: Saŋutaukapta iḷammiuġniḷuktugut. Irrusiñiŋarugut paŋmapaglu irrusiġigikput suaqłuŋisun nunam natiġluŋisun supayaam.

english: I am not writing these things to shame you, but to correct you as my dear children.
inupiaq: Aglaŋitkitka taapkua kanŋusaaqsaġlusi, aglaan siḷġiqsuqsaqłusi piviuttaġikkaptun miqłiqtuptun.

english: For though you may have ten thousand guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers, because I became your father in Christ Jesus through the gospel.
inupiaq: Kisiññaitchuanik unnii iḷisaurriqaġaluaġuvsi qapiŋaisaaqtiksravsiññik ukpiġutivsiññi, atausisualuŋmik iñuŋmik piqaqtusi aapaummatun ittuamik ilivsiññun, qanuq uvaŋa aapauruatun ilivsiññun alġaqsruutigiŋagiga tusaayugaaġiksuaq, aasii ilivsi anitqiŋarusi ukpiqłusi Christ-mun.

english: I encourage you, then, be imitators of me.
inupiaq: Tuvraqupiaqtuŋaasii ilivsiññun.

english: For this reason, I have sent Timothy to you, who is my dear and faithful son in the Lord. He will remind you of my ways in Christ, as I teach them everywhere in every church.
inupiaq: Aasii ikayuqsaqłusi tainna pitquvlusi, tiligiga ilivsiññun piviuttaġiraġa ukpiġnaqtuaġlu Timothy, miqłiqtuġimmatun itaġa pisigivlugu ukpiqtuaguŋaniŋa uvapkun. Itqaqtinniaġaasi iñuuniaġusimñik atausiŋŋuqatigikapkuqaŋa Christ, uvaŋa iḷisaurrisiptuttauq sumiḷiqaa aŋaiyyuliqiruani.

english: Some have become arrogant, as if I were not coming to you.
inupiaq: Iñuich iḷasi arguaŋarut, qaiñiaŋiññasugaluŋa ilivsiññun.

english: But I will come to you soon, if the Lord is willing, and I will find out not only the talk of these arrogant people, but also their power.
inupiaq: Aglaan ullayasigivsi, Atanġum pisuutigikpagu, iḷitchuġiniaqtuŋa arguaŋaruat tamatkua uqaqpagaaqsiññaqtilaaŋannik naagga piqapiaqtilaaŋannik God-im suaŋŋataanik.

english: For the kingdom of God is demonstrated not in idle talk but with power.
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im atanniqsimmataa iñuŋnun uqaqsiññaġniġuŋitchuq, iñuuniġuruq God-im suaŋŋataagun.

english: What do you want? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline or with love and a spirit of gentleness?
inupiaq: Sutquyumavisi? Ullagniaqpisi tatavsaġiaġlusi, naagga piviuttaqqunmi?

english: It is actually reported that sexual immorality exists among you, the kind of immorality that is not permitted even among the Gentiles, so that someone is cohabiting with his father’s wife.
inupiaq: Quliaqtuaġipiaŋagaat allatuun innivḷugu akunnavsiññi, allatuun piḷġusiġiŋisaŋat akunġanniunnii ukpiŋaitchuat. Qanuq uvva iñuk iñuuqatiqaqsimaruq aapami nuliaŋanik.

english: And you are proud! Shouldn’t you have been deeply sorrowful instead and removed the one who did this from among you?
inupiaq: Naaggauvva arguaŋamarusi. Isumaaqpałhaaqtuksraugaluaqtusi. Iñuk taamna allatuqtuaq anitauli akunnavsiññiñ.

english: For even though I am absent physically, I am present in spirit. And I have already judged the one who did this, just as though I were present.
inupiaq: Nayuqtigiŋitkaluaŋŋavsi, isumaaluutigipiaġataġiga taamna, irrusiñiktuŋaunnii nayuġmatun iḷivḷusi aasii isivġiivḷuŋa pisivlugu Ataniq Jesus Christ.

english: When you gather together in the name of our Lord Jesus, and I am with you in spirit, along with the power of our Lord Jesus,
inupiaq: Isivġianikkiga iñuk taamna allatuqtualivḷugu. Kasimakavsi iḷisimaaniŋavlugu isivġiutiga pisivlugu Ataniqput Jesus,

english: turn this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord.
inupiaq: aitchuutigiraksraġigiksi taamna aŋun Satan-mun naŋiliġumauq timimiñi aasii tuquluni, ilitqusia annaurrauyumauq Ataniqput Jesus Christ qaitqikpan.

english: Your boasting is not good. Don’t you know that a little yeast affects the whole batch of dough?
inupiaq: Uqavigaaġniqsi nakuuŋitchuq. Iḷisimagiksi mikiruurakkaluam imaksram puvlaktitchuugaa iluqaan akutaq. Tainnatuttauq piḷuun akunnavsiññi pipkaivsaaġniaġmiuq piḷuutivsaamik.

english: Clean out the old yeast so that you may be a new batch of dough – you are, in fact, without yeast. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.
inupiaq: Piḷuusiqinasi qanuq iñuuruksraurusi piḷuutaiḷḷusi, Christ tuquŋaruq piiqsaqługich piḷuutivut.

english: So then, let us celebrate the festival, not with the old yeast, the yeast of vice and evil, but with the bread without yeast, the bread of sincerity and truth.
inupiaq: Jew-guruat itqaġmatun qulaurrusiqivik niqinaqivlutiŋ, tuqułługu imnaiyaaq suli niġivḷutiŋ puvlaksautaitchuamik punniġmik, uvaguttauq qulaurrusiqimmatun pimmiugut. Christ God-im imnaiyaaŋatun ittuq tuqutauŋaruaq pisigivluta, aasiiḷi niġiḷakput puvlaksautaitchuaq punniq arriqaqtuaq piŋŋuaġutauŋitchuamik iḷumun ittuamiglu, niqigiŋaiġḷugu utuqqauruaq puvlaksautilik punniq, arriqaqtuaq uumikłiġñiġmik pigiitchuamiglu.

english: I wrote you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people.
inupiaq: Aglaŋaruŋa ilivsiññun tuyuutimni piqatiqaquŋił̣ł̣usi allatuqtinik iñuŋnik.

english: In no way did I mean the immoral people of this world, or the greedy and swindlers and idolaters, since you would then have to go out of the world.
inupiaq: Sivuniġiŋitkitka suuramikunnii piqatigiŋaiqukapkich avuunnaaqtuqulugich allatuqtauruat mattumani nunami naaggaunnii siŋñaturuat tigligayuktiqpaiḷḷu naaggaunnii ukpiqtauruat God-auŋitchuanun, qanuq tainna piñiaġuvsi aullaqtuksrauniaqtusi nunamiñ.

english: But now I am writing to you not to associate with anyone who calls himself a Christian who is sexually immoral, or greedy, or an idolater, or verbally abusive, or a drunkard, or a swindler. Do not even eat with such a person.
inupiaq: Aglaan tuyuŋagivsi piqasiqsuquŋił̣ł̣usi kiñapayaaq ukpiqtuaguqatiksi piḷuusiqikpan allatuunmik, naagga siŋñanmik, naaggaunnii ukpiqtauruamik God-auŋitchuanun, uqamaqłuurrisuuruamiglu, taaŋŋaqtauruamiglu, naagga tigligayuktiqpauruamik. Sumikunnii niġiqatigiraksraġiŋitkiksi tainnasiq iñuk.

english: For what do I have to do with judging those outside? Are you not to judge those inside?
inupiaq: Suniaġlugich isivġigaksraġivik ukpiŋaitchuat? Ukpiqtuaġuŋaruat kisiisa isivġigaksraġigivut.

english: But God will judge those outside. Remove the evil person from among you.
inupiaq: God-im isivġiġai tamatkua ukpiqtuaguŋitchuat. Anitchiuŋ piḷuusiqirauruaq iñuk akunnavsiññiñ.

english: When any of you has a legal dispute with another, does he dare go to court before the unrighteous rather than before the saints?
inupiaq: Iḷari uqaġlaqutiqaġumi ukpiqtuaguqanmiñun, uqaġlaqutini iłuaqsipkaġniagaksraġiŋitkaa isivġiqsimun ukpiqtuaguŋitchuamun, aglaan iłuaqsipkaġumiñaġaa ukpiqtuaġuŋaruamun. Kanŋusuktuksraurusi ukpiŋaitchuamun iłuaqsruqtinnavsiuŋ.

english: Or do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world is to be judged by you, are you not competent to settle trivial suits?
inupiaq: Naluvisi tamatkunuŋa ilaaguaqtauŋaruanun God-mun isivġiġumaaqtilaaŋanik nunam iñuŋi? Isivġiġumaaġniqavsigik iłuaqsruġumiñaġaluaġmigisi aŋiŋitchuat uqaġlaqutit.

english: Do you not know that we will judge angels? Why not ordinary matters!
inupiaq: Nalummivisi-suli isivġiiyumaaqtilaaptiŋnik isaġuliŋnik? Nalupqinaitchuamik iłuaqsiriyumiñaqtugut uqaġlaqutinik paŋmapak iñuuniptiŋni.

english: So if you have ordinary lawsuits, do you appoint as judges those who have no standing in the church?
inupiaq: Tavraasii tainna uqaġlaqutinigniġuvsi iłuaqsrugaksranik, isivġiqsiksraqtuksrauŋitchusi iñuŋmik pisuiññiqsrauyumiñaqtuamik aŋaiyyuliqiruani.

english: I say this to your shame! Is there no one among you wise enough to settle disputes between fellow Christians?
inupiaq: Kanŋusaaġniaqsaagaluaġivsi. Iñuitpaimña atausiuramik-unnii akunnavsiññi isumattutiqaqtuamik iłuaqsiriyumiñaġluni uqaġlaqutiŋiññik iḷauruat ukpiqtuanun aniqatinun.

english: Instead, does a Christian sue a Christian, and do this before unbelievers?
inupiaq: Unauvva piḷġusiġiłhaaġiksi. Aniqatim uuma uqaġlaqutini allamun aniqanmun, iłuaqsipkaġniagaqsiraġigai ukpiqtuaguŋitchuamun isivġiqsimun.

english: The fact that you have lawsuits among yourselves demonstrates that you have already been defeated. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?
inupiaq: Uqaġlaqutiqaġniq avanmun sivuniqaqtuq akiiḷipkaqtuamik piḷuunmun. Uqaġlaqutiqaqsaaniġmiñ, killukuaqtausitchiunnii, saglutaqtausitchiunniiḷu.

english: But you yourselves wrong and cheat, and you do this to your brothers and sisters!
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva ilivsi killukuaqtałhamaaġniqsusi saglutaġaqługiḷḷu allat, nanmiñiq unnii aniqatisi ukpiġunmi.

english: Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived! The sexually immoral, idolaters, adulterers, passive homosexual partners, practicing homosexuals,
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik iḷitchuġiŋarusi tamatkua iñuich nalaunŋasiŋaitchuat sivuġaani God-im qiḷaŋmukkumiñaisilaaŋannik, God-im atanniqsimavianun. Sagluqiraunasi, iñuuruat piḷuunmi tamatkualu ukpiqtuat God-auŋitchuamun, allatuqtillu naaggaunnii atunim timiqaġaluaŋŋaġmiŋ atuutiruat pigiitchuakun,

english: thieves, the greedy, drunkards, the verbally abusive, and swindlers will not inherit the kingdom of God.
inupiaq: naaggaunnii tigguuraqtit sigñaturuallu taaŋŋaqtillu uqamaqłuurririḷḷu tigligayuktiqpaiḷḷu qiḷaŋmukkumiñaitchut God-im atanniqsimavianun.

english: Some of you once lived this way. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.
inupiaq: Qaŋauvlugu iḷasi tainnasiuŋagaluaġmiruat. Aglaan paŋmapak salummaqtauŋavlusi piḷuutivsiññiñ, ilaaguaqtauvlusi God-mun, aasii ilaan akuqtuqłusi nalaunŋarualivḷusi, qanuq Ataniq Jesus Christ tuquŋaruq pisigivlugich piḷuutisi, aasii God-ipta Ilitqusiġiksuaŋan ukpiliqsinŋagaasi.

english: “All things are lawful for me” – but not everything is beneficial. “All things are lawful for me” – but I will not be controlled by anything.
inupiaq: Supayaat piñaiḷauŋitchut uvamnun, tainna uqaġuurusi. Aakkaluaq, aglaan supayaat anniqsuił̣haiññalaiñmiut. Supayaat piñaiḷauŋitchut uvamnun. Aakkaluaq, aglaan supayaamun atanniqsimaaqtitchumiñaiñmiuŋa.

english: “Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food, but God will do away with both.” The body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
inupiaq: God savaŋaruq niqimik niġiraksrauvlugu aqiaqqumiglu niqim akuqtuqtiksraŋanik, naaggauvva God-im maqulipkaġniaġik iluqaaktun. Aglaan iñuum timaa savaaguŋaitchuq, allatuutigitqulugu. Aglaan savaaguruq savautigitquvlugu Ataniġmun, aasii Atanġum aŋalataksraġigaa.

english: Now God indeed raised the Lord and he will raise us by his power.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq God-im aŋipkaŋammatun Ataniq tuqqunmiñ, uvaguttauq aŋipkaġniaġmigaatigut ilaan suaŋŋataata.

english: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Should I take the members of Christ and make them members of a prostitute? Never!
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik puttuqsriŋarusi Christ-mun pigitilaaŋiññik timisi. Timaan iḷagimmatun itkai. Taamna tainnainman, uvaŋa tiguniaqpigu iḷaŋa Christ aasii iḷaliutipkaġlugu aġnamun allatuqtimun? Naaggapiaġataq.

english: Or do you not know that anyone who is united with a prostitute is one body with her? For it is said, “The two will become one flesh.”
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik puttuqsrirusi aŋun iḷaliutiruaq inmiñik aġnamun allatuqtauruamun timiqasiutitilaaŋanik, qanuq Bible-ni aglausimaruq inna, “Malġuuruak atausiŋŋuġniaqtuk.”

english: But the one united with the Lord is one spirit with him.
inupiaq: Aglaalli iñuk iḷaliutiruaq Ataniġmun atausiŋŋuqatauruq ilaanun ilitqutchimi.

english: Flee sexual immorality! “Every sin a person commits is outside of the body” – but the immoral person sins against his own body.
inupiaq: Suuramikunnii piḷuusiqinasi allatuutikun. Iñuk piḷuksikami allanik piḷuutinik, piḷuksisiqalaitchuq timimiñik. Aglaan iñuk piḷuksikami allatuutikun, ilaa piḷuksiruq atuqługu timini.

english: Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have from God, and you are not your own?
inupiaq: Iḷisimapiaġataqtusi timisi aŋaiyyuvigitilaaŋiññik Ilitqusiġiksuamun God-im aitchuutigiŋakkaŋanun ilivsiññun. Ilivsiññik pigiŋitchusi,

english: For you were bought at a price. Therefore glorify God with your body.
inupiaq: qanuq tauqsiagurusi akiḷiqł̣usi tuqqutaanik Jesus. Taamna pisigilugu, aŋalatchigik timisi God nanġausiaqaġumiñaqsiḷugu.

english: Now with regard to the issues you wrote about: “It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.”
inupiaq: Paŋmapak sivuniġilavut qanuqirrutit tuyuutitigun apiqsruqtuutigirasi. Piḷḷuatauruq aŋun nuliagitkumi.

english: But because of immoralities, each man should have relations with his own wife and each woman with her own husband.
inupiaq: Aglaan pisigilugu ikł̣igutchaktitauniaġniq allatuunmun, iñullaa nanmiñiq nuliaqaġli suli aġnallaa nanmiñiq uiqaġluni.

english: A husband should give to his wife her sexual rights, and likewise a wife to her husband.
inupiaq: Aŋun taŋŋiimaaqtuksrauruq uiguruam piraksraŋiñik nuliamiñun, tainnatuttauq aġnaq piruksraummiuq uimiñun. Avanmun anniqsuutigiiksuksrauruk pigiraksraġikkaġmikkun.

english: It is not the wife who has the rights to her own body, but the husband. In the same way, it is not the husband who has the rights to his own body, but the wife.
inupiaq: Nuliaguruam kisimiñun pimaaqtuġumiñaitkaa timini, uiŋata pigimmigaa. Tainnatuttauq uiguruam kisimiñun pimaaqtuġumiñaiñmigaa timini, nuliaŋan pigimmigaa.

english: Do not deprive each other, except by mutual agreement for a specified time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then resume your relationship, so that Satan may not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
inupiaq: Pisuŋirrutinatik avanmun aglaan sivunniullaŋaguptik qanutun killiksriġḷutik aŋaiyyuuqtuallagniksraptiŋnun. Aglaan atautchimuvsaaġumautik, iḷaanni Satan-gum ikł̣igutchaktinniaqpiaġaatik pisigilugu aŋalalluatalguiññiqtik ilivsiŋñun.

english: I say this as a concession, not as a command.
inupiaq: Taamna uqausiġigiga, tuvaaqatinigukpan iñuk piñaġumiñaqsivḷugu, pitqurriutipiaġlugu piŋitkiga.

english: I wish that everyone was as I am. But each has his own gift from God, one this way, another that.
inupiaq: Piyummatigigaluaġmigiga iñupayaaq iñuuniallatquvlugu tuvaaqataiḷḷuni uvaptuttauq, aglaan ukpiqtuallaat inmikkun aitchuusiaqaqłutiŋ God-miñ, iḷaŋich tuvaaqatinikkumiñaqłutiŋ, aasiivsauq allat tuvaaqataiḷḷutiŋ.

english: To the unmarried and widows I say that it is best for them to remain as I am.
inupiaq: Tuvaaqatiniŋaitchuanun uiḷgaŋaruanullu uqallaktuŋa, iłuaqtuagunivḷugu iliŋich itpata tuvaaqataiḷḷutiŋ uvaptun.

english: But if they do not have self-control, let them get married. For it is better to marry than to burn with sexual desire.
inupiaq: Aglaan aŋalattaġilguitparruŋ inmun qaunakkutilluataq tuvaaqatiniktuksraurut. Qanuq iłuałhaaqtuq tuvaaqatiniktuni, ataramik nagriaġipkaġniġmiñ timim pisuutaanun.

english: To the married I give this command – not I, but the Lord – a wife should not divorce a husband
inupiaq: Tuvaaqatiniŋaruanun piraksriiruŋa, ami uvaŋapiaŋiḷaaq aglaan Ataniq, nuliaguruaq avinnani uimiñiñ.

english: (but if she does, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband), and a husband should not divorce his wife.
inupiaq: Aglaan avinniġumi, tuvaaqataiḷaġli naaggaqaa iḷammiutqigḷi uimiñun. Aasiisuli piraksriiruŋa uiguruam avitaksraġiŋitkaa nuliani.

english: To the rest I say – I, not the Lord – if a brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is happy to live with him, he should not divorce her.
inupiaq: Allanulli uqallaktuŋa, Ataniŋiḷaaq, kiñaliqaa aniqan tuvaaqatiqaqtuaq ukpiqtuaguŋitchuamik, aasii aġnaata iviġaumagilugu iñuuqatiginiŋa ilaa, ilaan avitaksraġiŋitkaa aġnaqtiŋ.

english: And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is happy to live with her, she should not divorce him.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq kiñaliqaa aġnaq tuvaaqatiqaġumi ukpiŋaitchuamik, uiŋata iviġaumagilugu iñuuqatigikpagu, aġnaata avitaksraġiŋitkaa uiñi.

english: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified because of the wife, and the unbelieving wife because of her husband. Otherwise your children are unclean, but now they are holy.
inupiaq: Qanuq ukpiŋaitchuaq uiŋa atausiŋŋuqatauŋavluni ukpiŋaruamun nuliamiñun katitinnamiŋ, qallił̣haaqtuq God-mun tuvaaqatiniŋaiññiġmiñiñ ukpiqtuamik. Tainnatuttauq ukpiŋaitchuaguluni nuliaguruaq qallił̣haaġmiuq God-mun atausiŋŋuqatigiŋavlugu uiñiktaani ukpiqtuaguruaq. Tamatkua tainnainŋitpata, miqłiqtusi avinŋanayaqtut God-miñ, tainnainniġmata iliŋich ilaaguaqtaurut God-mun.

english: But if the unbeliever wants a divorce, let it take place. In these circumstances the brother or sister is not bound. God has called you in peace.
inupiaq: Aglaan ukpiŋaitchuaq tuvaaqatauruaq avitchuaqsikpan, tainna piḷi. Tainna pianikpan, ukpiqtuaguruaq, aŋun naagga aġnaq, pituummiŋaiqsuq tuvaaqanmiñun. Qanuq God-im ququaŋagaatigut iñuutquvluta aŋuyautairrunmi.

english: For how do you know, wife, whether you will bring your husband to salvation? Or how do you know, husband, whether you will bring your wife to salvation?
inupiaq: Nuliaguruatiin, avinŋitkupku uigikkan iḷaanni annaurraupkaġniaġiñ. Tainnatuttauq uiguruatiin, avinŋitkupku nuliaġikkan iḷaanni annaurraupkaġniaġmigiñ.

english: Nevertheless, as the Lord has assigned to each one, as God has called each person, so must he live. I give this sort of direction in all the churches.
inupiaq: Aglaan sivunniiguvsi tamatkuniŋa nalupqigiŋiḷḷugu piyumausi iñuutilaaqsi God-im sivunniutaa tuvraqługu ilivsiññun, illusi irrusiġiŋaravsiññi ukpiqqaaqavsi. Taamna pitqurriutigigiga iluqaiññun aŋaiyyuliqiruanun sumiḷiqaa.

english: Was anyone called after he had been circumcised? He should not try to undo his circumcision. Was anyone called who is uncircumcised? He should not get circumcised.
inupiaq: Uvvauna sivuniġigiga. Ukpiqtuaġuŋaruaq nalunaiñŋutaqaaniŋagumi timimiñi Jew-guruatun, ukpiqtitauŋaiñŋaġmi, piiġñiataŋaiḷḷiuŋ nalunaiñŋutani. Aasiivsauq ukpiqtuaġuŋaruaq nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaiñŋaġmi Jew-guruatun, nalunaiñŋutchiġñiataktuksrauŋiñmiuq.

english: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Instead, keeping God’s commandments is what counts.
inupiaq: Qanuq nalunaiñŋutchiqsauniq naagga nalunaiñŋutchiqsauŋaiññiġḷu suliqutauŋitchuk God-mun. Naumałhaaqtuq kamagiruni God-im pitquraŋi.

english: Let each one remain in that situation in life in which he was called.
inupiaq: Iñupayaaq iñuuruksrauruq irrutchimi irvigikkaġmiñi ukpiqtitauqqaaqami.

english: Were you called as a slave? Do not worry about it. But if indeed you are able to be free, make the most of the opportunity.
inupiaq: Kivgauruaguŋavich ukpiqtitauqqaaqavich? Suliqutiginagu. Aglaan atanġiqsitauyumiñaġuvich, piññaktaaġisaġniaġumagiñ piviksriqsauguvich.

english: For the one who was called in the Lord as a slave is the Lord’s freedman. In the same way, the one who was called as a free person is Christ’s slave.
inupiaq: Iñuk kivgaullaġmi ukpiliqsitauŋaruaq Ataniġmun, atanġitchuq Atanġum sivuġaani. Tainnatuttauq iñuk kivgauŋitchuaq ukpiliqsitaukami, Christ-mun kivgaliutiruq.

english: You were bought with a price. Do not become slaves of men.
inupiaq: Christ tauqsiŋagaasi, akiḷiutivlusi tuquvluni pisivlusi. Tavraasii ilaa kamagiłhamaagaksraġigiksi tamatkunaŋŋaunnii atanaurauruaniñ nunami.

english: In whatever situation someone was called, brothers and sisters, let him remain in it with God.
inupiaq: Tavra aniqatiit qanusipayaami irviqaŋagumi iñullaa ukpiqtitauqqaaqami, tavrani illi piqatigilugu God.

english: With regard to the question about people who have never married, I have no command from the Lord, but I give my opinion as one shown mercy by the Lord to be trustworthy.
inupiaq: Paŋmapagli sivuniġilugich tuvaaqataitchuat, pitqurriutiksraitchuŋa Ataniġmiñ. Aglaan ukpiġnaqtuaguvluŋa kivgaunimni nagliktuutaagun Atanġum, qaitkiga uvaŋa isummatiga.

english: Because of the impending crisis I think it best for you to remain as you are.
inupiaq: Isumaruŋa nalaunŋanasugalugu iñuk iñuukpan irrusiġikkaġmisun, pisigilugu tavraġuqtuaq iłuiḷḷiuġun.

english: The one bound to a wife should not seek divorce. The one released from a wife should not seek marriage.
inupiaq: Tuvaaqatiqaqpich? Avinniaqsaanak. Tuvaaqataitpich? Tuvaaqataiḷaaġiñ.

english: But if you marry, you have not sinned. And if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. But those who marry will face difficult circumstances, and I am trying to spare you such problems.
inupiaq: Aglaan tuvaaqatinikkuvich piḷuksiŋitchutin. Suli niviaqsiaq tuvaaqatinikkumi piḷuksiŋitchuq. Aglaattauq tamatkua tuvaaqatiniktuat isumaaluutiqałhaaġniaqtut tuvaaqataitchuaniñ, aasii taavrumaŋŋa isumaaluutivsaaksramiñ piisitchukkivsi.

english: And I say this, brothers and sisters: The time is short. So then those who have wives should be as those who have none,
inupiaq: Uvva una sivuniġigiga aniqatiit. Savaurriviksraq Ataniġmik sivikłipiaġataġman, paŋmapaŋmiñ aglaan tamatkua tuvaaqatiqaqtuat savautilirruŋ Ataniq tuvaaqataitchuatun iḷiḷutiŋ.

english: those with tears like those not weeping, those who rejoice like those not rejoicing, those who buy like those without possessions,
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq ipiqtusuutit, naagga quviasuutit, naagga suġalġich piñaiḷutchiqsuqtaksraġiŋitkaatigut savaurriñiksraptiŋniñ Ataniġmik.

english: those who use the world as though they were not using it to the full. For the present shape of this world is passing away.
inupiaq: Tamatkualu atugaqaqtuat nunam piŋiñik piññagniaqsiññaġniġmun iñuuŋaiġḷutiŋ, qanuq manna nuna suġauttaqtuummaġmi piiġumaaqtuq.

english: And I want you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the things of the Lord, how to please the Lord.
inupiaq: Isumaaluutiqaquŋitkivsi. Tuvaaqataitchuaq isumasuŋaiññaġuuruq qanutchikun savautiyumiñaqtilaaŋanik Ataniq, ataramik iviġagukługu.

english: But a married man is concerned about the things of the world, how to please his wife,
inupiaq: Aglaalli tuvaaqatiqaqtuaq isumasuŋaiññaġuuruq nunam suġautaŋiñun, qanuġlugu iviġagumavlugu nuliani.

english: and he is divided. An unmarried woman or a virgin is concerned about the things of the Lord, to be holy both in body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the things of the world, how to please her husband.
inupiaq: Tainnainniġman, iviġagniatagligik iluqaaktun Ataniġlu nulianiḷu. Tainnatuttauq tuvaaqataitchuaq aġnaq isumaqasuŋaiññaġuuruq qanuġluni savautilluatapiaġumiñaqtilaaŋanik Ataniq iñuggunmiñik iluqaanik. Aglaalli tuvaaqatiqaqtuaq aġnaq isummatiqasuŋaiññaġuuruq nunam suġauttaŋiñik, iviġagumavlugu uiñi.

english: I am saying this for your benefit, not to place a limitation on you, but so that without distraction you may give notable and constant service to the Lord.
inupiaq: Uqautigivsi tamatkuniŋa ikayuqsaqłusi, suli iñuuniaġniq siġḷiġnaiqsaqługu ilivsiññun. Pitqugivsi sunik nalaunŋaruanik savautilluataquvlugu Ataniq pisuqtilaavsisun avigaaŋaŋaiġḷusi.

english: If anyone thinks he is acting inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the bloom of youth and it seems necessary, he should do what he wishes; he does not sin. Let them marry.
inupiaq: Iññuk piksrautigiiksinŋaruak katititchumaŋaiġumiŋ pisigilugu savaurriñiq Ataniġmik aasii aŋutim piḷḷuatapiaŋaiqpagu tuvaaqatiksrautini katitinŋaiḷġataqłutiŋ utuqqalisaiññaġmipkaġlugu suli ilaan pisuutini ilaanun suaŋavluni, katitillik. Taamna piḷuutaiuŋitchuq.

english: But the man who is firm in his commitment, and is under no necessity but has control over his will, and has decided in his own mind to keep his own virgin, does well.
inupiaq: Aglaattauq aŋun sivunnipiaŋagumi katitinŋisaaġugluni nuliaksraunmiñun, isumaqaġumi katitinŋaisaallagugluni pisigilugu aŋalalluataqługu kipiġniuġutini nuliaksraunmiñun, katitinŋaisaaġumi piḷḷuataġmiuq.

english: So then, the one who marries his own virgin does well, but the one who does not, does better.
inupiaq: Tavra taamna katitittuaq nuliaksrautigikkaġmiñun piḷḷuataqtuq aasii taamna katitinŋaitchuaq piḷḷuatałhaaġniaqtuq.

english: A wife is bound as long as her husband is living. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes (only someone in the Lord).
inupiaq: Nuliaguruaq pituummiruq uimiñun iñuuniqtutilaaŋatun uiñi. Uiguruaq tuqukpan, nuliaguruaq atanġitchuq tuvaaqasiutisukkumi kimik pisukkumi, aglaan uiñigluni ukpiqtuaguruamik.

english: But in my opinion, she will be happier if she remains as she is – and I think that I too have the Spirit of God!
inupiaq: Aglaalli uvaŋa isummatimni quviasułhaaġniaqtuq kisimġiuqtuaġumi. Piraksriġasugigivsi taavrumiŋa Ilitqusiġiksuaŋaniñ God-im.

english: With regard to food sacrificed to idols, we know that “we all have knowledge.” Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak tuyuġivsi sivuniġivlugu tuyuutivsiññi apiqsruutiksi, niġiñikun niqinik ilaaguaqtauŋaruanik iñuuraqpaŋnun. Taavrumuuna apiqsruutikun, iñupayaaq isumaqaqtuq iḷisimałhaaġasugaluni allaniñ ukpiqtuaguruaniñ. Tainnatchim iḷisimmatim iñuk kamasaaġutiqaqtitkaa, aglaan piviuttaqqutim suaŋasiḷaaġai ukpiġutiŋich ukpiqtuat.

english: If someone thinks he knows something, he does not yet know to the degree that he needs to know.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa isumaqaġumi iḷisimasiñasugalugu sunapayaaq, iḷisimanaqtisiññaġaa nalutilaani.

english: But if someone loves God, he is known by God.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuum piviuttaġikpauŋ God, ilaa iḷisimammigaa God-im inmiñun pigitilaaŋanik.

english: With regard then to eating food sacrificed to idols, we know that “an idol in this world is nothing,” and that “there is no God but one.”
inupiaq: Aasiuvva niġiñikun niqimik ilaaguaqtauŋaruamik iñuuraqpaŋnun, iḷisimarugut iñuuraqpak uumaŋitchuq, suli allamik God-aitchuq aglaan God atausiuruq.

english: If after all there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many gods and many lords),
inupiaq: Iñuich unnii isumagaluaqpata iñugiakkasugalugich god-it qiḷaŋmiḷu nunamiḷu, aasii taiḷugich god-inik ataniġniglu,

english: yet for us there is one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we live, and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we live.
inupiaq: uvagulli iḷisimarugut atausisualuŋmik God-mik Aapamik, savaŋaruamik supayaanik, suli ilaa pisivlugu iñuurugut. Iḷisimammiugut atausisualuŋmik Ataniġmik, Jesus Christ-mik, ilaagun supayaat savaaguŋavlutiŋ, suli ilaan aitchuŋagaatigut iñuggunmik isuitchuamik.

english: But this knowledge is not shared by all. And some, by being accustomed to idols in former times, eat this food as an idol sacrifice, and their conscience, because it is weak, is defiled.
inupiaq: Taamnaaglaan ukpiqtuat iḷaŋisa nalugaat. Iñuuniqtutilaamiktun isumasuuŋavlutiŋ iñuuraqpaich uumapiaġasugalugich, aasii niqit ilaaguaqtauruat iñuuraqpaŋnun ilaaguaqtaunasugalugich iḷumutun god-auruamun. Aasii paŋmapak niġisaqamiŋ tamatkuniŋa niqinik, tutqiiññiagaqsivḷutiŋ, isumavlutiŋ piḷuksiñasugivlutiŋ.

english: Now food will not bring us close to God. We are no worse if we do not eat and no better if we do.
inupiaq: Niqim nalaunŋasipkaġniaŋitkaatigut sivuġaani God-im. Niġigupta piḷuksiḷaaġniaŋitchugut, suli niġiŋitkaluaġupta nalaunŋasiḷaaġniaŋiñmiugut.

english: But be careful that this liberty of yours does not become a hindrance to the weak.
inupiaq: Qaunakłaaġlusiaglaan. Irrusiqaġaluaġuvsi niġiḷḷalusi tainnatchiñik niqinik, niġġiñasi, tutqiisaaġniaġuvsiuŋ aniqan ukpiġutaani suaŋaił̣haaqtuaq ilivsi ukpiġutivsiññiñ.

english: For if someone weak sees you who possess knowledge dining in an idol’s temple, will not his conscience be “strengthened” to eat food offered to idols?
inupiaq: Qanuq kialiqaa suaŋaił̣ł̣uni ukpiqtuaguruam tautukkumisi niġipkaqtillusi iñuuraqpaum aŋaiyyuviani, ilivsi iḷisimaruasii iñuuraqpaich uumaŋisilaaŋannik, qapiŋaisaaqtauviaqtuq niġiyumiñaqsiḷuni niqimik ilaaguaqtauruamik iñuuraqpaŋnun. Suaŋaiḷḷuni ukpiqtuagugumi aasii tutqiiḷiḷuni,

english: So by your knowledge the weak brother or sister, for whom Christ died, is destroyed.
inupiaq: ilaa piḷuksipkaqtauniaqtuq ilivich niġiñipkun. Tainnaqtitkupku, ilivich kaŋiqsisiqałhaaġniqpich suksraunġiqsinniaġaa suaŋaitchuaq ukpiqtuaq. Christ tuquŋammiruaq taamna aniqan suksraunġiqsautquŋił̣ł̣ugu.

english: If you sin against your brothers or sisters in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.
inupiaq: Tainna piḷuksikavich anniġiñ aniqatin, ilaa suaŋaiḷḷuqtuamik ukpiġutiqaqtuaq, piḷuksimmiutin Christ-mun.

english: For this reason, if food causes my brother or sister to sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I may not cause one of them to sin.
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainniġman niqi patchisaukpan aniqanma piḷuksiñiksraŋanun, suuramikunnii niqituġniaŋitchuŋa patchisausuŋiḷḷuŋa aniqanma piḷuksiñiksraŋanun.

english: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuamik ukpiqtuaguruŋa atanġiqsitauŋaruaq. Atanġum tiliraġigaaŋa allatituttauq tilirauŋaruatun, qanuq tautuŋagiga Jesus Ataniqput, suli ilivsi ukpiqtuaġuŋarusi Ataniġmun uvaŋa alġaqsruiñipkun.

english: If I am not an apostle to others, at least I am to you, for you are the confirming sign of my apostleship in the Lord.
inupiaq: Allat iñuich uqaġaluaqpata tilirauŋiññiḷuŋa, tiliraupiaŋaniraksraġigivsiŋa, qanuq ukpiġutiksi ukpiġnaqsiḷġutauruq Ataniġmun tiliŋatilaamnik alġaqsruitquvluŋa tusaayugaaġiksuamik.

english: This is my defense to those who examine me.
inupiaq: Taavrumiŋa kiggutiqaġuuruŋa iñuŋnun arguasuguuruanun Ataniġmun tiliŋatilaamnik.

english: Do we not have the right to financial support?
inupiaq: Nalaunŋaruq allatuttauq iñuktitun pamataugupta.

english: Do we not have the right to the company of a believing wife, like the other apostles and the Lord’s brothers and Cephas?
inupiaq: Nalaunŋammiuq uvaptiŋnun tuvaaqasiqpatigut nuliaguruam iglauraġikapta, tainnatuttauq allatitun tilirauruatun, Ataniptalu aniqatiŋisun, Cephas-tullu.

english: Or do only Barnabas and I lack the right not to work?
inupiaq: Kisimñuk Barnabas-lu uvaŋalu savaktuiññaġlunuk iñuggutiqaqtuksrauviñuk, pamatchiugaqtillusi allanik iñuŋnik? Tainna piraksraġiŋitkiptiguk.

english: Who ever serves in the army at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its fruit? Who tends a flock and does not consume its milk?
inupiaq: Iñupayaaq akiḷiiḷaitchuq aŋuyaktiġuqsaqami. Suli iñupayaaq nautchirriikami grapes napaaqtuayaaŋiññik niġiḷaunnani siiġñiaŋiññik piḷaitchuq. Suli iñupayaaq pamiqsaaqaqtuaq immuliviginiaġnagich piḷaitchuq. Tainnatulli iñuk tilirauruaq alġaqsruitquvlugu pamataksraġiŋitkaluaġmiuq inmiñik.

english: Am I saying these things only on the basis of common sense, or does the law not say this as well?
inupiaq: Uvaŋa, iñugruiññauruaŋaa, taamna tainna uqallausiġivigu? Naumi. Tainna pitqurat iḷisaurrimmiut.

english: For it is written in the law of Moses, “Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.” God is not concerned here about oxen, is he?
inupiaq: Pitqurani aitchuutauŋaruani Moses-mun aglausimaruq inna, “Sigguġutituġniaŋitkiñ qimukti tunmaqtuaq palauvaksranun amiġaiyaivḷuni palauvaksranik.” Isumavisi God isumaaluuttaqaġasugalugu qimuktinik kisianik tainna uqallakami?

english: Or is he not surely speaking for our benefit? It was written for us, because the one plowing and threshing ought to work in hope of enjoying the harvest.
inupiaq: Naumi. Uvagut isumaaluuttaġiłhaaŋagaatigut, qanuq iñuk nunaliqiruaq savaktuksrauruatun niġiugluni iḷaŋiutiniaqtilaamiñik palauvaksranik, tainnatulli iñuktauq salummairuaq palauvaksranik savaktuksraummiuq niġiugilugu iḷaŋiutiniaqtilaani.

english: If we sowed spiritual blessings among you, is it too much to reap material things from you?
inupiaq: Uvagut alġaqsruiŋakapta tusaayugaaġiksuanik ilivsiññun aasii ilivsi ukpiqtuaġuqłusi, pamataksrauŋitpisa?

english: If others receive this right from you, are we not more deserving?
inupiaq: Allat iñuich qasiḷiaġillakparruŋ pamarrusiaqaġnik ilivsiññiñ, nalaunŋałhaaġaluaqtuq uvagut qasiḷiaġiguptigu pamarrusiaksraq ilivsiññiñ. Aglaan qasiḷiaġiŋaitkikput taamna ilivsiññiñ, qanuq piñaiḷutchiqsuġuŋił̣ł̣ugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq Christ-kun.

english: But we have not made use of this right. Instead we endure everything so that we may not be a hindrance to the gospel of Christ.
inupiaq: Iḷisimagisi iñuich savaaqaqtuat God-im aŋaiyyuvikpaŋani niqiksraġuurut aŋaiyyuvikpaŋmiñ, suli aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich savaktuat ikipkaiviŋmi iḷaŋiutisuummiut niġrutiniñ aitchuutauruaniñ tavrani.

english: Don’t you know that those who serve in the temple eat food from the temple, and those who serve at the altar receive a part of the offerings?
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq Ataniq pitqurriiŋaruq tamatkua alġaqsruiruat tusaayugaaġiksuanik akiññaktuksrauvlugich tamatkunaŋŋa akuqtuiruaniñ tusaayugaaġiksuamik.

english: In the same way the Lord commanded those who proclaim the gospel to receive their living by the gospel.
inupiaq: Aglaan uvaŋa atuŋaitkiga nalliat-unnii tamatkua nalaunŋaruakun pamarrusiaqautiksrat, naaggaunnii ukuniŋa tuyuŋitchuŋa piññaksaġluŋa tainnatchimik pamarrusiaksramik. Sugiŋił̣haaġiga tuquguma alġaqsruiḷuŋa akiiḷaaġluŋa tammaiñiġmiñ ilivsiññun alġaqsruiñiksramik.

english: But I have not used any of these rights. And I am not writing these things so that something will be done for me. In fact, it would be better for me to die than – no one will deprive me of my reason for boasting!
inupiaq: Piraksriusiaqaqłuŋa alġaqsruutigitquvlugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq, kamasaaġutigiyumiñaitkiga alġaqsruiñiq. Alġaqsruiŋitkaluaġuma isumaapiaġataġniaqtuŋa.

english: For if I preach the gospel, I have no reason for boasting, because I am compelled to do this. Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel!
inupiaq: Alġaqsruisuksiññaġluŋa alġaqsruiguma akiḷiusiaqaġniaġaluaqtuŋa. Aglaan uvaŋa alġaqsruiŋitchuŋa pisuksiññaġluŋa, aglaan alġaqsruiruŋa God-im aitchuŋavluŋa savaaksrapiaġatamik.

english: For if I do this voluntarily, I have a reward. But if I do it unwillingly, I am entrusted with a responsibility.
inupiaq: Sumik aasii akiḷiusiaqaqpik? Quviasuunmik piññaktaamnik alġaqsruiñiġmiñ tusaayugaaġiksuamik pamarrusiaqaġaluaġnaŋa iñuŋniñ, nalaunŋagaluaŋŋaan apiqsriñiksraġa pamarrusiaksramik tamatkunaŋŋa ukpiqtuaniñ.

english: What then is my reward? That when I preach the gospel I may offer the gospel free of charge, and so not make full use of my rights in the gospel.
inupiaq: Tavra uvaŋa kivgauŋitkaluaŋŋaġma iñuŋmun, uvamnik iḷiuqtuŋa kivgatun iñupayaanun, uvapkun kiikaa iñuich qanutun ukpiliqugaluaqługich Christ-mun.

english: For since I am free from all I can make myself a slave to all, in order to gain even more people.
inupiaq: Jew-guruanun iḷisuummiuŋa Jew-guruatun, uvapkun Jew-guruat ukpiliqugaluaqługich. Iñuŋnun pitquratigun Moses-kun qaisauruatigun iñuuniaqtuanun, iḷisuummiuŋa iñuuniaġusiatitun tamatkua tainna iñuuniaġusiqaqtuat, uvapkun ukpiliqugaluaqługich. Isummatigiŋitchuŋa uvamnik pituksimarualiḷuŋa iñuuruksrauluŋa tainnaittuatigun piḷġutchisigun.

english: To the Jews I became like a Jew to gain the Jews. To those under the law I became like one under the law (though I myself am not under the law) to gain those under the law.
inupiaq: Jew-guŋitchuanun iñuuniaqtuaguŋitchuanun pitquratigun Moses-kun qaisauruatigun, iḷisuummiuŋa iñuuniaqtuatun pitquraitchuakun, uvapkun iliŋich ukpiliqugaluaqługich. Kipuqłaglugich pitquraŋi God-im piḷaiñmiuŋa tainna pikama, qanuq pitquraŋisa Christ aŋalatkaanŋa.

english: To those free from the law I became like one free from the law (though I am not free from God’s law but under the law of Christ) to gain those free from the law.
inupiaq: Iñuŋnun tutqiiḷiyaruanun ukpiġunmiŋni iñuusuuruŋa tutqiiḷitchaiḷivḷugich, uvapkun iliŋich ukpiqtuaguquvlugich. Qanupayaaq iñuk irrusiqaġman, ilaatun piñiḷugaqtuŋa pisigivlugu qanusipayaakun piñaġumiñaqpan iñuich iḷaŋich uvapkun ukpiqtuaguquvlugich.

english: To the weak I became weak in order to gain the weak. I have become all things to all people, so that by all means I may save some.
inupiaq: Tainna pisuuruŋa pisigivlugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq, iḷaŋiutisukłuŋa quviasaaġutiŋiñiñ.

english: I do all these things because of the gospel, so that I can be a participant in it.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi aqpaliurraqtuani, iluqaġmiŋ aqpaliurraqtuat akimaniataguurut, aglaan atausiq akiññaguuruq. Iñuunivsiññi Christ-mun, akiññallasivḷuni aqpaliurraqtuatulli pisitchi.

english: Do you not know that all the runners in a stadium compete, but only one receives the prize? So run to win.
inupiaq: Anaktaqtitun inmiñun qaunagilluataqtuatun supayaatigun, aitchuusiaġisukługu niaquġun maqullaruaq, tainnatulli uvagut ukpiqtuaguruaguut iñuulluataqtuksraurugut, aitchuusiaġiyumiñaqsiḷugu niaquġun akiññaktaaksraq maquyumiñaitchuaq.

english: Each competitor must exercise self-control in everything. They do it to receive a perishable crown, but we an imperishable one.
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainman, aqpaliurraqtitun ittuŋa akimasaqłuni aqpattuatun, naaggaqaa qakiqtaqtitun akimasaqłuni qakiqtaqtuatun.

english: So I do not run uncertainly or box like one who hits only air.
inupiaq: Aŋalalluataqtuŋa uvamnik, suli atanniqsimagiga timiga, iḷaanni alġaqsruiŋaqqaaġluŋa allanun, nalliummatiŋaiqsualiñasugaluŋa.

english: Instead I subdue my body and make it my slave, so that after preaching to others I myself will not be disqualified.
For I do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, that our fathers were all under the cloud and all passed through the sea,
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, itqaqsiuŋ suna piŋatilaaŋanik iŋiḷġaan maŋŋuuptiŋnun nunagluktuami. Nuvuyaŋata God-im aullatiŋagai iluqaisa, suli iluqaġmiŋ pisuaŋarut paliumaruakun nunakun ikaaqługu imaq.

english: and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea,
inupiaq: Tamatkunuuna nalautamikkun nuvuyakullu imikullu piqasiutiŋarut Moses-mun, aasii tamatkunuuna paptaiqsaummatun piŋarut Moses-mun.

english: and all ate the same spiritual food,
inupiaq: Aasiisuli iluqaġmiŋ niqiqaŋarut God-im pamarrutiŋiñik aliuġnaqtuakun,

english: and all drank the same spiritual drink. For they were all drinking from the spiritual rock that followed them, and the rock was Christ.
inupiaq: iluqaġmik suli imiqaġmivḷutiŋ imiġmik God-im pamarrutaanik aliuġnaqtuakun. Qanuq imiġiŋagaat imiq maqipkaqtitauruaq aliuġnaqtuakun uyaġagruaġmiñ, aasii taamna uyaġagruaq arrilisauruq Christ-mun.

english: But God was not pleased with most of them, for they were cut down in the wilderness.
inupiaq: God-im qaunagilluataġaluaŋŋaisa, iñugiagniqsrat iviġaummatigiŋaitkai, aasii ilaan suksraunġiqł̣ugich nunagluktuami.

english: These things happened as examples for us, so that we will not crave evil things as they did.
inupiaq: Tavra tamatkua piŋaruat taimani kiliktuutaurut uvaptiŋnun, kilikłuta kipiġniuquŋił̣ł̣uta pigiitchuanun, maŋŋuuruat piḷġusiatitun.

english: So do not be idolaters, as some of them were. As it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play.”
inupiaq: Ukpiqtaunasi sunun God-auŋitchuanun taipkua iḷaŋisa piḷġusiatitun. Taavrumuuna aglausimaruq Bible-ni inna, “Iñuich aquvinŋarut niqinaqisaqłutiŋ imiġukłutiglu, aasii makinmivḷutiŋ uamitchukłutiŋ.”

english: And let us not be immoral, as some of them were, and twenty-three thousand died in a single day.
inupiaq: Allatuqtauŋitcha taipkua iḷaŋisitun, 23,000 tuqummata uvlumi atautchimi.

english: And let us not put Christ to the test, as some of them did, and were destroyed by snakes.
inupiaq: Uvagut uuktugaksraġiŋitkikput Atanġum qimmaksaliyairrutaa taipkua iḷaŋisa piḷġusiatitun, suksraunġiqsauruat tuqunaliŋnun nimiġianun kiŋmaqtiłługich.

english: And do not complain, as some of them did, and were killed by the destroying angel.
inupiaq: Suli uqamayuktuksrauŋitchugut iḷaŋisasuli piḷġusiatitun, suksraunġiqsittuat isaġulganun tuqqutim.

english: These things happened to them as examples and were written for our instruction, on whom the ends of the ages have come.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ tamatkua nalautaġikkaŋich piŋarut iliŋiññun, uvaptiŋnun arriḷisautquvlugich, suli aglaaguvlutiŋ uvagut kiliktautquvluta piḷuksitquŋił̣ł̣uta, uvagut iñuuruaguut aqulliġñi uvluni.

english: So let the one who thinks he is standing be careful that he does not fall.
inupiaq: Tavraasii kiñaliqaa isumaqaġumi suaŋarualiḷuni ukpiġunmiñi, qaunagili piḷuksisuŋiḷḷuni.

english: No trial has overtaken you that is not faced by others. And God is faithful: He will not let you be tried beyond what you are able to bear, but with the trial will also provide a way out so that you may be able to endure it.
inupiaq: Qanupayaaq ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtauguvich, tainnatchikuttauq iluqaġmiŋ iñuich ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtauŋammiut. Aglaan God ukpiġnapiaqtuq, ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtaupkaġniaŋitkaatin qaaŋiġḷugu manimmiyumiñakkan. Ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtauguvich, ilaan akimmasiġñiaġaatin akimayumiñaqsiḷutin.

english: So then, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainman, uvaŋa piviuttaġivlusi aniqatiitkaa, ukpiqtuksrauŋipiaqtusi sunun God-auŋitchuanun.

english: I am speaking to thoughtful people. Consider what I say.
inupiaq: Uqautigivsi isumaturuatun iñuktun iḷivḷusi. Isivġiqsigik ilivsiññik uqaluŋma iḷumun itilaaŋat.

english: Is not the cup of blessing that we bless a sharing in the blood of Christ? Is not the bread that we break a sharing in the body of Christ?
inupiaq: Atanġum nullautchiġvianik pikapta, suli imiqłuta qallugauramiñ quyyatigiŋakkaptiŋniñ ilaanun, iluqata piqatigiiksinmatun pisuurugut, iḷaŋiutiniġmi anniqsuusianun Christ maqipkaqtauŋaruamiñ auŋaniñ. Suli niġikaptigu punniq atautchimiiłłuta, iḷaŋiutimmatun pisuummiugut anniqsuusianiñ piruaniñ Christ timaaniñ tuqutauŋaruamiñ uvagut pisivluta.

english: Because there is one bread, we who are many are one body, for we all share the one bread.
inupiaq: Aasii pisigivlugu iluqata niġiñiqput atautchimiñ punniġmiñ, uvagut atausiŋŋuqtitaurugut atautchisun timitun.

english: Look at the people of Israel. Are not those who eat the sacrifices partners in the altar?
inupiaq: Uuktuutigilugu una, isummatigisigik Jew-guruat piḷġusiŋich. Tamatkua niġisuuruat niġrutinik aitchuutauŋaruanik ikipkaiviŋmi piqasiutisuurut God-mun.

english: Am I saying that idols or food sacrificed to them amount to anything?
inupiaq: Uvva iḷisautiniḷukkivsi tamatkua niqit aitchuutauruat iñuuraqpaŋnun suuŋitchut, iñuuraqpaitchauq suuŋiñmatun.

english: No, I mean that what the pagans sacrifice is to demons and not to God. I do not want you to be partners with demons.
inupiaq: Sivuniġigiga ukpiŋaitchuat aitchuikamiŋ ikipkautinik iñuuraqpaŋnun, aitchuirut ilitqusiqł̣uŋnun God-mun pigaluaġnatiŋ. Piqasiqsuutitquŋitkivsi ilitqusiqł̣uŋnun.

english: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons. You cannot take part in the table of the Lord and the table of demons.
inupiaq: Imiġniaŋitkisi tapillugik qallugauraŋalu Atanġum qallugauraŋallu ilitqusiqł̣uich. Iḷaŋiutiyumiñaiñmiusi Atanġum niġġiviŋiññiñ iḷaŋiutilusiḷu niġġiviŋiññiñ ilitqusiqł̣uich.

english: Or are we trying to provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we really stronger than he is?
inupiaq: Ataniġmun qinnautipkaġniaŋaiqsa, qanuq iḷisimarusi suaŋałhaaŋitchugut ilaaniñ.

english: “Everything is lawful,” but not everything is beneficial. “Everything is lawful,” but not everything builds others up.
inupiaq: Supayaat piñaiḷauŋitchut, tainna uqaġuurusi. Aakkaluaq, aglaan iḷaŋich ikayuutaulaitchut iñuum ukpiġutaanun. Supayaat piñaiḷauŋiññigisi, aglaan iḷaŋich suli qapiŋaisaaġutauŋitchut iñuum ukpiġutaanun.

english: Do not seek your own good, but the good of the other person.
inupiaq: Piḷġutchiñi nalaunŋanasugalugich pisuukkavsiññi, anniqsuqsałhaaġlugich siḷallisi piraġutitchi, ilivsiññułhiñaq piŋaiġḷusi.

english: Eat anything that is sold in the marketplace without questions of conscience,
inupiaq: Niġġisiuŋ sunapayaaq tunirauruaq niqipianik tuniuqqaiviŋmi salapqiiñiaŋaiġḷusi qanusipayaamik nalupqitchautiksramik isumami,

english: for the earth and its abundance are the Lord’s.
inupiaq: qanuq Bible-ni uqaluk aglausimaruq, “Nuna Atanġum pigigaa, suli sunapayaaq nunamiittuaq.”

english: If an unbeliever invites you to dinner and you want to go, eat whatever is served without asking questions of conscience.
inupiaq: Iḷaŋata ukpiqtuaguŋitchuat aiyugaaqpasi niġiyaqtuqulusi aiyugaaqtauniġuvsi, niġġisiuŋ sunapayaaq inillaktauruaq sivuqqavsiññun salapqiiñiaŋaiġḷusi qanusipayaamik nalupqitchautiksramik isumami.

english: But if someone says to you, “This is from a sacrifice,” do not eat, because of the one who told you and because of conscience –
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuum uqallautikpasi inna, Taamnauvva niqi ilaaguaqtauŋaruaq iñuuraqpaŋnun, tainnaqpasi niġġiñagu, pisigilugu taamna kiliksiruaq ilivsiññik, qanuq nalupqisukłuni isumamiñi nalaunŋatilaaŋanik niġiruni kilikkaasi. Iḷaanni apiqsriñiaġugnaġmiusi, summanmiuvva niġiḷḷaniġa aŋalanniaġmivauŋ iñuum allam?

english: I do not mean yours but the other person’s. For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience?
inupiaq: Niġiḷḷaanigniġuma supayaamik quyyatigiŋakkamnik God-mun, summan iñuich pasiñiaqpanŋa niqitigun niġikkapkun?

english: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I blamed for the food that I give thanks for?
inupiaq: Innauvva ittuq. Niġiñiqsiḷu imiġniqsiḷu naagga sunapayaaq pikkaqsi, God-im nanġausiaqautigillaliuŋ.

english: So whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do everything for the glory of God.
inupiaq: Sumik piññasi piñaiḷutchiutauyumiñaqtuamik iñuich ukpiqtuaġuġniksraŋannun, Jew-gugaluaqpata, Greek-gugaluaqpata, naaggaunnii God-mun aŋaiyyuliqiruanun.

english: Do not give offense to Jews or Greeks or to the church of God,
inupiaq: Piraġutitchiḷi uvaptun. Iviġagniḷułhaaġaġigitka iñupayaat supayaatigun pikkapkun. Uvamnun anniqsuġniałhaalaitchuŋa, aglaan allat annaurrautqugaluaqługich.

english: just as I also try to please everyone in all things. I do not seek my own benefit, but the benefit of many, so that they may be saved.
Be imitators of me, just as I also am of Christ.
inupiaq: Piḷġusiqaġitchi uvaptun tuvraiñiaġmatun Christ-mik.

english: I praise you because you remember me in everything and maintain the traditions just as I passed them on to you.
inupiaq: Nanġaġivsi pisigivlugu itqaumaniqsi, tuvraiñiqsiḷu iḷisaurrutigiŋakkamnik ilivsiññun.

english: But I want you to know that Christ is the head of every man, and the man is the head of a woman, and God is the head of Christ.
inupiaq: Aglaan kaŋiqsitqugivsi Christ-gum qaukłiutilaaŋanik iñupayaamun, iñuum niaquġimmatun. Tainnatuttauq, uiguruaq niaquummatun inmiuq aġnamun, aasiisuli God niaquummatun Christ-mun.

english: Any man who prays or prophesies with his head covered disgraces his head.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa aŋun aŋaiyyuruaq naagga uqaqtauruaq God-mun nasaqtuqłuni iḷisimanaqtinŋitkaa Christ qaukłiġitilaaŋanik inmiñun.

english: But any woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered disgraces her head, for it is one and the same thing as having a shaved head.
inupiaq: Suli kiñaliqaa aġnaq aŋaiyyuruaq naagga uqaqtauruaq God-mun niaqquni matuiḷaaqługu iḷisimanaqtinŋitkaa uiñi qaukłiutilaaŋanik inmiñun. Inmiñik nalliummatinialaruq aŋunmiŋnun, nutchani iḷivḷugich kivraŋaruatun aŋutitun.

english: For if a woman will not cover her head, she should cut off her hair. But if it is disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, she should cover her head.
inupiaq: Aġnam matutuġniaŋitkumiuŋ niaqquni, saliraksraġigai nutchani aŋutitun. Aasii kanŋunaġniqpan aġnaq saliŋamman, matutuġliuŋ niaqquni.

english: For a man should not have his head covered, since he is the image and glory of God. But the woman is the glory of the man.
inupiaq: Aŋutim matutugaksraġiŋitkaa niaqquni qanuq ilaa savaaguŋaruq irrusiatun God-im, aasii salapqiqsimavlugu God-im kamanautaa. Aġnavli salapqiagaa aŋutim kamanautaa.

english: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man.
inupiaq: Aġnaġliasii savaaguŋaruq aŋunmiñ. Aŋun savaaguŋaitchuq aġnamiñ.

english: Neither was man created for the sake of woman, but woman for man.
inupiaq: Aŋun savaaguŋaiñmiuq anniqsuqsaġlugu aġnaq, aglaan aġnaq savaaguŋaruq anniqsuqsaqługu aŋun.

english: For this reason a woman should have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels.
inupiaq: Tavra aġnam matutuqtuksraġigaa niaqquni nalunaiñŋutaulugu ilaan qaukłiqaqtilaamiñun aŋunmik, isaġulgich iluqaġmiŋ tautuglugu suqpagiŋitchumagaat.

english: In any case, in the Lord woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq Atanġum sivunniuġutaani aŋutillu aġnallu anniqsuutigiiksuksrauniqsut avanmun,

english: For just as woman came from man, so man comes through woman. But all things come from God.
inupiaq: qanuq aġnaq savaaguŋagaluaqtillugu aŋunmiñ, aŋun paŋmapak animmiraqtuq aġnamiñ, tamarra supayaat qairut God-miñ.

english: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
inupiaq: Nalaunŋatilaaqsiuŋ ilivsiññik. Aġnaq aŋaiyyugumi God-mun niaqquni matuiḷḷugu nalaunŋava?

english: Does not nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace for him,
inupiaq: Ilivsi iḷisimarusi iḷisautiraksraitchusi aŋun nuyaqtusiruaq kanŋunaqtilaaŋanik.

english: but if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For her hair is given to her for a covering.
inupiaq: Aglaan aġnam nuyaqtuniŋa qiñiyunaqsiḷġutauruq ilaanun. Qanuq nusaŋi aitchuutaurut ilaanun matugitquvlugich.

english: If anyone intends to quarrel about this, we have no other practice, nor do the churches of God.
inupiaq: Kiñapayaaq uqavaaġumakpan taavrumuuna, uvagut piksraitchugut allamik piḷġutchimik, naaggaunnii aŋaiyyuliqiruaŋi God-im.

english: Now in giving the following instruction I do not praise you, because you come together not for the better but for the worse.
inupiaq: Aglaan ukunuuna iḷisaurrutitigun nanġaŋitkivsi, qanuq katinnavsi atautchimun anniaġutiłhaaġuurusi nakuurualiqiniġmiñ.

english: For in the first place, when you come together as a church I hear there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it.
inupiaq: Qanuq uvva aŋaiyyuliaqavsi inmikkuaŋasiñisuugaasi. Tainna kilgusiaqaŋaruŋa, aasii taamna ukpiġikavsakkiga.

english: For there must in fact be divisions among you, so that those of you who are approved may be evident.
inupiaq: Qanuq inmikkuaŋasiraġaġniq ittuksrausugnaġniqsuq akunnavsiññi, tamatkua iḷumun ukpiqtuaguruat satqummiquvlugich.

english: Now when you come together at the same place, you are not really eating the Lord’s Supper.
inupiaq: Katinnavsi atautchimun, Atanġum nullautchiġvianik niġiŋitchusi,

english: For when it is time to eat, everyone proceeds with his own supper. One is hungry and another becomes drunk.
inupiaq: qanuq niġiñiġmi, iñullaa isagutiraqtuq ilaan niqaunmiñik, allali iñuk kaaktillugu allasuli imiŋasivḷuni.

english: Do you not have houses so that you can eat and drink? Or are you trying to show contempt for the church of God by shaming those who have nothing? What should I say to you? Should I praise you? I will not praise you for this!
inupiaq: Suvisi? Aimaaġviqaqtusi niġġiviksranik imiġviksraniglu. Suuŋiḷaġigisi aŋaiyyuliqiruaŋi God-im tutqiisaaqługich tamatkua piksraitchuat. Qanuq uqallagniaqpik ilivsiññun? Nanġaġniaqpisi taavrumuuna? Naagga, nanġaġniaŋitkivsi.

english: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night in which he was betrayed took bread,
inupiaq: Qanuq Atanġum salapqiŋagaa uvamnun iḷisaurrutigiŋakkaġa ilivsiññun una. Taivrumani unnuami aitchuutausaġviŋmiñi, Atanġum Jesus tiguŋagaa punniq,

english: and after he had given thanks he broke it and said, “This is my body, which is for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
inupiaq: aasii quyyatigiqqaaqługu God-mun, ilaan avguŋagaa aasii uqallakłuni, Tavra taamna ittuq timiptun aitchuutigikkaptun tuqqutivlusi. Tainna pisiuŋ itqautigilugu uvamnun.

english: In the same way, he also took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, every time you drink it, in remembrance of me.”
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli ilaan tiguŋagaa qallugauraq wine-mik imalik nullautchianikamiŋ, uqallakłuni, Una wine qallugauramiittuaq ittuq uvaŋa auptun maqipkaqtauyumaaqtuatun, God nutauruakun sivunniuġurriyumiñaqsiḷugu iñuŋnik tuqqutipkun. Imiġuvsiuŋ piyumagiksi itqautigilugu uvamnun qanutun akulaisigilugu imiġaluaġuvsiuŋ.

english: For every time you eat this bread and drink the cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.
inupiaq: Tavra qanutun akulaisigilugu niġiguvsiuŋ punniq imiġlusiḷu qallugauramiñ, taavrumuuna maniuġiksi Atanġum tuqqutaa qaitqigñiŋanun aglaan.

english: For this reason, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
inupiaq: Tainnainman taamna, kiñaliqaa niġiruaq punniġmik imiqtuaġlu Atanġum qallugauraŋaniñ nalliummatiŋitchuakun piḷġutchikun, pasirauyumiñaqtuq qutchiksuakun isumakkutigiŋiññiḷugu Atanġum tuqqutaa.

english: A person should examine himself first, and in this way let him eat the bread and drink of the cup.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu iñuk qanuqitilaaqqaaqtuksraupiaqtuq inmiñun, aasii niġiḷuni punniġmik imiġluniḷu qallugauramiñ.

english: For the one who eats and drinks without careful regard for the body eats and drinks judgment against himself.
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñaliqaa niġiruaq imiqtuaġlu itqaumagiŋiḷḷaan sivuniŋa Atanġum tuqqutaata tatavsausiaksriuqtuq inmiñun.

english: That is why many of you are weak and sick, and quite a few are dead.
inupiaq: Tainnauvva piŋavlutiŋ iñugiaktuat iḷasi sayaitchut, naŋittuagurullu, suli iḷasi tuquvlutiŋ.

english: But if we examined ourselves, we would not be judged.
inupiaq: Qanuqitilaaġuugupta uvaptiŋnun nalaunŋaruakun, Atanġum ilaan qanuqitilaaġayaitkaatigut.

english: But when we are judged by the Lord, we are disciplined so that we may not be condemned with the world.
inupiaq: Tavra Atanġum ilaan qanuqitilaaġmatigut aasii paqitaġivluta pasiraksrauvluta, ilaan tatavsaġayukkaatigut, uvagut suksraunġiqsauqatautquŋił̣ł̣uta isuitchuamun piqatigilugich nunam iñuŋi.

english: So then, my brothers and sisters, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
inupiaq: Aniqatiitkaa, taamna tainnainman, utaqqisillaayumausi qakuguliqaa katitkuvsi atautchimun niġisuglusi Atanġum nullautchiġvianik.

english: If anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, so that when you assemble it does not lead to judgment. I will give directions about other matters when I come.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa kaakkumi niġisuiqsaaġli aimmiḷuni. Qanuq niġiqatigiikavsi atautchimi, aullasivsi iḷaanni tatavsausiaqaqtitpiaġaasi. Allatigun sutigun piraksriġñiaġivsi qaiguma.

english: With regard to spiritual gifts, brothers and sisters, I do not want you to be uninformed.
inupiaq: Aniqatiit, tuyuġivsi paŋmapak apiqsruutisi sivuniġivlugich Ilitqusiġiksuam aitchuutiŋigun. Kaŋiqsimaqłuquŋitkivsi tamatkunuuna.

english: You know that when you were pagans you were often led astray by speechless idols, however you were led.
inupiaq: Iḷisimarusi ukpiqtuaġuŋaiñŋavsi asiñuurrauŋarusi aŋaiyyusukłusi iñuuraqpaŋnun uqalaiḷanun, aasii tainna pikavsi aŋalatiłłusi tamatkunuŋa iñuuraqpaŋnun.

english: So I want you to understand that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus is cursed,” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.
inupiaq: Paŋmapak-aasii kaŋiqsitqugivsi taamna kiñaliqaa aŋalatittuaq Ilitqusiġiksuamun uqallakkumiñaipiaqtuq inna, Jesus suksraunġiqsauli. Suli kiñaliqaa uqallakkumiñaiñmiuq iḷumutun inna, Jesus Atanġuruq, Ilitqusiġiksuam pipkaŋisuaqpani.

english: Now there are different gifts, but the same Spirit.
inupiaq: God-im aitchuġaatigut iñugiaktuanik allakaaġiiñik ikayuqtiksraptiŋnik savautiguptiŋni, aglaan atautchim atiruam Ilitqusiġiksuam pigipkaġai iluqaisa uvaptiŋnun.

english: And there are different ministries, but the same Lord.
inupiaq: Allakaaġiiksuat savaaksrat God-mun ittut, aglaan iluqata savautigikput atausiq Ataniq.

english: And there are different results, but the same God who produces all of them in everyone.
inupiaq: Suli allakaaġiiksuat savaurriñġich inmiut savaaqaqtuni God-im savaaŋiñik, aglaan atausiuruam God-im iluqata savaktitkaatigut savaamiñik.

english: To each person the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the benefit of all.
inupiaq: Ilitqusiġiksuam iḷitchuġipkaġuugaa God-im suaŋŋataa atausiullaavluta uvaptigun, anniqsuqsaqługich aŋaiyyuliqiruat iluqaisa.

english: For one person is given through the Spirit the message of wisdom, and another the message of knowledge according to the same Spirit,
inupiaq: Ilitqusiġiksuam uqaqtillagaa iñuk isumattutikun, allasuli iñuk uqaqtillavlugu iḷisimmatiqaqtiłługu atausiuruam Ilitqusiġiksuam.

english: to another faith by the same Spirit, and to another gifts of healing by the one Spirit,
inupiaq: Atausiuruam Ilitqusiġiksuam allaptauq iñuk suaŋalluktuamik ukpiġutiqaqtillagaa, suli alla aitchuusiaqaqtillavlugu iłuaqsiriñiġmik atausiuruam Ilitqusiġiksuam.

english: to another performance of miracles, to another prophecy, and to another discernment of spirits, to another different kinds of tongues, and to another the interpretation of tongues.
inupiaq: Suli Ilitqusiġiksuam allaptauq savaktillavlugu aliuġnaqtuanik, aasiisuli alla iñuk uqaqtaullavlugu God-mun, allasuli iñuk puttuqsrisiqaqtillavlugu nalliaŋnun Ilitqusiġiksuamullu naagga iḷumun ilitqusiuŋitchuamullu iñuk aŋalatilaaŋanik, allasuli uqaqtillavlugu iñugiaktuanik uqautchiñik naluraŋiñik, aasiisuli sut uqautigikkaŋi, allamun iñuŋmun mumiksillavlugich nalugaluaġmiruamun taavrumiŋa uqautchimik.

english: It is one and the same Spirit, distributing as he decides to each person, who produces all these things.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ tamatkua ikayuusiat aitchuutaurut uvaptiŋnun atiruamiñ Ilitqusiġiksuamiñ atausisualuuruamiñ, aasii autaaqługich atausiullaavluta uvaptiŋnun, aitchuutit isummatigikkani pigiraksraġivlugich uvaptiŋnun.

english: For just as the body is one and yet has many members, and all the members of the body – though many – are one body, so too is Christ.
inupiaq: Qanuq timitun atausiuruatun aasii iñugiaktuanik sulliñiqaqłuni, suli iluqaġmiŋ iḷaŋi timim iñugiakkaluaqtillugich atausiuvluni timi, tainnatuttauq atausiŋŋuqatigiŋagikput Christ,

english: For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body. Whether Jews or Greeks or slaves or free, we were all made to drink of the one Spirit.
inupiaq: qanuq atausiullaavluta iḷaummatun ittugut Christ timaanun. Ilitqusiġiksuam atausiuruam iluqata atausiŋŋuŋagaatigut, atautchisun timitun, paptaiġutikun Jew-gugaluaġupta naagga Jew-guŋitkaluaġupta, kivgaugaluaġupta naagga kivgauŋitkaluaġupta. Aasii atausiuruaq Ilitqusiġiksuaq aitchuutauruq atausiullaavluta uvaptiŋnun.

english: For in fact the body is not a single member, but many.
inupiaq: Timi sulliñiqaqtuq iñugiaktuanik. Atausił̣hiñauluni sulliñiġuŋitchuq.

english: If the foot says, “Since I am not a hand, I am not part of the body,” it does not lose its membership in the body because of that.
inupiaq: Isigaich uqallakkumiñaqpata inna, Uvaŋa argauŋił̣ł̣uŋa timim sulliñiġiŋitkaaŋa. Taavruma uqallautim iḷauŋaipayaaġumiñaitkaa timimun.

english: And if the ear says, “Since I am not an eye, I am not part of the body,” it does not lose its membership in the body because of that.
inupiaq: Suli siun uqallallakpan, Qanuq irauŋił̣ł̣uŋa sulliñiġiŋitkaaŋa timim. Taavruma uqallautim iḷauŋaipayaaġumiñaiñmigaa timimun.

english: If the whole body were an eye, what part would do the hearing? If the whole were an ear, what part would exercise the sense of smell?
inupiaq: Timi iluqani iraukpan, iñuk tusaallayumiñaitchuq. Timi-suli iluqani siutaukpan, iñuk naiḷaiññayaġmiuq.

english: But as a matter of fact, God has placed each of the members in the body just as he decided.
inupiaq: Aglaan God-im tainna savaŋaitkaatigut. God-im savaŋagai timivut iñugiaktuanik sulliñiqaqługich, aasii ilaisigullaa inillakługich timim sulliñillaaŋa sumun pisukamiuŋ.

english: If they were all the same member, where would the body be?
inupiaq: Timi iluqani atausił̣hiñauluni sulliñiġugaluaqpan timaunayaitchuq.

english: So now there are many members, but one body.
inupiaq: Aglaan God-im savausiatun timimik, iñuk timiqaqtuq atautchimik sulliñiqaqtuamik iñugiaktuanik.

english: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I do not need you,” nor in turn can the head say to the foot, “I do not need you.”
inupiaq: Iri uqallakkumiñaitchuq argaŋnun, Anniqsuutigiŋitkikpiñ, naaggaunnii niaquq isigaŋnun, Anniqsuutigiŋitkikpiñ.

english: On the contrary, those members that seem to be weaker are essential,
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva, iḷaŋi timim qiññaqaqtuat anniqsuutauvigruaŋitchuatun piitchuipiaqtut.

english: and those members we consider less honorable we clothe with greater honor, and our unpresentable members are clothed with dignity,
inupiaq: Aasiisuli tamatkua timim sulliñiŋi qiñiyunapiaŋitchuat isummatigilluataġuummigivut qanuq piitchuiñmiut. Suli sulliñiŋi timim kanŋugiravut taalutaqaġivut.

english: but our presentable members do not need this. Instead, God has blended together the body, giving greater honor to the lesser member,
inupiaq: Qaunagilluatałhaaġivut tamatkunaŋŋa timim sulliñiŋiñiñ kanŋugiŋisaptiŋniñ. God-im savaŋagai timivut, uvaptiŋnun qaunagilluatałhaaquvlugich timim iḷaŋi isummatigikkavut anniqsuutaupiaŋiññasugalugich.

english: so that there may be no division in the body, but the members may have mutual concern for one another.
inupiaq: Tainna God-im sivuniqaŋagaa timi itquvlugu, sulliñipayauraŋi timipta atautchisun itquvlugich, qaunagilluataquvlugich iluqaisa atunim. Tainnatun God sivuniqaŋaruq iluqaisa ukpiqtuat iñuuniaqatigiiquvlugich atilutiŋ.

english: If one member suffers, everyone suffers with it. If a member is honored, all rejoice with it.
inupiaq: Atausiq iḷauruaq isumaaluusiqpan, iluqaġmiŋ iḷauruat isumaaluutigigaat, naagga atausiq iḷauruaq isumakkusiaqaġluataqpan, iluqaġmiŋ quviatchaktaurut.

english: Now you are Christ’s body, and each of you is a member of it.
inupiaq: Iluqavsi atausiurusi, iñullaaguvlusi sulliñiġimmatun Christ timaata itkaasi.

english: And God has placed in the church first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, gifts of healing, helps, gifts of leadership, different kinds of tongues.
inupiaq: Aasii aŋaiyyuliqiruat akunġanni God piksraŋaruq sivulliġivlugu, iñuich tilirauvlugich alġaqsruitquvlugich, igḷuani uqaqtiksranik God-mun, piŋayuagni iḷisaurriksranik, maanna aliuġnaqtuanik savallaruanik, tamatkuniŋalu iłuaqsiriḷḷaruanik, ikayuiruksraniglu, ataniġnaqutiqaqtuallu, uqallaruallu allakaaġiiñik uqautchiñik naluramiŋnik.

english: Not all are apostles, are they? Not all are prophets, are they? Not all are teachers, are they? Not all perform miracles, do they?
inupiaq: Uvva inna. Tamatkiġḷutiŋ ukpiqtuaguruat tilirauŋitchut alġaqsruiyyaqulugich, suli tamatkiġḷutiŋ God-mun uqaqtauŋiñmiut. Tamatkiġḷutiŋ iḷisaurrauŋiñmiut, naaggaunnii tamatkiġḷutiŋ aliuġnaqtuanik savalaiñmiut.

english: Not all have gifts of healing, do they? Not all speak in tongues, do they? Not all interpret, do they?
inupiaq: Iluqaqpiaġmiŋ piqaŋiñmiut iłuaqsiriñiġmik. Suli tamatkiġḷutiŋ uqallasiḷḷaruaguŋiñmiut allanik uqautchiñik naluramiŋnik naagga mumiksiḷḷasiḷutiŋ tamatkuniŋa allanik uqautchiñik.

english: But you should be eager for the greater gifts.
inupiaq: Tavraasii kipiġniupiaġitchi anniqsuutaułhaaqtuanik aitchuusiaqaġuglusi. Paŋmapak uqallautiniaġivsi nakuułhamaaqtuamik aitchuusianiñ.

english: And now I will show you a way that is beyond comparison.
If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but I do not have love, I am a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal.
inupiaq: Aitchuusiaqaġaluaġniġuma uqallaniġmik allagiiñik uqautchiñik nalukkamnik, uqallaluŋa allatun iñuktitun isaġuliktullu, aasii piviuttaqqutaiḷḷuŋa allanun iñuŋnun, uqaġniġa arriqaqtuq qukiġñaqsivḷugu kausugrukkaŋatitun savił̣hatun.

english: And if I have prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so that I can remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.
inupiaq: Suli aitchuusiaqaġmiguma uqaqtauniġmik God-mun, kaŋiqsiḷḷalugich iluqaisa sivuani kaŋiqsiḷaisaŋich iñuich iḷisimaluŋa supayaanik, naaggaqaa suaŋapiaġataqtuamik ukpiġutiqaġaluaġuma nuktallalugich iġġich aasii piviuttaqqutaiḷḷuŋa iñuŋnun, anniqsuutauŋitchuŋa.

english: If I give away everything I own, and if I give over my body in order to boast, but do not have love, I receive no benefit.
inupiaq: Aitchuutigigaluaġmigupkich supayaurat pigikkatka iḷiappauruanun iñuŋnun, naaggaqaa timiga ikipkaqtitkaluaġupku pisigilugu tusaayugaaġiksuaq, aasii piviuttaqsriŋiḷḷuŋa iñuŋnik, akiḷiusiaksraitchuŋa.

english: Love is patient, love is kind, it is not envious. Love does not brag, it is not puffed up.
inupiaq: Iñuk piviuttaqsriruaq iñuŋnik allanik qanułłayaitchuq taluġnaitchuġlu killuqsrautaitchuġlu uqavigaaġurriḷaitchuġlu.

english: It is not rude, it is not self-serving, it is not easily angered or resentful.
inupiaq: Iñuk piviuttaqsriruaq iñuŋnik allanik piġuqtilaitchuq inmiñik salliuniatalaitchuġlu. Iñuk piviuttaqsriruaq allanik iñuŋnik siŋñataitchuq, piavsayaiñmiuq, suli tumaqsiġiiḷaitchuq sunŋutchaunmiñ.

english: It is not glad about injustice, but rejoices in the truth.
inupiaq: Iñuk piviuttaqsriruaq allanik iñuŋnik suuramikunnii quviasulaitchuq iñuich piḷuktualiqimmata, aglaan quviasuguuruq iñuich nalaunŋarualiqimmata.

english: It bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
inupiaq: Iñuum piviuttaqsriruam allanik iñuŋnik manimmiḷḷagai pimaqłuutiŋich allat, ataramik ukpiġivlugu nakuuniqsraq iñuktigun, ataramik ququutivlugich pigigñiqsranik allat iñuich, suli manimmiḷgutiqaqtuiññaqłuni allanun iñuŋnun.

english: Love never ends. But if there are prophecies, they will be set aside; if there are tongues, they will cease; if there is knowledge, it will be set aside.
inupiaq: Piviuttaqqun inniaqtuq isuitchuamun. Aglaan aitchuusiaqaġniq uqaqtauniġmik God-mun piiġñiaqtuq, suli aitchuusiaqaġniq uqallasivḷugu iñuk nalukkaŋiñik uqautchiñik nutqaġniaġmiuq, suli aitchuusiaqaġniq God-miñ iḷisimallasivḷugu suna sivuani iḷisimaraiñŋaruaq, piiġñiaġmiuq.

english: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part,
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷitchiŋaniqput paŋmapak naamaitchuq, suli uqaqtauniqput God-mun naamaiñmiuq,

english: but when what is perfect comes, the partial will be set aside.
inupiaq: aglaan taimanigu naamasiraugupta qiḷaŋmi, pigiraksraġiŋaiġñiaġivut naamaitchuat aitchuusiat.

english: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. But when I became an adult, I set aside childish ways.
inupiaq: Taamna uuktuutiqaġumiñaqtuq uumiŋa. Miqłiqtuuŋŋaġma, uqausiqaŋaruŋa miqłiqtum uqausiatun, suli miqłiqtutun isummasiqaqłuŋa, sivunniuġuuvluŋalu miqłiqtutun. Aglaan agliraksraiqama, aġiuŋagitka miqłiqtut piḷġusiŋich.

english: For now we see in a mirror indirectly, but then we will see face to face. Now I know in part, but then I will know fully, just as I have been fully known.
inupiaq: Uvvasuli alla uuktuun taavrumuŋa. Paŋmapak uvva qiñiġmatun Christ pigikput taġġaktuutigipiaŋitchuakun, tauttuġluammatun pivḷugu. Aglaan taimanigu tautugniaġikput sukuiġḷugu. Paŋmapak iḷisimałauraqsiññaqtuŋa mikiruamik ilaagun, aglaan taimanigu kaŋiqsimmaġiksipiaġniaqtuŋa, God-im iḷisimmasipiaġataŋatun uvamnik paŋmapak.

english: And now these three remain: faith, hope, and love. But the greatest of these is love.
inupiaq: Tavra iñuich ukpiqsimaniaqtut suli, niġiugniaqtutsuli, piviuttaqsriḷutiglu suli, aglaan taapkunaŋŋa piŋasuni piviuttaqqutiqaġniq allanun anniqsuutaułhamaapiaqtuq.

english: Pursue love and be eager for the spiritual gifts, especially that you may prophesy.
inupiaq: Piviuttaqsriñiq allanik iñuŋnik kipiġniuġutigiłhaaqsiuŋ supayaamiñ. Aasiisuli kipiġniuġutigipiaġmiḷugich aitchuutiŋi Ilitqusiġiksuam, kipiġniuġutigiłhaaġlugu aitchuusiaqaġniq uqaqtauniġmik God-mun.

english: For the one speaking in a tongue does not speak to people but to God, for no one understands; he is speaking mysteries by the Spirit.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk uqaqtuaq uqautchimik nalukkaġmiñik uqaqtuq God-mun, uqautiŋitkai iñuich, qanuq iñuum kialiqaa kaŋiqsiḷaitkaa, uqaqtiłługu Ilitqusiġiksuam kaŋiqsiñaitchuamik uqautchimik.

english: But the one who prophesies speaks to people for their strengthening, encouragement, and consolation.
inupiaq: Aglaalli iñuk uqaqtauruaq God-mun kaŋiqsiñaqtuamik uqaqłuni suaŋasiḷaaġiruq iñuich ukpiġutiŋiññik, qapiŋaisaaqługiḷḷu suli arakługich.

english: The one who speaks in a tongue builds himself up, but the one who prophesies builds up the church.
