inupiaq: Aasii Melchizedek-kun uqautiksraukkaġaluaqtugut siġḷiġnaqtuanik sivunniuqsaaruni, aglaan ilivsi kaŋiqsiḷguitchusi.

english: During his earthly life Christ offered both requests and supplications, with loud cries and tears, to the one who was able to save him from death and he was heard because of his devotion.
inupiaq: Uvva paŋmapak iḷisaurriġuġumiñaqsigaluaqłusi, iḷisaurriqaqtuksraurusi-suli iñuŋmik iḷisaurrivsaaqtuksramik ilivsiññik sivulliqsigun iḷisaurrutitigun God-im uqaluŋiñi. Taamna pisigivlugu immuktuqtuksraurusi miqłiqtutun, niqipiaguŋitchuamik.

english: Although he was a son, he learned obedience through the things he suffered.
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñaliqaa iñuggutiqaqtuaq immuŋmik miqłiqtutun ittuq naluvlugu nalaunŋaruaq naagga nalaunŋaitchuaq.

english: And by being perfected in this way, he became the source of eternal salvation to all who obey him,
inupiaq: Aglaan niqipiaq sivuniqaqtuq agliŋaruanun, tamatkunuŋa iḷitchuġipkaqtitauŋaruanun sum nalaunŋatilaaŋanik piḷuktilaaŋaniglu.

english: and he was designated by God as high priest in the order of Melchizedek.
On this topic we have much to say and it is difficult to explain, since you have become sluggish in hearing.
For though you should in fact be teachers by this time, you need someone to teach you the beginning elements of God’s utterances. You have gone back to needing milk, not solid food.
For everyone who lives on milk is inexperienced in the message of righteousness, because he is an infant.
But solid food is for the mature, whose perceptions are trained by practice to discern both good and evil.
Therefore we must progress beyond the elementary instructions about Christ and move on to maturity, not laying this foundation again: repentance from dead works and faith in God,
inupiaq: Tavra uqautigiŋaiḷḷaglugich sivulliich siġḷiġnaitchuat iḷisaurrutit Christ-kun, aglisaiññaqta. Iḷisaurrigiññaŋaiġḷuta sivulliġñik iḷisaurrutinik kisiiññik ukuniŋa, isumalitqiunmik piḷġutchiñiñ tuqunaqtuaniñ, ukpiġunmiglu God-mun,

english: teaching about baptisms, laying on of hands, resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.
inupiaq: iḷisaurrutinik paptaiġutikun, iḷiñiŋanniglu argaŋisa umialiŋnat iñuum niaquanun, aŋŋisaatigullu tuquŋaruat, isuitchuakullu isivġiġvikun.

english: And this is what we intend to do, if God permits.
inupiaq: Aasii taamna sivunmuktuġniksraqput taŋŋiġñiaġikput God-im pipkaġumiñaqpagu.

english: For it is impossible in the case of those who have once been enlightened, tasted the heavenly gift, become partakers of the Holy Spirit,
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuich kaŋiqsipkaqtauganikamiŋ, uuktuaganikamiŋ annaunmik aitchuusiaqaanikamiglu Ilitqusiġiksuamik,

english: tasted the good word of God and the miracles of the coming age,
inupiaq: uuktuaganikamirruglu nakuutaa God-im uqaluan, suaŋŋataalu Atanġum salapqiġñiakkaŋa ukiuni qaiyumaaqtuani,

english: and then have committed apostasy, to renew them again to repentance, since they are crucifying the Son of God for themselves all over again and holding him up to contempt.
inupiaq: taapkua uuktuaqqaaqługich, aquatigun tunutkumirruŋ Christ, qanuġlugich isumalitqiksitqigñaġumiñaitchut. Qanuq ilaisa kikiaktuutitqigmatun pigaat Iġñiŋa God-im, suli kipautigivlugu ilaan tuqqutaa.

english: For the ground that has soaked up the rain that frequently falls on it and yields useful vegetation for those who tend it receives a blessing from God.
inupiaq: Iñuich ukpiqsimaaqtuat Christ-mun qaunakkusiaqaqtut nunatun qaunakkusiaqaqtuatun sialuŋman, aasii naurivḷuni niqiksranik tamatkunuŋa nunaliqiruanun.

english: But if it produces thorns and thistles, it is useless and about to be cursed; its fate is to be burned.
inupiaq: Iñuiḷḷi tunutchiruat Christ-mik suksraunġiqsaurut nunatun sialuŋman unnii nauriruatun kakiḷḷaġnaqtuanik. Anniqsuutauŋitchut ikiraugiññaġniaqtut.

english: But in your case, dear friends, even though we speak like this, we are convinced of better things relating to salvation.
inupiaq: Tainna uqaġaluaġuptaunnii, piviuttaġirauruasii, nalupqisuŋitchugut nunagiksuatun itilaavsiññik aasii annaurrauvlusi.

english: For God is not unjust so as to forget your work and the love you have demonstrated for his name, in having served and continuing to serve the saints.
inupiaq: Qanuq God nalaunŋaruq. Naluruuraaġniaŋitkaa ikayuutiksi, piviuttaqqullu iḷisimanaqtitaqsi savautikavsigik ukpiqtuat ilaa pisigivlugu, piḷġusivsisun paŋmapak.

english: But we passionately want each of you to demonstrate the same eagerness for the fulfillment of your hope until the end,
inupiaq: Suli tainnatun kipiġniuttaġigivsi atausiullaavlusi ikayuiñiapiaquvlusi. Taamna piguvsiuŋ iñuuniqtutilaavsisun nalupqiginiaŋitkiksi annautiksraqsi.

english: so that you may not be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and perseverance inherit the promises.
inupiaq: Tavraasii iqiatchautinagu ikayuiñiq, aglaan taipkunatun ukpiġutiqaġlusi qiñuirrutiqaġlusiḷu, kiŋuvaannakkumausi God-im unniqsuqłiisiŋiñik.

english: Now when God made his promise to Abraham, since he could swear by no one greater, he swore by himself,
inupiaq: God-im unniqsuqłiikamiuŋ Abraham, unniqsuqłiiŋagaa inmiguaqługu, sumik kamanałhaaqtuamik piiḷḷuni inmiñiñ,

english: saying, “Surely I will bless you greatly and multiply your descendants abundantly.”
inupiaq: uqaqłuni, “Nalupqinaitchuamik quviasaapiaġniaġikpiñ, iñugiaksipkaġlugiḷḷu kiŋuniqtin.”

english: And so by persevering, Abraham inherited the promise.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Abraham, qiñuiqł̣uni utaqqiuqqaaqłuni, piññaktaaġiŋagaa God-im unniqsuqłiisaa.

english: For people swear by something greater than themselves, and the oath serves as a confirmation to end all dispute.
inupiaq: Iñuiḷḷi iḷumutun unniqsuqłiisuurut nalupqinaiyausiqł̣utiŋ kamanałhaaqtuanik inmiŋniñ, aasii tainnaġmata arguanaiġaqtuq unniqsuqłiisaat avanmun.

english: In the same way God wanted to demonstrate more clearly to the heirs of the promise that his purpose was unchangeable, and so he intervened with an oath,
inupiaq: Tavrali God-im ukpiġnaqsiḷiġuŋagaa unniqsuqłiisini kiŋuvaannagniaqtuanun allaŋŋulaisilaaŋa sivunniutini, arguanaiyaqługu unniqsuqłiiñmik.

english: so that we who have found refuge in him may find strong encouragement to hold fast to the hope set before us through two unchangeable things, since it is impossible for God to lie.
inupiaq: Taapkuŋnuuna malġukkun allaŋŋulaitchuakkun, unniqsuqłiisikullu nalupqinaiyautikullu, God arguanaiŋaruq sagluyumiñaisilaamiñik. Uvagulli annaksaŋaruaguut qamannirviŋmun God-mun piyumalaaġusiqł̣uta piññaktaaġiyumavlugu annaun aitchuutigisukkaŋa.

english: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, sure and steadfast, which reaches inside behind the curtain,
inupiaq: Kitchatun pauksimmatauruatun, tainnatulli pauksimmatigigikput kitchatun taamna annagumman ilitqusiptiŋnun. Taamna annagumman qiḷaŋmi pigigikput, qanuq Jesus ayuŋaruq sivuptiŋni pisivluta. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaktun isiŋaruq amuŋatchianun talukiyaam inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtuamun God-mun. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguqtuq tuvraqługu piḷġusia Melchizedek-gum isuitchuamun.

english: where Jesus our forerunner entered on our behalf, since he became a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.
Now this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, met Abraham as he was returning from defeating the kings and blessed him.
inupiaq: Qanuq taavruma Melchizedek-gum, umialgata Salem, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋan sapiġñaġniqsrauruam God-im, paaŋagaa Abraham utiqtuaq tuquġaqqaaqługich umialgich. Aasii Melchizedek-gum aŋaiyyutiŋagaa piḷḷuatautiqaquvlugu.

english: To him also Abraham apportioned a tithe of everything. His name first means king of righteousness, then king of Salem, that is, king of peace.
inupiaq: Aasii Abraham-gum aitchuŋagaa quliŋŋuġutiŋiññik supayaurat piġġaktaami akimakami. Melchizedek-gum atqa mumiŋñiŋagun sivuniqaqtuq Umialguruq Iłuaqtualiqiniġmun, aasiisuli umialgummiuq Salem-mun sivuniqaqtuamun Umialganun Aŋuyautairrutim.

english: Without father, without mother, without genealogy, he has neither beginning of days nor end of life but is like the son of God, and he remains a priest for all time.
inupiaq: Aapaiñmiuq aakaitchuġlu maŋŋuitchuġlu aglausimaruanik, suli Bible uqaluŋisa quliaqtuaġiŋitkaat aniñiŋa tuquniŋalu. Tavraasii Melchizedek ittuq Iġñiŋatun God-im aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauvluni isuitchuamun.

english: But see how great he must be, if Abraham the patriarch gave him a tithe of his plunder.
inupiaq: Isumalaaġutigisiuŋ qanutun kamanaqtilaaŋa. Abraham kamanautikun maŋŋuuruam aitchullammagu quliŋŋuġutiŋiññik piġġaktaami akimakami.

english: And those of the sons of Levi who receive the priestly office have authorization according to the law to collect a tithe from the people, that is, from their fellow countrymen, although they too are descendants of Abraham.
inupiaq: Aasiiḷi taipkua kiŋuniŋi Levi-m aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguqtitauŋaruat pitquraqaqtut tigusitquvlugich quliŋŋuġutinik iñuŋniñ, ilaisa aniqatiimiŋniñ, maŋŋuqaġaluaqtillugitchauq Abraham-miñ.

english: But Melchizedek who does not share their ancestry collected a tithe from Abraham and blessed the one who possessed the promise.
inupiaq: Aglaan taamna iñuk Melchizedek, maŋŋuqaqatigiŋisaŋatunnii, aitchuusiaqaŋaruq quliŋŋuġutinik Abraham-miñ. Aasii uqallaŋaruq Abraham-mun unniqsuqłiisiaqaqtuamun, God-im piḷḷuataqtitchumagaatin.

english: Now without dispute the inferior is blessed by the superior,
inupiaq: Iñuk tainna uqallallaruaq kamanałhaaqtuq taavrumaŋŋa uqallausiqaqtuamiñ. Kialiqaa taamna qapiġumiñaitkaa.

english: and in one case tithes are received by mortal men, while in the other by him who is affirmed to be alive.
inupiaq: Aasiisuli Levi-m kiŋuniŋisa aitchuusiaġisuugaich quliŋŋuġutit aasii tuquvlutiŋ. Aglaalli Melchizedek aitchuusiaqaŋaruq quliŋŋuġutinik, quliaqtuaġuŋaitchuaq tuquŋaniḷugu.

english: And it could be said that Levi himself, who receives tithes, paid a tithe through Abraham.
inupiaq: Iḷaanni iñuktauq uqallakkumiñaġugnaġmiuq inna. Levi-vsauq kiŋuniŋi aitchuusiaqaġuurut quliŋŋuġutinik, akiḷiiŋammiñiqsut quliŋŋuġutinik Melchizedek-mun.

english: For he was still in his ancestor Abraham’s loins when Melchizedek met him.
inupiaq: Qanuq Abraham aitchuimman, aitchuimmatun piŋammiut aniŋaiñŋaġmiŋ unnii ilaan kiŋuniġivlugich.

english: So if perfection had in fact been possible through the Levitical priesthood – for on that basis the people received the law – what further need would there have been for another priest to arise, said to be in the order of Melchizedek and not in Aaron’s order?
inupiaq: Pitqurat iñuŋnun aitchuutauŋarut aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaummata Levi-m kiŋuniŋi. Tavra iñuich annaurraullakpata naamasiḷugu Levi-m kiŋuniŋigun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauruatigun Aaron-kun, piqaġugnaġniaŋitkaluaqtuq allamik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋmik Melchizedek-tun ittuamik.

english: For when the priesthood changes, a change in the law must come as well.
inupiaq: Qanuq allaŋŋuqtuksraġuġman aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaqaġniq Levi-m kiŋuniŋiñik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaktun Melchizedek-tun ittuamik, tainnatuttauq allaŋŋuqtuksraupiaġuummiut pitqurat.

english: Yet the one these things are spoken about belongs to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever officiated at the altar.
inupiaq: Qanuq Christ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaktun Melchizedek-tun kaŋiqaqtuq allamiñ Aaron-guŋitchuamiñ, savaaqaŋaitchuaniñ ikipkaiviŋmi.

english: For it is clear that our Lord is descended from Judah, yet Moses said nothing about priests in connection with that tribe.
inupiaq: Nalupqinaitchuq Ataniqput maŋŋuqaqtuaguruq Judah-miñ, aasii taapkua maŋŋuġiich Moses uqallausiġiŋaitkai aŋaiyyuliqsiqpautqulugich.

english: And this is even clearer if another priest arises in the likeness of Melchizedek,
inupiaq: Taamna nalupqinaivsaaŋaruq allasuli aŋaiyyuliqsiqpak Melchizedek-tun ittuaq salapqiġman.

english: who has become a priest not by a legal regulation about physical descent but by the power of an indestructible life.
inupiaq: Christ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguŋaruq, pisigivlugu iñuuniŋa isuitchuamun. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguŋaitchuq maŋŋuqaġniḷugu Aaron-miñ pitqurat apiqsriaŋatiktun.

english: For here is the testimony about him: “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”
inupiaq: Qanuq God-im uqallautiŋagaa Christ, “Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaurutin isuitchuamun tuvraqługu Melchizedek.”

english: On the one hand a former command is set aside because it is weak and useless,
inupiaq: Sivulliich pitqurat sivuniqaqtuat Levi-m kiŋuniŋigun asivaqtaurut, pisigivlugu suaŋaiññiŋat anniqsuutauŋiññiŋallu annaurriḷaił̣ł̣utiŋ iñuŋnik,

english: for the law made nothing perfect. On the other hand a better hope is introduced, through which we draw near to God.
inupiaq: qanuq taipkua pitqurat nalaunŋasipiaġatalaitkaat kiñapayaaq sivuġaani God-im. Aglaan Christ pisigilugu aŋaiyyuliqsiqpagikkaqput annagummatiqapiaqtugut, suli qalliḷaaġumiñaqtugut God-mun.

english: And since this was not done without a sworn affirmation – for the others have become priests without a sworn affirmation,
inupiaq: God unniqsuqłiipiaŋaruq Christ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauniaġnivḷugu isuitchuamun.

english: but Jesus did so with a sworn affirmation by the one who said to him, “The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind, ‘You are a priest forever’” –
inupiaq: Taipkua sivuani aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguqtuat aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguqtitausuurut unniqsuqłiisauŋitchuakun God-miñ, aglaan Christ aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaguqtitauŋaruq unniqsuqłiisimik inna,

english: accordingly Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant.
inupiaq: Sivulliich aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich iñugiaŋarut, tuqusuuvlutiŋ. Tuqqutim piiġuuŋagai savaaŋiññiñ.

english: And the others who became priests were numerous, because death prevented them from continuing in office,
inupiaq: Aglaan Jesus aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauruq taimuŋa, qanuq ilaa iñuuruq isuitchuamun.

english: but he holds his priesthood permanently since he lives forever.
inupiaq: Tainnaiłłuniasii ilaan ataramik annautiyumiñaġai tamatkua qalliḷaaqtuat God-mun inmigun, qanuq iñuuruq ataramik qiññuaqtuutisukługich God-mun.

english: So he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.
inupiaq: Qanuq nalaunŋaruq tainnatchimik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiannik piqaġupta, ilaaguaqtauruamik God-mun, pasiñaġumiñaitchuamik, piġuaġniġitchuamik, ilaaguaŋaruamik piḷuusiqiriniñ, kamanaqsipkaqtauruamik qiḷaŋmi.

english: For it is indeed fitting for us to have such a high priest: holy, innocent, undefiled, separate from sinners, and exalted above the heavens.
inupiaq: Jesus taipkunatun inŋitchuq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiŋisitun, aitchuiruksrauluni ikipkautinik uvlutuaqpan, sivulliġilugich ilaan piḷuutini, piḷuutiŋiññullu iñuich. Qanuq tuqukami naanŋagai ikipkautit pitqigaksraiqł̣ugich, inmiñik aitchuutigivluni.

english: He has no need to do every day what those priests do, to offer sacrifices first for their own sins and then for the sins of the people, since he did this in offering himself once for all.
inupiaq: Pitquratigun aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiksraġuugaich piḷuksiḷḷaruanik. Aasii pitqurat qaisauganiŋmata God-im nalunaiŋagaa Iġñini piḷuksiŋaitchuaq isuitchuamun.

english: For the law appoints as high priests men subject to weakness, but the word of solemn affirmation that came after the law appoints a son made perfect forever.
Now the main point of what we are saying is this: We have such a high priest, one who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,
inupiaq: Tavra sivuniġikkaŋa uqaluutigikkapta innaittuq. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiannik piqaqtugut Christ-mik, aquvititauruamik taliqpiata tuŋaanun God-im kamanaqtuam qiḷaŋmi.

english: a minister in the sanctuary and the true tabernacle that the Lord, not man, set up.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat pisinniktuq inimi ilaaguaqtauruami God-mun tupipiamiittuami aŋaiyyuviŋmi, iñuum nappaqtaġiŋisaŋani, aglaan Atanġum nappaqtaŋani.

english: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. So this one too had to have something to offer.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat aitchuutiqaqtuksrausuumman piksraqtaaguruaq aitchuitquvlugu aitchuutinik ikipkautiniglu God-mun pisivlugich iñuich; tainnatulli aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat pigikkaqput aitchuutiksraqaqtuksraupiaġmiuq sumik.

english: Now if he were on earth, he would not be a priest, since there are already priests who offer the gifts prescribed by the law.
inupiaq: Tavra Christ nunamiitkumi, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauyumiñaitkaluaqtuq sumikunnii, qanuq allanik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaqaqtuq nunami qaitchisuuruanik aitchuutinik pitquratiguaqłutiŋ.

english: The place where they serve is a sketch and shadow of the heavenly sanctuary, just as Moses was warned by God as he was about to complete the tabernacle. For he says, “See that you make everything according to the design shown to you on the mountain.”
inupiaq: Savaktut tupiġmi tuvrautiruami taġġauruamiḷu qiḷaŋmiittuamun tupipiamun aŋaiyyuviŋmun. Qanuq Moses nappaisaġumaagaqsimman tupiġmik aŋaiyyuviksramik, iḷisautiŋagaa God-im uqallautivlugu, “Qaunagilutin savakkumagitin supayaat tuvraġlugu iḷiktiġusiaq iḷisaurrusiaġikkan iġġimi.”

english: But now Jesus has obtained a superior ministry, since the covenant that he mediates is also better and is enacted on better promises.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich savaktut tupiġmi nunamiittuami taġġałhiñauruami, Christ-li pisinnikkumiñaqsiŋaruq qiḷaŋmi nakuułhaasugruktuamik nunami aŋaiyyuliqsiqpauruaniñ. Ilaan savaaŋa kamanałhaaqtuq aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich savaaŋiññiñ, qanuq God-im sivunniuġutaa nutauruaq ilaan qaaŋiqsitaŋa uvaptiŋnun nakuułhaaqtuamik unniqsuqłiisiqaqtuq.

english: For if that first covenant had been faultless, no one would have looked for a second one.
inupiaq: Qanuq sivulliuruaq sivunniuġun naamaŋakpan, simmausiġñiaŋitkaluaqtuq.

english: But showing its fault, God says to them,
inupiaq: Ataniq God iviġaumaiñŋaruq taipkunuŋa iñuŋnun, aasii uqallakłuni,

english: “Look, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will complete a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.

“It will not be like the covenant that I made with their fathers, on the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they did not continue in my covenant and I had no regard for them, says the Lord.

“For this is the covenant that I will establish with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord. I will put my laws in their minds and I will inscribe them on their hearts. And I will be their God and they will be my people.
“And there will be no need at all for each one to teach his countryman or each one to teach his brother saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ since they will all know me, from the least to the greatest.
“For I will be merciful toward their evil deeds, and their sins I will remember no longer.”
When he speaks of a new covenant, he makes the first obsolete. Now what is growing obsolete and aging is about to disappear.
Now the first covenant, in fact, had regulations for worship and its earthly sanctuary.
inupiaq: Tavra taamnaunnii sivulliq sivunniuġutaa God-im uqaluqaŋaruq qanuq piruksrautilaaŋannik tupiġmi aŋaiyyuviŋmi nunamiittuami.

english: For a tent was prepared, the outer one, which contained the lampstand, the table, and the presentation of the loaves; this is called the holy place.
inupiaq: Qanuq tupiq nappaqtauŋaruq siḷalliġuaqaqługu tairauruamik ilaaguaqtamik inimik God-mun. Aasii iḷuaniinŋarut qulliqaġvigḷu, niġġiviiḷḷu, qaamiutaqaqtuat punniġnik ilaaguaqtauruanik God-mun.

english: And after the second curtain there was a tent called the holy of holies.
inupiaq: Aasii tupiq kaŋiḷḷiqaqtuq tunuani talukiyaam, tairauruamik Ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtuamik inimik God-mun.

english: It contained the golden altar of incense and the ark of the covenant covered entirely with gold. In this ark were the golden urn containing the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the stone tablets of the covenant.
inupiaq: Aasii iḷuaniinŋaruq ikipkaiviḷiaq tivraġiksautinun piḷiaq maniŋmiñ kaviqsuamiñ, kigiunniġlu itqaumman God-im sivunniuġutaanun, puuqaqtuaq iluqani maniŋmik kaviqsuamik. Taavruma kiguunniġum imaġivlugich utkusigḷu piḷiaq maniŋmiñ kaviqsuamiñ imalik maana-mik, ayauppiaŋalu Aaron akutuqpanillaruaq, pitqurallu aglaŋaruat saapaqayaaŋnun uyaqqaŋnun.

english: And above the ark were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Now is not the time to speak of these things in detail.
inupiaq: Qaaŋaniinŋaruk matuam isaġullak qaummaġiksuak qulaŋiqsimavlugu nagliktuusiannagvik God-miñ. Taapkua paŋmapak uqautiginiaŋitkivut qanupiaq sivuniqaqtilaaŋat.

english: So with these things prepared like this, the priests enter continually into the outer tent as they perform their duties.
inupiaq: Tamatkua itqanaiganigataġmata tainna, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich ataramik uglaġaġniqsut siḷalliġmun tupiġmun, savaaġiugaqługich piraksrautitiŋ.

english: But only the high priest enters once a year into the inner tent, and not without blood that he offers for himself and for the sins of the people committed in ignorance.
inupiaq: Aglaan iḷuanun kaŋiḷḷium aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat kisimi isiġuuniqsuq atausiaqsiññaqługu ukiuq, augutiligaaqłuni piḷuutaiġutiksramiñik iñuiḷḷu piḷuutiŋisa piiġutiksraŋannik.

english: The Holy Spirit is making clear that the way into the holy place had not yet appeared as long as the old tabernacle was standing.
inupiaq: Taavrumuuna Ilitqusiġiksuam kaŋiqsipkaŋagaatigut taamna apqun inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtuamun God-mun aŋmaŋaisilaaŋanik-suli iñuich piḷḷasiḷugich tavruŋa, siḷallium tupqum napaniqtutilaaŋatun.

english: This was a symbol for the time then present, when gifts and sacrifices were offered that could not perfect the conscience of the worshiper.
inupiaq: Taamna siḷalliq tupiq qiñiġaaġimmatun itkaa paŋmapak piraġautchim. Qanuq aitchuutit ikipkautillu aitchuutaugayuktut naamaŋitchuat piḷuutaipiaġumiñaġlugich aŋaiyyurauruat.

english: They served only for matters of food and drink and various washings; they are external regulations imposed until the new order came.
inupiaq: Aglaan tamatkua piraġautchich aŋalatchirut aŋaiyyuliqiniġmi niqiłhiñaniglu imiłhiñamiglu qanusiḷimaaniglu aŋaiyyuliqinikun salummaksautinik timimun. Tamatkua qaałhiñakun piraġautchich piruksrausuurut tikitchiaġivlugu God-im nakuułhaaqtuaq sivunniuġutaa taŋŋiqsitaŋa Christ-mun.

english: But now Christ has come as the high priest of the good things to come. He passed through the greater and more perfect tent not made with hands, that is, not of this creation,
inupiaq: Tavra paŋmapak Christ qaiganiŋaruq, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiat nakuuruanun sunun paŋmapak ittuanun. Tupiq aŋaiyyuvik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaŋnun qaukłiuvigikkaŋa tupquŋitchuq nunami iñuich savaaġilugu, aglaan kamanałhaaqtuaq nakuułhaaqtuaġlu tupiq qiḷaŋmiittuaq.

english: and he entered once for all into the most holy place not by the blood of goats and calves but by his own blood, and so he himself secured eternal redemption.
inupiaq: Aasii aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiatitun Christ isiŋaruq pitqigaksraiqł̣ugu inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtauŋaruamun God-mun, augutiqaqłuni auŋił̣aaŋiññik niġrutit ikipkautausuuruat, aglaan ilaan auŋmiñik. Aasii auŋmiñik annakkumiñaqsiŋagaatigut isuitchuamun.

english: For if the blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a young cow sprinkled on those who are defiled consecrated them and provided ritual purity,
inupiaq: Qanuq taimani iñuk piḷuksiruaq salummaqtaugayuktuq God-im sivuġaani qivsaliktaukami niġrutit ikipkautausuuruat auŋiññik.

english: how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, purify our consciences from dead works to worship the living God.
inupiaq: Taamna tainnainŋakpan, qanutułhaaq auŋata Christ salummaqtigivagich ilitqutchisi tuqunaqtuaniñ piḷġutchiñiñ savautiyumiñaqsivḷugu God iñuuruaq. Christ, Ilitqusia iñuuruaq isuitchuamun, aitchuutigiŋaruq inmiñik tuqukami akuqtuġnaġumiñaqłuni God-mun.

english: And so he is the mediator of a new covenant, so that those who are called may receive the eternal inheritance he has promised, since he died to set them free from the violations committed under the first covenant.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigivlugu Christ atisipkaiñiaqtiġuŋaruq aitchuqłuta nutauruamik sivunniuġutaanik God-im, tamatkua ququaqtauruat aitchuusiaqaquvlugich isuitchuamik kiŋuvaaksramik God-im unniqsuqłiisaanik. Christ tuqukami tasuġumiñaqsiŋagai iñuich kamaksriŋitchuat God-im pitquraŋiñik sivulliġmi sivunniuġunmi.

english: For where there is a will, the death of the one who made it must be proven.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa sivunniqpan aitchuutigisukługich suġauttani kiŋuvaannaktuksrautinun aasii tuquvluni, taavruma iñuum tuquniŋa nalupqinaigaksrauruq kiŋuvaannaktuksrautit suġauttannaŋaiñŋaisa.

english: For a will takes effect only at death, since it carries no force while the one who made it is alive.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuum sivunniuġutaa taŋŋiġumiñaqtuq tuquanikpan kisianik. Iñuuŋŋaan kialiqaa kiŋuvaannaktaaġiyumiñaitkai suġauttaŋi.

english: So even the first covenant was inaugurated with blood.
inupiaq: Taimñaunnii sivulliq sivunniuġun nalupqinaiqsauŋaruq auŋich niġrutit atuqługich.

english: For when Moses had spoken every command to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and goats with water and scarlet wool and hyssop and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
inupiaq: Qanuq Moses uqautigianiŋmagich pitqurapayaurat sivunniuġunmiittuat iluqaiññun iñuŋnun, ilaa tigusiŋaruq auŋiññik niġrutit ikipkautausuuruat, imiġmiglu, kavviġiksuamiglu imnaim mitquanik, piġuaqtiġunmiglu aasii qivsaliŋagai auŋmik makpiġaat, iluqaisalu iñuich,

english: and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that God has commanded you to keep.”
inupiaq: aasii Moses uqaŋaruq, “Uuma augum nalupqinaiġaa sivunniuġutaa God-im ilivsiññun.”

english: And both the tabernacle and all the utensils of worship he likewise sprinkled with blood.
inupiaq: Tainnatun suli ilaan qivsalgutigiŋagaa auk tupiġmullu aŋaiyyuviŋmun utkusipayaanullu allallu supayaurat atuġuukkaŋi aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaum aŋaiyyuniġmi.

english: Indeed according to the law almost everything was purified with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.
inupiaq: Tavrakii kamagivlugich pitqurat, iluqakavsaŋmi sunapayaaq ilaaguaġutiqaġaqtuq God-mun auŋmik, suli auk maqinŋaunnagu, God-im piḷuutit suliqutigiŋaiḷaitkai itqaumayumiñaiġḷugich.

english: So it was necessary for the sketches of the things in heaven to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly things themselves required better sacrifices than these.
inupiaq: Tavra tainnatun nunamiittuat sut aŋaiyyuliqiniġmi ilaaguagaksrausuuŋarut God-mun, niġrutim auŋanik piqutiqaġluni tuvrautiłhiñat qiḷaŋmiittuanun. Aglaan qiḷaŋmiittuat ilaaguagaksrauŋarut auŋanik Christ nakuułhaaqtuamik aitchuunmik tamatkunaŋŋa.

english: For Christ did not enter a sanctuary made with hands – the representation of the true sanctuary – but into heaven itself, and he appears now in God’s presence for us.
inupiaq: Qanuq Christ isianiŋaruq qiḷaŋmun sivuġaanun God-im uvagut pisivluta. Isiŋaitchuq inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtuamun savaaŋannun iñuich, tuvrautiłhiñauruamun qiḷaŋmiittuamun.

english: And he did not enter to offer himself again and again, the way the high priest enters the sanctuary year after year with blood that is not his own,
inupiaq: Naaggaunnii Christ aitchuutigitqigaġluni inmiñik piŋitchuq, aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiŋisun inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtuamun ukiutuaġman isiġuuruatun saagaqłuni auŋmik, ilaan augiŋisamiñik.

english: for then he would have had to suffer again and again since the foundation of the world. But now he has appeared once for all at the consummation of the ages to put away sin by his sacrifice.
inupiaq: Qanuq tainna Christ aitchuutigitqigaaġuugumi, nagliksaatqigaqtuksrauniaġaluaqtuq akulaitchuami nunaqaŋa savaagumman. Aglaan paŋmapak, isuani piviksram, Christ qaiŋaruq atausiaqłuni, piiġiaqługu piḷuun aitchuutigivluni inmiñik.

english: And just as people are appointed to die once, and then to face judgment,
inupiaq: Iñuich tuquruksrausuurut atautchimi, aasii taavruma aquagun isivġiqsaulutiŋ.

english: so also, after Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many, to those who eagerly await him he will appear a second time, not to bear sin but to bring salvation.
inupiaq: Tainnatulli Christ, tuqutauganiŋavluni atausiaqłuni piiġiaqługich piḷuutiŋich iñugiaktuat, niptatqigñiaġmiuq, piḷuun piiġiasuŋaġnagu aglaan annautiyaqtuġlugich niġiupiaqtuat inmiñik.

english: For the law possesses a shadow of the good things to come but not the reality itself, and is therefore completely unable, by the same sacrifices offered continually, year after year, to perfect those who come to worship.
inupiaq: Tavra pitqurat taġġauruatun isiññaŋarut sunun anniqsuutauyumaaqtuanun Christ qaġġisiniakkaŋiñun. Pitqurat aitchuiḷaiñŋarut tamatkuniŋa anniqsuusiaksranik. Taamna tainnainman pitqurat piḷuutaiqsiḷaiñŋarut tamatkuniŋa qalliḷaaqtuanik God-mun tamatkunuuna ikipkautitigun aitchuutausuuruatigun ukiutuaġman.

english: For otherwise would they not have ceased to be offered, since the worshipers would have been purified once for all and so have no further consciousness of sin?
inupiaq: Ikipkautit piḷuutaiqsiḷḷapiaqpata aġiunayaqtut pitqigaŋaiġḷugich. Aŋaiyyurauruat atausiaġlugu taimuŋa piḷuutaiqsaullakpata, tavraŋŋaaglaan itqatqikkayaitkaich piḷuutit.

english: But in those sacrifices there is a reminder of sins year after year.
inupiaq: Tavraaglaan tamatkua ikipkaisit aitchuutauruat ukiutuaġman itqaqtirrutauraqtut piḷuusiqirautilaaŋannun iñuich.

english: For the blood of bulls and goats cannot take away sins.
inupiaq: Qanuq auŋich ikipkautausuuruat niġrutit piḷuutaiġutauyumiñaitchut.

english: So when he came into the world, he said,
inupiaq: Tainnainniġmata, Christ nunamukami, ilaa uqallaŋaruq God-mun,

english: “Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but a body you prepared for me.
inupiaq: Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpapayaaq nunamiittuaq makitasuuruq uvlutuaġman savaaġiramiñi, aitchuigaluamiiqł̣uni taapkuniŋasuŋaiññaq ikipkautinik, piḷuutaiġutauyumiñaitchuanik.

english: “Whole burnt offerings and sin-offerings you took no delight in.
inupiaq: Tavrali Christ aitchuiganikami ikipkaunmik piḷuutinun atautchimi taimuŋa, ilaa aquvinŋaruq God-im taliqpiata tuŋaanun,

english: “Then I said, ‘Here I am: I have come – it is written of me in the scroll of the book – to do your will, O God.’”
inupiaq: tavrani utaqqisaqłuni akiiḷitchiaġilugich uumigirini.

english: When he says above, “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sin-offerings you did not desire nor did you take delight in them” (which are offered according to the law),
inupiaq: Qanuq atausiaqsiññaqłuni aitchuivḷuni ilaan piḷuutaiŋagai taimuŋa tamatkua ilaaguaqtauruat God-mun.

english: then he says, “Here I am: I have come to do your will.” He does away with the first to establish the second.
inupiaq: Taamna Ilitqusiġiksuam nalupqinaiŋagaa uvaptiŋnun, uqallakłuni inna,

english: By his will we have been made holy through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
inupiaq: Tavraasii aniqatiit, attaqsrautairrutiqaqtugut isiġumiñaqłuta inimun ilaaguaqtaułhamaaqtauruamun God-mun auŋagun Jesus,

english: And every priest stands day after day serving and offering the same sacrifices again and again – sacrifices that can never take away sins.
inupiaq: ilaan aŋmautiŋagaatigut nutauruamik apqunmik qalliḷaaġviksraptiŋnik God-mun aasii iñuuluta isuitchuamun. Aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaich qaukłiatun qalliḷaaqtuatun God-mun amuŋatchianun talukiyaam, uvaguttauq qalliḷaaġumiñaġmigikput God timaagun Jesus, aitchuutigikkaŋagun tuquvluni.

english: But when this priest had offered one sacrifice for sins for all time, he sat down at the right hand of God,
inupiaq: Suli kamanaqtuamik aŋaiyyuliqsiqpaqaqtugut atanġuruamik God-im igluqatiŋiñun.

english: where he is now waiting until his enemies are made a footstool for his feet.
inupiaq: Taapkua tainnainniġmata, qalliḷaaqta God-mun iḷumutuuqtuamik uummatiqaġluta ukpiġutiqaġlutalu nalupqisuŋipiaqtuamik, isumaaluutaiġḷuta piḷuutiptiŋnik, suli salummaqtaupiaġluta piḷuutiptiŋniñ.

english: For by one offering he has perfected for all time those who are made holy.
inupiaq: Nalupqisuŋipiaqta qanuġliqaaŋaiġḷutalu uqautigiguptigu ukpiġikkaqput, qanuq God unniqsuqłiiŋaruaq ukpiġnapiaqtuq.

english: And the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us, for after saying,
inupiaq: Suli isumalaaġutigilakput qanuġluta qapiŋaisaaġutisugluta avanmun piviuttaqqutiniġmun piḷġusiġiksuanullu.

english: “This is the covenant that I will establish with them after those days, says the Lord. I will put my laws on their hearts and I will inscribe them on their minds,”
inupiaq: Katitqataqta piŋitqataaŋaiġḷuta atautchimun, piḷġusiġiliutikkaŋatitun iḷaŋisa iñuich iḷisimalugu Atanġum uvlua qallisaiññaqtuaq.

english: then he says, “Their sins and their lawless deeds I will remember no longer.”
inupiaq: Qanuq piḷuusiqiugaaġupta pisaaġiugaġluta kaŋiqsiŋaqqaaġlugu iḷumun ittuaq, ikipkautiksravsaamik allamik piitchuq piḷuutiptiŋnun piiġutiksramik.

english: Now where there is forgiveness of these, there is no longer any offering for sin.
inupiaq: Aglaan imma ittuq sivuuġanaqtuaq niġiugiraksraqput isivġiqsauviksraun, suli suamaruaq igniq suksraunġiiñiaqtuaq uumigiriŋiññik God-im.

english: Therefore, brothers and sisters, since we have confidence to enter the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus,
inupiaq: Iñuk kamaksriŋitchuaq Moses pitquraŋiñik tuqutaugayuŋaruq nagligiriqayuitchuq, uqaġiriqaġman malġuŋnik piŋasuniglu iḷisimaruanik piḷuusiqimman.

english: by the fresh and living way that he inaugurated for us through the curtain, that is, through his flesh,
inupiaq: Qanutun suaŋałhaaqtuamik tatavsagaksrauruq iñuk tununniktuaq God-im Iġñiŋanik, anniqsuutauŋiññivḷugu Christ tuqqutaa ilaan ilaaguaqtirrusiani God-mun, aasii pisaaŋavlugu Ilitqusiġiksuaq nagliktuutiqpaqaqtuaq inmiñun.

english: and since we have a great priest over the house of God,
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷisimagikput kiutilaaŋa uqallaŋaruaq, “Nalaunŋaruamik uvaŋa piñiaqtuŋa. Uvaŋa akisaurriñiaqtuŋa.” Suli uqallavsaaŋaruq, “Uvaŋa Atanġuruaŋaa isivġiġñiaġitka iñutka.”

english: let us draw near with a sincere heart in the assurance that faith brings, because we have had our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed in pure water.
inupiaq: Sivuuġanaqtuq tatavsaqtitchumiñaqsiruni God-mun iñuuruamun.

english: And let us hold unwaveringly to the hope that we confess, for the one who made the promise is trustworthy.
inupiaq: Tavra itqaqsigik sivulliich taipkua uvluġiŋarasi ukpiqqaaqavsi, igḷutuŋagisi nagliksaaġutiqpaich akiiḷipkaġaluaġnasi.

english: And let us take thought of how to spur one another on to love and good works,
inupiaq: Iḷaanniusi piaqłuktaqsiġuuŋarusi iłuiḷḷiuqtitausuurusiḷu iñuich takkuanni. Iḷaannisuli piqatausałhiñaaġuqłusi tainna aŋalatauruanun.

english: not abandoning our own meetings, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging each other, and even more so because you see the day drawing near.
inupiaq: Qanuq naglikkutiqaġuuŋarusiḷu tigutaaqtauruanun, suli sugilaitkiksi aqsaktauniq suġauttavsiññik, akuqtuqsimaaqługu suġaliqaqtilaaqsi nuŋuyumaaŋitchuanik qiḷaŋmi.

english: For if we deliberately keep on sinning after receiving the knowledge of the truth, no further sacrifice for sins is left for us,
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu attaqsraŋirrutiqaġitchisuli Ataniġmun, kamanaqtuamik akiḷiusiaqaġniaqtusi.

english: but only a certain fearful expectation of judgment and a fury of fire that will consume God’s enemies.
inupiaq: Aglaan manimmiḷgutiqaqtuksraurusi nalautchiyumiñaġuglusi pisuutaanik God-im aasii aitchuusiaqaġlusi ilaan unniqsuqłiisaanik iñuggunmik isuitchuamik.

english: Someone who rejected the law of Moses was put to death without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
inupiaq: Qanuq Bible uqaluqaqtut inna,

english: How much greater punishment do you think that person deserves who has contempt for the Son of God, and profanes the blood of the covenant that made him holy, and insults the Spirit of grace?
For we know the one who said, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay,” and again, “The Lord will judge his people.”
It is a terrifying thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
But remember the former days when you endured a harsh conflict of suffering after you were enlightened.
At times you were publicly exposed to abuse and afflictions, and at other times you came to share with others who were treated in that way.
For in fact you shared the sufferings of those in prison, and you accepted the confiscation of your belongings with joy, because you knew that you certainly had a better and lasting possession.
So do not throw away your confidence, because it has great reward.
For you need endurance in order to do God’s will and so receive what is promised.
For just a little longer and he who is coming will arrive and not delay.
But my righteous one will live by faith, and if he shrinks back, I take no pleasure in him.
But we are not among those who shrink back and thus perish, but are among those who have faith and preserve their souls.
Now faith is being sure of what we hope for, being convinced of what we do not see.
inupiaq: Iñuk ukpiġutiqaqtuaq nalupqisuŋitchuq God-im unniqsuqłiisiŋi taŋŋiġñiaqtilaaŋannik. Suli ukpiġutaata nalupqisuŋisitkaa sut ilitqutchikun ittuat iḷumun itilaaŋannik.

english: For by it the people of old received God’s commendation.
inupiaq: Qanuq taipkua iñuich taimani ukpiġutiqaġmata, God-im iviġaummatigiŋagai.

english: By faith we understand that the worlds were set in order at God’s command, so that the visible has its origin in the invisible.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuta kaŋiqsigikput God-im uqaluŋmigun nunamik savaŋatilaaŋa, tamatkua sut tautugnaqtuat savaaguŋatilaaŋannik suniñ salapqiŋitchuaniñ.

english: By faith Abel offered God a greater sacrifice than Cain, and through his faith he was commended as righteous, because God commended him for his offerings. And through his faith he still speaks, though he is dead.
inupiaq: Abel ukpiġutiqaqłuni God-mun aitchuiŋaruq akuqtuġnałhaaqtuamik ikipkaunmik Cain-miñ, taavrumuuna ilaa iviġaumakkusiaqaŋaruq nalaunŋarualirauvluni. God-im nalunaiŋagaa iviġaumatilaani akuqtuqługich aitchuutiŋi. Abel tuquŋagaluaqtuq, ukpiġutaaniñ iḷitchiyumiñaqtugut suli.

english: By faith Enoch was taken up so that he did not see death, and he was not to be found because God took him up. For before his removal he had been commended as having pleased God.
inupiaq: Enoch ukpiġutiqaqłuni mayuurrauŋaruq qiḷaŋmun tuqugaluaqtinnagu, aasii paqinnaiñŋaruq, qanuq God-im qiḷaŋmuutiŋagaa. Aasii mayuurrauŋaiñŋaan, God-im nalunaiŋagaa Enoch iviġaumagitilaaŋanik.

english: Now without faith it is impossible to please him, for the one who approaches God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
inupiaq: Tavra kialiqaa ukpiġutaitchuam iviġagumiñaipiaġaa God. Qanuq kiñaliqaa qaisuktuaq God-mun ukpiqtuksraupiaqtuq God-iqaġniḷugu, suli paqitillaniḷugu tamatkunuŋa ivaqłiapiaqtuanun inmiñik.

english: By faith Noah, when he was warned about things not yet seen, with reverent regard constructed an ark for the deliverance of his family. Through faith he condemned the world and became an heir of the righteousness that comes by faith.
inupiaq: Noah-m ukpiġiŋagaa God uqallautimmani suna piñiaqtilaaŋanik. Tautuŋaitkaluaŋŋaan uliqpaktuksraq, arguaginiḷugu God, umiaqpiŋaruq annautisukługich igluqatini. Umiaqpivḷuni salapqiŋagaa ukpiġutairrutaat nunam iñuŋisa aasii suksraunġiqsauŋarut. Pisigivlugu Noah-m ukpiġutaa God-im akuqtuŋagaa.

english: By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out to a place he would later receive as an inheritance, and he went out without understanding where he was going.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuni, Abraham kamaksriŋaruq God-im ququaġmani aullaquvlugu nunamun aitchuusiaġiyumaakkaġmiñun kiŋuvaaġitqulugu. Tavra aullaŋaruq, nalullaġmi sumun aullaġniaqtilaamiñik.

english: By faith he lived as a foreigner in the promised land as though it were a foreign country, living in tents with Isaac and Jacob, who were fellow heirs of the same promise.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuni tuyuġmiaġuŋaruq nunami God-im unniqsuqłiisaani inmiŋnun, tupiqtuqłutiŋ allami nunami inmatun. Tainnatuttauq Isaac-lu Jacob-lu tupiqtuŋammiuk kiŋuvaannaktaaksraunmiŋni taavrumani nunami unniqsuqłiisauruami.

english: For he was looking forward to the city with firm foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
inupiaq: Qanuq Abraham niġiugaqaŋaruq iniqpaŋmik nuktaŋitchuamik iñuuviksramiñik, God-im payaŋaiqł̣ugu nappakkaŋanik ilaan isumamigun.

english: By faith, even though Sarah herself was barren and he was too old, he received the ability to procreate, because he regarded the one who had given the promise to be trustworthy.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuni, Sarah aaquaŋagaluallaġmi siŋaiyaupkaqtauŋaruq, qanuq ukpiġiŋagaa piḷḷaruaguvlugu God unniqsuqłiiŋaruaq.

english: So in fact children were fathered by one man – and this one as good as dead – like the number of stars in the sky and like the innumerable grains of sand on the seashore.
inupiaq: Tavraasii Abraham-miñ, iñuŋmiñ atautchimiñ tuquŋaruatun iḷiŋaruamiñ, aniŋarut kiŋuniġiich iñugiaktigiliqł̣utiŋ uvluġiaŋisun qiḷaum, kisiññaisigiruatullu qaviaŋatun taġium siñaata.

english: These all died in faith without receiving the things promised, but they saw them in the distance and welcomed them and acknowledged that they were strangers and foreigners on the earth.
inupiaq: Tamatkua iluqaġmiŋ tuquŋarut ukpiġutiqaqłutiŋ aitchuusiaġigaluaġnagich unniqsuqłiisauruat, aglaan iḷisimavlutiŋ taŋŋiġñiaqtilaaŋannik quviatchaktitauŋarut. Piiḷaaġiŋaitkaat iglaagutilaaqtiŋ tuyuġmiagutilaaqtiglu nunami.

english: For those who speak in such a way make it clear that they are seeking a homeland.
inupiaq: Iñuich tainna uqaqtuat nalupqinaiġaat niġiuktilaaqtiŋ aimaaġviksramik qiḷaŋmi.

english: In fact, if they had been thinking of the land that they had left, they would have had opportunity to return.
inupiaq: Isumagiŋagumirruŋ taimña nuna qimakkaqtiŋ, utiġumiñaŋagaluaqtut pisukkumiŋ.

english: But as it is, they aspire to a better land, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore, God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.
inupiaq: Aglaan iliŋich kipiġniuŋarut iñuusukłutiŋ nakuułhaaqtuami aimaaġviŋmi, qiḷaŋmiittuami. Taamna pisigivlugu God-im kanŋusuutigiŋitkaa tairaugumi ilaisa God-iŋannik, aasii itqanaiyautiŋagai iniqpaŋmik.

english: By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac. He had received the promises, yet he was ready to offer up his only son.
inupiaq: Abraham uuktuaqtaukami ukpiġutiqaqłuni kamagiŋagaa God, aasii aitchuutigivlugu Isaac ikipkautiksrauvlugu. Taamna aitchuusiaqaŋaruaq unniqsuqłiiñmik iñugiaktuanik kiŋuniksranik itqanaiñŋaruq aitchuutigisukługuunnii iġñitualuni,

english: God had told him, “Through Isaac descendants will carry on your name,”
inupiaq: unniqsuqłiiŋagaluaqtillugu God inna, Isaac-kuaġlutiŋ kiŋuniqtin iñukpalliġñiaqtut.

english: and he reasoned that God could even raise him from the dead, and in a sense he received him back from there.
inupiaq: Abraham nalupqigiŋaitkaa God aŋipkaiyumiñaqtilaaŋanik Isaac-mik tuqqunmiñ. Tavra tainna pimman, iġñini aitchuusiaġitqiŋagaa iñuuvlugu, tuquŋaruatun iḷigaluaqtuaq.

english: By faith also Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning the future.
inupiaq: Isaac ukpiġutiqaqłuni uqallaŋaruq iġñagmiñun Jacob-mullu Esau-mullu God-mun aitchuutiginiaġnivḷugich quviasaaġusiat piyumaaqtuat.

english: By faith Jacob, as he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph and worshiped as he leaned on his staff.
inupiaq: Jacob tuquaqsikami, ukpiġutiqaqłuni uqallautiŋagik atausiullaavlugik iġñiŋik Joseph piḷḷuatausiaqaquvlugik, sikimmivḷuni aŋaiyyuŋaruq ayauppiaqsimaaqłuni.

english: By faith Joseph, at the end of his life, mentioned the exodus of the sons of Israel and gave instructions about his burial.
inupiaq: Joseph, tuquyasikami, ukpiġutiqaqłuni uqallausiġiŋagaa aullaġniksrautaat Israel-guruat Egypt-miñ. Aasii nalupqigiŋił̣ł̣ugu aullaġniaqtilaaŋat, piraksriiŋaruq aullatitquvlugu iḷuviñi.

english: By faith, when Moses was born, his parents hid him for three months, because they saw the child was beautiful and they were not afraid of the king’s edict.
inupiaq: Moses animman aŋayuqaak ukpiġutiqaqłutik, iriqsimaŋagaak tatqiñi piŋasuni. Tautukamitku miqłiqtułhiñauŋitpalliġman, sivuuġagiŋaitkaak kamaksriŋiññiksraq umialgum pitqurriutaanik aŋugaurat tuqutquvlugich.

english: By faith, when he grew up, Moses refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,
inupiaq: Moses ukpiġutiqaqłuni God-mun aŋutiġuanikami, iñuusuŋiñŋaruq iġñiġuluni Pharoah-m panianun,

english: choosing rather to be ill-treated with the people of God than to enjoy sin’s fleeting pleasure.
inupiaq: tigusiaġiłhaaqługu pigiitchuakun aŋalatauniq piqatigilugich God-im iñuŋi aliasuŋisaaġutiqallagniġmiñ piḷuutinik piiġaqtuanik.

english: He regarded abuse suffered for Christ to be greater wealth than the treasures of Egypt, for his eyes were fixed on the reward.
inupiaq: Ilaa nagliksaaŋaruq pimaqłuktausiaqaqłuni piqatigivlugich iñuŋi God-im, nagliksaaġmatun Christ pisigivlugu. Aasii isummatigiŋagaa nagliksaaġniq anniqsuutaułhaaqługu suġaliŋiñiñ Egypt, qanuq ilaa ukpipiaŋaruq God-mun akiḷiġñiaġnivḷuni.

english: By faith he left Egypt without fearing the king’s anger, for he persevered as though he could see the one who is invisible.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuni Moses qimaŋagaa Egypt, iqsigiŋaiqł̣ugu qinnautaa umialgum qanuq sivunmuuŋaruq iñuktun tautuaġiruatun God-mik tautugnaitchuamik.

english: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of the blood, so that the one who destroyed the firstborn would not touch them.
inupiaq: Moses ukpiġiŋagaa God uqallautimmani piraksriqł̣ugich iñuich imnaiyaam auŋanik qivsaliquvlugich upkuat avatiŋich, God-im isaġulganun tuqqutauruamun tuqutquŋił̣ł̣ugich aŋayukłich miqłiqtuŋich, miqłiqtuŋisun tuqutauruatun Egypt-miut.

english: By faith they crossed the Red Sea as if on dry ground, but when the Egyptians tried it, they were swallowed up.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłutiŋ Israel-guruat ikaaŋagaat taġiuq atiqaqtuaq Red Sea-mik, pisuaqłutiŋ paliumaruakun nunakuaġmatun. Aglaalli Egypt-miut, tainnatun pisaġaluaqamiŋ ipigiññaŋarut.

english: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after the people marched around them for seven days.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutaatigun Israel-guruat katchiġruaŋi Jericho-m ulġupkaqtauŋarut kaivaluqqaaqługich tallimat malġugni uvluni.

english: By faith Rahab the prostitute escaped the destruction of the disobedient, because she welcomed the spies in peace.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłuni, Rahab allatuqti tuqutauŋaitchuq iñuich piqatigilugich tuqummata iñuuruat Jericho-mi ukpiġiŋił̣ł̣ugu God, ilaan iḷammiuġutikun paġlaŋavlugich nalunaqtuakun takuuqtit.

english: And what more shall I say? For time will fail me if I tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, of David and Samuel and the prophets.
inupiaq: Uqautivsaaġumiñaġaluaġivsi iñuktigun ukpiġutiqaqtuatigun. Sivisuvaitchuq quliaqtuaġisaġupkich Gideon-lu Barak-lu Samson-lu Jephthah-lu David-lu Samuel-lu uqaqtiŋiḷu God-im.

english: Through faith they conquered kingdoms, administered justice, gained what was promised, shut the mouths of lions,
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłutiŋ akimaŋarut umialgutiniñ, piŋarut nalaunŋaruanik pitqiksiġautairrunmiglu, akuqtuiŋarut God-im unniqsuqłiisiŋiñik, annaurrauŋarut lion-niñ,

english: quenched raging fire, escaped the edge of the sword, gained strength in weakness, became mighty in battle, put foreign armies to flight,
inupiaq: ikiŋaitkai ikualaqpaktuam igniġum, allattauq annaŋarut savikpakun tuqutauniksramiñ, allattauq suaŋŋatinnaŋarut suaŋaiḷikamiŋ, iḷaŋitchauq sapiġñaqsiŋarut aŋuyakamiŋ, aasii pigruqtitchiŋarut allat nunat aŋuyaktiŋiññik.

english: and women received back their dead raised to life. But others were tortured, not accepting release, to obtain resurrection to a better life.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłutiŋ, aġnat aitchuusiaqaŋarut tuquriamiŋnik aŋipkaqtauvlugich. Iñuich iḷaŋich anniġñapiaġataqtuakun nagliksaaqtitauŋarut, pisuŋiñŋagaat tigutaaqtauŋaiḷḷaŋniksraq, aŋisukłutiŋ nakuułhaaqtuamun iñuggunmun.

english: And others experienced mocking and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment.
inupiaq: Allattauq nagliksautigiŋagaat kipakkusiaq ipiġaqtuqsiġñiġlu, qiḷiqsruivḷugiḷḷu tigutaaqtauvlutiglu.

english: They were stoned, sawed apart, murdered with the sword; they went about in sheepskins and goatskins; they were destitute, afflicted, ill-treated
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaqłutiŋ uyaġaŋnik miḷḷuuqtauŋarut, uluaqtuqtauŋarullu malġuułługich, uuktuqtauŋarut, tuqutauŋarut savikpaŋnik, kukiḷuŋarut annuġaaqaqłutiŋ niġrutit amiŋiññik piiḷḷiuqłutiŋ, iłuiḷḷiuqtitauvlutiŋ, anniaqtauvlutiglu.

english: (the world was not worthy of them); they wandered in deserts and mountains and caves and openings in the earth.
inupiaq: Maliqataqsiŋarut nunagluktuakun iġġisigullu iriqtuqłutiŋ qaiġusuŋiñiḷu nunam. Iliŋich nunam iñuŋisa naligiŋitkaich.

english: And these all were commended for their faith, yet they did not receive what was promised.
inupiaq: Aasii taipkua iluqaġmiŋ ukpiqtuaguvlutiŋ, iviġaumanaġaluaqtuat God-mun aitchuusiaġiŋaitkaat God-im unniqsuqłiisaa,

english: For God had provided something better for us, so that they would be made perfect together with us.
inupiaq: qanuq God sivunniŋaruq nakuułhaaqtuamik uvaptiŋnun. Taipkua utaqqiruksrauŋarut uvaptiŋnik piqatigiyumiñaqsitchiaġiluta God-im unniqsuqłiisaanik.

english: Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, we must get rid of every weight and the sin that clings so closely, and run with endurance the race set out for us,
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ taipkua ukpiġutiqaqtuat qiñiqtuaqtuatun iñugiakłutiŋ ittut aqpaliurraqtuanik, uvagullu aqpaliurraqtuaguruatun. Tavraasii, asivaġlavut iluqaisa piñaiḷutapayaat nakuuŋitchuat, piḷuutipayaallu ayuġnaitchuat qaniłłutiŋ, aasii tikitqaurraqta piyumalaaġluta God-im pitqutaagun uvaptiŋnun,

english: keeping our eyes fixed on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of our faith. For the joy set out for him he endured the cross, disregarding its shame, and has taken his seat at the right hand of the throne of God.
inupiaq: qiñiġlugu Jesus aullaqisaaguruaq naamasiriŋalu ukpiġutipta. Pisigivlugu quviasuun akiḷiusiaksrani, igḷutuŋagaa tuqqun aŋarraurami, sugiŋaiqł̣ugu kanŋusaaġun, aasii aquvititauŋaruq taliqpiata tuŋaanun God-im qiḷaŋmi.

english: Think of him who endured such opposition against himself by sinners, so that you may not grow weary in your souls and give up.
inupiaq: Isumalaaġutigisiuŋ Jesus. Igḷutuiŋaruq qanutupayauraq piaqłuktautinik piḷuusiqiriniñ, tainnatulli ilivsi piyuaqsiġuvsi piḷaiŋitchumausi qapiŋasiŋiḷḷusiḷu.

english: You have not yet resisted to the point of bloodshed in your struggle against sin.
inupiaq: Qanuq ilivsi aŋuyaŋaitchusi piḷuunmik maqitchisałhiñaaġuġlusi auvsiññik.

english: And have you forgotten the exhortation addressed to you as sons?
inupiaq: Piiguŋasugnaqtusi God-im uqaluanik tuqłuutiqaqtuamik ilivsiññun iġñinik,

english: “My son, do not scorn the Lord’s discipline
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu, qapiŋaimmaġiksaaġitchi ukpiqsimaaġlusiḷu tatavsaqtaukavsi.

english: or give up when he corrects you.
inupiaq: Iñuutchisi sivukkiruatun qaiqsuatullu apqutitun illich, suaŋaił̣haaqtuat ukpiqtuat maliġuutiyumaut puukaġaluaġnatiŋ, aasii suaŋasiḷaaqtaulutiŋ.

english: “For the Lord disciplines the one he loves and chastises every son he accepts.”
inupiaq: Iñupayaanun aŋuyautairrutiqaġitchi, ilaaguaqtaulusiḷu God-mun. Taapkuak piiḷḷugik, kialiqaa tautukkumiñaitkaa Ataniq.

english: Endure your suffering as discipline; God is treating you as sons. For what son is there that a father does not discipline?
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi iluqasi iñuusuglusi God-im ikayuutaagun. Iluqasi killuqsrautaittitchi, qanuq salapqiġman killuqsraun isumaalluksautausuuruq, aasii iñugiaktuat piḷuksipkaqługich.

english: But if you do not experience discipline, something all sons have shared in, then you are illegitimate and are not sons.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa allatuqtauŋiḷḷi naagga qaunakłaanġiġḷuni piññani God-mik Esau-tun, tunisiŋaruatun kiŋuvaannaktaaksrautikkaluamiñik atautchimi niġiñiġmun.

english: Besides, we have experienced discipline from our earthly fathers and we respected them; shall we not submit ourselves all the more to the Father of spirits and receive life?
inupiaq: Qanuq iḷisimarusi aquvatigun, ilaa kipiġniutchakkaluaqami piññaktaaġisukługu kiŋuvaannaktaaksrautikkaluani, ilaa itigaurraŋaruq. Tasuqsaagaluaqamiuŋ qulvivḷuni, kiŋuġautchiŋaruq isumalitqigñiksramun.

english: For they disciplined us for a little while as seemed good to them, but he does so for our benefit, that we may share his holiness.
inupiaq: Ilivsi qaiŋaitchusi iġġimun Moses aitchuusiaqaġvianun pitquranik, igniġmun ikualaruamun, taaqtuamullu, qaummaavyuktuamullu, anuġiqpaktuamullu,

english: Now all discipline seems painful at the time, not joyful. But later it produces the fruit of peace and righteousness for those trained by it.
inupiaq: nipauqłuktautivlu nipaanun nipimullu uqaluqaqtuamun. Iñuich tusaaruat iqsitchakpaił̣ł̣utiŋ qiññuaqtuŋarut uqautiŋaiquvlutiŋ.

english: Therefore, strengthen your listless hands and your weak knees,
inupiaq: Qanuq iliŋisa iqsitchautigiŋagaat piraksriun aitchuutauruaq inmiŋnun inna, “Iñuich unnii niġrutimunniiḷu aksiukpagu iġġiq, uyaġaŋnik miḷḷuuqtauniaqtuq.”

english: and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be put out of joint but be healed.
inupiaq: Qanutun tatamaanaqtigiŋaruq tautukkaŋat Moses uqallallasimman, “Iqsitchakłuŋa uuliksiŋaruŋa.”

english: Pursue peace with everyone, and holiness, for without it no one will see the Lord.
inupiaq: Aglaan qaiŋarusi Iġġianun Zion iniqpaŋanun iñuuruam God-im, Jerusalem-mun qiḷaŋmiittuamun, isaġuliŋnullu kisiññaġumiñaitchuanun quviasukłutiŋ kasimaruat,

english: See to it that no one comes short of the grace of God, that no one be like a bitter root springing up and causing trouble, and through him many become defiled.
inupiaq: kasimaniŋannullu kamanaqtuat atiŋich aglausimaruat qiḷaŋmi, God-mullu isivġiqsauruamun iluqaiññun, ilitqusiŋiññullu nalaunŋaruat iñuich naamasipkaqtauŋarut.

english: And see to it that no one becomes an immoral or godless person like Esau, who sold his own birthright for a single meal.
inupiaq: Qaiŋammiusi Jesus-mun, atisipkaiñiaqtauruamun, aitchuqłuta God-im nutauruamik sivunniuġutaanik. Nalupqinaiŋagaa God-im sivunniuġutaa maqipkaqługu auni, iḷisaurriruaq iłuałhaaqtuanik uvaptiŋnun Abel auŋaniñ.

english: For you know that later when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, for he found no opportunity for repentance, although he sought the blessing with tears.
inupiaq: Qaunagisitchi kamagisuglugu God uqaqtuaq. Qanuq taipkua kamaksriŋitchuat Moses-mik tatavsaqtauŋarut, uvagut tatavsaqtaułhaaġniaqtugut kamagisuŋitkuptigu God.

english: For you have not come to something that can be touched, to a burning fire and darkness and gloom and a whirlwind
inupiaq: Ilaan nipiłhiñaŋata taimani aulayyaŋagaa nuna, paŋmapak-aasii ilaa unniqsuqłiiŋaruq, “Atausivsaami aulayyaksiññaġniaŋitkiga nuna aglaan qiḷaglu.”

english: and the blast of a trumpet and a voice uttering words such that those who heard begged to hear no more.
inupiaq: Taamna uqallaun, “Atausivsaamiiġun,” sivuniqaqtuq sut aŋalayyaktauyumiñaqtuat piiqsauniaqtut, qanuq savaaguŋarut. Sut aulayyaktauyumiñaitchuat itchumaaqtut isuitchuamun.

english: For they could not bear what was commanded: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned.”
inupiaq: Aitchuusiaqaqapta umialgunmik aulayyaktauyumiñaitchuamik, quyyatiqaqta suli savautilluataġlakput God qiksigipiaġataġlugu,

english: In fact, the scene was so terrifying that Moses said, “I shudder with fear.”
inupiaq: qanuq God-ikput ikinnillaruatun igniqtun ittuq.

english: But you have come to Mount Zion, the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to myriads of angels, to the assembly
and congregation of the firstborn, who are enrolled in heaven, and to God, the judge of all, and to the spirits of the righteous, who have been made perfect,
and to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks of something better than Abel’s does.
Take care not to refuse the one who is speaking! For if they did not escape when they refused the one who warned them on earth, how much less shall we, if we reject the one who warns from heaven?
Then his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, “I will once more shake not only the earth but heaven too.”
Now this phrase “once more” indicates the removal of what is shaken, that is, of created things, so that what is unshaken may remain.
So since we are receiving an unshakable kingdom, let us give thanks, and through this let us offer worship pleasing to God in devotion and awe.
For our God is indeed a devouring fire.
From James, a slave of God and the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes dispersed abroad. Greetings!
inupiaq: James, kivgaŋa God-im Atanġuvlu Jesus Christ, tuyuqtuq paġlatinik iluqaiññun God-im iñuŋiñun siaminŋaruanun iluqaani nunami.

english: My brothers and sisters, consider it nothing but joy when you fall into all sorts of trials,
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, quviasupiaġitchi uuktuaqtaukavsi allakaaġiiñik uuktuaġutinik,

english: because you know that the testing of your faith produces endurance.
inupiaq: qanuq iḷisimarusi uuktuaġusiaŋa ukpiġutivsi tuniqsiḷiġutigigiksi.

english: And let endurance have its perfect effect, so that you will be perfect and complete, not deficient in anything.
inupiaq: Aasii tuniqsimatuiññaġitchi supayaami, ataramik piḷusi God-im piḷġusiġitqukkaŋiñik iluqaiññik, ataramik iñuusiqaġumausi iviġaumasuglugu God, sunik piŋaiġḷusi iviġaumanaitchuanik ilaanun.

english: But if anyone is deficient in wisdom, he should ask God, who gives to all generously and without reprimand, and it will be given to him.
inupiaq: Kiñapayaaq isumattutaiḷḷiuġumi, qiññuaġli God-miñ aasii isumattutiksriññiaġaa. Qanuq God aitchuiḷḷaruq iñupayaanun nauttaasuŋaġnani, qiññuaġniġaqłilaitchuġlu.

english: But he must ask in faith without doubting, for the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed around by the wind.
inupiaq: Aglaan apiqsriḷi ukpiġutiqaġluni, nalupqisuutaiḷḷuni suuramikunnii, qanuq iñuk nalupqisuktuaq ittuq qaiḷḷiŋatun taġium uŋugrugikkaŋatun nalluakkaŋatullu anuġim.

english: For that person must not suppose that he will receive anything from the Lord,
inupiaq: Iñuk tainnaittuaq isumanani aitchuusiaqaġniaġasugaluni supayaamik Ataniġmiñ.

english: since he is a double-minded individual, unstable in all his ways.
inupiaq: Qanuq malġuutchiŋaruamik isumalik tuniqsimaruaguŋitchuq suraġaġnipayaamiñi.

english: Now the believer of humble means should take pride in his high position.
inupiaq: Aniqan iḷiappauruaq mattumani nunami quviasuktuksrauruq God-im kamanaqsipkaġmani,

english: But the rich person’s pride should be in his humiliation, because he will pass away like a wildflower in the meadow.
inupiaq: tainnatun suli suġalliruaq aniqan God-im kamanaiqsinmani, qanuq ukpiqtuat atirut God-mun. Suġalliruaq nautchiatun tuquliruatun piñiaqtuq.

english: For the sun rises with its heat and dries up the meadow; the petal of the flower falls off and its beauty is lost forever. So also the rich person in the midst of his pursuits will wither away.
inupiaq: Qanuq siqiñiq nuimman pasiŋñaqtuam uunnaŋata panaqłukkai ivgich nautchiallu, aasii nautchiat katakłutiŋ, qiñiyunaiqł̣utiglu, tainnatun suġalliruaq tuquliñiaqtuq piḷġutchimiñi.

english: Happy is the one who endures testing, because when he has proven to be genuine, he will receive the crown of life that God promised to those who love him.
inupiaq: Quviasugli iñuk igḷutuiruaq uuktuaġusiamik, qanuq igḷutuanikkumiuŋ uuktuaġusiaq, aitchuusiaqaġniaqtuq isuitchuamik iñuggunmik, God-im unniqsuqłiisaanik akiḷiutiginiaġnivḷugu tamatkunuŋa piviuttaġirimiñun.

english: Let no one say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God cannot be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.
inupiaq: Kiñapayaaq ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtaukami uqallaŋnani, Ikł̣igutchaktinniaġaaŋa God-im. Qanuq God ikł̣igutchaktitauyumiñaitchuq piḷuktuamun, suli ikł̣igutchaktitchiñialaitchuq kimigliqaa iñuŋmik.

english: But each one is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desires.
inupiaq: Aglaan uvva iñullaa ikł̣igutchaktinniaqtauraqtuq kaviuġuksaaqtaukami, inataukamiḷu kipiġniuġunmiñun.

english: Then when desire conceives, it gives birth to sin, and when sin is full grown, it gives birth to death.
inupiaq: Aasii ilaan kipiġniuġunmi pigiitchuat payarimmanni piḷuusiqisuuruq, aasii iñuk piḷuutiŋisa suksraunġiqsaupkalġiñaġniaġaat.

english: Do not be led astray, my dear brothers and sisters.
inupiaq: Piviuttaġikkavsi aniqatiit, sagluqipkaġnasi.

english: All generous giving and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or the slightest hint of change.
inupiaq: Iluqaġmiŋ aitchuutigiksuat inuaŋaitchuallu aitchuutit paŋmaŋŋaqtaurut, qaisaŋi God-im savaŋaruam qaummatipayauranik. Ilaa allaŋŋulaitchuq inŋitchuġlu taġġaqtun allaŋŋuqtaqtuatun.

english: By his sovereign plan he gave us birth through the message of truth, that we would be a kind of firstfruits of all he created.
inupiaq: God-im pisuunmigun anitqiksinŋagaatigut uqaluagun iḷumun ittuam, uvagut iniqaqqaaquvluta savaapayauramiñiñ.

english: Understand this, my dear brothers and sisters! Let every person be quick to listen, slow to speak, slow to anger.
inupiaq: Piviuttaġikkavsii aniqatiit, iḷisimasiuŋ una. Iñupayaaq ataramik itqanaiḷḷi naalaġniñiġmun aglaan uqallayaiḷḷuni, qinnayaiḷḷuniḷu,

english: For human anger does not accomplish God’s righteousness.
inupiaq: qanuq iñuk qinnakami taŋŋiiḷaitchuq God-im nalaunŋatqutaanik.

english: So put away all filth and evil excess and humbly welcome the message implanted within you, which is able to save your souls.
inupiaq: Taamna pisigilugu iñuusiqaŋaiġitchi pigiitchuamik, piugaŋaiġḷugich God-im pigiiññiraŋi. Aglaan kamasaaŋaiġḷusi kamagisigik God-im uqaluŋi, ilaan iḷitchuġipkaŋakkaŋi ilivsiññun annaurrautquvlusi.

english: But be sure you live out the message and do not merely listen to it and so deceive yourselves.
inupiaq: Uqalua God-im kamagisiuŋ. Naalaġnigiññaġuvsiuŋ uqaluk, sagluqirusi ilivsiññik.

english: For if someone merely listens to the message and does not live it out, he is like someone who gazes at his own face in a mirror.
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñapayaaq naalaġniraugiññaqtuaq uqaluŋmun kamagigaluaġnagu, iñuktun ittuq taġġaqtuqtuatun kiiññamiñik.

english: For he gazes at himself and then goes out and immediately forgets what sort of person he was.
inupiaq: Qanuq tautuktuq inmiñik aasii aullaqami piiguaniktiġaa qanuq qiññaqaqtilaani.

english: But the one who peers into the perfect law of liberty and fixes his attention there, and does not become a forgetful listener but one who lives it out – he will be blessed in what he does.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuk tainnainŋitchuq qiñiqtuiññaqtuaq God-im pitquraŋiñun nalaunŋaruanun atanġiqsitchiḷḷaruanun iñuŋnik. Naalaġnisuŋaiññaqamigich God-im uqaluŋi kamagituiññaqługiḷḷu piiguqtilaitkai tavrauvvaa, aasii quviasuusiaqaqtitauvluni pisigivlugu taŋŋiiñini uqaluŋmik.

english: If someone thinks he is religious yet does not bridle his tongue, and so deceives his heart, his religion is futile.
inupiaq: Kiñaliqaa isummatigigumi iḷumun ukpiqtuaguniḷuni aŋalatchuiḷḷaan uqaluni, sagluqiruq inmiñik. Taavruma iñuum ukpiqtuaguniŋa taŋiġitchuq.

english: Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world.
inupiaq: Uvva innaittuq God-im nalaunŋarualikkaŋa iḷumutullu ittualivḷugu ukpiqtuaguniq, takulugich aŋayuqaagiŋaruat, uiḷgaŋaruallu piiḷḷiuqpata, suli qaunagiluni inmiñik piḷuksisuŋiḷḷuni nunam iñuŋisun.

english: My brothers and sisters, do not show prejudice if you possess faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ.
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, ukpiqtuagukavsi Ataniptiŋnun Jesus Christ-mun kamanaqtuaguruamun, suuramikunnii aŋalannagich iñuich allagiiksitaġlugich.

english: For if someone comes into your assembly wearing a gold ring and fine clothing, and a poor person enters in filthy clothes,
inupiaq: Qanuq suġalliruaq iñuk kaviqsuamik qitiqłiaġutilik annuġaaġipiaġataġmiḷuni isiqpan aŋaiyyuvivsiññun, suli iḷiappauruaq isiġmiḷuni annuġaaluktuġluni,

english: do you pay attention to the one who is finely dressed and say, “You sit here in a good place,” and to the poor person, “You stand over there,” or “Sit on the floor”?
inupiaq: aasii ilivsi qaunagiłhaagaqsiguvsiuŋ annuġaaġipiaġataqtuaq aasii uqallautilugu, Aquvittin uvuŋa inilluatamun, aasiiḷi uqallautilugu iḷiappauruaq, Makitaiñ takanani, naagga, Aquvittin natiġmun saniġaannun aquppiutama,

english: If so, have you not made distinctions among yourselves and become judges with evil motives?
inupiaq: allakaaġiiksitaġisi iñuich akunnavsiññi, isivġiqł̣ugich pigiitchuanik isumaqaqłusi.

english: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters! Did not God choose the poor in the world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom that he promised to those who love him?
inupiaq: Piviuttaġikkavsii aniqatiit, naalaġnisitchi, God-im piksraqtaaġiŋagai piiḷḷiuqtuat mattumani nunami piiḷḷiuquŋił̣ł̣ugich ukpiġunmi, kiŋuvaannaquvlugiḷḷu atanniqsimaviŋmiñi unniqsuqłiisauŋaruamik ilaan piviuttaġirimiñun.

english: But you have dishonored the poor! Are not the rich oppressing you and dragging you into the courts?
inupiaq: Tavra suksraġiŋiñŋagiksi iḷiappauruaq. Nalliŋisa nagriaġisuuvasi isivġiqsiñuutivlusiḷu? Suġalliruat.

english: Do they not blaspheme the good name of the one you belong to?
inupiaq: Iliŋisa uqamaqłuutigisuugaat taamna atilluataq God-im aitchuutaa ilivsiññun.

english: But if you fulfill the royal law as expressed in this scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing well.
inupiaq: Nalaunŋarualiqiniaqtusi kamagiguvsiuŋ God-im pitquraŋa, Bible uqalugikkaŋat inna, “Piviuttaġisaġiñ siḷalliñ iliktun iḷiḷugu.”

english: But if you show prejudice, you are committing sin and are convicted by the law as violators.
inupiaq: Aglaan allakaaġiiksitaġuvsigik iñuich qiññaŋatigun, piḷuusiqirusi. Aasii pitqurat pasiñiaġaasi kipuqłaiñiḷusi.

english: For the one who obeys the whole law but fails in one point has become guilty of all of it.
inupiaq: Qanuq kiñapayaaq kamaksriŋitchuaq iḷaŋannik pitqurat pasirauruq kamaksriŋitchualivḷugu iluqaiññik pitquranik.

english: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a violator of the law.
inupiaq: Qanuq God uqaqtuq, Allatuġnak, aasiisuli uqallakłuni, Iñuaġnak. Tavra allatuŋitkaluaġuvich aglaan iñuaġlutin, kamaksriŋitchutin pitquranik.

english: Speak and act as those who will be judged by a law that gives freedom.
inupiaq: Tavra uqaġitchi iñuulusiḷu tamatkunatun iñuktun isivġiqsauyumaaqtuatun pitquratigun atanġiqsitchiḷḷaruatigun iñuŋnik.

english: For judgment is merciless for the one who has shown no mercy. But mercy triumphs over judgment.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuk nagliksralaitchuaq God-im nagliginiaŋiñmigaa isivġiġumiuŋ, aglaan nagliktuun akimaniaqtuq nagliktauruaq isivġiqsaukpan.

english: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but does not have works? Can this kind of faith save him?
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, iñuk uqaqtuaq ukpiġutiqaġnivḷuni aasii anniqsuiñiaŋiḷḷuni allanik, ukpiġutaata anniqsuġumiñaqpauŋ? Ukpiġutaan tainnaittuam annautiyumiñaitkaa.

english: If a brother or sister is poorly clothed and lacks daily food,
inupiaq: Aniqan annuġaagiḷḷiuqpan niqiksraiḷḷiuġluniḷu,

english: and one of you says to them, “Go in peace, keep warm and eat well,” but you do not give them what the body needs, what good is it?
inupiaq: qanuġlugu anniqsuġumiñaitkaa uqallautigiññaġlugu inna, God-im quviasuusiġḷisin, uunnaagiñ niġiḷḷuataġlutillu, aitchuġaluaġnagu pigiraksraġiraŋiñik iñuuniaġniġmi. Tainnasiq ukpiġutaupiaqpa?

english: So also faith, if it does not have works, is dead being by itself.
inupiaq: Ukpiġutiqaġniq ikayuġniasuŋaġnagich allat iñuich iḷumutun ukpiġutauŋitchuq, tuquŋaruatun ittuq.

english: But someone will say, “You have faith and I have works.” Show me your faith without works and I will show you faith by my works.
inupiaq: Aglaan iñuk iḷaanni uqallagniaġmiuq iñuŋmun, Ukpiġutiqaqsiññaqtutin aasiiḷi uvaŋa ukpiġutiqaqtuŋa anniqsuiñiaqłuŋa allanik. Tautuktinŋa ukpiġutiŋnik anniqsuiñiaġaluaġnak, uvaŋali anniqsuiñiaġnipkuŋ tautuktinniaġikpiñ ukpiġutimnik.

english: You believe that God is one; well and good. Even the demons believe that – and tremble with fear.
inupiaq: Tavra uqaqtutin ukpiġnivḷutin atausiunivḷugu God, taamna nakuuruq. Ilitqusiqł̣uitchauq ukpiġigaat taamna, aasii iliŋich uuliksisuurut sivuuġavlutiŋ.

english: But would you like evidence, you empty fellow, that faith without works is useless?
inupiaq: Isumalaaŋitchuatiin iñuuk, iḷisautitquyumavich ukpiġun anniqsuiñialaitchuaq suuŋisilaaŋanik?

english: Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he offered Isaac his son on the altar?
inupiaq: Isumalaaġutigisiuŋ maŋŋuqput Abraham. Qanuqłuni nalaunŋasirauŋava God-im sivuġaani? God-im iḷisimaŋagaa nalaunŋaruagutilaaŋanik ukpiġunmiñi pisigivlugu aitchuutigiyumiñaġmagu iġñini Isaac niġrutitun iḷivḷugu ikipkaiviŋmun.

english: You see that his faith was working together with his works and his faith was perfected by works.
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġisitchi ilaan ukpiġivaił̣ł̣ugu God piyummatiqaŋaruq supayauramik God-im piraksriqpani. Taavruma piraŋata nalupqinaiŋagaa ukpiġutiqapiaqtilaaŋanik,

english: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, “Now Abraham believed God and it was counted to him for righteousness,” and he was called God’s friend.
inupiaq: aasii Bible uqaluŋich taŋŋiqsauŋarut uqaluqaqtuat inna, “Abraham ukpiġiŋagaa God, aasii taavruma nalaunŋasiŋagaa sivuġaani God-im.” Aasii ilaa tairauŋaruq avilaitqataanik God-im.

english: You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone.
inupiaq: Iḷitchuġirusi tasamma iñuum nalaunŋasipkaqtautilaaŋanik savaalluatatigun ukpiġutiłhiñaŋiḷaakun.

english: And similarly, was not Rahab the prostitute also justified by works when she welcomed the messengers and sent them out by another way?
inupiaq: Aasiivsauq Rahab, sivuani allatuqtauŋagaluaqtuaq, uuktuutauyumiñaġmiuq ukpiġutim anniqsuiḷḷatilaaŋanik. Ilaa nalaunŋarualirauŋaruq anniqsuiñiġmigun tukkuliikami kivgauruanik suli aullaqtiłługich allakun apqutikun.

english: For just as the body without the spirit is dead, so also faith without works is dead.
inupiaq: Tavra timitun tuquŋaruatun ilitqusiq piiġman timimiñ, tainnatun ukpiġun tuquŋammiuq anniqsuiñiaŋiññami.

english: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers and sisters, because you know that we will be judged more strictly.
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, iñugiaktuasii iḷisaurriġuġnasi, qanuq iḷisimarusi uvagut iḷisaurriruaguut isivġiusiaqaġniaqtugut tuniqtulluktuamik allaniñ.

english: For we all stumble in many ways. If someone does not stumble in what he says, he is a perfect individual, able to control the entire body as well.
inupiaq: Qanuq iluqata killukuaġuurugut iñugiaktuatigun, aasii kiñaliqaa killukualaitchuaq uqaluŋmigun, ilaa iñulluatapiaguruq, aŋalataġillasiŋavlugu iluqaan timi.

english: And if we put bits into the mouths of horses to get them to obey us, then we guide their entire bodies.
inupiaq: Kiŋmiġusiġuugivut tuttuqpaich qaniŋisigun kamagitquvluta, aulataġillagivut sumun aullaġukapta.

english: Look at ships too: Though they are so large and driven by harsh winds, they are steered by a tiny rudder wherever the pilot’s inclination directs.
inupiaq: Isummatigisigik umiaqpaich. Qanutun kamanaqtigigaluaqtut anuġiqpaum tiŋillavlugich, aulatiqaqtut aquutikułłuuramik sumupayaaq aqutim pisuutaa sivunniġman.

english: So too the tongue is a small part of the body, yet it has great pretensions. Think how small a flame sets a huge forest ablaze.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq uqaq mikigaluaqtuq iḷagikkaŋa timim, qanutun uqavigaaġuutigiruq sunik kamanaqtuanik. Ignikułłuuram ikuallaktillagai napaaqtusalaich.

english: And the tongue is a fire! The tongue represents the world of wrongdoing among the parts of our bodies. It pollutes the entire body and sets fire to the course of human existence – and is set on fire by hell.
inupiaq: Tainnatuttauq uqaq igniqtun inmiuq, Uqqam salapqiġuugai iñuum isumagiirrutiŋi salapqiqł̣ugu iluqaan pigiitchuapayaaq iḷisimakkaŋat iñupayaurat. Uqqam salapqiġuugaa iñuum siḷivinŋatilaaŋa piḷuunmik suraġaġnipayaakun. Tavraasii uqaq igniqtun iłłuni ikuallaktitaŋatun nagliksaaġvium, iłuiḷḷiuġutiqaqtitkaa iñuuniqput iluqaan sivisutilaaŋatun.

english: For every kind of animal, bird, reptile, and sea creature is subdued and has been subdued by humankind.
inupiaq: Qanusipayaat niġrutit, tiŋmiallu, paamġuqtuallu, taġiuvlu niġrutiŋi, iñuum pamiqsaaġillagai.

english: But no human being can subdue the tongue; it is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.
inupiaq: Aglaan kialiqaa iñugruiññaum aŋalallasiyumiñaitkaa pamiqsaatun uqaq pigiitchuaq, siḷivinŋaruaq tuqunamik.

english: With it we bless the Lord and Father, and with it we curse people made in God’s image.
inupiaq: Uqqaptiŋnik nanġaġuugikput Ataniq, Aapalu, suli uqqaptiŋnik uqamaqłuutivlugich iñuich savaaguruat arriŋatun God-im.

english: From the same mouth come blessing and cursing. These things should not be so, my brothers and sisters.
inupiaq: Qanuq atautchimiñ qaniġmiñ qairuk quviasaaġullu uqamaqłuullu. Aniqatiimaaŋ, taamna tainnaittuksrauŋitkaluaqtuq.

english: A spring does not pour out fresh water and bitter water from the same opening, does it?
inupiaq: Imiġiksuaġlu taġiuġnitchuaġlu maqiyumiñaitchuk atautchimiñ maqsraluktuamiñ imiġmiñ.

english: Can a fig tree produce olives, my brothers and sisters, or a vine produce figs? Neither can a salt water spring produce fresh water.
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, fig napaaqtua nauriyumiñaitchuq olive-nik, naaggaunnii grape napaaqtuayaaŋa fig-nik. Tainnaptauq taġiuġnitchuaq imiq maqiyumiñaitchuq taġiuġniitchuamik.

english: Who is wise and understanding among you? By his good conduct he should show his works done in the gentleness that wisdom brings.
inupiaq: Kiña akunnavsiññi isumaturuaguva kaŋiqsisiqaqpalu? Isumattutiqaqtilaani kaŋiqsisiqaqtilaaniḷu iḷisimanaqtilliuŋ iñuulluataunmigun savaalluatamigullu kamasaaŋaiġḷuni isumattutiqaġluniḷu.

english: But if you have bitter jealousy and selfishness in your hearts, do not boast and tell lies against the truth.
inupiaq: Aglaan uumisuutiqaqtuiññaġuvsi killuqsraunmiglu siŋñanmiglu isumatuniḷusi kamasaaġnasi, saglutigilugu God-im iḷumun ittuaŋa.

english: Such wisdom does not come from above but is earthly, natural, demonic.
inupiaq: Qanuq tainnasiq isumattun qairuaguŋitchuq God-miñ, aglaan iñugruiññaġniñ, piḷuksisuguuruaniñ iñuutchivsiññiñ Tuunġaġmiḷḷu.

english: For where there is jealousy and selfishness, there is disorder and every evil practice.
inupiaq: Qanuq iñuich killuqqutimmata siŋñarrautimmatalu atiŋirrutinikkayuktut, qanusipayaaġlu pigiitchualiqiniq iḷivḷuni.

english: But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, accommodating, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial, and not hypocritical.
inupiaq: Aglaan isumattutim paŋmaŋŋaqtauruam iñuk piḷuutaisitkaa aŋuyautairrutiqaqtitkaalu pikałaktautairrutiqaqtitkaalu uqayunaqtitkaalu, suli nagliktuiḷḷatuqpaktuq anniqsuiḷḷaturuġlu, atunim aŋalatkai iñuich, naagga piŋŋuaġutaitchuq.

english: And the fruit that consists of righteousness is planted in peace among those who make peace.
inupiaq: Aasii iñuich atisipkaiñiaqtuaguruat nalaunŋaruakun iñuich iñuuniaqatigiiksillagaich piisinniaqługu atiŋirrun.

english: Where do the conflicts and where do the quarrels among you come from? Is it not from this, from your passions that battle inside you?
inupiaq: Sum aullaqisaaġuuvagich aŋuyautit qanaaġutillu akunnavsiññi? Iñukpalliġuurut pigiitchuaniñ pisuutivsiññiñ iñiqługu qalanmatun ittuamiñ iḷuvsiññiñ.

english: You desire and you do not have; you murder and envy and you cannot obtain; you quarrel and fight. You do not have because you do not ask;
inupiaq: Kipiġniuġaluaġaqtusi piqaġukłusi pigiliutillammiñaġiḷḷu, taimmaasii iñuaqsałhiñaaġuqłusi. Suli kaviuqłusi piññaktaaġillammiñagiḷḷu, aasii taimma qanaaġutiaqsivḷusi aŋuyautivlusiḷu. Piññaktaaġilaitkisi pigisukkasi, qanuq apiqsriaġilaitkisi God-mun.

english: you ask and do not receive because you ask wrongly, so you can spend it on your passions.
inupiaq: Apiqsrigaluaġmiraqtusi aitchuusiaqalaitchusi, qanuq apiqsrisuuvlusi killukuaŋaruakun, atuġuqługich ilivsi aliasuŋisaaġutivsiññun.

english: Adulterers, do you not know that friendship with the world means hostility toward God? So whoever decides to be the world’s friend makes himself God’s enemy.
inupiaq: Ukpiġnaitchuasii iñuich, naluvisiuŋ avilaitqatauniq nunam iñuŋiñun piḷuusiqisuuruanun akiḷḷiḷiqsuutautilaaŋanik God-mun? Tavraasii kiñapayaaq avilaitqatauruaq nunam iñuŋiñun, aŋuyyiruq inmiñik God-mun.

english: Or do you think the scripture means nothing when it says, “The spirit that God caused to live within us has an envious yearning”?
inupiaq: Isumavisi taŋiġiḷamik Bible uqaġasugalugich uqallakamiŋ inna, Ilitqusiq God-im iḷiraŋa iñuŋmun mumiŋaruq tutchutikun kipiġniuġutinun.

english: But he gives greater grace. Therefore it says, “God opposes the proud, but he gives grace to the humble.”
inupiaq: Aglaan taavrumaŋŋa kipiġniuġunmiñ suaŋałhaaqtuq God-im nagliktuutiqpakun ikayuun aitchuutaa. Taamna pisigivlugu Bible uqaluŋich uqaqtut inna, “God-im akiḷḷiḷiqsuġai kamasaaqtuat, aglaan aitchuiruq nagliktuutiqpaŋmik kamasaaŋitchuanun.”

english: So submit to God. But resist the devil and he will flee from you.
inupiaq: Aŋalallisi God-im. Akiḷḷiḷiqsuqsiuŋ Tuunġaq aasii pigruġniaqtuq ilivsiññiñ.

english: Draw near to God and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and make your hearts pure, you double-minded.
inupiaq: Qalliḷaaġitchi God-mun, ilaaptauq qalliḷaaġniaġmiuq ilivsiññun. Piḷuusiqirauruasii, isumalitqigitchi piḷuutiniñ savaaġiŋaravsiññiñ. Ilivsi malġuŋnik isumaqaqtuasii, kamagipiaġataqsiuŋ God. Ukpiŋŋuaqtuaguŋaiġitchi.

english: Grieve, mourn, and weep. Turn your laughter into mourning and your joy into despair.
inupiaq: Nunuuraliġitchi isumaaġlusiḷu qialusiḷu piḷuutisi pisigilugich. Iglaqhaaqtaġniqsi mumigḷi qirratiġuġluni, suli quviasuutiksi ipiqtusuutiġuġluni.

english: Humble yourselves before the Lord and he will exalt you.
inupiaq: Kamanaiġitchi ilivsiññik sivuġaani God-im, aasiiḷi ilaan kamanaqsipkaġniaġaasi.

english: Do not speak against one another, brothers and sisters. He who speaks against a fellow believer or judges a fellow believer speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but its judge.
inupiaq: Aniqatiimaaŋ, uqautikkutinasi pigiitchuamik avanmun. Qanuq iñuk uqautiqaqtuaq pigiitchuamik aniqanmun naagga qanuqinniġairuaq aniqanmiñik uqautigigai pigiitchualivḷugich pisaaŋavlugiḷḷu God-im pitquraŋi piviuttaqqutinikun avanmun. Tainna iḷiuġuvsigik God-im pitquraŋi kamaksriñiaqtuaguŋaiqsusi pitquranik, aglaan isivġiqsiġuqtusi pitquranik.

english: But there is only one who is lawgiver and judge – the one who is able to save and destroy. On the other hand, who are you to judge your neighbor?
inupiaq: God kisimi pitquralirauruq isivġiqsauvluniḷu. Ilaa kisimi annaurriḷḷaruq suksraunġiiḷḷavluniḷu. Aglaalli kiunasugivich isivġiqsuatiin siḷalliġñik?
